2. 1 14Ounce Can Hearts Of Palm Not Packed With Sugar Rough Chopped To Consistency Of Crab Meat
3. 14 Cup Chopped Celery
4. 14 Cup Diced Red Bell Pepper
5. 12 Cup Chopped Onion
6. 1 Teaspoon Minced Garlic
7. 2 Teaspoons Old Bay Seasoning
8. 1 Teaspoon Fresh Lemon Juice
9. 14 Cup Vegan Mayonnaise
10. 2 6Inch Hoagie Rolls
11. Vegan Butter
12. Lemon Wedges To Serve
preparation:
1. Heat 2 Tablespoons Of The Oil In Large Skillet Over Medium-High Heat. Add The Hearts Of Palm And Sauté For 8 To 10 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally To Prevent Sticking. Cook Until Golden Brown On All Sides. Set Aside To Cool. Add The Celery And Peppers And Mix Well.
2. Heat 1/2 Tablespoon Of Oil In A Skillet Over Medium Heat. Add The Onion And Sauté Until Translucent, 3 To 4 Minutes. Add The Garlic And Sauté For 1 Minute.
3. Remove From The Heat And Add The Onion Mixture To The Hearts Of Palm. Mix Well. Add The Old Bay Seasoning, Lemon Juice, And Mayo.
4. Toast The Hoagie Rolls Until Gold Brown, Then Butter The Insides.
5. Divide The Hearts Of Palm Mixture Between Both Rolls. Serve Warm With Wedges Of Lemon.
6. Did You Enjoy This Dish? Explore More Vegan Seafood Recipes.

title: Paella Verduras
ingredients:
1. Teaspoon Saffron Strands
2. 1 Litre Vegetable Stock
3. 240G 2 Cups Shelled Broad Fava Beans
4. 100G 23 Cup Fine Green Beans Topped And Tailed And Halved
5. 100G 23 Cup Fine Asparagus Cut Into 5Cm Lengths
6. 3 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
7. 200G 1 13 Cup Small Courgettes Zucchini Cut Into Thick Slices
8. 1 Medium Onion Finely Chopped
9. 1 Large Red Pepper Deseeded And Chopped Into 1Cm Pieces
10. 1 Large Green Pepper Deseeded And Chopped Into 1Cm Pieces
11. 3 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
12. 1 Teaspoon Sweet Pimentn
13. 200G 1 Cup Tomatoes Fresh Or From A Can Skinned And Chopped
14. 400G 2 Cups Short Grain Paella Rice Such As Calasparra Or Bomba
15. 2 Tablespoons Freshly Chopped Flatleaf Parsley
16. 100G 12 Cup Shelled Peas
17. 280G Jar Chargrilled Artichokes In Olive Oil Drained
18. Fine Sea Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Shake The Saffron Strands Around In A Slightly Hot Frying Pan For A Few Seconds Until Dry But Not Coloured, Then Tip Into A Small Mortar Or Coffee Cup And Grind To A Powder With The Pestle Or A Wooden Spoon. Add A Splash Of The Stock And Set Aside.
2. Bring A Pan Of Salted Water To The Boil. Drop In The Broad Beans, Bring Back To The Boil And Cook For 2 Minutes. Lift Out With A Slotted Spoon Into A Colander, Leave To Drain, Then Tip Into A Bowl.
3. Bring The Pan Of Water Back To The Boil, Add The Green Beans And Cook For 3 Minutes. Remove With The Slotted Spoon To The Colander And Refresh Under Cold Water. Tip Onto A Plate.
4. Bring The Water Back To The Boil Once More, Add The Asparagus, Bring Back To The Boil, Drain And Refresh Under Cold Water. Pop The Broad Beans Out Of Their Skins And Add To The Plate Of Green Beans With The Asparagus.
5. Heat 2 Tablespoons Of The Olive Oil In A Large Non-Stick Frying Pan Or Shallow Flameproof Casserole Dish Over A Medium-High Heat. Add The Courgettes And Fry Them For 2–3 Minutes Until A Light Golden Brown. Lift Out Onto A Plate.
6. Add The Remaining Tablespoon Of Oil And The Onion To The Pan And Fry Gently For 5 Minutes. Add The Red And Green Pepper And Continue Frying Until The Onion Is Soft And Lightly Golden. Stir In The Garlic And Pimentón And Fry For 1 Minute More.
7. Add The Tomatoes And Fry For 2–3 Minutes Until Softened, Then Stir In The Rest Of The Stock, The Saffron Mixture And Some Seasoning To Taste And Bring To The Boil.
8. Sprinkle In The Rice And The Parsley, Stir Lightly To Evenly Distribute The Rice Around The Pan, Then Scatter Over The Cooked Beans, Asparagus, Courgettes, Peas And Artichokes And Shake The Pan Gently So That They All Bed Down Slightly Into The Rice.
9. Lower The Heat And Leave To Simmer Vigorously For 6 Minutes, Then Lower The Heat Again And Leave To Simmer Gently For A Further 14 Minutes, Until All The Liquid Has Been Absorbed And The Rice Is Tender, But Still With A Little Bit Of A Bite To It.
10. Remove The Pan From The Heat, Cover With A Large Lid Or Clean Tea Towel And Leave To Rest For 5 Minutes Before Serving.

title: Banana Sticky Toffee Pudding
ingredients:
1. 150G Bananas This Is The Weight After The Skin Is Removed
2. 50Cups Water
3. 60G Dates If They Are Not Soft Soak Them In Hot Water For 10 Minutes
4. 60G Gram Flour
5. 40G Potato Starch Or Tapioca Flour
6. 12Tsp Baking Powder
7. 12Tsp Bicarbonate Of Soda
8. 60G Dark Sugar Muscovado Coconut Molasses
9. 1Tsp Ground Ginger Optional
preparation:
1. Prep Time: 20 Minutes
2. Cook Time: 30 Minutes
3. Makes: 4 Portions
4. Skill Level: Medium
5. Equipment Needed:
6. Hand Blender
7. Jug Or Bowl
8. Muffin Tray
9. Mixing Spoon
10. Tips:
11. For A Gluten Version Simply Omit The Gram Flour And Potato Starch/Tapioca Flour. Replace
12. With 100G Plain Flour.
13. The Pudding Batter Can Be Mixed And Blended In A Food Processor.
14. Use Ripe Or Overripe Bananas. Never Use Under-Ripe Bananas.
15. Either Muscovado, Coconut Or Molasses Sugar Must Be Used To Give The Pudding And
16. Sauce A Toffee/Caramel Flavour.
17. Set Your Oven To 180C/350F/Gas Mark 4. Put All Of The Ingredients In A Large Bowl Or Jug.
18. Using A Hand Blender, Blend All Of The Ingredients Ensuring There Are No Lumps.
19. Pour Into 4 Large Muffin Holes.
20. Bake For 30 Minutes Until Cooked Through.

title: Fennel Sauteed with Peppers
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
2. 2 Red Peppers Deseeded And Cut Into Thin Strips
3. 500G Fennel Trimmed And Finely Chopped About 3 Bulbs
4. 2 Garlic Cloves Crushed
5. 250G Peas Shelled
6. Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper
7. 1 Tablespoon Freshly Chopped Flatleaf Parsley
preparation:
1. In A Wok Or Heavy-Bottomed Frying Pan Heat The Oil, Add The Peppers And Fennel And Cook For 10–15 Minutes Over A Moderate Heat Until Crunchy, Stirring Occasionally.
2. Add The Garlic And Peas And Continue Cooking For 2 Minutes.
3. Season, Scatter With The Parsley And Serve.
4. Recipe Taken From The Meat Free Monday Cookbook. Foreword By Paul, Mary And Stella Mccartney. Published By Kyle Books. Photography By Tara Fisher.
5. Find More Great-Tasting Recipes On The Meat Free Monday Website Here.*
6. *Please Note That This Website Also Produces Vegetarian Recipes.

title: Tzatziki
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Provamel Soya Alternative To Yogurt Free From Sugars
2. 2 Diced Cucumbers
3. 3 Cloves Minced Garlic
4. 3 Tbsp Lemon Juice
5. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
6. Dash Salt And Pepper
7. 1 Tbsp Fresh Chopped Mint Leaves
preparation:
1. This Vegan Tzaztiki Is Made Usingprovamel Soya Alternative To Yogurt Free From Sugars.
2. Mix All The Ingredients Together And Serve Chilled As A Dip Or Topping To A Dish.
3. Add Some Dill If You Want A Proper Tzatziki, Because Without It’S Actually A Raïta, But We Don’T Want To Nitpick!
4. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Vegan Double Dark Chocolate Ice Cream
ingredients:
1. 150G Cashews
2. 3 Tablespoons Good Quality Cocoa Powder
3. 150Cups Warm Water
4. 1 Tablespoon Pectin
5. 300Cups Coconut Cream
6. 150G Golden Caster Sugar
7. 200G Vegan Dark Chocolate Broken Into 2Cm Squares
8. 2 Tablespoons Cornflour
preparation:
1. Empty The Cashews, Cocoa Powder, Warm Water And Pectin Into A Blender And Blend On High Until All Is Silky Smooth. Pour Into A Large Bowl And Set Aside.
2. Spoon The Coconut Cream Into A Medium Saucepan And Add The Caster Sugar And Cubed Dark Chocolate. Heat Very Gently, Regularly Stirring Until The Sugar Has Dissolved And The Chocolate Has Melted Into The Cream.
3. Measure The Cornflour Into A Small Bowl And Add 2 Tablespoons Of The Coconut Chocolate Mixture Into The Cornflour. Stir To Combine Until You Have A Thick, Uniform, Soft Paste. Return This Paste To The Saucepan And Continue To Stir Until Dissolved. Continue To Cook The Ice Cream Base For 5-7 Minutes, Over A Gentle Heat Until Steam Rises From The Mixture And The Cornflour Has Performed Its Task And Thickened The Mixture. The Consistency Will Be That Of Double Cream.
4. Pour The Warm Coconut And Chocolate Base Into The Cashew Mixture And Stir Until Thoroughly Well Combined. Cover With Cling Film And Set The Ice Cream Base Aside To Cool.
5. Transfer To An Ice Cream Machine And Churn Until Frozen, About 45 Minutes. Transfer To A Freezeable Container And Freeze Overnight. Remove From The Freezer A 5-10 Minutes Before Scooping.

title: Puy Lentil Pie
ingredients:
1. 250G Merchant Gourmet Tomatoey French Puy  Green Lentils
2. 90G Whole Chestnuts
3. 200G Chestnut Puree
4. 600G Pumpkin Or Butternut Squash Peeled And Cut Into 25Cm Cubes
5. 4 Sheets Filo Pastry
6. 1 Large Onion Finely Sliced
7. 3 Tbsp Vegetable Oil Plus Extra For Brushing
8. 200Cups Vegetable Stock Plus Extra If Necessary For Puree
9. 1 Tbsp Chopped Rosemary
10. 1 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil
11. Salt  Freshly Ground Pepper
preparation:
1. Pre-Heat Your Oven To 220C / Rack Position On Upper Middle Shelf
2. Toss The Diced Pumpkin With 2 Tbsp Oil And A Pinch Of Salt. Roast On A Low Sided Tray For 20 Minutes
3. Put 200G Of The Cooked Pumpkin With The Chestnut Puree In Your Liquidiser. Blend For 2-3 Minutes Until The Puree Is Smooth And Mousse Like. If The Puree Is Too Thick, Add Hot Stock 1 Tbsp At A Time. Season To Taste
4. Get A Shallow Pan, Add The Onion And 1 Tbsp Of Oil, Cover And Soften The Onions For 6 Minutes, Then Turn Up The Heat And Fry Them Until Golden For 4-5 Minutes. Add The Lentils, 200Ml Vegetable Stock, Chestnuts, Rosemary And Remaining Pumpkin. Bring To The Boil Then Take Off The Heat. Season To Taste
5. Spread The Lentil Mixture Into 2 Small Oven Proof Dishes. Spoon The Puree Into The Centre Of Each. Use A Spatula To Gently Smooth Towards The Edges A Little. Don’T Worry If The Puree Sinks Into The Lentils A Little
6. Lay Two Sheets Of Filo Pastry On Your Work Surface. Sprinkle Them With Smoked Paprika. Brush All Over With Olive Oil
7. Scrunch The Pastry Up Into The Size Of The Dishes. Try And Keep As Much Of The Pastry As Possible Off The Chickpea Puree’S Surface Because The Moisture Will Make It Go Soft
8. Brush And Sprinkle Two More Sheets Of Pastry. Put A Second Sheet Of Filo On Top Of Each Pie To Make Doubly Sure That It’S Crisp. Bake For 12-15 Minutes Until Hot And Golden. Serve!

title: Chestnut Cranberry Pie
ingredients:
1. 1Tbsp Sunflower Oil
2. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
3. 1 Garlic Clove Finely Chopped
4. 125G Mushrooms Roughly Chopped
5. 400G Butternut Squash Peeled And Cut Into 1 Inch Cubes
6. 125G Cooked Chestnuts Roughly Chopped
7. 125G Dried Puy Or Green Lentils
8. 1 Litre Water
9. 125G Baby Spinach
10. 25G Dried Cranberries
11. 3 Sage Leaves Finely Chopped
12. 1Tbsp Tomato Puree
13. 50Cups Vermouth Optional
14. 12Tsp Salt
15. 14Tsp Ground Black Pepper
16. A Mushroom Or Veg Stock Cube
17. 1Tsp Yeast Spread Or Dark Miso
18. 2 Gluten Free Ready Made Puff Pastry
19. 1Tbsp Plant Milk
preparation:
1. In A Large Frying Pan Heat The Oil On A Medium Heat. Once Hot, Add The Onions, Cook For 10-15 Minutes Until Translucent. Add The Garlic And Mushrooms, Cook For A Further 5-10 Minutes Until The Mushrooms Are Browned.
2. Add The Squash, Chestnuts, Lentils, Water, Spinach, Cranberries, Sage, Tomato Puree, Vermouth, Salt, Pepper, Stock Cube And Yeast Spread To The Pan. Simmer For 20-30 Minutes Until The Lentils Are Soft.
3. Heat Your Oven To 180C/360F/Gm4. Roll The Pastry Out Until It Is Thin. Cut 8 Circles And Place In Small Tart Tins Making Sure The Dough Goes Up The Sides. Prick The Bases With A Fork. Bake For 8-10 Minutes Until The Pastry Has Cooked And Is Starting To Turn Golden Brown.
4. Divide The Lentil Mixture Between The Tart Bases. Cut Star Shapes From The Remaining Dough And Place On Top Of Each Tart. Brush A Little Milk On The Pastry As A Glaze. Bake For A Further 10 Minutes Until The Filling Is Cooked Through And The Star Pastry Is Golden.

title: Smoky Sweet Glazed Vegetables
ingredients:
1. 2 Parsnips Peeled And Cut Into 1Inch Cubes
2. 4 Carrots Peeled And Cut Into 1Inch Cubes
3. 2 Sweet Potatoes Peeled And Cut Into 1Inch Cubes
4. 1 Red And 1 Yellow Pepper Cut Into 1Inch Pieces
5. 10 Cherry Tomatoes On The Vine
6. 2 Tablespoons Olive Or Vegetable Oil
7. Half Bottle Of Jack Daniels Smokey Sweet Glaze
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400F/204C.
2. In A Large Mixing Bowl Combine The Vegetables And The Oil; Toss Until Vegetables Are Evenly Coated.
3. Spread Vegetables Out Evenly On A Large Baking Tray. Roast For 15 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Or Until Tender.
4. Add The Cherry Tomatoes.
5. Drizzle Over A Healthy Coating Of Jack Daniel’S® Smokey Sweet Glaze And Finish Off In The Oven For 10 Minutes.
6. Serve With A Pot Of Jack Daniel’S® Smokey Sweet Glaze To Dip.

title: Chocolate and Peanut Butter Fridge Bars
ingredients:
1. 400G Can Of Chickpeas Drained
2. 250G Medjool Dates Pitted
3. 4 Tablespoons Crunchy Peanut Butter
4. 5 Tablespoons Raw Cacao
5. 3 Tablespoons Melted Coconut Oil
6. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
7. 2 Tablespoons Cacao Nibs
8. 2 Tablespoons Chopped Hazelnuts Plus Extra To Scatter
9. 40G Vegan Chocolate
10. Sea Salt Flakes
preparation:
1. Put The Chickpeas, Dates, Peanut Butter, Cacao, Coconut Oil, Vanilla And A Generous Pinch Of Sea Salt Into A Food Processor Or High-Speed Blender. Blitz Until You Get A Smooth Mix. Now Add The Cacao Nibs And Hazelnuts, And Pulse Once To Mix.
2. Line A 17 X 22Cm Baking Tray With Baking Parchment Then Spoon The Mix Into The Tray. Smooth Out To The Edges.
3. Gently Melt The Chocolate In A Small Bowl Suspended Over A Small Saucepan Of Boiling Water.
4. Drizzle The Melted Chocolate Over The Mixture In The Tray, Then Scatter With Some Chopped Hazelnuts And Sprinkle Over A Little Salt. Refrigerate For At Least 4 Hours, Or Overnight, To Firm Up.
5. Remove From The Tray And Cut Into Squares. The Bars Are Best Kept In The Fridge Where They Will Keep For 3–4 Days, Or Store In The Freezer For Up To A Few Weeks.
6. Tip: Swap The Peanut Butter For Almond Butter And Add A Teaspoon Of Almond Essence.

title: Panzanella
ingredients:
1. Loaf Ciabatta
2. 6 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
3. 2 Garlic Cloves 1 Peeled 1 Crushed
4. Teaspoon Dried Oregano
5. 2 Tablespoons Goodquality Red Wine Vinegar
6. 2 Tablespoons Freshly Chopped Flatleaf Parsley
7. 1 Tablespoon Baby Capers Drained
8. 6 Plum Tomatoes Roughly Chopped
9. 1 Small Red Onion Finely Sliced
10. Cucumber Deseeded And Cut Into Chunks
11. 2 Celery Stalks Finely Sliced
12. 12 Fresh Basil Leaves Ripped
13. 50G Stoned Black Olives Halved
14. Salt And Freshly Ground Black
preparation:
1. Cut The Ciabatta In Half And Brush The Cut Sides With A Little Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Heat A Ridged Grill Pan Or Normal Grill And Toast The Ciabatta Until Crisp And Golden.
2. Rub The Peeled Garlic Clove Over The Cut Sides Of The Bread, Tear The Bread Into Rough Chunks And Set Aside.
3. In A Small Bowl Whisk Together 5 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil, The Crushed Garlic Clove And The Red Wine Vinegar. Season Well With Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper And Add The Freshly Chopped Flatleaf Parsley.
4. In A Large Bowl, Mix Together The Bread And Baby Capers, Plum Tomatoes, Sliced Onion, Cucumber, Sliced Celery, Basil Leaves, And Black Olives, And Toss With The Dressing. Season To Taste.

title: Maccheroni with Seitan Ragu
ingredients:
1. 200G Seitan Crumble
2. 3 Tablespoon Extravirgin Olive Oil
3. 67 Medium Cup Mushrooms
4. 1 Small Onion
5. 1 Stick Celery
6. 1 Small Carrot
7. 1 Pinch Chili Flakes
8. 2 Bay Leaves
9. 400G Chopped Tomatoes
10. 1 Small Bunch Flat Parsley
11. Salt And Pepper
12. 500G Dry Maccheroni Or Mezze Maniche Or Any Short Pasta Of Your Choice
preparation:
1. Chop Finely The Onion, Celery And Carrot
2. Place In A Heavy Casserole And Add The Olive Oil, Chilli And Bay Leaves.
3. Start Frying Slowly Until All The Vegetables Are Soft And Golden Brown.
4. Chop The Mushrooms Finely And Add In To The Soffritto Together With The Seitan And Cook Until All The Water Is Evaporated.
5. Add The Tomato And Bring To Boil.
6. Reduce The Heat And Simmer For 30-40 Minutes Until The Sauce Has Thickened
7. Season With Salt And Pepper
8. Cook The Pasta As Per Package Instruction In Salted Boiling Water
9. Drain And Toss In The Ragu
10. Sprinkle With Freshly Chopped Parsley And Serve Immediately

title: Leek Latkes With Cauliflower ‘Cheese’
ingredients:
1. 500G 1 Pound Parsnip Peeled And Cut Into Chunks
2. 12 Leek Finely Sliced
3. 14T White Pepper
4. 14T Salt
5. 500G 1 Pound Waxy Potatoes
6. 1 Small Cauliflower Cut Into Small Pieces
7. 1 Can Or Jar Cannellini Beans
8. 4T Nutritional Yeast
9. 1 Garlic Clove
10. 14T Salt
11. 1T Fresh Thyme Leaves
12. 2T Water
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200C
2. Grease A 12 Cup Muffin Tray
3. Boil The Parsnip For Around 10 Minutes Until Soft
4. Drain And Leave To Cool
5. Sauté The Leeks In A Little Oil For 5 Minutes
6. Put The Parsnip Into A Large Bowl, Use A Hand Blender Or Potato Masher To Puree Them
7. Add The Leeks, Pepper And Salt, Mix Well
8. Grate The Potatoes (Skin On) Add To The Parsnip And Mix
9. Taste To Check Seasoning
10. Divide The Mixture Between The Cups In The Muffin Tray
11. Press Your Thumb Into Each So That The Mixture Goes Up The Side And There Is A Deep Indent In The Middle
12. Bake For 30 Minutes Until Golden And Crispy Around The Edges
13. For The Cauli Cheese Steam Or Boil The Cauliflower Till It Is Just Soft
14. Put The Beans In A Bowl With The Nutritional Yeast, Garlic, Salt And Water, Blend With A Hand Blender
15. Add The Thyme And Cauliflower, Heat Gently In A Pan For 10 Minutes
16. Now Load The Leek Latkes With The Cauliflower, Sprinkle A Few Thyme Leaves On Top

title: Tomato Mushroom Roast
ingredients:
1. 350G Mushrooms I Used Button Mushrooms But Any Will Suit
2. 2 Onions
3. 142 G Tin Tomato Concentrate Puree
4. 200G Brown Bread Or Tomato Bread Made Into Crumbs
5. 3 Tablespoons Yeast Flakes
6. 1 Dessertspoon Yeast Extract
7. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Chop The Onion Finely And Fry In Olive Oil Until Translucent.
2. Chop Mushrooms Finely And Add To Onions.
3. Whencooked, Add Tomatoconcentrate,Yeast Flakes And Yeast Extract. Stir Well.
4. Add Breadcrumbs And Mix Until Combined – The Mixture Should Be Quite Dry And Form A Ball.
5. Place In A Well-Greased And Lined (Small) Loaf Tin.
6. Cook At 400 Degrees C, Until The Top Begins To Brown (Approx. 20 Minutes) Then Turn Oven Down To 350, Andcook For Another 20-25 Minutes.
7. Turn Loaf Out Of Tin And Slice.
8. Note: This Is Also Really Good The Next Day Servedcold, With Salad.

title: Smoky Socca Tacos and Peach Salsa
ingredients:
1. For The Socca
2. 200G Chickpeagram Flour
3. 300Cups Water
4. Olive Oil For Cooking  See Note
5. For The Hot Filling
6. 1 Chipotle Chilli
7. 1 Tsp Olive Oil
8. 1 Red Onion
9. 4 Cloves Garlic
10. 1 Tin Pinto Beans 400G  Drained Weight 240G Rinsed And Drained
11. 1 Medium Tomato
12. 1 Tsp Ground Cumin
13. 1 Tsp Smoked Paprika
14. 2 Tsp Good Soy Sauce Or Aminos
15. For The Peach Salsa
16. 1 Avocado
17. 4 Saturn Peaches Or 1 Regular Peach
18. 2 Medium Tomatoes
19. Juice Of 1 Lime Preferably Organic
20. Handful Of Fresh Coriander Stems  Leaves
21. 4 Romaine Or Gem Lettuce Leaves
preparation:
1. Make The Socca Batter By Sifting The Chickpea Flour Into A Bowl. Combine With The Water By Hand-Whisking (Using A Fork Is Fine) To Ensure There Are No Lumps And It’S Nice And Bubbly. Set Aside.
2. Place The Chipotle Chilli In A Bowl With Boiling Water And Set Aside.
3. To Make The Salsa, Chop The Avocado, Peaches And Tomatoes Into Small Chunks And Combine In A Bowl With The Lime Juice And Finely Chopped Coriander.
4. Cut The Lettuce Into Fine Ribbons And Place In A Bowl.
5. Remove The Chipotle Chilli From The Water And Remove The Seeds And Membrane (If You Don’T Do This Your Mouth Will Be On Fire!). Finely Chop The Rest.
6. Heat The Olive Oil In A Frying Pan While You Chop The Onion, Garlic And Tomato. Add These And The Chipotle To The Pan And Cook Until The Onions Become Translucent – About 5 Minutes. Add The Cumin And Paprika, Give It A Stir And Then Add The Pinto Beans. While This Is Cooking You Can Make The Socca Tacos.
7. Place A Good, Non-Stick Frying Pan On A Medium Heat, Adding A Little Oil If Needed (See Note). Once The Pan Is Hot, Spoon In Some Of The Socca Batter. I Find A Large Serving Spoon Is About The Right Amount – Making About 6 Tortillas.
8. Wait For Bubbles To Appear In The Batter. Once They Have All Popped, Flip The Tortilla Over And Allow The Other Side To Cook – About 2 Minutes On Each Side.
9. Pop Them On A Plate Ready To Serve.
10. The Hot Filling Will Also Be Ready By Now, Transfer This To A Serving Bowl.
11. I Like To Serve These By Setting Out All The Dishes On The Table For A Diy Dinner – It’S Much More Fun!
12. Notes:I Recently Acquired A Ceramic Frying Pan Which Is Perfect For This Recipe. You Can Make Pancakes – And Everything Else – Without The Need For A Single Drop Of Oil! If Your Pan Is Not Super Non-Stick, Use A Little Oil For The Socca, As You Would For Regular Pancakes.If You Don’T Want To Be Cooking The Hot Filling And The Socca Tortillas At The Same Time, Make The Tortillas First And Set Aside On A Plate – They Don’T Need To Be Hot To Serve.I’Ve Suggested Using Organic Limes Because Not Only Do They Taste Great, But They Are Unwaxed (Which Is Particularly Important If You’Re Using The Zest).

title: Berry and Apple Crumble
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Of Apples
2. 2 Oranges Freshly Squeezed
3. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon
4. Pinch Of Mixed Spice
5. Pinch Of Nutmeg
6. Pinch Of Ginger
7. 3 Tablespoons Coconut Sugar
8. Pinch Sea Salt
9. 1 Cup Berries Elderberries If You Can Find Them
10. Crumble
11. 2 Cups Rolled Oats
12. 6 Tablespoons Coconut Sugar
13. Cup Sunflower Seeds
14. Cup Pumpkin Seeds
15. Cup Coconut Oil
preparation:
1. Slice The Apples, And Place In A Baking Tray With Fresh Orange Juice Or Water, Spices, Coconut Sugar And Salt. Mix Well.
2. Bake At 350F/180C For About 15 Minutes, Remove From The Oven And Then Add The Berries.
3. Make The Crumble By Mixing The Oats, Coconut Sugar, Seeds And Melted Coconut Oil.
4. Place The Crumble On Top Of The Fruit, And Bake Until The Topping Is Golden – Around 30 Minutes.
5. Serve With Soya Or Coconut Ice Cream.

title: The Best Vegan Burger
ingredients:
1. 4 Frys Traditional Burgers
2. Olive Oil
3. 1 Red Onion Thinly Sliced
4. 2 Tsp Sugar
5. 2 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
6. 2 Cloves Garlic Chopped
7. 2 Tbsp Wholegrain Mustard
8. 2 Tsp Flat Leaf Parsley Chopped
9. 1 Tsp Dried Thyme
10. Sea Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper
11. 12 Butternut Thinly Sliced
12. Vegetable Oil
13. 1  Fresh Chillies Finely Chopped To Serve Optional
14. 4 Sesame Burger Buns Toasted
15. 1 Red Onions Peeled
16. 1 Large Ripe Tomato Chopped
17. Lettuce
18. Tomato Chutney Or Sweet  Chilli Sauce
19. Gherkins Sliced
preparation:
1. In A Large Saucepan Heat A Drizzle Of Olive Oil.
2. Add Onions And Stir-Fry For 1 Minute.
3. Add Sugar And Balsamic Vinegar To Caramelise.
4. Remove And Cool Down.
5. Onions Should Still Be Firm.
6. Combine Onion Mixture With Garlic, Mustard, Parsley And Thyme.
7. Fry The Burgers In A Little Oil On Medium Heat For 8 Minutes.
8. Place Patties On Burger Buns And Top With Onion Mixture, Sliced Onion, Tomato, Lettuce, Gherkin And Tomato Chutney Or Sweet & Chilli Sauce.
9. To Make The Butternut Crisps, Preheat Oven To 200ºc.
10. Brush Butternut Slices With Oil.
11. Bake For 20 Mins, Or Until Crispy.
12. Coat Butternut Crisps With Fresh Chilli (Optional), Sea Salt And Black Pepper.

title: Pulled Oumph! Tacos
ingredients:
1. 280 G Pulled Oumph
2. Vegetable Cooking Oil For Frying
3. Your Favourite Taco Fillings We Love Our Tacos With Loads Of Veggies Sliced Tomatoes Salad Leaves Thinly Sliced Peppers Etc Topped With Avocado Cream And Sriracha Mayonnaise And Grated Plantbased Cheese
4. Avocado Cream
5. 2 Avocados
6. 1 Clove Of Garlic
7. 1 Small Piece Of Ginger Approx 1 Cm Square
8. 1 Chili To Taste
9. 12 Tbsp Of Freshly Squeezed Lemon Juice
10. Salt And Ground Black Pepper
11. Sriracha Mayonnaise
12. Plantbased Mayonnaise
13. Sriracha Hot Sauce Or Other Spicy Chilli Hot Sauce
preparation:
1. Instruction ::
2. Defrost The Pulled Oumph!, And Then Fry On A Medium Heat In A Little Vegetable Oil.
3. Avocado Cream:
4. Pit And Peel The Avocado And Place In A Bowl. Crush The Garlic, Grate The Ginger And Add To The Mix. Lastly, Add Finely Chopped Chili, Lemon Juice, Salt And Black Pepper To Taste. Mix With A Hand Blenderuntil It’S A Smooth, Creamyconsistency.
5. Srirachamayonnaise:
6. Place The Mayo In A Bowl And Addsriracha, Or Other Spicy Chili Hot Sauce,To Taste.
7. Build Your Own Tacos With Pulled Oumph!, Your Favourite Veggies, The Avocado Cream, Mayonnaise And Top With Grated Cheese.
8. Boom! Taco Time!

title: Herby Stuffed Squash
ingredients:
1. 2 Butternut Squash Halved Lengthwise
2. 1Tbsp Sunflower Oil
3. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
4. 2 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
5. 200G Dried Green Lentils
6. 50G Millet Or White Quinoa
7. 500Cups Stock
8. 60G Kale Leaves Torn Into Small Pieces
9. 50G Dried Cranberries
10. 12Tsp Sage Finely Chopped
11. 12Tsp Rosemary Finely Chopped
12. 12Tsp Thyme Finely Chopped
13. 1Tsp Salt
14. 12Tsp Ground Black Pepper
15. The Juice Of Half A Lemon
16. 2Tbsp Ground Nuts Or Seeds
preparation:
1. Heat Your Oven To 180C/360F/Gm4.
2. Put The Squash On A Baking Tray, Face Down. Bake For 25-35 Minutes Until It Is Cooked Through.
3. In A Large Saucepan Heat The Oil On A Medium Heat, Once Hot Add The Onions. Cook The Onions For 10-15 Minutes Until They Are Translucent. Add The Garlic, Cook For A Further 5 Minutes Then Add The Lentils, Millet Or Quinoa, Stock, Kale, Cranberries, Herbs, Salt And Pepper. Cook On A Low To Medium Heat For 25-30 Minutes Until The Lentils Are Soft.
4. Scoop Out The Seeds And Some Flesh From The Squash. You Need To Scoop Out Enough So There Is Space For The Lentils. Spoon The Lentils Into The Squash, Add A Little Lemon Juice, Scatter With Ground Nuts Or Seeds And Serve Immediately.

title: Green Bean Salad with Caesar Dressing
ingredients:
1. 5 Cherry Tomatoes
2. 12 Carrot
3. 1 Heaped Tbsp Kidney Beans
4. 12 Bell Pepper
5. 40G Shredded Kale  Rocket
6. 12 Cooked Beetroot
7. 1 Tbsp Of Sesame Seeds
8. Handful Of Almonds
9. For Caesar Salad Dressing See Link In Directions
preparation:
1. Wash The Kale / Rocket
2. Remove The Centre Stalk From The Kale And Shred
3. Wash Tomatoes And Pepper
4. Peel The Carrot
5. Chop The Bell Peppers And Beetroot
6. Toss This Together With The Kale/Rocket Leaves
7. Heat The Kidney Beans Over A Medium Heat For A Few Minutes
8. Grate The Carrot On Top Of The Leaves
9. Drain The Beans And Add Them To The Salad
10. Top With Almonds And Sesame Seeds
11. Garnish With Cherry Tomatoes
12. Dress With Caesar Salad Dressing

title: Oumph! Doner Style Kebab
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Oumph Kebab Dner Style 280 G
2. 3 Tbsp Water
3. 4 Large Pita Breads
4. For The Spicy Tomato Sauce
5. 2 Normal Sized Tomatoes Roughly Chopped
6. 4 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
7. 12 Tsp Chilli Flakes
8. 12 Garlic Minced
9. Salt And White Wine Vinegar To Taste
10. Your Favourite Kebab Veggies For Example Sliced Onions Iceberg Lettuce Sliced Cucumber Shredded Red Cabbage Sliced Chillies Andor Pickled Chillies
11. For The Garlic Yogurt Drizzle
12. 200 Cups Plantbased Yogurt
13. 23 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
14. 1 Tsp Ground Cumin
15. 12 Clove Of Garlic Minced
16. Freshly Squeezed Lemon Juice And Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Start With The Sauces. For The Spicy Tomato Sauce: Place All The Ingreients, Except Salt And Vinegar, In A Bowl. Mix With A Hand Mixer For 11-20 Seconds. Add A Pinch Of Salt And Around 1-2 Tsp Of Vinegar, To Taste.
2. To Make The Garlic Yogurt Drizzle: Mix The Yogurt, Oil And Cumin In A Bowl And Add A Little Salt And A Squeeze Of Lemon, To Taste.
3. Fry The Oumph! Kebab Döner Style (Defrosed Or Straight From The Freezer) In A Hot Frying Pan – But With No Fat Added. Stir For 2-3 Minutes. Add The Water And Fry Until The Water Has Evaporated.
4. Toast The Pita Breads In A Toaster Or Warm Them In The Oven. Fill The Pita Breads With Oumph! Kebab Döner Style And Veggies And Top With The Spicy Tomato Sauce And Garlic Yogurt Drizzle.
5. Serve With Out Without Fries – The Choice Is Yours! Enjoy!

title: Dhal with Caraway Aubergine
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Aubergine
2. 1 Tsp Caraway Seeds
3. Tsp Sea Salt Flakes
4. 4 Tbsp Olive Oil
5. 170G Red Lentils
6. 1 Pint Vegetable Stock
7. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
8. 1 Onion
9. 1 Clove Of Garlic
10. Inch Piece Of Ginger
11. 1 Bay Leaf
12. Stick Of Cinnamon
13. Tsp Cumin
14. Tsp Turmeric
15. Tsp Sea Salt Flakes
16. The Juice Of  A Lemon
preparation:
1. Trim The Ends From The Aubergine And Cut Into ½ Inch Chunks. Place The Oil, Sea Salt And Caraway Seeds Into A Bowl And Mix Together, Add The Aubergine And Toss Into The Oil Until Well Coated. Leave To Marinate.
2. Roughly Chop The Onion And Finely Grate The Garlic And Ginger. Heat The Olive Oil In A Large Saucepan, Add The Onion, Garlic And Ginger And Fry Gently Until The Onion Has Begun To Soften – About 20 Minutes. Add The Spices To The Pan And Continue To Fry For A Further 3 Minutes. Add The Lentils To The Pan And Stir Together Until Coated. Pour Over The Stock, Cover And Bring To The Boil, Then Leave To Simmer Gently For 20 Minutes (Try Not To Stir) Or Until Nearly All Of The Liquid Has Been Absorbed.
3. While The Lentils Are Cooking Preheat The Oven To 180C. Tip The Aubergine Onto A Baking Tray And Roast For 30-35 Minutes Until Golden.
4. Take The Lentils Off The Heat And Then Using A Wooden Spoon, Beat Vigorously Until You Have A Smooth And Creamy Dhal. Stir In The Sea Salt And Lemon Juice, Then Spoon Into A Serving Dish. Roughly Chop The Coriander, And Scatter Over The Dhal Along With The Roasted Aubergine Before Serving.
5. Loved This Recipe? Check Out Thesedelicious Vegan Curry Recipes Or, If You’Re Feeling Inspired, Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox. We’Ll Send You Everything You Need To Try Vegan For 31 Days.

title: Grilled Vegan Feta on Summery Watermelon and Caper Salad
ingredients:
1. Vegan Feta Cheese Ingredients
2. 75G Unsalted Cashew Nuts
3. 150Cups Water
4. 12 Cup Corn Starch
5. 3 12 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
6. 2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
7. 1 Tsp Olive Oil
8. 1 Tsp Salt
9. 14 Tsp Garlic Powder
10. Other Ingredients
11. Watermelon Slices
12. Capers
13. Thinly Sliced Red Onion
14. Mint Or Rocket Leaves
15. Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Add All Vegan Feta Cheese Ingredients Into A Blender (No Need To Soak The Cashews) And Blend Until You Get A Smooth Cheese Sauce.
2. Then Pour It Into A Pan And Heat Up To High To Medium Heat. Stir Continuously So It Doesn’T Burn. Slowly The Sauce Will Turn Into A Thick Paste. Once It Has Reached A Paste-Like Consistency Keep Cooking For Another 2-3 Minutes As The Starch Needs To Be Fully Cooked. If You Don’T Cook It Long Enough You Might Taste The Starch.
3. Transfer The Paste Into A Tupperware Dish And Even It Out With A Spoon. Keep It In The Fridge For At Least 2-3 Hours (Or In The Freezer For 1.5+ Hours) Until It Has Set Completely.
4. Then Cut Off Slices And Sauté The Cooled Down Slices (Don’T Take It Out Fo The Fridge Hours Before, It Works Best When They Are Cool) In A Griddle Pan On Both Sides Until It Turns Crispy And You Can See The Burn Marks.
5. Serve On A Plate On Top Of A Melon And Add Some Capers As Well. Garnish With Either Mint Or Rocket Leaves. Drizzle Some Olive Oil Over It For Some Extra Deliciousness (Not Necessary If You Are Looking To Reduce Calories). Enjoy!
6. —Exceedingly Vegan

title: Chicken Style Curry
ingredients:
1. Ingredients : For The Main Curry
2. Pack Of Squeaky Bean Kick Of Tikka Chicken Style Pieces
3. X1 Red Bell Pepper Diced
4. X1 Tin Of Butter Beans
5. 
6. For The Sauce
7. 2 Tablespoons Of Olive Oil
8. 1 Large Onion Diced Small
9. 1 Tablespoon Grated Fresh Ginger
10. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
11. 1 Tablespoon Garam Masala
12. 1 Teaspoon Curry Powder
13. 1 Teaspoon Ground Coriander
14. 14 Teaspoon Cayenne Pepper
15. 1 Teaspoon Salt
16. 3 Ounces Tomato Paste
17. 1 135 Oz Canned Full Fat Coconut Milk
18. 
19. For Serving
20. 4 Cups Of Basmati Rice
21. Vegan Naan Bread
22. Chopped Coriander To Season
preparation:
1. Add 2 Tablespoons Of Olive Oil In A Pan Over Medium-High Heat. Saute The Onion For 3-4 Minutes, Then Add The Ginger And Garlic And Cook For 1 More Minute. Add The Spices, Salt, Tomato Paste And Coconut Milk. Stir Until Smooth And Combined, Then Simmer For 5-10 Minutes, Stirring Frequently. Once Finished, Put This Mixture To One Side.
2. In Another Pan On Medium Heat, Add Some Olive Oil And Cook The Diced Pepper Until Softened. Then, Add The Tin Of Butter Beans, Stir And Leave For 1 More Minute. Add The Pack Of Tikka Pieces, Stir So All The Ingredients Are Combined And Turn Down The Heat To Low.
3. Take Your Sauce And Slowly Start Adding The Mixture To The Ingredients. Keep This On A Low Heat And Slowly Cook Until The Ingredients Start Bubbling.
4. We Suggest Serving With Basmati Rice, Vegan Naan And A Sprinkle Of Chopped Coriander For The Ultimate Curry Experience!

title: Macro Paella
ingredients:
1. Tsp Saffron Threads
2. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
3. 2 Garlic Clovescrushed
4. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
5. 2 Tomatoes Finely Chopped
6. 1 Red Pepperyellow Peppergreen Pepper Deseeded And Finely Chopped
7. 1 Handful Fresh Green Beans Finely Chopped
8. Miso Bouillon Sachet Or Organic Vegetable Stock Cube Mixed In 1 Litre Of Water Uk 18 Pints
9. 1 Pack Tempeh Seitan Or Tofu Cut Into Small Cubes If Desired
10. 2 Tbsp Tamari Or Shoyu
11. Lemon Wedges
12. 2 Cups Paella Rice Or Brown Rice
preparation:
1. Soak The Saffron Threads In A Bowl Of Water And Set Off To The Side.
2. If You Are Adding Any Vegetable Protein Heat Some Olive Oil In A Pan And Fry The Tempeh/Seitan Or Tofu On Either Side For A Few Minutes Until Golden, Remove And Set Aside.
3. In A Large Paella Pan Heat The Olive Oil And Add The Garlic, Onion And Tomatoes And Sauté Until Soft.
4. Add The Sweet Peppers, Green Beans, And Cover With The Bouillon Stock.
5. Add The Tamari And Leave To Simmer At A Low Heat For 30 Minutes Or More Until The Vegetables Are Al Dente, Adding More Water If Necessary.
6. Add The Rice One Handful At A Time Along With The Tempeh, Seitan Or Tofu (If Using), And Then Add The Saffron Threads And The Soaking Water, Adding Some More Water If Required.
7. Cover With Some Foil And Simmer For Half An Hour Until The Rice Is Also Soft To The Bite.
8. Serve With Lemon Wedges On The Side Of The Pan.

title: Pastéis de Nata
ingredients:
1. 1 Sheet Of Puff Pastry
2. 200 Cups Of Coconut Milk
3. Cup Of Soya Cream
4. Cup Of Soya Milk
5. Tsp Of Vanilla Essence
6. 1 Tsp Of Cinnamon
7. 30G Of Cornflour
8. 100G Of Sugar
9. 1 Small Skin Of Lemon
10. 1 Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Turn On The Oven At 250º C.
2. In A Pan, Add The Dry Ingredients (Except The Salt) And The Soya Cream And Mix Well Everything. Add The Other Liquid Ingredients And Mix Again.
3. Heat At A Medium Temperature Until It Boils And Gets Thick. Do Not Forget To Always Stir It When Cooking. Add The Salt, Mix It And Put Aside.
4. Cut The Pastry Into Little Rolls. Fold Each Of Them And Press Into The Walls Of The Small Moulds. It Must Be As Thin As You Can, But Without Making Holes On It.
5. Fill Half Of The Moulds With The Cream, Lay Them On A Baking Tray And Oven Bake For About 20 Minutes Or Until The Cream Is Dark.
6. Serve The “Pastéis De Nata” Warm With A Little Cinnamon On The Top.
7. Maria Aragão, Author Of The Vegan Recipes Book “Omeletas Sem Ovos”.

title: Mushroom and Chestnut Wellington
ingredients:
1. Mushroom And Chestnut Wellington
2. 200G Chestnut Mushrooms
3. 100G Shiitake Mushrooms
4. 300G Chestnuts Roasted And Peeled
5. 125G Cooked Blackeyed Beans
6. 1 Red Onion
7. 2 Cloves Garlic
8. 1 Tsp Dried Sage
9. 1 Tbsp Mushroom Ketchup Optional
10. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
11. Salt And Pepper
12. Shortcrust Spelt Pastry
13. 175G Spelt Flour
14. 75G Vegan Margarine
15. 34 Tbsp Water
16. 2 Tbsp Nondairy Milk For Brushing
preparation:
1. Begin By Cooking Your Chestnuts.Whilst Your Chestnuts Are Roasting, Finely Chop The Onion And Gently Fry In A Frying Pan Until Translucent And Just Starting To Caramelise.
2. Mince The Garlic And Slice The Mushrooms And Stir Into The Onion. Sweat On A Medium Heat Until Most Of The Water Has Been Released From The Mushrooms And They Are Just Starting To Brown. Then Set The Pan Aside To Cool.
3. In A Food Processor, Blend The Beans And Chestnuts Until They Start To Resemble Breadcrumbs. If You Like A Little Extra Texture Blend The Chestnuts Separately And Leave Them A Little Coarser.
4. Place The Bean And Chestnut Mixer Into A Large Mixing Bowl.
5. Blend The Mushrooms In The Food Processor And Add To The Mixing Bowl Along With The Sage, And Mushroom Ketchup If Using.
6. Mix Together Well And Season To Taste And Set Aside Whilst You Make The Pastry.
7. Measure Out The Flour And Marg Into A Large Mixing Bowl And Chop Into The Marg With A Knife Until Cut Into Fairly Small Chunks. Then Rub The Mixture Together With Your Fingertips Until It Resembles Fine Breadcrumbs.
8. Add The Water A Bit At A Time Until The Mixture Comes Together In Your Hands To Form A Ball.
9. Place The Pastry Covered In The Fridge For 20 Mins Before Rolling It Out On A Lightly Floured Surface Into A Large Rectangle.
10. Mould The Mushroom Mixture Into A Loaf Shape In The Centre Of Your Pastry Length Ways.
11. Brush The Pastry Edges With Milk And Carefully Roll The Whole Thing, Leaving The Seam Underneath.
12. Pinch The Ends Together And Brush The Whole Thing With Milk, Make A Few Small Cuts In The Pastry For Steam To Escape Then Place Onto A Greased Baking Tray.
13. Bake In A Pre-Heated Oven At 180C For 35-40 Mins Until Golden Brown.

title: Low Sugar Sweet and Sour Sauce
ingredients:
1. 1Tsp Olive Oil Or Coconut Oil
2. 1 Small Red Onion Finely Diced
3. 2 Crushed Garlic Cloves
4. Tsp Fresh Ginger Root Grated
5. Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Diced Or Pinch Of Chilli Flakes Optional
6. Tsp Chinese Five Spice Powder
7. 4 Tbsp Tomato Puree
8. 200Cups Fresh Vegetable Stock
9. 2Tsp Cornflour
10. 2 Tbsp Rice Vinegar Or Apple Cider Vinegar
11. 2 Tbsp Xylitol Or Pinch Of Stevia To Taste
12. 2 Tbsp Tamari Soy Sauce Gluten Free
13. 200G Fresh Pineapple Cut Into Small Pieces
14. Freshly Ground Black Pepper
15. Pinch Of Sea Salt
preparation:
1. Heat The Oil In A Pan And Saute The Onion For A Couple Of Minutes Until It Starts To Soften. Add The Garlic, Ginger And Chilli If Using And Stir For A Minute.
2. In A Small Bowl Add The Cornflour And Mix In 3Tbsp Of Vegetable Stockto Make A Smooth Paste.
3. Add The Remaining Vegetablestock, Vinegar, Xylitol, Tamari And Tomato Puree To The Pan And Bring To The Boil. Turn Down The Heat, Add The Pineapple Chunks And Cornflour Paste And Simmer For A Couple Of Minutes To Thicken The Sauce. Season To Taste.

title: Raspberry Frozen Yogurt
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Frozen Raspberries
2. 1 Cup Warm Water
3. 2 6Ounce Containers Greekstyle Coconut Or Soy Yogurt
4. 13 Cup Coconut Sugar Or Other Dry Sweetener
5. 18 Cup Agave Nectar
6. 1 Tablespoon Grand Marnier
preparation:
1. Mix The Sugar And Agave Nectar In The Cup Of Water And Stir Until Dissolved. Add This Mixture To A Blender (High Speed If You Have One) With The Frozen Raspberries. Blend Until Thoroughly Combined.
2. Strain The Mixture Through A Mesh Sieve Into A Large Bowl Or Another Vessel That Will Be Easy To Pour. This Will Remove Any Crunchy Raspberry Seeds That May Not Have Been Blended. This Is Optional But Recommended. It Creates A Much Creamier, More Pleasant Texture.
3. After Straining, Return About One Half Of The Mixture To The Blender. Then Add The Yogurt And Blend Again Until Smooth. Pour Back Into The Bowl With The Rest Of Your Raspberry Puree, And Add The Grand Marnier, Too. Whisk Until Incorporated.
4. Follow The Instruction : On Your Ice Cream Maker For The Rest. This Batch Went Through Mine For Between 15-20 Minutes.
5. Makes Approximately 1 Quart.
6. By Lizz Clements

title: Oumph! Tikka Masala
ingredients:
1. 280 G Oumph The Chunk
2. 1 Onion
3. 3 Garlic Cloves
4. 3 Cm Ginger
5. 3 Tbsp Garam Masala
6. 2 Tbsp Tomato Pure
7. Red Chilli Pepper
8. 50 G Of Plantbased Margarine
9. 400 G Coconut Cream
10. 400 G Finely Chopped Tomatoes
11. 1 Tbsp Vegetable Stock Powder
12. 4 Green Cardamom Pods
13. 1 Lime
14. 1 Tomato
15. Bell Pepper
16. To Serve Basmati Rice And Cardamom Pods Fresh Coriander
preparation:
1. Peel And Chop The Onion, Garlic And Ginger. Chop The Chilli.
2. Fry The Chopped Ingredients With The Tomato Purée And Spices In The Margarine.
3. Add The Coconut Cream, Chopped Tomatoes And 4 Cardamom Pods, Crushed.
4. Bring To The Boil And Simmer For 10 Minutes.
5. Season To Taste With The Juice Of 1 Lime And Salt.
6. Add Oumph! And Simmer For A Further 7-10 Minutes.
7. Dice The Tomato And Bell Pepper And Add Them To The Pan For The Final 2 Minutes.
8. Cook The Basmati Rice As Stated On The Packaging, But Add A Pair Of Crushed Cardamom Pods To The Cooking Water.
9. Chopped Coriander Is The Finishing Touch In “Tikka” – Namaste!
10. Enjoyed Making This? Why Not Try More Of Our Vegan Curry Recipes?

title: Sweet and Sour Tofu with Edamame Noodles
ingredients:
1. 1 Block Of Firm Tofu I Used Cauldron Which Is Available In Most Uk Supermarkets
2. 2T Tamari You Can Sub With Soya Sauce If Youre Ok With Gluten
3. 1T Toasted Sesame Oil
4. 1 Red Birdseye Chilli The Small Hot Chillies
5. 1 Inch Of Ginger Root
6. The Juice Of Half A Lime
7. 2 Medjool Dates Or 4 Other Dates Soaked In Hot Water To Soften For 10 Minutes
8. Half A Cup Of Water
9. 100G Edamame Noodles Or Rice Noodles
10. Sunflower Or Coconut Oil
11. 2 Handfuls Mangetout
12. 1 Red Pepper Sliced
13. 2 Handfuls Beansprouts
14. 1 Bunch Coriander Leaf
preparation:
1. Wrap The Tofu In A Clean Cloth, Place Something Flat On Top Of It, Such As A Chopping Board. Add Something Heavy. Leave It To Press For 1 Hour. You Can Use A Tofu Press Also.
2. Heat Your Oven To 200C.
3. Boil Water In Your Kettle.
4. Cut The Tofu Into Bitesize Squares And Put It Into A Tupaware Box. Add The Tamari And Sesame Oil, Put The Lid On And Rotate The Box Until The Tofu Is Covered.
5. Place The Tofu On A Baking Sheet And Into The Oven Whilst You Cook The Rest Of The Dish.
6. Roughly Chop The Chilli And Ginger. Blend These With The Lime Juice, Dates And Water.
7. Put The Hot Water From Your Kettle In A Large Frying Pan On The Hob. Bring To The Boil And Add The Noodles. Once Cooked Drain And Set Aside, Return The Pan To The Heat.
8. Add The Oil And The Veg, Fry On A High Heat, Stirring Occasionally. When The Veg Starts To Char Add The Noodles, Tofu And Sauce. Add Salt To Taste.
9. Tear The Top Leaves From The Bunch Of Coriander. There Is No Need To Chop It With A Knife. Add To The Dish, Stir Well And Serve.

title: Beetroot and Kale Burgers with Balsamic Red Onions
ingredients:
1. Makes 6 Burgers
2. 2 Medium Cooked Beetroot
3. 50G Bulgar Wheat Cooked According To Package Directions
4. 50G Red Lentils Cooked Along With The Bulgar
5. 50G Houmous
6. Zest Of 1 Lemon
7. 1 Tsp Ground Cumin
8. 4 Large Leaves Of Kale Quite Finely Chopped
9. Sea Salt And Cracked Black Pepper To Taste
10. Buns And Garnishes Of Choice To Serve
11. For The Onions
12. 2 Red Onions Sliced Into Rings
13. 2 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
14. 12Tsp Fennel Seeds
preparation:
1. Start With The Onions, Saute Over A Low-Medium Heat In A Teaspoon Of Oil Or A Splash Of Water Until Soft And Lightly Coloured.
2. Stir In The Fennel Seeds And Vinegar And Keep Warm.
3. Meanwhile, Pulse Together The Burger Ingredients Until It Can Clump Together, It Should Still Have Texture And Flecks Of Kale But Be Able To Be Formed Into Burger Shapes. If The Mixture Seems To Wet, Add Breadcrumbs Or Ground Almonds A Tablespoon At A Time Or If It Seems Too Dry, Add Water A Tablespoon At A Time.
4. Make 6 Burgers Out Of The Mixture And Grill With A Little Cooking Spray Until Coloured, Just A Couple Of Minutes On Each Side. Alternatively Use A Cast Iron Pan Or Regular Frying Pan.
5. Serve In Buns, Topped With Onions And Your Favourite Garnishes.

title: Power-packed Horlicks Vegan Energy Balls
ingredients:
1. 100G Dried Apricots
2. 100G Dates
3. 100G Pecan Nuts
4. 50Cups Coconut Milk
5. 25G Horlicks Vegan
6. 25G Coconut Oil
7. 15G Sunflower Seeds
8. 10G Poppy Seeds
9. 15G Crushed Pecan Nuts
10. 10G Desiccated Coconut
11. Pinch Of Ground Turmeric
12. Pinch Of Ground Cinnamon
preparation:
1. Blitz Apricots, Dates, Pecan Nuts, Turmeric, Cinnamon In A Food Processor Until Finely Chopped.
2. Add The Horlicks Vegan, Coconut Milk And Melted Coconut Oil And Blend Until It Comes Together.
3. Shape The Mix Into Walnut-Sized Balls, Roll Some Of The Balls In Chopped Sunflower Seeds, Some In Poppy Seeds, Some In Crushed Pecan Nuts And Some In Desiccated Coconut.
4. Store In An Airtight Container Until You Need An Energy Uplift!

title: Ciambotta (Vegetable Stew)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Oil Or Water For Sauting
2. 1 Large Yellow Onion Chopped
3. 3 Medium Carrots Peeled And Diced
4. 2 Stalks Of Celery Diced
5. 3 Cloves Garlic Peeled And Finely Chopped
6. 1 Medium Globe Eggplant Chopped Into 1Inch Pieces
7. Cup 120 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
8. 1 28Ounce Can Fire Roasted Diced Tomatoes
9. 2 Large Yellow Potatoes Peeled And Chopped
10. 2 Red Bell Peppers Seeded And Diced
11. 2 Medium Zucchini Or Any Summer Squash Unpeeled And Diced
12. 2 Bay Leaves Fresh Or Dried
13. 1 Teaspoon Dried Thyme
14. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
15. 1 Teaspoon Dried Parsley
16. 1 Teaspoon Dried Tarragon
17. 1 Teaspoon Salt
18. Freshly Ground Pepper
19. Cup 10 To 12 Leaves Chopped Basil
preparation:
1. Heat The Oil Or Water In A Soup Pot Over Medium-High Heat For Just About 1 Minute. Add The Onions, Carrots, Celery, And Garlic, And Cook For About 10 Minutes Until All The Veggies Begin To Soften. Stir Occasionally.
2. Add The Eggplant And Water, And Cook, Covered, Until The Eggplant Is Slightly Softened, About 10 Minutes.
3. Add The Canned Tomatoes With Their Juice, Potatoes, Bell Peppers, Zucchini, Bay Leaves, Thyme, Oregano, Parsley, And Tarragon. Stir, Then Reduce Heat To Low And Cook Uncovered For About 25 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Until All The Vegetables Are Soft. (If Water/Broth Evaporates While The Vegetables Are Still Cooking, Add A Little Extra.)
4. Stir In The Salt And Pepper, Along With The Chopped Basil. Serve Immediately With A Hearty, Rustic Loaf Of Bread.
5. For Your Edification
6. Mirepoix Is A Mixture Of Chopped Onions, Carrots, And Celery, And To Reduce Some Prep Time, You Can Often Find Pre-Chopped Mirepoix In Such Grocery Stores As Trader Joe’S And Whole Foods (Usa Only).
7. For Your Modification
8. Add Your Favorite Vegan Italian Sausage, Such As Field Roast Or Tofurky, To The Stew At The End. I Think For Maximum Flavor And Texture, You Will Want To Slice The Sausage(S) Into Discs, Fry Them In A Little Olive Oil, Then Add Them To The Soup In The Last 10 Or 15 Minutes Of Cooking.

title: Vegan Chilli
ingredients:
1. 1 White Onion
2. 3 Cloves Of Garlic
3. Salt
4. Paprika
5. A Chilli Pepper  Your Choice Of Hotness
6. Around Half A Pack Of Vegan Soya Mince Dried Or Frozen
7. Two Tins Of Beans  Kidney White Butter Or Pinto Beans All Work Well
8. Tomato Puree
preparation:
1. Like Any Good Dish, Start By Frying Chopped Onion And Garlic In A Large Frying Pan. Chuck In Some Salt, Pepper And A Hefty Sprinkling Of Paprika; At Least A Tablespoon.
2. Add Chopped Chili Pepper – Your Preference Of Chili. One Whole Chili Should Do The Job; Go For Birds Eye If You Want A Hot One, Or One Of The Larger Chili’S, Which Usually Don’T Pack Quite As Much Heat. Also, Including Seeds Make It Hotter, So Ditch Them If You Are A Mega Chili Weed!
3. Add The Mince Once The Onions, Garlic And Chili Are Soft
4. When The Mince Has Browned Add Your Beans. I Can’T Imagine A Chilli Without Kidney Beans, They Are A Must.
5. Next, Add A Tin Of Tomatoes. Also Add Some Tomato Puree – How Much Depends On How Rich You Want It. Leave It To Simmer. The Longer You Simmer, The Tastier It Will Be. At Least Half An Hour Should Do The Job.
6. Serve With Rice, Nachos, Tacos Or Jacket Potato. Delicious Accompanied With Guacamole And Salsa!

title: Sweet Potato, Black Bean Patties
ingredients:
1. 2 Cans Black Beans
2. 2 Medium Sweet Potatoes
3. 1 Cup Crushed Tortilla Chips  Optional
4. 12 Red Onion Finely Diced
5. 12 Cup Coriander Diced
6. 12 Cup Sweet Corn
7. 1 Tbsp Paprika
8. 1 Tsp Garlic Powdergranules
9. 1 Tsp Cumin
10. Pinch Of Chili Powder
11. Cup Of Polenta Flour To Coat
12. Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Makes 8 Patties.
2. Preheat Oven To 170 Degrees
3. Wash Sweet Potatoes And Cut Into Cubes, Leaving The Skin On.
4. Place Into A Steamer And Steam Until Soft. This Takes Approximately 20 Minutes.
5. Drain And Rinse Black Beans, Place In A Large Mixing Bowl.
6. Add Onion, Coriander, Sweet Corn, Paprika, Garlic, Cumin And Chilli Powder To The Mixture.
7. When The Sweet Potatoes Are Ready Place In A Separate Mixing Bowl And Mash With The Back Of A Fork Or A Masher Until Creamy.
8. Add The Black Bean Mixture And 1 Cup Of Crushed Tortilla Chips To The Sweet Potato Mixture And Mix Well.
9. On A Separate Plate/Bowl Pour ¼ Cup Of Polenta Flour Ready To Coat The Patties.
10. Prepare The Mixture Into The Patty Size Desired, Roll In Polenta Flour Until They Are Completely Coated And Set Aside On A Baking Tray Lined With Nonstick Baking Paper.
11. Brush A Small Amount Of Oil Onto Each Patty, Place In The Oven And Bake For Around 30-40 Minutes, Flipping Them Halfway. The Longer You Bake Them The Firmer And Drier They Will Get.
12. Serve With Your Favourite Filling.

title: Chipotle Kale Bean Stew
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Coconut Oil
2. 2 Medium Red Onions Finely Diced
3. 2 Large Carrot Diced
4. 2 Red Pepper Finely Diced
5. 2 Tbsp Dried Thyme
6. 1 Tbsp Sweet Paprika
7. 1 Tbsp Tomato Pure
8. 1 X 400G Black Beans Drained
9. 12 Tbsp Of Lemon Juice
10. 1 12 Tbsp Milled Chia Seeds Or 1 Tbsp Pulsin Protein Powder I Use Pea Or Soya
11. 5 Plump Garlic Cloves Minced
12. 3 Celery Stalks Finely Diced
13. 2 Large Sweet Potatoes Diced
14. 1 12 Tbsp Dried Oregano
15. 12 Tsp Chipotle Powder Or 1 Tsp Chipotle Paste
16. 750Cups Vegetable Stock
17. 1 X 400G Can Of Blackeyed Beans Drained
18. 150G Black Kale Finely Sliced
19. Salt  Pepper
20. To Garnish Freshly Chopped Parsley  Ground Flaxseed
preparation:
1. Melt Coconut Oil In A Large Non-Stick Pot.
2. Add The Minced Garlic And Chopped Red Onion, Brown For About 2 Mins Before Adding The Chopped Celery, Carrot And Sweet Potato. Cook For A Further 2 Mins Before Adding In The Diced Red Pepper.
3. Add The Herbs And Spices, And Mix For About 30 Secs Before Adding In The Stock, Tomato Purée Black-Eyed Beans And Black Beans. Simmer For 20 Mins.
4. Add The Chopped Black Kale And Cook For A Further 4 Mins. Add Lemon Juice. Season With Salt And Pepper. Stir In Milled Chia Seeds Or 1 Tbsp Protein Powder (Pea Or Soya Bean Derived Work Well) To Thicken The Sauce.
5. Serve With A Garnish Of Chopped Parsley
6. Optional: Serve With A Sprinkle Of Ground Flaxseed To Boost The Nutrient Content.
7. So Man
8. Www.Sobody.Co.Uk
9. Hello! I Am So From Sobodyuk. I Am A Gym Bunny, Healthy Food Blogger & A Geeky Scientist! These Days My Lab Is The Kitchen! I Love Creating Delicious, Healthy, Wholefood, Clean-Eating, Nutrition-Dense Recipes To Maximise Performance & Health. My Recipes Include Paleo, Low Carb, Vegan, Vegetarian, Gluten Free.

title: Vegan Buddha Bowl With Almond Avocado Dressing
ingredients:
1. Base
2. 1 Red Onion Chopped
3. 20G Ginger Grated
4. 200G Glutenfree Noodles Cooked
5. 
6. Miso Eggplant  Tofu
7. 2 Tsp Miso Paste
8. 2 Tbsp Tamari
9. 20G Grated Ginger
10. 2 Tbsp Sesame Oil
11. 1 Eggplant Sliced
12. 200 Grams Organic Tofu Cubed
13. 
14. Salad Ingredients
15. 1 Carrot Spiralled Or Grated
16. 14 Red Cabbage Shredded
17. 1 Zucchini Spiralised Or Ribboned
18. 1 Bunch Asparagus Steamed
19. 
20. Tangy Almond Horseradish Dressing
21. 1 Avocado
22. 12 Cup Califia Farms Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Another Plant Milk Of Your Choice
23. 12 Tbsp Olive Oil
24. 12 Tbsp Lime Juice
25. 2 Tsp Horseradish Mustard
26. 2 Tsp Miso Paste
27. Nigella Seeds Add To Taste
28. 2 Tbsp Tamari
29. Salt And Pepper Add To Taste
preparation:
1. Prepare The ‘Base’ Of Your Buddha Bowl. Braise Onion (Simmer In A Small Amount Of Water) For Five Minutes. Add Grated Ginger, Continue On Low Heat For A Further Minute Or Two.
2. Toss Noodles In Onion, Ginger Mix And Set Aside.
3. To Prepare Miso Marinade, Combine Miso Paste, Tamari, Ginger And Sesame Oil In A Small Bowl, Mix Well. Coat Tofu And Eggplant In This Mix And Set Aside.
4. Using A Double-Sided Griddle, Grill Eggplant For 15 Minutes (Or Until Soft). Alternatively, You Can Bake Eggplant However This Will Take Longer (Up To 30 Minutes Depending On How Thickly The Eggplant Is Sliced).
5. Pan Fry Marinated Tofu In Heavy Based Pan, Approximately 5 Minutes Each Side. Set Aside To Cool.
6. To Prepare The Dressing, Mix Ingredients In A High-Speed Blender, Blend Until Smooth.
7. Arrange Noodles, Vegetables, Eggplant And Tofu In A Large Bowl. Generously Drizzle With Dressing.

title: Vegan Big Breakfast
ingredients:
1. 1 Can Organic Kidney Beans Aprox 240G
2. 1 Can Organic Chickpeas Aprox 240G
3. 2 Cans Organic Chopped Tomatoes Aprox 280G
4. 2 Large Potatoes Washed
5. 150G Fresh Parsley
6. 2 Ripe Avocadoes
7. 500G Mushrooms
8. 900G Raw Spinach
9. 2 Cloves Garlic
10. 4 Ripe Tomatoes
11. 1 Onion
12. 150G Fresh Basil
13. Juice Of Half A Lemon
14. 14 Cup Olive Oil
15. 1 Tbsp Sunflower Oil
16. 2 Springs Fresh Rosemary
17. 12 Tbsp Cumin
18. Salt And Pepper
19. Loaf Of Fresh Sourdough Bread
preparation:
1. Turn Your Oven On To A Low Heat
2. Begin By Chopping Your Potatoes Into Large Chunks, Ready For Boiling
3. Place A Large Saucepan Of Water On To Boil
4. Dice Your Onion And Garlic. Leave Half The Garlic For Your Mushrooms And The Other Half For The Beans.
5. Slice Mushrooms In Half.
6. When Water Is Boiling – Place Your Potatoes In. Leave For Approximately 15 Minutes Or Until Soft.
7. Meanwhile, Heat Your Sunflower Oil In A Large Wok Or Frying Pan. Add Onion And Half The Garlic. Saute Until Brown.
8. Add The Canned Tomatoes, Kidney Beans, Chickpeas, Cumin And About 1/2 Cup Diced Basil. Leave To Simmer On A Low Heat. This Should Gradually Thicken, So By The Time You Are Ready To Serve – You Have A Thick Spicy Bean Mixture! Add Salt And Pepper To Taste. Ideally This Should Have About 40 Minutes To An Hour To Simmer And Let The Flavors Marinate.
9. When Your Potatoes Are Cooked – Drain Out All The Water And Mash Roughly With A Masher Or Fork. Leave Them Nice And Chunky And The Skin On! Add Your Parsley, Olive Oil, Lemon Juice, Rosemary, Salt And Pepper And Continue To Stir And Combine All Together.
10. Make Small Potato Cakes With Your Hands And Set Aside.
11. Add A Little Bit Of Oil Into A Frying Pan And Fry Off Your Potato Cakes For A Few Minutes On Both Sides.
12. Once All Are Browned On Both Sides – Pop Them Into The Oven To Stay Warm Until Serving Time.
13. In The Same Frying Pan – Add Your Sunflower Oil, Chopped Garlic And Mushrooms. Saute These Over A Medium Heat Until Your Mushrooms Are Cooked And Nice And Garlic-Y. Add The Spinach, Rosemary And A Sprinkling Of Salt And Pepper Closer To Serving Time.
14. About Ten Minutes Before Serving: Halve Your Whole Tomatoes And Place Them Under The Grill For A Few Minutes With A Sprinkling Of Salt And Pepper And A Little Drizzle Of Olive Oil.
15. Flan Your Avocado By Halving, Removing The Stone, Scooping Out Each Half With A Spoon To Separate From The Skin And Then Slicing Into A Nice Flan. Set Aside.
16. Slice Your Sourdough Nice And Thickly – You Can Optionally Toast This And Add Some Vegan Butter Or Olive Oil!
17. Assemble!!
18. Begin With Your Slice Of Sourdough And Around It – Arrange The Potato Cakes, Spicy Beans, Mushrooms And Spinach Mixture, Tomato And Avocado. Finish Your Dish With A Lovely Spring Of Fresh Rosemary.
19. Enjoy!

title: Fresh and zesty pasta sauce
ingredients:
1. 450G1Lb Pasta  Spaghetti Or Linguini Work Well But Feel Free To Experiment With Other Types Eg Fusilli Penne Wholemeal Noodles
2. 23 Tbsp Olive Oil Extra Virgin If Possible
3. 3 Large Cloves Garlic
4. 2 Large Ripe Avocados  The Readytoeat Variety Are Best
5. 2 Large Ripe Tasty Tomatoes  Eg Beefsteak Variety
6. Medium Red Chilli
7. 15 Fresh Basil Leaves Torn  A Good Handful
8. Zest And Juice Of A Lime
9. Salt And Lots Of Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Options
2. For Those Who Prefer Large Quantities Of Garlic To Be Cooked, Sauté The Garlic In Some Of The Olive Oil First. Then Just Mix It In With The Chopped Vegetables, Herbs And Pasta As Below.
3. Replace Avocados With Strips Of Roasted Red Pepper – Home-Made Or In A Jar. You Will Need At Least Half A Large Jar. Roasted Peppers Are Sold Either In Brine Or In Oil. If The Former, Drain Well And Do Not Add Extra Salt To The Dish. If They Are In Oil, Omit Most Of The Oil In The Recipe.
4. Greener Pasta!
5. Boil A Kettle Of Hot Water, Pour It Into Your Saucepan, Add The Pasta And A Little Salt. Bring To The Boil, Then Switch Off The Heat And Cover The Pan With A Well-Fitting Lid. The Pasta Will Continue To Cook In The Hot Water – In The Usual Cooking Time But Without Using Extra Fuel. Stir Occasionally To Prevent Clumping.
6. Cook The Pasta In A Large Pan Of Salted Boiling Water According To The Packet Instruction : – Or See Our Top Tip Above.
7. While The Pasta Is Cooking Prepare The Rest Of The Dish.
8. If You Are Cooking The Garlic, Do So Now. Heat 2 Tbsp Of The Oil In A Small Frying Pan And Fry It Gently For A Minute Or Two, Making Sure It Does Not Burn. Remove From Heat – Keeping Any Remaining Oil – And Set Aside.
9. If Using The Garlic Raw, Crush And Set Aside.
10. Peel The Avocados. Remove The Stones And Chop Into Chunks.
11. Chop The Tomatoes Into Chunks.
12. De-Seed The Chilli And Chop Fine.
13. Drain The Pasta And Mix In The Prepared Vegetables.
14. Add The Remaining Olive Oil, Lime Zest/Juice And Basil Leaves. Season Well.
15. Serve Immediately.

title: Peppers Stuffed With Leek Risotto
ingredients:
1. 500Cups Water
2. 2T Stock Powder
3. 1 Leek
4. 1 Large Garlic Clove
5. 1T Extra Virgin Olive Oil
6. 150G 1 Cup Risotto Rice Arborio Carnaroli Etc
7. 120Cups 12C White Wine
8. 12T Rosemary
9. 60G Baby Spinach
10. Salt
11. 3 Peppers
12. 1T Pine Nuts
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200C
2. Heat The Water With The Stock In A Pan, Once Hot Lower The Heat
3. Finely Chop The Garlic And Roughly Slice The Leek
4. In A Large Pan Heat The Oil, Add The Garlic And Leek
5. Fry On A Low To Medium Heat, This Will Take A While But The Leek Needs To Be On A Low Heat As It Burns Easily
6. Once The Leek Is Soft Add The Rice And Mix Well
7. Add The Wine And Mix Well Again
8. Allow The Wine To Reduce By Half
9. Add The Rosemary Either Whole Or Chopped Finely, Depending On Your Preference
10. Add The Stock 1/2 A Cup At A Time, Allowing It To Be Absorbed Almost Completely Before Adding The Next
11. This Process May Take 30 Minutes Or So
12. Once The Rice Is Cooked Add Salt To Taste
13. Cut The Top Off The Peppers And Remove The Seeds And The Bitter Membrane
14. Fill With The Risotto, Wrap Each In Foil And Bake For 30 Minutes
15. Toast The Pine Nuts And Scatter On Top

title: Sweet Spiced Seitan Skewers
ingredients:
1. Approx 250G Of Seitan I Used Granovita Mock Duck Which Comes In A 285G Tin
2. 12 Chillies
3. Handful Of Coriander Leaves
4. 1 Teaspoon Of Grated Ginger
5. 2 Tablespoons Of Soy Sauce
6. 1 Teaspoon Of Maple Syrup
7. 1 Teaspoon Of Rice Vinegar Or Similar
8. 1 Teaspoon Of Sesame Seeds
9. Skewers
preparation:
1. If Using Bamboo Skewers, Pop Them In Water To Soak To Help Prevent Them Burning
2. Chop The Seitan Into 1/2 Inch Thick Pieces – Don’T Worry Too Much About Uniformity
3. Chop The Chillies And Coriander Leaves
4. Place The Seitan, Chillies, Coriander, And Ginger Into A Bowl
5. Add The Liquid Ingredients And Sesame Seeds
6. Mix Well Then Leave To Soak For 15-20 Minutes
7. Place Onto Skewers In Desired Portions
8. Spoon Any Left Over Mixture Over The Skewers
9. Grill & Eat!

title: “Deluxe-tarian” Burger
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Garden Gourmet Sensational Burger Or Another Plantbased Equivalent
2. 50 G Vegan Cheese
3. 1 Ripe Fig
4. 2 Tblsp Hummus
5. 1 Small Head Of Green Curly Lettuce
6. 1 Tblsp Ready To Eat Pomegranate Seeds
7. 2 Tbsp Vegan Yoghurt
8. 2 Vegan Green Burger Buns See Recipe Or Use Other Vegan Burger Buns
9. 50 G Baby Spinach Leaves And A Few Leaves Curly Lolo Bionda Lettuce
preparation:
1. Slice The Zucchini And Vegan Cheese, Grill The Slices For About 2 To 3 Minutes In A Hot Grill Pan On Both Sides Till Grill Marks Are Showing And Set Aside. Also Cut The Fig In Slices.
2. Cut The Burger Buns Lengthwise And Grill Both Cutting Sides Until Grill Marks Are Showing.
3. Grill The Burgers According To The Instruction : On The Package And Place Slices Of The Vegan Cheese On It While The Burgers Are Still Warm.
4. Spread The Bun Bottoms With Hummus. Cover With Spinach And Place The Burgers With Vegan Cheese On It. Place Fig Slices On The Vegan Cheese And A Few Leaves Of Curly Lettuce.
5. Spoon Vegan Yoghurt Sauce On It, Sprinkle With Pomegranate Seeds And Place The Lids On Top Ingredients And Season With Salt And Lime Juice.
6. For 7 Vegan Burger Buns We Will Need: 1 Pack Of White Bread Mix (With Yeast, 450 G), 300 G Fresh Spinach, 2 Tblsp Extra Virgin Oil , 275 Ml Of Luke Warm Water, 1 Tblsp Coconut Milk To Brush, Sesame Seeds And / Or Poppyseed. Preheat The Oven To 180 ºc.Cook (Stir While Cooking) The Spinach Short With A Little Water. Rinse Under Cold Water In A Colander And Grind Into Puree In A Kitchen Machine. Mix It Into The Bread Mix And Add Water And Olive Oil. Knead And Let Rise According To The Instruction : On The Package. Divide The Dough Into 7 Equal Pieces And Roll Into Balls. Shape Them Into Balls By Rolling The Dough Under The Hollow Of Your Hands. Place Them Seam Side Down On A Oil Creased Baking Tray Or On Baking Paper. Brush Them Lightly With Coconut Milk And Sprinkle With Sesame Seeds And / Or Poppy Seeds. Let Them Rise Again To Double Volume And Bake Them For Approx.15 Minutes. They Should Sound Hollow When Tapped Underneath.

title: Lemon Sesame Seed Protein Balls
ingredients:
1. 185G One Heaping Cup Of Dried Pitted Dates
2. 2 Tablespoons Of Sesame Seeds
3. 25G 14 Cup Of Pistachios
4. Juice Of 13 Lemon
5. 2 Tablespoons Of Agave Syrup
6. 30G 13 Cup Of Glutenfree Rolled Oats
7. 2 Teaspoons Of Pulsin Organic Sunflower Protein Powder Or Your Favorite Protein Powder
preparation:
1. After Struggling With Undiagnosed Chronic Pain For Months, Michaella Mazzoni Turned To Food For Healing. Michaella’S Kitchen Is A Food Blog With Recipes Which Are All Refined Sugar Free. All The Recipes Are Wholesome, Healthy And Easily Replicated In Reader’S Homes Without Expensive Equipment Or Hard To Find Ingredients. Michaella Mazzoni
2. Preheat Your Oven To 180 Degrees Celsius.
3. Line A Baking Tray With Parchment Paper And Evenly Spread Out The Oats. Place In The Oven On The Middle Tray For About 5-7 Minutes Or Until The Oats Become Golden Brown In Colour.
4. While The Oats Are Happily Toasting Away, Start To Chop The Dates Until They Become A Paste Like Consistency.
5. Roughly Chop The Pistachios.
6. Next, Mix Together The Chopped Dates With The Agave Syrup, Seeds, Pistachios And Protein Powder.
7. Lastly, Stir In The Toasted Oats And The Fresh Lemon Juice.
8. Roll The Mixture Together Into Balls And Store In The Fridge In An Air Tight Container.
9. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Portobello Fajitas with Cilantro Garlic Sauce
ingredients:
1. 1 Portobello Mushroom
2. 14 Cup Onion Sliced
3. 12 Bell Pepper Sliced
4. 2 Tbsp Tamari Or Soy Sauce
5. 12 Tsp Chili Powder
6. 14 Tsp Turmeric
7. For The Cilantro Garlic Sauce
8. 12 Cup Arugula
9. 12 Cup Pea Shoots
10. 14 Cup Cilantro
11. 2 Garlic Cloves
12. 1 Tbsp Coconut Sugar
13. 12 Lemon Juiced
14. 12 Lime Juiced
15. 14 Cup Water
preparation:
1. Prep Time:15 Min, Cook Time: 5 Min,Total Time: 20 Min
2. 
3. Marinate Mushrooms For At Least 10 Minutes In Soy Sauce, Chili Powder, Turmeric, And Cumin.
4. Slice The Bell Peppers And Onions.
5. Prep All The Ingredients For The Cilantro Garlic Sauce And Throw Into The Blender.
6. Blend Until Smooth.
7. Cook Bell Peppers And Onions In Favorite High Heat Cooking Oil, Such As Coconut Oil For 1-2 Minutes.
8. Add In The Marinated Mushrooms And Cook For 3 Minutes, Or Until The Mushrooms Are Soft.
9. Throw In A Splash Of Water When Things Start To Get Dry.
10. Notes:1 Minute Before The Mushrooms Are Done Cooking, I Add My Flour Tortilla On Top And Let It Steam From My Splash Of Water.
11. Raw Vegan Version
12. Marinate Bell Peppers, Onion And Mushrooms In Marinade For At Least 4 Hours.
13. Dehydrate For 2-4 Hours.
14. Wrap With A Collard Green Or Other Raw Wrap.

title: Potato Wedges with Jack Daniel’s® Full Flavour Smokey Barbecue Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
1. 12 Bottle Jack Daniels Full Flavour Smokey Barbecue Sauce
2. 450G1Lb Medium New Potatoes
3. 2 Tablespoon Olive Oil
4. Sea Salt And Coarse Ground Black
5. For The Dipping Sauce
6. Bottle Of Your Favourite Jack Daniels Barbecue Sauce For Dipping
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200C/400F/Gas 6.
2. Cut The Potatoes Lengthwise Into Wedges And Place Into A Roasting Tray. Drizzle With The Olive Oil And Season With A Few Grinds Of Salt And Pepper. Place In The Oven And Bake For About 20 Minutes.
3. Remove From Oven And Pour Over ½ Bottle Of Jack Daniel’S® Full Flavour Smokey Barbecue Sauce. Gently Toss In Sauce To Coat Thoroughly The Wedges.
4. Return To Oven For About 15Mins Until Potatoes Are Fully Cooked And Sauce Has Reduced And Glazed The Potatoes. Remove From Baking Tray And Serve On A Warm Plate.
5. For The Dipping Sauce:
6. Pour Half A Bottle Of Your Favourite Jack Daniel’S® Barbecue Sauce Into A Pan And Cook Gently For Around Ten Minutes Until The Sauce Reduces Down. Serve Warm.

title: Matcha Pancakes
ingredients:
1. 1 Banana Mashed
2. 190Cups Dairy Free Milk
3. 1 Heaped Tablespoon Of Pulsin Pea Protein Or Similar
4. 1 Teaspoon Of Vanilla Extract
5. 75G Plain Flour
6. 1 Tablespoon Of Maple Syrup
7. 1 Teaspoon Of Baking Powder
8. 1 Teaspoon Of Matcha Powder
preparation:
1. In A Mixing Bowl Add Your Flour, Pulsin Powder, Baking Powder And Matcha Powder.
2. In Another Mixing Bowl, Combine Your Milk, Maple Syrup, Banana And Vanilla Extract.
3. Slowly Pour Your Wet Ingredients Into Your Dry Until Combined.
4. Let The Mixture Sit For A Few Minutes.
5. Heat A Non Stick Pan Over A Medium Heat And Add A Tablespoon Of Oil Of Choice.
6. Add A Few Spoonful’S Of Mixture (Spread Apart) Into The Pan And Flip Over After A Couple Of Minutes. The Trick Is To Drop Your Mixture Into The Pan From A Height To Get Even Pancakes.
7. Cook On The Other Side For A Couple Of Minutes, And Then Empty Onto Plate And Stack.
8. Top With Creamy Coconut Yogurt And Chopped Figs.

title: Oil-Free Potato Wedges and Salsa Verde
ingredients:
1. 650G White Potatoes About 3 Mediumsize
2. Juice Of  A Lemon
3. Tsp Cayenne
4. 1 Tsp Turmeric
5. 1 Tsp Smoked Paprika
6. 2 Tsp Dried Thyme
7. For The Salsa Verde
8. 1 Clove Garlic
9. 2 Tsp Capers
10. 4 Pitted Olives Any
11. Tsp Dijon Mustard
12. 1 Tbsp Vinegar Apple Cider Redwhite Wine
13. Juice Of  A Lemon
14. I Handful Each Of Fresh Basil Leaves Coriander And Spinach
15. Salt And Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Heat The Oven To 180°C / 350°F / Gas Mark 4.
2. Cut Each Potato Into 8 Equal-Sized Wedges And Place In A Large Mixing Bowl. Add The Seasoning And Lemon Juice And Give It All A Good Stir So That Each Wedge Is Coated.
3. Line A Tray With Parchment Paper And Arrange The Wedges Skin-Side Down.
4. Place On The Middle Shelf Of The Oven And Cook For 40-50 Minutes, Turning Once. If You Think They Are Browning Too Much Towards The End But Not Yet Cooked Through, Cover With Foil.
5. While The Wedges Are Cooking, Make The Salsa Verde. Place All The Ingredients In A Food Processor And Roughly Blitz Until You Have A Consistency You Are Happy With (I Prefer It To Not Be Over-Processed).
6. If You Don’T Have A Food Processor, Finely Chop The Ingredients And Blend In A Pestle And Mortar. If It Looks Too Dry Add A Little Olive Oil Or Extra Lemon Juice.

title: Quick Melty Vegan Cheese
ingredients:
1. 500 Cups2 Cups Soya Milk For The Best Results Use A Thick Rich Milk Or Creamer
2. 6 Tsp Agar Powder
3. 1 Tsp White Vinegar
4. 2 Tsp Coarse Salt Or 1 Tsp Fine Salt
5. 40G4 Tbsp Tapioca Starch
6. 1 Tsp Paprika Used Smoked For A Smoky Cheese
7. 15G14 Cup Nutritional Yeast Flakes
8. 14 Tsp Turmeric Optional For Colour
9. 1 Capsule Of Vegan Probiotic Emptied Optional
10. 6 Tbsp Agar Flakes Can Be Used Boil Mixture Gently For 15 Minutes After Adding The Flakes Vinegar And Salt Before Adding The Remaining Ingredients
11. Carrageenan Can Also Be Used 3 Tsp Powder  Often Sold As Vegegel Or Vegeset  Cheese Will Not Be As Firm As When Set With Agar But It Behaves The Same And After A Little Time In The Freezer Grates Well
preparation:
1. Bring The Soya Milk To A Boil Over A Medium Heat.
2. Once Boiling, Remove From The Heat And Whisk In The The Agar Powder (Or Agar Flakes Or Carrageenan), Vinegar And Salt.
3. Mix The Tapioca Starch In A Cup With A Few Tablespoons Of The Hot Soya Milk And Set Aside.
4. Bring The Soya Milk Mixture To A Boil Again, Then Whisk In The Rest Of The Ingredients, Including The Tapioca Mixture.
5. Cook For 10 Or So Minutes, Make Sure It Comes To A Boil At Least Once, Then Remove From Heat And Stir In The Probiotic Of Using Then Pour Into A Container To Set.
6. Leave To Harden In The Fridge Or Freezer To Make It Easier To Grate.

title: Sweet and Sour Cabbage
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
2. 1 Sliced Onion
3. 2 Tablespoons White Wine Vinegar
4. 2 Teaspoons Sugar
5. 1 Tablespoon Sambal Oelek Indonesian Chilli Sauce
6. 6 Tablespoons Chopped Tomatoes
7. 750G Shredded Chinese Cabbage
8. Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper To Taste
9. 23 Spring Onions
10. 1 Shredded Red Chilli Sprinkled
preparation:
1. Heat 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil In A Heavy-Bottomed Pan And Cook 1 Sliced Onion Until Soft.
2. Stir In 2 Tablespoons White Wine Vinegar, 2 Teaspoons Sugar, 1 Tablespoon Sambal Oelek (Indonesian Chilli Sauce) And 6 Tablespoons Chopped Tomatoes And Mix Well.
3. Add 750G Shredded Chinese Cabbage And Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper.
4. Cook For 10 Minutes With The Lid On, Stirring Occasionally, Until The Cabbage Is Tender.
5. Serve Hot With 2–3 Spring Onions And 1 Shredded Red Chilli Sprinkled Over The Top.

title: Beetroot Chocolate Cake
ingredients:
1. 200G Flour
2. 90G Caster Sugar
3. 1 Tsp Baking Powder
4. 12 Tsp Bicarbonate Of Soda
5. 2 Small Beetroot Peeled Boiled And Pureed
6. 150G Chocolate
7. 1 Tbsp Golden Syrup
8. 1 Tsp Balsamic Vinegar
9. For The Frosting
10. 100G Icing Sugar
11. 1 Tbsp Cocoa Powder
12. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
13. For The Topping
14. 100G Raspberries
15. 1 Tbsp Icing Sugar
preparation:
1. Pre-Heat The Oven The 180 Degrees Celsius.
2. Sift The Flour, Baking Powder And Bicarb Into A Large Bowl. Gently Stir Through The Caster Sugar.
3. Peel And Boil The Beetroot For Around An Hour And Then Puree In A Blender. Whisk Together With The Golden Syrup And Balsamic.
4. Melt The Chocolate In A Double Broiler And Add To Puree – Stir Until Smooth.
5. Make A Well In The Centre Of The Flour Mixture And Add The Wet Ingredients. Gently Fold And Transfer To A Lined Cake Tin. Bake For 30-35 Mins Or Until A Skewer Comes Out Clean.
6. Allow The Cake To Cool Completely Before Frosting – To Make The Cake Completely Even And Suitable For The Raspberry Topping, Slice Off The Top With A Serrated Knife.
7. Mix The Icing Sugar, Cocoa Powder And Vanilla Extract Together Before Adding Some Water A Tablespoon At A Time (Approx. 50-75Ml Or Until It Reaches The Desired Consistency), And Beat With A Spatula Until Thick And Smooth. Spread Over The Whole Cake Using A Palette Knife.
8. Muddle The Raspberries, Leaving A Few Whole Before Stirring Through The Icing Sugar. Just Before Serving Top The Cake With The Raspberry Mixture And Slice.

title: Vegan Chicken Fajitas
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Frys Chickenstyle Strips Or Similar
2. 1 Red Onion Finely Sliced
3. 1 Red Pepper Sliced
4. 1 Yellow Pepper Sliced
5. 1Tbsp Vegetable Oil
6. 1 Pack Fajita Seasoning Mix Approx 30G
7. To Serve
8. 8 Flour Tortillas
9. Lettuce Leaves
preparation:
1. Heat The Oil In A Pan And Add The Onion, Stirring Until Softened.
2. Add In The Sliced Peppers And Fry’S Chicken-Style Strips.
3. Sprinkle Over The Fajita Spice Mix And Stir Fry Until The Peppers Are Cooked And The Chicken-Style Strips Are Golden.
4. Warm Your Tortillas, Either In The Microwave For 30 Seconds, Or Wrapped In Foil In A Hot Oven For 10 Minutes.
5. Stack Your Warmed Tortillas With Lettuce And The Fajita Filling. Wrap, And Eat!
6. A Little Extra:
7. Add Salsa Or Guacamole To Your Wraps To Make It Saucy.
8. Make It A Feast:
9. Serve With Tex-Mex Sides Like Nachos, Wedges, Or Mexican-Style Rice For An Even Bigger Meal.
10. Did You Like These Vegan Chicken Fajitas? Explore More Vegan Bbq Recipes!

title: Thai Tempeh & Noodle Lettuce Wraps
ingredients:
1. 10 Lettuce Leaves
2. Wholegrain Brown Rice Noodles
3. Avocado
4. Red Cabbage
5. A Lime
6. For The Tempeh Marinade
7. 2 Tsp Tamari
8. 1Cm Fresh Ginger Grated
9. 2 Tsp Maple Syrup
10. 1 Tsp Sesame Oil
11. I Block Plant Power Tempeh
12. Thai Sauce
13. 5 Tbsp Tahini
14. 2 Tbsp Tamari
15. 1 12 Tbsp Maple Syrup
16. 2Cm Fresh Ginger
17. 1 Small Garlic Clove
18. 1Cm Red Chilli
19. Juice Of Half Lime
preparation:
1. In A Bowl Add The Marinade Ingredients And Mix Together. Chop The Tempeh Into Cubes And Add It To The Marinade And Coat Well. Leave Aside Ready To Cook.
2. In A Mixed Add The Thai Sauce Ingredients With A Little Water And Mix Until You Get A Nice Smooth Runny Consistency. Adjust Tamari Or Maple Syrup To Your Taste
3. Add Water To A Pan And Heat Until Boiling. Add The Noodles And Cook Until Al Dente (Drain And Pour Over Cold Water To Stop Them From Continuing To Cook) Coat With A Little Sesame Oil To Stop Them From Sticking Together
4. In A Pan Add The Tempeh And Cook Until Nicely Browned On All Side, Remove From The Pan And Set Aside. Then Add The Noodles To The Pan With A Little Sesame Oil And A Dash Of Tamari And Cook Until Gently Warmed Through.
5. Add A Little Of The Noodles To Each Lettuce Boat, Topped With The Tempeh, Some Chopped Avocado, Red Cabbage And Drizzle With The Thai Sauce And Some Black Sesame Seeds.
6. Feel Free To Squeeze Over Some More Lime Juice For Added Zing.
7. Did You Like This Dish? Explore More Healthy Vegan Recipes.

title: Vegan Smoked Salmon
ingredients:
1. Marinade
2. 100Cups Olive Oil
3. 2 Tbsp Caper Brine
4. 2 Nori Sheets Torn Into Tiny Pieces
5. 2 Tbsp Soy
6. 1 Tsp Miso
7. 1 Tbsp Rice Wine Vinegar
8. 1 Tbsp Agave
9. 1 Tsp Garlic Powder
10. 1 Tsp Smoked Paprika
11. 1 Tsp Liquid Smoke
12. 2 Large Carrots
13. Dill And Capers To Serve
preparation:
1. Make The Marinade By Putting All The Ingredients Into A Dish And Mixing Well. Set Aside.
2. Peel, Top And Tail The Carrots, Then Slice Long Thin Strips From Them Using A Vegetable Peeler.
3. Steam Them Over A Pan Of Boiling Water For 4 Mins.
4. Immediately Put Them Into The Marinade And Mix Well. Cover And Refrigerate Overnight
5. Drain The Oil From Them And Serve On A Bagel With Vegan Cream Cheese And Chopped Dill And Capers.

title: Minty Vietnamese Summer Rolls
ingredients:
1. Ingredients : To Make Roughly 20 Rolls
2. 20 Rice Paper Sheets You Can Find These In Larger Supermarkets Or Asian Stores
3. 1 Avocado Chopped Into Thin Slices
4. 1 Small Bunch Of Mint Leaves Separated From Stalk
5. 1 Small Carrot Grated
6. 1 Small Onion Chopped Finely
7. 12 Cucumber Chopped Into Thin Strips
8. 100G Of Green Leaves I Normally Use Spinach Hard Stalks Removed
9. Dipping Sauce
10. Soy Sauce
11. Sesame Seeds
12. A Few Drops Of Sesame Seed Oil
13. Optional Finely Chopped Chilli Or Chilli Flakes
preparation:
1. Arrange All The Ingredients So That They Are Easy To Access. The Rice Paper Rolls Are Very Delicate, And Get Sticky When Drying. I Have Found That The Quicker You Make The Rolls, And The Less You Handle Them You Lower The Chances Of Them Breaking Up. Having Said That, Do Not Worry If The Paper Rips. Just Try And Minimize The Damage, They Become Much More Solid After 15Minutes Or So. And They Taste So Good No One Will Notice The Small Tears Trust Me!
2. Place One Sheet Of Rice Paper Into A Bowl Of Warm Water. Leave For Approximately 30Seconds Or Until The Sheet Becomes Malleable.
3. Take The Rice Paper Out Of The Bowl And Place On A Clean Plate. Add A Small Amount Of Each Ingredient, Making Sure No Hard Bits Are Sticking Out That Could Damage The Paper.
4. Now It Is Time To Roll. Fold In 2 Opposing Sides Of The Rice Paper As Tightly As Possible. Then Take The Third Side And Fold Over, Making Sure It Is Tight And Roll It Over The Fourth Side To Completely Seal The Summer Roll.
5. For The Dipping Sauce Mix The Ingredients In A Small Bowl.

title: Tofu Sushi Rolls
ingredients:
1. Sushi Rice  150G
2. Tofu  300G
3. Peanut Butter  2 Tbsp
4. Soy Sauce  2 Tbsp
5. Mirin  15 Tbsp
6. Sesame Oil  1 Tsp
7. Garlic Clove  1
8. Avocado
9. Carrot  1
10. Sesame Seeds  10G
11. Rice Wine Vinegar  15 Tbsp
12. White Sugar   Tsp
13. Salt   Tsp
14. Nori Sheets  1 Pack
preparation:
1. Rinse And Drain The Sushi Rice In A Sieve. Place The Rice In A Small Saucepan With 220Ml Of Water, Bring Up To A Boil, Lower The Heat To A Gentle Simmer, Cover And Cook For 15 Minutes Until All The Water Has Been Absorbed.
2. Drain And Wrap The Tofu In Kitchen Paper Then Place Between Two Plates With Something Heavy On Top Like A Couple Of Tins. Leave To Press For 20 Minutes. This Process Allows The Tofu To Take On More Flavour.
3. Preheat The Oven To 190 Degrees Celsius.
4. Prepare The Peanut Sauce. Mix The Peanut Butter With 1 Tbsp Of Soy Sauce, 1.5 Tbsp Of Mirin, 1 Tsp Of Sesame Oil And 1 Tbsp Of Water. Peel And Finely Chop Or Grate The Garlic, Then Add To The Sauce. Your Sauce Should Be The Consistency Of Single Cream. If Necessary Add A Splash More Of Water To Loosen.
5. Prepare The Filling. Cut The Avocado In Half, Remove The Pit And Scoop The Flesh Away From The Skin, Keeping The Shape Intact. Cut The Avocado Into Strips Lengthways. Peel And Grate The Carrot. Divide Both Into 4 Equal Portions. Cut The Tofu Into 8 Slices And Coat With 1 Tsp Of Soy Sauce. Place The Coated Tofu On A Tray And Bake In The Oven For 8 Minutes.
6. Toast The Sesame Seeds In A Dry Frying Pan Over A High Heat For 1 Minute Or Until Golden, Then Tip Onto A Small Plate.
7. Cool The Rice. When The Rice Is Cooked, Take It Off The Heat And Mix In 1.5 Tbsp Of Rice Wine Vinegar, ½ A Tsp Of Salt, ½ A Tsp Of Sugar And Most Of The Toasted Sesame Seeds, Saving A Sprinkle For Garnishing. Spread The Rice Onto A Plate And Leave To Cool, Then Divide Into 4 Equal Portions.
8. After 8 Minutes, Take The Tofu Out Of The Oven And Coat With Half Of The Peanut Sauce. Bake For Another 10 Minutes Then Remove From The Oven And Slice Each Strip In Half Lengthways.
9. Start Rolling! Place A Small Bowl Of Water Nearby. Lay 2 Layers Of Clingfilm Larger Than The Nori Sheet Over Your Clean Chopping Board. Place The Nori On Top Of The Clingfilm In Portrait Orientation. Using Your Hands, Take One Portion Of Rice And Spread It Evenly Onto The Half Of The Nori Sheet Closest To You, Leaving A 1Cm Gap At The Edge Of The Sheet. Wet Your Fingertips To Stop The Rice Sticking To Your Hands.
10. Place Your Strips Of Tofu With A Portion Of Avocado And Carrots Horizontally In The Centre Of The Rice.
