1. Wash The Fruit. Core The Apples And Chop Into Cubes, Roughly 2Cm. Take A Third Of The Chopped Apples And Simmer In A Little Water With The Agave Nectar And Cinnamon.
2. Once They Become Soft And Pulpy And Can Be Lightly Mashed With A Wooden Spoon To Form A Sauce, Add The Remaining Apples And Soften Slightly For A Couple Of Minutes.
3. Remove From The Heat And Stir In The Blackberries Gently So As Not To Crush Them.
4. Pour The Fruit Mixture Into An Ovenproof Dish And Preheat Your Oven To 180ºc/350ºf/Gas Mark 4.
5. Meanwhile, Rub The Vegan Margarine Into The Flour Until It Resembles Fine Breadcrumbs, Then Stir In The Oats And Sugar.
6. Sprinkle The Crumble Topping Onto The Fruit Filling And Press It Down Lightly. Scatter A Little Extra Sugar All Over The Top, Then Pop In The Oven For About 25 Minutes.
7. Serve Hot With Lashings And Lashings Of Vegan Custard!
8. Like This Recipe And Want To Try More? Sign Up With Veganuary Today For Recipes Delivered Straight To Your Inbox.

title: Chilli Cornbread
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Cornmeal
2. 1 Cup Plain Flour
3. 2 Tsps Baking Powder
4. 5G Dried Chipotle Mora Chilli
5. 1 Pinch Pink Himalayan Salt
6. 13 Cup Organic Coconut Oil
7. 2 Tblsps Maple Syrup
8. 2 Cups Almond Milk
9. 2 Tsps Raw Apple Cider Vinegar Or Freshly Squeezed Lemon Juice
preparation:
1. Makes 9-12 Servings
2. Equipment
3. Two Mixing Bowls
4. Measuring Cups
5. Measuring Spoons
6. Small Pan
7. Whisk
8. Wooden Spoon
9. Baking Paper
10. 8″ X 8″ Baking Tray
11. Turn The Oven On To 175C And Line Your Baking Dish With Baking Or Greaseproof Paper. Melt The Coconut Oil And Leave To Cool.
12. Pour The Almond Milk And Apple Cider Vinegar Or Lemon Juice Into A Bowl And Whisk Together. This Will Create A ‘Buttermilk’, So Don’T Worry When It Starts To Curdle Or Separate.
13. Finely Chop The Chilli Into Tiny Pieces And Add It With All Of The Other Dry Ingredients Into Another Bowl. Stir Thoroughly.
14. * Top Tip *
15. Wearing Disposable Gloves Helps To Avoid Any Accidental Chilli ‘After Burn’ If You Forget And Touch Your Skin After Chopping.
16. Add The Cooled, Liquid Coconut Oil And Maple Syrup To The ‘Buttermilk’ Bowl, And Whisk Briskly For A Minute Or So To Combine And Create A Slightly Frothy Mixture.
17. Pour The Liquid Into The Dry Ingredients Bowl And Stir Together Until You Have A Thick Batter Without Any Lumps. Pour Into The Baking Dish And Pop In The Oven For 30-35 Mins. To Check It’S Cooked, Insert A Skewer Into The Middle And It Should Come Out Clean.
18. * The Chilli Cornbread Tastes Delicious Both Warm And Cold, And Is A Great Side For Soup, Chilli Con Carne, Or Dipped In Flavoured Oils And Vinegars. The Cornbread Will Keep For 1-2 Days In An Airtight Container, However It Always Tastes Best On The Day You Make It As Gets Drier Over Time; Surely A Great Reason To Share It With Your Friends!

title: Hearty Winter Stew
ingredients:
1. 2 Onions Finely Sliced
2. 1 Medium Butternut Squash Peeled Deseeded And Cubed
3. Boiling Water
4. Approximately 400G Mixed Sliced Mushrooms We Used Shitake Mushrooms  Chestnut Mushrooms
5. 1 Medium Swede Peeled Cubed
6. 200G Chopped Chestnuts Buy Peeled Cooked  Ready To Use
7. Sea Salt To Taste
8. Small Handful Of Fresh Thyme Finely Chopped
9. Handful Fresh Tarragon Optional
preparation:
1. Heat Your Favourite Oil Or Cooking Fat In A Large Casserole Dish (We Used Coconut Oil – You Could Also Use Rapeseed Oil To Name A Few)
2. Fry The Onions For A Few Minutes Until Soft And Translucent
3. Add The Swede, Squash, Mushrooms And More Seasoning To The Casserole, And Sweat For Approximately 10 Minutes… Until The Mushrooms Are Soft
4. Stir In The Fresh Thyme And Chestnuts, And Almost Cover The Ingredients With Boiling Water (If Unsure Best To Add Less, Otherwise The Stew Will Be Too Thin), Add A Little More Seasoning
5. Once It Comes To The Boil Reduce The Heat, Cover With A Lid And Gently Simmer For 40-60 Minutes
6. Season To Taste And Serve With Fresh Tarragon
7. Optional: Upgrade With Pulsin’ Pea Protein!

title: Chocolate Baked Pear Pudding
ingredients:
1. 2 Tbs Oat Flour Ground Oats
2. 1 Tbs Cocoa Or Carob Flour
3. Tsp Baking Powder
4. 13 Cup Apple Puree Or Vegan Yoghurt Or Other Fruit Puree
5. 2 Tsp Syrup Of Choice Or A Pinch Stevia To Taste
6. 1 Tsp Oil
7. Approx 1 Tbs Liquid Only If Needed To Make A Smoother Batter
8. 1 Smallmedium Pear
9. Sauce For Drizzle
preparation:
1. Mix The Dry Ingredients To Small Bowl And Add The Wet Ingredients And Mix Well. The Mixture Should Be Thick And Fairly Smooth (How Smooth It Is Depends On The Type Of Flour Used My Oat Flour Gave More Texture).
2. Spoon The Mix Into A Large Ramekin (Or Small Deep Sides Dish- There Should Be Min. 1Cm Space Beneath The Rim Once The Pear Is Pushed In! To Allow For A Slight Rise In The Mixture). Push The Pear Gently Into The Centre Of The Ramekin So That Is At Least Half Submerged.
3. Bake For 10-15 Minutes At 180C Until The Pear Is Golden And The Mixture Is Very Lightly Browned.
4. Serve With A Drizzle Or Carob, Chocolate, Yoghurt, Cream As Desired.

title: Risotto Primavera
ingredients:
1. 25 G Flora Freedom Or Similar
2. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
3. 1 Large Onion Finely Chopped
4. 2 Cloves Garlic Crushed
5. 225 G Arborio Rice
6. 700 Cups Hot Vegetable Stock
7. 300 Cups Vegan Dry White Wine Optional But Increase Stock To 1 Litre If Not Used
8. 250 G Frozen Petit Pois
9. 125 G Asparagus Tips Each Cut Into Three
10. 175 G Spinach Washed And Drained
11. 75 G Vegan Parmsan Cheese Grated
12. Pinch Of Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Heat Flora And Olive Oil In A Large Pan And Fry The Onion And Garlic Until Soft But Not Browned.
2. Add The Rice And Stir Well. Pour In The Wine And Bring To The Boil. Reduce Heat And Cook Gently, Whilst Stirring, Until The Liquid Has Been Absorbed.
3. Stir In 300Ml Stock And Repeat Until The Stock Has Been Absorbed.
4. Add Half The Remaining Stock, And Continue Cooking, Stirring Occasionally Until The Risotto Has A Creamy Consistency.
5. Add The Peas To The Rice Together With The Asparagus And Remaining Stock. Bring Back To A Simmer And Continue Stirring As The Liquid Is Absorbed And The Rice Becomes Tender.
6. Stir In The Spinach, With A Little More Stock If Necessary, And Sprinkle In The Cheese, Stirring Until Melted Through.
7. Season To Taste And Serve Straight Away.

title: Courgette and Carrot Spaghetti with Red Pepper and Tomato Sauce
ingredients:
1. 4 Courgettes
2. 4 Carrots
3. Pinch Of Sea Salt
4. Handful Of Basil Leaves
5. Italian Seasoning
6. Olives And Cherry Tomatoes Sliced To Serve
7. Macadamia Nut Cheese
8. 1 Cup  125G Macadamia Nuts
9. Cup  60G Cashew Nuts
10. 1Tbsp Tamari Or Coconut Aminos
11. 2Tbsp Mirin Or Lemon Juice
12. 23 Tbsp Water
13. 1Tbsp Nutritional Yeast Flakes
14. Red Pepper Sauce
15. Cup Pine Nuts
16. 1 Red Pepper
17. 2Tsp Lemon Juice
18. 1Tbsp Tamari
19. 2Tsp Xylitol
20. 2 Sundried Tomatoes In Oil Drained
preparation:
1. Using A Spiraliser Turn The Carrot And Courgette To Create Long Noodles. Place In A Bowl And Sprinkle With Salt.
2. Place All The Ingredients For The Nut Cheese In A High Speed Blender. Blend Until Smooth – You May Need To Add A Little Water To Get The Right Consistency.
3. Mix All The Pepper Sauce Ingredients Together, Adding A Little Water To Get To The Right Consistency.
4. Rinse The Vegetable Spaghetti And Dry Well With Kitchen Towel. Place In A Clean Bowl And Add The Basil Leaves, Tomatoes And Olives And Seasoning. Mix In The Cheese Then Serve Drizzled With The Pepper Sauce.

title: Summer Pudding
ingredients:
1. 6 Large Slices Of Bread Crusts Removed
2. 100G  3 Oz Sugar
3. 75Cups  25 Fl Oz Water
4. 700G  1 Lb Soft Fruit Eg Strawberries Raspberries Blueberries Blackberries Redcurrants Blackcurrants
preparation:
1. Cut The Bread Into Neat Fingers.
2. Slowly Heat The Sugar And Water Together In A Saucepan Over A Low Heat Until The Sugar Dissolves.
3. Add The Fruit And Simmer Gently For About 7-10 Minutes. Reserve A Few Spoonfuls Of Juice.
4. Line The Base And Sides Of A 1 Litre Basin With Bread Fingers.
5. Add Half Of The Hot Fruit And Cover With More Bread Fingers. Pour In Remaining Fruit And Top With The Remaining Bread. Cover With A Saucer Or Plate And Place A Heavy Weight On Top.
6. Refrigerate Overnight.
7. Turn Out Onto A Plate. If There Are Any White Patches, Spoon A Little Of The Reserved Juice Over Them.
8. Serve With Your Favourite Vegan Cream Or Ice Cream Alternative. Elderflower Sorbet Would Make A Light, Refreshing, Summery Accompaniment.

title: Crustless Rice and Zucchini Quiche
ingredients:
1. 23 Cup Uncooked Rice Of Your Choice I Use Basmati
2. Cup Plant Milk
3. Cup Water
4. 2 Large Onions Finely Cubed
5. 2 Cloves Garlic Finely Cubed
6. 4 12 Mediumsized Zucchini Of 8 Length Finely Sliced
7. 1 Tablespoon Italian Seasoning
8. Cup Dried Parsley
9. 34 Cup Cashew Parmesan
10. 1 Teaspoon Tomato Paste
11. Salt And Pepper
12. 12 Tablespoons Vegan Butter
13. 2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast
14. For The Eggmixture
15. 1 Cup Chickpea Flour
16. 1 Cup Water
17. Teaspoon Kala Namak For A Hint Of Eggy Flavour
18. For The Cashew Parmesan
19. 1 Cup Roasted And Salted Cashews
20. 13 Cup Nutritional Yeast
21. 1 Teaspoon Shiro Miso Optional
preparation:
1. Parmesan:Mix All Roasted Cashews, Nutritional Yeast And Shiro Miso In Ablender Until The Mixture Has The Texture Of Grated Parmesan.If You Use Unsalted Cashews, Add A Teaspoon Of Salt To Themixture. I Recommend You Double Or Triple The Recipe, It Keepsin The Fridge And You’Ll Want To Use It In Other Dishes, Too.
2. You Can Use Leftover Rice For This, But If You Don’T: Cookrice According To Instruction : In Plant Milk And Water. Frythe Zucchini Slices In Batches In A Pan In Hot Oil Untilthey’Re Soft And Start To Brown. You Can Let The Zucchinislices Drain On Paper Towel. Sauté Onions And Garlic In Thesame Pan.
3. Preheat Oven To 200C/390F.
4. For The ‘Egg’-Mixture: Mix Kala Namak And Chickpea Flour In Abowl. Add The Water And Whisk Until The Mixture Is Smooth Andstarts To Get A Little Foamy. Add The Cashew Parmesan And Mixwell.
5. Mix Cooked Rice, Parsley, Tomato Paste, Seasoning And Onionsin A Big Bowl. Salt And Pepper To Taste. Add The ‘Egg’-Mixture. Be Aware That Uncooked Chickpea Flour Has A Strong,Unfamiliar Taste That Will Disappear After Cooking. It Makesit Difficult To Taste The Uncooked Mixture, You Might Want Torely On Your Experience Or Salt And Pepper Before You Add The‘Egg’-Mixture. Add The Fried Zucchini Slices, Mix Everythingwell And Fill The Mixture In A Greased Springform Tin.Sprinkle With The Nutritional Yeast, Garnish With Flakes Ofbutter And Bake At 200C/390F For About 50 Minutes.
6. If The Quiche Browns To Quickly, Cover The Form With Tinfoil.
7. It’S Done When The Center Is Firm To The Touch.
8. Serve Hot Or Warm With Carrot Salad And (Vegan) Sour Cream. Ilove To Eat It When It’S Cold, It Gets An Almost Meat-Loaflike Taste And Texture After A Night In The Fridge.

title: Tofu Panang Curry
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Vegetable Oil
2. 2 Generous Tablespoons Panang Curry Paste
3. 250Cups 9Fl Oz Coconut Milk
4. 1 Tablespoon Palm Sugar
5. 2 Tablespoons Light Soy Sauce
6. 200G 7Oz Firm Tofu Cut Into Chunks
7. 67 Sweet Basil Leaves Plus Extra To Garnish
8. 3 Kaffir Lime Leaves Chopped
9. 1 Red Birds Eye Chilli Finely Sliced
10. Steamed Jasmine Rice To Serve
preparation:
1. Heat The Oil In A Wok Set Over A Medium-High Heat. Once Hot, Add The Curry Paste And Stir-Fry For About 1 Minute, Until Fragrant.
2. Gradually Stir In Half The Coconut Milk And Cook For About 1 Minute, Until The Oil From The Paste Rises To The Surface Of The Coconut Milk. Once This Happens, Stir In The Remaining Coconut Milk, Then Mix In The Palm Sugar And Soy Sauce And Cook For A Further Minute.
3. Bring The Mixture To The Boil, Then Add The Tofu. Reduce The Heat And Simmer For 2–3 Minutes, Until The Tofu Is Heated Through. Stir In The Sweet Basil, Lime Leaves And Sliced Chilli.
4. Remove The Pan From The Heat. Serve The Curry Immediately, With A Bowl Of Rice, Garnished With Extra Basil Leaves.

title: Sweet Potato & Watercress Soup
ingredients:
1. 1 Onion
2. 2 Cloves Garlic Crushed
3. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
4. 2 Celery Stalks Finely Sliced
5. 4 Cups Vegetable Stock
6. 2 Sweet Potatoes Peeled And Cut Into Cubes
7. 1 Bunch Watercress
8. 2 Heaped Tbsp Sweet White Miso
preparation:
1. Roughly Chop The Onion, Crush The Garlic And Add To A Large Saucepan With The Olive Oil.
2. Saute For 5 Minutes.
3. Add The Celery And Stock, Stir To Mix And Then Add The Sweet Potatoes.
4. Cover And Cook For 15 Minutes.
5. Transfer To A Blender And Add The Watercress.
6. Return To The Pan And Stir In The Miso.
7. Serve Garnished With A Sprig Or Two Of Watercress.
8. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Gluten-free Brownies
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Of Dates
2. 1 Cup Of Raw Almonds
3. 12 Cup Of Cocoa Powder
4. 12 Cup Ground Almonds
5. 45G Chopped Dark Chocolate Sugar Free
6. 12 Cup Of Raw Walnuts
7. 2 Tbsp Maple Syrup
8. 2 Tbsp Milled Chia Seeds Mixed With 3 Tbsp Water Or Use Flax Seeds
preparation:
1. Preheat The Over To 180C And Line A Baking Tray With Greaseproof Paper.
2. In A Saucepan Add The Dates And Cover With Water, Cook Down For 10-15 Minutes On A Medium Heat Until Soft And Gooey.
3. Into The Blender Add The Whole Almonds And Blitz For 30 Seconds. Add The Cocoa Power, Ground Almonds, Dark Chocolate And Walnuts And Blitz Together Until The Walnuts Are Chopped Up.
4. In A Small Bowl Mix Together The Milled Chia Seeds And Mix With Water. Add To The Blender Along With The Maple Syrup.
5. Once The Dates Have Boiled Down Add To The Blender And Mix Everything Together.
6. Spread The Mixture Evenly In The Baking Tin And Bake For 15 Minutes.
7. Leave To Cool In The Tray And Once Cooled Cut Into Squares. Keep In The Fridge.

title: Stuffed Bulgur Aubergine with Chermoula
ingredients:
1. 4 Aubergines
2. 34 Tablespoons Goodquality Olive Oil
3. Juice Of 1 Lemon
4. Pinch Of Sea Salt
5. Freshly Ground Black Pepper
6. For The Bulgur Salad
7. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
8. 1 Large Red Onion Or 2 Small Finely Sliced
9. 4 Garlic Cloves Thinly Sliced
10. 1 Teaspoon Paprika
11. 450Cups Vegetable Stock
12. 150G Bulgur Wheat
13. 3 Tablespoons Chopped Flatleaf Parsley
14. For The Chermoula
15. 1 Teaspoon Cumin Seeds
16. 1 Teaspoon Coriander Seeds
17. 15G Coriander Roughly Chopped
18. 15G Flatleaf Parsley Roughly Chopped
19. 2 Garlic Cloves Crushed
20. Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Chopped
21. Grated Zest And Juice Of 1 Unwaxed Lemon
22. 1 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
23. 100Cups Olive Oil
24. Teaspoon Salt Or More To Taste If Needed
25. Freshly Ground Black Pepper
preparation:
1. First, Make The Bulgur Salad. Heat A Large Frying Pan Over A High Heat And Add The Olive Oil. Once The Oil Is Hot, Add The Onion And Cook For 1–2 Minutes, Then Stir In The Garlic And Paprika.
2. Bring The Vegetable Stock To A Simmer In A Small Saucepan Over A Medium Heat. Add The Bulgur Wheat And Gently Cook For 8–10 Minutes Until The Grains Have Plumped Up And Are Cooked Through. Remove From The Heat And Stir Through The Red Onion Mixture And Parsley. Set Aside.
3. Meanwhile, Make The Chermoula. Heat A Small, Dry Frying Pan Over A Medium Heat, Add The Cumin And Coriander Seeds And Cook For 2 Minutes Until Just Toasted. Transfer To A Small Mixing Bowl, Add The Remaining Chermoula Ingredients And Mix To Combine. Season To Taste, Then Set Aside.
4. Preheat The Oven To Its Hottest Setting And, Once It Is Roasting Hot, Turn It To The Grill Setting. Pierce Each Aubergine Twice With A Small, Sharp Knife. Place On A Baking Sheet Under The Grill, With The Oven Door Closed, For 25 Minutes Or Until The Aubergine Skin Is Black And The Flesh Is Collapsed And Soft, Using Tongs To Turn Halfway Through This Time. Remove From The Oven, Then Slice Each Hot Aubergine Lengthways Down The Centre, Being Careful Not To Cut All The Way Through, And Split Open. Drizzle With The Olive Oil And Lemon Juice, And Season With The Sea Salt And Some Pepper.
5. Serve The Aubergines Heaped With A Spoonful Of The Bulgur Wheat Salad And A Spoonful Of Chermoula.

title: Blueberries and Cream Layer Dessert
ingredients:
1. Tofu Cream
2. 1 Pack Silken Tofu
3. 13 Cup Rice Syrup
4. 1 Tbsp Olive Sunflower Or Safflower Oil
5. 1 Tbsp Soymilk
6. 1  Tsp Vanilla Extract
7. 1 Tsp Lemon Juice
8. Blueberry Sauce
9. 4 Cups Fresh Blueberries Use Frozen If Not In Season
10. 13 Cup Rice Syrup
11. 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
12. 2 Tbsp Kuzu Gluten Free Starch
preparation:
1. Allow Two Hours For Chilling Both The Tofu Cream And The Blueberry Sauce.
2. Tofu Cream:
3. Whip All Ingredients Together In A Blender Until Very Smooth. Refrigerate At Least Two Hours Before Serving.
4. Blueberry Sauce:
5. Set Aside One Cup Of The Blueberries For Topping The Dessert.
6. Place The Remaining 3 Cups Of Blueberries In A Pot With The Rice Syrup And Lemon Juice.
7. Dissolve The Kuzu In Two Tablespoons Of Water And Add To The Pot.
8. Bring To A Boil And Simmer On Low Heat For 4 Minutes.
9. Stir In The Kuzu And Simmer Until The Mixture Starts To Thicken.
10. Transfer To A Blender And Blend To A Cream.
11. Pour Into A Bowl And Allow To Cool.
12. Chill In The Refrigerator For At Least Two Hours.
13. Using Pretty Glasses And Layer Some Blueberry Sauce In The Bottom And Tofu Cream On Top.
14. Continue This Process Of Layering Until The Glass Is Full, And Then Top With Blueberries And Toasted Flaked Almonds, Or Nuts Of Your Choice.

title: Makai Pawa
ingredients:
1. 3 Handfuls Of Pawa Rice Flakes
2. Less Than 12 A Tin Of Sweetcorn Makai  About 120G
3. 1 Fresh Chilli
4. Less Than 1 Tablespoon Of Oil  Sunflower Olive Canola Or Rapeseed Oil
5. 12 Teaspoon Of Mustard Seeds
6. 2 Sweet Neem Leaves
7. 1 Pinch Of Asafetida Hing
8. Less Than A 14 Teaspoon Of Cumin Seeds Jiru
9. 1 Handful Of Red Skin Peanut Kernels
10. 1 Pinch Of Turmeric
11. Salt To Taste
12. 1 Drizzle Of Lemon Juice
13. 1 Handful Of Freshly Chopped Coriander
preparation:
1. Thisrecipe Serves 1
2. Wash 3 Handfuls Of Pawa (Rice Flakes) In Warm Water – Do This Once Or Twice But Not For Long
3. Leave It In A Straineruntil You Need It, So That The Water Drainsaway
4. In A Pan, Add The Oil, Mustard Seeds, Jiru And Hing
5. Add The Peanut Kernels
6. Add 2 Sweet Neem Leaves
7. Put The Lid On The Pan And Wait Until The Seeds Begin To Pop
8. Add The Chilli – Ensure That You Taste The Chilli First So That You Can Amend How Much You Put In According To How Spicy The Chilli Is
9. Open A Can Of Sweetcorn And Drain The Water
10. Add The Sweetcorn To The Pan And Mix
11. Add Salt To Taste
12. Add The Turmeric
13. Let It Cook Until The Corn Is Softer (About 5 Minutes)
14. Add The Pawa And Lemon Juice And Mix
15. After About 5 Minutes Add The Chopped Coriander And Mix
16. Serve And Enjoy After A Couple Of Minutes

title: Vegetable Curry
ingredients:
1. 300G Provamel Soya Alternative To Yogurt Free From Sugars
2. 800G Potatoes
3. 4 Tbsp Olive Oil
4. 1 Chopped Onion
5. 2 Tbsp Organic Tikka Masala
6. 400G Canned Tomatoes
7. 200G Cauliflower
8. 200G Drained Chickpeas
9. 1 Handful Of Spinach
preparation:
1. Replace The Chickpeas With Lentils If You Want A More Crunchy Bite.
2. This Vegetable Curry Is Made Usingprovamel Soya Alternative To Yogurt Free From Sugars.
3. Heat The Oil In A Skillet
4. Add The Tikka Masala And The Onion
5. Add The Cauliflower Tomatoes And Put The Lid On
6. Mix In The Chick Peas, Spinach And Parboiled Potatoes And Cook Another 15 Mins
7. Season With Salt And Pepper And Spoon In The Soya Alternative To Yogurt
8. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Banana, Raisin and Walnut Loaf
ingredients:
1. 200G Selfraising Flour
2. 1 Teaspoons Ground Cinnamon
3. 1 Teaspoons Ground Ginger
4. 12 Teaspoon Grated Nutmeg
5. 12 Teaspoon Of Baking Powder
6. 60G Dairyfree Margarine
7. 110G Soft Light Brown Sugar
8. 175G Mashed Ripe Bananas
9. 25G Chopped Walnut Pieces
10. 25G Raisins
11. 110 Cups Dairy Free Milk Alternative  This Is Approximate You May Need Less
preparation:
1. Preheat Over To 180Oc/160Oc Fan/Gas 4.
2. Line A 1Lb Loaf Tin With Non-Stick Baking Parchment.
3. Sift Together The Flour, Ground Cinnamon, Ginger, Nutmeg, Baking Powder In A Large Mixing Bowl. Rub In The Dairy-Free Margarine Until You Have A Consistency Of Fine Breadcrumbs. Add The Sugar, Bananas, Chopped Walnuts, And Raisins. Stir Well.
4. Gradually Add The Dairy-Free Milk A Little At A Time Until You Have A Soft Dropping Consistency, The Amount Needed Will Depend On The Ripeness Of The Bananas.
5. Spoon Into The Tin And Level The Surface. Bake In The Oven For 1¼ To 1½ Hours Or Until Golden, Firm To Touch And A Skewer Inserted Into The Middle Comes Out Clean. Cover With Foil If The Loaf Is Browning Too Much During Cooking.
6. Leave To Cool In The Tin Then Turn Out Onto A Wire Rack To Finish Cooling.

title: Rosemary Oatcakes (savoury, wheat-free, vegan cracker)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Of Finely Chopped Rosemary
2. 300G 10 Oz Plain Oatmeal Ground Oats
3. Teaspoon Sea Salt Or To Taste
4. 175Cups  200Cups 6  7 Floz Approx Filtered Or Spring Water
5. 50G 1Oz Spelt Flour Or Fine Oatmeal To Roll With
6. A Dash Of Oil For Oven Tray
preparation:
1. Finely Chop A Good Handful Or More Of Fresh Rosemary Leaves, Until You Have At Least A Tablespoon Of Finely Chopped Rosemary.
2. Turn Oven On To Approximately Gas Mark 7 (220˚C/425˚F).
3. Mix All Dry Ingredients Together.
4. Add 175Ml (6 Floz) Of The Water And Mix Thoroughly With The Dry Ingredients. Add The Remaining 25Ml Of Water A Little At A Time, Until You Have A Dough-Like ‘Rollable’ Ball (The Best Way To Mix Is To Use The Back Of A Spoon, With A Pressing Type Motion Or Just Get Your Hands In There). When You Have Added All Water Necessary, Press Firmly Together With Your Hands. You May Be Tempted To Add More Water To Get It To Bind, But Make Sure That You Really Need It First, Otherwise You’Ll End Up With A Soggy Mix! If You Put Too Much Water In It’S Not Really A Problem Though, Just Add Extra Oatmeal Or Spelt Flour.
5. Split The Dough Into Two (Makes Rolling Easier) And Roll Out On A Flour Dusted Surface Until It Is About 3 Mm (8Th Of An Inch) Thick (I Like To Use Spelt Flour Or Fine Oatmeal To Roll/Dust With, But Whatever You Have Will Do).
6. Cut With Cookie Cutter And Place Onto An Oiled Oven Tray. If You Don’T Have A Cookie Cutter, Then Just Cut Into Squares Or Triangles With A Sharp Knife.
7. Place On Oven Tray And Then Bake In Preheated Oven Between 20 And 25 Minutes, Until They Begin To Gently Tan.
8. Lift From Tray And Let Them Cool Down On A Cooling Tray. They Should Firm Up Nicely With An Enjoyable Crunch. Some People Like Them Less Crunchy, In Which Case Take Out Before They Start To Tan. I Am In The ‘Crunchy’ Camp Personally. Explore.

title: Crispy Salt and Pepper Spiced Tofu
ingredients:
1. 400G Of Firm Tub Tofu I Used Cauldron Original
2. 1 Tsp Of Chinese 5Spice Feel Free To Substitute With Your Preferred Spice
3. 12 Tablespoons Of Vegetable Oil Rice Bran Is Good As It Has A High Smoke Point Olive Oil Works Well Too
4. 1 Tablespoon Of Plain Flour If Youre Gluten Or Wheat Intolerant You Can Substitute For Your Preferred Flour Or Use Gramchickpea Flour
5. 1 Teaspoon Of Dried Chilli Flakes Optional
6. Splash Of Soy Sauce
7. 1 Sliced Chilli 1 Spring Onion Few Slices Of Red Onion Optional  For Garnish
8. 2 Tablespoons Of Oil Rice Brand Oil Is Good As It Has A High Smoke Point But Olive Oil Works Well Too
9. Salt  Pepper
10. Your Favourite Vegan Dipping Sauce  I Love Sweet Chilli With This Dish
preparation:
1. I Know Tofu Can Be A Little Daunting To Cook With If You Haven’T Used It Before, Particularly If You’Re A New Vegan And Attempt To Treat It Like You Might Have Done A Non-Vegan Protein Source.
2. Top Tofu Tip!Before We Get Started It’S Probably Worth Sharing My Number 1 Favourite Tip For Tofu – Freeze It First, Then Defrost It.
3. Whilst This Means A Little More Planning, It Seems To Make A Big Difference In The Firmness, How Easy It Is To Work With, And Also The Texture Of The End Result. It’S Not The End Of The World If You Haven’T Time To Freeze It Before Using But For Future Reference, I Find It Works Best To Keep Tofu In The Freezer And Just Take It Out To Defrost The Evening Before Or The Morning Of The Day I’M Going To Be Using It
4. Unpackage The Tofu And Drain Well, Squeezing The Excess Moisture Over The Sink Before Placing In A Clean Tea Cloth
5. Wrap The Cloth Around The Tofu And Press Down On It To Remove As Much Of The Moisture As Possible – I Find Placing It Between Two Chopping Boards Is A Good
6. Cut The Tofu Into Cubes – I Find Slicing It In Half Into Two Flat Slabs Is A Good Way To Start
7. Place The Tofu In A Bowl, Add The Salt, Pepper, Spices, And Soy Sauce And Mix Gently Until All Pieces Are Evenly Coated
8. Add The Flour And Mix Again, Until Evenly Coated
9. Heat The Oil In A Pan, Then Carefully Add The Tofu (You Don’T Want To Burn Yourself With Splashes Of Hot Oil!)
10. Fry The Tofu, Turning Occasionally, Until Golden
11. Serve As Is With The Garnish Or Dipping Sauce Or Add At The Last Minute To Your Favourite Stir Fry Dish
12. Enjoy!

title: Cauliflower Sweet Potato Mac & Cheese
ingredients:
1. 150G Cooked And Cooled Sweet Potato Flesh
2. 100G Cooked And Cooled Cauliflower
3. 60G Smooth Roast Cashew Butter
4. 3  6 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast Depending On How Cheesy You Would Like Your Sauce
5. Tsp Garlic Powder
6. Tsp Onion Powder
7. Tsp Paprika
8. 1 Tsp Lemon Juice
9. 200Cups  250Cups Oat Milk Or Cashew Milk
10. 1 Tsp Dijon Mustard
11. 2 Tbsp 15G Pea Protein
12. 300G Uncooked Dried Elbow Pasta
13. 4 Handfuls Finely Chopped Kale
14. 4 Tsp Veganfriendly Basil Pesto
15. Vegan Crispspotato Chips Of Choice
preparation:
1. Cook Pasta According To Packet Instruction :.
2. Blend Together All Sauce Ingredients With The Exception Of The Protein Powder Until Perfectly Smooth And Silky In A High-Speed Blender.
3. Start With 200 Ml Of Oat Milk And Add More If Necessary Either Before Or After You Add The Protein Powder.
4. Add Protein Powder And Blend To Combine.
5. Season To Taste With Pink Himalayan Rock Salt.
6. Mix Shredded Kale With Pesto.
7. Add Sauce To Cooked And Drained Pasta.
8. Serve Topped With Some Of The Kale Pesto Slaw And Crisps Of Choice. Dig In!

title: Gooey Chocolate Brownies
ingredients:
1. 1 X 400G Tin Of Aduki Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 6 Tbsp Ground Flaxseed
3. 75Cups Sunflower Oil
4. 200G Light Soft Brown Sugar
5. 55G Cocoa Powder
6. 55G Ground Almonds
7. 1 Tsp Glutenfree Baking Powder
8. 100G Dark Dairyfree Chocolate
9. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. Makes 9 Brownies
2. You Will Need A 23 Cm Square Tin For This Recipe
3. Preheat The Oven To 180C And Lightly Grease And Line A 23Cm Square Brownie Tin.
4. Begin By Combining The Ground Flaxseed In A Bowl With 9 Tablespoons Of Water, Stir Together And Set Aside To Thicken Up – The Flaxseed Will Absorb All Of The Liquid, Acting As A Binder For The Brownies.
5. Place The Aduki Beans Into A Food Processor And Blitz Until You Have A Smooth Paste. Add The Flaxseed Mixture, Oil, Sugar, Cocoa, Ground Almonds, Baking Powder And Vanilla Extract And Pulse Until You Have A Rich And Glossy Batter.
6. Roughly Chop The Dark Chocolate Into Small Chunks, Add It To The Mixture And Pulse Briefly Just To Combine The Chocolate Into The Mixture. Spoon The Brownie Batter Into The Tin And Then Bake In The Oven For 55-60 Minutes, Stopping Half Way Through To Cover The Brownies Loosely In Foil To Stop Them Catching.
7. Remove From The Oven And Set Aside To Cool Down Until Just Warm, This Way The Brownies Will Have Had Time To Set A Little But Still Be Deliciously Warm.
8. Like This Recipe And Want To Try More? Sign Up With Veganuary Today For Recipes Delivered Straight To Your Inbox.

title: Pineapple Coconut Muffins
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Of Spelt Flour
2. 2 Tsp Of Baking Soda
3. 4 Tbsp Of Coconut Powder
4. 1 Cup Of Stevia Or Agave Powder
5. 400G Fresh Ripe Pineapple Or 1 Can Of Pineapple 400G
6. 23 Cup Molten Soya Margarine Or Groundnut Oil
7. Cup Provamel Rice Coconut Drink
8. 1 Pinch Of Salt
9. 1 Tsp Of Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. Pineapple Coconut Muffins Are Made Usingprovamel Rice Coconut Drink.
2. Preheat The Oven To 180°C.
3. Put All The Dry Ingredients In A Bowl And Mix Well.
4. Dice The Pineapple And Puree With A Hand Blender Until You Have A Coarse Paste.
5. Mix The Pineapple And The Other Wet Ingredients Together With The Dry Ingredients Until You Have A Smooth Dough.
6. Take A Muffin Tin And Place Muffin Liners In Each Tin.
7. Scoop The Batter In The Liners Until They Are Filled ¾.
8. Sprinkle With Some Coconut Powder.
9. Put Them In The Oven For About 20-25 Minutes Until They Are Golden Brown.

title: Chocolate Mousse with Raspberry and Salted Chocolate Crumble
ingredients:
1. Vegan Raspberry And Chocolate Crumble
2. 75G Gluten Free Or Hazelnut Flour
3. 30G Cocoa Powder
4. 7G Salt
5. 75G Caster Sugar
6. 50G Muscavado Sugar
7. 125G Ground Almonds
8. 100G Melted Vegan Butter Or Margarine
9. 75G Freeze Dried Raspberry Pieces Optional
10. Caramel Layer Optionalstrong
11. 15G Cornstarch
12. 130G Almond Milk
13. 120G Sugar
14. 30G Vegan Butter Or Margarine
15. Vegan Mousse
16. 300G Soft Tofu
17. 100G Dark Chocolate
18. 25G Cocoa Powder
19. 70G Maple Syrup
20. Pinch Of Sea Salt
preparation:
1. Vegan Raspberry And Chocolate Crumble
2. Mix Every Dry Ingredient In A Bowl And Add The Melted Vegan Butter To Bind The Mix Together.
3. Spread Out Evenly On A Lined Baking Tray And Cook At 170C For 12-15 Minutes.
4. Once Cooled Add The Raspberry Pieces And Set Aside.
5. If You Wish To Prepare This In Advance, The Crumble Can Be Stored In A Airtight Container For Up To Five Days.
6. Caramel Layer (Optional)
7. Mix The Almond Milk With The Corn Starch And Warm Up Gently In A Small Pan Until 50C-60C, Set Aside.
8. Heat The Sugar In A Pan On A Medium Heat Until It Reaches A Light Golden Caramel, Turn The Heat To Low And Then Slowly Add The Milk, Whisking All The Time Until Fully Incorporated.
9. Once All The Milk Is In, Bring The Mix To The Boil And Whisk Constantly For 1 Minute (This Will Cook The Cornstarch And Thicken The Mix)
10. Take Off The Heat, Whisk In The Butter Until It Is Emulsified And Set Aside In A Bowl To Cool To Room Temperature.
11. Vegan Mousse
12. Warm The Chocolate Gently In The Microwave And Stir With A Spoon Until Melted.
13. Drain Off The Tofu And Place It Into A Blender With All The Other Ingredients, Blend Until Smooth.
14. Put To One Side Until You Are Ready To Pour Into The Glasses (Do Not Store It In The Fridge While You Gather The Other Elements, It Will Become To Firm To Pour)
15. Finishing
16. Start With Pouring A Small Amount Of Mousse Into The Bottom Of The Glass And Layer With The Crumble, Followed By Another Layer Of Mousse.
17. Place In The Fridge To Set For 15 Minutes Before Topping With A Spoonful Of Caramel And Finishing With More Crumble.

title: Beyond Sausage Stuffed Peppers
ingredients:
1. 2 Packets Beyond Sausage Brat Original 4 Total
2. 200G Cooked Quinoa
3. 3 Large Green Chillies
4. 70G Corn Kernels
5. 70G Canned Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
6. 70G Petite Diced Tomatoes
7. 70G Plantbased Cheese Of Your Choice
8. 3 Tablespoons Chopped Fresh Coriander Leaves
9. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
10. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
11. Teaspoon Onion Powder
12. Teaspoon Chilli Powder Or More To Taste
13. Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper To Taste
14. 6 Peppers Tops Cut Stemmed And Seeded
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 180C.
2. Line A 9×13 Baking Dish With Parchment Paper.
3. In A Large Bowl, Combine Quinoa, Green Chillies, Corn, Beans, Tomatoes, Plant-Based Cheese, Cilantro, Cumin, Garlic, Onion And Chilli Powder, Salt And Pepper, To Taste.
4. De-Case The Beyond Sausage Links. In A Pan, Crumble The Links And Cook For About 4 Minutes. Note: They Will Continue To Cook In The Oven, And You Don’T Want Them To Dry Out.
5. Spoon The Filling Into Each Bell Pepper Cavity. Place Filled Pepper In The Prepared Baking Dish, Cavity Side Up, And Bake Until The Peppers Are Tender And The Filling Is Heated Through About 25-30 Minutes.
6. Serve And Enjoy!
7. Did You Enjoy This Dish? Check Out This Beyond Sausage Toad In The Hole Too.

title: Chaka-lekka Burger Pie
ingredients:
1. 1 Box Of Frys Traditional Burgers Or Similar
2. 2 Packets Of Puff Pastry
3. Olive Oil For Frying
4. Salt And Pepper
5. 1 Cup Chakalaka
6. 1 Cup Cup Grated Vegan Cheese
7. Sesame Seeds To Garnish
8. To Serve
9. Baked Potato Wedges
10. Tomato Sauce
11. Simple Side Salad
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180°C.
2. Roll Out The First Pack Of Puff Pastry On A Floured Surface, Using A Small Plate Just Larger Than The Patty, Cut 2 Circles From The Pastry. Place 1 Traditional Burger Patty On Top Of Each Pastry Round And Wet The Edges With A Little Water.
3. Top With A Generous Dollop Of Chakalaka And Grated Vegan Cheese.
4. Repeat The Process Of Cutting 2 Circles From The Second Roll Of Pastry And Place The Circles Over The Top Of The Burgers.
5. Using A Fork, Seal The Edges Well And Brush The Top Of The Pies With A Little Olive Oil. Sprinkle With Sesame Seeds Then Bake For 30-40 Minutes, Or Until Golden Brown On Top.
6. Serve The Pies With A Side Of Crispy Baked Potato Wedges And Tomato Sauce For Dipping.

title: Jeera Aloo
ingredients:
1. 2 Tbsp  Oil
2. 1  Tbsp Cumin Seeds
3. 34 Medium Potatoes Roughly 600G
4. 2 Green Chillies Chopped
5. 1 Tsp Grated Ginger
6. 12 Tsp Ground Turmeric
7. 14 Tsp Chilli Powder
8. 12 Tsp Coriander Powder
9. 12 Tsp Pink Salt
10. 12 Tsp Cumin Powder
11. 2 Tsp Mango Powder Amchur Powder Or Sub For Lemon Juice
12. Chopped Coriander
preparation:
1. Peel Potatoes And Cut Them Into Medium-Small Sized Cubes.
2. Steam Or Boil Them Until They Are Cooked But Still Hold Their Shape. (Start With Cold / Room Temperature Water)
3. Heat Oil Over Low-Medium Heat.
4. Add Cumin Seeds And Sauté Until Fragrant.
5. Then Add Green Chillies And Ginger. Sauté For Just Under A Minute.
6. Add All Dry Spices. Cook For A Few Seconds.
7. Add Steamed/Boiled Potatoes. Mix Until All Potatoes Are Coated With Spices.
8. Cover Lid And Cook For 3-4 Minutes.
9. Sprinkle With Chopped Coriander.
10. Love This Dish? Explore Even More Vegan Curry Recipes.

title: Marrow and Carrot Soup
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
2. 1 Onion Peeled And Chopped
3. 1 Garlic Clove Crushed
4. 12 Medium Marrow Deseeded And Chopped
5. 2 Carrots Sliced
6. 500Cups Stock
7. 2 Teaspoons Paprika
8. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
9. 1 Teaspoon Dried Basil
10. 1 Tin Of Chopped Tomatoes
11. Freshly Ground Black Pepper
12. Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Heat The Olive Oil In A Large Heavy-Bottomed Saucepan.
2. Fry The Onion Gently Until It Begins To Soften.
3. Add The Garlic Clove.
4. Add All The Vegetables And Cook For A Minute.
5. Add The Stock, Herbs And Tin Of Tomatoes.
6. Bring To The Boil And Simmer For 30-45 Minutes Until All The Vegetables Are Soft.
7. Process In A Liquidiser Until Smooth.
8. Return To The Pan And Heat Through.
9. Season To Taste With Freshly Ground Black Pepper And Salt As Required.
10. Like This? Check Out More Vegan Soup Recipes!

title: Gluten-Free Brownie
ingredients:
1. 360G Dark Chocolate 40
2. 200G Milk Alternative
3. 1 Tsp Sea Salt
4. 150G Brown Sugar
5. 200G Crunchy Peanut Butter
6. 5G Baking Powder
7. 230G Glutenfree Flour
8. Baking Tray 5Cm Depth 20Cm Wide 30Cm Long
preparation:
1. Melt Together The Dark Chocolate & Salt With The Milk Alternative In A Dish Over A Pan Of Water.
2. Mix Together Well Then Add Everything Except The Gluten-Free Flour, Mixing Together Thoroughly For Around 20 Seconds.
3. Once You Have A Paste-Like Substance Mix In The Gluten-Free Flour. Line The Baking Tray With Grease-Proof Paper And Scrape In The Brownie Batter. Bake At 160C In A Pre-Heated Oven For 40 Minutes, Turning Halfway.
4. Remove From The Oven And Allow To Cool And Refrigerate Overnight.
5. Cut, Serve And Eat.
6. No Nonsense Vegan Recipes – Food Rhino
7. Facebook
8. Instagram
9. Want More Recipes Like This? Sign Up To Veganuary For Free Recipes, Meal Plans, Cookbooks And More!

title: Cherry Pie
ingredients:
1. 8Oz226G Plain Flour
2. 4Oz113 Fat I Used A Halfhalf Ratio Of Vegan Butter To Vegetable Fat
3. 2Oz56G Aquafaba Liquid Drained From A Can Of Chickpeas Plus More For Brushing
4. 1Oz28G Caster Sugar
5. 300G Cherries Pitted
6. 2 Tbsp Caster Sugar
7. 2 Tsp Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 350F.
2. Get A 7 Inch Pie Dish Ready.
3. Start By Making The Pastry. In A Large Mixing Bowl Add The Flour And Fat. Using Your Hands Rub The Fat Through The Flour Until The Mixture Resembles A Coarse Sand.
4. Stir In The Sugar. Make A Well In The Middle Of The Flour Then Add The Aquafaba, Using A Wooden Spoon To Mix It All Together.
5. Lightly Flour Your Kitchen Surface, Then Plop The Dough Out Of The Bowl. Knead Lightly For Around 5 Minutes Until The Pastry Is Smooth. Roll Into A Ball And Place In A Ziplock Bag. Chill The Pastry In The Fridge For At Least 1 Hour.
6. Whilst The Pastry Is Chilling, Start On The Cherry Filling. Pit The Cherries – I Find The Easiest Way Is To Use An Empty Wine Bottle And A Chopstick. Place 1 Cherry In The Opening Of The Wine Bottle And Use The Sharp End Of The Chopstick To Push Out The Pit.
7. Once All The Cherries Are Pitted Add Them To A Saucepan With The 2 Tablespoons Of Sugar And Vanilla Extract. Cook On A Medium-Low Heat Until The Juices Run Out And The Fruit Is Soft. Set Aside To Cool.
8. Divide The Pastry Into Two Equal Parts.Flour Your Surface And Roll Out One Piece Of Pastry Into An 8 Inch Circle And Carefully Lay It Over The Pie Dish.
9. Using Your Fingers Press The Pastry Into The Dish. Cut Away The Excess Pastry. Scoop Out The Cherries Using A Slotted Spoon, Making Sure Not Too Take Too Much Of The Juice, Into The Pie Casing.
10. Roll Out Your Second Piece Of Dough And Carefully Lay It Over The Top Of The Pie. Using Your Thumb Press All The Way Around The Edge Of The Dish To Seal The Pastry. Cut Away The Excess Pastry. Then Using Your Finger, Press The Thumb Sealed Part Inwards To Make A Little Flute.
11. If You Want To, You Can Use Your Excess Pastry To Make A Little Decoration! Cut Two Slits In The Top Of The Pie Crust Then Brush It With A Little Aquafaba.
12. Bake The Pie In The Oven For 25 Minutes Or Until Golden Brown, Rotating Half Way.

title: Psychedelic Smoothie Bowl
ingredients:
1. 1 Bananas
2. 12C Coconut Yoghurt
3. 12C Dairy Free Milk
4. A Lemon Zested
5. 14T Turmeric Powder
6. A Handful Of Fresh Or Frozen Raspberries
7. 1T Beetroot Powder
8. A Handful Of Baby Spinach
9. 12T Spirulina Powder
preparation:
1. Blend The Bananas, Yoghurt And Milk Till Smooth, Portion It Into 3 Bowls.
2. In The First Bowl Add The Lemon Zest And Turmeric, Blend.
3. In The Second Bowl Add The Raspberries And Beetroot Powder, Blend.
4. In The Third Bowl Add The Spinach And Spirulina, Blend.
5. In Your Serving Bowl Add A Large Spoonful Of Each Mixture, One At A Time.
6. Once All Of The Smoothie Is In Your Bowl Use Your Finger To Create Beautiful Patterns.

title: Greek Vegetable and Butter Bean Stew
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Red Onion Sliced
2. 10 Small New Potatoes Halved
3. 12 An Aubergine Sliced Into Chunks
4. 1 Courgette Sliced
5. 1 Sweet Red Pepper Sliced
6. 1 Stick Of Celery Sliced
7. 10 Mushrooms Sliced Or Quartered
8. A Handful Of Green Beans
9. A Handful Of Black And Green Olives Whole Or Halved
10. A Handful Of Spinach Or Kale
11. 1 Tin Of Plum Tomatoes
12. 1 Large Cup Of Vegetable Stock
13. 1 Tbsp Of Tomato Puree
14. 1 Tsp Balsamic Vinegar
15. A Drizzle Of Agave Syrup Or Other Sweetener
16. Black Pepper
17. Sea Salt
18. Nutritional Yeast
19. Mixed Italian Herbs
20. Oregano
21. Coriander
22. Cumin
23. 2 Bay Leaves
24. Lemon Juice
25. 1 Garlic Clove
preparation:
1. Lightly Fry The Onion, Then Add The Potato Along With A Small Amount Of Water.
2. Steam For Approximately 10 Minutes Before Adding The Other Veggies.
3. Add In Your Seasonings Along With 1 Large Cup Of Vegetable Stock.
4. Replace Lid And Bring To The Boil For Approximately 20 Minutes, Adding Additional Water As Required.
5. Reduce The Heat And Add Your Spinach Or Kale.
6. Steam For A Few Additional Minutes, Or Until The Vegetables Are To Your Liking.
7. Serve In A Shallow Bowl And Sprinkle With Vegan Feta.

title: Traditional Burger with Sweet Tomato Relish
ingredients:
1. 1 Box Frys Traditional Burgers
2. 12 Can Of Tomatoes Or Tomato And Onion Mix
3. 1 Tbsp Chutney
4. 12 Garlic Clove Crushed
5. 75 Cups Mustard
6. 200 Cups Barbecue Sauce
7. Salt And Pepper
8. 4 Seeded Buns
9. Olive Oil For Grilling
10. 2 Medium Gherkins Sliced
11. 1 Red Onion Thinly Sliced
12. 1 Tomato Sliced
13. Rocket
preparation:
1. Relish:Place Tomato And Onion Mix In Small Barbecue Cast Ironpot, Add Chutney And Garlic. Place Pot On Barbecue And Simmerfor 3 Minutes.Season With Salt And Pepper.
2. Marinade:Combine Bbq Sauce And Mustard To Create A Baste For The Burgers.
3. Grill The Burgers On The Barbecue For 8 Minutes, Oruntil Cooked Through, Basting And Turning Regularly.
4. Slice The Buns In Half, Lightly Brush With Olive Oil, Toast Lightlyon The Barbecue.
5. Assemble The Burger:Layer With Relish, Sliced Tomato And Watercress.Add The Burgers, Gherkins, Red Onion And More Relish.

title: Sweet Chilli Relish
ingredients:
1. 8G Dried Ancho Poblano Chillies With Seeds
2. 2 Roasted Red Peppers From A Jar Or You Can Roast Your Own
3. 5 Cherry Tomatoes
4. 1 Large Clove Garlic
5. 12 Red Onion
6. Chopped Into 3 Chunks
7. 1 Cm Piece Fresh
8. Peeled Ginger
9. Pinch Of Pink Himalayan Salt Or Table Salt
10. Generous Pinch Of Black Pepper
11. 1 Tsp Sugar Optional
12. 1 Tblsp White Wine Vinegar
13. 1 Tblsp Balsamic Vinegar
preparation:
1. Makes 1 Large Jar
2. Equipment
3. Measuring Cups & Spoons
4. Food Processor
5. Frying Pan
6. Wooden Spoon
7. Airtight Glass Jar
8. Sieve
9. Soak The Dried Chilli And Seeds In Hot Water For 10 Mins To Soften. When They’Re Ready, Drain Into A Sieve And Tip Into The Processor.
10. Add The Rest Of The Ingredients To The Food Processor And Blitz Together For 15-20 Seconds Until Everything Is Chopped Into Tiny Pieces (It Doesn’T Need To Be Completely Smooth).
11. Pour The Mix Into A Frying Pan And Simmer Gently On A Medium Heat For 8-10 Mins, So That Most Of The Liquid Is Absorbed And The Flavours Intensify. Stir Occasionally To Make Sure Nothing Sticks To The Bottom Of The Pan.
12. * Top Tip *
13. Keep An Eye On The Pan As The Timings Are Just A Guide – Don’T Over Simmer The Relish Or It Will Dry Up And Burn.
14. The Relish Is Ready When The Excess Liquid Has Been Absorbed But It’S Still Moist – Taste And Adjust Any Seasonings Or Sweetness To Your Own Taste. Leave To Cool And Store In An Airtight Jar.
15. * This Sweet Chilli Relish Is Delicious On Crackers, Open Sandwiches And Serves As A Great Party Dip For Slices Of Toasted Pitta Bread. It’S Also Perfect For Mixing Through Cooked Pasta And Veggies To Add A Spicy Twist, Plus Any Other Tasty Combinations You Discover! Store It In The Fridge And It Will Keep For Up To 1 Week (If You Haven’T Eaten It All By Then!)
16. I’Ve Got Loads More Yummy Vegan Recipes Onlottielovesfood.Comor Come Say Hi Ontwitterorinstagram.

title: Beetroot, Butterbean and Mint Dip
ingredients:
1. 2 Beetroot Leaves Trimmed
2. 23 Garlic Cloves
3. 1 Tsp Cumin Seeds
4. 1 Tin Butter Beans
5. 2 Tsp Tahini Optional
6. Half A Lemon Juiced
7. A Handful Of Fresh Mint Leaves
8. 1 Tbsp Walnut Oil Or Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Heat The Oven To 180C. Wash The Beetroots, Brush With A Little Oil And Wrap Each One In Foil. Wrap The Garlic Cloves Into A Loose Foil Parcel And Place Beets And Garlic Into The Centre Of The Oven For 45 Minutes.
2. Dry Fry The Cumin Seeds In A Non-Stick Frying Pan For A Minute Or Two Keeping Them Moving So They Don’T Burn. Using A Pestle And Mortar Or Spice Grinder Grind The Toasted Seeds And Set Aside.
3. Reserving The Liquid, Drain And Mash The Butterbeans And Add In Tahini, If Using. I Mash The Beans Quite Coarsely So As To Keep A Chunky Texture But If You Prefer A Smoother Consistency You Might Want To Use A Blender. Once Mashed Stir In The Cumin, Lemon Juice And Season Well.
4. Peel The Beetroot And Garlic. Cut The Beetroot Into Quarters And Place In A Blender. Cut The Very Tips Of The Garlic Cloves And Squeeze The Soft Garlic Pulp In With The Beetroot. Add A Tablespoon Of The Reserved Liquid From The Beans And Pulse. If The Beetroot Needs A Bit Of Encouragement To Move Then Add More Of The Reserved Liquid As Necessary. Blend Until You Have A Smooth Purée. Season To Taste.
5. Coarsely Chop The Mint Leaves And Grind In A Pestle And Mortar With The Oil. If You Don’T Want To Use Oil Then Finely Chop The Leaves And Scatter On At The End.
6. To Serve, Dollop The Bean Mixture Into A Bowl Or Plate And Create A Shallow Well In The Centre. Spoon The Beetroot Purée Into The Well And Drizzle The Mint And Oil Over The Top.

title: Coconut Panna Cotta
ingredients:
1. For The Panna Cotta
2. 400Cups Or 15 Oz Regular Ie Not Light Canned Coconut Milk
3. 400 Cups Or 15 Oz Coconut Cream
4. 100G Or 12 Cup Sugar
5. 1 14 To 1 12 Teaspoons Of Agar Agar Powder
6. 4 Tablespoons Cold Water
7. 1 Fresh Vanilla Pod
8. For The Raspberry Compote
9. 1 Punnet Fresh Raspberries C 250G Or 2 Cups Washed
10. Juice Of Half A Small Lemon
11. 1 Tablespoon Water
12. 12 Tablespoon Sugar
preparation:
1. Makes: 5 Teacup-Sized Panna Cottas
2. Instruction : Time: 10-15 Minutes
3. Cooling And Setting Time: 4 Hours +
4. First, Make The Panna Cottas. You Need To Do This Way In Advance Of Serving Them, At Least Four Hours Prior. The Panna Cottas Will Keep Well Overnight, So You Can Always Prepare Them The Night Before You Need Them, If Necessary.
5. Add 4 Tablespoons Of Cold Water To A Small Bowl. Stir Into This 2 Teaspoons Of Agar Agar, And Set Aside For 5 Minutes To ‘Bloom’.
6. Add To A Saucepan The Coconut Milk, Coconut Cream, Sugar, And Vanilla Bean. Bring This Mixture To A Boil, Then Whisk In The Agar-Water Mixture. Let The Whole Thing Boil For Another Minute Or So, Then Sieve Into A Large Mixing Bowl.
7. From The Mixing Bowl, Carefully Pour The Hot Coconut Mixture Into Your Serving Glasses Or Dishes. Let The Mixture Cool For About Half An Hour Before Transferring The Glasses To Your Fridge.
8. Refrigerate The Panna Cottas For At Least 4 Hours, Until Set.Once The Panna Cottas Are Cooling You Can Get To Work On The Compote.
9. Add The Fresh Raspberries, Lemon Juice, Water And Sugar To A Medium Saucepan. Crush Up The Raspberries A Little In The Pan With A Spoon. Bring This Mixture To A Boil And Allow It To Keep Boiling For A Couple Of Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
10. Then, Turn The Heat Right Down. Leave The Pan Uncovered, On A Very Low Simmer, Until Most Of The Water Has Evaporated And The Fruit Has Cooked Down Into A Nice, Smooth Compote-Y Paste. Keep Stirring The Mixture Every 10 Minutes Or So To Help Break The Raspberries Down.
11. If You’Re Not A Fan Of Raspberry Seeds, Sieve Your Compote Before Cooling It. Otherwise, Simply Set It Aside For 40-50 Minutes, Or Until Your Panna Cottas Are Set.
12. When The Compote Is Cool And Your ‘Cottas Set, Scoop On Top Of Each One An Even Amount Of Raspberry Compote. Serve, Preferably As Soon As Possible, And At Most Within 2-3 Hours Of Assembling.

title: Gluten Free Red Currant Bundt Cake with a Coconut Glaze
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Gram Flour
2. 12 Ground Almonds
3. 2 Tsp Baking Powder
4. 12 Bicarbonate Of Soda
5. 2 Tbsp Coconut Oil Melted
6. 13 Cup Plain Soya Or Coconut Yoghurt
7. 13 Cup Coconut Milk
8. 23 Cup Maple Syrup
9. 14 Cup Agave
10. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
11. 2 Cups Red Currants
12. For The Glaze
13. 1 Heaped Tbsp Coconut Oil
14. 14 Cup Coconut Milk
15. 14 Cup Desiccated Coconut
16. 2 Tbsp Agave
17. 1 Tbsp Cornflour
preparation:
1. Pre-Heat The Oven To 180 Degrees Celcius/350 Degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Combine The Flour, Ground Almonds, Baking Powder And Bicarbonate Of Soda In A Bowl.
3. Whisk Together The Yoghurt, Milk, Coconut Oil, Vanilla Extract And Sweeteners.
4. Make A Well In The Flour And Pour In The Wet Ingredients. Fold Gently Until The Ingredients Are Thoroughly Combined Before Stirring Through Around Half Of The Redcurrants – Leaving The Remainder On The Stalk For Presentation Purposes.
5. Grease Your Bundt Tin With A Little Coconut Oil. Pour The Batter Into The Tin And Bake For Around 30Mins.
6. Allow It To Cool For Around 10Mins Before Removing From The Tin And Transferring To A Cooling Rack.
7. Meanwhile, Whisk All The Glaze Ingredients Together In A Pan And Simmer Until Reduced And Reasonably Thick. Let It Cool A Little Before Spooning Around The Top Of The Cake, Allowing Some Of It To Strategically Run Down The Sides. Leave It To Cool Further For Around 5-10Minutes Before Adorning With The Remaining Red Currants.

title: Salted Caramel Chocolate Cheesecake Slices
ingredients:
1. For The Base
2. 2 X Cocoa Delight Nakd Bars Roughly Chopped
3. For The Filling
4. 75G Cashew Nuts Soaked For At Least An Hour
5. 7 Dates Pitted And Soaked For At Least An Hour
6. 2Tbsp Almond Milk
7. 1Tbsp Tahini
8. 14Tsp Vanilla Extract
9. Pinch Of Ground Sea Salt
10. For The Topping
11. 40G Dairyfree Milk Chocolate
12. 1Tbsp Coconut Oil
13. 12 Berry Delight Nakd Bar
14.
preparation:
1. Makes 2 Servings.
2. Press The Cocoa Delight Nakd Bar Pieces Together With Your Hands And, Using A Rolling Pin, Roll Out Them Until They Are 1/2Cm Thick. You May Need To Bring Them Together And Roll Out Again A Few Times Until They Form A Single Piece That Can Be Rolled Out Without Any Gaps. Roll Out Into A Rectangle Approx. 5Cm X 10Cm And Place In The Bottom Of Suitable Container.
3. In A Food Processor, Blend All Of The Filling Ingredients Together Into A Thick And Creamy Mixture. Scoop Out Over The Base, Smooth Out The Top, And Place In The Freezer.
4. Whilst The Filling Is In The Freezer, Roll Out The Berry Delight Nakd Bar And Cut Out Four Small Heart Shapes. Melt The Chocolate And Coconut Oil Over A Bain-Marie, Stirring Well. Once Smooth And Fully Melted, Remove From The Heat And Pour Over The Cheesecake Filling. Place The Hearts On Top And Return To The Freezer. Freeze For At Least Ten Minutes To Allow The Topping To Set Fully.
5. When You Are Ready To Serve, Remove From The Freezer And Container. Allow To Defrost For Around Ten Minutes, Then Using A Very Sharp Knife, Cut Into Two Slices (Tip: A Sawing Action Works Best To Avoid Cracking The Topping), And Serve!

title: Aloo Sandheko – Nepalese Potatoes
ingredients:
1. 500G Potatoes Peeled And Cubed
2. 3 Cloves Garlic Cut Into Very Thin Strips
3. 3 Cm Piece Ginger Peeled And Cut Into Very Thin Strips
4. 1 Large Red Onion Peeled And Finely Sliced
5. 1 Tsp Chilli Powder
6. 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
7. Salt To Taste
8. 3 Tbsp Mustard Or Another Oil
9. 1 Tsp Fenugreek Seeds
10. 2 Green Chillis Deseeded And Sliced Very Fine
11. 1 Tsp Ground Turmeric
12. Handful Fresh Coriander Chopped
preparation:
1. Boil The Potatoes In Water Until They Are Soft, Then Drain.
2. In A Bowl, Combine The Garlic, Ginger, Onion, Chilli And Lemon Juice, Then Coat The Potatoes In The Mixture. Season To Taste.
3. Heat The Oil In A Frying Pan, Then Add The Fenugreek Seeds. When They Start To Brown, Add The Green Chillis And The Turmeric. Cook For Another Minute, Then Add This Spice Mixture To The Potatoes.
4. Refrigerate To Cool, Then Serve Garnished With The Coriander
5. Explore Even More Quick And Easy Vegan Recipes!

title: Veggie Bean Burrito Bowl
ingredients:
1. 2 Flour Tortilla Wraps
2. 1 Small Red Onion Finely Sliced
3. 2 Limes
4. 1 400G Tin Of Mixed Beans Drained And Rinsed
5. 1 Roasted Red Pepper From A Jar Roughly Chopped
6. 130G Sweetcorn
7. Small Bunch Coriander Roughly Chopped
8. 4 Radishes Finely Sliced
9. 1 Avocado Peeled And Sliced
10. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil Plus A Little Extra To Brush The Wraps With
11. 4 Heaped Tbsp Alpro Plain Unsweetened Big Pot
12. 1 Tsp Chipotle Paste
13. Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180C. Cover The Red Onion With Boiling Hot Water And Leave For 5 Mins. Drain The Water And Pat Dry. Place In A Small Bowl, Season Well With Salt And Pepper And Add The Juice Of 1 Lime. Leave To Macerate Whilst You Prepare The Remaining Ingredients.
2. Brush The Flour Tortillas With Oil Lightly. Use The Underside Of A Muffin Tray To Shape The Tortillas Into A Bowl Pushing The Middle Section Of Each Into The Gaps To Hold In Place. Bake In The Oven For 6-8 Minutes Or Until Golden Brown And Crisped.
3. Mix Together The Beans, Sweetcorn, Sliced Radish, Roasted Red Pepper, Coriander, Olive Oil And Juice Of 1 Lime. Season Well With Salt And Pepper.
4. Marble The Chipotle Paste Into The Alpro Plain Unsweetened Big Pot.
5. Spoon The Beans Into The Tortilla Bowls, Top With The Red Onions, Sliced Avocado And A Big Dollop Of The Sauce.

title: Vegan Chocolate Cake
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice
2. 300Cups Soya Milk
3. 275G Selfraising Flour
4. 25G Cocoa Powder
5. 1 Level Teaspoon Bicarbonate Of Soda
6. 175G Caster Sugar
7. 150G Flora Freedom Melted Or Similar Alternative
8. 3 Tablespoons Golden Syrup
9. For The Icing
10. 75G Flora Freedom
11. 200G Icing Sugar
12. 25G Cocoa Powder
13. 2 Tablespoons Water
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 180° C, 160° C Fan, Gas Mark 4.
2. Add Lemon Juice To The Milk And Set Aside.
3. Sieve Together The Flour, Cocoa, Caster Sugar And Bicarbonate Of Soda Into A Large Mixing Bowl.
4. Pour The Milk, Melted Butter And Golden Syrup Over The Flour Mixture And Stir Until It Becomes A Smooth Batter.
5. Halve The Mixture Between Two 20Cm Greased And Base Lined Sandwich Tins And Bake In Preheated Oven For 35-40 Minutes.
6. Check To See If Your Cake Is Cooked By Inserting A Skewer Into The Centre Of Each Half. If It Comes Out Clean, Leave The Cakes In The Tins For 5 Minutes Before Turning Out And Cooling On A Wire Rack.
7. Meanwhile, To Make The Icing Beat Together All Ingredients Until Smooth.
8. When The Cakes Are Completely Cold, Sandwich Together With Half Of The Icing. Spread The Remaining Icing Over The Top Of The Cake.
9. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Rosemary, Olive and Tomato Muffins
ingredients:
1. 63G Gram Flour
2. 63G Wholemeal Flour
3. 1 Tsp Baking Powder
4. 90Cups Nondairy Milk
5. 1Tsp Red Wine Vinegar
6. 1 Tbsp Agave Or Maple Syrup
7. 3 Tsp Coconut Oil Solid
8. 1 Sprig Fresh Rosemary Leaves Chopped
9. 2 Medium Tomatoes
10. 12 Kalamata Olives Pitted And Sliced If You Dont Include Olives Add A Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. This Recipe Is For 6 Muffins
2. Heat The Oven To 180°C / 350°F / Gas Mark 4.
3. Cut Each Tomato Into Eight Segments, Place Them On A Tray And Roast For 25 Minutes, Or Until Soft. This Step Could Be Done In Advance, When You Have The Oven On For Something Else – Just Keep Them In The Fridge.
4. Melt The Coconut Oil In A Ramekin. Once Melted, Use A Little To Grease Each Muffin Pocket.
5. Combine The Milk And Vinegar In A Jug And Leave To One Side, To Curdle.
6. Sift The Flour Into A Mixing Bowl, Stir And Add The Baking Powder. Mix In The Tomatoes, Olives And Rosemary Ensuring An Even Coating Of Flour.
7. Make A Well In The Centre And Mix In The Milk And Vinegar, Then The Syrup And Remaining Oil.
8. Once All Ingredients Are Combined Use A Spoon To Distribute The Mixture Between Six Muffin Pockets.
9. Cook For 20 Minutes. Leave Them To Cool In The Tray Before Transferring To A Rack, To Prevent Crumbling Whilst Hot.

title: Blueberry Lemon Cheescake
ingredients:
1. For The Base
2. 50G Rolled Oats
3. 8 Dates Pitted
4. 25G Sultanas
5. 10G Sunflower Seeds
6. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
7. Zest Of 1 Organic Unwaxed Lemon
8. Pinch Of Himalayan Pink Salt
9. For The Filling
10. 75G Cashews Presoaked In Water For At Least An Hour
11. 100G Fresh Blueberries
12. 1 Tsp Maple Syrup
13. Juice Of 1 Organic Unwaxed Lemon
14. Seeds Of 2 Cardamom Pods
15. To Decorate
16. 50G Fresh Blueberries
17. Fresh Mint Leaves Optional
preparation:
1. Begin By Making The Base. Heat A Large Pan To A Medium Temperature And Gently Toast The Oats For About 5 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. There Should Be A Delicious – But Not Burning! – Aroma.
2. Combine The Oats With The Rest Of The Base Ingredients In A Food Processor. Pulse On A Low Speed Until All The Ingredients Clump Together, But Retain A Nice Texture.
3. Line A 10Cm Flan Tin With Foil.
4. Scoop Out The Base Mixture And Press Down Evenly Into The Tin. Place In The Freezer.
5. To Make The Filling, Start By Processing The Cashews Until You Have A Smooth Paste. Next, Add 50G Of Blueberries And The Remaining Filling Ingredients To The Processor And Blitz Until Combined.
6. To Assemble, Scatter The Other 50G Of Blueberries Over The Base And Then Pour On The Filling. Smooth Over With The Back Of A Spoon, Ensuring It Goes Right Up To The Edges Of The Tin.
7. Freeze, For At Least An Hour, Until Needed.
8. Notes
9. The Longer You Soak The Cashews, The Smoother (And Easier On Your Food Processor) They Will Be.
10. Transfer To The Fridge A Little While Before Serving To Aid Slicing.

title: Cheesy Spinach & Kale Dip
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
2. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
3. 170G Baby Spinach
4. 170G Kale Chopped
5. 1 Cup Artichoke Hearts Drained  Finely Chopped
6. Almond Milk Cheese Sauce
7. 1  Cups Raw Cashews Soaked  Drained In Boiling Water For 5 Minutes
8. 3 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
9. 1  Tsp Onion Powder
10. 2 Tsp Mild Chilli Flakes
11. Salt  Pepper To Taste
12. 2 Tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice
13. 1  Cups Califia Farms Unsweetened Almond Milk
14. To Serve
15. Large Cob Bread Loaf
16. Crackers
17. Toasted Pita Bread Slices
18. Veggie Sticks
19. Fresh Herbs
20. Vegan Parmesan Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 205⁰C. Line A Small To Medium Sized Deep Baking Tray With Parchment Paper. Set Aside.
2. In A Non Stick Pan, Heat The Olive Oil Over Medium Heat. Stir In The Garlic And Cook Briefly Until Fragrant. Add In The Spinach And Kale. Place A Lid Over The Pan To Steam. Cook Until Wilted. Once Cooked, Stir Through The Artichokes. Set Aside.
3. Using A High Speed Blender, Add All The Almond Milk Cheese Sauce Ingredients. Blend Until Smooth.
4. Add The Warm Veggie Mix To The Prepared Baking Tray. Stir In The Almond Milk Mixture Overtop And Stir To Combine. Place Into The Oven, Covered For 10 Minutes, Remove Cover And Bake Another 5-7 Minutes Or Until Thick And Scoopable. Best Served Warm, Enjoy!

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups with Toasted Coconut
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Ground Up Pecans
2. Cup Of Toasted Coconut Sweetened Or Unsweetened
3. Cup Vegan Butter
4. 1 Cup Of Natural Peanut Butter Crunchy Or Smooth
5. 200G Dark Chocolate
6. Cup Of Nuts Or Extra Coconut For The Tops
preparation:
1. Put The Pecans Into A Food Processor And Pulse Until It Resembles Graham Cracker Crumbs.
2. In A Pan, Toast The Coconuts On Medium Heat. Keep An Eye On This As They Can Go From Golden Brown To Black Quickly If You Are Not Watching. Stir The Coconut Around Every So Often To Get Even Browning. Transfer To A Bowl Once Browned.
3. Melt The Vegan Butter Over Medium Heat In A Small Pot. Stir In The Peanut Butter, Ground Pecans, And Toasted Coconuts. Mix Well And Then Remove From Heat.
4. In A Muffin Tray (With Liners Or Without – Without Requires You To Use A Knife To Pop Them Out Later But Still Works) Add 2 Tablespoons Of The Mixture Into Each Cup.
5. In A Glass Microwave Safe Bowl, Melt The Dark Chocolate. Spoon Over Each One Of The Cups Evenly.
6. Sprinkle Nuts Or Coconut Over The Top. (You Could Even Mix It In With The Chocolate First!)
7. Now Place The Tray Into Your Freezer For 2 Hours To Set.
8. After 2 Hours Remove From The Freezer And Remove The Peanut Butter Cups! They Can Be Kept In The Fridge And Eaten Right Away. I Usually Wait 5 Minutes From When They Are Taken From The Freezer Before Diving In!

title: Tibetan-inspired Coconut Curry
ingredients:
1. 5Cm Grated Ginger
2. 5 Cloves Garlic
3. 2 Tbsp Cumin
4. 2 Tbsp Fenugreek
5. 1 Tbsp Ground Coriander Seeds
6. 2 Tbsp Turmeric
7. 40G Chopped Coriander
8. 1 Veg Stock Cube
9. 1 Chopped Yellow Pepper
10. 1 Sliced Red Onion
11. 8 Quartered New Potatoes
12. 200G Chopped Baby Sweetcorn
13. 2 X 400G Cans Chickpeas Drained
14. 2 X 400Cups Coconut Milk
preparation:
1. Lightly Sweat The Garlic, Ginger, Spices And Onion For A Few Minutes In Rapeseed Oil Until The Onion Is Soft.
2. If You Think The Spices Are Going To Catch Add A Little Water To Prevent This.
3. Add The Coconut Milk And Veg Stock And Simmer For A Few More Minutes Before Adding The Pepper And Potatoes.
4. Once The Potatoes Are Nearly Cooked Add The Rest Of The Ingredients And Simmer Until The Potatoes And Are Cooked.
5. No Nonsense Vegan Recipes – Food Rhino
6. Facebook
7. Instagram

title: Decadent Basmati Rice Pudding
ingredients:
1. Cup White Basmati Rice
2. 1  Teaspoons Fine Sea Salt
3. 4  Cups Soymilk Or Nutmilk
4. Cup Vegan Sugar
5. 1 Slightly Heaping Tablespoon Cornstarch
6. 1  Tablespoons Pure Vanilla Extract
7. Teaspoon Ground Cardamom
8. Pinch Of Fine Sea Salt
preparation:
1. Combine 1 ½ Cups Water, The Rice, And The Salt In A Saucepan And Bring To A Boil.
2. Cover And Simmer The Rice Over Very Low Heat For 10 Minutes, Until Most Of The Water Is Absorbed. Check Frequently And Stir To Make Sure It Doesn’T Stick.
3. Add 3 ½ Cups Of The Soymilk And The Sugar And Gently Stir To Combine. Continue Simmering On Very Low Heat For An Additional 20 To 25 Minutes, Until The Rice Is Soft And Most Of The Milk Absorbed. You Want A Spongy Texture, With No Bite.
4. Remove The Rice From The Heat.
5. Pour ¼ Cup Of The Remaining Soymilk Into A Bowl And Whisk In Cornstarch To Dissolve. Now Add The Vanilla Extract And Cardamom.
6. Pour The Cornstarch-Milk Mixture Along With The Remaining ¾ Cup Soymilk Into The Hot Pudding And Stir To Combine. At This Point, I Usually Add A Pinch Of Salt, Which Helps To Draw Out The Subtle Sweetness Of The Pudding.
7. Serve Warm Or At Room Temperature.

title: Ginger chilli Tofu Steaks
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Of Tofu 396G
2. 1 Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Chopped
3. 3 Tbsp Tamari Or Dark Soya Sauce
4. Juice From 1 Large Orange
5. 1 Tsp Coconut Oil
6. 3 Balls Of Stem Ginger Sliced Finely Into Strips
7. 12 Tsp Coconut Sugar
8. Zest From 1 Large Orange
9. Black Pepper
10. Optional  Tbsp Pulsin Protein Powder To Thicken The Sauce
preparation:
1. Drain The Water From The Tofu And Blot. Slice Into Chunky Steaks Approximately 1.5Cm Thick.
2. In A Container Large Enough To Accommodate The Tofu Steaks, Mix Together The Marinade Ingredients: Ginger, Chilli, Coconut Sugar, Tamari Or Soya Sauce, Orange Zest, Orange Juice And Black Pepper. If You Are Using Protein Powder, Add This To The Sauce Later.
3. Immerse The Tofu Steaks. Cover And Pop In The Fridge For At Least An Hour To Allow The Flavours Of The Marinade To Soak In.
4. Melt Coconut Oil In A Shallow Pan. Drain The Steaks From The Sauce And On A Low-Heat Pan-Fry For About 8-10 Mins, Turning Over Half-Way Through With A Fish-Slice. Alternatively, You Can Grill The Steaks (Allow 9-10 Mins).
5. While The Steaks Are Cooking, Mix In The Protein Powder To The Sauce (If Using) And Heat Gently In A Saucepan. Pour Over The Steaks. Serve. Enjoy!
6. So Man
7. Www.Sobody.Co.Uk
