15. Remove The Pastry From The Fridge And Carefully Unroll Onto A Baking Tray Lined With Parchment (If The End Of The Pastry Is A Little Still And Doesn’T Want To Unroll, Leave It To Warm Up For 2 Minutes).
16. Remove The Custard From The Fridge And Transfer It To The Bowl Of A Stand Mixer Fitted With The Paddle Attachment. Beat On High Speed Until Smooth Again. If You Don’T Have A Stand Mixer, Beat With A Whisk Until Smooth.
17. Divide The Dough Into 6 Squares Using A Pizza Cutter (For Me Each Square Was 12.5Cm).
18. In A Cup, Mix Together The Plant Milk, Oil, And Syrup. This Will Be Your “Egg Wash”.
19. Using A Pastry Brush, Apply A Small Amount Of Egg Wash To The Centre Of Each Square.
20. Fold The Corners Of The Square Into The Centre And Push Them Down Gently To Stick.
21. Add A Heaped Tablespoon Of Custard To The Centre Of Each Pastry Square. Follow With A Peach Half And Push Down Gently To Make Sure The Custard Squeezes Out Further Than The Peach Half.
22. Brush The Pastry With The Egg Wash And Place In The Oven For 15-20 Minutes Or Until The Pastry Is Golden Brown.
23. To Finish
24. Whisk Together The Icing Sugar And Plant Milk Until Smooth And Thick Enough To Drizzle Off The Whisk.
25. Drizzle The Icing Over The Pastries.
26. Sprinkle The Pistachios Over The Pastries Before Serving.

title: Spiced Apple Slice
ingredients:
1. 150G112 Cups Of Flour
2. 3 Tsp Baking Powder
3. 75G12 Cup Coconut Palm Sugar  1 Tbsp
4. 85G7 Tbsp Of Coconut Oil
5. 1 Tbsp Of Ground Flax
6. 75G34 Cup Of Old Fashion Oats
7. 1 12 Tsp Cinnamon
8. 3 Eating Apples
9. 75G 12 Cup Of Apple Sauce
10. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Line Or Grease A Square Tin And Preheat The Oven To 180 C/350 F.
2. Add 2 Tablespoons Of Water To The Flax And Leave To One Side. Whilst That Is Thickening, Sift Together The Flour, Salt, Baking Powder And Tablespoon Of Sugar, Then Rub In The Oil Until The Mixture Resembles Breadcrumbs.
3. Add The Flax Mixture And Knead Until It Becomes A Firm But Pliable Dough. Put Into The Tin And Press To Cover The Bottom Evenly.
4. Brush A Thin Layer Of Apple Sauce Onto The Dough, Then Cut The Apples Into Thin Slices And Layer Them On Top. Use The Rest Of The Apple Sauce To Cover The Apple Slices.
5. Mix Together The Oats, Sugar And Cinnamon And Sprinkle On Top Of The Apples.
6. Bake For 1 Hour.
7. Leave In The Tin For 10 Minutes, Then Carefully Transfer To A Cooling Rack.
8. Can Be Eaten Warm With A Big Scoop Of Coconut Milk Ice Cream Or Left To Cool.

title: Vegan No-Meat Balls with Hasselback Potatoes
ingredients:
1. 1 Box Frys Asian Spiced Burgers Thawed And Grated
2. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
3. 3 Sprigs Fresh Rosemary Stems Removed And Finely Chopped
4. 2 Heaped Tsp Dijon Mustard
5. 12 Tsp Dried Oregano
6. 2 Green Chillies Finely Chopped
7. 2 Tbsp Chickpea Flour Or Use Allpurpose Flour
8. 23 Tbsp Water
9. 1 Can Of Tinned Tomatoes Or Your Favourite Pasta Sauce
10. 2 Potatoes
11. Olive Oil Optional
12. Italian Herbs As Needed
13. Salt To Taste
14. Fresh Rosemary For Garnish
preparation:
1. Defrost The Fry’S Asian Spiced Burgers And Grate Into A Medium Sized Bowl.
2. Add Onions, Rosemary, Mustard, Oregano, Green Chillies, Chickpea Flour (Or All-Purpose Flour) And Water To Grated Burgers. Mix Well To Create A Batter That Can Be Rolled Into Balls.
3. Using Your Hands, Roll The Batter Into Small Balls And Set Aside For 5 Minutes In The Fridge.
4. Place The Meatballs In The Airfryer And Cook For 8 Minutes At 200°C.
5. Transfer The Meatballs To A Small Ovenproof Dish, Add The Tinned Tomatoes (Or Pasta Sauce) And Place The Dish Into The Basket Of The Airfryer. Alternatively, Create A “Dish” Out Of Tin Foil And Place The Meatballs And Tinned Tomatoes In That.
6. Slide The Dish Into The Airfryer. Set The Temperature To 170°C And The Timer For 5 Minutes To Warm Everything Through.
7. If You Have Large Potatoes, Slice Them In Half. Cut Slits Down Into The Potatoes About 0.5-1Cm Apart And 1Cm From The Base.
8. Brush The Potatoes Lightly With Olive Oil (Optional) Then Cook Them In The Airfryer For 15 Minutes At 200°C.
9. Open Airfryer And Brush Again With The Oil (If Required), Sprinkle With The Herbs And Salt, And Continue To Cook For Another 15 Minutes Or Until The Potatoes Are Cooked Through.
10. Serve The Meatballs With The Potatoes And Garnish With Fresh Rosemary And A Green Salad.

title: THIS Butter Chicken
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack This Isnt Chicken
2. 2 Tbsp Vegan Yoghurt
3. 1 Tbsp Peeled Ginger Finely Chopped
4. 1 Tbsp Cloves Of Garlic Finely Chopped
5. 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
6. 1 Tsp Oil
7. 1 Tsp Salt
8. 5 Tsp Butter Chicken Spice Blend
9. For The This Isnt Butter Chicken Sauce
10. 2 Tbsp Vegan Butter
11. 1 Medium Onion Chopped
12. 3 Tsp Fresh Garlic Chopped
13. 3 Tsp Fresh Ginger Chopped
14. 5 Tsp Butter Chicken Spice Blend
15. 1 Tin Chopped Tomatoes
16. 4 Tsp Brown Sugar
17. 1  Tsp Salt
18. 50Cups Plant Based Milk
19. 50Cups Water
20. 100Cups Vegan Cream
21. Tsp Garam Masala
22. 1 Tbsp Fresh Coriander Leaves Chopped For Garnishing
preparation:
1. Step One: Marinade This Isn’T Chicken
2. In A Bowl Mix All The Chicken Tikka Marinade Ingredients Together. Add The This Chicken And Stir To Coat Well. Leave Covered In The Fridge For 30 Minutes So The Chicken Soak Up The Marinade.
3. Grab A Skillet And Drizzle Some Oil In The Bottom Of The Pan, Fry The Marinated Chicken Pieces For 5 Minutes Until They Start To Change Colour And Brown.
4. Step Two: Butter Chicken Sauce
5. Melt 1 Tbsp Of The Vegan Butter In A Large Pan On A Medium Heat, Add The Chopped Onions, Ginger And Garlic. Cook For Approximately 8-9 Minutes Until Onions Are Soft And Translucent. Add The Butter Chicken Blend And Stir For A Few Seconds.
6. Add The Tinned Tomatoes, Sugar, Salt, Plant-Based Milk And Water, Then Stir Until Mixed Well Together. Cover And Cook On A Medium Heat For 10 Mins. Remove The Pan From The Heat And Place The Mixture Into A Blender Or Food Processor Until It Forms A Smooth Curry Texture.
7. Add The This Isn’T Chicken Pieces Into The Sauce, Stir And Cook For A Further 3-4 Mins On Medium Heat Until The Chicken Is Heated Through. Add The Cream, Remaining Tbsp Of Butter, And The Garam Masala. Stir And Cook For A Further 2 Mins. Serve With A Sprinkle Of Chopped Coriander.

title: Wicked Serious Carbonara
ingredients:
1. For The Alfredostyle Cream Sauce
2. 1 Cup  200G Raw Cashews Soaked For A Few Hours And Rinsed If Youre Short On Time Boil The Raw Cashews With The Cauliflower In The First Step In The Directions Below
3. 400G Cauliflower Roughly 1 Head Cleaned And Dismembered Into Large Pieces
4. 5 Garlic Cloves Peeled
5. Pinch Of Salt
6. 1 Bay Leaf
7. 3 Cups Water
8. 14 Cup  50G Pine Nuts Toasted Optional
9. 1 Tbsp White Miso Paste Optional
10. 1 Tsp Salt
11. 32 Oz  900Cups Unsweetened Soy Milk Or Your Favourite Nondairy Milk
12. For The Mushrooms
13. 2 Cups  400G Shiitake Mushrooms Sliced
14. 3 Tbsp Olive Oil
15. 34 Tsp Smoked Paprika
16. 1 Tsp Black Pepper
17. For The Carbonara
18. 1 Lb  450G Fresh Fettuccini
19. 3 Tbsp Olive Oil
20. 12 Large Onion Medium Diced
21. 2 Cloves Garlic Sliced Thin
22. 12 Cup  100G Peas Fresh Or Frozen
23. Garnish
24. Small Bunch Of Flatleaf Parsley Leaves Picked Lightly Packed
25. Cracked Black Pepper
26. Coarse Salt
preparation:
1. In A Large Sauce Pot Add Cashews (If You Didn’T Soak Them), Cauliflower, Garlic, A Pinch Of Salt, Bay Leaf And 3 Cups Of Water. Cover And Bring To A Slow Boil Overa Medium-High Heat.
2. Cook For 10-15 Minutes Or Until The Cauliflower Easily Breaks Apart. Strain And Remove Bay Leaf.
3. Transfer Mixture To A High-Speed Blender (Add Cashews At This Point If You Pre-Soaked Them). Add Pine Nuts, Miso And Salt. Begin Blending On Low-Speed While Slowly Adding The Soy Milk. Once Incorporated, Blend On High For Couple Minutes Until The Mixture Is Silky Smooth.
4. Set Aside Half Of The Mixture For This Recipe And Save The Remaining Mixture In A Closed Container In The Fridge For Up To A Week For Other Use.
5. To Make The Mushrooms
6. Preheat Oven To 375.
7. Add Sliced Shiitakes To A Small Bowl And Toss With 1 T Of The Oil, Smoked Paprika And Pinch Of Black Pepper. In A Large Oven-Safe Skillet, Heat 2 Tbsp Oil On The Stovetop Over Medium-High Heat. Add Shiitake Mushrooms And Sauté For 2 Minutes, Then Transfer Pan Directly To Oven And Finish Roasting For 10 Minutes. Remove And Transfer The Mushrooms To A Paper Towel To Allow To Drain And Crisp Up.
8. To Complete The Dish
9. Cook Fettuccine Al Denteaccording To The Package Instruction :, Set Aside.
10. Heat Large Sauce Pot On Medium Heat Until Hot, Then Add Oil, Onions And Sliced Garlic Cloves And Sauté For 3 Minutes Until They Begin To Brown. Add A Splash Of Water (Or White Wine If Handy) To Loosen, Then Half Of The Alfredo-Stylesauce, Peas And Mushrooms.
11. Heat For 1 Minute Then Add Pasta And Stir To Coat.
12. Remove From Heat And Garnish With The Parsley, Black Pepper And Salt, To Taste.
13. Helpful Tip: While Preparing This, We Cooked The Pasta Ahead Of Time, And When It Was Time To Add The Pasta To The Sauce We Boiled A Small Pot Of Water And Poured It Over The Cooled Pasta To Loosen And Bring It Up To Temp Before Adding To The Heating Sauce.

title: Tofu Shallot Satay with Crispy Kale
ingredients:
1. For The Skewers
2. 1 Block Of Firm Tofu I Used Cauldron Which I Freeze Defrost Drain And Press
3. 2 Tbsp Tamari
4. 1 Tbsp Toasted Sesame Oil
5. 12 Shallots Peeled
6. 6 Skewers Soaked In Water For 30 Minutes This Stops Them From Burning In The Oven
7. For The Marinade
8. 1 Tbsp Tamari
9. Juice Of 1 Lime
10. 1 Garlic Clove Finely Grated
11. 1 Red Birdseye Chilli Finely Chopped
12. 2 Tbsp Peanut Butter Either Chunky Or Smooth
13. 1 Spring Onion Finely Chopped
14. For The Crispy Seaweed
15. 65G Kale Stalk Removed And Shredded
16. 1Tsp Tamari
17. 1T Date Syrup
18. 1Tsp Sesame Seeds
preparation:
1. Preheat Your Oven To 200C.
2. Cut The Tofu Into 12 Cubes, Put This Into A Tupaware Box With 2T Tamari And 1T Sesame Oil.
3. Put The Lid On And Move The Box Around So That The Tofu Is Covered.
4. Set To One Side Whilst You Peel The Shallots And Make The Marinade.
5. To Make The Marinade Put The Tamari, Lime Juice, Garlic, Chilli And Peanut Butter In A Glass Or Cup And Mix Well. You Might Need To Smush The Pb With A Fork, As It’S A Fat It Can Resistant To Mixing. But Keep Smushing And It Will Eventually Concede And Play Nice.
6. Add The Shallots And Marinade To The Tofu And Again Put The Lid On And Move About Until All Of The Tofu And Shallots Are Covered In The Sauce.
7. Put 2 Cubes Of Tofu And 2 Shallots On Each Skewer, Place On A Baking Tray, Spoon Any Remaining Sauce On And Put Them Into The Oven.
8. To Make The Crispy ‘Seaweed’ Put The Kale In A Bowl, Add The Tamari And Date Syrup, Massage The Kale Until It Has Softened And It Is Covered With The Sauce.
9. Put The Kale On A Baking Tray, Spreading It Out So It Is One Layer Only.
10. Sprinkle This With The Sesame Seeds And Put The Tray Into The Oven.
11. Bake The Skewers For Around 20 Minutes, The Edges Of The Tofu Will Brown And The Skin Of The Shallots Will Blister.
12. Bake The Kale For Just 5 Minutes, Until It Crisps Up But Before It Becomes Burnt!!
13. Serve With A Scattering Of Spring Onion On The Skewers.

title: Oreo Chocolate Cheesecake
ingredients:
1. 2 Cans Of Fullfat Coconut Milk Chilled Overnight
2. 1 Tub Of Tofutti Plain Vegan Cream Cheese
3. 7Oz 200G
4. 1 Cup Vegan Dark Chocolate
5. 5Oz 150G
6. 15 Cup Oreos
7. 3Tbsp Vegan Margarine
8. 4Tbsp Powdered Sugar
preparation:
1. Start By Crushing 150G Of Oreo Biscuits. The Easiest Way To Do This Is By Blitzing In A Food Processor But If You Don’T Have One Feel Free To Pop Them Into A Sandwich Bag, Cover With A Cloth And Smash Them With A Rolling Pin.
2. Melt The 3Tbsp Of Vegan Margarine And Add This To The Crushed Biscuits.
3. Press The Biscuit Mixture Into Your Pan Until The Bottom Is Evenly Coated And Then Pop This Into The Fridge.
4. Take The Can Of Chilled Coconut Milk From The Fridge, Carefully Open It And Scoop Out The Hard Coconut Fat From The Top. Be Careful Not To Get Any Of The Watery Section As This Will Make It More Difficult For The Cheesecake To Set. Add To This The Tub Of Vegan Cream Cheese And Powdered Sugar. Blitz It All Together Until Smooth (1-2Mins).
5. Melt 150G Of The Chocolate, Add This To The Coconut/Cream Cheese Mixture And Combine.
6. After That You Have A Smooth, Chocolate Mixture, Take Your Oreo Biscuit Base Out Of The Fridge. Dollop The Coconut/Cream Cheese Mixture On Top And Smooth It Off.
7. Here Is Where A Little Patience Is Required; Leave The Cheesecake To Chill For 2 Hours Although It Works Best If You Leave It Overnight (I Know I Couldn’T The First Time So I Totally Wouldn’T Blame You If You Had 2 Hours Ready To Count Down On Your Stopwatch)!
8. Once Chilled, Take The Remaining 50G Of Chocolate, Chop It Finely And Use It To Top The Cheesecake To Add Texture And Even More Chocolatey Goodness To Your Cheesecake.

title: Charred Fig and Rocket Salad with Lemon Tofu Feta
ingredients:
1. 3 Handfuls Of Rocket Leaves
2. Handful Of Fresh Basil Leaves
3. 6 Ripe Figs Quartered
4. 2 Tablespoons Balsamic Vinegar
5. 3 Tablespoons Toasted Pine Nuts
6. For The Lemon Tofu Feta
7. 1 Tablespoon Nutritional Yeast Flakes
8. Juice Of  A Lemon
9. Teaspoon Lemon Zest
10. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
11. 400G Firm Tofu Well Drained Crumbled
12. 1 Clove Of Garlic Peeled And Crushed
13. Large Pinch Of Sea Salt
14. Pinch Of Cracked Black Pepper
15. For The Dressing
16. 1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice
17. 1 Teaspoon Brown Rice Syrup
18. Tablespoon Balsamic Vinegar
19. Pinch Of Sea Salt
20. 1 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil
preparation:
1. To Make The Tofu Feta, Put The Nutritional Yeast Flakes Into A Bowl With The Lemon Juice And Zest And Leave To Dissolve.
2. Heat The Oil In A Small Frying Pan On A Medium Heat And Add The Tofu And Garlic. Pan-Fry Until Slightly Golden, Then Add The Lemon Mix, Salt And Pepper, Bring To The Boil And Cook Until The Lemon Juice Has Evaporated. Spoon Into A Bowl And Allow To Cool. Check That It’S Just A Little Too Salty, Like Feta.
3. To Make The Dressing, Whisk Together The Lemon Juice, Syrup, Vinegar, Salt And Extra Virgin Olive Oil In A Small Bowl.
4. Mix The Rocket And Basil Leaves Together In A Bowl. Drizzle 1 Tablespoon Of The Dressing Over The Leaves And Toss Together. Keep The Rest Of The Dressing For Further Dipping And Drizzling.
5. Warm A Griddle Pan On A High Heat And Brush With A Little Oil. Just As The Oil Begins To Smoke, Place Your Figs Widthways In The Pan. Allow To Cook For 2 Minutes, Basting Them With Balsamic Vinegar As You Go.Turn Them When Well Caramelized, Then Remove The Now Sticky Figs From The Heat.
6. Scatter The Leaves Beautifully On Plates, And Top With The Warm Figs, A Couple Of Spoons Of The Tofu Feta And A Sprinkling Of Toasted Pine Nuts.

title: Pulled Oumph! & Grilled Mango Salsa Lettuce Leaf Tacos
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Pulled Oumph 280 G
2. 1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
3. 8 Large Romaine Lettuce Leaves
4. Vegan Chilli Mayo Or Guacamole To Serve Optional
5. For The Mango Salsa
6. 450 G Mangos Finely Diced
7. Finely Diced Red Onion Rinsed
8. 1 Red Pepper Finely Diced
9. 1 Green Chilli Finely Diced
10. A Handful Of Fresh Coriander
11. 34 Tbsp Fresh Mint
12. 1 Tbsp Oil
13. 2 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar
14. 1 Tsp Brown Sugar
15. Tsp Salt
16. Tsp Black Pepper
preparation:
1. To Prepare The Grilled Mango Salsa; Slice Off Both Halves Of The Mango Around The Stone. Leaving The Skin On, Score Each Mango Piece In A Criss-Cross Pattern And Place It Skin Down Onto The Hot Bbq.
2. In The Meantime, Fry The Pulled Oumph! In The Vegetable Oil In A Non-Stick Frying Pan For 4-5 Minutes Or Until Done.
3. To Assemble The Mango Salsa, Peel And Cut The Grilled Mango Into Small Cubes And Add It To A Large Mixing Bowl Alongside The Finely Diced And Rinsed Red Onion, Red Pepper And Green Chilli. Sprinkle In A Handful Of Finely Chopped Fresh Coriander And Fresh Mint, Then Combine The Oil, Apple Cider Vinegar, Brown Sugar, Salt And Black Pepper In A Small Jug And Drizzle It Over The Salsa. Mix Well To Evenly Coat The Salsa In The Dressing.
4. Assemble Your Tacos By Filling 1-2 Tablespoons Of The Mango Salsa Into A Lettuce Leaf, Top With 1-2 Tablespoons Of Pulled Oumph! And Finish Off With A Drizzle Of Chilli Mayo Or Guacamole To Serve.

title: Deep Fried Tofu Balls with a Lemon Tahini Sauce
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
2. 1 Pack Firm Tofu
3. 1 Large Clove Garlic Crushed
4. 2 Spring Onions And 1 Small Leek Minced
5. 1 Carrot Very Finely Grated
6. Pinch Sea Salt
7. 2 Tbsp Shoyu Or Tamari Natural Soy Sauce
8. 1 Tsp Umeboshi Paste
9. 2 Tsp Freshly Grated Ginger Juice
10. 23 Tbsp Wholewheat Flour
11. Sunflower Oil For Deep Frying Organic And Cold Pressed
12. 2 Tbsp White Miso
13. 2 Tbsp Tahini
14. Tsp Tamari Soy Sauce
15. Tsp Lemon Juice
16. Spring Water
preparation:
1. Tahini Is A Thick, Smooth Paste Made From Ground Sesame Seeds. Serve This Sauce Over Cooked Or Raw Vegetables, Tofu, Tempeh, Or Use As A Dip Or Spread.
2. For The Lemon Tahini Sauce: Add The Light Miso, Tahini, Tamari, Lemon Juice And Water Into A Blender And Blend Until Smooth And Creamy. (Ingredients Marked With *)
3. In A Pan Warm The Olive Oil And Sauté The Garlic Then Add The Spring Onions Or Leek And Carrot. Pop On The Lid And Cook For 5 Minutes Until The Vegetables Are Soft.
4. Pat The Tofu Dry With Paper Towel And Mash With A Fork In A Bowl. Add The Vegetables From The Pan And The Remaining Ingredients And Form Into Balls, Wetting Your Hands Now And Again To Stop The Mixture From Sticking.
5. In A Heavy Bottomed Pan Heat The Sunflower Oil, Bring To Correct Temperature And Deep Fry The Tofu Balls.
6. Drain On Paper Towel And Serve With The Sauce Drizzled Over The Top.
7. Variation – You Can Add Chopped Basil, Parsley, Or Chives To The Mixture. Use Barley, Chickpeas Or Rice Miso Instead Of A Light Miso For A Different Taste.

title: Sweet Potato Bean Burgers with Maple Dijon Sauce
ingredients:
1. Burgers
2. Tb Ground Flaxseed
3. 1  Tb Water
4. 1 13 Cup Cooked Sweet Potato
5. 1 Cup Canned Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
6. 2 Tb Dry Quick Oats
7. 2 T  13 C Divided Bread Crumbs  Regular Panko Whole Wheat Or Glutenfree All Work
8. 12 T Finely Chopped White Or Yellow Onion
9. 34 Tsp Of Each Cinnamon Chili Powder Garlic Powder And Salt
10. Maple Dijon Sauce
11. 13 C Maple Syrup
12. 13 C Dijon Mustard
preparation:
1. This Sweet Take On Veggie Burgers Is Sure To Impress Your Family And Friends. Makes 4 Burgers Or 8 Mini Patties!
2. First, Roast Two Large Or Three Medium Sized Sweet Potatoes (Poked Several Times With A Fork) In A 375 Degree Oven For About 45 – 60 Minutes. They’Ll Be Very Soft And Fork Tender When They’Re Done. You May Not Need To Use All Of The Cooked Sweet Potato.
3. Next, Combine The Water And Ground Flaxseed In A Small Bowl And Then Set It Aside For Now.
4. In A Medium-Sized Bowl, Place Your Garbanzo Beans And Mash Them Up With A Potato Masher Or Large Fork, Leaving Some Beans Partially Intact.
5. To The Same Bowl, Add Your Cooked Sweet Potato, Dry Oats, 2 Tablespoons Of Breadcrumbs, Onion, Spices And Salt. Finally, Add The Flaxseed/Water Mixture And Then Stir It All Together.
6. Form This Mixture Into Four Equal-Sized Patties. Then, Coat Each Side With Breadcrumbs And Put Them In A Lightly Oiled Pan Over Medium-High Heat.
7. While Those Patties Are Cooking, Prep Your Maple Dijon Sauce By Combining The Maple Syrup And Mustard In A Small Bowl.
8. After Approximately 5 – 7 Minutes, Flip The Burgers.
9. While You’Re Waiting For The Second Side To Cook, Prep Your Other Toppings. I Like To Use Lettuce, Tomato And Sometimes A Bit Of Sliced Avocado!
10. Once Those Burgers Form A Nice Crispy Brown Surface On Each Side, Remove Them From The Pan And Sprinkle Them With A Small Pinch Of Salt And Pepper.
11. If You’Re Like Me And Love A Toasted Bun, Now Would Be The Time To Place Those Buns In The Hot Pan To Lightly Toast On Each Side.
12. The Last Step? Place Those Burgers On Your Buns, Drizzle With Plenty Of Maple Dijon Sauce, Load Up Your Toppings, And Enjoy!
13. This Recipe Can Also Be Used To Make A Killer Appetizer Or Side Dish! Just Form The Mixture Into Small Cakes Instead Of Patties.

title: Kale, Broccoli & Tofu Stir-Fry with Ginger Miso Dressing
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Toasted Sesame Oil
2. 2 Cloves Garlic Peeled And Crushed
3. 1 Onion Finely Sliced Halfmoons
4. 10 Fresh Shitake Mushrooms Finely Sliced Or Dried Shitake Mushrooms
5. Block Of Tofu Cut Into Small Dice
6. 1 Head Of Broccoli Cut Into Medium Sized Pieces
7. 1 Head Curly Kale Stem Removed And Thinly Sliced
8. 3 Tbsp Tamari Or Shoyu Organic Soya Sauce
9. 1 Tbsp White Miso Paste Dissolved In Two Tbsp Water
10. 1 Tbsp Freshly Squeezed Ginger Juice
11. 1 Tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
12. 2 Tbsp Toasted Sesame Seeds
preparation:
1. To Get The Best Taste From Tofu I Dry-Fry It And Then Marinate It For A Few Hours, Or Overnight In The Fridge.
2. To Dry-Fry Simply Press Excess Water Out With Paper-Towel, Slice The Tofu And Place In A Dry-Frying Pan At A Low Heat And Press With A Spatula. You Will Hear A Hissing Sound As The Excess Water Is Removed. Turnover And Do The Other Side. To Marinade I Use 1 Tbsp Of Each – Freshly Squeezed Ginger Juice, Shoyu And Mirin – You Can Add ¼ Tsp Turmeric, Sweet Paprika, Garlic Powder Or Whatever Taste Excites You.
3. Press The Tofu In Paper Towels To Absorb Any Excess Water.
4. Whisk The Soya Sauce, Miso Paste, Ginger Juice And Vinegar In A Cup And Set Aside.
5. Heat The Toasted Sesame Oil In A Wok Over Medium Heat And Add The Garlic, Onion And The Mushrooms Stir Well And Cook For 5 Minutes.
6. Add The Diced Tofu And Cook On A High Heat For 5 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
7. Add The Kale Stir And Cover For 5 Minutes Or Until It Turns Bright Green Adding A Little Water If Necessary.
8. Add The Broccoli Cover For 3 Or 4 Minutes, If The Pan Seems Dry Add A Splash More Water.
9. Remove From The Heat. Stir In The Dressing.
10. Serve In Bowls And Sprinkle With Toasted Sesame Seeds.

title: Miso Soup
ingredients:
1. 5 Inch Piece Of Kombu Seaweed 13Cm
2. 2 Dried Shitake Or Maitake Mushrooms
3. 6 Inch Piece Of Wakame Seaweed 15Cm
4. 1 Onion Finely Diced
5. 1 Carrot Finely Diced
6. 1 Celery Stick Finely Diced
7. Spring Or Filtered Water
8. 1 Tsp Miso Per Cup Of Soup
9. Fresh Grated Ginger Juice 1Tbsp Added At The End Of Cooking
10. Spring Onions Finely Diced For Garnish
preparation:
1. Soak The Kombu And Dried Mushrooms In 6 Cups Of Filtered Water For 30 Minutes.
2. Remove The Mushrooms, Dice Them (Discarding The Stem As It Can Be Bitter Tasting) And Place Back In The Pot.
3. Bring The Stock To A Boil Then Lower Heat And Simmer For 10 Minutes (This Stock Is Called Dashi In Japan And Is The Base For Many Noodle Dishes, Stews, Sauces As Well As Soups.)
4. Soak The Wakame For 10 Minutes And Then Cut Into Small Pieces With Kitchen Scissors.
5. Add The Wakame And The Soaking Water To The Pot, Along With The Vegetables And Simmer For 20 Minutes.
6. Whisk Miso With A Little Of The Broth And Then Add To The Soup And Switch Off The Heat.
7. Do Not Allow The Miso To Boil Or It Will Destroy The Enzymes.
8. Serve Hot With Finely Chopped Spring Onions To Garnish. You Can Add Cubed Tofu Or Soba Noodles To Make The Soup More Of A Meal.
9. Variations: You May Add Some Diced Garlic Or Ginger Juice (Squeezed From Grated Ginger) To Your Miso Soup For A Different Taste. Add Any Leftover Cooked Grains Such As Millet, Short Grain Brown Rice Or Quinoa To Your Soup And Make It More Of A Lunch Or Meal. You Can Place A Small Piece Of Lemon In The Bottom Of Each Bowl And Then Pour In The Soup. This Aids In Liver Cleansing And Adds Vitamin C.

title: Salt baked carrots, smoked almond, coconut yoghurt & verbena
ingredients:
1. 1 Bunch Of Carrots With Leaves Either Multi Coloured Or Traditionally Orange
2. 200G Salt
3. 300G Plain Flour Gluten Free Is Fine
4. 2 Tbsp Finely Chopped Rosemary
5. 2 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
6. 150 Cups Warm Water
7. A Small Tub Of Coconut Yoghurt
8. 30G Smoked Almonds
9. 1 Tablespoon Vegetable Extra Virgin Olive Oil
10. 1 Jar Belazu Verbena Harissa Paste
11. Washed Leaves From The Carrots
12. Edible Herbs Or Flowers Like Basil Nasturtium Tarragon Or Borage
preparation:
1. Trim The Leafy Tops From The Carrots And Then Make The Crust. Mix The Salt And Flour Together In A Bowl, Add The Rosemary And Oil And Stir In The Water. Knead By Hand Or In A Standing Mixer For A Couple Of Minutes To Obtain Smooth Dough. Let It Rest For 15 Minutes. Preheat The Oven To 160C
2. Roll Out The Dough On A Lightly Floured Surface To A Thickness Of About 1Cm. Cut Rectangles Large Enough To Wrap The Dough Individually Around Each Vegetable And Press The Edges Together To Seal.
3. Put The Dough-Wrapped Carrots On An Oven Tray Lined With Baking Paper And Bake For 45 Minutes Until The Dough Is Hard And The Veg Inside Are Tender (Test With A Skewer).
4. Once The Carrots Are Cooked, Slice Open The Salt Crust And Leave Until Cool Enough To Handle. Discard The Crust And Use A Cloth To Rub The Skin From The Carrots.
5. For The Bases, Take One Cooked Carrot And Slice It Lengthways Into 4 Strips About 1/2Cm Thick, Saving Any Offcuts. Lay Each Strip Slightly Off Centre Of 4 Serving Plates.
6. Take The Offcuts And The Just One Of The Carrots And Blend To A Smooth Pesto In A Food Processor With A Big Teaspoon Of Coconut Yoghurt, The Smoked Almonds And The Olive Oil. Add A Spoonful Of Water If The Mixture Is Too Thick. Place In A Piping Bag. Pipe A Line Of Carrot Pesto Along Each Carrot Strip On The Plates.
7. Slice The Remaining Carrots Into Accurate Discs 1 Cm Thick Plus A Few Thinner Ones. Stand The Discs In Descending Size Order Along The Strips In The Shape Of A Carrot.
8. Spoon A Little Yoghurt And Harissa Alongside For Dipping And Finish The Plate With The Herbs Or Flowers That You Have Found Or Foraged.

title: Lentil Lasagne
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Red Onion
2. 2 Large Cloves Of Garlic
3. 200G 7Oz Mushrooms
4. Splash Of Olive Oil
5. 200G 7Oz Puy Lentils Or Brown Lentils
6. 450Cups 15Fl Oz Spring Water
7. 1 Heaped Teaspoon Allspice
8. 1 Heaped Teaspoon Cinnamon
9. Pinch Ground Cardamom
10. 500Cups 17Fl Oz Passata Or Tinned Tomatoes
11. 1 Heaped Teaspoon Coconut Sugar
12. 1 Teaspoon Sea Salt
13. 1 Large Handful Fresh Parsley
14. 150G 5Oz Rice Pasta
15. 1 Small Apple
16. For The Cashew Cheeze Sauce
17. 100G 3 Oz Cashews
18. 1 Large Lemon
19. Pinch Black Pepper
20. Teaspoon Sea Salt
21. 1 Heaped Teaspoon Dried Parsley
22. Extra Water To Thin If Needed
preparation:
1. You Will Need:
2. An Oven Proof Dish Approx 21 X 15Cm (6Cm Deep) Or 8½ X 6 Inches (2½In Deep).
3. The Cashew Sauce Is Made By First Soaking The Cashews For Up To An Hour To Make Them Soft Enough To Blend.
4. Place The Cashews Into A Mug Or Jug Along With The Juiced Lemon, Salt, Pepper And Parsley.
5. Allow The Cashews To Soak In The Lemon Juice For Up To An Hour And Then Blend With A Blender To Create A Thick Creamy Sauce. If The Sauce Is Too Thick Then Add A Dash Of Water To Achieve Your Desired Sauce-Like Consistency.
6. Roughly Chop Red Onion And Mushrooms.
7. Crush Or Finely Chop Garlic And Saute In A Medium Sized Pan With Onion And Mushrooms (With A Splash Of Olive Oil) For A Couple Of Minutes To Bring Out Their Flavour.
8. Add The Lentils And Water To The Pan And Bring To The Boil.
9. In The Meantime Add Allspice, Cinnamon, Cardamon, Sea Salt, Coconut Sugar And Passata To The Pan, Stirring To Mix Everything Together.
10. Once The Pan Has Come To The Boil Turn Down To A Low/Medium Heat, Placing The Lid On. Stir Regularly Over A Period Of About 45 Minutes Or Until All Water Has Absorbed And The Mixture Resembles A Thick Sauce. If You Are Busy And Want To Come Back To This Later, Then Simply Cook For About 30 Minutes, Turn Off And Leave It To Finish Cooking With The Lid On, In Its Own Heat.
11. Whilst The Lentil Part Is Cooking In The Pan, Cook The Pasta, Drain It And Put To The Side.
12. Slice Apple Into Thin Slices And Roughly Chop Parsley. When The Lentil Part Has Cooked, Add The Parsley To The Pan And Mix In.
13. Spoon About Half Of This Lentil Mixture Into An Oven Proof Dish And Add A Layer Of Your Cooked Rice Pasta (This Should Be About ½ Of Your Pasta). Make Up Another Layer On Top Of The Pasta With Your Apple Slices.
14. Spoon The Rest Of Your Lentil Mixture On Top Of Your Apple Layer And Then Add Another Layer With The Rest Of The Pasta.
15. Spoon/Pour On Your Cashew Sauce On Top Of The Final Layer Of Pasta. If The Cashew Sauce Seems Too Thick, Then Add A Little Water To Loosen It Up.
16. Your Layers Might Resemble Something Like This:
17. (Base) Lentil – Pasta – Apple – Lentil – Pasta – Cashew Sauce (Topping)
18. But Remember There Is No Right Or Wrong. If Your Creativity Is Inspired, Then Let It Flow!
19. Place Your Whole Dish In The Oven At Gas Mark 6 (200˚C/400˚F) For Approximately 40 Minutes And Then Serve Hot With Veggies Or Salad.

title: Jackfruit Fish Fingers
ingredients:
1. 1 Jar Clearspring Organic Young Jackfruit Chunks Or Similar Drained And Rinsed
2. 2 Sheets Japanese Sushi Nori
3. 1 Jar Or Can Of Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
4. 1 Leek Finely Sliced
5. 1 Tsp Sunflower Oil
6. Tsp Sea Salt
7. 50G Breadcrumbs
preparation:
1. Toast The Nori Is A Dry Frying Pan On A High Heat Until It Starts To Blacken And Crumple. Put The Nori Into The Chopper Attachment Of A Hand Blender Or A Food Processor. Grind Until It Is Small Flakes, Put Into A Large Bowl.
2. Add The Jackfruit To The Blender Or Food Processor And Mix Until It Is Flakes But Not So Much That It Becomes Mush, Put This Into The Large Bowl.
3. Heat A Little Oil, Fry The Leeks On A Low Heat Until Soft. Add The Leeks, Chickpeas, Salt, Blend Untill Smooth, Add To The Large Bowl And Mix Everything Well. Roll Out Between 2 Sheets Of Greaseproof Paper, Cut Into 10 Slices
4. Pour The Breadcrumbs Onto A Plate, Take One Slice Of The Mixture, Squeeze Between Your Hands (This Will Hold Them Together More When Cooking), Roll In The Breadcrumbs. Do This With All Of The Mixture
5. Pour A Thin Layer Of Oil Into A Frying Pan, Heat Till Very Hot, Fry The ‘Fish’Fingers On Each Side Till Browned And Crispy
6. Drain On Kitchen Roll To Get Rid Of Any Excess Oil.
7. Serve With Avocado, Tomato Salad Or An Aioli Dip.

title: Ultimate Vegan BOSH! Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
1. 300G Macaroni
2. 750Cups Unsweetened Plantbased Milk
3. 50G Cashew Nuts
4. 40Cups Olive Oil
5. 1 Garlic Clove
6. 40G Flour
7. 100G Dairyfree Cheese
8. 3 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
9. 2 Tsp Dijon Mustard
10. 50G Fresh Breadcrumbs
11. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
12. Salt And Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat Grill To High. Large Saucepan Of Salted Water On A High Heat. Medium Saucepan On A Medium-High Heat. Power Blender. Large Ovenproof Frying Pan. Microplane Or Fine Grater. Whisk.
2. Cook The Mac: Bring The Pan Of Salted Water To The Boil. Add The Macaroni And Cook For 1 Minute Less Than Stated On The Packet Instruction :. Drain
3. Meanwhile, Make The Nut Milk Mixture: Put The Almond Milk And Cashews Into The Medium Saucepan And Bring To The Boil. Allow To Cool. Transfer The Mixture To The Power Blender And Blitz Until Smooth
4. Make The Sauce: Put The Frying Pan Over A Medium Heat And Add The Olive Oil. Peel The Garlic And Grate It Straight Into The Pan. Cook For A Couple Of Minutes Until Just Starting To Brown. Add The Flour To The Pan And Whisk Until It Combines With The Garlicky Oil To Make A Paste. Cook For 1 Minute. Reduce The Heat To Low. Slowly Pour In A Little Of The Nut Milk Mixture And Whisk Until Completely Combined. Keep Adding More, Little By Little, Whisking Until All The Nut Milk Is Incorporated. Cook For 2 Minutes. Grate The Dairy-Free Cheese. Add The Nutritional Yeast, Mustard And Cheese To The Pan. Stir To Mix, Adding A Splash More Almond Milk If The Mixture Is Too Thick. Taste And Season Generously With Salt And Pepper. Drain The Cooked Macaroni. Take The Pan Of Sauce Off The Heat And Tip In The Drained Pasta. Stir To Coat The Pasta In The Sauce.
5. Make The Topping: Put The Breadcrumbs, Olive Oil And A Big Pinch Of Salt And Pepper Into A Bowl And Stir To Mix. Scatter The Crumbs Over The Pasta
6. Finish: Place The Pan Under The Grill And Cook For 2-3 Minutes, Keeping A Close Eye On It, Until The Topping Is Crispy. Serve.

title: Spaghetti Bolognese
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Onion
2. 1 Large Carrot
3. 23 Cloves Of Garlic
4. 2 Teaspoons Of Dried Rosemary
5. 2 Teaspoons Of Dried Thyme
6. Pinch Of Basil Fresh Frozen Or Dried Will Do
7. Dash Of Olive Oil
8. 500G Of Vegan Mince You Can Use A 400G Tin Of Lentils Instead Of The Mince If You Prefer
9. Tin Of Chopped Tomatoes
10. Water
11. Glass Of Red Wine Optional
12. Spaghetti 75G100G Per Person
13. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Dice The Onion And Carrot
2. Mince The Garlic
3. Measure Out The Pasta And Set To One Side
4. Prepare A Large Pan Of Water With A Dash Of Olive Oil And Salt Ready For The Pasta
5. Prepare A Separate Pan For The Bolognese With A Dash Of Oil And Place On A Medium Heat
6. Sweat Off The Chopped Onion And Carrot In The Oil Until They Begin To Soften
7. Add The Garlic And Stir Well
8. Add The Herbs
9. Add The Mince, Mix Well Ensuring The Mince Is Completely Coated With The Herbs And Evenly Mixed With The Other Ingredients
10. Once The Mince Is Warm, Add The Wine, Bring To The Boil Then Simmer
11. Add The Tin Of Tomatoes And Stir Well
12. Fill The Tomato Tin With Water And Add To The Mixture Before Bringing To The Boil
13. Leave To Simmer On A Low Heat For 20 Minutes, Stirring Regularly To Ensure It Does Not Stick To The Pan
14. Taste To Check The Carrot Is Cooked Through, If Not Keep On The Low Heat For Another 10 Minutes
15. If Needs Be, Add More Water To Ensure The Mixture Doesn’T Dry Out
16. Add Salt And Pepper To Your Taste
17. Once The Bolognese Is Almost Cooked, Bring The Pasta Water Pan To The Boil, And Add The Spaghetti
18. Cook The Spaghetti For 11-12 Minutes, Until Al Dente
19. Once The Spaghetti Is Cooked, Drain And Add To The Bolognese And Mix Well
20. Serve With A Sprinkling Of Basil If You Like
21. Like This Recipe And Want To Try More? Sign Up With Veganuary Today For Recipes Delivered Straight To Your Inbox.

title: Quinoa Breakfast Bowl Porridge
ingredients:
1. 50G  Cup Or 1 Oz Approx Quinoa
2. 200Cups  Cup Or 7Fl Oz Approx Coconut Milk
3. 50Cups About A  Cup Or 1 Fl Oz Water
4. 5 Pitted Dates
5. Sprinkle Of Cinnamon Optional
6. Fresh Berries Optional
preparation:
1. Rinse Quinoa Thoroughly A Using An Extra Fine Sieve. This Removes Any Of The Natural Soapy, Saponins That Sometimes Coat Quinoa.
2. Chop Dates Into Small Pieces And Then Add All Ingredients To A Pan (Leaving Out The Cinnamon Or Berries, Which Will Be Added Once Served).
3. Bring Pan To The Boil And Simmer On A Low Heat For 25 Minutes (Or Until The Quinoa Has Absorbed All Of The Liquid). Stir Once In A While With A Wooden Spoon. The Dates Should Slowly Fall Apart Melting Into The Pan To Create A Delicious Sweetness. If The Dates Are Particularly Tough, Then Encourage The Breaking Down Process By Pressing Them Down With Your Spoon.
4. Once Cooked Enjoy Your Quinoa Bowl Served Hot Or Cold, Adding A Sprinkle Of Cinnamon And/Or A Small Handful Of Fresh Berries.

title: Gyoza Dumplings (Pot Stickers) with Black Vinegar Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
1. For The Dipping Sauce
2. 4 Tbsp Soy Sauce
3. 2 Tbsp Mirin
4. 2 Tsp Toasted Sesame Oil
5. 3 Tbsp Rice Vinegar
6. 1 Shallot Green Onion Finely Chopped
7. Bunch Of Fresh Chives Finely Chopped
8. 1 Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Chopped
9. For The Dumplings
10. 4 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
11. 1 Onion Chopped
12. 1 Garlic Clove Crushed
13. 15Goz Fresh Root Ginger Peeled And Finely Chopped
14. 1 Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Chopped
15. 2 Carrots Grated
16. 1 Bunch Of Spring Onions Scallions Finely Chopped
17. 3 Wood Ear Mushrooms Or Any Mushroom Of Your Choice Finely Sliced
18. 350G12Oz Fresh Firm Tofu
19. 1 Tbsp Soy Sauce
20. 1 Tbsp Toasted Sesame Oil
21. 400G12Oz Pack Dumpling Skins
preparation:
1. To Make The Sauce, Combine All The Ingredients In A Bowl And Set Aside.
2. For The Dumpling Filling, Heat 1 Tbsp Of The Vegetable Oil In A Pan, Then Add The Onion, Garlic, Ginger And Chilli And Sauté For About 4 Minutes Until Cooked Through. Add The Carrot, Spring Onions And Mushrooms, Then Crumble The Tofu Into The Pan. Cook The Mixture For 10–15 Minutes Until It’S Quite Dry, Then Season With The Soy Sauce And Toasted Sesame Oil. Leave Until Cool Enough To Handle.
3. Take A Dumpling Skin In One Hand, Then Dip The Index Finger Of Your Other Hand In A Little Water And Use It To Wet The Top Half Of The Skin. Put About ½ Tbsp Of The Filling Mixture Into The Middle Of The Skin, Then Fold The Skin Over To Form A Half-Moon Shape, Crimping And Sticking The Edges Together As You Go. Repeat With The Remaining Skins And Filling.
4. In A Large Frying Pan With A Lid, Heat The Remaining Vegetable Oil Over A High Heat. Add The Dumplings To The Pan And Fry, Uncovered, For About 4 Minutes Until The Bottoms Are Golden And Crisp.
5. Add A Ladleful Of Water And Quickly Put The Lid On The Frying Pan To Steam The Dumplings For 2 Minutes. Remove The Lid And Continue To Fry, Uncovered, Until Any Leftover Water Has Evaporated – Be Careful As The Hot Liquid Can Splash. Keep An Eye On The Bottom Of The Dumplings At This Stage As You Don’T Want Them To Burn. Gently Lift The Dumplings With A Spatula And Transfer Them To A Serving Plate And Serve Immediately With The Dipping Sauce.

title: Black Bean Sliders with Homemade Bitty Buns
ingredients:
1. For Sliders
2. 1 Can Of Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
3. 1 Cup Cooked Brown Rice
4. 1 Cup Frozen Corn Kernels
5. 1 Green Bell Pepper Diced
6. 1 Jalapeno Pepper Finely Diced
7. 1 Tablespoon Grapeseed Or Olive Oil
8. 3 Tablespoons Mild Or Medium Salsa
9. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
10. 1 Teaspoon Onion Powder
11. 12 Teaspoon Salt
12. 12 Teaspoon Chipotle Chili Powder
13. 12 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
14. 13 Cup Brown Rice Flour
15. For Bitty Buns
16. 1 12 Cups Water Warmed To Between 110120 Degrees F
17. 2 Teaspoons Agave Nectar
18. 4 Teaspoons Active Dry Yeast
19. 3 12 Cups Whole Wheat Flour
20. 1 Teaspoon Salt
21. 2 Teaspoons Vital Wheat Gluten
preparation:
1. Homemade Veggie Burgers Can Be A Challenge To Some! Vegetable Patties Can Be Cooked By Baking, Frying, Or Grilling. For This Recipe, I Formed The Patties The Night Before And Then Froze Them In Order To Make Them Grillable. This Actually Worked Really Well. Note, However, That I Grilled Them In A Grill Pan, Not On An Outdoor Grill. Your Results May Vary.
2. To Make The Patties, Combine One Half Of The Beans And One Half Of The Rice In A Food Processor. Add The Oil And Salsa And Process Until Mostly Smooth. Combine With The Remaining Ingredients In A Large Bowl And Mix Well. Form Into 8 Patties With Your Hands. I Roughly Measured Them As 1/3 Cup Of Patty Mix Each. Wrap In Waxed Paper Or Parchment Paper And Let Freeze In A Container Or On A Flat Surface In A Plastic Bag.
3. To Make The Bitty Burger Buns, Combine The Warm Water, Agave, And Yeast And Whisk Until Combined, Just A Few Seconds. Let Stand 10 Minutes Until Proofed. Combine With The Remaining Ingredients And Mix Until Dough Forms. Knead Until Smooth. Add More Flour If Too Sticky. I Added An Additional Two Tablespoons. I Also Used My Standing Mixer For This, Using The Dough Hook Of Course. I Let The Machine Knead The Dough For 3-4 Minutes. If Kneading By Hand You May Be Looking At 5-7 Minutes Instead. Roll To A 1/2 Inch Thickness, Then Cut With A Biscuit Cutter Into 12-16 Rounds.
4. Sprinkle Cornmeal On A Couple Of Cookie Sheets. Place The Buns On The Cookie Sheets. Cover With A Towel And Let Rise In A Warm Place For One Hour. Bake At 375 Degrees For 10-12 Minutes, Until Browned On Top.
5. When Ready For The Burgers, Lightly Oil A Non-Stick Grill Pan. Preheat Over Medium High Heat. Cook Each Patty For 5-7 Minutes, Pushing Down With A Spatula Occasionally For Nice Grill Marks. Gently Flip And Cook For The Same Amount Of Time On The Other Side.
6. You Don’T Have To Make All Of The Patties At Once. Just Keep Them In The Refrigerator Until You’Re Ready For Another!
7. Garnish With Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Avocado, Pickles, You Name It.
8. Makes 8 Patties, 12-16 Buns.

title: Avocado, Watercress and Dill Summer Rolls with Orange and Soy Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack 20 Inch Rice Wrappers
2. 1 Cucumber
3. 1 Large Avocado
4. 8 French Radishes
5. 75G Watercress
6. 1 Bunch Dill Washed
7. Salt And Pepper To Season
8. Dipping Sauce
9. 1 Large Orange Juiced
10. 25Cups Soy Sauce
preparation:
1. To Make The Dipping Sauce Place The Orange Juice In A Pan On A Low Heat For 7-8 Minutes So It Reduces By Around Two Thirds. Take Of The Heat And Mix With The Soy Sauce. Place In A Small Bowl And Set Aside To Cool.
2. Take The Cucumber And Slice Into Thin Strips Using A Julienne Peeler Or Sharp Knife. Only Cut The Outer Flesh Of The Cucumber Discarding The More Watery Core.
3. Halve And Peel The Avocado, Remove The Stone And Slice Lengthways In Half Inch Slices. Slice The Radishes Lengthways.
4. Fill A Bowl With Slightly Warm Water. The Diameter Of The Bowl Needs To Be Wider Than The Rice Paper So That The Rice Paper Can Be Fully Immersed In The Water.
5. Dunk One Rice Paper In The Bowl Of Water For 5 Seconds. Give It A Shake To Get Rid Of Excess Water And Lay On A Clean Chopping Board.
6. Near One Of The Edges Of The Paper Place A Handful Or Two Of The Watercress Tearing Any Larger Clumps Into Smaller Sections As The Rolls Are Meant To Be Eaten By Hand.
7. Next, Place Two Or Three Slices Of The Avocado On Top Of The Watercress. Then, Take A Few Sprigs Of Dill And, Using A Pair Of Scissors, Chop Finely Over The Avocado And Watercress And Season With Salt And Pepper.
8. Fold The Near Edge The Wrapper Over The Contents, Then Fold Both Sides Into The Middle And Roll Up.
9. Serve With The Dipping Sauce.

title: Chana Masala
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Red Onion  Diced
2. 3 Cloves Of Garlic  Crushed
3. 23 Green Chillies  Diced
4. 1 Teaspoon Of Crushed Ginger
5. 400G Can Of Chopped Tomatoes
6. 400G Cooked Chickpeas
7. 1 Teaspoon Of Coriander Powder
8. 1 Teaspoon Of Garam Masala
9. 1 Teaspoon Of Turmeric
10. 1412 Teaspoon Of Tamarind Powder Or 12 Teaspoons Of Lemon Juice
11. 1 Bayleaf
12. Salt  Pepper To Taste
13. Handful Of Chopped Coriander  A Wedge Of Lemon To Garnish Optional
14. 1 Tablespoon Of Cooking Oil
preparation:
1. Heat The Oil In A Pan And Add The Onion
2. As Soon As The Onions Begin To Soften, Add The Chillies And Mix Well
3. Add The Garlic And Ginger
4. As Soon As The Garlic And Ginger Start To Cook, Add The Powdered Spices (And Lemon Juice If Using) & Mix Well
5. Add The Chickpeas And Stir Into The Spices
6. Add The Chopped Tomatoes, Fill The Can With Water And Add To The Pan
7. Bring To The Boil Then Turn Down To Simmer
8. Keep Stirring Occasionally Until Cooked
9. Season As Required
10. Serve With Rice
11. Follow This Link For More Mouth-Watering Vegan Curry Recipes!
12. And If You Like Our Recipes And Want To Try More, Sign Up To Try Veganuary Today For Recipes Delivered Straight To Your Inbox.

title: Mexican Plate, with Chilli, Guacamole, Refried Beans and Black Rice
ingredients:
1. Black Rice
2. 1 X Can Of Refried Beans
3. Guacamole
4. 2 Ripe Avocados
5. Red Onion About Half A Small One
6. Stalk Of Spring Onion
7. 1 X Red Chilli
8. 68 Cherry Tomatoes
9. Juice Of About Half A Lemon
10. Salt And Cracked Pepper
11. Chilli Non Carne Recipe Link In Instructions
preparation:
1. What’S On The Plate?
2. Black Rice – I’Ve Been Obsessed With This Ever Since I Was Introduced To It By Jane, And I Love The Fact That It Has Bite And Is Really Easy To Cook. 1 Part Rice To 2 Parts Water, Bring To Boil, Turn Down And Simmer For 40 Minutes. Works Perfectly Every Time. I Buy The Biona Black Rice, But You Should Be Able To Find It In Most Supermarkets.
3. Refried Beans – I’Ve Been A Refried Bean Fan Ever Since I Was A Kid. Great In Nachos As Well, But Lovely Here Because Of Their Creamy Flavour. You Buy It In Cans, And You’Ll Find Them In The Mexican Section.
4. Guacamole – I Always Make My Own, As It Is So Much Tastier, Really Easy And Doesn’T Have Any Sour Cream Sneaked In (Many Store-Made Guacs Do, So Always Check The Label Before You Buy). My ‘Go-To’ Recipe Is This:
5. Mash Up 2 Ripe Avocados With A Fork
6. Finely Dice Some Red Onion (About Half A Small One) And A Stalk Of Spring Onion – Add To Bowl
7. Finely Dice One Red Chilli (Up To You If You Keep The Seeds Or Not!) – Add To Bowl
8. Chop Up About 6-8 Cherry Tomatoes Into Little Pieces (In Half And Then In Half Again At Least) – Add To Bowl
9. Squeeze In The Juice Of About Half A Lemon – Do This To Taste. You Can Always Add More Lemon, So Start Off With A Little First
10. Salt And Cracked Pepper
11. If You Don’T Have Any Fresh Chilli Then You Can Use A Hot Sauce, Like Tabasco, Instead. And If You’Re Not Keen On Heat, Then Just Leave The Chilli Out Altogether.
12. Chilli Non Carne – Full Recipe Here

title: High-Protein Vegan Lasagne
ingredients:
1. Meatless Farm Co Mince 400G
2. 1 Red  Yellow Pepper
3. 100G Mushrooms
4. 1 Can Tinned Tomatoes
5. 1 Tbsp Tomato Paste
6. Few Handfuls Of Kale  Spinach
7. Splash Of Tamari  Liquid Aminos
8. Garlic Powder Mixed Herbs Paprika Cumin Black Pepper
9. 6 Lasagne Sheets
10. For The Cheese Sauce
11. Soaked Cashews Soak In Boiling Water For Around 2030 Minutes
12. Head Of Boiled Cauliflower
13. 150Cups Of Almond Milk
14. 34 Tbsp Of Nutritional Yeast
15. Tsp Of Mustard
16. 1 Tbsp Of White Miso
17. Tbsp Of Tamari  Liquid Aminos
18. Juice Of A Lemon And Splash Of Apple Cider Vinegar
19. Garlic Powder Paprika Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Saute The Vegetables And Add The Seasoning After A Few Minutes.
2. Pour In The Tinned Tomatoes, Tomato Paste And Simmer For A Few Minutes.
3. Add In The Meatless Mince And Simmer For A Further 10 Minutes.
4. Blend All The Cheese Ingredients To Make The White Sauce.
5. Once All Cooked, Layer Half Of The Mince Mixture Onto An Oven Proof Dish And Then Layer ½ Of The Cheese Sauce Before Adding 3 Lasagne Sheets On Top.
6. Repeat The Layer And Top With The Remaining White Sauce.
7. Cover Loosely With Foil And Bake For Around 20 Minutes At 180 Degrees.
8. Serve With Some Green Beans Or Whatever Vegetables You Like!
9. Created By @Feedmeglow (Www.Instagram.Com/Feedmeglow)
10. Makes 3-4 Portions

title: Cosy Cacciatore
ingredients:
1. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
2. Seasoning
3. 4 Meatless Farm Chicken Breasts Cut Into Large Chunks
4. 2 Large Shallots Finely Chopped
5. 1 Carrot Peeled And Finely Chopped
6. 1 Celery Stick Finely Sliced
7. 2 Sprigs Rosemary
8. 2 Bay Leaves
9. 4 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
10. 1 Red Pepper Sliced
11. 150G Pitted Mixed Olives
12. 1 Vegan Chickenveg Stock Cube
13. 50Cups Balsamic Vinegar
14. 100Cups Boiling Water
15. 400G Tinned Chopped Tomatoes
16. To Serve Optional
17. Large Handful Parsley Roughly Chopped
18. Finely Chopped Sundried Tomatoes
19. Crusty Vegan Bread
preparation:
1. Heat Your Olive Oil In A Large, Non-Stick Casserole Pan Over A Medium Heat. Whilst Heating, Season Each Of Your Meatless Farm Chicken Breasts All Over With A Pinch Of Salt And Pepper.
2. Once The Oil Is Hot, Add Your Seasoned Meatless Farm Chicken Breasts And Cook For 3 Mins On Each Side Until Golden (Ensure That You Move About To Stop Any Sticking To The Pan).
3. Remove Your ”Chicken” From The Pan And Set To One Side. Using The Same Pan, Now Add Your Shallots, Carrot, Celery, Rosemary And Bay Leaves And Cook For A Five Mins, Continuously Stirring Until Softened. Add Your Garlic And Cook For A Further Min Until Fragrant.
4. Add The Peppers, Olives, Crumbled Stock Cube, Balsamic And Water And Simmer Over A Medium-High Heat For 5 Mins Until The Liquid Has Halved.
5. Add The Chopped Tomatoes And Simmer For A Further 10 Mins Before Adding Your Meatless Farm Chicken And Cooking Over A Low-Medium Heat For A Further 5 Mins.
6. Leave In The Pan, Sprinkle With Parsley And Sundried Tomatoes And Place In The Centre Of The Table With Some Torn, Crusty Bread For The Ultimate, One-Pot Family Warmer.

title: Spiced Stuffin’ Muffin
ingredients:
1. 1Tbsp Sunflower Oil
2. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
3. 100G Carrots Finely Chopped
4. 2 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
5. 100G Chestnut Mushrooms Finely Chopped
6. 400G1 Can Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
7. 100G Walnuts
8. 100G Cooked Chestnuts
9. 1Tsp Salt
10. 12Tsp Ground Black Pepper
11. 1Tsp Ground Ginger
12. 1Tsp Ground Cinnamon
13. 2Tbsp Aquafaba
14. 2Tbsp Psyllium Husk
15. 1Tbsp Sunflower Oil
preparation:
1. Heat Your Oven To 190C/375F/Gm5.
2. Heat The Oil In A Large Frying Pan. Once The Oil Is Hot Add The Onion And Carrot. Fry For 10-15 Minutes Until The Onion Is Translucent.
3. Add The Garlic And Mushrooms. Fry For Another 5-10 Minutes Until The Mushroom Has Browned.
4. Blend The Mixture From The Pan With The Chickpeas, Walnuts, Chestnuts, Salt, Pepper, Spices, Aquafaba And Psyllium Husk.
5. Add A Small Amount Of Oil To A Muffin Tin. Divide The Muffin Batter Between All The Holes. Bake For 35-45 Minutes Until Browned And Cooked Through.
6. Tips
7. If You Want A Herby Stuffing Simply Omit The Spices And Replace With Fresh Sage Leaves, Thyme Or Rosemary.
8. The Psyllium Husk Acts As A Binder In This Recipe But Also Adds Moisture. You Can Omit It But The Muffins Will Be A Little Crumbly.

title: Veggie Curry Pies
ingredients:
1. 1 Tsp Coconut Oil
2. 1 Medium Onion
3. 3 Garlic Cloves
4. 14 Thumb Ginger
5. 100G Cherry Tomatoes
6. 12 Small Butternut Squash
7. 2 Medium Potatoes
8. Large Handful Of Coriander
9. 100G Frozen Peas
10. 80G Baby Spinach Leaves
11. 1 Pot Of Tideford Organics Vegan Rogan Josh Or Similar
12. 12 Lime
13. Salt And Pepper
14. 2 X 320G Sheets Of Glutenfree Puff Pastry
15. 4 Tsp Glutenfree Plain Flour Plus Extra For Dusting
16. 1 Tbsp Plant Milk Of Your Choice
17.
preparation:
1. 4 Springform Pie Tins Approx. 11Cm In Diameter
2. Heat The Coconut Oil In A Large Pan On A Medium Heat. While The Pan Heats Up, Peel And Discard The Skin Of The Onion, Slice It Thinly And Add It To The Pan. Fry For 10 Minutes, Stirring Frequently Until It Begins To Caramelise.
3. Meanwhile, Peel And Finely Dice The Ginger And Garlic. Then Peel And Dice The Butternut Squash And Potatoes. Quarter The Cherry Tomatoes And Finely Chop The Stalks Of The Coriander, Saving The Leaves For Later. Add The Ginger, Garlic, Squash, Potatoes, Tomatoes And Coriander Stalks To The Pan And Fry For A Further 15 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
4. Add The Frozen Peas, Spinach Leaves And Rogan Josh Curry Sauce To The Frying Pan And Simmer For 10 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
5. Next, Roughly Chop The Coriander Leaves And Stir Them Into The Pan Along With The Juice From The Half Of Lime And Season To Taste With Salt And Pepper.
6. Preheat The Oven To 200°C Fan.
7. Meanwhile, Roll Out The Pastry On A Floured Surface Until It’S A Few Millimetres Thick. Use A Sharp Knife To Cut 4 Circles A Few Cms Wider Than The Pie Tins (Make Sure You Leave Enough Pastry For The Tops), Then Line The Pie Tins With The Pastry By Pressing The Pastry Into The Base And Sides To Ensure The Inside Of The Tin Is Fully Covered.
8. Sprinkle A Tsp Of Flour Over The Base To Stop It From Going Soggy, Then Fill Each Pie With The Curry Filling.
9. Use The Remaining Pastry To Cover Each Pie And Pinch The Top And Sides Of The Pastry Together To Close The Pie.
10. Brush The Tops With Plant Milk And Bake In The Oven For 20-25 Minutes, Until Golden Brown.
11. Serve With Chips And Mushy Peas. Enjoy!
12. If You’Ve Been Inspired By This Recipe, Check Out This Lentil And Mushroom Pie!

title: Nākd Almond & Raspberry Cookies
ingredients:
1. 200G Ground Almonds
2. Tsp Glutenfree Baking Powder
3. A Small Pinch Of Salt
4. 4 Tbsp Vegan Spread Or Coconut Oil
5. 4 Tbsp Maple Syrup Or Agave Nectar
6. Tsp Almond Extract
7. 1 Nkd Berry Delight Bar Cut Into Chips
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 170C. And Line A Baking Tin With Greaseproof Paper.
2. Mix Together The Ground Almonds, Baking Powder And Salt In A Large Bowl. Then Add The Vegan Spread, Sweetener And Almond Extract And Mix Again Until Well Combined.
3. Stir In The Nākd Berry Delight Chips Until Evenly Incorporated Into The Mixture.
4. Transfer The Mixture Between Two Sheets Of Clingfilm Wrap And Leave In The Fridge For Approximately 30 Minutes, To Firm Up. Once Firm, Roll The Dough Out To About 1Cm Thickness And Cut Out Your Cookie Shapes.
5. Bake The Cookies For 8-10 Minutes, Keeping A Close Eye On The Oven And Rotating The Baking Sheet A Couple Of Times To Prevent It From Browning Too Much. Leave To Cool Before Enjoying!

title: Mandarin Orange Stirfry
ingredients:
1. 12 Tsp Vegetable Oil
2. 1 Cup Jasmine Rice
3. 1 Packet Of Gardein Mandarin Orange Chickn
4. 6 Fl Oz Coconut Milk
5. 2 Tsp Salt
6. 1 Tbsp Sugar
7. 2 Cups Baby Bok Choy 1 Diced
8. 3 Tbsp Green Onions Cut Into 18 Pieces
9. 1 Tbsp Black Sesame Seeds
preparation:
1. For The Rice:
2. Combine Jasmine Rice, Coconut Milk, Salt And Sugar Or Agave, Mix Well And Place In Rice Cooker Or Stove Top And Simmer For 15-20 Minutes.
3. For The Stir Fry:
4. Sauté Frozen Mandarin Chick’N With Oil In A Non-Stick Frying Pan Over Medium Heat Until Browned And Crisp On All Sides (7 Minutes).
5. Add Diced Bok Choy To The Pan And Sauté 1 Minute Until Wilted. Add Thawed Sauce And Stir For 30 Seconds Until Sauce Is Thick And Sticky.
6. Divide Rice Between Bowls And Top With Chick’N And Bok Choy Mixture. Garnish With Green Onion And Black Sesame Seeds.

title: Turkish Tofu & Spinach Börek
ingredients:
1. 6 Sheets Filo Pastry Cut In Half And Left Out Of The Fridge For Ten Minutes
2. 100G Fresh Spinach
3. For The Tofu Layer
4. 400G Tofu Drained And Crumbled
5. 20G Fresh Mint Finely Chopped
6. 2 Cloves Garlic Crushed
7. 50G Dairyfree Margarine Melted
8. 2Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
9. Tsp Freshly Ground Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200C.
2. Mix The Tofu Layer Ingredients Together Thoroughly.
3. Grease A Large Oven-Proof Dish With A Thin Coating Of The Melted Dairy-Free Margarine. Add The First Sheet Of Filo Pastry, Followed By A Coat Of Margarine. Repeat With Three More Filo Sheets.
4. Cover The Filo Pastry Evenly With Half Of The Spinach, Followed By Half Of The Tofu Mix.
5. Repeat Steps 3 And 4 To Add The Next Layer. Add A Final Layer Of Filo Sheets, Being Sure To Coat The Top Layer With Plenty Of The Melted Dairy-Free Margarine.
6. Bake In The Oven For Around 45 Minutes Or Until The Pastry Has Turned Golden Brown.

title: Superseed Chocolate Torte
ingredients:
1. Super Seed Base
2. 50G Cacao
3. 50G Cacao Nibs
4. 100G Coconut Sugar
5. 150G Sesame Seeds
6. 150G Sunflower Seeds
7. 1 Tbsp Carob
8. 50G Frozen Raspberries
9. Avocado Cream Top
10. 1 Avocado
11. 60 Cups Maple Syrup
12. 2 Tbsp Cacao Powder
13. Chocolate Drizzle
14. 30G Cacao Butter
15. 20G Cacao Powder
16. Tbsp Agave
preparation:
1. In A High Speed Blender Whiz Everything But The Berries (For The Base) Together Until A Light Crumb Forms Then Add The Raspberries To Form A Dough.
2. Press Into A Round Tin – About 2 Inches Thick And Leave In The Fridge To Set.
3. Whiz All The Topping Ingredientstogether Then Add To The Set Base.
4. For The Chocolate Drizzle, Melt The Cacao Then Sift In Cocoa And Stir In Agave, And Drizzle On Top.
5. We Like To Decorate Our Cakes With Dried Flowers, Fresh Fruit Or Extra Seeds – Be Creative!
6. This Cake Is Ready Straight Away So Dig In! It Keeps For About 1 Week.

title: Fava Bean Cookies
ingredients:
1. 100G Fava Bean Flour
2. 150G Ground Almonds
3. 3Tbsp Maple Syrup 4Tbsp If You Like Them Sweeter
4. 4Tbsp Coconut Oil
5. 1Tsp Bicarbonate Of Soda
6. 1Tspvanilla Extract
7. 50Graw Dark Chocolate Roughly Chopped Into Small Pieces
8. A Pinch Of Sea Salt
preparation:
1. Makes 12 Small Cookies – Oven 150C.
2. Put All Of The Ingredients, Apart From The Chocolate, Into A Food Processor. Whizz Up Until The Mixture Starts To Come Together, Then Empty Out Into A Bowl.
3. Add The Roughly Chopped Chocolate Into The Crumbed Mixture And Bring Together With Your Hands Until It Forms A Ball.
4. Divide The Cookie Dough Into Twelve Evenly Sized Balls And Place Onto A Baking Tray. Using The Palm Of Your Hand Squash The Cookie Balls Down To Make A Flat Round Cookie Shape.
5. Bake In The Oven For 10-15 Minutes, Depending On How Hot Your Oven Is.

title: Vegan Peanut Butter & Raspberry Breakfast Jar
ingredients:
1. 90G Organic Rolled Oats
2. 500Cups Oat Milk
3. 4 Tbsp 45 Nutmilk Or 70 Dark Chocolate Singleserve
4. 2 Tbsp Frozen Raspberries
5. 2 Pinches Of Pumpkin Seeds
6. 4 Tsp Raspberry Jam
7. 30G Maple Syrup
8. Crunchy Salted Peanut Butter Add To Your Liking
preparation:
1. Stir The Rolled Oats, Oat Milk And Maple Syrup Together In A Bowl.
2. With Two Short Glasses Or One Small Jar, Start Building Your Breakfast.
3. Start By Spreading Some Peanut Butter Against The Inside Of The Jar Or Glass, Then Spoon In The Oat Mixture.
4. Spoon In Some Raspberry Jam And Sprinkle In Some Frozen Raspberries, Pumpkin Seeds And Some Of The Nutmilk Or 70% Dark Chocolate Flakes From Your Single-Serve.
5. Keep Layering The Oat Mixture, Jam, Raspberries, Pumpkin Seeds And Chocolate Flakes Until The Jar Or Glass Is Full, Or You Feel Like There’S Enough For Your Breakfast.
6. Finish Your Breakfast Pot With A Layer Of Raspberries, Pumpkin Seeds, And Chocolate Flakes On Top.

title: Portobello Veggie Burgers
ingredients:
1. 1 Can Of Black Beans
2. 
3. 1T Stock Powder
4. 
5. 1 Garlic Clove Finely Chopped
6. 
7. 1 Red Onions Finely Chopped
8. 
9. 2T Ground Flax Seed
10. 
11. 12C Cooked Rice
12. 
13. 12 Tablespoon Toasted Sesame Seeds
14. 
15. Tablespoon Cumin Seeds Toasted And Ground
16. 
17. 12 Tablespoon Coriander Seeds Toasted And Ground
18. 
19. Half A Handful Of Each  Flat Parsley Coriander Mint
20. 
21. T Of Yeast Extract Or Marmitevegemite
22. 
23. Salt To Taste
24. 
25. 4 Portobello Mushrooms
26. 
27. 2T Tamari
28. 
29. 2T Water
30. 
31. 1T Hot Smoked Paprika
32. 2 Large Ripe Tomatoes
33. Baby Spinach
preparation:
1. Set Your Oven To 200C.
2. Drain And Rinse The Beans Very Well, Put Them Into A Large Bowl.
3. Add The Stock Powder, Garlic, Red Onion, Flax, Rice, Sesame Seeds, Spices, Herbs, Yeast Extract And A Little Salt.
4. Using A Hand Blender Or Food Processor Blend Until Smooth.
5. You Can Make The Patties One Of Two Ways, Shape Them With Your Hands Or Roll Out Between 2 Sheets Of Baking Paper And Cut Out Shapes With A Glass.
6. Bake In The Oven For Around 30 Minutes.
7. Remove The Stems From The Mushrooms Carefully, So The Caps Don’T Break.
8. Put The Mushrooms In A Large Bowl With The Tamari, Water And Paprika. Turn The Mushrooms Over And Around So That They Are Covered With The Sauce.
9. Bake The Mushrooms In The Oven For 15 Minutes.
10. Slice The Tomatoes, Put The Spinach On Your Plate, Assemble The Burgers With The Tomatoes And Enjoy!!!!

title: Creamy Courgette and Sundried Tomato Risotto
ingredients:
1. Serves 1
2. 12 Cup Or Approx 200G Risotto Rice
3. 1 Small Onion
4. 12 Courgette
5. 3 Garlic Cloves
6. 4 Sundried Tomatoes
7. 12 Tsp Chilli Flakes
8. 12 Cup Or Approx 200G Risotto Rice
9. 1 Litre Vegetable Stock
10. 60Cups Soya Or Other Plant Cream
11. 3 Asparagus Spears
12. Salt And Pepper
13. Olive Oil And Extra Virgin Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Heat A Little Oil In A Large Skillet. Bring A Large Pan Of Water To Boil, Add The Vegetable Stock And Reduce To Barely A Simmer.
2. Finely Chop The Onion And Add To The Skillet, Along With A Little Salt And Pepper. Sweat Until Soft. Dice The Courgette And Add To Pan And Cook Until Just Beginning To Soften. Mince The Garlic Cloves And Add To Pan, Season And Sweat For Several Minutes Until The Garlic Begins To Exude An Aroma.
3. Stir In The Risotto Rice And Let It Absorb The Flavours For A Minute Or Two Before Ladelling In The Stock, Just Covering The Rice. Simmer Gently Until The Stock Is Completely Absorbed Before Ladelling In More, Stirring Frequently. You May Not Need To Use The Full Litre So Remember To Taste Your Rice Once It Begins To Look Plump – It Should Be Al Dente In Texture.
4. Roughly Chop The Sundried Tomatoes And Add To The Pan Along With The Chilli Flakes. Pour In The Soya Cream And Stir Through. Check For Seasoning And Allow The Cream To Heat Through Before Serving.
5. For The Asparpagus Spear Simply Coat Them In Extra Virgin Olive Oil And Seasoning. Griddle For Around 10Mins On A Heated Griddle Pan. Serve On Top Of The Risotto Before Finishing With A Final Drizzle Of Evoo And A Smidge More Sea Salt.

title: Tofu Bhurji (Indian Scrambled Tofu)
ingredients:
1. Tsp Cumin Seeds
2. Tsp Fennel Seeds
3. 1 Tbsp Oil
4. 400 G Tofu
5. 2 Medium Onions Chopped
6. 1 Bell Pepper Chopped
7. 2 Green Chillies Chopped
8. Tbsp Grated Garlic
9. 1 Tsp Grated Ginger
10. 1 Large Tomato Chopped
11. 1 Tsp Pink Salt
12. 1 Tsp Ground Cumin
13. 1 Tsp Ground Coriander
14. Tsp Ground Turmeric
15. 2 Tsp Kashmiri Chilli Powder
16. 12 Juice From A Lemon
17. 18 Tsp Ground Cinnamon
18. Cup Chopped Coriander
preparation:
1. Squeeze Excess Water Out Of The Tofu.
2. Crumble The Tofu Into Small-Medium Sized Pieces. Set Aside.
3. Heat Oil In A Pan Over Medium Heat.
4. Add In Cumin Seeds, Fennel Seeds And Mix.
5. Mix In Chopped Onions And Green Chillies And Sauté Onions Until Translucent.
6. Add Grated Garlic And Grated Ginger And Cook For 2 Minutes Or Until The Raw Smell Disappears.
7. Add Chopped Bell Pepper And Chopped Tomato And Cook For Another 1-2 Minutes.
8. Add In Ground Cumin, Ground Coriander, Ground Turmeric, Pink Salt, Kashmiri Chilli Powder And Cook For 2-3 Minutes.
9. Add In Crumbled Tofu, Mix Well And Cook For Another 2 Minutes.
10. Mix In Ground Cinnamon.
11. Squeeze Juice Lemon And Add Chopped Coriander.
12. Take Off Heat And Serve With Chapati / Naan.

title: Coffee and Walnut Cake
ingredients:
1. For The Cake
2. 100G4Oz Dairyfree Spreadmargarine
3. 150G6Oz Soft Brown Sugar
4. 200G8Oz Selfraising Flour
5. 1 Tsp Baking Powder
6. 1 Tsp Bicarbonate Of Soda
7. 1 Tbsp Instant Coffee Granules Dissolved In 200Cups8 Fl Oz Boiling Water Or Cooled Espressofilter Coffee
8. 1 Tsp White Wine Or Cider Vinegar
9. 1 Tsp Xanthan Gum
10. 100G4Oz Roughly Chopped Nuts Walnuts Pecans Or Hazelnuts  Reserve 25G1 Oz To Top The Cake
11. For The Vegan Buttercream Icingfrosting
12. 1 Tbsp Coffee Dissolved In 3 Tbsp Boiling Water
13. 200G8Oz Icing Sugar
14. 50G2Oz Dairyfree Spreadmargarine Softened
preparation:
1. Make Up The Coffee And Set To One Side To Cool.
2. Pre-Heat The Oven To 170C/160C Fan/325F/Gas3.
3. Cream The Spread And Sugar.
4. Add All Of The Remaining Ingredients (Reserving 25G/1Oz Of The Nuts) And Mix Until Just Combined.
5. Divide The Mixture Between 2 Greased And Lined 7″ Sandwich Tins.
6. Bake For 20-25 Mins Until The Cakes Are Firm And Spring Back Slightly If Pressed Gently In The Centre.
7. Turn Out Onto A Wire Rack And Remove The Greaseproof Paper.
8. Allow To Cool Before Icing.
9. Soften The Spread In A Bowl And Stir In The Icing Sugar.
10. Mix Together, Adding Just Enough Of The Coffee To Make A Thick, Spreadable Icing.
11. Spread In The Middle And On Top Of The Cake.
12. Decorate The Top Of The Cake With The Remaining Nuts.
13. Suitable For Freezing.
14. Love This Recipe? Want More Like This? Sign Up To Veganuary For Delicious Recipes, Our Celebrity Meal Plans, Nutritional Advice And So Much More. The Best Part Is It’S 100% Free!
15. *I Made This Cake As An Experiment, To Try Out The Tub Of Xanthan Gum I Had Recently Bought. Xanthan Gum Is A Binder And Emulsifier Which Is Often Used In Gluten-Free Baking – It Can Be Found In The Baking Or Free-From Section Of Most Big Supermarkets.

title: Steak and Ale Pie
ingredients:
1. Jusroll Frozen Puff Pastry Or Similar  Ready Rolled Or Blocks
2. One Large White Onion Sliced
3. A Few Cloves Of Garlic More Or Less Depending On How Garlicky You Like Your Food Chopped
4. Dried Parsley Salt Pepper And Any Other Of Your Favourite Herbs
5. 5  6 Large Field Mushrooms Or Around 10 Smaller Variety Mushrooms Chestnut Mushrooms Are Lovely As They Have A Nice Nutty Flavour Slice Thickly
6. A Pack Of Frys Thickcut Chunky Strips Or Other Beef Substitute
7. Bisto Original Gravy Granules Or Other Vegan Granules
8. A Cup Of Vegan Ale  Check Barnivore A Great Vegan Alcohol Website If You Dont Drink Alcohol Replace With Water
preparation:
1. Fry The Onion And Garlic, Herbs And Seasoning In Some Oil Until A Little Soft.
2. Add The Mushrooms And “Meat” Strips And Fry Until The Strips Start To Look Browned
3. Add The Ale And Sprinkle In The Gravy Granules, A Tablespoon At A Time Until It Starts To Thicken. Make Sure The Gravy Isn’T Watery, As It Will Make The Pastry Really Soggy. It Just Needs To Cover The Ingredients In The Pan.
4. Roll Out The Pastry, Line A Roasting Dish With It And Place The Pie Filling In The Dish. Place The Pastry On The Top And Squash The Edges Of The Bottom Layer And The Top Of The Pie Together With A Fork. If You Want Less Pastry, You Can Leave Off The Bottom Layer And Just Have The Top. Don’T Worry If It Looks A Mess, When The Pastry Puffs Up, It Will Look Fab! And If The Gravy Overflows And Runs Out, Even Better!
5. Cook At 200 Degrees For About Half An Hour, Or Until The Pastry Looks Nice And Brown.
6. If You’Ve Been Inspired By This Recipe, Why Not Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: ‘Prawn’-Style Chow Mein
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Frys Meat Free Crispy Prawns Or Similar Plantbased Prawn Alternative
2. 100G Mccain Asian Stir Fry
3. 250G Egg Free Noodles
4. 2 Cups Boiling Water
5. Pinch Of Salt
6. 2 Tbsp Peanut Oil
7. 1 Tbsp Crushed Garlic
8. 2 Tbsp Soy Sauce
9. 12 Tsp Brown Sugar
10. 1 Tbsp White Wine Vinegar
11. 14 Cup Roasted Peanuts
12. 14 Cup Spring Onion Sliced
preparation:
1. Defrost 1 Pack Of Fry’S Meat-Free Crispy ‘Prawns’
2. Place ‘Prawns’ On A Non-Stick Baking Tray And Place In A Preheated Oven At 180°C For 6 – 8 Minutes.
3. Cook Noodles In Salted Water Drain Under Colder Water And Set Aside.
4. Heat Up Frying Pan Or Wok Until Very Hot.
5. Add Peanut Oil, Crushed Garlic And Fry For A Few Seconds (Do Not Burn).
6. Toss In Carrots, Onion, Cabbage, Red Pepper And Snow Peas And Stir Fry For 3 – 4 Minutes.
7. Mix In The Prepared ‘Prawns’.
8. Combine Soy Sauce, Brown Sugar And White Wine Vinegar In A Small Bowl. Mix Until The Sugar Has Dissolved.
9. Add The Cooked Noodles And The Soy Mixture And Stir Fry For 1 Minute.
10. Add Roasted Peanuts And Garnish With Chopped Shallots.
11. Did You Like This Dish? Check Out More Vegan Seafood Recipes.

title: Bhaji Battered Jerk Mini Fillet Flatbread
ingredients:
1. Bhaji Battered Jerk Mini Fillet
2. 2 X Pack Quorn Jerk Mini Fillet
3. 100G Gram Flour
4. 10G Nigella Seeds
5. 5G Curry Powder
6. 1 X Onion  Sliced
7. 25G Ground Cumin
8. 25G Ground Coriander
9. 1G Paprika
10. Yoghurt Flatbread
11. 250G Vegan Yogurt
12. 250G Selfraising Flour
13. Salt
14. Extra Flour For Dusting
15. Mint Yoghurt
16. 250G Vegan Yoghurt
17. 15G Mint
18. Lime Zest
19. Mangohabanero Salsa
20. 1 X Mango  Peeled And Finely Diced
21. 1 X Habanerochilli  Chopped Finely  Leave The Seeds In
22. 100G Sugar
23. 50Cups Water
24. 90Cups White Wine Vinegar
25. 15G Coriander  Chopped Finely
26. Pineapple Juice  To Thin
27. 10Cups Vegetable Oil
28. Charred Pineapple
29. 1 X Pineapple
preparation:
1. Bhaji Battered Jerk Mini Fillet
2. Mix Dry Spices And Seeds With Gram Flour.
3. Peel And Thinly Slice Onion.
4. Mix Dry Mix With Enough Water To Bind To A Thin Batter.
5. Add The Onion And Mix Through.
6. Slice Quorn Jerk Mini Fillets
7. Toss Quorn Jerk Mini Fillets In Batter Until Well Coated – Fry @ 180C Until Crispy And Hot Through. Drain And Season With Salt.
8. Yoghurt Flatbread
9. Mix Together Until A Smooth Dough Forms.
10. Divide Into Portions.
11. Flour Lightly And Roll Out To Desired Thickness – 1Cm
12. Cook Over Dry Heat In A Griddle Pan On Both Sides – Until Bar Marked, Puffed And Cooked Through.
13. Keep Warm Until Used.
14. Mint Yoghurt
15. Finely Chop The Mint & Zest The Lime.
16. Mix With The Yoghurt.
17. Mango/Habanero Salsa
18. Peel And Finely Dice The Mango
19. Finely Dice The Chilli
20. Fry Off The Mango/ Chilli In The Vegetable Oil Over Medium Low Heat For 5-6 Minutes Until They Begin To Soften
21. Add The Vinegar And Sugar To The Pan
22. Bring To A Boil – Then Turn Down To A Simmer And Leave For 20 Minutes.
23. Allow To Cool Slightly And Then Blend Until Smooth – Mix In The Chopped Coriander And Thin Down If Necessary To Be Able To Drizzle.
24. Charred Pineapple
25. Remove The Outer Skin From The Pineapple And Remove The Core.
26. Slice Into Wedges.
27. Char On Both Sides In A Hot Griddle Pan Until Well-Marked.

title: Baked Apples with Spiced Rice Pudding
ingredients:
1. 4 Large Apples
2. 60G Short Grain White Rice
3. 200Cups Coconut Milk
4. 2Tbsp Coconut Sugar Or Other Sugar
5. 80Cups Plant Milk
6. 2Tbsp Mixed Dried Fruit This Recipe Uses Cranberries And Sultanas
7. 12Tsp Orange Zest
8. 12Tsp Vanilla Essence
9. 12Tsp Ground Cinnamon
10. 14Tsp Ground Nutmeg
11. 2Tbsp Finely Chopped Nuts Such As Pecans And Walnuts
12. A Little Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Heat Your Oven To 180C/360F/Gm4.
2. Cut The Top Off Each Apple. If They Will Not Sit Upright, Cut A Small Amount Off The Bottom Of Each Apple.
3. Using A Spoon Dig Out The Flesh Of The Apples, Creating ‘Bowls’ From The Apples.
4. Bake For 15-20 Minutes Until The Apples Are Cooked Through. Do Not Overcook The Apples As This Will Cause Them To Fall Apart.
5. Finely Chop The Apples, Removing Any Seeds Or Stems.
6. Put The Apple In A Saucepan With The Rice, Coconut Milk, Sugar, Milk, Fruit, Zest, Vanilla Essence And Spices.
7. Bring To The Boil Then Lower To A Simmer. Simmer For 15-20 Minutes Until The Rice Is Cooked Through And The Rice Pudding Has Thickened.
8. Add Half The Chopped Nuts To The Rice Pudding. Mix In And Spoon The Mixture Into The 4 Apple Bowls.
9. Dip Each Apple In The Remaining Chopped Nuts. Place On A Serving Plate With A Drizzle Of Maple Syrup.

title: Braised Cauliflower and Puy Lentil Tabouleh
ingredients:
1. 100G Puy Lentils
2. 1 Bay Leaf
3. 220G Bulgur Wheat Rinsed In Cold Water
4. 450Cups Boiling Water Or Veg Stock
5. 1 Small Cauliflower Cut Into Small Florets Roughly 2Cm In Size Stalks Finely Diced Waste Nothing
6. Large Pinch Of Ground Cumin
7. Large Pinch Of Ground Coriander
8. Large Pinch Of Sweet Paprika
9. Large Pinch Of Ground Turmeric
10. Small Pinch Of Ground Cinnamon
11. Teaspoon Sea Salt
12. 4 Spring Onions Finely Chopped
13. A Cucumber Deseeded
14. Finely Diced 2 Ripe Tomatoes Deseeded And Finely Diced
15. 1 Tablespoon Great Olive Oil
16. A Handful Of Dried Apricots Soaked For 2 Hours Then Drained And Finely Chopped
17. A Handful Of Fresh Flatleaf Parsley Finely Chopped
18. A Handful Of Fresh Mint Leaves
19. Finely Chopped Seeds From 1 Small Pomegranate
20. 1 Tablespoon Toasted Sesame Seeds
21. 1 X Pomegranate Dressing
22. For The Garnish
23. 4 Tablespoons Pomegranate Seeds
24. A Handful Of Chopped Fresh Parsley And Mint
preparation:
1. Put The Lentils Into A Pan And Cover With Water. Leave For 5 Minutes, Then Pick Out Any Floating Lentils. Drain, Cover With Fresh Water, And Add The Bay Leaf. Bring To The Boil, Then Reduce The Heat And Simmer For 30 Minutes, Stirring And Checking The Water Level (Add More If Needed). The Lentils Should Be Springy, But Cooked. Drain If Necessary, Though There Should Be Very Little Liquid Left.
2. Put The Bulgur Wheat Into A Large Bowl And Pour Over The Boiling Water Or Stock, Enough To Cover It By About 2Cm. Tightly Cover And Leave For 30 Minutes. Once Cooked, Fluff With A Fork And Cool.
3. In A Frying Pan, Heat The Oil On A High Heat, Then Add The Cauliflower And Begin To Fry. Stir Regularly And Cook For 10–12 Minutes. Once The Cauliflower Has Softened And The Edges Are Slightly Charred, Sprinkle Over The Ground Spices And Salt And Cook For A Further 2 Minutes, Stirring Well. Cover And Leave To Cool. The Cauliflower Should Be Nicely Coated With The Spices. Make The Pomegranate.
4. Dressing. Add Three-Quarters Of The Lentils To The Bulgur Wheat, Along With The Cauliflower, Herbs And The Rest Of The Ingredients, Then Pour Over The Dressing And Mix Gently Together With Your Hands Until Well Combined.
5. Place In A Wide, Shallow Serving Bowl And Spread Out Evenly. Sprinkle Over The Remaining Lentils And Garnish With Pomegranate Seeds And Herbs.

title: Black Forest Gateaux
ingredients:
1. Chocolate Sponge
2. 1 14 Cups Flour
3. 1 Cup Sugar
4. 13 Cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
5. 1 Tsp Baking Soda
6. 12 Tsp Salt
7. 1 Cup Warm Water
8. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
9. 13 Cup Vegetable Oil
10. 1 Tsp Distilled White Or Apple Cider Vinegar
11. Cherry Filling
12. 34 Cup Sugar
13. 2 Teaspoons Cornstarch
14. 1 Dash Salt
15. 13 Cup Cherry Liqueur Or Water If You Do Not Want To Include Alcohol
16. Two Tins Of Cherries Drained
17. Cream Filling
18. Nondairy Whipping Cream Soyatoo Whipping Cream Is Available From Us Or Uk Online Stores
preparation:
1. Chocolate Sponge:
2. Mix All The Dry Ingredients Together Well, Add In The Wet Ingredients And Mix Well.
3. Divide The Mixture Between The Two 8 Inch Round Baking Tins.
4. If You Want A Towering Cake, Double The Sponge Mixture Recipe And Divide Between Three Baking Tins.
5. Cook For 25 – 30 Mins At 200/400 Degrees Or Gas Mark 6 And Check By Poking The Cakes With A Small Knife Or Toothpick. If The Knife Or Toothpick Doesn’T Come Out Clean, Put Back In The Oven For 5 Mins At A Time Until The Poke Test Comes Out Clean.
6. Leave The Sponges To Cool When Done.
7. Cherry Filling:
8. Heat The Sugar, Cornstarch And Salt In A Pan.
9. Stir In The Cherry Liqueur Or Water.
10. Then Add The Cherries And Cook Until The Mixture Thickens.It Can Be A Little Runny As The Juice Can Soak Into The Bottom Sponge.
11. You Can Save The Drained Cherry Juice And Add Some Cherry Liqueur To Make Some Lovely Sweet Shots To Go With The Cake!
12. Cream Filling:
13. Soyatoo Whipping Cream Is Available From Us Or Uk Online Stores.
14. Just Keep Whipping These Until They Are As Thick As You Can Get – Using An Electric Whisk Is Best, Otherwise You Might Be Whisking All Day!
15. To Assemble!
16. Place The Cherry Filling Over The First Sponge And Let The Juice Soak In.
17. If You Have Only One More Sponge, Place The Cream On Top Of The Cherries. If You Have Two More, Place The Next Sponge On Top Of The Cherries And Then Layer The Cream On Top Of That.
18. Place The Last Layer Of Sponge On The Cream.
19. On The Top, You Can Go Crazy With All Cream, Or Cream Around The Edge Of The Top Sponge And Some Cherries In The Middle.
20. Garnish With Your Choice Of Glacé Cherries, Chocolate Shavings Or Maybe Chocolate Chips!

title: Sensational Chorizo Salad with Baby Potatoes and Avocado
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Garden Gourmet Sensational Chorizo Sausage Or Another Plantbased Equivalent
2. 800 G Small Potatoes
3. 4 Tbsp Of Olive Oil
4. 1 Bell Pepper
5. Tsp Of Fennel Seeds
6. 3 Vine Tomatoes
7. 1 Avocado
8. 1 Tsp Of Provenal Herbs
9. Tsp Of Paprika Powder
10. Juice Of Half Of Lemon
11. A Few Sprigs Of Basil And Oregano
preparation:
1. Heat The Oven To 200 ° C And Cover A Baking Sheet With Baking Paper. Spread The Potatoes On The Baking Paper. Drizzle With Olive Oil And Season With The Spices. Cut The Pepper Into Slices, Spread Them Out On A 2Nd Baking Sheet. Drizzle With Olive Oil And Season With The Fennel Seeds, Salt And Pepper.
2. Put Everything In The Oven For 20 Minutes. The Peppers Will Be Cooked Before The Potatoes. Cook The Chorizo.
3. Prepare The Sensational Chorizo (Or Similar) Based On The Instruction : On The Pack.
4. Cut The Tomatoes/Avocado And Mix Them With The Ingredients. Place The Potatoes In A Large Bowl With The Peppers. Cut The Chorizo And Mix Everything.
5. Garnished With Avocado Salsa And Some Additional Fresh Herbs.
6. Love This Recipe? When You Sign Up To Veganuary, You’Ll Get Access To Our Cookbooks, Delicious Recipes, Meal Plans And More. (It’S Free!)

title: Tofu Scramble Breakfast Burritos
ingredients:
1. 1 X Block Of Firm Tofu
2. Olive Or Rapeseed Oil
3. 1 X Onion
4. 23 Garlic Cloves
5. 12 Teaspoon Of Thyme
6. A Good Shake Of Paprika
7. 14  12 Teaspoon Of Turmeric
8. 12 Tablespoons Soytamari Sauce
9. Optional Mushrooms Peppers Chili Red And Yellow Pepper Etc
10. 23 Tablespoons Of Nutritional Yeast
11. Black Pepper And Salt To Taste
12. Tortilla Wraps
13. Garnish Options
14. Tomato Salsa
15. Hot Sauce
16. Jalapenos
17. Spring Onions
18. Grated Vegan Cheese
19. Avocados
preparation:
1. This Recipe Uses A Whole Block Of Tofu So Makes A Healthy Serving Of Scramble. How Many Burritos You Have Will Be Determined By How Much You Pack Into Each, And How Large Your Tortilla Wraps Are… But You Should Have Four Large Burritos If You Make Them According To The Recipe Below.
2. Rinse The Tofu, Wrap It In A Clean Tea Towel, Then Put Something Heavy On Top (Some Books, Perhaps) To Press The Liquid From It.
3. Peel And Finely Chop The Onion And Garlic. Add These To A Frying Pan With A Splash Of Olive Oil.
4. Cook For A Bit And Then Add The Thyme, Paprika And Turmeric. Mix And Then Add The Soy Sauce.
5. Add Any Other Veg You Want To Include And Stir.
6. Now, Take The Books Off The Tofu And Give The Tea Towel Another Squeeze. Then With Your Hands, Crumble The Tofu Into The Frying Pan.
7. Mix The Tofu Through, Using Your Spoon To Break Up Any Bigger Bits. It Should Look Similar To Scrambled Egg Now.
8. Once All Mixed In, Add Nutritional Yeast And Mix In. I Am Obsessed With Nutritional Yeast So I Always Add More Than 2!
9. Add Some Pepper And Mix Again.
10. Leave To Cook For Another 20 Mins Or So, Turning Down The Heat A Little To Stop It Sticking. Give It A Stir Occasionally.
11. After About 20 Minutes You Can Start To Prep Your Tortilla Wraps. Spread Some Tomato Salsa In The Middle Of The Wrap. Add Sliced Avocado Or A Little Homemade Guacamole On Top, And Then Sprinkle On Some Grated Vegan Cheese. Then Pile Some Scramble On Top Of The Cheese And Add Sliced Spring Onions And Jalapenos On Top.
12. Wrap Up And Serve With Extra Avocado And Frank’S Hot Sauce.

title: Chocolate and Peanut Butter ‘Freakshake’
ingredients:
1. 150G 23 Cup Nut Milk Hazelnut Or Almond Work Really Well Here
2. 1 Banana
3. 1 Heaped Tbsp Peanut Butter
4. 1 Scoop Dairyfree Vanilla Ice Cream
5. 1 Tsp Cocoa Powder
6. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
7. 100G 35 Oz Plaindark Chocolate Chips Check The Label
8. Handful Sweet Popcorn
preparation:
1. Place The Nut Milk, Banana, Peanut Butter, Ice Cream, Cocoa Powder, Maple Syrup And About A Third Of The Chocolate Chips Into A Blender Or Food Processor, And Blitz Until Smooth And Creamy, (This May Take Up To A Minute).
2. Set Aside About A Tablespoon Full Of The Remaining Chocolate Chips, And Pour The Rest Into A Small Microwave-Safe Bowl. Microwave On Full Power For One Minute Until Melted, And Whisk With A Fork Until Smooth.
3. Dip The Rim Of Your Glass Into The Melted Chocolate, Then Use A Teaspoon To Drizzle More Of The Chocolate Around The Rim To Create The Trademark Freakshake Dribbles Around The Outside.
4. Pour In The Milkshake, Then Top With As Much Popcorn As Gravity Will Allow, Scatter Carefully With The Chocolate Chips, And Then Drizzle The Whole Lot With Even More Melted Chocolate.

title: Simple Spanish Stew
ingredients:
1. 2 Servings Of Pearl Barley
2. 1 Vegetable Stock Cube
3. 1 Tin Of Plum Tomatoes
4. 1 Handful Whole Black Pitted Olives
5. 1 White Onion Diced Largely
6. 1 Sweet Red Pepper Diced Largely
7. 12 Butternut Squash Diced Largely
8. 1 Tin Of Chickpeas
9. 2 Tsp Smoked Paprika
10. 1 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
11. Sea Salt  Black Pepper To Taste
12. Lemon Juice
13. Fresh Flatleaf Parsley
preparation:
1. Boil The Pearl Barley In A Separate Pan For Approximately 30-40 Minutes.
2. In A Large Stew Pan, Fry Off The Onion Until Lightly Browned, Adding In Each Of The Seasonings.
