3. Add The Butternut Squash And A Touch Of Water To Help It Soften. Steam For Around 10 Minutes.
4. Add The Remaining Vegetables And Steam For A Further 5 Minutes.
5. Add The Vegetable Stock And Tinned Tomatoes, Bringing The Whole Mix To The Boil.
6. Simmer For Another 30 Minutes, Adding The Chickpeas And Kale After Around 20 Minutes.
7. Stir In The Pearl Barley And Stir Thoroughly.
8. Serve With A Sprig Of Parsley On The Top! Season To Taste.
9. Hungry For More Recipes Like This? Sign Up To Veganuary For Our Celebrity Cookbook, Meal Plans, Nutritional Advice, Recipes And So Much More. Did We Tell You? It’S 100% Free!

title: Middle Eastern Style Salad
ingredients:
1. 100G Uncooked Quinoa
2. 15G Fresh Parsley Chopped Finely
3. 10G Fresh Mint Chopped Finely
4. 30G Dried Barberries Or Dried Cranberries Or Dried Goldenberries Or A Mixture Of All Three If You Wish
5. 1012 Large Radishes Sliced Finely
6. 20 Cherry Tomatoes Halved
7. 1 Pomegranate Deseeded
8. 1 Large Avocado Deseeded And Cut Into Chunks
9. To Decorate A Handful Of Pumpkin Seeds And Some Chopped Parsley
10. For The Dressing
11. 2 Cloves Of Garlic Finely Chopped
12. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
13. 2 Tbsp Pomegranate Molasses
14. 2 Tbsp Of Apple Cider Vinegar
15. 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice Lemon Juice
16. Tsp Sweetener Of Choice Date Syrupagave   Tsp Stevia
17. Tsp Sumac
18. Tsp Salt
19. Pepper To Taste
20. Tbsp Pulsin Protein Powder Or Similar
21. Variations
22. Make A Green Middle Easternstyle Salad By Adding   Tsp Of Spirulina Or Wheatgrass Powder To The Cooked Cooled Quinoa
23. Substitute Berries For Dried Apricots Or Sour Cherries
24. Substitute Quinoa For Bulgar Wheat Cauliflower Rice Or Giant Cous Cous
25. Include Chunks Of Cucumber
26. Mint Can Be Substituted For Fresh Coriander
27. Sprinkle Hemp Seeds Flaxseed Or Chia Seeds On Top For An Extra Nutrient Boost
preparation:
1. Cook The Quinoa As Per Manufacturer’S Instruction :. Allow To Cool.
2. In The Meantime, Chop Up The Salad Ingredients.
3. Make The Dressing. In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Dressing Ingredients.
4. In A Large Bowl, Mix Together The Quinoa, Salad Dressing And The Chopped Up Salad Ingredients, Reserving Some Parsley For The Garnish.
5. Garnish With The Remaining Chopped Parsley And A Handful Of Pumpkin Seeds. Enjoy!
6. Did You Enjoy This Dish? Explore More Vegan Salad Recipes.

title: Oumph! Buddha Bowl
ingredients:
1. 1 Tsp Sesame Seeds
2. 250 Cups Sushi Rice Or Black Rice
3. 280 G Oumph The Chunk Or Bibim Oumph Or Pulled Oumph
4. For Oumph The Chunk
5. 100 Cups Plantbased Sriracha Mayo Can Be Bought Readymade
6. 1 Tbsp Japanese Soy Sauce
7. Vegetable Suggestions
8. Small Broccoli Florets Steamed Around 250 G
9. Shredded Carrots Or Sweet Potatoes Around 200 G
10. Shredded Sugar Snap Peas
11. Green Leaves Such As Baby Spinach
12. Pea Shoots Sprouts Etc
13. Sauce Suggestions Sriracha Mayo Hummus Toum  Or Your Favourite Around 2 Tbsp Per Person
preparation:
1. *If You Want To Spice Up The Oumph! Yourself, Use Oumph! The Chunk: Mix The Sriracha Mayo And Japanese Soy Sauce With Oumph! The Chunk. Fry Over Medium Heat In A Pan With Oil Until Golden Brown, Then Sprinkle Sesame Seeds On Top.
2. **If You’Re Using Bibim Oumph! And Pulled Oumph! – Just Follow The Cooking Instruction : On The Packaging.
3. Boil The Rice As Stated On The Packaging.
4. If You Fancy Broccoli Or Cauliflower, Cut In To Small Florets And Steam Or Boil Until Just Done. Rinse In Cold Water To Stop Them From Cooking Further And Season With, For Example, Some Sesame Seeds And Japanese Soy – Or Keep It Au Naturel! Serve Lukewarm Or Cold.
5. Finely Grate For Example Carrot Or Sweet Potato – A Small Handful Per Portion Will Do.
6. Use Bean Sprouts, Or Any Other Sprouts You Fancy, About 100 Ml Per Person.
7. Cut The The Sugar Snaps In To Thin Pieces, Or Use Whole, Approx. 3-4 Per Person.
8. Green Leaves Like Baby Spinach Are Tasty And Healthy, One Handful Will Be Perfect.
9. Use Ready-Made Dressing Or Make Your Own.
10. Line The Bottom Of The Bowl With The Rice. Carefully Arrange The Various Ingredients On Top. There Are No Wrong Ingredients In A Buddha Bowl, As Long As It’S Yummy And Looks Good! Let Your Creativity Run Wild!

title: Aloo Masala Toast
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Oil
2. 1 Cup Mashed Potato
3. 12 Cup Finely Chopped Bell Pepper
4. 1 Tsp Grated Garlic
5. 12 Cup Finely Chopped Onion
6. 14 Cup Finely Chopped Red Cabbage
7. 14 Cup Finely Chopped Carrot
8. 1 Tsp Chaat Masala
9. 14 Tsp Chilli Powder
10. 18 Tsp Ground Turmeric
11. 14 Tsp Pink Salt
12. Black Pepper
13. 12 Tbsp Chopped Coriander
14. Vegan Butter
15. 4 Slices Bread I Used Seeded Bread
16. Topping Options
17. Tangy Green Chutney  Sweet Tamarind Chutney Onions Tomatoes Sev Pomegranate Seeds Coriander Leaves Ketchup Chillies
preparation:
1. Heat Oil Over Low-Medium Heat.
2. Add Garlic And Sauté For 40 Seconds.
3. Mix In Onions And Sauté For A Few Seconds.
4. Add Bell Pepper, Carrot And Purple Cabbage And Sauté For 5-7 Minutes.
5. Combine Mashed Potato And Cook For 3 Minutes.
6. Mix In Chopped Coriander And Transfer Mixture Into A Bowl.
7. Spread Both Sides Of Bread With Vegan Butter And In The Same Pan Toast Both Sides Until Golden (Or Crispy As You Like!)
8. Add 1/4 Of The Mixture On Each Slice Of Bread And Top With Whatever You Like!

title: Nākd Mini Strawberry Cheesecakes
ingredients:
1. 4 Nkd Strawberry Crunch Bars
2. 65G Cashew Nuts Soaked Overnight In Water And Drained
3. Juice Of 2 Lemons
4. 60Cups Agave Nectar Or Maple Syrup
5. 60Cups Coconut Oil Melted
6. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
7. 3 Pitted Dates
8. 6 Large Strawberries
preparation:
1. Instruction : Time: 15 Minutes, Plus 15 Minutes Chilling
2. Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
3. Grease Or Line A Muffin Tin Or Preferably Use A Silicon Muffin Tray To Make The Cheesecakes Easier To Remove.
4. Chop The Nākd Bars In A Food Processor Or High Powered Blender Into Small Bits And Divide Them Into 6 Sections. Press Firmly Into The Bottom Of The Muffin Tins Or Silicon Trays To Make 6 Cheesecake Bases.
5. Blend Together The Cashew Nuts, Agave Nectar/Maple Syrup, Coconut Oil And Vanilla Until It Makes A Smooth Silky Mixture. Pour The Mixture Onto Each Of The Cheesecake Bases Until It Fills The Top.
6. Make The Strawberry Swirl By Blending Together The Dates And Strawberries Then Dropping A Few Dots Of The Mixture Onto The Top Of The Cheesecakes. Use A Skewer To Gently Swirl The Strawberry Mixture Around.
7. Place The Cheesecakes In The Freezer Overnight Or For At Least 4 Hours To Set.
8. Sit At Room Temperature Before Serving And Enjoy!

title: Sweet & Sour Sticky Tofu
ingredients:
1. 15G Cashew Nuts
2. 1 Brown Onion
3. 1 Red Chilli
4. 1 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar
5. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
6. 1 Tbsp Oil
7. 1 Tbsp Tamari
8. 1 Yellow Pepper
9. 2 Tbsp Tomato Puree
10. 300G Firm Tofu
11. 40G Kale
12. 4 Tsp Cornflour
13. 80G Brown Rice
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180C / Gas Mark 4 And Boil A Kettle. Rinse The Brown Rice And Place Into A Saucepan With 400Ml Boiling Water And A Pinch Of Sea Salt. Simmer For 20-25 Mins Until Cooked, Then Drain.
2. Cut The Yellow Pepper And Onion Into Bite-Sized Pieces. Roughly Chop The Kale. Finely Chop The Chilli (Remove The Seeds For Less Heat). Drain And Rinse The Tofu, Pat Dry With Paper Towel. Cut The Tofu Into 2Cm Cubes.
3. To Make The Sweet And Sour Sauce; In A Small Bowl Mix Together The Tamari, Tomato Puree, Maple Syrup, Apple Cider Vinegar And Half Of The Chilli With 2 Tbsp Cold Water.
4. Place The Cornflour Into A Bowl With A Pinch Of Sea Salt. Place The Tofu Cubes Into The Bowl And Coat Evenly.
5. Place The Kale On A Baking Tray With A Pinch Of Sea Salt And Combine With 1 Tsp Oil, Spread Out Into An Even Layer. Place In The Oven For 10 Mins Until Turning Crispy.
6. Heat A Large Wok Or Frying Pan With 2 Tsp Oil On A Medium-High Heat And Cook The Tofu For 10 Mins, Turning Occasionally Until Turning Golden. Then Add The Onion And Pepper And Cook For 5 Mins Until Softening. Add In The Sauce And Turn Down The Heat. Cook For 1-2 Mins Until The Sauce Has Thickened.
7. Spoon The Brown Rice Into Two Warm Bowls Alongside The Sweet And Sour Tofu And Crispy Kale. Sprinkle With The Cashew Nuts And Remaining Chilli (If Desired).

title: Adzuki Bean Soup with Squash and Parsnip
ingredients:
1. 6 Cups Filtered Water
2. 1 Cup Adzuki Beans Soaked Overnight Night Or Used Canned Organic Beans
3. 2 Stamp Size Pieces Kombu Seaweed
4. 1 Cup Diced Onion
5. 1 Cup Diced Carrot
6. 1 Cup Diced Squash
7. 1 Cup Diced Parsnip
8. Freshly Grated Ginger Juice To Taste Approximately 1 Tbsp
9. Shoyusoy Sauce To Taste
preparation:
1. Discard The Water From The Soaking Beans And Add Fresh Filtered Water. Bring Water With Adzuki Beans And Kombu To A Boil Over Medium-High Heat.
2. Reduce Heat To Medium And Cook For 30-45 Minutes Until Beans Are Soft.
3. (Discard This Part Of The Recipe If You Are Using Canned Beans – See Below.)
4. Add The Onion And Carrot And Cook For A Further 10 Minutes. Add The Squash And Parsnip And Cook For 15 Minutes More Or Until Soft. Stir In The Ginger Juice And Add Shoyu To Taste.
5. If Using Canned Beans:Place The Cooked Beans Along With The Onion And Carrot And Cook For 10 Minutes In 2 Cups Of Water. Add The Squash, Parsnip And 1 Cup Of Water And Cook For A Further 10 Minutes. Season The Soup To Taste With Ginger Juice And Shoyu And Serve With Some Crusty Sourdough Bread.
6. According To A Recent Study, Regular Bean Eaters Are 22 Percent Less Likely To Be Overweight And Have Smaller Waistlines Than Those Who Don’T Eat Them.Beans Release Energy Slowly Into The Body, Making Them A Great Weight Loss Food. They Are Also High In Protein And Fibre, Which Satiates The Appetite And Helps Keep You Full For Longer Periods Of Time.

title: Red Pepper Cashew Cream
ingredients:
1. 1 And 12 Cups Cashews
2. 1 Roasted Red Pepper From A Jar Or Roast Your Own If You Have Time
3. 34 Cup Cold Water
4. 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice Or Apple Cider Vinegar
5. 12 Red Onion
6. 1 Garlic Clove
7. 12 Tbsp Olive Or Coconut Oil
8. 1 Tsp Paprika
9. 1 Tsp Turmeric
10. Black Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Makes 1 Large Jar
2. Equipment
3. Food Processor
4. Frying Pan
5. Wooden Spoon
6. Bowl And Water For Soaking The Cashews
7. Measuring Cups
8. Chopping Board And Knife
9. Put The Cashews Into A Bowl, Cover With Cold Water And Allow To Soak For 30 Mins. Remove The Pepper From The Jar So It’S Ready To Use, Or Roast A Fresh Pepper If You Prefer.
10. Roughly Chop The Onion And Garlic And Fry Gently For 5-10 Mins In The Oil, So They Soften And Turn Golden. Add The Turmeric And Paprika After A Couple Of Minutes Of Cooking.
11. * Time Saving Tip *
12. You Can Add The Onion And Garlic Raw If You Prefer, But I Found That My Loved Ones Weren’T Shy About Telling Me How Strongly It Smelled!
13. Drain The Cashews And Add To The Processor With The Cooked Onions, Garlic, Roasted Pepper, Water And Lemon Juice Or Vinegar. Blitz Together On High-Speed, Stopping Every So Often To Scrape Down The Sides. Keep Blending Until A Smooth Texture Has Formed And Then Get A (Big) Tasting Spoon To Try It. Add Black Pepper And (If Needed) Salt, And Give It Another Quick Whizz.
14. * You’Re Now Ready To Enjoy This Creamy Goodness On Crackers Or Open Sandwiches. It’S Also Perfect For Mixing Through Cooked Pasta And Veggies, Serves As A Great Dip Alternative To Hummus, Plus Any Other Tasty Combinations You Discover! Store In An Airtight Jar, And It Will Keep In The Fridge For Up To 5 Days.
15. I’Ve Got Loads More Yummy Vegan Recipes On Lottielovesfood.Com

title: Green Tea-Almond Cake with Coconut Glaze
ingredients:
1. For The Cake
2. 2 Tbsp Flaxseed Meal
3. 34 Cup Nondairy Milk
4. 1 13 Cups Whole Wheat Spelt Or Mixed Glutenfree
5. 2 Tsp Baking Powder
6. 1 Tbsp Matcha Green Tea Powder
7. 1 Tsp Lemon Zest
8. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
9. 12 Tsp Nutmeg
10. 18 Tsp Salt
11. 12 Cup Coconut Oil Melted
12. 12 Cup Coconut Sugar
13. 2 Tsp Vanilla Extract
14. 12 Cup Raw Almonds Toasted And Chopped
15. For The Glaze
16. 1 Can Light Coconut Milk Placed In The Refrigerator Overnight And Unshaken
17. 1 Tbsp Arrowroot Powder
18. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup Or Agave Nectar
19. 12 Tsp Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 425°F. Oil An 8×4-Inch Loaf Pan.
2. In A Medium-Sized Bowl,Whisk Togetherthe Flaxseed Meal And Non-Dairy Milk. Set Aside.
3. In Another Medium-Sized Bowl, Stir Together The Flour, Baking Powder, Matcha, Lemon Zest, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, And Salt.
4. In A Larger Bowl, Whisk Together The Melted Coconut Oil, Coconut Sugar, And Vanilla Extract. Whisk In The Flax Mixture. Add A Third Of The Dry Mixture At A Time To The Wet Mixture, Stirring Well To Combine After Each Addition. After All The Dry Ingredients Are Incorporated, Stir In The Almonds.
5. Scoop The Batter Into The Oiled Loaf Pan, Place In The Oven, And Immediately Lower The Oven Temperature To 375°F. Bake For 20-30 Minutes, Or Until A Toothpick Or Knife Inserted Into The Center Of The Cake Comes Out Clean. Allow To Cool In The Pan For At Least 20 Minutes Before Placing On A Cooling Rack To Cool Completely.
6. While The Cake Bakes, Prepare The Glaze. Carefully Pour Only The Creamy White Liquid At The Top Of The Can Of Coconut Milk Into A Medium-Sized Bowl, Taking Care To Get As Little As Possible Of The Clear Coconut Water At The Bottom Of The Can Into The Bowl. Reserve The Leftover Coconut Water For Smoothies. Whisk In The Arrowroot, Syrup/Nectar, And Vanilla. Place The Glaze In The Refrigerator Until The Cake Has Cooled Completely.
7. Once The Cake Has Cooled Completely, Place It Onto A Baking Sheet And Spoon The Coconut Glaze Over The Top, Letting The Glaze Drizzle Down The Sides Of The Cake. Transfer The Cake Toa Serving Plate And Either Serve Immediately, Or, For A Moister Texture,Allow The Cake To Sit For A Couple Of Hours While The Glaze Soaks In.

title: Sweet French Fries with Tofu Mayo
ingredients:
1. 2 Sweet Potatoes
2. Extra Virgin Olive Oil
3. Sea Salt
4. Tofu Mayonnaise
5. Half Pack Of Silken Tofu
6. 12 Tsp Dry Mustard
7. 12 Tsp Sea Salt
8. 1  Tbsp Lemon Juice
9. 1 Tbsp Rice Malt Syrup
10. 1 Tbsp Apple Balsamic Vinegar
11. Cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 225C/450F.
2. Slice Potatoes Lengthwise Into Half Inch Thick Slices.
3. Cut The Slices Into Half Inch Thick Spears Just Like French Fries.
4. Toss Them With A Generous Amount Of Olive Oil To Coat The Potato Pieces And Sprinkle With Your Choice Of Dried Herbs, I.E. Rosemary/Thyme.
5. Spread In A Rimmed Baking Sheet, Avoiding Overlap And Bake, Uncovered For About 20-25 Minutes, Until Browned And Crisp, Stirring Occasionally To Ensure Even Browning.
6. Remove From Oven And Toss With A Light Seasoning Of Sea Salt.
7. Tofu Mayonnaise:
8. This Is A Smooth And Very Moreish Vegan Mayonnaise.
9. Place Tofu, Dry Mustard, Sea Salt, Apple Balsamic Vinegar, Rice Malt Syrup And Lemon Juice Into The Blender.
10. Blend With Low Speed, And Pour In Slowly The Olive Oil With 2 Teaspoons Of Very Hot Water To Emulsify The Mayonnaise.
11. The Mayonnaise Can Be Kept In The Fridge For 3 Weeks.
12. Enjoy!

title: Cauliflower ‘Chicken’ Keralan Curry
ingredients:
1. Cauliflower Cut Into Florets
2. 1 Aubergine Cut Into Chunks
3. 2 Tbsp Olive Or Vegetable Oil
4. 1 Large Onion
5. 3 Tbsp Keralan Curry Paste
6. 1 Tsp Turmeric
7. 160G Garden Gourmet Mediterranean Fillet Pieces Or Similar
8. 3 Tbsp Desiccated Coconut
9. 400Cups Wunda Unsweetened Or Similar
10. 400G Can Drained Chickpeas
11. Large Handful Cherry Tomatoes
12. 1 Lime Juiced
13. Handful Coriander Leaves
14. Steamed Basmati Rice To Serve
preparation:
1. Heat Oven To 200˚C, (180˚C For Fan Ovens), Gas Mark 6.
2. Coat The Cauliflower And Aubergine In 1Tbsp Of The Oil And Tip Out Onto A Baking Sheet. Roast For 20 Minutes, Turning The Veg Halfway Through Cooking, Until Everything Is Golden And Tender.
3. Soften The Onion In The Remaining Oil In A Large Saucepan. Stir In The Curry Paste And Turmeric To The Saucepan And Cook For A Couple Of Minutes Until Fragrant. Tip In The Garden Gourmet Fillet Pieces And Fry For 2-3 Minutes. Add The Desiccated Coconut, Wunda, Chickpeas, Cauliflower And Aubergine To The Saucepan And Bring To The Boil. Turn Off The Heat And Stir Through The Tomatoes.
4. Add The Lime Juice, Coriander And Season To Taste Before Spooning The Curry Over The Freshly Cooked Rice And Then Dive In!
5. Did You Like This Dish? Try This Vegan Chicken-Style Curry Recipe.

title: Hot Brownie Skillet
ingredients:
1. Dry Ingredients
2. All Purpose Flour  1 Cup
3. Coconut Flour  12 Cup
4. Almond Flour  12 Cup
5. Coconut Sugar  3 Tbsp
6. Baking Powder  1 Tbsp
7. Raw Unsweetened Cocoa Powder  13 Cup
8. Cinnamon  14 Tsp
9. Nutmeg  18 Tsp
10. Ginger  18 Tsp
11. All Spices  18 Tsp
12. Pinch Of Salt
13. Chopped Pecan  14 Cup
14. Dark Chocolate Chips  14 Cup
15. Wet Ingredients
16. Ripe Banana  1
17. Nut Butter  14 Cup Almond Peanut
18. Pumpkin Sauce  34 Cup
19. Maple Syrup  3 Tbsp
20. Flax Egg  2 2 Tbsp Ground Flax Seeds  5 Tbsp Water
21. Vanilla Extract  1 Tsp
22. Chocolate Sauce Ingredients
23. Raw Cocoa Powder  14 Cup
24. Coconut Oil  14 Cup
25. Maple Syrup  1 Tbsp
26. Decoration
27. One Peanut Butter Miiro Popsicle
preparation:
1. Prepare The Brownie
2. Heat The Oven At 350F (180°C).
3. Prepare The Flax Egg By Mixing 2 Tbsp Of Ground Flaxseeds With 5 Tbsp Of Lukewarm Water. Stir Well And Sit While Preparing The Rest.
4. In A Medium Bowl, Mash The Ripe Banana Using A Fork. Add In The Pumpkin Sauce, The Nut Butter, Maple Syrup And Vanilla Extract. Mix Well. Note: You Can Use Any Nut Butter Of Your Choice: Almond Or Cashew Give The Lightest Flavor, But You Can Use Peanut Butter For An Extra Flavor. For The Pumpkin Sauce You Can Simply Make Your Own By Steaming Half A Pumpkin And Blending With A Splash Of Water.
5. Pour The Flax Egg In The Wet Mixture, And Mix Well Until Fully Combined.
6. Prepare The Dry Mixture By Mixing All The Dry Ingredients Except Pecan And Chocolate Chips In A Large Bowl.
7. Pour The Wet Mixture Over The Dry One And Mix Well Using A Wooden Spatula Or Your Hands Until Everything Is Combined And You Obtain An Homogeneous Dough.
8. Add Half Of The Chopped Pecans And Half The Chocolate Chunks And Mix Roughly.
9. Spread The Brownie Dough In A Ovenproof Skillet. Sprinkle The Other Half Of Pecan And Chocolate.
10. Bake In Oven For About 20 Minutes. When Finished, Let Cool Down At Room Temperature A Few Minutes.
11. Prepare The Chocolate Coating And Dress
12. Gently Melt The Coconut Oil In A Double Boiler. Remove From Heat And Mix In The Maple Syrup And Cocoa Powder Until Perfectly Combined.
13. Drizzle The Chocolate Sauce Over The Brownie.
14. Cut Your Favorite Miiro Popsicle In Big Pieces And Spread On The Warm Brownie.

title: Christmas Cake
ingredients:
1. 150G Dairy Free Margarine Softened Take Out Of Fridge Measure What You Need For Cake And Set To One Side For Approx 30 Minutes To Warm Before Starting To Make Your Cake
2. 150G Light Muscovado Sugar
3. Egg Replacement  3 Tablespoons Of Milled Flaxseeds And 9 Tablespoons Of Cold Water Mix And Leave To Thicken
4. 225G Selfraising Flour
5. 400G Luxury Vegan Sweet Mincemeat
6. 175G Mixture Of Glace Cherries Cut Into 4 Rinsed In Water To Remove Stickiness Mixed Peel And Currants
7. 50G Chopped Almonds
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 160Oc/ Fan Or 140Oc/Gas 3.
2. Lightly Grease The Tin Then Line The Base And Sides With Non-Stick Baking Parchment.
3. Measure All Of The Cake Ingredients Into A Large Bowl And Beat Well For 1 Minute Until Thoroughly Combined. Turn Into The Prepared Tin And Level The Surface.
4. Bake For About 1¾ – 2 Hours Or Until Skewer Inserted Into The Centre Comes Out Clean And The Cake Is Shrinking From Sides Of The Tin. Cover The Cake With Foil After 1 Hour If It Is Beginning To Brown Too Much. Leave To Cool In The Tin For 10 Minutes Then Turn Out, Peel Off The Parchment And Finish Cooling On A Wire Rack.
5. Decorate As You Wish. I Like To Melt A Little Apricot Jam, Brush On Cake And Decorate The Top With Nuts And Dried Fruits, Placing Marzipan Festive Shapes Around The Cake.

title: The Really Hungry Burger
ingredients:
1. Olive Oil
2. 6 Big Portobello Mushrooms Roughly Chopped Into Little Bits
3. A Few Sprigs Of Fresh Thyme Leaves Picked
4. Sea Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper
5. 1  400G Tin Of White Beans Haricot Or Cannellini Well Drained
6. 4 Fat Medjool Dates Pitted
7. 2 Cloves Of Garlic Peeled And Finely Chopped
8. A Small Bunch Of Fresh Parsley Finely Chopped
9. 2 Tablespoons Tahini
10. 2 Tablespoons Soy Sauce Or Tamari
11. 200G Cooked And Cooled Brown Rice
12. 100G Raw Weight
13. 50G Breadcrumbs Or Oats
14. Grated Zest Of 1 Unwaxed Lemon
15. To Serve
16. 12 Avocados Peeled And Sliced
17. Tomato Relish Or Ketchup
18. Pickled Cucumber See Above
19. A Few Handfuls Of Spinach Leaves
20. 8 Seeded Burger Buns I Use Wholemeal Ones
preparation:
1. I’Ve Played Around With A Lot Of Recipes Before Settling On This One, Some Full Of Bright Herb Freshness And Grated Veg, Some Packed With Protein-Rich Tofu, And All Were Good, But What I Look For In A Burger Is A Deep Moreish Favour, Savoury And Complex, So This Is The One.
2. I Use Brown Rice Here, But Any Cooked Grain You Have Will Do – Quinoa, Pearl Barley And Farro All Work Well.
3. I Like To Make A Quick Pickled Cucumber To Top These With. Thinly Slice A Quarter Of A Cucumber And Pop It Into A Bowl With A Pinch Of Salt, A Squeeze Of Agave Syrup, And A Good Tablespoon Of White Wine Vinegar, Then Scrunch Together And Leave To Sit While You Make Your Burgers. A Homemade Quick Pickle That Beats A Gherkin Any Day. 🙂
4. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.
5. Get A Large Pan On A Medium Heat And Add A Splash Of Olive Oil. Once The Pan Is Good And Hot, Add The Mushrooms And Thyme And Season With Salt And Pepper. Fry On A Good Heat Until The Mushrooms Have Dried Out And Are Slightly Browned, Then Set To One Side And Leave To Cool.
6. Next, Drain The White Beans And Put Them Into A Food Processor With The Dates, Garlic, Parsley, Tahini And Soy Sauce. Pulse Until You Have A Smoothish Mixture, Then Transfer To A Bowl And Add The Rice, Breadcrumbs, Lemon Zest And The Cooled Mushrooms. Mix Well, Then Put Into The Fridge For 10 Minutes Or So To Firm Up.
7. Once Cooled, Divide The Mixture Into 8 Portions And Shape Into 8 Patties. Place Them On A Baking Tray Lined With Baking Paper And Pop Into The Fridge Until Needed. (This Can Be Done The Day Before – And The Burgers Freeze Well At This Point.)
8. Preheat Your Oven To 230°C/Fan 210°C/Gas 8 And Bake The Burgers For 15 Minutes, Until Nicely Brown. If You Like Cheese On Your Burger, Pop A Slice On Top A Couple Of Minutes Before They Come Out Of The Oven.
9. While Your Burgers Are Cooking, Get Your Toppings Ready. I Go With Avocado, Tomato Relish And The Quick Cucumber Pickle Above, Plus A Few Spinach Leaves. Hummus, Grated Carrot And Sprouts Is Another Favourite, But Feel Free To Improvise And Try It Your Own Way.
10. Once The Burgers Are Golden, Toast Your Buns And Layer Up Your Burgers. I Like To Serve Them With The Sweet Potato Fries. You Can’T Beat A Burger And Chips, And These Ones Are As Healthy As They Are Tasty.

title: Vegan Nuggets Platter
ingredients:
1. 30 X Garden Gourmet Vegan Nuggets
2. 100 Cups Vegan Teriyaki Sauce
3. 20G Fresh Coriander To Garnish
4. Ginger Rice
5. 125G Ginger Peeled And Finely Chopped
6. 3 X Garlic Cloves Peeled And Finely Chopped
7. 100G Onions Peeled And Finely Chopped
8. 20G Vegetable Oil
9. 450G Jasmine Rice
10. 900Cups Water
11. Cracked Black Pepper
12. Asian Coleslaw
13. 750G Pointed Red Cabbage
14. 750G Pointed Green Cabbage
15. 600G Cucumbers Approx 15 Cucumbers
16. 250 Cups Soya Yogurt
17. 25G Fresh Coriander
18. 30G Peanuts
19. 2 X Lime
preparation:
1. To Cook The Ginger Rice – Peel The Ginger, Onions And Garlic And Chop It Finely
2. Heat Up The Oil In A Pot And Brown The Chopped Vegetables Without Them Taking Too Much Colour. Add The Rice And Stir Well
3. Add Water To The Pot And Put On A Lid On. Bring It To The Boil And Let It Simmer On Low Heat For 10 Mins And Let It Hereafter Rest In The Pot For 5-10 Minutes Before Serving
4. To Make The Slaw – Chop The Pointed Cabbage Finely And Cut The Cucumbers In Coarse Pieces
5. Chop The Coriander And The Nuts Coarsely And Mix It With The Cabbage
6. Grate The Lime Peel With The Fine Side Of The Grater And Juice The Lime
7. Mix The Lime Peel And Juice With The Yoghurt And Mix It With The Cabbage Just Before Serving
8. To Cook The Nuggets – To Cook The Nuggets, Place On A Lined Backing Tray With Greaseproof Paper And Bake In Preheat Oven To 180⁰C From Frozen: 8 Minutes
9. To Serve – Skewer Three Crispy Nuggets (Per Portion) On Some Grill Skewers With The Slaw, Ginger Rice, Teriyaki Sauce And Garnish With Coriander.
10. Chef’S Tip:
11. This Recipe Is Also Great As A Family Starter To Share.

title: Chilli Sin Carne
ingredients:
1. 1 Onion
2. 1 Green Pepper
3. 1 Cloves Of Garlic
4. 1 Chili Pepper
5. 750 Cups Canned Sieved Tomatoes
6. 2 Cans Of Kidney Beans 400 G
7. 1 Can Of Borlotti Beans 400 G
8. 1 Tbsp Of Tomato Puree
9. 1 Tl Smoked Paprika Powder Spicy
10. 2 Tbsp Of Oregano
11. Pepper And Salt
12. Olive Oil
13. 1 Cube Of Vegan Chocolate
14. 200 Cups Provamel Soya Alternative To Cream
15. Finely Chopped Red Onion
16. Fresh Coriander
17. Mexican Tortillas
preparation:
1. Provamel Soy Alternative Cream Helps To Make This Vegan Chili Sin Carne.
2. Heat A Tbsp Of Olive Oil In A Thick Bottom Cooking Pot.
3. Finely Chop The Onion, Garlic, Chili And Pepper And Bake In The Olive Oil.
4. Add The Sieved Tomatoes And Tomato Puree After 5 Mins.
5. Season With Oregano, Paprika Powder, Pepper And Salt.
6. Let It Simmer For 20 Mins. Over A Low Heat.
7. Garnish With The Soya Cream, Chopped Red Onion, Coriander And Serve With The Tortillas.

title: Spiced Apple Blondies
ingredients:
1. For The Spiced Apple
2. 1 Bracupsey Apple
3. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
4. 1 Tsp Ginger
5. Tsp Nutmeg
6. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
7. 2 Tbsp Water
8. For The Blondie Mix
9. 1 Tin Chickpeas
10. 1 Tbsp Flax Seeds 3 Tbsp Water
11. 2 Tsp Coconut Oil Solid
12. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
13. 8 Dates Pitted
14. 50G Organic Sultanas Oilfree
15. 2 Tbsp Desiccated Coconut
16. 10 Sprigs Fresh Thyme Leaves Picked
17. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
18. 2 Tsp Baking Powder
19. Tsp Himalayan Pink Salt
20. 1 Tbsp Chia Seeds To Decorate
preparation:
1. Instruction : Time: 25 Minutes
2. Cooking Time: 25 Minutes
3. Heat The Oven To 180°C / 350°F / Gas Mark 4.
4. Prepare The Flax ‘Egg’ By Combining The Flax Seeds And Water In A Bowl And Popping It In The Fridge For Around 15 Minutes.
5. Put The Coconut Oil Into A Ramekin And Heat In The Oven For 5 Minutes, Until Melted.
6. Peel And Core The Apple And Chop It Into Small Pieces. In A Saucepan, Cook On A Medium Heat With The Maple Syrup, Water And Spices. Simmer Until You Have Something Resembling Apple Puree, Stirring Occasionally To Ensure The Maple Syrup Isn’T Burning And Most Of The Water Has Evaporated. Set Aside To Cool.
7. While The Apple Is Cooking You Can Start To Make The Blonde Mix. Drain And Rinse The Chickpeas And Put These, Together With The Dates And The Flax Egg, Into A Mixing Bowl. Use An Electronic Hand Blender Or Processor To Combine.
8. If You Need To, Use A Little Of The Melted Oil To Grease A Brownie Tin And Add The Rest To The Blondie Mix.
9. Stir In The Remaining Ingredients, Except The Chia Seeds. If The Mixture Looks Too Dry You Can Add A Tbsp Of Non-Dairy Milk (This Will Depend On The Amount Of Moisture In Your Apple Puree).
10. Pour The Mixture Into A Brownie Tin And Spread Evenly With A Spatula. Sprinkle The Chia Seeds Across The Top And Bake In The Oven For 25 Minutes.
11. Once Cooled, Remove From The Tin To A Cooling Rack. Slice Into Squares And Store In The Fridge: They Will Firm Up And Keep For Longer.

title: Spicy Moroccan Soup
ingredients:
1. Tbsp Coconut Oil
2. 4 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
3. 2 Large Sweet Potatoes Diced Into Small Cubes
4. 2 Red Peppers Diced Into Small Cubes
5. 3 Tsp Ground Coriander
6. 14 Tsp Ground Cinnamon Optional
7. 14L Stock I Use Vegetable Bouillon Powder
8. Tbsp Tomato Puree
9. 1 Can 235G Of Blackeyed Beans
10. Juice From Half A Lemon
11. 2 Large Red Onions Finely Chopped
12. 3 Celery Sticks Finely Chopped Into Small Cubes
13. 1 Large Carrot Diced Into Small Cubes
14. 25 Tsp Ground Turmeric Or Vitalising Superpowder
15. 3 Tsp Ground Cumin
16. 1 Red Chilli Finely Chopped Deseeded If Required Or 1412 Tsp Dried Chilli Flakes Or Powder Depending On How Hot You Like It
17. 1 Tbsp Soya Sauce Or Tamari
18. 1 Can 400G Chopped Tomatoes
19. Optional 3 Tbsp Protein Powder Eg Pea Protein Soya Bean Protein
20. 20G Fresh Coriander Finely Chopped Reserve Some For The Garnish
21. Optional A Sprinkle Of Ground Flaxseed For Garnish
preparation:
1. In A Deep Pot, Melt The Coconut Oil. Then Add The Chopped Onions, Garlic And Celery. Cook For 5 Mins Until The Onion Is Soft.
2. Add The Diced Sweet Potato, Carrot And Peppers. Sauté For A Further 5 Mins.
3. Stir In The Spices, Chilli Or Chilli Flakes/ Powder, Stock, Soya Sauce Or Tamari, Tomato Puree, Chopped Tomatoes And Black-Eyed Beans. Bring To The Boil And Then Allow To Simmer On A Low Heat For 15-20 Mins, Until The Vegetables Are Tender.
4. Stir In The Protein Powder, If Using.
5. Stir In The Lemon Juice And ¾ Of The Chopped Fresh Coriander. Ladle Into Bowls And Garnish With The Remaining Chopped Coriander And Sprinkle Of Ground Flaxseed If Desired. Enjoy!
6. So Man
7. Www.Sobody.Co.Uk
8. Hello! I Am So From Sobodyuk. I Am A Gym Bunny, Healthy Food Blogger & A Geeky Scientist! These Days My Lab Is The Kitchen! I Love Creating Delicious, Healthy, Wholefood, Clean-Eating, Nutrition-Dense Recipes To Maximise Performance & Health. My Recipes Include Paleo, Low Carb, Vegan, Vegetarian, Gluten Free.

title: Celeriac Monster Pot Roast and Plant-Pushing Cold Cuts
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Onion Quartered And Kept Together
2. 2 Large Carrots Quartered
3. 2 Large Russet Potatoes Quartered
4. 5 Garlic Cloves
5. 14 Cup  60Cups Olive Oil Optional
6. 1 Tbsp Coarse Salt
7. 1 Tbsp Black Pepper
8. 1 Large Celeriac Celery Root  Scrubbed Clean With A Brush But Kept Unpeeled
9. 14 Cup  60Cups Vegetable Broth Beer Or Water
10. 1 Bay Leaf
11. 1 Tbsp Chopped Thyme Optional
12. 1 Tbsp Chopped Rosemary Optional
13. Flat Leaf Parsley For Garnish
14. Horseradish For Serving Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 300.
2. In A Large Bowl, Add The First Four Cut Vegetables, And Carefully Toss With Couple Tablespoonsof Oil And Pinch Of Salt And Pepper To Coat. Transfer The Contents Into The Bottom Of A Dutch Oven.
3. In The Same Bowl, Coat The Exterior Of The Celeriac With Oil, More Salt And Pepper And Place On Top Of The Vegetables In The Dutch Oven.
4. Add Liquid And Bay Leaf, Then Cover And Roast Low And Slow For 3 1/2 To 4 Hours Until Done. You Can Tell When It’S Finished When You Can Pierce Through The Celery Root With A Long Skewer Easily.
5. Remove From The Oven, Carve Slices Of Celeriac Monster And Serve With The Vegetables. Garnish With The Fresh Herbs And Parsley, And Serve With Horseradish, If Desired.

title: Perfect Potato Salad
ingredients:
1. 750G Small Potatoes
2. 1 Bunch Of Spring Onions
3. 6 Radishes
4. 6 Cornichons
5. 1 Tablespoon Capers
6. 2 Tablespoons Wholegrain Mustard
7. 1 Tablespoon White Wine Vinegar
8. 3 Tablespoons Olive Oil
9. Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper To Taste
10. 2 Tablespoons Roughly Chopped Chives
11. 2 Tablespoons Freshly Chopped Flatleaf Parsley
preparation:
1. Cook 750G Small Potatoes In Salted Boiling Water Until Tender, Drain And Cool Slightly, Then Cut Into Bite-Size Pieces And Tip Into A Large Bowl.
2. Trim And Finely Slice 1 Bunch Of Spring Onions.
3. Cut 6 Radishes Into Fine Matchsticks.
4. Roughly Chop 6 Cornichons And 1 Tablespoon Capers.
5. In A Small Bowl Whisk Together 2 Tablespoons Wholegrain Mustard, 1 Tablespoon White Wine Vinegar And 3 Tablespoons Olive Oil And Season With Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper.
6. Pour The Dressing Over The Potatoes, Add The Spring Onions, Radishes, Cornichons, Capers, 2 Tablespoons Roughly Chopped Chives And 2 Tablespoons Freshly Chopped Flatleaf Parsley And Gently Mix Together.
7. Serve At Room Temperature.

title: Traditional Irish Porridge Bread
ingredients:
1. 400G Of Glutenfree Oats Equivalent To Two Yoghurt Cartons Filled With Oats We Used Bunalun
2. 1 500G Tub Of Alpro Plain Yoghurt Or Equivalent
3. 1 Tsp Baking Soda
4. Tsp Salt
5. 1 Tbsp Soya Milk Or Any Plantbased Milk You Want
6. 1 Tbsp Treacle
7. A Handful Of Mixed Seeds
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 180 C/ 350 F/ Gas Mark 4.
2. Line Your Bread Tin With Greaseproof Paper Or Grease It With Oil Or Soya Butter.
3. Add The Full Tub Of Alpro Yoghurt To A Large Bowl.
4. Fill The Empty Yoghurt Tub With Oats And Pour That Amount Into The Bowl With The Yoghurt. Scrape Out Any Bits Sticking To The Sides.
5. Repeat This Step So You Should Have 2 Yoghurt Tub Measures Full Of Porridge Oats In The Bowl.
6. Add All The Rest Of Your Ingredients To The Bowl Too.
7. Fold All Your Ingredients Together.
8. If It Seems A Bit Dry Add Another Tbsp Of Milk Until The Mixture Is Like A Wet Oaty Dough.
9. When The Mixture Is Well Combined Add It To Your Bread Tin And Smooth The Top.
10. Sprinkle The Seeds Over The Top.
11. Bake For Approx. 45 – 55 Minutes And When It Is 10 Minutes From The End Take The Bread Out Of The Tin And Turn It Upside Down In The Tine And Put Back Into The Oven. Cook It Like That For The Last 10 Minutes.
12. When It’S Ready Take It Out And Turn It Upside Down On A Wire Rack And Leave It Until It’S Cool. Then Enjoy!

title: Cool Sesame & Dino Kale Yuba Noodles
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Of Hodo Yuba Sheets
2. 1 Bunch Of Lacinato Kale
3. 13 Cup Tahini
4. 13 Cup Rice Vinegar
5. 4 T Glutenfree Tamari
6. 2 T Sesame Oil
7. 1 T Sugar
8. 13 T Salt
9. 7G Ginger
10. 5 Cloves Garlic
11. Optional To Garnish Julienned Cucumbers Toasted Sesame Seeds Chopped Parseley Andor Cilantro Red Chili Flakes
preparation:
1. Remove Yuba From Packet And Place On Cutting Board. (There’S No Need To Unfold The Sheets, But If You Are Unfamiliar With The Yuba, There Are Two Folded Sheets In The Pack, Fyi!) Cut Yuba To Desired Width, Like You Would With Regular Pasta – For This Dish, I Prefer About 1/2″ Wide Noodles. Toss Cut Yuba Into A Large Mixing Bowl And Pull Apart To Separate.
2. Rinse The Kale And Strip The Main Vein Out, Reserve To Snack On, Stir-Fry Or Pickle! Cut Similarly To The Yuba Noodles In Width (Hint: Cut Lengthwise To Get Longer Rather Than Shorter Strips.) Toss Chopped Kale In With The Yuba And Set Aside.
3. For The Sesame Sauce, These Are The Basic Ingredient Quantities, But As Always, Adjust To Taste! (You Can Use This Sauce With Anything, By The Way, Regular Noodles, As A Dipping Sauce For Veggies & Tofu, Etc Etc Etc.) Peel Ginger And Grate, Conserving The Liquid As Well. Peel And Mince The Garlic (I Tend To Drop Both Ginger And Garlic Into The Food Processor At The Same Time And Mince Into Almost A Paste.) Add All Other Ingredients And Puree Together.
4. Add Sauce To Yuba And Kale And Mix Well! Garnish As You Like. As A Side Dish, Serves 4-6 And As A Main, 2-3.
5. Sesame Sauce Can Be Prepared Up To A Few Days In Advance. The Salad Can Be Prepared A Day In Advance – Yuba And Kale Both Hold Up Very Well, And The Kale Actually Softens Up A Bit With Time! (Perfect For Picnic Planning.)

title: Orange Goji Smoothie
ingredients:
1. 1 Orange Peeled And Segmented
2. Frozen Banana
3. 1  Tbsp Goji Berries
4. 1 Tbsp Ground Flaxseed Or Chia Seeds
5. Juice From Half A Lime
6. 70 Cups 13 Cup Chilled Coconut Water
7. 2 Tbsp Of Pulsin Protein Powder Pea Or Soya Bean Work Well Or 25G Silken Tofu Or Squash Or 10G Of Cashews
8. 5 Ice Cubes
9. Optional Ingredients
10. 1 Tsp Baobab Superfruit Powder
11. 1 Tsp Camu Berry Powder
12. Goji Berries To Garnish
preparation:
1. Throw All The Ingredients In A Blender.
2. Whizz Until Smooth. Taste And Adjust If Required. This Smoothie Is Sweet Enough For My Palate, But It You Want It Sweeter, You Can Add ½ Tsp Agave Or Date Syrup Or A Few Drops Of Stevia.
3. Pour Into A Glass. Decorate With A Few Goji Berries And Serve. Enjoy!
4. So Man
5. Www.Sobody.Co.Uk
6. Hello! I Am So From Sobodyuk. I Am A Gym Bunny, Healthy Food Blogger & A Geeky Scientist! These Days My Lab Is The Kitchen! I Love Creating Delicious, Healthy, Wholefood, Clean-Eating, Nutrition-Dense Recipes To Maximise Performance & Health. My Recipes Include Paleo, Low Carb, Vegan, Vegetarian, Gluten Free.

title: Plant Powered ‘Winter’ Bowl
ingredients:
1. 1 Tin Of Chickpeas
2. 1 Tsp Cumin
3. Tsp Garlic Granules
4. 2 Tsp Olive Oil
5. Salt And Pepper
6. 2 Handfuls Of Rocket
7. 1 Pouch Of Steamed Brown Rice
8. 6 Falafels
9. 1 Roasted Pepper From A Jar Cut Into Strips
10. 1 Avocado Peeled And Sliced
11. Red Onion Finely Sliced
12. 10 Baby Carrots Peeled
13. A Handful Of Green Or Black Olives
14. 2 Heaped Tbsp Alpro Plain Unsweetened Big Pot
15. 1 Tsp Harissa Paste
16. 2 Wedges Of Lemon
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180C.
2. Drain The Chickpeas And Pat Dry With Kitchen Towel. Place In A Bowl And Add In The Cumin, Garlic Granules, Olive Oil And Season Generously With Salt And Pepper. Toss To Coat In The Spices And Roast In The Oven On A Flat Baking Tray For 20 Minutes Or Until Slightly Crispy.
3. Cook The Rice As Per The Packet Instruction :, Spoon Into 2 Bowls.
4. Top The Bowls With The Falafel, Sliced Avocado, Sliced Red Pepper, Sliced Red Onion, Rocket, Olives And Baby Carrots.
5. Spoon The Alpro Plain Unsweetened Big Pot Into The Middle And Top Each Bowl With A Little Of The Harissa Marbling This Into The Dressing.
6. Sprinkle Over The Chickpeas And Serve.

title: Quick Stir Fry
ingredients:
1. Olive Oil
2. 1 X Large Onion
3. 3 Cloves Of Garlic
4. Tamarisoy Sauce
5. A Teaspoon Of Chopped Ginger
6. A Good Sprinkle Of Cayenne Pepper Or Chilli Powder
7. 12 Packet Of Frozen Edamame Beans
8. 1 X Pack Of Stir Fry Vegetable Mix
9. 12 Packet Of Kale
10. 1 X Pack Of Marinated Tofu
preparation:
1. Pour Some Boiling Water From The Kettle Into A Pan, Put On A Low Heat And Chuck In Your Edamame Beans (These Need Approx. 5 Minutes To Cook And Should Only Be On A Simmer, Never A Boil)
2. In A Fry Pan, Add Some Olive Oil And Put On A Medium Heat
3. Chop Up Your Onion And Throw In The Pan
4. Chop/Mince Your Garlic And Ginger And Add To The Pan After A Minute Or Two
5. Add A Good Shake Or Two Of Cayenne Pepper/Chili Powder And Stir Well
6. Add A Generous Splash Or Two Of Soy Sauce And Mix
7. Wash Your Stir Fry Mix And Add To The Pan, Stirwell
8. Wash Your Kale, Roughly Chop And Add To The Pan. Mix In Well So That The Kale Iscombined In With The Veggies
9. Your Edamame Beans Should Be Ready Now, So Drain Into A Colander And Set Aside (Briefly)
10. If The Kale Is Starting To Wilt And Darken In Colour, Open The Tofu And Chuck Into The Pan. Mix Well
11. Add The Edamame Beans And Stir In Well
12. Serve And Eat Without Hesitation!

title: Roast Potatoes with Peppers, Garlic and Creamy Tahini Sauce
ingredients:
1. 1Kg Floury Potatoes  I Recommend Maris Pipers Or King Edwards
2. 4 Tbsp Olive Oil
3. 5 Cloves Of Garlic
4. 3 Stems Of Rosemary
5. 1 Jar Of Roasted Peppers In Oil
6. For The Tahini Sauce
7. 1 Tbsp Tahini Light Or Dark
8. 2 Tbsp Water
9. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil  Or Use The Oil From The Jar Of Peppers
10. 1 Tsp Cider Vinegar Or 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice
11. 1 Tsp Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Peel And Cut The Potatoes Into Large Bite Size Chunks. Place Them In A Large Saucepan And Cover With Water. Bring To The Boil And Then Leave At A Rolling Simmer For 10 Minutes. Meanwhile, Pour The Oil Into A Large Mixing Bowl And Add The Garlic Cloves (Skin On) And A Generous Pinch Of Sea Salt.
2. Drain The Potatoes And Then Tip Into The Bowl Of Oil And Garlic. Mix Together, Not Minding If The Potatoes Mar On The Edges – This Will Add To Their Crispness Later. Tip The Potatoes Onto A Baking Tray, Scatter Over The Rosemary And Roast For 1 Hour In The Oven Or Until Golden And Crunchy.
3. While The Potatoes Are Roasting, Make Up The Tahini Sauce. Place The Tahini And Water Into A Bowl And Stir Together Until Completely Smooth. Pour In The Oil, Cider Vinegar (Or Lemon Juice If Using), Maple Syrup And Season With Salt And Pepper. Stir Together Until You Have A Smooth And Creamy Sauce. Taste And Add Any Extra Seasoning If You Think It Needs It.
4. When The Potatoes Are Ready, And Crisp And Golden, Tip Them Out Onto A Serving Platter, Discarding The Rosemary Stalks And Taking The Roasted Garlic Cloves And Squeezing The Soft Garlic Interior Into The Tahini Sauce. Now Scatter Over The Peppers And Mix With The Potatoes, Before Drizzling Over The Tahini Sauce And Serving Immediately.

title: Ginger and Cinnamon Cookies
ingredients:
1. 60Cups  14 Cup Nutty Bruce Activated Almond Mlk Or Your Preferred Plant Milk
2. 125Cups  12 Cup Vegetable Or Coconut Oil
3. 500G  2 Cups Wholemeal Flour
4. 1 Tsp Baking Soda
5. 1 Tbsp Ground Cinnamon
6. 1 Tbsp Ground Ginger
7. 12 Tsp Salt
8. 200G  1 Cup Browncoconut Sugar
preparation:
1. Sift The Dry Ingredients (Flour, Baking Soda, Cinnamon, Ginger, Salt & Sugar) Into A Bowl And Mix Together.
2. Add The Wet Ingredients (Almond Milk & Oil) And Mix Together Until Combined To Form A Dough.
3. Roll Out 12 Balls Of The Dough And Place On A Lined Baking Sheet With Plenty Of Space Between Them (They Will Spread A Little).
4. Bake At 180 Degrees For 10 Minutes, Then Allow To Cool On The Tray.

title: A Great Big Lunchtime Salad Bowl
ingredients:
1. 2 X Baby Gem Lettuce
2. Half A Large Bag Of Kale
3. 1 X Red Pepper
4. 1 X Green Pepper
5. 3 X Celery Stalks
6. About 10Cm Of Cucumber
7. 2 X Gherkins
8. A Good Handful Of Kalamata And Green Olives
9. Half A Bag Of Readytoeat Puy Lentils
10. 1 X Packet Of Cauldron Marinated Tofu Or Similar By Another Brand
11. Balsamic Vinegar
12. Olive Oil
13. Sunflower Seeds Toasted
14. Salt And Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. You Can Really Do This In Any Particular Order. Ultimately It All Gets Mixed Up!
2. In A Fry Pan Chuck A Good Handful Or Two Of Sunflower Seeds And Dry Fry. You Want Them Slightly Browned, So They Have A Lovely Nutty Taste. Put Them To The Side While You Do The Rest
3. Rip Up The Lettuce Heads Into A Colander And Wash. Then Add The Kale And Wash, Massaging As You Go. (Massaging Kale Seems Hilarious At First, But It Does Help It To Soften, And Basically You’Re Just Rubbing It Between Your Fingers. When I First Started Eating Raw Kale I Found It Quite Tough, So The More You Massage It Then Softer It Gets. If The Kale Is Very Fresh You May Hardly Need To Do This. It Really Is A Case Of Personal Taste. I Don’T Notice The Toughness Of Kale In The Same Way I Used To, Because I Eat It Such A Lot.) Rip The Kale And Lettuce Into Smaller Pieces, And Discard Any Woody Kale Stalks
4. Chop Up Your Peppers, Celery, Cucumber, Gherkins, Olives And Chuck In A Big Bowl
5. Add The Puy Lentils And Marinated Tofu And Mix Well
6. Add The Lettuce And Kale Bit By Bit, Mixing As You Go. A Good Salad Is One Where You Get A Bit Of Everything, So Try To Evenly Distribute
7. Add The Sunflower Seeds, A Good Splash Of Olive Oil And A Drizzle Of Balsamic Vinegar
8. Crack Pepper Over The Top And A Little Salt If You Think It Needs It
9. Serve In Big Bowls And Enjoy!
10. Additions:Crusty Bread, Hummus, More Olives, Guacamole, Aubergine Dip Ora Tomato, Red Onion And Basil Salad All Go Well With This. Create A Table Of Colour With The Salad As The Centre Piece! Also Perfect Picnic Grub On A Lovely Summer Day. This Is A Filling Salad Though, And Delicious Just As It Is.

title: Simple Summer Corn Salad
ingredients:
1. 4 Ears Corn
2. 1 Cup Cherry Tomatoes
3. 1 Cup Cilantro
4. 12 Large Cucumber
5. 12 Bell Pepper
6. 12 Medium Shallot
7. 1 Lemon
8. 1 Lime
9. 4 Cloves Garlic
10. 12 Medium Serrano Or Jalapeo Pepper
11. A Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Hold The Corn Upright In A Mixing Bowl, Cut The Corn Kernels Off The Cob In A Downward Motion.
2. Cube The Cucumbers, Halve The Tomatoes, Mince The Garlic, Shallot, Cilantro And Peppers, Throw It All In The Mixing Bowl.
3. Juice The Lemon And Lime.
4. Mix Everything Together Well And Enjoy!
5. Notes
6. You Can Refrigerate This Dish For Up To A Week. You Will End Up With A Lot Of Juice, I Just Drink It, But You Could Also Use This Juice As A Marinade Or Pour It Over Rice.

title: Katsu Curry
ingredients:
1. Half A Medium Butternut Squash Or 1 Large Aubergine Or 1 Block Smoked Tofu
2. 1 Onion
3. 2 Large Garlic Cloves
4. 15G Root Ginger
5. Oilwater
6. 1Tsp Garam Masala
7. 2Tsp Curry Powder
8. Tsp Ground Turmeric
9. 35G Glutenfree Cornflakes Blitzed In A Blender Or Breadcrumbs
10. Tsp Salt
11. 1Tbsp Sashimi Togarashi Optional
12. 30G Cornflourcornstarch
13. 3Tbsp Water
14. 120G Short Grain Rice
preparation:
1. Prep Time: 30 Mins
2. Cook Time: 40 Mins
3. Preheat Your Oven To 200C/390F/Gm6.
4. Chop Squash Into Slices, Around 2Cm Wide. There Is No Need To Peel Them At This Stage.
5. Place On A Baking Tray And Bake In The Oven For 20 Mins. (If Using Aubergine You Can
6. Griddle It. If Using Tofu You Can Bake With A Small Amount Of Oil For Around 20 Mins.)
7. To Make The Sauce, Roughly Chop The Onion And Garlic Cloves. Then Chop The Ginger,
8. Slightly Smaller Than The Onion And Garlic. Then Add To A Blender And Blend Until Smooth.
9. To Make The Sauce Add Some Oil To A Pan On A Medium Heat. Add The Paste, Making Sure To Stir Often. If It Begins To Stick You Can Add A Little Water. Cook Until Golden Brown. Add Garam Masala, Curry Powder And Ground Turmeric And Mix For A Minute. Then Slowly Add More Water Until You Get The Desired Sauce Consistency. Then Add A Little More Water And Leave On A Low Heat, Stirring Occasionally.
10. Remove The Skins From Roasted Squash Pieces.
11. Add 3Tbsp Water To The Cornflour/Cornstarch And Mix In A Bowl.
12. In A Separate Bowl Add The Cornflakes Or Breadcrumbs The Salt And Sashimi Togarashi
13. Then Mix.
14. Dip The Squash Pieces Into The Cornflour Mix And Then Press Into The Breadcrumb Mix And Fry In A Pan With A Little Oil. Repeat This With All The Pieces And Cook Until Golden Brown.
15. Assemble The Rice, Sauce And Butternut Pieces On A Plate And Enjoy!

title: Summer Rolls
ingredients:
1. 1 Small Red Cabbage
2. 2 Carrots
3. 1 Cucumber
4. Bunch Of Spring Onions
5. Bunch Of Fresh Coriander
6. 1 Or 2 Limes
7. Soy Sauce
8. Marinated Tofu Either Prebought Or Homemade
9. Crushed Peanuts
10. Dipping Sauce Of Your Choice Sweet Chilli Sriracha Etc
11. 1 Pack Of Rice Paper
preparation:
1. The Key To This Recipe Is The Instruction :, Which Only Takes About 10 Minutes, So First Things First Get Your Veggies And Condiments Ready And Arranged In Front Of You.
2. Shred The Cabbage And Carrot, If You Have A Food Processor With A Slicer Attachment Then That’S Perfect, Otherwise Julienne Or Grate Them.
3. Cut The Cucumber Into Inch-Long Lengths And Then Match-Stick Them.
4. Cut The Spring Onions Into Inch-Long Lengths And Then Cut Into Quarters.
5. Smash Up The Peanuts (Use Plain, Non-Roasted With No Skins).
6. Cut The Limes Into Quarters (If You Bash Them On The Work Surface Before Cutting Them You’Ll Get More Juice Out).
7. Get The Marinated Tofu Out And Ready In Front Of You.
8. Roughly Chop The Coriander.
9. Making These Is A Bit Like A Production Line, So Arrange All Of The Above In A Way That All The Pieces Are Accessible, Then Open The Rice Paper And Get A Large, Shallow Dish And Fill It With Warm Water.
10. Soak One Sheet Of Rice Paper In The Warm Water Until It Becomes Pliable, But Not Totally Floppy. This Should Be About 10 – 20 Seconds; It’Ll Continue To Soften Up Once You Take It Out Of The Water.
11. Lay The Sheet Of Rice Paper In Front Of You, And Then Add Into The Middle Of The Rice Paper In A Line, The Cabbage, Carrot, Cucumber And Spring Onion, Tofu, A Pinch Of Peanuts And Coriander And A Squeeze Of Lime. The Trick Here Is To Not Overfill Them As You’Re Going To Roll Them Up.
12. Fold In The Left And Right Sides Of The Rice Paper, Then Fold Up The Bottom To Cover The Ingredients (Think Of Making An Envelope), Then Roll The Rice Paper And Ingredients To Make A Roll.
13. Place On A Plate And Repeat Steps 1-3 Until You Have Enough Summer Rolls.
14. Serve With Additional Lime And Coriander And With A Selection Of Dipping Sauces.
15. Did You Enjoy This Recipe? Check Out These Rainbow Rolls With Peanut Dipping Sauce!

title: Grilled Almond Buttah and Fresh Berry Sandwiches
ingredients:
1. Vegan Butter Room Temp
2. 14 Cup  50G Almond Butter
3. 4 Pieces Of Whole Grain Bread
4. 12 Cup  100G Fresh Berries Of Your Choice
5. A Few Mint Leaves Torn To Shreds
6. 2 Tbsp Maple Syrup Or Coconut Nectar
preparation:
1. Makes 2 Sandwiches
2. Spread A Small Amount Of Butter On One Side Of Each Slice Of Bread, Make Sure It Is Room Temp And Spreadable.
3. Smear Almond Butter Over The Unbuttered Side Of Two Of The Pieces Of Bread. Top With A Generous Amount Of Fresh Berries In Any Artistic Way You Like, Add A Few Mint Leaves, Don’T Be Shy About Piling Them On.Drizzle Maple Syrup On Top Of The Berries And Place Theother Slice Of Bread, Buttered Side Up, On Top.
4. On Medium Heat, Heat Up A Cast Iron Or Grill Pan. Place The Sandwich Into The Pan And Press Down Lightly With A Spatula. After A Minute, Flip And Repeat On The Other Side, Repeat As Needed Until Golden Brown. Much Like Roasting Marshmallows Over An Open Fire, Heat Until Your Desired Griddled Colour Is Achieved.
5. Remove From Heat, Slice Into Fourths, Garnish With Fresh Mint And Serve Warm.
6. Options:Try This With All Sorts Of Combos, Different Seasonal Berries, Fresh Sliced Strawberries Etc. Works Great When You’Re Trying To Cut Down On Processed Sugar Intake And Sugary Jams.

title: Apricot-Almond Quinoa Muffins
ingredients:
1. Cup Uncooked Quinoa
2. 1 Cup Water
3. 1 Cup Nondairy Milk
4. 1 Tbsp Ground Flaxseed
5. Very Ripe Banana Mashed
6. 4 Tbsp Maple Syrup
7. Tsp Vanilla Extract
8. 1  Cups White Whole Wheat Spelt Or Mixed Flour
9. Cup Ground Almond
10. 1  Tsp Baking Powder
11. Tsp Sea Salt
12. Tsp Ground Cinnamon
13. Tsp Ground Cardamom
14. Cup Finely Chopped Dried Apricots
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 350ºf. Lightly Oil Enough Mini Muffin Pan To Yield 48 Mini Muffins, Or One 12-Cup, Regular-Sized Muffin Pan.
2. In A Small Saucepan, Bring The Quinoa To The Boil, Then Cover The Pot, Reduce The Heat To Its Lowest Setting, And Cook For 25 Minutes. Turn Off The Heat And Let Stand, Covered, For 10 Minutes. Uncover The Quinoa, Fluff With A Fork, And Set Aside.
3. In A Medium-Sized Bowl, Whisk Together The Non-Dairy Milk, Flaxseed Meal (Flaxseed Mixed With 3Tbsp Water) Mashed Banana, Maple Syrup, And Vanilla.
4. In A Large Bowl, Combine The Flour, Almond Meal, Baking Powder, Salt, And Spices.
5. Add The Wet Ingredients To The Dry, Mixing Until Just Incorporated. Gently Fold In The Cooked Quinoa And Apricots.
6. Scoop The Batter (About 2 Tsp Per Mini Muffin, Or A Scant ¼ Cup Per Regular-Sized Muffin) Into The Prepared Muffin Pans And Bake Until A Toothpick Or Sharp Knife Inserted Into The Center Of A Muffin Comes Out Clean (15 Minutes For Mini Muffins, 20 Minutes For Regular Muffins)

title: Beetroot Panzanella
ingredients:
1. 2 Large Ripe Tomatoes
2. 1 Thick Slice Of Sourdough Bread
3. 1 Clove Garlic
4. A Sprig Of Fresh Rosemary
5. 1 Tbsp Salt And Pepper
6. 2 Beetroots Boiled Peeled And Diced
7. A Handful Of Curly Kale Or Cavolo Nero Shredded And Blanched For 3 Minutes In Boiling Water
8. 8 Cherry Tomatoes Halved
9. 14 Red Onion Finely Sliced
10. 1 Tbsp Hazelnuts Roughly Chopped
11. Dressing
12. 2 Tsp Olive Oil
13. 1 Tsp Red Wine Vinegar
14. 12 Tsp Maple Syrup
15. Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat The Grill On High.
2. Roughly Chop The Tomatoes And Tip Into A Large Bowl. Squash Them With Your Hands Until All The Flesh Is Reduced To Juice.
3. Rub The Slice Of Bread With The Clove Of Garlic And Crushed Rosemary. Drizzle With Olive Oil And Place On A Baking Sheet Under The Preheated Grill. Toast On Both Sides Until Golden Then Carefully Cut Into Rough Cubes And Add To The Tomatoes In The Mixing Bowl. Mix Together And Set Aside For Ten Minutes While You Prepare The Remaining Vegetables.
4. In A Separate Small Bowl Whisk Together The Dressing Ingredients.
5. Add All The Other Ingredients To The Tomatoes And Bread And Mix Well.
6. Drizzle Over The Dressing, Plate And Enjoy.

title: Aubergine Chickpea Stew with Fresh Flatbreads
ingredients:
1. For The Stew
2. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
3. 1 Large Onion Finely Sliced
4. 4 Cloves Of Garlic Peeled And Crushed
5. 1 Tsp Fresh Parsley Stalks
6. Tsp Ground Cumin
7. Tsp Ground Coriander
8. Tsp Ground Nutmeg
9. 1 Tsp Ground Cinnamon
10. Tsp Smoked Paprika
11. Tsp Ground Cloves
12. 2 Aubergines Eggplant Approx 600G Halved Lengthways Then Sliced Into 1Cm Semicircles
13. 1 X 400G Tin Chickpeas Drained Keep The Liquid To Use For Aquafaba In Another Recipe
14. 2 X 400G Tins Peeled Plum Tomatoes
15. 1 Tbsp Light Brown Sugar
16. 500Cups Vegetable Stock
17. Juice Of 1 Lemon
18. For The Flatbreads
19. 130G Strong White Bread Flour
20. 350G Plain White Flour
21. 1 Tsp Fine Sea Salt
22. 300Cups Lukewarm Water
23. 2 Tsp Quick Yeast
24. 1 Tsp Sugar
preparation:
1. To Make The Stew:
2. Preheat The Oven To 200C (Fan).
3. Place A Cast-Iron Dutch Oven (With Lid) Over A Medium/Low Heat And Add The Oil.
4. Once The Pan Is To Temperature, Add The Onion And Fry Lightly For A Minute. Add The Garlic And Parsley Stalks Before Frying For A Further 2 Minutes. Do Not Allow The Onions Or Garlic To Brown.
5. Add The Spices And Stir Well To Coat The Onion. Add The Aubergine, Chickpeas, Tinned Tomatoes, Brown Sugar, And Vegetable Stock. Stir Well.
6. Cover The Pot With The Lid And Place In The Preheated Oven For 90 Minutes, Removing To Stir Every Half Hour.
7. While The Stew Cooks, Make The Flatbreads.
8. To Make The Flatbreads:
9. Combine The Flours And Salt In The Bowl Of A Stand Mixer Fitted With The Dough Hook. If You Don’T Have A Stand Mixer, Just Use A Medium Sized Bowl.
10. Place 100 Ml Of The Water Into A Small Bowl And Add The Sugar And Yeast. Mix Well And Set Aside To Allow The Yeast To Bloom.
11. Mix The Yeast Mixture Into The Flour Along With The Rest Of The Water. If Using A Stand Mixer, Knead Using The Dough Hook Attachment For Roughly 8-10 Minutes, Until The Dough Is Smooth. If Kneading By Hand, Sprinkle A Counter With Flour And Knead Vigorously For 8-10 Minutes.
12. Transfer The Dough To A Lightly Oiled Bowl, Cover With A Damp Tea-Towel And Leave To Proof Somewhere Room Temperature For At Least One Hour.
13. Once Proofed, Punch Down The Dough To Remove The Larger Air Bubbles.
14. Lightly Flour A Rimmed Baking Tray. Turn The Dough Out Onto A Clean Surface And Slice The Dough Into 8 Even Pieces. Roll Them Into Tight Balls And Place On The Floured Tray To Prove, Covered With A Damp Tea-Towel. Leave To Proof A Second Time For Around 40 Minutes.
15. Once Proofed, Roll Out Each Ball To Around 15Cm. Place A Dry, Cast-Iron Skillet Over Medium Heat.
16. Place One Flatbread In The Skillet And Cook Until Puffed And Bubbly. Flip After Around 3 Minutes, Making Sure The Bottom Isn’T Burning. Cook For A Further Minute Or Two On The Second Side Before Removing. Repeat With All Of The Flatbreads. Wrap The Cooked Flatbreads In A Clean Tea-Towel To Keep Them Warm.

title: Creamy Sesame Arame with Skinny Soba Somen Noodles
ingredients:
1. Pack Skinny Soba Somen Noodles
2. Cup Arame Seaweed Rinsed
3. Filtered Water
4. Cup Sauerkraut
5. 2 Tsp Sesame Tahini
6. Cup Fresh Or Frozen Corn
7. 1 Thinly Sliced Spring Onion
8. Zest From One Lemon
preparation:
1. Bring A Large Pot Of Water To A Boil And Cook The Soba Noodles For 3 Minutes.
2. Drain And Rinse In Cold Water, Set Aside.
3. Place The Rinsed Arame In A Small Pan And Add Enough Filtered Water To Cover, Bring To A Boil And Simmer On Low Heat For 15 Minutes.
4. Gently Stir In The Sauerkraut, Tahini And Corn And Simmer For 5 Minutes.
5. Arrange The Soba Noodles In A Bowl And Top With The Creamy Arame.
6. Garnish With The Spring Onions And Lemon Zest.
7. Delicious!

title: Whole Roasted Eggplant Parm-Eh-Ish
ingredients:
1. For The Cauliflowercashew Buttah Base
2. 1 Small Head Cauliflower Bottom Stem Removed Cleaned And Dismembered Into Large Pieces
3. 1 Cup  200G Raw Cashews Soaked In Water For At Least 1 Hour Or Overnight Then Strained And Rinsed
4. 45 Medium Garlic Cloves
5. 12 Tsp Coarse Salt
6. 2 Tbsp Rice Vinegar
7. 1 Bay Leaf
8. 2 Cups Water
9. For The Eggplant
10. 12 Mediumsized Eggplants
11. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
12. 12 Tsp Coarse Salt Jacobsens Sea Salt
13. 12 Cup  100G Cauliflower Buttah
14. 300G Crushed Kettle Potato Chips Salt  Cracked Pepper
15. 4 Cherry Tomatoes Sliced
16. Small Handful Of Fresh Basil Leaves Washed And Lightly Packed
preparation:
1. To Make The Cauliflower-Cashew Buttah Base
2. In A Medium-Sized Sauce Pot, Add The Dismembered Cauliflower, Cashews, Garlic, Salt, Rice Vinegar And Bay Leaf Along With 2 Cups Of Water And Cover.
3. Heat On Medium-High Until It Reaches A Slow Boil, Then Steam For 10-15 Minutes Until The Cauliflower Is Cooked Throughout And Breaks Apart Easily. Let It Cool, Then Strain And Remove The Bay Leaf.
4. Transfer The Mixture To A High-Speed Blender. Start Blending On Low Speed And, Using Damper/Plunger, Mash All The Ingredients Down To Ensure Everything Gets Blended. Add A Few Splashes Of Water Or Non-Dairy Milk Only If Absolutely Needed (We’Re Looking To Create As Thick Of A Mixture As Possible For The Buttah So The Less Liquid The Better). Once Completely Blended And Smooth, Measure Out 1/2 Cup Of The Butter And Chill The Rest For Another Use.
5. Save The Remaining Buttah Base In A Closed Container In The Fridge For Up To A Week.
6. To Make The Eggplant
7. Preheat Oven To 375. Lightly Oil A Baking Sheet.
8. To Prep The Eggplant, Slice It In Half Lengthwise And Score The Inside Without Piercing The Skin, With One Tablespoonof Oil Rubbed Into Each Top Half. Season With The Salt. Spread A Thin Layer Of Cauliflower Buttah On The Open Face Of Each Half Allowing Some To Get Between The Slices.
9. On A Separate Plate, Apply Potato Chip Crust To Cover The Open Eggplant Flesh. Add A Few Dollops Of Cauliflower Buttah To The Top And Place Sliced Tomatoes Along With And Bake Face Side Up For 40-45 Minutes.
10. Remove From Heat Garnish With Fresh Basil Leaves And Serve.

title: Fudgy Chocolate Chip Brownies
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup Plus 1 Tablespoon Organic Allpurpose Flour
2. 12 Cup Organic Whole Wheat Pastry Flour
3. 12 Cup Dutchprocess Cocoa Powder
4. 12 Cup Minus 1 Tablespoon Granulated Sugar
5. 14 Cup Organic Whole Cane Sugar Ground In A Blender Until Powdered
6. 2 Tablespoons Arrowroot Or Organic Cornstarch
7. 1 Teaspoon Aluminumfree Baking Powder
8. 14 Teaspoon Fine Sea Salt
9. 14 Cup Plus 2 Tablespoons Mild Tasting Extravirgin Olive Oil Or Organic Neutral Vegetable Oil
10. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Grade B Or Dark Amber
11. 14 Cup Any Nondairy Milk
12. 2 Teaspoons Pure Vanilla Extract
13. 14 Teaspoon Chocolate Extract Optional
14. Heaped 14 Cup Vegan Chocolate Chips Or Mini Chunks
15. 13 Cup Lightly Toasted Walnuts Or Mixed Nuts Coarsely Chopped Optional
preparation:
1. Note: If Using Coconut Oil As The Fat, Make Sure The Other Ingredients Are At Room Temperature, Or The Oil Will Harden Into Clumps During Mixing.
2. Makes One 8 X 8-Inch Square Pan
3. Position A Rack In The Middle Of The Oven And Preheat To 350° F. Oil An 8 X 8-Inch Square Pan And Then Line The Bottom With Parchment Paper. Do Not Oil The Paper.
4. Place A Wire Mesh Strainer Over A Medium Bowl. Add The All-Purpose Flour, Pastry Flour, Cocoa, Granulated Sugar, Whole Cane Sugar, Arrowroot Or Cornstarch, Baking Powder, And Salt To The Strainer And Stir With A Whisk To Sift The Ingredients Into The Bowl. (If Any Small Bits Remain In The Strainer, Add Them To The Mixture In The Bowl.) Whisk To Aerate The Mixture.
5. Whisk The Oil, Maple Syrup, Nondairy Milk, Vanilla, And Chocolate Extract, If Using, In A Separate Medium Bowl Until Completely Combined. Pour Into The Dry Ingredients And Mix With A Silicone Spatula Until The Batter, Which Will Be Thick, Is Smooth. Allow The Batter To Rest For Ten Minutes.
6. Stir The Chocolate Chips And Nuts, If Using, Into The Batter. Spoon The Batter Into The Prepared Pan, And Spread Into An Even Layer With A Metal Spatula.
7. Bake For 23 Minutes Until The Top Is Set And Dry And The Sides Have Pulled Just Slightly Away From The Pan.
8. Remove The Pan From The Oven And Set On A Cooling Rack. Immediately Insert A Wooden Tester Diagonally Into The Brownies. The Tester Will Be Coated With Batter, But Not Wet. If Necessary, Bake For Another Minute.
9. Cool To Room Temperature. The Middle Of The Cake Will Sink As It Cools; Don’T Worry. Once Cold You Can Push The Sides Down To Level The Cake If You Like. Refrigerate Until Very Cold Before Cutting Into Squares.
10. Keeping:Refrigerate The Brownies In A Covered Container, In Layers Separated By Parchment, For Up To Three Days, Or Freeze For Up To One Month. Defrost Unwrapped Or Eat Straight Out Of The Freezer.

title: Irish Vegetable Stew
ingredients:
1. 1 Turnip Or Swede If Youre From Outside Of Ireland
2. 2 Large Onions Or 4 Small Ones
3. 4 Celery Stalks
4. 2 Large Carrots Or 4 Small Ones
5. 2 Parsnips
6. 500Cups Veg Stock Made With 2 Vegetable Stock Cubes
7. 1 Tbsp Soya Butter
8. 1 Tbsp Herbes De Provence
9. 1 Dsp Dessert Spoon Flour
10. Salt Optional And Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Wash And Peel All The Veg And Cut Them Into Large Chunks At An Angle.
2. Melt The Butter In A Large Sauce Pan And Add The Chopped Onions Once Melted.
3. Cook The Onions Until They Soften And Are Coated In The Butter. Around 4 Minutes Maybe.
4. Add The Herbs Then And Stir To Coat The Onions In The Herbs.
5. Then Add The Flour And Stir To Make Sure This Mixture Doesn’T Stick To The Pan. Let The Flour And The Herbs Cook With The Onions For A Few Minutes So The Butter Absorbs The Flavour.
6. Then Add The Stock Very Slowly. Add In Just A Little Bit At A Time Stirring All The Time. This Will Form A Kind Of Gravy-Like Liquid.
7. Then Add In The Rest Of The Vegetables And If You Think The Mixture Needs More Liquid Just Add In A Bit More Boiling Water.
8. Add Some Black Pepper And Salt If You Think It Needs It (I Didn’T Use Salt).
9. Put A Lid On Then And Let It Simmer On A Low Heat For Around An Hour Or Until The Veg Are Cooked.
10. Serve With Spuds Anyway You Like!

title: Chocolate, Orange and Walnut Cookies
ingredients:
1. 220G Margarine At Room Temperature
2. 120G Caster Sugar
3. 120G Soft Brown Sugar
4. 100Cups Oggs Aquafaba
5. 350G Plain Flour Sifted
6. 1 Tsp Bicarbonate Of Sod
7. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
8. 200G Chocolate Chips
9. 1 Orange Zest
10. 50G Hazelnuts Crushed
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180°C (160°C If Using A Fan Oven)/ Gas Mark 4 And Line A Baking Tray With Parchment Paper.
2. Using An Electric Whisk, Cream Together The Margarine And Both Types Of Sugar Until The Grains Dissolve And The Mixture Becomes Paler.
3. Whilst Continuing To Whisk The Margarine And Sugar, Pour In The Oggs® Aquafaba And The Remaining Ingredients, Other Than The Chocolate Chips And Continue Whisking ’Til You’Ve Formed A Lovely Thick Dough.
4. Add The Dark Chocolate Chips, Orange Zest And Crushed Hazelnuts Into The Mixture And Stir Thoroughly With A Big Spoon.
5. Pop In The Fridge For 30 Minutes.
6. Using Two Teaspoons, Gather Spoonfuls Of The Dough And Roll Them Into Little Balls, Each Roughly The Size Of A Golf Ball. Spread Them Out On A Baking Tray, About 6 Per Tray As They Tend To Spread Out A Lot.
7. Bake For 10-12 Minutes. In This Time, They Should Have Turned Golden, Whilst Retaining That Crucial Gooey Centre.

title: Blueberry Cheesecake
ingredients:
1. Tub Of Vegan Plain Cream Cheese
2. Pack Of Silky Tofu
3. Cup Maple Syrup
4. 2 Tablespoons Cornflour
5. 1 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
6. 1 Teaspoon Pure Vanilla Essence
7. Cup Fresh Blueberries
8. 3 Tablespoons Maple Syrup
9. Teaspoon Cinnamon
10. Teaspoon Ginger Powder
11. Teaspoon Grated Fresh Nutmeg
12. Crust
13. Box Of Stemginger Oat Crackers
14. 5 Tablespoons Pure Coconut Butteroil
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 350F/180C.
2. Make The Crust First. Crush The Ginger Biscuits, Or Process Until Crumb-Like. Add The Melted Coconut Oil, And Then Mix Well. Press Into A Flan Tin, Shape It Into All The Sides, And Firmly Across The Bottom.
3. Put The Cream Cheese Through To The Vanilla Into A Food Processor; And Mix The Ingredients Until Completely Smooth, With No Lumps. Take Out Half Of This Mixture From The Processor And Spread It In The Bottom Of The Crust.
4. To The Remaining Cream Cheese Mix, Add The Blueberries And Other Ingredients, Through To The Nutmeg; And Mix Well. Very Carefully Place It Onto The First Layer Of Cheesecake.
5. Bake For 50-60 Minutes, And After Removing From The Oven, Allow It To Cool, Then Put It Into The Fridge To Chill. This Will Take A Few Hours.
6. Can Be Frozen, But Allow At Least Ten Minutes To Defrost Before Serving.

title: Cherry Bakewell Baked Oats
ingredients:
1. 80G Porridge Oats
2. 2 Tbsp Ground Flaxseed
3. 20G Ground Almonds
4. 70G Alpro Plain Unsweetened
5. 170Cups Alpro Almond Unsweetened Drink
6. Tsp Almond Extract Optional
7. 100G Frozen Pitted Cherries Or Tinned
8. 2 Tbsp Maple Syrup Plus Extra To Serve
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180C.
2. Mix Together All The Ingredients Except The Cherries Until Well Combined And Spoon Into Two Small Shallow Baking Dishes.
3. Dot With The Cherries Pushing Them Into The Oats.
4. Bake In The Oven For 20 Minutes Or Until Set With A Lightly Coloured Crust On Top.
5. Drizzle With A Little Extra Maple Syrup And Serve!
6. Crave More Recipes Like This? Sign Up To Try Veganuary Today To Get Our Celebrity Cookbook, Meal Plans, Nutritional Advice, Recipes, And More All For Free!

title: Herb-Crusted Cashew Cheese
ingredients:
1. Vegan Cashew Cheese Ingredients
2. 75G Unsalted Cashew Nuts
3. 150Cups Water
4. 4 Tbsp Corn Starch
5. 3 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
6. 2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
7. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
8. 34 Tsp Salt
9. 13 Tsp Garlic Powder
10. Other Ingredients
11. Herbs De Provence
preparation:
1. All You Have To Do Is Add All Cashew Cheese Ingredients Into A Good Blender And Blend Until You Get A Very Smooth Consistency.
2. Then Pour The Mixture Into A Pan And Heat Up. Make Sure You Stir Constantly. After A Few Minutes, It Will Change Texture And Turn Into A Thick Paste.
3. Transfer The Paste Into A Tupperware Dish And Even Out So It’S Neatly Packed Into The Dish.
4. Let Set In The Fridge For 1 Hour Or Until It Has Completely Cooled Down.
5. Then Sprinkle Some Herbs De Provence On A Plate. Coat The Cheese On All Sides. Enjoy!
6. Yes, That Was It Already, So Simple!!
7. —Exceedingly Vegan

title: Vegan Kebab Skewers with Grilled Peaches and Vegan Tzatziki
ingredients:
1. Serves 34
2. 34 Large Ripe Peaches
3. 1 Pack Oumph Kebab Spiced 280G
4. For The Glaze
5. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
6. 1 Tbsp Tamari Soy Sauce
7. Tsp Crushed Black Pepper
8. 1 Tbsp Rapeseed Oil
9. For The Tzatziki Dip
10. 1 Large Cucumber Shredded
11. 2 Tsp Salt
12. 350G Dairyfree Yoghurt
13. Juice Of 1 Lemon
14. 2 Garlic Cloves Crushed
15. 1 Tbsp Fresh Dill
16. To Serve
17. Toasted Fresh Pita Breads
preparation:
1. Fire Up Your Bbq And Wait 30 Minutes Until The Coals Are Glowing And Hot, Hot, Hot.
2. In The Meantime, Wash And Half The Peaches And Allow For The Oumph! Kebab Spiced To Defrost, And Pierce Them Onto Skewers. If You’Re Using Wooden Skewers On Your Bbq Then Make Sure To Soak Them In Water For At Least An Hour Before Using.
3. For The Glaze, Simply Mix Maple Syrup, Tamari, Black Pepper And Rapeseed Oil In A Small Bowl, Then Brush Your Skewers With The Glaze Before Placing Them Onto The Hot Bbq. Turn The Skewers Regularly Until The Peaches Are Starting To Caramelise And The Kebab Is Lightly Browned.
4. To Prepare The Tzatziki Dip, Finely Shred The Cucumber With A Grater Or A Food Processor, Then Transfer The Shreds To A Nut Milk Bag Or A Clean Kitchen Towel And Squeeze Out As Much Of The Water As You Can.
5. Transfer The Cucumber Shreds To A Large Bowl And Stir In The Salt, Then Allow It To Rest For 10 Minutes And Squeeze Out Any Releasing Liquid Again. Mix The Cucumber And Salt With The Dairy-Free Yoghurt, Lemon Juice, Garlic And Fresh Dill.
6. To Serve, Drizzle The Grilled Peach & Kebab Skewers With A Little Tzatziki And Use The Rest To Dip Some Freshly Toasted Pitta Bread.

title: Mince and Onion Pie
ingredients:
1. 500 G Soya Mince I Used Granose Soya Mince
2. 1 Onion Chopped
3. 1 2 Tablespoons Of Oil
4. 250Cups Of Vegan Gravy Keep It Quite Thick If You Cant Find Any Then You Could Use Vegetable Stock And Gravy Browning
5. 1 Tbsp Ketchup
6. 2 Teaspoons Hendersons Relish Or Vegan Worcestershire Sauce
7. Black Pepper To Taste I Used A Lot
8. 12 Teaspoon Oregano
9. 1 Pack Of Ready To Roll Shortcrust Pastry Jusrol Is Vegan
10. 1 Pack Of Ready To Roll Puff Pastry Jusrol Is Vegan
11.
preparation:
1. The Filling Can Also Be Frozen And Then Used At A Future Date.
2. The Filling:
3. Finely Chop The Onion And Soften In A Large Pan With The Oil.
4. Once Softened, Add The Soya Mince And Cook-Off, Stirring Frequently, For About 5 Minutes. The Kind Of Soya Mince I Used Needed To Be Rehydrated First So Make Sure You Follow The Instruction : For That. If You Are Using Frozen, Break It Up A Bit And Add It To The Pan.
5. Add In The Gravy, Ketchup, Henderson’S, Pepper And Oregano To The Pan. Stir It All Together Then Cook Over A Medium Heat. Try To Reduce The Mixture Down So That It’S Not Too Wet. You Should Be Able To Drag A Spoon Through The Pan And Have The Mixture Stay Apart For A Few Seconds.
6. This Can Then Be Refrigerated Until You Are Ready To Use It. It Will Freeze Too So You Can Make Lots This Time And Then Defrost Ahead Of Time In The Future.
7. The Pie:
8. Get Your Pie Dish Or Dishes Ready And Roll Out The Shortcrust Pastry As Per The Instruction : So You Have Enough To Cover The Bottom And The Sides Of Your Dish. This Is A Proper Pie, Not A Stew With A Puff Pastry Hat On.
9. Line The Bottom And Sides Of Your Dish With The Pastry And Then Blind Bake At 200C For Around 15 Mins Until The Pastry Turns Golden. You Can Prick The Pastry On The Bottom Of The Pan With A Knife To Stop It Rising Up And Help It Cook A Little Better.
10. While Your Pastry Is Blind Baking, You Can Roll Out Your Puff Pastry For The Top As Per The Instruction : On The Packet.
11. Once Your Shortcrust Is Ready, Add The Filling And Then Place The Puff Pastry On Top. Crimp Around The Edges And Then Make A Couple Of Holes In The Top With A Sharp Knife To Let The Steam Out.
12. Brush With Soya Milk (Or Other Non-Sweet Plant Milk) And Bake At 200C For Around 30 Mins Or Until The Top Is Lovely And Golden.
13. Want More Recipes Just Like This? Sign Up To Veganuary For Recipes, Meal Plans, Nutritional Advice, Celebrity Cookbooks And More (All For Free!)

title: Cumin Roasted Carrots & Crispy Chickpeas
ingredients:
1. 2 Pots Herby Houmous
2. 450G Mixed Baby Carrots
3. 1 Tin Of Chickpeas Drained Rinsed And Patted Dry
4. 2 Tbsp Light Oil
5. 1 Tbsp Cumin Seeds
6. 1 Tbsp Ground Cumin
7. Salt Pepper
8. 12 Tbsp Zaatar
9. Few Springs Of Parsley
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180°C.
2. Add The Carrots, Cumin Seeds And Oil To A Lined Baking Tray And Rub To Combine. Sprinkle With A Tsp Of Salt And Place In The Preheated Oven For About 20-30Mins Or Until The Carrots Are Tender And Roasted.
3. Line Another Baking Tray And Add The Chickpeas, Another Tbsp. Of Oil And A Good Sprinkle Of Salt. Stir To Combine And Add To The Oven To Crisp Up. Stir After 10 Minutes And Continue To Cook For Another 10 Minutes, After Which Sprinkle On The Ground Cumin And Stir Again, Place Back Into The Oven For Another 10 Minutes.
4. Spread The Houmous Onto A Large Serving Plate, Once Your Carrots Are Cooked Remove From The Oven And Place On Top Of The Houmous, Sprinkle Over The Crispy Chickpeas, Zaatar And Fresh Parsley Leaves.
5. Credit: @Natalie.Naturally

title: Miso Broth
ingredients:
1. 2 Teaspoons Sesame Oil
2. 200G Mushrooms Enoki Or Shiitake Sliced
3. Carrot Peeled And Sliced Into Matchsticks
4. 1 Red Chilli Sliced
5. 1 Tablespoon Shredded Fresh Ginger
6. A Good Handful Of Choi Sum Or Baby Leaf Spinach Shredded
7. 5 Spring Onions Trimmed And Finely Sliced On The Diagonal
8. 2 Tablespoons Yellow Miso Paste
9. 125G Tofu Drained And Cut Into Small Dice
10. Tamari Or Soy Sauce To Taste
preparation:
1. Heat The Sesame Oil In A Wok Or Large Frying Pan And Add The Mushrooms And Carrots. Quickly Cook The Veggies For A Minute Until Just Softened Then Add The Chilli And Ginger And Cook For Another 10 Seconds.
2. Throw The Choi Sum Or Baby Leaf Spinach And Spring Onions Into The Wok And Cook Until The Leaves Are Only Just Wilted.
3. Remove From The Pan And Divide Between 2 Bowls.
4. Bring 700Ml Water To The Boil In A Large Pan.
5. In A Small Bowl Mix The Miso With A Couple Of Tablespoons Of The Water And Then Add The Paste To The Pan. Stir To Combine And Add A Little More Miso If Needed.
6. Divide The Drained And Diced Tofu Between The Bowls And Pour Over The Miso Broth.
7. Add Tamari Or Soy Sauce To Taste And Serve Immediately.

title: Pumpkin Macaroni Cheese
ingredients:
1. 750G Fresh Pumpkin Peeled And Cut Into 2Cm Cubes
2. 2 Onions Chopped
3. 500Cups Hot Vegetable Stock
4. 3 Garlic Cloves Peeled And Left Whole
5. 1Tsp Dijon Mustard
6. Tsp Ground Nutmeg Plus Extra To Serve
7. Freshly Ground Black Pepper To Taste
8. 320G Macaroni Pasta
9. 1Tsp Cornflour Mixed With 2Tsp Cold Water To Form A Paste
10. 3Tbsp Nutritional Yeast Optional
preparation:
1. Add The Pumpkin, Onions, Vegetable Stock, Garlic, Mustard, Nutmeg And Black Pepper To A Large Pan.
2. Place The Pan Over A Medium Heat, Cover And Cook Gently For Around Thirty Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Until The Pumpkin Is Tender.
3. Set The Pan Aside To Cool A Little And Bring A Fresh Pan Of Water To The Boil. Once Boiling, Add The Macaroni To The Water And Cook According To The Pasta’S Instruction :.
4. Meanwhile, Add The Pumpkin Mix To A Blender And Blend Until Smooth.
5. Once Cooked, Drain The Pasta And Return To The Pan. Add The Pumpkin Sauce And Mix Well To Coat The Macaroni Fully.
6. Return The Pan To A Medium Heat, Add The Cornflour Paste And Stir To Thicken.
7. Remove From The Heat, Stir In The Nutritional Yeast, Season With Extra Black Pepper If Desired And Serve With A Sprinkle Of Nutmeg On Top.

title: “Spicy-tarian” Hot Dog
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Garden Gourmet Sensational Sausages1 Pack Garden Gourmet Sensational Sausages Or Another Plantbased Equivalent
2. 2 Vegan Hotdog Buns
3. 1 Small Head Of Green Lettuce
4. 2 Tblsp Home Made Salsa See Chefs Tip
5. 2 Tblsp Quacamole Ready To Eat Or Home Made
6. 1 Green And Red Jalapeno Peppers
preparation:
1. Cut The Buns Lengthwise And Grill Both Sides Until Grill Marks Are Showing.
2. Grill The Sausages According To The Instruction : On The Package.
3. Spread The Guacamole In The Hotdog Buns And Cover With A Few Lettuce Leaves.
4. Put The Grilled Sausages On Top And Spoon The Salsa On It.
5. Garnish With Coriander
6. Serve With Mexican Vibe Ingredients Like Nacho Chips, Grated Vegan Cheese, Coriander, Extra Guacamole And Lime.
7. For Homemade Salsa We Will Need: 2 Tomatoes,100 G Pineapple, ½ Small Red Onion, 1 Tblsp Corn Kernels, 1 Small Bunch Of Coriander, ½ Jalapeno Pepper (Without Seeds), Salt, Lime Juice. Cut Tomatoes (Without Seeds) And Pineapple In Small Pieces And Chop The Onion, Coriander And Jalapeno Pepper. Combine All Ingredients And Season With Salt And Lime Juice.

title: Coconut Bacon
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Liquid Smoke Hickory Or Mesquite Flavor
2. 2 Tablespoons Tamari Soy Sauce
3. 1 Tablespoon Maple Syrup Or Agave Nectar
4. 1 Tablespoon Water
5. 3 Cups 200 G Unsweetened Coconut Flakes
preparation:
1. Makes 3½ Cups
2. Preheat The Oven To 325°F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper.
3. In A Large Bowl, Stir Together The Liquid Smoke, Tamari Soy Sauce, Maple Syrup Or Agave Nectar, And Water.
4. Add The Coconut Flakes To The Bowl, And Using A Rubber Spatula, Gently Toss Together The Coconut With The Liquid Mixture Until The Coconut Flakes Are Thoroughly Coated.
5. Transfer The Coated Coconut Flakes Onto The Prepared Baking Sheet, Spreading Them Out In A Single Layer So They Cook Evenly, And Place The Baking Sheet In The Preheated Oven. Bake For 20 To 25 Minutes, And Stay Close By.
6. After 10 Or 15 Minutes And Every 5 Minutes Thereafter, You Will Want To Toss And Flip The Flakes Using A Spatula. This Is Not Only To Make Sure The Flakes Cook Evenly But Also To Ensure That They Don’T Burn, And They Will Burn If You Don’T Regularly Toss Them.
7. Depending On Your Oven, You May Also Need To Turn The Baking Sheet Around To Ensure They Cook Up Evenly. As You Continue To Check, Feel Free To Taste To Make Sure They’Re Nice And Crispy. They Will Be A Nice Brown Color When They’Re Done, And If You Test Them, You’Ll Notice The Coconut Flavor Is Pretty Much Gone.
8. Remove From The Oven, And Let Cool Before Storing In A Sealed Bag Or Container. (They Continue To Crisp Up As They Cool.) The Coconut Bacon Will Stay Fresh For Up To 3 Weeks—In Or Out Of The Refrigerator.
9. Suggestions For
10. Make A Classic Bacon, Lettuce, And Tomato Sandwich With Some Avocado Slices!
11. Top A Baked Potato With A Couple Tablespoons, As You Would With Bacon Bits.
12. Offer The Coconut Bacon As An Option For A Salad Topping.
13. It’S A Great Garnish For Soup.
14. Sprinkle Them On Top Of Your Favorite Macaroni & Cheese Recipe Or On Top Of Pasta.
15. For Your Information
16. Look For Unsweetened Coconut Flakes In The Bulk Section Of Your Grocery Store; Packaged Brands Include Edward & Sons/Let’S Do Organic And Bob’S Red Mill (Usa Only).
17. For Your Edification
18. Liquid Smoke Adds A Wonderful Depth Of Flavor To So Many Dishes, And A Little Goes A Long Way. It’S A Great Staple To Keep In The Cupboard, And You’Ll Find Yourself Using It Often To Add A Smoky Flavor To Your Favorite Recipes.

title: Rainbow Smoothie
ingredients:
1. 2 Tbsp Of Chia Seeds
2. 34 Cup Of Coconut Or Any Other Plant Based Milk
3. 1 Mango
4. 13 Cup Of Oats
5. 1 Tbsp Raw Cacao
6. 34 Cup Of Plant Milk
7. Dash Of Maple Syrup
8. 1 Dragon Fruit Can Substitute With Pear Apple Or Pineapple
9. 1 Kiwi Fruit
preparation:
1. First You Will Have To Create Each Layer. Do It The Night Before To Save Time And Also To Allow Each Layer Set Nicely
2. Chia Layer: 2 Tbsp Of Chia Seeds, 3/4 Cup Of Coconut Or Any Other Plant Based Milk. Mix All Together And Pop In The Fridge. After 15 Min Take It Out And Stir To Avoid Lumps. Put Back In The Fridge To Set Overnight.
3. Mango Layer: Just Simply Cut Up Your Mango Into Small Pieces And Blend With Your Blender.
4. Chocolate Layer: 1/3 Cup Of Oats, 1 Tbsp Of Raw Cacao , 3/4 Cup Of Plant Based Milk And Little Bit Of Maple Syrup. Mix It All Together And Put In The Fridge To Set Overnight.
5. Dragon Fruit Layer: Simply Cut Up Your Dragon Fruit And Blend With Your Blender. If You Don’T Have Dragon Fruit You Can Use Any Other Fruit Such As Pineapple, Pear Or Even Apple.
6. Kiwi Layer: Peel Your Kiwi And Blend With Your Blender.
7. In The Morning Pour Each Of The Layers In To A Glass Very Carefully, I Used A Small Spoon. This Way You Will Avoid Mixing All Layers Together. Top Up With Gojiberries, Desiccated Coconut, Or Hemp Seeds.

title: The Tempeh Stack Sandwich
ingredients:
1. 200G Pack Tempeh
2. 2 Tablespoons Sesame Oil
3. 2 Tablespoons Shoyu Sauce
4. 2 Teaspoons Hot Sauce Like Sriracha Optional
5. 2 Garlic Cloves Minced
6. 1 Teaspoon Fresh Grated Ginger Juice
7. Juice From One Lemon
8. Bread And Fillings Of Your Choice Suggestion In Recipe
preparation:
1. If Making For Next Day Lunch, Let The Tempeh Marinate Overnight.
2. Preheat The Oven To 190/370Deg.
