3. Preheat The Oven To 180C And Line A 12 Hole Muffin Or Cupcake Tray With Paper Cases.
4. Hull The Strawberries And Place In A Mixing Bowl. Use A Fork To Mash The Strawberries Until Pulpy And Juicy.
5. Pour The Oil Into A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Sugar And Beat Together Until Combined. Stir In The Flaxseed And Water Mixture Until Combined (It Will Be Slightly Tacky In Consistency). Add The Strawberries And Flour And Use A Metal Spoon To Fold Them Into The Mixture Until Mixed.
6. Spoon The Mixture Evenly Into The Cupcake Cases, Level The Tops And Bake In The Oven For 20 Minutes. Remove From The Oven And Transfer To A Wire Rack To Cool Completely.
7. Meanwhile, Make The Buttercream Icing. Place The Margarine, Rice Milk And Vanilla Extract Into A Mixing Bowl, Sift Over Half Of The Icing Sugar And Use An Electric Whisk To Mix The Ingredients Together. I Recommend Using An Electric Whisk As It Takes Some Time To Get The Icing Mixture To The Right Creamy Consistency – About 4 Minutes. By All Means Do It By Hand But It May Take You Much Longer. Sift In The Remaining Icing Sugar And Continue To Whisk Until Thick, Glossy And Creamy. Place The Icing In The Fridge To Chill Until Ready To Spread.
8. Once The Cupcakes Are Completely Cool, Spread Liberally With The Icing And Decorate With The Fresh Strawberries.

title: Hot Fried Maitake Chicken
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb  450G Maitake Mushroom Clusters
2. 1 Cup  250Cups Oil For Frying
3. 3 Cups  375G Panko Breadcrumbs
4. 3 Cups  375G Crumbled Bbq Potato Chips
5. 3 Cups  375G Flour
6. 1 Tbsp Salt Coarse Grind Sea Salt
7. 1 Tbsp Poultry Seasoning
8. 1 Tbsp Black Pepper Fine Grind
9. 3 Cups  360Cups Follow Your Heart Vegan Egg Wash Mixture
10. 12 Cup  120Cups Hot Sauce
preparation:
1. Heat Cast Iron Skillet Or Heavy-Duty Saucepan To Med Heat. On 1/2 Sheet Pan Lay Out All Mushrooms In Whole Clusters, Drizzle And Lightly Dab 1 T Of Oil To The Mushrooms. Apply A Light Coat In Which The Seasoning Will Stick To, Sprinkle Dry Seasoning Then Add To Heated Cast Iron Pan And Weigh Down With Additional Cast Iron Pan, A Brick Wrapped In Tin Foil Or Heavier Cover To Create A Press. Cook For 2 -3 Minutes Then Flip Over Being Careful Not To Tear The Mushroom Breasts. Sprinkle A Bit More Of Seasoning And Then Press With Pan Again. Repeat This Process Several Times Until Mushrooms Are Condensed And Pressed Into Light Golden Brown Pieces With No Liquid In The Pan.
2. Note:Depending On The Mushrooms (Cause They’Re All Different) Some Will Leach More Liquid Than Others. Don’T Fret It Might Take A Couple Minutes Longer To Cook But The Liquid Will Dissipate. After They Are Pressed And Golden, Remove Mushrooms From Heat And Cool.
3. In Medium-Size Bowl Or Container Add Pressed Shrooms And Haute Sauce To Marinate For At Least An Hour Or Overnight.
4. In Three Separate Bowls Get The Breading Station Ready.
5. Seasoned Flour With A Little Salt And Pepper
6. Make Vegan Egg Wash Mixture By Following Directions On Follow Your Heart Vegan Egg
7. Make Panko Crumb Crust By Adding Panko, Bbq Potato Chips, And Seasoning To Food Processor And Pulse Until Coarse Grind Consistency.
8. Lightly Dredge Each Piece Of Shroom, First In Flour To Coat, Then In Vegan Egg Mixture, Then In Seasoned Panko, So It’S Fully Coated.
9. In Medium Cast Iron Pan Add Oil So It’S Between 1/4 & 1/2-Inch Deep And Heat On Medium Heat, Once Hot Begin To Fry Each Piece For Several Minutes On Each Side Until Golden Brown, When Done Let Sit On Newspaper Or Paper Bag To Catch Excess Oil.
10. Note: If You’Re Doing A Big Batch And Allow To Cool – Pieces May Be Reheated Before Serving By Assembling On A Baking Sheet And Reheat In A350-Degree Oven For 5 – 10 Minutes Until Hot.

title: Watercress Quinoa Soup With Balsamic Onions
ingredients:
1. 3 Small Red Onions Finely Sliced
2. 12 Cup Red Wine
3. 12 Cup Balsamic Vinegar
4. 1 Cup Water
5. 3 Cups Boiling Water
6. 1 Tsp Stock Powder
7. 1 Garlic Clove Minced
8. 80G Watercress
9. 14 Tsp Ground White Pepper
10. 1 Cup White Quinoa
preparation:
1. Put The Onions, Wine, Balsamic Vinegar And 1C Water In A Frying Pan. Bring To The Boil On A High Heat Then Reduce To A Medium Heat
2. Cook For 20 Minutes Until The Onions Are Soft. If The Pan Gets Dry Add A Little More Water
3. Put The Water, Stock, Salt, Garlic And Quinoa In A Pan
4. Simmer For 15 Minutes Or Until The Quinoa Is Very Soft
5. Add The Watercress, Blend With A Hand Blender
6. Add Pepper And Salt To Taste
7. Cook On A Low Heat For 10 Minutes
8. To Serve Put The Soup In A Bowl And Gently Place A Large Spoonful Of Onions On The Top

title: Vegan Fried Chicken
ingredients:
1. Homemade Seitan
2. For The Coating  Flour
3. 12 Tsp Cayenne Pepper
4. Tsp Dried Marjoram
5. 2 Tsp Garlic Powder
6. 2 Tsp Dried Oregano
7. 2 Tsp Dried Sage
8. 2 Tbsp Paprika
9. 2 Tbsp Freshly Ground Black Pepper
10. Kosher Salt
11. 1 Cup Allpurpose Flour
12. 14 Cup Corn Starch
13. Tsp Baking Powder
14. For The Buttermilk
15. 1 Cup Vegan Buttermilk 1 Cup Of Soya Milk And 1 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar Whisked Together And Left To Sit For 5  10 Mins
16. 1 Tsp Hot Sauce
17. Pinch Of Salt
18. Oil For Frying
preparation:
1. Make The Seitan Following The Instruction : Below:
2. There Are Loads Of Recipes For Seitan And I Am Working My Way Through Them, Learning As I Go. For This Recipe I Tried One By Isa Chandra (Chicken Stylee Seitan, Available On Theppk.Com) And Because It Was A Big Batch I Tried A Couple Of Different Ways Of Cooking It. I Think Either Way Would Work And I Would Definitely Try The Boiled  For This Recipe Next Time.
3. I Followed The Recipe By Isa Chandra Up To The Point Of Cooking. At That Point, I Separated The Seitan Dough In To Two Batches. With One, I Followed The Recipe, Gentry Cooking The Seitan In Stock. This Was The Most Successful Of My Attempts So Far. It Is Really, Really Important Not To Let It Boil. I Got All Tech About It And Dragged Out The Jam Thermometer. I Kept It Between 94 And 98 Degrees.
4. Anyway, For This Particular Version, I Took The Other Half Of The Seitan And Formed It In To Small Nuggets. Keep Them On The Small Side Because They Will Expand On Cooking. I Put Them On An Oiled Baking Tray And Covered Them With Tin Foil And Baked For 20 – 30 Mins At 180Oc. Keep An Eye On Them, They Are Only Small So It Won’T Take Much To Burn Them. My Thinking With This Was That It Keep Them Dry And Therefore Make The Coating Stick Better.
5. If You Have The Time, The Stock  Would Work Too But You Would Want To Leave Them To Drain For Quite A While And Get As Much Stock Out Of Them As You Can Before Trying To Do The Coating.
6. If You Don’T Fancy Making Your Own Seitan Or You Have Your Own Preferred Product Or Recipe, You Could Just Use That. If You Are Still Searching For That Perfect Recipe, Give Isa’S Recipe A Go.
7. You Will Need 2 Bowls And A Drying Rack To Complete All Of The Coating Process And To Also Drain Off The Seitan Once Cooked.
8. Start Off By Making The Vegan Butter Milk. Combine The Ingredients And Then Let Sit For 5 To 10 Mins Whilst You Get All The Ingredients For The Flour Together And Mix Them Well In A Bowl. By The Time You Have Got Them All Sorted, Your Buttermilk Should Be Good To Go.
9. In Your Second Bowl, Mix The Buttermilk With The Hot Sauce And Salt. You Are Now Ready To Being The Coating Process.
10. Add The Seitan To The Buttermilk And Let Soak For 10 Mins. One Soaked, Add The Pieces A Few At A Time To The Flour And Coat Well Before Putting On The Drying Rack And Leaving For Another 5 To 10 Mins. You Can Use This Time To Get Your Oil Heated Up. You Want It At 180Oc. Be Careful, Don’T Burn Your House Down Or Anything.
11. Once The Seitan Pieces Have Sat In The Coating For 10 Mins, We Repeat The Coating Process. This Helps More Of The Flour Stick And Also Creates All Sort Of Lumps, Bumps And Crevices Which Are Going To Make This Really Good. Straight In To The Buttermilk, Straight In To The Flour And Then In To The 180Oc Oil.
12. The Most Important Tip I Found Was To Leave The Pieces Along For At Least 3 Minutes Otherwise You Risk Knocking The Coating Off. Overall Mine Took About 8 Mins To Get Nice And Golden. My Pan Was Not Big Enough To Cook The Whole Lot And Yours Probably Won’T Be Either So I Did A Couple Of Batches And Kept The First Batch Warm In A Low Oven. I Chucked The First Batch In The Oil Again For A Minute At The End, Just Because.

title: CHICKPEA FRITTATA
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Chickpea Flour
2. 1 Cups Vegetable Stock
3. 1 Cup Plenish Cupsk Or Similar
4. Tsp Baking Soda
5. 1 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
6. Tsp Turmeric
7. 3 Cups Vegetables Of Choice  Courgette Spinach Asparagus Chard Kale Are All Good
8. Cup Red Pepper
9. Salt
10. Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180°C. Add The Chickpea Flour, Stock, Baking Soda, Yeast And Turmeric In A Bowl And Whisk Together Until Smooth. Leave For 30 Minutes.
2. Sautée Your Vegetables In A Large Skillet Pan Until Just Tender. Pour The Chickpea Batter Into Skillet And Transfer To The Oven To Cook For 25-30 Minutes, Or Until The Top Appears Light Golden Brown. Remove From The Oven And Allow To Cool For Around 15 Minutes. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Fridge For Up To 4 Days.

title: Gazpacho
ingredients:
1. 500G Large Heirloom Or Vine Tomatoes Thats About 6 Large Or About 12 Regular Sized Tomatoes
2. 1 Small Red Onion
3. 1 Small Cucumber
4. The Juice Of 1 Orange
5. The Juice Of 1 Lemon
6. 1 Clove Garlic
7. 2 Tbsp Apple Cider Vinegar
8. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
9. A Small Bunch Of Fresh Parsley
10. A Small Bunch Of Fresh Coriander
11. 4 Soaked Pitted Dates
12. 1 Tsp Ground Cumin
13. A Small Pinch Of Chilli Powder
preparation:
1. This Recipe Also Calls For Soaked Dates: I Recommend You Cover The Dates In A Little Boiling Water (Just Enough To Cover) For An Hour Before Making. Alternatively You Can Use Medjool Dates (Don’T Forgot To Remove The Stones!) Which Are Much Softer And Also Larger, So Halve The Number Required. It’S Also Really Nice To Use A Mix Of Tomatoes If You Can – Yellow, Red, Plum, Cherry, Heirloom Etc. It Just Looks So Beautiful In The Bowl, But If You Can Only Get Standard Tomatoes Then I Recommend Going For A Mix Of Large And Cherry, All On The Vine For Added Flavour.
2. Place Half Of The Tomatoes (Choose The Prettier Ones To Chop Up Later) Into A Blender With The Juice Of The Orange And Lemon, Clove Of Garlic, Cider Vinegar, Dates, Cumin, Chilli And Oil.
3. Blitz Until Completely Smooth And Then Add The Fresh Herbs And Pulse Verybriefly Until Just Incorporated-If You Blend The Herbs Too Long The Gazpacho Will Turn Brown Instead Of A Rich Red Colour.
4. Finely Dice The Remaining Tomatoes, Cucumber And Onion. Place In A Large Mixing Bowl And Then Pour The Blended Mixture Over The Top.
5. Season To Taste, Stir Well Andrefrigeratefor As Long As Possible Before Serving – If You Make This The Day Before And Leave In The Fridge Overnight You’Ll Find That The Flavours Really Develop.
6. To Serve, Pour The Gazpacho Into Bowls And Top With A Drizzle Of Good Quality Olive Oil.
7. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Vegan Korean Temple Kimchi
ingredients:
1. 2 Cabbages
2. 3 Cups Red Chilli Powder Gochugaru
3. Cup Naturally Brewed Soy Sauce
4. 2 Cups Glutinous Rice Porridge
5. Korean Raspberry Extract  Cup
6. 20G Green Sea Fingers Cheonggak
7. Cups Cooked Soybean Boiled And Mashed Into A Paste
8. Salt
preparation:
1. Remove The Base Of The Green Sea Fingers And Finely Chop Them Until They Form A Soft Paste.
2. Mix In A Large Bowl The Glutinous Rice Porridge, Red Chili Powder, Prepared Green Sea Fingers, Prepared Soybean, Soy Sauce And Korean Raspberry Extract. Season The Mixture Using Salt (About 1 Tbsp). Leave The Paste To Rest For About 2 Hours.
3. Mix Three Handfuls Of Salt Into A Large Bowl Of Water And Soak The Cabbage.
4. Cut The Cabbages Vertically In Half And Make Small Cuts In The Roots. Mix Three Handfuls Of Salt Into A Large Bowl Of Water And Soak The Cabbage For A Minute Or So.
5. Spread A Generous Amount Of Salt In Between The Leaves (Coarse Sea Salt Works Best); Add Even More To The Stems. Leave For As Long As Possible To Rest – From 3 To 12 Hours.
6. Remove Any Excess Brine From The Cabbages And Spread The Prepared Seasoning Paste Between The Leaves.
7. Cover The Cabbages Using The Outermost Leaves And Store Them In Containers To Ferment.

title: Miso-Glazed Eggplant with Spicy Chickpeas and Ninja Nuts
ingredients:
1. 2 Eggplants Sliced In Half And Scored
2. 12 Cup  100G Fresh Chickpeas Cooked Tossed With 1 Tsp Chilli Flakes And 12 Tsp Smoked Paprika
3. Pinch Coarse Salt
4. 14 Cup  50G Candiedsalted Nuts Karate Chopped
5. 14 Cup  50G Green Onions Sliced
6. 1 Tbsp Chili Peppers Sliced Wicked Thin
7. For The Glaze
8. 12 Cup  120Cups Sake
9. 2 Tbsp Chickpea Miso
10. 2 Tbsp Agave Nectar
11. 1 Tbsp Fresh Turmeric
12. 2 Garlic Cloves
13. 1 Tsp Lemongrass Chopped
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees.
2. Score Eggplants Across The Surface In Both Directions.
3. Blend Glaze Ingredients Together Until Smooth.Apply Glaze To Eggplants, Making Sure It Gets In Between The Cracks Of The Score Lines And Marinate For At Least 15 Minutes.
4. Top With The Chickpeas That Were Tossed With The Chilli And Paprika. Add A Pinch Of Salt.
5. Bake For 25 Minutes, Basting With The Glaze Halfway Through Cooking Time And Again Once They Come Out Of The Oven.
6. Top Withthe Chopped Nuts, Green Onions And Chilli Peppers. Serve Immediately.

title: Banana and Blueberry Granola Bars
ingredients:
1. 2 Very Ripe Bananas
2. 3 Tbsp Almond Butter
3. 80Cups Date Syrup
4. 1 Large Handful Of Blueberries
5. 2 Tbsp Coconut Oil
6. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
7. 14 Tsp Nutmeg
8. 1 Tsp Hemp Protein Powder
9. 200G Glutenfree Rolled Oats
10. 1 Tbsp Chia Seeds
11. 2 Tbsp Dessicated Coconut
12. 1 Handful Cacao Nibs
13. 1 Handful Pumpkin Seeds
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To Gas Mark 4 / 180 C
2. Line A Baking Tray With Baking Paper, And Then Grease It With Coconut Oil
3. In A Food Processor, Combine Bananas, Almond Butter, Coconut Oil, Date Syrup, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, And Half Of The Blueberries. Mix Until Completely Combined And You Have A Thick Paste Mixture.
4. In A Frying Pan, Gently Toast The Nuts And Seeds For 3-5 Minutes, Until Slightly Brown. Leave To Cool. Once Cooled, Roughly Chop The Nuts.
5. In A Large Bowl, Mix The Oats, Hemp Powder, Chia Seeds, Coconut, Cacao Nibs, The Rest Of The Blueberries And Toasted Nuts/Seeds.
6. Stir The Banana Paste Mix Into The Oat Mix And Combine.
7. Pour Mix Into Your Lined Tray. Push Down With A Spatula To Ensure Mixture Is Evenly Packed.
8. Bake For 30-40 Mins, Until Lightly Golden. (These Bars Are Quite Soft, If You Wish For Them To Be Slightly Crunchier, Then Bake For 10-15 More Mins, But Keep An Eye On Them So They Don’T Burn!)
9. Leave To Cool For 10 Mins, Then Tip Onto Wire Rack And Let Cool Completely.

title: Coconut and Thai Basil Stir Fry
ingredients:
1. 2 Tsp Coconut Oil
2. 1 Lemongrass Stalk Hard Outer Layers Removed White Section Very Finely Chopped
3. 1 Green Chilli Finely Chopped
4. 1 Inch Ginger Skin Scraped Off Finely Chopped
5. 1 Clove Garlic Peeled And Finely Chopped
6. 6 Spring Onions Shredded
7. 1 Large Red Pepper Cored And Cut Into Chunks
8. 100G Sugar Snap Peas Topped And Tailed
9. 1 Tsp Nigella Seeds
10. 90G Fresh Coconut Chunks Are Fine Roughly Chopped Or Blitzed In The Food Processor
11. 40 Thai Basil Leaves
12. Salt For Seasoning
preparation:
1. Heat The Coconut Oil In A Wok Or Large Frying Pan On A Medium-High. Add The Lemongrass, Chilli, Ginger And Spring Onion And Cook For 1 Minute Stirring To Prevent Burning.
2. Throw In The Peppers And Sugar Snap Peas And Cook For 2 Minutes. Stir In The Nigella Seeds And Coconut Pieces And Cook For A Further 2 Minutes.
3. Take Off The Heat And Stir Through The Thai Basil Leaves. Season With A Little Salt.
4. Serve With Rice Noodles.

title: Crunchy Cous Cous Tacos with a Sweet n’ Spicy Jalapeno Dressing
ingredients:
1. Tacos
2. For The Dressing
3. 5 Pickled Jalapeno Pieces
4. 12 Tsp Dijon Mustard
5. 1 Heaped Tbsp Agave Syrup
6. Juice Of Half Lime
7. 12 Tsp Cider Vinegar
8. For The Cous Cous
9. 12 Cup Cous Cous
10. 1 Tbsp Taco Seasoning
11. 12 Cup Defrosted Frozen Peas
12. 1 Tbsp Chopped Coriander
13. 3 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil
14. Pinch Of Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. Dressing:
2. Put Everything In An Empty Jar And Shake Vigorously Until It Emulsifies.
3. Cous Cous:
4. Place The Cous Cous And Taco Seasoning In A Bowl. Mix To Combine And Cover With Freshly Boiled Water. Put A Plate On Top And Leave To Soak For Ten Minutes.
5. Fluff With A Fork And Stir Through The Peas, Coriander And Half The Dressing.
6. Serve Alone Or In A Crunchy Taco – Top With More Dressing Before Eating!

title: Roasted Aubergine Lasagne
ingredients:
1. 250G Puy Lentils Or Substitute Vegan Mince
2. 12 Large Tomatoes Or Use 2 Tins Of Chopped Tomatoes
3. 2 Tbsp Tomato Puree
4. 2 Aubergines
5. 1 Carrot Diced
6. 4 Cloves Of Garlic
7. 1 Stick Of Celery Diced
8. 1 Large Onion Diced
9. 1 Red Pepper
10. Dark Soy Sauce 2 Tbsp
11. Vegetable Stock 1 Pt Good Quality Vegetable Bouillion Works Best
12. Small Sprig Of Fresh Thyme 2 Bay Leaves And Handful Of Fresh Marjoram
13. 400Cups Almond Or Soy Milk
14. 2 Tbsp Plain Flour
15. 40G Vegan Margarine
16. 120G Grated Hard Vegan Cheese Such As Vegan Parmesan
17. 1 Packet Of Egg Free Lasagne Pasta
18. Black Pepper White Pepper And Sea Salt
preparation:
1. Sauté 1/2 Of The Onion And One Clove Of Crushed Garlic In Olive Oil Until Softened. Add Puy Lentils, Sauté For A Further Minute Then Add 1 1/2 To 2 Pints Of Stock And Simmer Until Lentils Are Fully Cooked And Soft. Add Further Stock As Needed. You Are Aiming For Them To Absorb Most Of The Liquid Without Leaving Too Much Broth.
2. Remove The Hard Core Of The Tomatoes And Place Whole On A Baking Tray, Along With 3 Garlic Cloves. Roast On High Heat Until Well Roasted And Starting To Blacken. Blitz With Handblender. Set Aside.
3. Remove Ends And Slice Aubergines Lengthways, Approx 1.5Cm Thickness. Drizzle With Olive Oil And Salt And Pepper. Roast On High Heat Until Golden Brown And Soft. Set Aside.
4. Sauté The Remaining Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, And Celery, Then Add Cooked Lentils, Soy, One Bay Leaf, A Handful Of Fresh Marjoram, And A Sprig Of Thyme. Add Blended Tomato Sauce (Or Tinned Tomatoes And Garlic If Using) And The Tomato Puree. Bring To Boil And Simmer For 10 Minutes. Add 1/2 Teaspoon Of Salt And Pepper, Then Taste To Check Seasoning And Adjust According To Taste.
5. Heat Butter In A Small Pan, Add A Pinch Of Salt And Plain Flour And Cook To Make A Roux, Gently Cooking The Paste For 2-3 Minutes. Then Slowly Add Milk, Whisking All The Time Until Reach A Creamy Consistent Sauce. Add A Bay Leaf, And Simmer For 2 Minutes.
6. Layer Some Bechamel Sauce On The Bottom Of A Large Deep Baking Dish And Cover With Pasta. Then Layer Over Lentil And Tomato Mix, Followed By A Layer Of Roasted Aubergine, Allowing The Aubergine To Overlap To Create A Nice Thick Layer. Add Another Layer Of Lentil Mix And Then Top With Another Layer Of Pasta, On Top Of The Pasta Pour Creamy Béchamel Sauce. Sprinkle Top With Cheese And Salt And Pepper.
7. Bake In A Medium Hot Oven At 190 C For 30-40 Mins Until Bubbling And Top Is Golden Brown. Serve With A Fresh Green Salad.
8. Love This Recipe? Get Recipes Like This Sent Straight To Your Inbox When You Sign Up To Veganuary. We’Ll Also Send You Our Celebrity Cookbook, Meal Plans, Nutritional Advice, Budgeting Tips And More – All For Free. What Are You Waiting For?

title: Coconut Lentil Curry with Roasted Turmeric Cauliflower and Jackfruit Chutney
ingredients:
1. 250G Merchant Gourmet Simply Cooked Beluga Lentils
2. 2 Tbsp Coconut Oil
3. 12 Onion Thinly Sliced
4. 14 Head Of Cauliflower Broken Into Florets
5. 12 Tsp Turmeric
6. 1 Tsp Sea Salt
7. 30G Mild Red Curry Paste
8. 1 Kaffir Lime Leaf
9. 300Cups Coconut Milk
10. 1 Tsp Palm Or Light Brown Sugar
11. 2 Tsp Soy Sauce
12. 60G Thin Green Beans Cut In Half
13. 100G Basmati Rice Cooked According To Pack Directions
14. Coriander Leaves To Garnish
15. 1 Lime Cut Into Wedges
16. For The Jackfruit Chutney
17. 1 Tsp Coconut Oil
18. 12 Red Onion Chopped
19. 1 Garlic Clove Thinly Sliced
20. 1 Tin Of Jackfruit In Syrup Drained Reserve 100Cups Syrup
21. 34 Tbsp Palm Or Light Brown Sugar
22. 3 Tbsp Rice Wine Vinegar
23. 12 Red Chilli Sliced
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 200C Or 180 Fan-Assisted
2. Toss Cauliflower With Spices And Oil. Place On Roasting Pan And Put In The Oven For 15 Minutes
3. Add Coconut Oil To A Deep Heavy Gauge Skillet And Cook Onions For 2-3 Minutes, Add Curry Paste And Cook 1 Minute
4. Add Coconut Milk, Sugar, Soy And Lentils And Green Beans And Simmer Low For 5 Minutes
5. For The Chutney, Add Coconut Oil To A Pan And Saute The Onions For 3 Minutes, Then Add The Rest Of The Ingredients And Cook On A Low Heat For 8-10 Minutes
6. Once The Cauliflower Is Roasted, Add To The Pan Of Lentils
7. Serve With Rice And Chutney, Garnish With Coriander And Lime Wedges

title: Decadent Chocolate Tart
ingredients:
1. 120G Walnuts And Pecans Or Use Sunflower Seeds If Making Nut Free Uk 42Oz
2. 100G Dessicated Coconut Uk 35Oz
3. 150G Pitted Dates Uk 53Oz
4. 2 Tbsp Cocoa Powder Uk 1Oz
5. 50  80 Cups Water Uk 18  28Fl Oz  Usa 17  27 Fl Oz
6. A Pinch Of Sea Salt
7. 160G Cocoa Powder Uk 56Oz  Usa A Little Less Than 34 Cups
8. 500Cups Maple Syrup Uk 176Oz  Usa 211Cups
9. 210G Coconut Oil Uk 74Oz
10. The Above Measurements Have Been Converted To Meet Universal Standards And Every Effort Has Been Taken To Ensure Accuracy
11. Discover More Decadent Vegan Dessert Recipes
preparation:
1. Firstly, Line The Cake Tin With A Sheet Of Cling Film, Laying It As Smoothly As Possible Inside The Tin.
2. Next, Place The Walnuts, Coconut And Cocoa Powder Into A Food Processor And Pulse Until Of A Fine Breadcrumb Consistency.
3. Add The Dates And The Pinch Of Sea Salt And Continue To Pulse, And Then Add The Minimum Amount Of Water, Pulsing As You Go, Until The Mixture Combines And Pulls Together. You Can Add The Remaining Water If You Feel Like The Mixture Isn’T Holding Together.
4. Transfer The Base Mixture Into The Cake Tin And Press Down Lightly With Your Fingers To Spread It Over The Base Of The Tin, Then, Using A Spoon, Smooth Out The Top Layer Of The Mixture So That It Forms An Even Base.
5. Place In The Fridge And Leave To Chill While You Make The Topping.
6. Place The Cocoa Powder, Maple Syrup And Coconut Oil In A Blender – I Recommend Using A High Powered Blender Instead Of A Food Processor As It Will Give You A Creamier Result.
7. Blitz The Ingredients Until You Have A Completely Smooth, Creamy Filling – This May Take A Few Minutes.
8. Pour The Chocolate Ganache Filling Over The Base Of The Tart, Level The Top With The Back Of A Spoon And Then Chill In The Fridge For At Least 3 Hours Before Serving.
9. A Little Tip, When Ready To Serve, Run A Large Knife Under The Hot Tap Before Slicing The Tart, Repeat For Every Slice As This Will Give You The Smoothest, Leanest Slices Of Tart.

title: Pasta in a Creamy Basil Sauce
ingredients:
1. 300 Grams Of Uncooked Pasta
2. 12 Teaspoons Of Olive Oil
3. 1 Chopped Orange Pepper
4. 1 Chopped Yellow Pepper
5. 1 Small Can Of Sweetcorn
6. 2 Chopped Tomatoes
7. 1 Cup Of Fresh Edamame Beans
8. For The Vegan Basil Cream
9. 1 Cup Of Fresh Basil
10. 1 Small Avocado
11. 14 Cup Of Fresh Lemon Juice
12. 2 Tablespoons Of Water
13. 2 Tablespoons Of Olive Oil
14. 1 Teaspoon Of Salt
15. Black Pepper To Taste
16. Chilli Flakes To Taste
preparation:
1. This Recipe Serves 4 To 6 People
2. Boil A Large Pot Of Water And Add The Pasta Until It’S A Little Undercooked
3. Heat The Olive Oil And Add The Chopped Peppers And Courgette
4. Cook For 10 Minutes
5. Put The Basil, Water, Olive Oil, Lemon Juice, Avocado, Salt, Black Pepper, And Chilli Flakes In A Blender And Create The Cream
6. Before The Vegetables Are Fully Cooked, Add The Chopped Tomatoes, Pasta And Beans
7. Cook For About 5 Minutes
8. Add The Basil Cream And Stir
9. Add Salt, Pepper, And Chilli Flakes To Taste
10. Garnish With Basil Leaves
11. Adapted From Oh She Glows

title: OmniMeat Sticky Rice
ingredients:
1. Omnimeat  1 Pack
2. Sticky Rice  900 G
3. Ginger Minced  10 G
4. Dried Shiitake Mushroom Soakedthickly Sliced  5 Pcs
5. Fried Garlic Optional  40 G
6. Soaked Mushroom Water  300Cups
7. Sesame Oil  7 Tbsps
8. 
9. Seasoning
10. Soy Sauce  4 Tsps
11. Ground White Pepper  12 Tbsp
12. Vegetarian Oyster Sauce  2 Tbsps
13. Five Spices Powder  Pinch
14. Mirin  10 G
15. 
16. Sauce
17. Fresh Chili Pepper Diced  20 G
18. Tomato Sauce  60 G
19. Miso  50 G
20. Water  200 G
21. Sugar  15 G
22. Mirin  10 G
preparation:
1. Soak Sticky Rice For 4 Hours, Then Pour The Water Out And Steam For 30 Minutes.
2. Pan-Fryomnimeatuntil It Forms A Flat Patty, Then Diceomnimeatpatty And Set Aside.
3. Heat Oil In A Pan And Stir-Fry Sliced Shiitake Mushroom And Minced Ginger Until Aromatic. Addomnimeatand Stir-Fry For A While, Then Add Seasonings And Mix Well.
4. Add Fried Garlic (Optional), Water, Soaked Mushroom Water And Boil For 10 Minutes, Set Aside.
5. Pan-Fry Diced Peppers Until Aromatic, Then Mix Well With Tomato Sauce And Miso. Add Water, Sugar And Mirin, Then Cook Until Thickens. Blend The Mixture Into Smooth Paste.
6. Mix The Steamed Sticky Rice With Sesame Oil And The Paste, Then Steam It For Another 30 Minutes.
7. Did You Enjoy This Dish? Explore More Vegan Chinese Recipes.

title: Turmeric & Sweet Potato Falafels
ingredients:
1. 240G8Oz Chickpeas Or 1 Tin Drained
2. 300G10Oz Sweet Potatoes Or 1 Medium Sized
3. 2 Large Cloves Garlic
4. 1 Handful Fresh Coriander Leaves
5. Teaspoon Ground Cardamon
6. Heaped Teaspoon Ground Turmeric Or 1 Heaped Tablespoon Of Freshly Grated
7. 2 Teaspoons Heaped Ground Coriander
8. 1 Teaspoon Heaped Ground Cumin
9. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
10. 1 Heaped Teaspoon Sea Salt
11. 2 Tablespoons Gram Flour Chickpea Flour
12. Extra Gram Flour For Rolling With
preparation:
1. Scrub And Chop The Sweet Potato And Boil Until Soft With Skin Still Included (Approximately 10 Minutes). Then Drain And Place In A Mixing Bowl.
2. Crush Garlic And Chop Along With Coriander Leaves (As Small As You Can) With A Sharp Knife.
3. Add All Ingredients Into Blender Or Food Processor (Except The Gram Flour). I Find This Actually Works Best With A Hand (Immersion) Blender. With A Hand Blender, You Can Apply Downward Pressure And Get In There Nicely… If You Use A Jug Blender Or Food Processor It Will Work Fine If You Keep Scraping Down The Sides And Loosen The Mixture. Alternatively You Could Go For The Real Rustic Effect And Use A Strong Potato Masher To Do The Job Instead. Blend Until Most Of The Mixture Is Broken Down. It Doesn’T Need To Be Totally Smooth; It Can Be Quite Rustic.
4. Once Blended Add The Gram Flour And Continue To Mix In With A Spoon. If You Leave It On The Side For A While (Half And Hour Or Half A Day) Then It Will Firm Up A Little Making It Slightly Easier To Roll. I Sometimes Let It Stand If I Have Time, But That’S Not Essential.
5. Chickpea Moisture Varies From Batch To Batch. The Mixture Should Be Soft And Pliable, Easy To Roll Into A Ball In Your Hands. Take A Heaped Teaspoon Worth Of Mixture And Roll A Small Ball (This Should Be Smaller Than A Golf Ball). The Delightful Yellowness Glow Of The Turmeric Will Rub Off A Bit On Your Hands. If You’D Rather Now Yellow-Out Your Hands Then Use Extra Gram Flour To Roll With. If Your Mixture Is Too Soft To Roll Well, Then Add A Little Extra Gram Flour Or Use Gram Flour To Roll In.
6. Place On A Lightly Oiled Baking Tray And Bake In Preheated Oven At Gas Mark 6 Or 7 (200˚C To 220˚C/ 400˚F To 425˚F) For Approximately 30 Minutes Or Until Tanned.
7. Enjoy!

title: Christmas Savoury Roulade
ingredients:
1. 1 Sheet Of Jus Rol Puff Pastry
2. Filling
3. 1  2 Packs Of Stuffing Mix A Flavour Of Your Choice  I Use Sainsburys Taste The Difference Chestnut Cranberry And Orange
4. 2 Linda Mccartney Rosemary And Red Onion Sausages Cooked And Diced
5. Approx 8 Chopped Precooked Chestnuts I Use Merchant Gourmet
6. Approx 4 Chopped And Lightly Fried Chestnut Mushrooms
7. Additional Seasonings To Suit Your Taste
preparation:
1. Soak The Stuffing Mix, Precooked Chestnuts And Precooked Sausages For 15 Minutes. Leave To Cool Or Place In The Fridge Overnight.
2. When Preparing To Cook, Preheat The Oven To 200C.
3. Place The Filling In A Line Downthe Centre Of The Unrolled Puff Pastry Sheet.
4. Wrap The Pastry Around The Filling And Seal.
5. Slice Some Diagonal Lines Along The Top Of The Pastry And Brush With A Small Amount Of Oil.
6. Place In The Oven And Cook For Approximately 40 Minutes, Or Until Golden Brown And The Pastry Has Cooked Through.
7. Leave To Cool And Serve At A Family Buffet With Christmas Chutney, Or Serve With Your Christmas Dinner Covered In Gravy. Yum!

title: Sour and Spicy Noodles
ingredients:
1. Omnipork Defrosted  120 G
2. Sweet Potato Noodles  160 G
3. Minced Garlic  1 Tsp 5G
4. Chili Bean Sauce  2 Tbsps 30G
5. Soybeans  2 Tbsps 30G
6. Peanut  2 Tbsps 30G
7. White Sesame  2 Tbsps 18G
8. Coriander  As Appropriate
9. 
10. Broth Seasoning Per Bowl
11. Zhenjiang Vinegar  2 Tbsps 30Cups
12. Light Soy Sauce  1 Tbsp 15Cups
13. Sugar  1 Tsp 5G
14. Salt  12 Tsp 3G
15. Chili Oil  1 Tbsp 15Cups
16. 
17. Chili Oil
18. Dried Chili  40 G
19. Spring Onion Chopped  2 Pcs 10G
20. Ginger Sliced  5 Slices 20G
21. Sichuan Pepper  1 Tbsp 15G
22. Star Anise  3 Pcs 15G
23. Oil  200 Cups
preparation:
1. Heat Oil In A Wok And Stir-Fry Minced Garlic Until Aromatic. Then, Add Omnipork And Stir In Chili Bean Sauce, Set Aside.
2. Chili Oil: Soak Dried Chili, Then Drain And Pat Dry Chilies. Blend Them Thoroughly Into A Paste, Set Aside.
3. Heat 200Ml Oil In A Wok, Stir-Fry Ginger, Spring Onion, Sichuan Pepper And Star Anise Until Fragrant, Then Turn Off Heat. Pour Oil Into The Bowl Using A Sieve To Separate The Oil And Ingredients To Make Chili Oil.
4. Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat And Deep-Fry Peanuts And Soybeans Until Crispy, Drain And Set Aside.
5. Soak Sweet Potato Noodles In Warm Water For 1 Hour Until Softened. Cook In Boiling Water Until Transparent, Drain And Set Aside.
6. Prepare A Bowl, Add All Ingredients Of Broth, Chili Oil And Boiling Water And Mix Well. Add Glass Noodles, Omnipork, Fried Soybeans And Peanuts Into The Bowl. Sprinkle White Sesame And Top With Coriander To Serve.

title: Creamy Lemon Breaded Chicken
ingredients:
1. Serves 2
2. 1 Pack 180G Likemeat Breaded Chicken
3. Spaghetti Enough For 2 People
4. 1 Medium Onion Finely Chopped
5. 2 Cloves Of Garlic Minced
6. A Handful Of Peas Frozen Works Best
7. 250Cups Of Vegan Cream Or Plant Milk
8. 3 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
9. 12 Tsp English Mustard
10. The Juice And Zest From One Lemon
11. 1 Vegetable Stock Cube
12. 12 Tsp Smoked Paprika
13. A Generous Pinch Sea Salt And A Grind Of Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Prepare The Spaghetti In A Saucepan And Allow To Cook While You’Re Making The Sauce.
2. Heat 1 Tbsp Oil In A Large Frying Pan On A Medium Heat.
3. Add The Chopped Onion And Fry For 3-4 Minutes To Soften.
4. Add The Garlic And Stir In. Stir In The Frozen Peas And Cook For A Couple More Minutes.
5. Pour In The Cream With The Onions Plus Lemon Juice, Zest, Mustard, Nutritional Yeast, Salt, Pepper, Stock Cube And Paprika.
6. Simmer For 2-3 Minutes Stirring Occasionally.
7. In A Separate Pan Fry The Breaded Chicken For 3 Minutes Each Side.
8. Drain The Cooked Spaghetti (Saving A Little Of The Pasta Water) And Add The Spaghetti To The Lemon Sauce.
9. Add A Little Of The Pasta Water To The Sauce To Thicken It. Coat The Spaghetti In The Sauce And Pour Into Bowls.
10. Slice The Breaded Chicken Into Strips And Place On Top Of The Pasta.
11. Garnish With A Dash Of Olive Oil, Parsley And Lemon Zest.

title: Seitan “a la Taronja”
ingredients:
1. 200G Seitan
2. 2Tbsp Olive Oil
3. Juice From 1 Orange
4. 120G Pickled Red Cabbage
5. 1 Tsp Salt  Sea Algae Mix
6. 2 Tbsp Orange Marmalade
7. 2 Tsp Cumin Seeds
8. 1 Tbsp Capers
9. 1 Orange Sliced
10. 200 Cups Veg Broth
11. Pinch Pepper
preparation:
1. Cut The Seitan In Thin Slices And Brown In A Pan With Some Olive Oil.
2. Throw In The Cabbage And Season With Salt And Pepper. Add The Cumin Seeds, Orange Juice, Marmalade And Capers. Stir And Cover.
3. Add The Broth And Leave To Simmer For Approx. 10 Mins Or Until The Cabbage Has Absorbed Most Of The Liquid.
4. Add The Orange Slices And Cook For A Further 2-3 Mins.
5. Serve With Basmati Rice.

title: Chocolate, Cherry and Honeycomb Parfait
ingredients:
1. For The Honeycomb
2. 5 Tbsp Granulated Sugar
3. 2 Tbsp Golden Syrup
4. Tsp Bicarbonate Of Soda
5. For The Parfait
6. 200G Dark Dairyfree Chocolate
7. 150G Dairyfree Margarine Or Coconut Oil At Room Temperature
8. 2 Tbsp Golden Syrup
9. 85G Blanched Almonds Or Use The Same Weight In Favourite Gluten Free Vegan Biscuits If You Cant Have Nuts Or Stem Ginger Instead For Extra Flavour
10. 85G Glace Cherries
11. 100G Dried Cranberries
preparation:
1. You Will Need A 450G/1Lb Loaf Tin For This Recipe
2. Begin By Making The Honeycomb. Generously Grease A Flat Baking Tray With Vegetable Oil. Melt The Granulated Sugar And Golden Syrup In A High Sided Saucepan Over A Low Heat. Once Melted, Turn Up The Heat A Little And Bubble The Syrup Until It Turns To A Rich, Caramel Gold Colour. Whisk In The Bicarbonate Of Soda – This Will Make The Syrup Foam Up, Hence The High Sided Pan – And Immediately Pour The Mixture Onto Your Greased Baking Tray. Set The Tray Aside And Leave It To Cool For 20 Minutes, Before Sliding The Honeycomb Off And Chopping It Roughly Into Small Chunks For The Parfait.
3. Next, Line The Loaf Tin With Enough Cling Film To Allow It To Drape Over The Edges By About 3 Inches, Smoothing The Cling Film Into The Tin To Form A Crease Free Base.
4. Break Up The Dark Chocolate And Roughly Chop The Almonds. Place The Chocolate, Golden Syrup And Margarine In A Heatproof Bowl Over A Pan Of Simmering Water, Stir Together Until Melted And Combined To A Smooth And Glossy Finish.
5. Take The Bowl Off The Heat And Stir In The Chopped Honeycomb, Almonds, Cherries And Cranberries. Spoon The Mixture Into The Lined Tin And Level The Top. Fold The Overhanging Cling Film Loosely Over The Top Of The Parfait And Then Place In The Freezer For 1 Hour, Remove From The Freezer And Transfer The Parfait To The Fridge Until Set. Once Ready To Serve, Carefully Lift The Parfait From The Tin, Unwrap The Cling Film And Cut Into 2 Cm Slices To Serve.
6. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Individual Mushroom Parcels
ingredients:
1. 1 Packet 320G Readyrolled Puff Pastry All Jusrol Pastry Is Suitable For Vegans Except All Butter And Sweet Shortcrust Products
2. 4 Large Flat Mushrooms
3. 4 Tbsp Vegan Pesto
4. 8 Sundried Tomatoes In Oil Drained
5. 150G Vegan Mozzarella Cheezly By Vbites Works Well
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 220°C/425 °F/Gas 7
2. Unroll The Pastry And Cut Into 4 Pieces
3. Roll These 4 Pieces Into Squares
4. Place A Mushroom On Each Square And Top The Mushroom With The Pesto Sauce, Tomatoes, Then The Sliced Cheezly
5. Season
6. Now Bring Up The Corners Of The Pastry Over The Topping And Press To Seal Together
7. Place These Parcels On A Baking Sheet And Bake For 20 Mins Until The Pastry Is Golden
8. These Can Be Made And Kept In The Fridge Until Ready To Cook And They Can Also Be Frozen After Cooking And Then Reheated.

title: Lemon Pepper Vegan Fish Tacos
ingredients:
1. 2 Quorn Breaded Fishless Fillets Or Similar
2. 150G Pineapple Diced
3. 25G Red Onion Diced
4. 1 Fresh Jalapeno Chilli Seeds Removed And Diced
5. 2 Tbsp Finely Chopped Fresh Coriander
6. 2 Tbsp Lime Juice Plus Wedges For Serving
7. 14 Tsp Each Ground Cumin Chilli Powder Salt And Pepper
8. 60G Finely Shredded Red Cabbage
9. 4 Corn Tortillas Warmed
10. Lime Wedges For Serving
preparation:
1. Prepare The Quorn Fishless Breaded Fillets With A Lemon & Pepper Breadcrumb According To Package Directions.
2. Meanwhile, Toss Together The Pineapple, Red Onion, Jalapeno, Coriander, Lime Juice, Cumin, Chili Powder, Salt And Pepper. Let It Stand For 5-10 Minutes For The Flavours To Marry.
3. Slice Each Fillet Into 6 Strips And Serve With The Pineapple Salsa And Cabbage In The Tortillas, With Lime Wedges For Squeezing.
4. Tips: Substitute Pineapple With Mango. Add Avocado Slices Or Guacamole To The Tacos If Desired.
5. Did You Enjoy This Dish? Explore More Vegan Seafood Recipes.

title: Bean & Sweetcorn Soup
ingredients:
1. 2 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil
2. 1 Clove Garlic Minced
3. 1 Carrot Cut Into Small Cubes
4. 1 Celery Stalk Cut Into Small Cubes
5. 2 Small Leeks Finely Sliced
6. 4 Tbsp Tomato Passata
7. 1 Cup Of Borlotti Or Mixed Beans Cooked Canned Organic Is Fine
8. 2 Stamp Size Pieces Kombu Seaweed Optional
9. 1 Sachet Miso Bouillon Or 1 Organic Vegetable Stock Cube
10. Small Jar Of Peas And Corn
11. 4 Cups Filtered Water
12. 2 Tbsp Finely Diced Fresh Parsley
13. Sea Salt And Black Pepper To Taste Optional
preparation:
1. Bring The Kettle To A Boil, And Mix The Ingredients Of The Miso Bouillon Sachet Or Vegetable Stock Cube In 4 Cups Of The Hot Water And Set Aside.
2. In A Pot, Warm Up The Oil And Add The Garlic And Fry For A Few Seconds. Add The Carrots And Celery And Leeks And Sauté For Five Minutes. Add The Tomato Passata And Cook For A Further Few Minutes. Add The Beans, Kombu And Stock. Bring To The Boil And Cook For 20 Minutes On A Low Heat.
3. Remove And Discard The Kombu.
4. Remove One Heaped Cup Of The Soup, Blend To A Cream In An Upright Blender Or Use A Stick Blender And Return To The Pot.
5. Stir In The Jar Of Corn/Peas And Simmer For 5 Minutes. Stir In The Parsley.
6. Season The Soup To Taste With Salt And Black Pepper (Optional) And If You Prefer Finish Off With A Swig Of Olive Oil.

title: Raspberry, Vanilla, Coconut and Passionfruit Pancakes
ingredients:
1. 1  Cups Buckwheat Flour
2. 1 Cup Coconut Yoghurt
3. Cup Almond Meal Or Desiccated Coconut
4. 2 Passionfruit
5. 1 12 Tsp Baking Powder
6. 1 Punnet Raspberries
7. Pinch Ground Cinnamon
8. 13 Cup Toasted Coconut Flakes
9. 1 Cup Califia Farms Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk
10. Maple Syrup To Drizzle
11. 2 Tbsp Coconut Oil
12. 1 Tsp White Vinegar Optional
13. 13 Cup Maple Syrup Or Coconut Sugar
14. Zest 1 Lemon
15. Cup Coconut Oil Or Nondairy Butter To Cook The Pancakes
preparation:
1. Add And Mix Through The Almond Milk, Coconut Oil, Vinegar, If Using, Maple And Lemon Zest.
2. Heat A Non-Stick Frying- Pan Over A High Heat And If You Have One, Place A Love Heart Cutter In The Pan.
3. Add A Little Oil To The Pan And Spoon In About ½ Cup Of Pancake Batter. Cook For About 2 Minutes Then Carefully Flip And Cook For 2 Minutes More. If Using The Heart Cutter, Remove This Before Flipping The Pancake. Repeat Until All The Mix Has Been Cooked.
4. To Serve, Combine The Yoghurt With The Pulp Of 1 Passion Fruit And Spoon This Over Your Pancakes Then Top With Raspberries, Coconut Maple Syrup And More Passionfruit.

title: Jackfruit Ceviche
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 20 Oz Green Jackfruit In Water Or Brine
2. Cup Peeled And Small Diced Tomato
3. Cup Peeled Seeded And Small Diced Cucumber
4. Cup Small Diced Onion
5. Cup Chopped Cilantro
6. 1 Clove Garlic Minced
7. 1 Small Serrano Chili Seeded And Finely Minced
8. Juice Of 1 Lime
9. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
10. Tsp Fine Sea Salt Or Kosher Salt Or More To Taste
11. Tsp Coarse Ground Black Pepper
12. Tsp Ground Cumin
13. Ripe But Firm Avocado Diced
preparation:
1. Canned Green Jackfruit Bears A Resemblance To Flaked Crabmeat When Cooked. It Can Be Found In Indian And Asian Markets Or Purchased Through The Internet. Look For The Label “Green Jackfruit” Or “Young Green Jackfruit” And Be Sure That It’S Packed In Water Or Brine And Not Syrup. Cans Of Ripe Jackfruit Packed In Syrup May Be Stocked Nearby, But Don’T Be Tempted To Substitute As The Ripe Fruit Will Be Too Sweet For This Application.
2. *Chef’S Note: Traditional Ceviche Made With Fresh Seafood Has A Fresh, Clean Flavor And Should Not Be Fishy. If You Wish To Add A Subtle Ocean Flavor To This Plant-Based Version Add A Little Bit Of Dried Kelp Flakes Or Flaked, Toasted Nori.
3. Drain The Jackfruit And Rinse. If The Jackfruit Was Canned In Brine, Rinse Thoroughly. Add The Chunks Of Jackfruit To 1 Quart Salted Boiling Water. Reduce The Heat To A Slow Boil And Cook For 15 Minutes. Drain In A Colander And Let Cool. When Cool Enough To Handle, Remove The Tough Core From Each Chunk Of Jackfruit With A Sharp Knife And Discard. Break The Chunks Apart With Your Fingers And Remove The Soft Seeds And Seed Membranes And Discard. The Remaining Flaky Pulp Is The Only Portion You Will Want To Use In The Dish, So Sort Through The Chunks Carefully (There Will Be A Significant Amount Of Unusable Material). Wrap The Pulp In A Lint-Free Kitchen Towel And Squeeze To Remove Excess Water. Coarsely Chop The Pulp And Place In A Mixing Bowl.
4. Add The Remaining Ingredients Except For The Avocado And Toss Well To Combine. Refrigerate For Several Hours To Marinate The Ingredients And Blend The Flavors. Add The Diced Avocado Just Before Serving And Toss Well. The Avocado Can Also Be Placed Into A Ring Mold And The Ceviche Layered On Top For A Lovely Presentation. Season The Ceviche With Additional Salt As Desired And To Taste. Serve With Crunchy Tortilla Chips.
5. Tip: Strips Of Flour Or Corn Tortilla That Have Been Flash-Fried In Cooking Oil Make An Interesting And Crunchy Garnish.
6. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Vegan Tuna Melt
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
2. 2 Red Onions Sliced
3. 1 Tablespoon Sugar
4. 1 Packet Of Future Farm Tvna
5. 2 Tablespoons Vegan Mayo
6. A Small Handful Of Chives Finely Chopped Optional
7. 1 Teaspoon White Wine Vinegar
8. 4 Slices Of Bread
9. 2 Tablespoons Vegan Butter
10. 1 Jalapeno Finely Sliced
11. Salt And Freshly Ground Black Pepper
preparation:
1. In A Medium Sized Frying Pan, Heat The Oil On A Low Heat. Add The Onions And Cook For 10-15 Minutes Until Softened And Beginning To Caramelise. Add The Sugar And Cook For A Further 5 Minutes Until Sticky, Dark And Soft. Set Aside.
2. In A Bowl, Mix The Tvna With The Vegan Mayo, Chives And Vinegar. Season Generously With Pepper. Set Aside.
3. Butter The Bread Then Add To A Dry Frying Pan Until Golden And Toasted On One Side. Flip Over And Add A Cheese Slice To Each Piece Of Bread And Continue To Cook Until Melted.
4. Assemble The Tuna Melt By Sandwiching The Tuna Mayo Mixture With Caramelised Onions And Sliced Jalapenos Between Two Slices Of Cheesy Toast.

title: Vanilla Fudge
ingredients:
1. 370G Carnation Vegan Condensed Milk Alternative
2. 120Cups Plant Milk Alternative
3. 350G Demerara Sugar
4. 115G Vegan Spread Or Butter Alternative
5. 2 Tsp Vanilla Bean Extract Or Vanilla Extract
6.
preparation:
1. Line A 20Cm Square Cake Tin With Baking Parchment. Set Aside.
2. Place The Ingredients Into A Large Non-Stick Saucepan And Melt Over A Low Heat, Stirring Until The Sugar Dissolves.
3. We Like To Add A Little Pinch Of Salt To The Caramel Which You Can Do At The Beginning Of This Step.
4. Bring To The Boil Then Simmer For 5-8 Minutes, Stirring Continuously And Scraping The Base Of The Pan. Take Care While The Mixture Boils And During Stirring As The Fudge Will Be Very Hot! To See If It’S Ready, Drop A Little Of The Mixture Into A Jug Of Ice-Cold Water. A Soft Ball Of Fudge Should Form.
5. Alternatively, Check With A Sugar Thermometer If You Have One (The Fudge Should Be Approximately 112-115°C).
6. Remove The Fudge From The Heat And Leave To Cool For 5 Minutes. Beat The Mixture Until It Loses Its Shine And Becomes Very Thick (This Should Take About 10 Minutes). You’Ll Have A Dead Arm But It’S Worth It For The Best Ever Vegan Fudge!
7. You Can Add Chopped Chocolate, Nuts, Stem Ginger, Cookie Pieces, Alcohol, Flavouring Extracts Whatever You Like To The Fudge After Its Cooled And Then Beat As Usual.
8. Press Into The Prepared Tin With The Back Of A Spoon And Leave To Set Before Cutting Into Squares.
9. The Fudge Will Keep For Up To 2 Weeks In An Airtight Container At Room Temperature.

title: Quick Cream of Watercress Soup
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Vegan Margarine Eg Pure Vitalite Suma Or Biona
2. 2 Tsp Olive Oil
3. 1 Onion Peeled And Chopped Roughly
4. 1 Large Bunch Of Watercress Or 2 Bags Readywashed Watercress  Keep A Few Small Sprigs For Garnish
5. 500Cups18Fl Oz Strong Vegan Stock  Use 2 Green Oxo Or 2 Tsp Vegan Bouillon Powder Such As Marigold
6. 2 Tsp Dried Parsley Or 1 Handful Of Fresh Chopped Roughly
7. 2 Tins Of White Beans Eg Butterbean Haricot Cannellini
8. 1 Pinch Nutmeg
9. Dash Of Soya Milk Or Soya Cream  Or Other Unsweetened Plain Plant Milk Such As Coconut Or Rice
10. Salt And Lots Of Black Pepper
preparation:
1. In A Medium-Large Saucepan, Heat The Margarine. When It Is Melted, Add The Oil. Fry The Onion Gently In The Fat Until It Is Translucent (Softened But Not Brown).
2. Add The Watercress And Sauté For Another Few Minutes.
3. Add The Stock, Parsley, Beans And Nutmeg. Bring To The Boil Then Simmer For 15-20 Minutes.
4. Blend Until Smooth. Taste And Season – Add More Salt/Pepper/Nutmeg As Desired. Add The Soya Milk Or Soya Cream At This Point.
5. Add The Watercress Sprigs Just Before Serving.

title: Crispy Sesame Tofu
ingredients:
1. 250G Plain Tofu
2. Marinade
3. 100Cups Apple Juice
4. 4 Tbsps Shoyu Sauce
5. 2 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
6. Thumb Size Piece Of Fresh Ginger Root Peeled And Sliced
7. 1 Red Chilli Deseeded And Chopped
8. Tofu Crust
9. 50G Cornflour
10. 3 Tbsps Black Sesame Seeds
11. 3 Tbsps White Sesame Seeds
12. 1 Tsp Chilli Flakes
13. Sunflower Oil For Shallow Frying
preparation:
1. Slice The Tofu Horizontally, Then Cut Diagonally Into 8 Triangles. Place The Tofu In A Shallow Dish.
2. Mix Together The Marinade And Pour Over The Tofu.
3. Leave The Tofu To Marinade For At Least An Hour, Turn The Tofu Half Way Through So That It Marinated Evenly.
4. Mix Together The Tofu Crust Ingredients. Take The Tofu Pieces One At A Time And Dip Into The Mix So That The Crust Sticks To All Sides.
5. Shallow Fry The Tofu, Until Crisp. Set Aside.
6. Strain The Marinade And Keep As A Dipping Sauce.

title: Vegan Sausage Roll
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Of Quorn Vegan Cumberland Sausages Defrosted
2. 4 Sage Leaves
3. 3 Sprigs Of Thyme Leaves Only
4. 1 Apple Grated
5. 1 Clove Of Garlic Crushed
6. Tsp Salt
7. Tsp Black Pepper
8. 1 Pack Of Readytoroll Vegan Puff Pastry
9. 1 Tbsp Vegan Milk
preparation:
1. Preheat Your Oven To 200C And Line A Baking Tray With Greaseproof Paper.
2. Place The Quorn Vegan Cumberland Sausages, Sage Leaves, Apple, Garlic, Salt And Pepper And Pulse Until Smooth.
3. Remove The Puff Pastry From Its Packaging And Roll Out On To A Clean, Flat Surface. Cut In Half Lengthways To Create Two Long Strips. Divide The Sausage Mixture And Place In A Long Sausage Shape Across The Long Edge Of The Pastry Strips.
4. Using Both Hands, Tightly Roll And Fold The Pastry Over, Tucking In Underneath And Pressing Lightly To Seal The Pastry. Brush The Pastry With The Vegan Milk. Transfer On To The Baking Tray And Bake For 20 Minutes.

title: Chicken-style Skewers with Peanut Satay
ingredients:
1. Box Frys Chickenstyle Strips
2. 4 Tbsp Peanut Butter
3. Tsp Cumin Powder
4. 4 Tbsp Soy Sauce
5. 2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
6. 1 Tsp Garlic Powder
7. Tsp Ginger Powder
8. 1 Tsp Turmeric
9. Sugar
10. Plantbased Milk Or Water As Needed
11. Sliced Scallions Or Green Onions Crushed Peanuts And Fresh Coriander For Garnish
12. Skewers For Serving
preparation:
1. For The Peanut Satay, Combine The Peanut Butter, Cumin Powder, Soy Sauce, Lemon Juice, Garlic Powder, Ginger Powder, Turmeric And Sugar In A Bowl. Stir All Ingredients Together. Add A Little Bit Of Plant-Based Milk Or Water To Thin Out The Mixture As Needed.
2. In The Airfryer, Air Fry The Chicken-Style Strips For 6 Minutes At 185°C*.
3. Combine Chicken-Style Strips And Sauce In A Dish, Ensuring The Strips Are Covered With By The Sauce. For Best Results, Marinade For An Hour (Or Overnight) In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator.
4. Thread The Chicken-Style Strips Onto Skewers. Add The Chicken-Style Strips To The Airfryer And Air Fry For 2-3 Minutes To Reheat.
5. Sprinkle The Skewers With Fresh Scallions, Crushed Peanuts And Coriander, And Serve With The Remaining Sauce On The Side.
6. *Reduce Cooking Time If The Chicken-Style Strips Have Defrosted.

title: Warm Potato Salad with Chargrilled Asparagus and Lemon
ingredients:
1. 400G Cherry Tomatoes Halved
2. 1 Tbsp Soft Brown Sugar
3. Salt And Black Pepper
4. 100G Asparagus
5. 1 Lemon Very Thinly Sliced
6. 15G Roughly Chopped Parsley
7. 1 Crushed Garlic Clove
8. 600G Jersey Royal Potatoes Washed And Scraped Clean But Skins Left On
9. 60Cups Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Heat The Oven To 140C. Place The Tomatoes Cut-Side Up On A Baking Tray Lined With Greaseproof Paper, Sprinkle With The Sugar And A Little Salt, And Bake For 90Minutes, Until Semi-Dry. Remove From The Ovenand Set Aside To Cool Down.
2. Place The Asparagus In A Bowl And Coat With A Little Olive Oil, Salt And Pepper. Heat The Griddle Pan On The Hob And Once Very Hot Add The Asparagus. Cook For 2 Minutes On Each Side Until Chargrilled. Place The Asparagus In A Large Mixing Bowl, Along With The Now Cool Dried Tomatoes, The Lemon, Parsley And Garlic.
3. Place The Potatoes In A Large Saucepan, Cover With Plenty Of Cold Water, Add A Good Dose Of Salt And Boil For 20-25 Minutes, Until Just Cooked. Drain, Leave To Cool A Little, Then Cut Into Quarters Or Halves.
4. Wipe Clean The Potato Pan, Pour In The Olive Oil And Heat Up. Return The Potatoes To The Pot And Fry For About 10 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Until Golden Brown On All Sides. Add The Warm Potatoes To The Salad, Toss Gently, Taste And Season. Add A Little More Olive Oil If Necessary.

title: Beyond Meat Chilli Beef Lettuce Cups
ingredients:
1. 1 Pack Beyond Mince
2. 3 Tbsp Veg Oil
3. 2 Garlic Cloves Peeled And Minced
4. 2 Tbsp Ginger Choppedgrated
5. 1 Long Red Chili Sliced
6. 40 Cups Soy Sauce
7. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
8. 1 Tbsp Gochujang Paste
9. Handful Of Coriander
10. 2 Baby Gems
11. 1 Cucumber
12. 1 Carrot Peeled
13. 250 Ml Rice Vinegar
14. 150 G Sugar
15. Tsp Chili Flakes
16. 1 Tbsp Grated Ginger
17. 2 Spring Onion Thinly Sliced Lengthwise
preparation:
1. Combine The Vinegar Together With The Sugar, Tbsp Of Grated Ginger, Salt And Chili Flakes, Whisk Until The Sugar Has Dissolved.
2. Shave The Carrot And The Cucumber Into Ribbons, Use A Peeler Or A Mandoline. Add Both To The Pickle Juice And Set Aside For At Least 30” Before Using
3. In A Wok Or Frying Pan Add The Beyond Mince, Cook On Medium Heat Breaking It Down With A Spoon For 5”. Now Add The Vegetable Oil, Ginger, Garlic, Chili And Cook For 2”. Finally Add The Soay, Honey And Gochujang Paste, Stir Well And Cook For 10” Until The Mince Is Fully Cooked. Lave To Cool At Room Temperature.
4. Divide The Baby Gem Leaves And Spoon The Mince On Top Of Each Leaf. Garnish With The Pickles Vegetables And Fresh Cilantro And Spring Onion. Enjoy!

title: Tempeh Bacon Bowl
ingredients:
1. For The Tempeh Bacon
2. 200G Tempeh
3. 1 Tbsp Maple Syrup
4. 4 Tbsp Soy
5. 1 Tbsp Red Wine Vinegar
6. 1 Tsp Liquid Smoke
7. 1 Tsp Cumin
8. 1 Tsp Smoked Paprika
9. 1 Tsp Chilli Flakes
10. For The Squash
11. 1 Squash I Used Butternut But Acorn Squash Would Also Be Great
12. 2 Tsp Maple Syrup
13. 1 Tsp Coconut Oil Solid
14. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
15. 1 Tsp Sweet Paprika
16. 5 Sprigs Fresh Thyme Leaves Picked
17. For The Freekeh
18. 100G Freekeh
19. 500Cups Water
20. 1Tsp Coconut Oil Solid
21. 4 Cloves Garlic Sliced
22. 250G Mushrooms Chopped
23. 5 Sprigs Fresh Thyme Leaves Picked
24. For The Chickpeas
25. 1 Tin Chickpeas
26. 1 Tsp Coconut Oil Solid
27. 1 Tsp Smoked Paprika
28. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
29. 1 Tsp Chilli Flakes
30. 5 Sprigs Fresh Thyme Leaves Picked
31. Other
32. 510G Wakame
33. 300G Spring Greens Or Other Leafy Greens
34. 2 Medium Tomatoes
35. Avocado And Pickles Are Also Great Additions
36. For The Dressing
37. 1 Inch Fresh Ginger
38. 1 Tbsp Peanut Butter
39. 1 Red Chilli
40. 3 Sprigs Fresh Thyme Leaves Picked
41. 2 Tbsp White Miso
42. 1 Tsp Maple Syrup
43. 2 Tbsp Soy
44. Lime Juice
45. 2 Tbsp Water
46.
preparation:
1. Instruction : Time: 20 Minutes
2. Cooking Time: 60 Minutes
3. At Least 2 Hours In Advance: Prepare The Bacon By Slicing The Tempeh As Thinly As You Can And Coat It With The Marinade Ingredients.
4. Preheat The Oven To 200°C / 400°F / Gas Mark 6.
5. To Prepare The Squash, Use A Sharp Knife To Top And Tail It And Then Cut Lengthways Down The Middle. Scoop Out The Seeds And Stringy Bits Using A Spoon. Slice A Criss-Cross Pattern Across The Flesh And Drizzle The Maple Syrup And Oil Onto Each Half, Followed By The Seasoning.
6. Cook For 45 Minutes To An Hour. It Should Turn A Lovely Caramelised Brown, And Be Soft, But Not Mushy. Once Cooked, Slice Into Chunks.
7. Combine The Chickpeas, Oil And Seasoning In An Oven Proof Dish And Cook For 30 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally To Ensure Even Cooking.
8. Arrange The Tempeh Bacon Slices On A Flat Tray, Lined With Parchment Paper, And Pour Over Any Remaining Marinade. Place The Tray In The Oven And Cook For 20-30 Minutes, Turning Once.
9. While The Squash, Chickpeas And Tempeh Are Cooking, Prepare The Freekeh By Simmering In Water For 15 Minutes. Drain And Set Aside. Heat The Oil In A Large Pan And Sautée The Garlic, Mushrooms And Thyme Until Lightly Browned. Add The Freekeh, Stir And Take Off The Heat.
10. Once The Oven-Cooked Ingredients Are Almost Done, Slice The Greens Into Ribbons And Steam Until Soft. Rehydrate The Wakame According To The Packet And Slice Thinly. Slice The Tomatoes.
11. To Make The Dressing, Combine All The Ingredients In A Food Processor And Blend Until Smooth.
12. You’Re Now Ready To Assemble The Bowl! I Like To Start With The Freekeh And Greens, Then Layer In Sections, Finishing With The Dressing.

title: Spinach and Nutmeg Quinoa Bake
ingredients:
1. 4 Cups Cooked Quinoa Or Two Cups Uncooked
2. 2 Tablespoons Vegetable Bouillon Powder For The Quinoa Cooking Water
3. Olive Oil Sunflower Or Coconut Oil
4. 4 Teaspoons Egg Replacer Plus Liquid
5. 2 Onions One Red If Desired
6. 5 Cloves Garlic
7. 2 Teaspoons Nutmeg
8. Pinch Cayenne Pepper
9. 4 Cups Of Babyspinach Leaves
10. 3 Cups Vegan Sour Cream Or Coconut Cream
11. 2 Teaspoons Organic Lemon Zest
12. Teaspoon Freshly Ground Black Pepper
13. 1 Grated Carrot
14. 1 Teaspoon Turmeric
preparation:
1. If Cooking The Quinoa: Cook In Water And Bouillon, Until The ‘Tail’ Comes Out Of The Seed.
2. Preheat Oven To 350F/175C. Oil A 20 X 20Cm Baking Dish Or Line With Baking Paper.
3. Whisk Egg Replacer And Water And Leave To Sit. Sauté Chopped Onions And Garlic In A Little Oil For Several Minutes, Until Clear.
4. Add Nutmeg And Cayenne, Then Spinach, And Sauté For A Few Minutes.
5. Combine With The Egg Mixture. Mix Well, Then Add Quinoa, Carrot, Lemon Zest, Pepper, Turmeric And Cream.
6. When Well Mixed, Pour Into The Baking Dish. Bake For One Hour Or Until The Edges Are Brown.
7. After Cooking, Leave To Set For Ten Minutes. Can Be Served Hot Or Cold. Perfect For Lunch Boxes.

title: Portobello Mushrooms and Tofu Scramble Ciabatta Sandwich
ingredients:
1. 2 Half Ciabatta Loaves
2. 4 Portobello Mushrooms
3. 350G Firm Tofu 12 Oz
4. 2 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast
5. 12 Tsp Turmeric
6. 12 Tsp Dried Thyme
7. 1 Jar Of Vegan Red Pesto Or Equivalent
8. 2 Roasted Peppers In A Jar
9. Small Bunch Of Alfalfa Sprouts
10. 14 Red Onion Finely Chopped
11. Salt  Pepper
12. Olive Oil
13. Kalamata Olives To Serve Optional
preparation:
1. Put The Grill On.
2. Place Portobello Mushrooms In A Dish And Brush With Olive Oil. Place Under The Grill And Cook For 8 Mins On Each Side.
3. In A Saucepan Scramble The Drained Tofu With A Fork. Add Turmeric, Thyme And Nutritional Yeast. Blend Well And Cook Until Warm. Season To Taste.
4. When The Mushrooms Are Almost Cooked, Cut Ciabatta Loaves In Half Horizontally And Toast.
5. Spread Pesto Inside Each Toasted Ciabatta Halves.
6. For Each Sandwich, Sprinkle Ciabatta Bottom With Alfalfa Sprouts And Red Onions.
7. Stack 2 Mushrooms On Top, Followed By Half The Tofu Scramble And 1 Roasted Pepper.
8. Sprinkle With Alfalfa Sprouts And Cover With Ciabatta Top.
9. Serve With Kalamata Olives (Optional)

title: Tempeh Bolognese
ingredients:
1. For The Bolognese Sauce
2. 250G Tempeh
3. 250G Field Mushrooms Or Any Other Is Fine
4. 1 Stick Celery Finely Chopped
5. 1 Medium Carrot Finely Chopped
6. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
7. 4 Cloves Garlic
8. 20G Tomato Puree
9. 200Cups Red Wine
10. 1 Canned Chopped Tomatoes Or 400G
11. 300Cups Passata
12. 100Cups Water
13. Few Sprigs Rosemary And Thyme Finely Chopped
preparation:
1. Start To Pulse The Mushrooms As They Need To Be Pureed. Remove And Place Into A Bowl.
2. Do The Same To The Tempeh, But This Needs To Be A Bit Chunkier. Place It In With The Mushrooms.
3. Add The Mushroom And Tempeh Into The Pan, Turn The Heat Up To Cook Out The Mushroom Water. This Will Do Two Things: Give A Deep Colour And Intensify The Flavours.
4. Once The Mushroom Water Has Been Cooked Out And Evaporated, Transfer The Mix Out Of The Pan And Drain In The Colander.
5. In The Same Large Pan, Add Some Olive Oil. Add The Finely Chopped Veggies And Cook Slowly, Releasing All Those Beautiful Aromas And Flavours. Then In With The Garlic And Cook For A Further 2-3Mins.
6. Add The Finely Chopped Thyme And Rosemary And Continue To Cook For A Few Minutes.
7. Go In With The Tomato Puree, Cook Out Slowly For 3 Mins. Finely Add The Red Wine And Turn The Heat Up To Deglaze The Pan With All The Caramelized Sediment That’S On The Bottom Of The Pan – This Is Where All The Natural Flavour Is.
8. Reduce To Cook Out The Alcohol And Add The Tempeh And Mushroom Mixture Back Into The Pan. Give The Mix A Good Stir.
9. Add The Canned Tomatoes, Passata And Water. Give It A Good Stir.
10. Season With Salt And Pepper Cook For 10 Mins.
11. Have A Pan Of Boiling Water Ready To Cook The Pasta. Mix And Emulsify The Bolognese Sauce With The Cooked Pasta.
12. Finish With A Sprinkle Of Nutritional Yeast.
13. Serve And Enjoy!
14. Did You Like This Dish? Check Out This Lentil Bolognese Recipe Too.

title: Chunky Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1. 100G  3 Oz Vegan Margarine
2. 75G  2 Oz Fairtrade Soft Light Brown Sugar
3. 2 Tablespoons Rice Syrup Or Agave Nectar
4. 175G  6 Oz Selfraising Flour
5. 150G  5 Oz Vegan Dark Chocolate Roughly Chopped
6. 2 Tablespoons Plant Milk Of Your Choice Eg Soya Rice Or Oat Milk
preparation:
1. Preheat Your Oven To 180ºc/350ºf/Gas Mark 4 And Grease Two Baking Trays.
2. Cut The Chocolate Into Big Fat Chunks.
3. Soften The Margarine, Add The Sugar And Cream Together Until Light And Fluffy.
4. Stir In The Rice Syrup Or Agave Nectar, Flour, Plant Milk And Chocolate Chunks And Mix Well.
5. Place About 18 Spoonfuls Of The Mixture Onto The Baking Trays, Allowing Space For The Cookies To Spread A Little.
6. Bake For 8-10 Minutes.
7. Remove Immediately From The Baking Trays And Place On A Wire Rack To Cool.
8. Enjoy!

title: Double Chocolate & Banana French Toast
ingredients:
1. Makes 2 French Toast
2. 3 Tbs Of Selfraising Flour
3. 330 Cups Of Chocolate Flavoured Bright Barley Drinks Or Similar
4. 1 Pinch Of Salt
5. 1 Pinch Of Cinnamon
6. 4 Pieces Of Bread
7. For The Nutella Makes A 700 Gram Jar
8. 300 Grams Hazelnuts Lightly Toasted
9. 250 Cups Coconut Oil
10. 34 Tablespoons Maple Syrup
11. 3 Tablespoons Cacao Powder
12. 12 Vanilla Pod Bean Scraped Or 12 Teaspoon Ground Vanilla Pod
13. Toppings
14. Banana
15. Strawberries
16. Cinnamon Dusting
17. Fresh Berries
18. Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Start With The Nut-Ella
2. Place The Hazelnuts In A Preheated Oven 180 Degrees For 10 Minutes. This Way They Get Lightly Toasted And Release Fat So They Can Easily Be Made Into Nut Butter.
3. Put In A Blender And Blitz Until Fine. Start On The Low Setting And Work Your Way Up. Then Add The Rest Of The Ingredients And Blend To A Smooth Chocolate Paste.
4. Spoon Into A Clean Glass Jar Or Container And Set Aside.
5. For The French Toast
6. In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Plant Milk, Flour, Cinnamon And Pinch Of Salt.
7. Place The Bread In A Shallow Dish (With Sides) That Holds All Of The Bread. Pour The Batter Over The Bread Or Dip, Then Lift Or Flip It Over To Make Sure Both Sides Are Evenly Coated.
8. Heat A Drizzle Of Coconut Oil In A Large Frying Pan Over Medium Heat. When The Pan Is Hot, Add The Bread Slices And Cook For A Few Minutes Each Side Until Golden Brown.
9. To Make It Look Pretty, Arrange Your Toast Slices And Serve Scattered With Fresh Berries, Banana Slices And Big Generous Dollops Of Home-Made Nut-Ella!

title: Dark Chocolate Forest Fruit Cake
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cup Oat Flour
2. 14 Cup Starch I Used Potato Starch
3. 12 Cup Cocoa Powder
4. 1 Cup Apple Puree 2 Cored Apples Blended
5. 12 Cup Berry Juice Ie Cranberry Juice
6. 12 Tsp Pure Stevia
7. 1 Heaped Cup Of Mixed Frozen Berries For Top Use Frozen So The Fruit Does Not Burn
preparation:
1. Blend The Apples Until Smooth, Add The Stevia And Cocoa Powder. Mix Through The Flour And Starch And Lastly The Juice To Form A Smooth Thick Batter.
2. Spoon The Batter Into A 8″ Cake Tin And Roughly Smooth The Top. Pile The Frozen Berries On Top Of The Batter And Lightly Press.
3. Bake At 180C For Approx 35 Minutes- Check The Cake After 20 Minutes And If The Top Is Already Golden But Centre Still Requires Extra Time, Loosely Cover For The Final 15 Minutes Or So.
4. Serve Hot Or Cold, With Custard Or Cream (Vegan Of Course)!
5. *Note: I Used Apple Juice The First Time It Is Tasted Slightly Too Appley For My Taste But Was Still Fine. I Would Suggest Using A Berry Juice To Compliment The Berries On Top.

title: Christmas Nut Roast
ingredients:
1. 50G Quinoa Flakes
2. 100G Oat Flakes
3. 50G Oatmeal
4. 1 Sprig Of Rosemary
5. 6 Sage Leaves
6. 1 Bag 200250G Spinach Washed
7. 4 Cloves Garlic Crushed
8. 2 Tsp Salt
9. Black Pepper
10. Half Tsp Chilli Sauce Optional
11. 1 Can Of Chopped Tomatoes
12. 6 Dessertspoon Olive Oil
13. 1 Dessertspoon Rice Syrup
14. Nuts  Coarse Ground
15. 100G Cashew Nuts
16. 100G Walnuts
17. 100G Brazil Nuts
preparation:
1. Pre-Heat The Oven To 180°C
2. Grind The Nuts To A Coarse Texture In A Pestle And Mortar
3. Mix Together The Quinoa Flakes, Oat Flakes, Oatmeal And Nuts Into A Bowl
4. Bash Up The Salt, Garlic, Rosemary & Sage Leaves In A Pestle & Mortar To Make A Rough Paste And Add To The Mixing Bowl, Mix Well
5. Finely Chop The Spinach And Mix Into The Bowl
6. Add The Tomatoes (And Chilli Sauce If Using), Season With Black Pepper And Mix Well
7. Add The Olive Oil And Rice Syrup And Mix In Well
8. Line A Loaf Tin With Grease-Proof Paper And Spoon In The Mixture, Pressing Down Firmly As You Go
9. Cook For Approximately An 60-90 Minutes (Depending On Your Oven), Until Golden Brown On Top And Cooked All The Way Through

title: Lime and Mango Cheesecake
ingredients:
1. Crust
2. 1 Cup Raw Almonds
3. Cup Medjool Dates
4. Quarter Cup Desiccated Coconut
5. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Essence
6. Pinch Sea Salt
7. Filling
8. 2 Ripe Mangoes
9. Half A Lime Juice And Zest
10. Half Cup Broken Cashew Nuts Soak Overnight
11. 3 Tablespoons Coconut Oil
12. 5 Tablespoons Maple Syrup
13. 1 Cup Coconut Cream
14. 1 Tablespoon Fresh Mint Leaves
15. Teaspoon Vanilla Essence
preparation:
1. Whizz All The Crust Ingredients In A Food Processor Until It Forms Into Crumbs, Then Divide Between Four Mini-Tart Pans. Use Damp Fingers, And Press Down Until It Resembles A Crust. Leave To One Side While You Make The Filling.
2. Process The Mango, Cashews (Drained), Lime Juice And Zest, Coconut Oil And Cream, Mint, Vanilla And Maple Syrup Until Creamy.
3. Pour Into Crust Cases, And Freeze For At Least Two Hours.
4. Remove From The Freezer And Leave For Only A Few Minutes Before Serving. Garnish With Fresh Mint Leaves Or Lime Slices.

title: Cashew Oat Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup 120G Smooth All Natural Cashew Butter
2. 14 Cup 55G Coconut Oil
3. 13 Cup 95G Maple Syrup
4. 114 Cup 150G Oat Flour Or 1 Cup 120G Oat Flour  14 Cup 30G Pulsin Brown Rice Protein Powder
5. 12 Cup 50G Rolled Oats
6. 14 Tsp Baking Soda
7. Pinch Of Pink Himalayan Rock Salt
8. Pinch Or Two Of Cinnamon
9. 14 Tsp Vanilla Powder Or Pure Vanilla Extract Not Essence
10. 23 Tbsp Pulsin Sugarfree Chocolate Drops
preparation:
1. Melt Coconut Oil In The Microwave. Mix With Cashew Butter And Maple Syrup (Add Vanilla Extract If Using).
2. Mix Together Dry Ingredients…Protein (If Using), Oat Flour, Oats, Salt, Cinnamon, Baking Soda And Vanilla Powder If Using.
3. Make A Well In The Centre Of The Dry Ingredients. Pour In The Wet Ingredients And Mix Well To Combine. Allow To Cool For 10 Minutes Before Stirring In Chocolate Chips. Place Into The Fridge For 30 Minutes.
4. Preheat Oven To 180C (350F).
5. Use An Ice Cream Scoop To Scoop Out Dough Onto A Baking Paper Lined Baking Tray To Create 8-9 Cookies. Gently Flatten With The Palm Of Your Hand (They Will Spread A Little Whilst They Cook).
6. Bake In The Preheated Oven For 10 -12 Minutes (Until Golden!)… 12 Minutes For A Firmer Cookie But It Really Does Depend On Your Oven!
7. Allow To Cool On The Tray For 10 Minutes. Transfer To A Wire Rack To Cool Fully…Or Serve The Up Warm With Ice Cream Of Choice… I’D Opt For My Vanilla Bean Dream Ice Cream.
8. Once Cool Store In A Seal Tight Container At Room Temperature For Up To Four Days Or Freeze For Up To One Month.

title: Lemony Courgette Soup with Mint Pesto
ingredients:
1. 2 Tbsp Olive Oil
2. 2 White Onions
3. 1Kg Large Courgettes A Mix Of Yellow And Green Preferably Organic And Not Too Young
4. 1 Bay Leaf
5. 1  Tsp Herbs De Provence
6. Tsp Mustard Powder
7. 750Cups Vegetable Stock
8. 1 Unwaxed Lemon
9. Salt And Pepper To Season
10. Of A Nutmeg Plus More For Serving
11. For The Pesto
12. 25G Fresh Mint Leaves Picked
13. 2 Cloves Garlic Roughly Chopped
14. 60G Pine Nuts
15. 6 Tsp Olive Oil
16. 1 Tsp Nutritional Yeast
17. Tsp Salt
preparation:
1. Finely Chop The Onions. Using A Heavy Based, Lidded Pan Heat 2 Tbsp Of Olive Oil And Add The Onions Giving Them A Quick Stir So They Get Coated In The Oil. Pop The Lid On The Pan And, Keeping The Heat Low, Sweat The Onion For Around 10 Mins, Stirring Occasionally, Until Translucent. While The Onion Is Cooking You Can Prepare The Courgettes. Give Them A Wash, And Cut Away Any Damaged Skin. Slice Each Courgette In Half Lengthways And Slice Into ¼ Inch Pieces. When The Onions Are Cooked, Add The Courgettes, Bay Leaf, Herbs De Provence And Mustard Powder, Give Them A Good Stir, And Balance The Lid Back On The Pan So It Is Slightly Ajar. The Cooking Time Here Will Vary A Little Depending On The Size Of The Courgettes But This Should Be Around 20-25 Minutes With The Courgettes Taking On A Translucent Appearance When They Are Cooked.
2. While The Courgettes Are Cooking, Make The Pesto. Using A Food Processor Or A Pestle And Mortar Blend Together The Pine Nuts, Garlic, Mint And 4 Tsp Of The Olive Oil. Once A Coarse Paste Is Formed Add The Salt And The Nutritional Yeast. Give Another Quick Blend So The New Ingredients Are Integrated But The Texture Of The Pesto Remains Coarse.
3. Once The Courgettes Are Cooked, Add The Vegetable Stock And Grate In The Nutmeg. Keeping The Pan On A Low Heat Stir Well For A Minute Or Two Before Transferring The Contents To The Blender (Or Leave In The Pan If Using A Hand Blender). Puree The Soup Adding Some Hot Water If The Soup Is Too Thick, And Return To The Pan.
4. Zest The Lemon. Cover The Zest As It Dries Out Incredibly Quickly And Set Aside Until Serving. Disposing Of Any Pips, Squeeze The Juice Into The Hot Soup. Give A Quick Stir And Check The Seasoning.
5. To Serve, Ladle The Soup Into The Serving Bowls And Grate Over A Little Nutmeg. Rest A Dollop Of Pesto On Top Of The Soup Then Scatter Over The Lemon Zest.
6. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Spiced Apple Porridge with Grilled Pears
ingredients:
1. For The Grilled Pears
2. 2 Pears
3. Coconut Sugar
4. Pinch Of Ground Cinnamon
5. Pinch Of Ground Cloves
6. Pinch Of Ground Nutmeg
7. For The Porridge
8. 80G Porridge Oats
9. 300Cups Your Favourite Non Dairy Milk
10. Approx 50Cups Water
11. 1 Apple
12. 12Tsp Cinnamon
13. Pinch Of Ground Cloves
14. Pinch Of Ground Nutmeg
15. For Topping
16. 1 Tbsp Hazelnuts
17. 1 Tbsp Pumpkin Seeds
preparation:
1. Wash The Pears, Slice In Half Lengthways And Scoop Out The Core. Place On A Baking Tray And Sprinkle With The Sugar And Spices. Grill The Pears For Around 20-25 Minutes Whilst You Prepare The Porridge.
2. Place A Saucepan On A Low-Medium Heat And Add The Oats, Spices And Milk.
3. Wash The Apple And Grate It Before Adding It To The Saucepan Straight Away Before It Browns. Stir The Porridge Well Whilst It Cooks To Ensure You Get A Nice Creamy Porridge.
4. Whilst The Porridge Cooks, Heat A Frying Pan On A High Heat And Add The Hazelnuts. Shake Occasionally To Prevent Burning Until The Skins Start To Peel Away. Transfer Onto Some Kitchen Towel And Leave To Cool Slightly Before Rubbing In The Towel To Remove The Skins. Meanwhile Toast The Pumpkin Seeds In The Frying Pan, Shaking The Pan Until They Start To Pop Then Transfer Into A Bowl To Cool.
5. When The Porridge Starts To Thicken You May Need To Add Some Water, Up To 50Ml To Get Your Preferred Consistency. (I Always Find How Much Liquid You Require Can Vary Quite Dramatically Depending On What Oats You Use). After 15-20 Minutes You Should Have Perfect Creamy Porridge Ready To Serve.
6. Chop The Toasted Hazelnuts And Sprinkle Over Along With The Pumpkin Seeds. Finally Top With The Grilled Pears.

title: Overnight Oats
ingredients:
1. 4Tbsp Natural Oat Yogurt Or Your Choice Of Yogurt
2. 100G Rolled Porridge Oats
3. Handful Of Raspberries
4. Handful Of Blueberries
5. Drizzle Of Maple Syrup
6. 100Cups Almond Milk
7. 2 Tbsp Chia Seeds
8. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. In A Small Bowl, Add In Rolled Oats, Chia Seeds, Almond Milk, 4Tbsp Oat Yogurt And Maple Syrup And Stir With A Spoon To Combine.
2. Add Oats And Stir A Few More Times. Press Down With A Spoon To Ensure All Oats Have Been Moistened And Immersed In Almond Milk. Cover Securely And Set In The Fridge Overnight Or At Least 6 Hours To Set.
3. The Next Day, Loosen With A Splash Of Water (Or Milk) If Needed. Top With Oat Yogurt, Or Garnish With Berry Toppings As Desired.
4. Note Overnight Oats Will Keep In The Fridge For 2-3 Days, Though Best Within The First 12-24 Hours.

title: Chocolate Blueberry Lovehearts
ingredients:
1. Chocolate Ingredients
2. 50G 1 Oz Raw Cocoa Butter
3. 50G 1 Oz Raw Cocoa Powder
4. 3 Tablespoons Raw Coconut Sugar
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
6. Filling Ingredients
7. 70G 2Oz Fresh Blueberries
8. 40G 1Oz Coconut Butter
9. 1 Medjool Date Pitted
preparation:
1. You Will Need: A Heart-Shaped Chocolate Mould With 12 Hearts. You Can Use Any Chocolate Mould Shape If You’D Prefer A Different Shape.
2. You Can Also Watch A Video Demonstration Of Chocolate Making
3. Step One:
4. ‘Shave’ The Solid Cocoa Butter With A Sharp Knife Or Grater. Shaving Is Just Really Thin Slicing That Makes The Cocoa Butter Crumble. The Finer You Can Get It, The Easier It Will Be To Melt. You Can Leave It In Big Chunks If You Like, But Be Prepared To Wait A While For It To Melt.
5. Step Two:
6. Melt The Cocoa Butter. You Can Do This By Leaving It In A Warm Place In A Heat Proof Glass Bowl By A Fire Or Directly Above A Hot Radiator. It Melts At 34˚C. The Idea Is To Melt It, Rather Than Cook It, Maintaining Its ‘Un-Cookedness’. If You Don’T Have A Gentle Heat Source Then Use A Hob Or Stove.
7. Put The Cocoa Butter In A Small, Oven Proof, Glass Bowl And Then Put That Bowl In A Pan Containing An Inch Or So Of Really Hot Water. Keep The Hob/Stove Burning On A Low Heat. The Heat Will Then Transfer Through The Bowl, Enough To Melt The Cocoa Butter. Give It Frequent Stirs To Assist The Melting Process. Don’T Keep It On The Heat Any Longer Than It Takes To Melt It.
8. The Best Time To Use It Is When It Has Just Melted. If It Is Too Hot, Then It Takes Longer To Cool Down And The Coconut Sugar Will Sink To The Bottom Of The Chocolate When Added.
9. Step Three:
10. Add The Coconut Sugar To The Melting Cocoa Butter During Step Two. The Melting Cocoa Butter Will Help To Soften And Dissolve The Sugar.
11. Step Four:
12. When The Cocoa Butter Has Finally Melted, Mix In The Cocoa Powder And Any Other Remaining Ingredients.
13. Here’S The Fun Part!
14. Making Chocolate Hearts:
15. Place 1 Teaspoon Of Your Melted Chocolate Mixture Into Each Heart-Shaped Well. When You’Ve Put Some In Every Heart, Pop Them Into The Freezer Whilst You Prepare And Blend The Filling Ingredients.
16. Prepare The Filling:
17. Blend All The Filling Ingredients Together Thoroughly And Leave On The Side Whilst You Make The Chocolate.
18. Making Chocolate Hearts Continued:
19. Take Your Hearts Out Of The Freezer (After About 10 Minutes Worth Of Chilling) And Place The Blueberry Filling Into Each One. This Is Slightly Fiddly! Use A Teaspoon And A Knife To Help The Process…
20. Take About ½ A Teaspoon Of Filling And Gently Dollop It On Top Of The Freshly Chilled Chocolate Hearts. Aim Right For The Middle Of The Heart. You’Ll Find That Some Always Hits The Edges… Simply Tease It Back With Your Knife To Create A Thin Gap At The Edges (You’Ll See Why Next).
21. Take The Rest Of Your Melted Chocolate (You Should Have Some Left – If Not – Make Some More) And Pour 2 Or 3 Teaspoons Over Each Dollop. Place Your Tray Of Hearts Straight Into The Freezer To Help Your Chocolates Set. This Should Be Ready In About 15 Minutes. You Can Also Set Them By Leaving In The Fridge Or Any Cool Place (But Allow Extra Time For Setting).
22. Enjoy!

title: Tofu Satay With Peanut Sauce
ingredients:
1. Marinade
2. 2 Lemongrass Stalks Trimmed And Finely Chopped
3. 15G 7 12 Teaspoons Fresh Root Ginger Finely Chopped
4. 2 Plump Garlic Cloves Peeled And Crushed
5. 1 Red Chilli Deseeded If You Like It Less Hot Finely Chopped
6. 15 Tsp Ground Cumin
7. 2 Tsp Ground Coriander
8. 12 Tsp Ground Tumeric
9. 12 Tsp Agave
10. 3 Tsbp Tamari Or Soy Sauce
11. 1 Tbsp Rapeseed Oil Or Olive Oil
12. Peanut Satay Sauce
13. 100G 6 Tbsp Smooth Peanut Butter
14. 140Cups About 12 Cup Coconut Milk
15. 34 Tbsp Tamari Or Soya Sauce
16. 2 Tsp Lime Juice
17. 12 Tsp Chilli Flakes
18. 1 12 Tbsp Protein Powder Optional
19. 2 Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. If You Are Using Wooden Skewers, Soak Them For About 20-30 Mins In Cold Water So That They Do Not Burn When You Cook The Satay
2. Make The Marinade – Finely Chop The Lemon Grass, Root Ginger, Chillies And Mix With Crushed Garlic In A Bowl. Add The Ground Cumin, Coriander, Turmeric, Agave Syrup, Lime Juice, Tamari/Soya Sauce And Rapeseed Or Olive Oil. Alternatively, You Can Blitz This All In A Food Processor To Form A Paste
3. Prepare The Protein – Slice The Tofu Into Thick Slices About 1.5Cm Thick (Or Cubes If You Are Skewering Them)
4. Make The Satay – Put The Peanut Butter, Coconut Milk, Chilli Flakes, Tamari Or Soya Sauce, Lime Juice And Protein Powder Of Choice Into A Small Saucepan And On A Low Heat Melt The Peanut Butter And Mix All The Ingredients Together To Form A Thick Sauce. Pour Into A Bowl And Decorate With 2 Slices Of Fresh Red Chilli
5. Coat The Tofu With The Satay Marinade For At Least 30 Mins In The Fridge
6. Grill Marinated Tofu Slices For About 4-5 Mins Each Side. (Note: These Are Also Great On The Barbecue)
7. Season With A Twist Of Ground Black Pepper. Serve With Warm Protein Peanut Satay Sauce, Wedges Of Lime (The Sharpness Contrasts Beautifully With The Creaminess And Spicy Marinade) And Salad
8. So Man
9. Www.Sobody.Co.Uk
10. Hello! I Am So From Sobodyuk. I Am A Gym Bunny, Healthy Food Blogger & A Geeky Scientist! These Days My Lab Is The Kitchen! I Love Creating Delicious, Healthy, Wholefood, Clean-Eating, Nutrition-Dense Recipes To Maximise Performance & Health. My Recipes Include Paleo, Low Carb, Vegan, Vegetarian, Gluten Free.

title: Traditional Irish Pumpkin Brack
ingredients:
1. A Small Bit Of Pure Soya Butter For Greasing
2. 200G Light Muscavado Sugar
3. 200G Grated Pumpkin Flesh Try Squash Either
4. Finely Grated Zest And Juice Of 1 Lemon
5. 100G Raisins
6. 100G Ground Almonds
7. 200G Gluten Free Selfraising Flour Normal Flour Will Work Too
8. Pinch Of Salt
9. 1Tsp Cinnamon
10. A Generous Grating Of Nutmeg
11. 4 Tbsp Vinegar
12. 4 Tsp Baking Soda
13. The Brine From One Can Of Chickpeas
preparation:
1. Lightly Grease A Bread Loaf Tin (22 X 12Cm Or Something Like That) And Line It With Greaseproof Paper/Baking Parchment. (I Forgot To Do This Actually…)
2. Weigh Out And Prepare All Your Ingredients.
3. Add The Lemon Zest And Juice, Raisins And Ground Almonds To The Pumpkin Flesh In A Large Bowl.
4. Add The Baking Soda To The Vinegar In A Food Mixing Bowl.
5. Add The Sugar To This And Beat Using An Electric Whisk For 2-3 Minutes Until Pale And Creamy.
6. Add This To The Pumpkin Mixture And Lightly Stir.
7. Sieve The Flour And Add To The Mix Along With The Spices. Fold It All In Together Until Well Combined.
8. Using An Electric Whisk Beat The Chickpea Brine Until It Holds Soft Peaks Like What Egg Whites Would Do.
9. Stir A Heaped Tablespoon Of This Into The Brack Mixture To Loosen It And Then Fold The Rest In As Lightly As Possible.
10. Pour The Mixture Into A Prepared Load Tin And Even Out The Surface.
11. Bake It In The Oven For Around 1 Hour At The Temperature Recommended.
12. Check If Ready By Inserting A Skewer Or Knife Into The Centre. It Should Come Out Clean, But If It Doesn’T, Leave It In For Longer And Turn Down The Heat If It Is Starting To Burn Out The Outside. Remove The Loaf From The Tin And Leave In The Oven At An Even Lower Heat Near The End To Ensure Thorough Baking.
13. Then Let It Cool On A Wire Rack Before Slicing. Don’T Be Tempted To Slice Into It Before It Cools! It Could Fall Apart!
14. Enjoy With Some Soya Butter And A Cup Of Tea.

title: Vegetable ‘Butter’ Masala
ingredients:
1. Selection Of Vegetables
2. 350G New Potatoes Skin On And 23Cm Diced
3. 2 Carrots Peeled And 2Cm Diced
4. 200G Cauliflower 23Cm Florets
5. 100G Green Beans Top And Tailed
6. 100G Mushrooms 23Cm Diced
7. 2 Tbsp Shashlik Paste Mixed With 12 Tbsp Plain Soya Yoghurt I Use The Hungry Gecko But You Could Use Other Marinades Or Substitute With Following Simple Marinade
8. Basic Marinade
9. 12 Tbsp Plain Soya Yoghurt
10. 4 Garlic Cloves Crushed And Chopped
11. 1 Piece Of Ginger Finely Minced
12. 1 Green Chilli Finely Chopped
13. 1 Large Red Chilli Finely Chopped
14. 1 Tbsp Paprika Powder
15. Tsp Chilli Powder
16. 2 Tsp Garam Masala
17. For The Butter Masala
18. 50G Veg Oil
19. 6 Cardamon Pods Crushed
20. 2 Piece Of Cassia Bark Or Cinnamon
21. 6 Cloves
22. 1 Large Onion Finely Chopped
23. 2 Thumb Fresh Ginger Finely Chopped
24. 4 Green Chillies Cut Lengthways Add Less If You Want It Less Spicy
25. 2  Tsp Paprika Powder Mild Variety
26. 1 Tsp Hot Chilli Powder Add Less If You Want It Less Spicy
27. 1 Tsp Garam Masala Powder
28. 1 Tsp Coriander Powder
29. 4 Tbsp Tomato Puree
30. 120Cupss Soy Or Almond Cream
31. 2 Tbsp Agave Syrup
32. 1 Tsp Fenugreek Powder
33. 1 Tsp Salt
34. Handful Of Fresh Coriander
preparation:
1. Marinate Prepared Vegetables, Using Either The Shashlik Paste Marinade Or The Basic Marinade You Have Made Yourself. Cover And Set Aside In Fridge For Half An Hour.
2. In A Large Pan, Add The Vegetable Oil Then Add The Cardamom, Cassia Bark And Cloves. Gently Fry Until Aroma Is Released, Then Add Chopped Onion. Fry Gently Until Onion Is Transparent And Starting To Turn Golden. Remove The Whole Spices.
