3. Lay The Marinated Vegetables (Except The Green Beans And Mushrooms) On A Well Oiled Tray And Bake In A Hot Oven (200C) For 15 Minutes, Turning Occasionally To Ensure Nicely Browned On All Sides. The Potatoes May Need An Additional 5-10 Minutes Depending On The Size Of The Pieces. Check They Are Cooked Through. Add The Green Beans And Mushrooms To The Tray And Bake For Another 10 Minutes.
4. Add The Ginger, Chillies, Paprika, Coriander, Garam Masala And Fenugreek Powder To The Large Pan, And Fry Gently For 2 Minutes. Then Add The Tomato Puree, Syrup And Two Cups Of Water. Bring To Simmer And Season To Taste With Salt. Simmer Gently For 10-15 Minutes, Then Add Soy Or Almond Cream And Bring Back To Simmer.
5. I Prefer To Place The Roasted Vegetables In A Bowl And Pour Over The Masala, As This Helps The Vegetables Keep Their Lovely Marinade. But You Can Add The Vegetables To The Large Pan Also, Stir Gently And Then Serve Immediately.
6. Serve With Steamed Rice And Soft Chapatis Or Parathas, Garnish With Fresh Coriander, And Some Freshly Sliced Cucumber, Red Onion And A Wedge Of Lemon On The Side.

title: Beyond Meat Toad In The Hole
ingredients:
1. 125G Self Raising Flour
2. 100G Flour Chickpea
3. 1 Tsp Baking Powder
4. 1 Tsp Salt
5. 1 Tsp Turmeric
6. 1 Tbsp Zaatar
7. 400 Cups Oat Milk
8. 4 Tbsp Rapeseed Oil
9. 6 Beyond Meat Sausages
10. 1 Red Onion In Wedges
11. 200G Rainbow Baby Carrots Sliced
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven At 210°C.
2. In A Large Mixing Bowl Add The Flours, Baking Powder, Salt Turmeric And Za’Atar, In A Jug Measure The Oat Milk Then Whisk It In The Dry Ingredients Until You Have A Smooth Batter. Place It In The Fridge Until Needed.
3. Pour 3 Tbsp Of Oil In The Roasting Tin (Enough To Cover All The Base) And Place It In The Oven To Heat Up For Around 7”.
4. In The Meantime, In A Large Frying Pan On Medium-Low Heat Add 1 Tbsp Of Oil, Once Warm Add The Sausages And Gently Cook All Around Until Evenly Golden. Remove From The Heat.
5. Carefully Remove The Tin From The Oven, Pour The Batter You Kept In The Fridge And Evenly Spread Sausages, Onion Wedges And Sliced Carrots In The Batter. Bake For Around 30 Minutes On A Low Oven Shelf, Until The Batter Is Puffed And Golden. Enjoy!

title: Quinoa Pesto Salad
ingredients:
1. 12 C Quinoa Cooked
2. 1 C Asparagus Cut Into Bitesized Pieces
3. 14 C Red Onion Diced
4. 12 C Sweet Bell Peppers Diced
5. 12 C Grape Tomatoes Halved
6. 5 Artichoke Hearts Chopped
7. 1 T Parsley Chopped
8. 1 15 Oz Can Nosaltadded Chickpeas Rinsed And Drained
9. 1 T Pesto
10. 1 T Balsamic Vinegar
preparation:
1. Add The Asparagus To Hot Quinoa And Cover For 5 Minutes.
2. Toss Vegetables Together.
3. Whisk Together Vinegar And Pesto. Pour Over Vegetables.
4. Add Quinoa, Asparagus And Chickpeas
5. In A Smaller Bowl, Combine The Balsamic Vinegar With Pesto Until Smooth. Pour It Into The Large Bowl Of Veggies, Along With The Chickpeas, Quinoa, And Asparagus. Stir To Coat And Serve Warm Or Cold.

title: Roasted Red Pepper Hummus
ingredients:
1. 2 Large Sweet Red Bell Peppers
2. 2 Large Cloves Of Garlic
3. 2 Heaped Tablespoons Of Tahini
4. 1 Tin 240G8Oz Drained Or 1 Cups Tinned Chickpeas
5. 2 Lemons
6. 3 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
7. Teaspoon Sea Salt
preparation:
1. De-Seed, De-Stalk And Slice Your Peppers In Half Or Quarters.
2. Next: Roast The Sweet Pepper And Garlic In A Hot Oven… To Do This, Keep The Garlic In Its Skin And Place On An Oven Tray Along With The Pepper And Place In A Pre-Heated Oven (Gas Mark 7/425°C/220°F Should Work Fine). Roast Garlic For Up To 10 Minutes And The Pepper For About 15-20 Minutes (Or Until The Pepper Is Easy To Pierce). No Need To Let The Pepper Char.Note: I Find It Easier To Roast This Ahead Of Time – Get On With Something Else – And Then Set Them Out To Cool For A Little While Before Adding To The Rest Of The Ingredients.
3. It’S Best To Wait Until The Garlic Cools Down A Little Before You Pop It Out Of It’S Skin. Gently Chop Off The Top; Then Squeeze Out The Fleshy Garlic And Place In A Jug Ready To Blend With Everything Else.
4. Rinse And Drain Chickpeas.
5. Juice Lemon And Discard The Skin.
6. Add All Ingredients To A Jug And Blend Until You Reached Your Desired Consistency.
7. Chill In The Fridge Before Serving.
8. This Serves Well With: Salad In A Sandwich On Crackers As A Veggie Dip With Baked Potatoes Or Coconut-Sweet-Potatoes It’S Pretty Versatile And Should Keep In The Fridge For Over A Week. I Like To Make A Batch Of Pates And Dips To Enjoy Throughout The Week. Gotta Make Plenty In My House Though As They Vanish Pretty Quickly!

title: Sweet Potato Brownies
ingredients:
1. 2  Cups Stewed And Mashed Sweet Potato
2. 1 Cup Coconut Sugar Or Brown Sugar
3. Cup Raw Cacao
4. 4 Tbsp Agave Or Carob Nectar
5. 2 Tsp Natural Vanilla
6. 250G Of Dark Chocolate  Uk 9 Oz
7. 2 Tbsp Of Coconut Oil Or Dairyfree Margarine
8. 2 Cups Of Almond Flour
9. 2 Tbsp Of Baking Powder
10. 1 Cup Of Chopped Walnuts Or Hazelnuts
preparation:
1. Melt The Chocolate And Coconut Oil Together.
2. Mix The Mashed Sweet Potato With All The Other Ingredients.
3. Mix The Two Together, Mixing Well, The Batter Is Not As Liquid As A Normal Brownie Batter.
4. Spread Out In A 33 X 33 Cm (16,5 X 16,5 Inch ) Baking Tin And Bake At 180 °C For About 20-25 Minutes (Test With A Skewer, When It Comes Out Clean, The Brownies Are Ready)
5. Leave To Cool Before Cutting Into Squares.

title: Vietnamese Rice Paper Rolls
ingredients:
1. 8 Small Rice Paper Wrappers
2. 60G Rice Vermicelli
3. 8 Frys Family Battered Prawns Lightly Fried
4. 1 Tbsp Chopped Basil
5. 3 Tbsp Chopped Mint Leaves
6. 3 Tbsp Chopped Coriander
7. 1 Carrot Finely Sliced Julienne Strips
8. 2 Lettuce Leaves Chopped
9. 2 Avocados Sliced
10. 3 Tablespoons Hoisin Sauce
11. 1 Teaspoon Finely Chopped Roasted Peanuts
preparation:
1. This Recipe Serves 4 As A Starter.
2. Boil Rice Noodles For 3 To 5 Minutes.
3. Rinse Thoroughly With Cold Water And Drain Well So They Don’T Stick Together.
4. Fill A Large Bowl With Warm Water.
5. Dip One Wrapper Into The Water For A Few Seconds (1-3 Secs) To Soften.
6. Lay Wrapper On The Plate And Place 2 Fry’S ‘Prawn’ Halves, A Handful Of Noodles, Basil, Mint, Coriander, Lettuce, Carrots In A Row Across The Centre, Leaving A Few Cm Of The Wrapper Uncovered On Each Side.
7. Lay The Avocado Slices Over The Top.
8. Fold In Uncovered Sides Of Wrapper, Then Tightly Roll To Enclose The Filling.
9. Repeat!
10. Sauce:Mix The Hoisin Sauce And Peanuts Together.
11. Serve The Rice Paper Rolls With Hoisin-Peanut Dipping Sauce.

title: Aubergine Bolognese
ingredients:
1. Ingredients : For Four People
2. 1 Aubergine
3. 1Kg Of Fresh Tomatoes Out Of Season Use One Or Two Cans Of Tomato Instead
4. 1 Big Onion
5. 4 Cloves Of Garlic
6. 1 Sprig Of Rosemary
7. 2 Sprigs Of Thyme
8. Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. 100G Of Soy Mince
10. 25G Of Fresh Parsley
preparation:
1. Fry The Finely Chopped Onion And Garlic. Once They Are Softened Add The Soy Mince, And Then The Blended Tomatoes.
2. In A Separate Frying Pan Overcook The Chopped Aubergines. Once Ready Add To The Rest Of The Sauce.
3. Add The Thyme, And Rosemary, Then Let The Sauce Simmer For About 15Minutes. Now Your Sauce Is Ready Stir In The Finely Chopped Parsley And Serve!
4. If Making Spaghetti Bolognese, I Recommend Sprinkling Some Nutritional Yeast And Fresh Parsley On Top.

title: Cheese on Toast (with Potato and Carrot Cheese)
ingredients:
1. 1 X Large Potato
2. 1 X Large Carrot
3. 3 Tablespoons Of The Potatocarrot Water
4. 13 Cup Of Oil I Use Olive
5. 12 Cup Of Nutritional Yeast
6. Juice Of Half A Lemon
7. Teaspoon Of Garlic Powdergranules
8. Dash Of Celery Salt Or Onion Powder
9. Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. There Are Lots Of Recipes For Potato Cheese Out There, But This Is The One I Have Adapted From Various Different Ones.
2. Peel One Large Potato And One Large Carrot
3. Chop Into Small Chunks (Carrot Smaller Than The Potato As It Is Harder)
4. Boil Until Soft
5. Put 3 Tablespoons Of The Potato Water Into Afood Processor
6. Drain Potatoes And Carrots And Pour Into Theprocessor
7. Add:1/3 Cup Of Oil (I Use Olive),1/2 Cup Of Nutritional Yeast, Juice Of Half A Lemon, Teaspoon Of Garlic Powder/Granules, Dash Of Celery Salt/Onion Powder, Cracked Pepper
8. Blend!
9. You Can Eat This Cheese Straight Away With Tortilla Chips, Use As Your Cheese Topping On Pizza, Or Go For The All-Time Best Comfort Food – Cheese On Toast!
10. Grill Your Bread On One Side, Remove And Spread Liberally With The Potato Cheese, Place Back Under Grill.

title: Savoury Gram Flour Pancakes
ingredients:
1. 100G Gram Flour
2. 150Cups Water To Add To The Batter
3. Juice From  Limelemon
4. 50G Soya Yoghurt
5. Teaspoon Powdered Black Pepper
6. Teaspoon Per Pancake Of Fruit Salt Or Bicarbonate Of Soda
7. Less Than  Teaspoon Ajwain Seeds If Available
8. Thumb Size Piece Fresh Ginger
9. A Few Spinach Leaves Chopped
10. 3 Sprigs Fresh Coriander Leaves Chopped
11. Tomato Diced
12. Red Onion Diced
13. Green Chilli Optional Finely Sliced
14. Salt To Taste
15. Oil To Grease The Pan
preparation:
1. Preparing The Pancake Batter:Soak The Gram Flour In Water And Soya Yoghurt For Approximately 2 Hours.
2. Start Warming A Frying Pan. When It’S Slightly Hot, Grease The Pan And Sprinkle A Pinch Of Salt. Then Use A Kitchen Paper To Wipe Off The Salt And Oil From The Pan.
3. Add The Salt, Powdered Black Pepper, Ginger And Ajwain Seeds (If Using) To The Gram Flour Batter, And Mix
4. Thoroughly.
5. Into A Teacup, Add Some Gram Flour Batter, Then Add A Quarter Teaspoon Of Fruit Salt Or Bicarbonate Of
6. Soda, Stir Vigorously, And Immediately Pour Onto The Heated Pan In A Circular Motion.
7. Work Very Quickly To Make The Pancake Circular, Thin And Approximately 6 Inches In Diameter.
8. While The Top Side Of The Pancake Is Wet, Sprinkle The Chopped Coriander, Spinach, Tomatoes And
9. Onions Onto It.
10. Cook The Pancake On Medium Heat, And Don’T Let It Burn.
11. After A Couple Of Minutes, Check Whether The Pancake Is Easy To Lift Off The Pan And If The
12. Underside Has Cooked To Golden Brown. Add Oil To The Pancake Edge If Necessary To Lift The
13. Pancake.
14. If The Pancake Has Turned To Golden Brown, Turn The Pancake Over And Let It Cook On The Other
15. Side. If Not, Add A Little Oil To The Pancake Edge Let It Cook.
16. When Cooked On Both Sides, Remove The Cooked Pancake And Serve.
17. Makes 4 Pancakes.

title: Coconut Parsnip with Red Beans, Lime & Ginger
ingredients:
1. 1 Tbsp Plain Oil Not Olive
2. Parsnips 700800G1Lb 8Oz1Lb12Oz Peeled And Chopped Into Medium Chunks
3. 2 Cloves Garlic Crushed
4. 5Cm2 Inch Piece Of Ginger Grated  About 1 Tbsp Grated
5. Half A Large Red Chilli Deseeded And Chopped Fine
6. 1 Tsp Cumin Powder
7. 100Cups3 Generous Fl Oz Coconut Milk
8. 1 Lime Zested And Squeezed  At Least 1 Tbsp Juice
9. Half A Tin Of Red Or Pink Beans Aduki Kidney Or Pinto  About 120G4Oz Homecooked
10. Salt And Pepper To Taste
11. 2 Tbsp Finely Chopped Fresh Coriander
preparation:
1. Put Parsnip Pieces On To Steam – About 15 Minutes, But Test With A Sharp Knife After 10. You Want Neither Hard And Woody Nor Mushy.
2. Meanwhile, Heat Oil In A Medium Heavy-Bottomed Saucepan.
3. Lightly Cook Garlic, Chilli And Ginger For 1-2 Minutes. Add Cumin Powder And Cook A Further Minute, Stirring Well. Take Off The Heat And Set Aside.
4. When Parsnips Are Cooked, Add To The Pan With Garlic Mixture And Heat Through, Gently Stirring.
5. Add Coconut Milk And Heat To A Simmer. Add Lime Zest, Lime Juice And Beans. Stir In Well, Ensuring Heated Through. Check Seasoning.
6. Sprinkle With Fresh Coriander And Serve Immediately.

title: Parsnip and Peas Rosemary Soup
ingredients:
1. 500G Parsnips 1 Lb
2. 1 Large Onion
3. 3 Large Garlic Cloves
4. 1 Litre Vegetable Stock Uk 1  Pints  Us 1 Quart
5. 750G Frozen Peas 1Lb 11Oz
6. 2 Tbsp Fresh Rosemary Leaves Chopped
7. 3 Tbsp Olive Oil
8. Salt  Pepper
preparation:
1. Heat Olive Oil In A Large Saucepan. Add Roughly Chopped Onion And Crushed Garlic Cloves. Fry Until Soft.
2. Add Chopped Rosemary And Fry For 1 Minute Or So.
3. Add Parsnips (Peeled And Cut In 1Cm Thick Slices).
4. Add Vegetable Stock. Bring To Boil, Then Cook Covered Under Medium Heat For 15-20 Mins Until Parsnips Are Soft.
5. When The Parsnips Are Soft, Add 2/3 Frozen Peas And Cook For 8 Mins Until Peas Are Cooked.
6. Puree The Vegetables With A Liquidiser Until The Soup Is Smooth. Add More Water Or Stock To Desired Consistency. Season To Taste.
7. Add A 1/3 Of Frozen Peas Left. Bring Back To The Boil And Cook For Another 8 Mins Under Medium Heat Until Peas Are Cooked.
8. Serve With A Slice Of Chunky Bread.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1. 28G Okara Flour Or Just Use More Allpurpose Flour Instead
2. 188G Allpurpose Flour
3. 1  Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. Teaspoon Salt
6. 250G Packed Light Brown Sugar
7. Cup Plus 2 Tablespoons Hot Water
8. 100G Coconut Oil Melted
9. 84G Unsweetened Almond Butter Well Stirred Before Measuring
10. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
11. 210G Vegan Chocolate Chips
12. 70G Chopped Walnuts Optional
preparation:
1. Line Baking Sheets With Parchment Paper. Preheat The Oven To 350 F.
2. In A Medium Bowl, Whisk Okara And All-Purpose Flours, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, And Salt. Set Aside.
3. In A Large Bowl, Whisk The Brown Sugar With Hot Water. Add The Coconut Oil, Almond Butter, And Vanilla And Whisk Until Smooth. Stir In Flour Mixture. Stir In Chocolate Chips And Nuts (If Using).
4. *Baker’S Secret: Cookies Are Extra Delicious If You Rest The Dough For 1 Hour Or More Before Baking.
5. Place Heaping Tablespoons Of Dough 2” Apart On Lined Pans. Bake 14-16 Minutes In Preheated Oven, Rotating Pans Half Way, Until Cookies Are Golden Brown. Set Pans On A Rack To Cool.
6. Inspired By This Recipe? Why Not Check Out Our Top 10 Vegan Desserts Blog?

title: Stuffed Peppers
ingredients:
1. 6 Bell Peppers
2. 1 Small Courgette
3. 1 Small Onion
4. 3 Garlic Cloves Crushed
5. 225G Brown Rice
6. 50G Currants
7. 1 Tsp Turmeric
8. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
9. Tsp Sumac Optional
10. 1 Litre Vegetable Stock I Use Bouillon
11. Olive Oil
12. Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. Tips:
2. If Your Peppers Don’T Sit Upright In The Saucepan Because There Is Space Around Them, Then Squeeze An Onion Or A Potato In Next To Them To Make Them Sit Tight.
3. Add Some Olive Oil To The Pan Of Boiling Water The Peppers Cook In. This Will Add A Bit Of Flavour And Soften Them Up Nicely.
4. If You’D Prefer To Use White Rice, Just Cut Out The First Stage. Add Your Rice Into The Onion Mixture Without Pre-Cooking It.
5. Cook The Brown Rice For Half Of The Time It Suggests On The Packet.
6. While The Rice Is Cooking You Can Prep The Peppers And Filling – Wash The Peppers And Cut The Tops Off, Making Sure The Green Stalk Is Still Attached So You Can Use The Top Of The Pepper For A Lid. De-Seed And Place All Six In A Saucepan So They Stand Upright. Set Aside.
7. Dice The Onion And Gently Fry In A Medium Sized Frying Pan With A Little Olive Oil. Dice The Courgette Into Small Pieces And Add To The Pan Along With The Crushed Garlic. Add The Currants And Spices.
8. By This Time Your Rice Should Be Ready. Drain It And Add It To The Pan. Stir To Combine Everything, Turn Up The Heat And Add Your Stock. Once It Starts Bubbling Turn Down To A Low Heat And Let Simmer Until The Liquid Has Evaporated And The Rice Has Fully Cooked. Add More Liquid If Needed. Once Cooked, Taste And Season.
9. Spoon The Rice Into The Peppers, Filling Them To The Top, Then Place The Top Of The Pepper Back On. Repeat, So All Six Peppers Are Filled.
10. Carefully Pour Some Boiling Water Into The Saucepan, Which The Peppers Are Sitting In, Making Sure Not To Pour It Over The Peppers. The Water Should Come Up To About Half The Height Of The Peppers. Put A Lid On, Turn The Hob Onto A Medium Heat And Let Them Simmer For 30 -45 Minutes Until The Peppers Have Softened.
11. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Nutrition Bar
ingredients:
1. 600G Mixed Nuts
2. 150G Shredded Or Dessicated Coconut
3. 200G Dried Fruit Chopped Dark Chocolate Raw Cacao Nibs Seeds Etc
4. 80Cups Coconut Oil
5. 80Cups Almond Butter
6. 50G Sukrin Gold
7. 75G Sukrin Sesame Flour
8. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
9. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
10. 1 Tsp Sea Salt
preparation:
1. Soak The Nuts (And Seeds If Using) Overnight With The Salt.
2. (Whole Nuts Can Cause Digestive Issues For Some, Which Is Largely Due To Their Phytate Content, An Anti-Nutrient That Removes Essential Minerals From The Body, And Is Found In Grains, Nuts And Seeds. Soaking Them And Gently Roasting Them As We Do In This Recipe Removes The Phytates, Thus Making Them More Digestible And Much Safer To Eat. Adding Sesame Or Peanut Flour Adds Extra Yum Plus Protein, And They Are Free From Sugar Which Makes Them Low Carb Too.)
3. Drain And Rinse The Soaked Nuts Well.
4. Place On A Baking Sheet And Roast At Gm4/350F/180C For 12-15 Mins, Checking And Stirring Regularly. Cool.
5. Roughly Chop Half The Nuts.Process The Rest Until They Begin To Form A Paste.
6. Melt Together The Almond Butter And Coconut Oil, Sukrin Gold, Vanilla And Until The Gold Is Dissolved.
7. Stir In The Nut Paste And Nuts, Any Additions And The Sesame Flour.
8. Pack Into A Lined Dish, Allow To Sit In The Fridge For An Hour Before Slicing And Serving.

title: Guacamole and Tomato Salsa
ingredients:
1. For The Guac
2. 2 Ripe Avocados Peeled And Stoned
3. Red Onion Chopped
4. Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Chopped
5. 10 Sprigs Fresh Coriander Cilantro
6. Juice Of  Lime
7. Salt And Pepper
8. For The Salsa
9. Red Onion Chopped
10. 5 Plum Tomatoes Finely Diced
11. Red Chilli Deseeded And Finely Chopped Or More To Taste
12. 10 Sprigs Fresh Coriander Cilantro
13. Juice Of  Lime
14. Dash Of Olive Oil
15. Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. Guacamole
2. Put Everything In A Food Processor And Blitz For About 10 Seconds, Making Sure You Keep Some Of The Texture. If You Feel Like Getting More Hands On, Do It The Traditional Way, Using A Pestle And Mortar.
3. Adjust The Chilli, Lime And Salt And Pepper To Your Taste.
4. Salsa
5. Simply Mix Everything Together Thoroughly, And Adjust The Chilli, Lime And Salt And Pepper To Your Taste.

title: Mediterranean Veg & Bean Country Style Pie with Three Bean Salad
ingredients:
1. 1 Frys Mediterranean Veg  Bean Country Style Pie
2. 13 Cup Cannellini Beans Rinsed And Drained
3. 13 Cup Kidney Beans Rinsed And Drained
4. 13 Cup String Green Beans End Chopped And Thinly Sliced
5. Yellow Pepper Diced
6. Red Onion Finely Chopped
7. Celery Stalk Finely Chopped
8. Cup Loosely Packed Fresh Finely Chopped Flatleaf Parsley
9. Tsp Fresh Finely Chopped Rosemary
10. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
11. 2 Tbsp Granulated Sugar More Or Less To Taste
12. 1 12 Tbsp Olive Oil
13. 1 Tsp Salt
14. 14 Tsp Black Pepper
preparation:
1. In A Large Bowl, Mix The 3 Different Types Of Beans, The Celery, Onion, Parsley, And Rosemary.
2. In A Separate Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Vinegar, Sugar, Olive Oil, Salt, And Pepper. Add The Dressing To The Beans. Toss To Coat.
3. Chill The Salad In The Fridge For A Few Hours, Allowing The Beans To Soak Up The Flavour Of The Dressing.
4. Heat Up The Pie So That It Is Warmed Through.
5. Serve The Salad With The Pie When Ready.

title: Coronation Chickpea Sandwich
ingredients:
1. 1X 400G Tin Chickpeas Drained
2. 1 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
3. 1 Red Onion Peeled And Finely Chopped
4. 1 Clove Garlic Peeled And Crushed
5. 2 Tsp Mild Curry Powder
6. 40G  Cup Sultanas Soaked In Hot Water For 10 Minutes And Drained
7. Cup Vegan Mayonnaise
8. 1 Tbsp Mango Chutney
9. Sea Salt And Black Pepper To Taste
10. To Serve
11. 812 Slices Fresh Crusty Bread
12. Lettuce Leaves
13. Sliced Red Onion
preparation:
1. Heat The Oil In A Frying Pan And Add The Chickpeas, Onions And Garlic With Some Seasoning. Gently Cook For A Few Minutes Until The Onions Begin To Soften, Before Adding The Sultanas And Curry Powder. Continue To Cook, Stirring, Until The Spices Are Fragrant. Leave To Cool.
2. Once Cooled, Lightly Mash The Chickpeas So That Some Still Remain Whole. Stir In The Mango Chutney, Mayonnaise And Season To Taste.
3. Spread The Mixture Liberally Over The Bread, Adding Lettuce And Onion. Serve Immediately.

title: Herbie Roasted Potatoes — Hedgehog style!
ingredients:
1. Oil Enough To Coat The Potatoes
2. 400G Of Potatoes
3. 1 Tbsp Of Curcuma Or Paprika
4. 6 Sprigs Of Fresh Thyme Or About 2Tbsp Of Dried Thyme
5. 1 Stick Of Fresh Rosemary Or 1Tbsp Of Dried Rosemary
6. Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. As A Side For Four People:
2. Chop The Potatoes In Half. Place The Halves On The Chopping Board And Cut Strips Half Way Down Along The Potato.
3. Once All The Potatoes Are Done Place In A Big Mixing Bowl With The Spices And Oil. Using Your Hands Coat Each Potato, Making Sure That Oil Goes Into The Crevices.
4. Place In A Baking Tray And Put In The Oven At 170C°. The Cooking Time Depends On The Size Of The Potato, But It Is Normally Between 30Min And An Hour. Every 10Minutes Or So It Is Good To Shake The Baking Tray To Make Sure That The Potatoes Are Not Sticking.
5. Et Voila! The Finished Result:Crispy, Herbie Goodness : )

title: Aubergine and Sage Spaghetti Marinara
ingredients:
1. 2 Tsp Olive Oil
2. 1 Aubergine Eggplant
3. 100G Wild Mushrooms Or Other Variety Eg Chestnut
4. 6 Cloves Garlic
5. 10 Fresh Sage Leaves
6. 150G Wholewheat Or Spelt Spaghetti Plus Water For Cooking
7. 1 Jar  500Cups Spicy Marinara Sauce Recipe Link Under Preparation
8. 2 Tbsp Pumpkin Seed And Sun Dried Tomato Pesto Recipe Link Under Preparation
9. Optional Fresh Basil Leaves To Garnish
preparation:
1. Please Click Formarinara Sauce Recipe
2. Please Click Forpumpkin Seed And Sun Dried Tomato Pesto Recipe
3. On A Medium To High Heat, Warm 1 Tsp Of The Olive Oil In A Large, Non-Stick Pan. Slice The Mushrooms And The Garlic And Add These To The Pan.
4. While The Mushrooms And Garlic Are Sautéing, Chop The Aubergine Into Cubes No Larger Than 1Cm. Add The Second Tsp Of Oil And The Aubergine Cubes To The Pan And Give It A Good Stir.
5. Cook For About 10 Minutes, Until The Aubergine Cubes Are Lightly Browned And Soft. Roughly Chop The Sage Leaves And Add These Too.
6. Bring A Large Pan Of Water To The Boil And Add The Spaghetti.
7. You Can Now Stir The Marinara Sauce Into The Pan With The Aubergines And Lower The Heat, So It Can Bubble Away While The Spaghetti Cooks.
8. Around 5 Minutes Before The Pasta Is Ready Spoon Some Of The Pasta Cooking Water Into The Sauce Until You Have A Consistency You’Re Happy With. The Aubergines Suck Up A Lot Of The Sauce, So This Helps To Loosen It All Up Again.
9. Once The Spaghetti Is Ready Drain It And Add It To The Sauce. Give It All A Nice Stir And Spoon Into Bowls. To Serve, Dot The Pesto Around The Bowl And Sprinkle On Some Fresh Basil.

title: Cheesy Vegan Potato Bake
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Raw Cashews
2. 67 Medium Potatoes Thinly Sliced
3. 1 Cup Califia Farms Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Your Preferred Vegan Milk
4. Tsp Onion Powder
5. 1 Tsp Salt  Pinch Of Pepper
6. 1 Tbsp Corn Starch
7. 2 Tsp Apple Cider Vinegar
8. 1 Tsp Dijon Mustard
9. 1 Onion Thinly Sliced
10. Vegan Cheese Grated Optional
preparation:
1. Place The Cashews In A Heat Proof Bowl And Cover With Boiling Water, Set Aside For 15 Minutes.
2. Pre Heat Your Oven To 200 Degrees Celsius.
3. Drain The Cashews And Place Them Into A Blender With The Califia Farms Unsweetened Almond Milk, Onion Powder, Salt, Pepper, Corn Starch, Vinegar And Mustard And Blend Until Smooth.
4. Place The Sliced Potatoes Into A Bowl And Pour Over ¼ Of The Sauce Mixture, Stir To Coat Each Potato Slice.
5. Place The Potato Slices In A Baking Tray Alternating Sizes And Adding In A Slice Of Onion Every So Often.
6. Once The Tray Is Full, Pour Over The Remaining Sauce To Fill The Tray, If Using Cheese Add That On Top Now.
7. Cover Tightly With Foil And Bake For 35 Minutes, Then Remove The Foil And Bake For A Further 30 Minutes Or Until Browned And The Potatoes Are Soft.
8. Sprinkle Some Fresh Rosemary Or Chives On Top And Serve Immediately.

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chunk Cookies
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup Plus 1 Tablespoon Allpurpose Glutenfree Baking Mix
2. 3 Tablespoons Dutchprocess Cocoa Powder
3. 38 Teaspoon Ground Cinnamon
4. 38 Teaspoon Fine Sea Salt
5. 14 Teaspoon Aluminumfree Baking Powder
6. 3 To 4 Grinds Of Black Pepper Optional
7. 1 Tablespoon Ground Chia Seeds
8. 2 Tablespoons Hot Water
9. 2 Tablespoons Nondairy Milk
10. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup Grade B Or Dark Amber
11. 2 Teaspoons Pure Vanilla Extract
12. 5 Tablespoons Organic Granulated Sugar Plus 13 To 12 Cup For Shaping
13. 2 12 Tablespoons Coconut Oil Melted
14. 13 Cup Glutenfree Chocolate Chunks
preparation:
1. Note: You Don’T Need Skill But You Do Need Extra Time To Make These Cookies: Make Sure You Allow 30 Minutes For Whisking And Allowing The Dough To Thicken. And Remember When Using Melted Coconut Oil, All The Other Ingredients Need To Be At Room Temperature Or The Oil Will Harden Into Lumps During Mixing.
2. Makes 1 Dozen Cookies
3. Position A Rack In The Middle Of The Oven And Preheat To 375°F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper.
4. Place A Wire Mesh Strainer Over A Medium Bowl. Add The Baking Mix, Cocoa, Cinnamon, Salt, And Baking Powder To The Strainer And Stir With A Whisk To Sift The Ingredients Into The Bowl. (If Any Small Bits Remain In The Strainer, Add Them To The Mixture In The Bowl.) Add The Pepper If Using; Whisk To Aerate The Mixture, And Set Aside.
5. Make The Chia Gel: Put The Ground Chia Seeds Into A Small Bowl. Pour The Hot Water Over The Chia And Set Aside For 1 Minute. Whisk For 30 Seconds. (The Paste Will Be Thick.)
6. Whisk The Nondairy Milk Into The Chia Paste Until Combined. Let Sit For 5 Minutes And Whisk Again. Whisk In The Maple Syrup And Vanilla Until Combined. Let Sit For 5 Minutes And Whisk Again.
7. Add 5 Tablespoons Of The Sugar And Whisk Vigorously For 1 Minute To “Cream” The Sugar. Add The Coconut Oil And Whisk Until Thoroughly Incorporated. Add To The Dry Ingredients And Mix With A Silicone Spatula Until No Traces Of Dry Ingredients Remain.
8. Mix The Chocolate Chunks Into The Dough—It Will Be Shiny And Thick But Soft. Set Aside For 15 To 20 Minutes At Room Temperature To Allow The Dough To Thicken, Stirring Every Five Minutes.
9. Shape The Cookies: Put 1/3 Cup Of The Remaining Sugar Into A Shallow Dish. Scoop The Dough In A Measuring Tablespoon And Push Off Into The Sugar With A Teaspoon. Roll The Pieces In The Sugar Until Thoroughly Coated. Add More Sugar As Needed. Lift The Cookies Onto The Parchment-Lined Baking Sheet, Placing Them 2 Inches Apart. Press To Flatten.
10. Place The Baking Sheet Into The Oven; Immediately Reduce The Heat To 350°F, And Bake For 11 Minutes Until The Cookies Are Puffed And Set. The Cookies Are Soft When They Come Out Of The Oven But Will Firm As They Cool.
11. Place The Baking Sheet On A Wire Rack. Wait 10 Minutes Until The Cookies Are Cool, Then Run A Spatula Underneath To Release.
12. Keeping:Store The Cookies In A Covered Tin Or Jar, Layers Separated By Parchment, For Up To Two Days. Freeze For Up To One Month.

title: Carrot and Apple Cake with Lemon Icing
ingredients:
1. 150G Dairyfree Margarine
2. 100Cups Golden Syrup Or Agave Syrup
3. 200G Soft Light Brown Sugar Or Coconut Sugar
4. 250G Carrots
5. 1 Eating Apple
6. 100G Apple Puree
7. 250G Glutenfree Self Raising Flour
8. 3 Tsp Baking Powder
9. Tsp Mixed Spice
10. 25G Ground Flaxseed
11. For The Icing
12. 150G Icing Sugar
13. 23 Tbsp Lemon Juice
14. The Grated Zest Of 1 Lemon And Orange
preparation:
1. You Will Need An 8 Inch/20 Cm Cake Tin With Removable Base For This Recipe
2. Despite Its Steps, It Is Incredibly Easy To Make And Keeps Really Well (Opt For An Airtight Tin Or If Pushed, A Big Freezer Bag Clipped Over A Plate) Making It A Real Cut-And-Come-Again Type Bake, Ideal For A Friends And Family Do Or A Weekend When You Know Lots Of People Will Be Coming By.
3. Preheat The Oven To 180C And Lightly Grease And Line The Cake Tin.
4. Place The Margarine, Syrup And Brown Sugar (Or Coconut Sugar) Into A Saucepan And Heat Gently Over A Low Heat, Stirring Every Now And Then, Until The Sugar Has Completely Dissolved. Take Off The Heat And Pour Into A Large Mixing Bowl And Leave To Cool For 10 Minutes.
5. Trim The Ends From The Carrots And Core The Apple, Finely Grate Both – I Don’T Worry About Peeling Either The Apple Or Carrots (Though I Do Give Them A Good Scrub First) But Please, Feel Free To Peel Both If You Want To.
6. Spoon The Apple Puree Into The Syrup Mixture And Stir Together, Sift Over The Flour, Baking Powder And Mixed Spice And Fold Together. Next, Add The Grated Apple, Carrot And The Ground Flaxseed And Fold Together Until Completely Combined And Fragrant. Pour The Cake Mixture Into The Prepared Tin And Then Bake In The Oven For 1 Hour – 1 Hour 10 Minutes Or Until Risen And Golden And Firm To The Touch.
7. Leave The Cake To Cool In Its Tin For 5 Minutes And Then Transfer To A Wire Rack To Cool Completely. Place The Icing Sugar Into A Mixing Bowl And Add The Lemon Juice, Bit By Bit, Until The Desired Consistency. Spread Over The Cake And Scatter Over The Lemon And Orange Zest.
8. Like This Recipe? Sign Up To Veganuary Today To Get Recipes Like This Delivered Directly To Your Inbox.

title: Tarka Dal
ingredients:
1. For The Dal
2. 3 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
3. 1 Onion Finely Chopped
4. 1 Clove Garlic Peeled And Crushed
5. 2 Tsp Ground Turmeric
6. 1 Tsp Garam Masala
7. 2 Tomatoes Finely Chopped Or Half A 400G Tin Of Chopped Tomatoes
8. 75G Moong Dal
9. 75G Red Split Lentils
10. 600Cups Boiling Water Or Vegetable Stock
11. For The Tarka
12. 4 Tbsp Vegetable Oil
13. 1 Tsp Cumin Seeds
14. 1 Dried Red Chilli
15. Tsp Chilli Powder
16. Tsp Asafoetida
17. 4 Curry Leaves
18. Tsp Yellow Mustard Seeds
19. 1 Clove Garlic Peeled And Finely Sliced
preparation:
1. To Make The Dal:
2. Place A Medium Saucepan Over A Medium Heat And Add The Vegetable Oil. Bring To Temperature Before Adding The Onion And Frying For A Few Minutes. Do Not Allow The Onion To Brown.
3. Add The Garlic And Fry For A Further Few Minutes Before Adding The Turmeric, Garam Masala And Tomatoes. Cook For A Few Minutes, Stirring Often, Until The Tomatoes Start To Lose Their Shape. Add The Dal/Lentils Along With The Boiling Water Or Vegetable Stock. Bring To A Simmer Before Covering And Turning The Heat To Low.
4. Allow The Dal To Cook For A Total Of 20-30 Minutes, Removing The Lid To Stir Regularly. The Dal Is Done When The Lentils Are Completely Soft But Still Hold Their Shape Slightly.
5. Season With Sea Salt To Taste.
6. To Make The Tarka:
7. Add The Oil To A Small Saucepan Or Frying Pan And Place Over A Medium Low Heat. Once The Oil Is Hot, Add All The Remaining Ingredients Except The Garlic. Stirring Constantly, Fry The Spices For Around A Minute – Do Not Allow Them To Burn.
8. Once The Spices Are Fried And The Oil Has Taken On A Slight Red Hue From The Chilli, Add The Garlic And Fry Very Briefly Before Removing From The Heat And Spooning Over The Cooked Dal. Serve With Some Fresh Coriander And Some Basmati Rice Or Roti (Optional).

title: Savoury Tomatoes with Cous Cous
ingredients:
1. 8 Tomatoes
2. 1 Finger Chilli
3. 12 Teaspoon Of Ryemustard Seeds
4. 14 Teaspoon Of Jirucumin Seeds
5. 12 Teaspoon Of Coconut Oil Olive Oil Sunflower Oil Or Rapeseedcanola Oil
6. Salt To Taste
7. 1 Pinch Of Turmeric
8. 23 Teaspoon Of Ground Coriander Powder
9. 1 Handful Of Freshly Chopped Coriander
10. For The Cous Cous
11. 12 A Cup 125Cups Of Cous Cous
12. Vegan Stock
13. Olive Oil
14. Water
15. Salt
16. Pepper
preparation:
1. This Recipe Serves 2
2. How To Make The Savoury Tomatoes:
3. Chop The Tomatoes
4. Chop The Chilli – Amount Determined By Your Love Of Spice!
5. Put Thecoconut Oil In A Pan
6. When It Warms Up, Add The Rye Andjiruand Put The Lid On The Pan
7. When It Pops, Add The Chillies And Cover The Pan Again
8. After About 15 Seconds, Add The Chopped Tomatoes
9. Add The Salt, Turmeric And Ground Coriander Powder
10. Let It Cook
11. When It’S As Soft As You’D Like Add The Coriander – This Is Usually After 5 Minutes For Me
12. How To Make For The Cous Cous:
13. Boil The Kettle
14. Put The Cous Cous In A Bowl
15. Crumble The Stock On To The Cous Cous Ensuring There Are No Lumps
16. Mix It Up
17. Drizzle Some Olive Oil On It
18. Add Water So That The Level Of Water Reaches About 1Cm Above The Cous Cous
19. Add Some Freshly Ground Salt And Pepper
20. Stir A Little
21. Cover The Bowl With A Plate And Leave It For About 3 Minutes
22. The Water Should Be Absorbed And The Cous Cous Will Be Ready

title: No Churn Bakewell Tart Ice Cream
ingredients:
1. For The Almond Ice Cream Base
2. 250Cups Coconut Cream
3. 1 Cup Of Raw Cashews Soaked Overnight
4. 1 Cup Water
5. 2 Tsp Almond Extract
6. 1 Can Of Chickpeas Liquid Drained Off Just Shy Of 1 Cup
7. 1 Cup Icing Sugar
8. 12 Tsp Cream Of Tartar
9. For The Roasted Cherries
10. 250G Cherries Pitted And Cut Into Halves
11. For The Cookie Dough
12. 50G Vegan Butter Softened
13. 25G Brown Sugar
14. 75G Plain Flour
15. 14 Tsp Vanilla
16. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 350F.
2. Halve And Pit The Cherries. Spread On A Baking Tray And Roast For 15-20 Minutes Until Soft. Set Aside To Cool.
3. Next Make The Cookie Dough, In A Bowl Beat Together The Butter And Sugar. Sift In The Flour And Salt. Stir Until Fully Combined. Set Aside.
4. Make The Cashew Cream. Drain And Rinse The Soaked Cashews Then Add Them To The Blender. Add 1 Cup Water And Blend On High Until Completely Smooth. Set Aside.
5. Make The Almond Coconut Whip. Beat The Coconut Cream In A Stand Mixer Then Add The Almond Extract. Pour In The Cashew Cream And Beat Again Until Fully Incorporated. Pour Into A Container And Set Aside.
6. Make The Vegan Meringue. Clean The Mixer Bowl. Pour The Chickpea Brine Into A Saucepan And Reduce On A Medium Heat For 5 Minutes. You Should End Up With Just Shy Of 3/4 Of A Cup Of Liquid. Add Chickpea Brine To The Mixer Bowl. Beat On High With The Balloon Whisk Attachment For 5-8 Minutes.
7. Once The Soft Peaks Appear, Add The Cream Of Tartar. Beat For Another 5 Minutes, Then Slowly Start Adding The Sugar Bit By Bit.
8. Whilst The Meringue Is Whipping, Using Your Hands Break Off Fingernail Sizes Of The Cookie Dough And Set Aside.
9. Once The Meringue Has Formed Stiff Peaks, Immediately Fold In The Cashew Coconut Cream Mixture. It Will Deflate By Almost Half. Stir In The Roasted Cherries And Cookie Dough.
10. Pour The Ice Cream Mixture Into A Container And Place In The Freezer For At Least 8 Hours, Preferably Overnight. Remove From The Freezer 5-10 Minutes Before Serving.

title: Biff’s Pour-On-Everything Beer Cheese Sauce
ingredients:
1. Sweet Potato  23 Cup Or 100G
2. Nutritional Yeast  2 Heaped Tablespoons
3. White Or Brown Miso Paste   Teaspoon
4. Beer Can Be Regular Glutenfree Or Alcoholfree  160Cups
5. Plant Milk  160Cups
6. Cider Or White Wine Or Rice Wine Vinegar   Teaspoon
7. Onion Powder  1 Teaspoon
8. Garlic Powder  1 Teaspoon
9. Potato Starch  1 Heaped Tablespoon Or Corn Starch  15 Heaped Teaspoon
10. Tapioca Starch  Heaped Teaspoon
11. Rapeseed Oil  1 Tablespoon
12. Salt   Tsp
preparation:
1. Peel The Sweet Potato, Dice Into Cubes, And Boil For Ten Minutes Or Until Soft. When Ready, Drain.
2. Whilst The Sweet Potato Is Boiling, Put The Rest Of The Ingredients Into A Blender Or Nutribullet, Starting With The Wet Ingredients, Then Adding The Dry Ones. Add Your Cooked Sweet Potato When Ready.
3. Blend Until Smooth And Creamy.
4. At This Point, Set Aside Any Sauce You Don’T Want To Use Right Away And Pop In The Fridge Or Freezer.
5. To Cook The Sauce, Pour Into A Non-Stick Saucepan Or Frying Pan On A Medium Heat. Cook For 3-5 Minutes Until The Sauce Thickens And Is Hot But Not Boiling, Then Turn The Heat Down As It Thickens. Make Sure To Stir Continually With A Flat Bottomed Spatula To Stop Anything Sticking To The Pan.
6. When The Sauce Is Thick And Silky Like A Custard, Take Off The Heat And Add It To Your Favourite Recipe Immediately! (We Like To Pour Over Cooked Macaroni, Add A Herby Breadcrumb Crumb And Bake For 20 Minutes In The Oven For An Easy And Delicious Mac N Cheeze.)

title: Thai Yellow Noodle Soup
ingredients:
1. For The Yellow Curry Paste
2. 12 Stalk Lemongrass  Sliced
3. 2 Fresh Or Dried Red Or Yellow Chillies
4. 12 Cup Chopped Onion
5. 2 Tbsp Chopped Fresh Ginger
6. 1 Tbsp Chopped Garlic
7. 1 Tsp Ground Coriander
8. 1 Tsp Mustard Seeds
9. 12 Tsp Ground Turmeric
10. 1 Tbsp Coconut Sugar Or Date Syrup
11. 2 Kaffir Lime Leaves Or 1 Tsp Lime Zest
12. 4 Tbsp Lime Juice
13. Up To 4 Tbsp Coconut Milk
14. For The Noodle Soup
15. 100G2 Nests Wholewheat Noodles Or Rice Or Bean Thread Noodles For Gluten Free Option
16. 1 Small Onion Sliced Into Rings
17. 2 Tbsp Thai Yellow Curry Paste Homemade As Above Or From A Jar
18. 100Cups Coconut Cream Or Milk
19. 10 Sprigs Of Fresh Coriander
20. Half A Red Pepper Sliced Into Thin Strips
21. A Handful Of Fresh Spinach
22. 1 Red Chili
23. Water
preparation:
1. Yellow Curry Paste:
2. Place All Ingredients Except Coconut Milk In A Blender And Blend Well To A Paste, Gradually Adding The Coconut Milk To Get The Right Consistency.
3. Store In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To Two Weeks.
4. To Use, Stir Fry About 4 Tbsp For About A Minute Until Fragrant, Then Add Some Coconut Milk And/Or Water To Make A Curry Or Use As Below For Noodle Soup.
5. Noodle Soup:
6. Cook The Noodles As Per Package Instruction : And Set Aside.
7. Add The Onion To A Medium Saucepan With A Dash Of Water Or Oil Or Cooking Spray And Saute For About 5 Minutes On A Low-Medium Heat Until Starting To Soften. Add The Curry Paste And Saute For A Further Minute Until Fragrant.
8. Add The Coconut Cream And About 250Ml/1 Cup Of Water And Stir To Make A Broth.
9. Add In The Pepper And Chopped Coriander Stalks (Reserving The Leaves) And Cook For A Few Minutes Until It Just Comes To The Boil Then Add The Spinach And Allow To Wilt, Adding More Water As You Feel Necessary To Keep A Creamy Broth Consistency. Stir Through Half Of The Coriander Leaves, Roughly Chopped.
10. Divide The Noodles Between Serving Bowls Then Spoon The Broth Over And Garnish With Slices Of Chili And Coriander Leaves.

title: Omnipork’s Omni Wellington
ingredients:
1. Omni Log
2. 400G Omnipork Mince
3. 100G Omnipork Strips
4. 2 Tablespoons Corn Starch
5. Small Bunch Thyme
6. Ground Black Pepper
7. Sea Salt
8. Olive Oil
9. English Mustard
10. 320G Ready Roll Sheet Puff Pastry
11. 320G Ready Roll Sheet Puff Pastry For Lattice Top Optional
12. Nondairy Milk
13. Mushroom Duxelle
14. 300G Chestnut Mushrooms
15. 1 Small Red Onion
16. 100G Chestnuts Boiled Or Roasted And Peeled
17. 1 Sprig Of Thyme
preparation:
1. Roughly Chop The Omnipork Strips And Add To The Omnipork Mince. Season With Salt And Black Pepper. Add The Corn Starch And Mix Well. Put In Fridge To Chill For 30 Mins.
2. Use Clingfilm To Form The Mince Mixture Into A Log Shape Approximately 20Cm In Length. Leave In Fridge To Chill Whilst Preparing The Mushroom Duxelles.
3. For The Mushroom Duxelles, Dice The Mushrooms And Onions Finely (Or Use A Food Processor). Cook The Diced Mushrooms And Onions Over A Medium Heat, Season With Black Pepper, Salt And Thyme Leaves, Until All The Water Is Cooked Off. Roughly Chop The Chestnuts And Add To The Mixture. Set Aside And Let It Cool Down Completely.
4. Heat A Pan With A Good Lug Of Oil And Add A Small Bunch Of Thyme. Season The Omni Log Generously With Black Pepper And Salt And Sear All Sides Over High Heat. Whilst The Omni Log Is Still Hot, Use A Pastry Brush And Cover It With Mustard.
5. Unroll The Puff Pastry And Spread The Mushroom Duxelles So That They Will Cover The Entire Omni Log Once Rolled Over.
6. Place The Omni Log On Top Of The Mushroom Duxelles And Use A Non-Dairy Milk To Wash The Edges Of The Puff Pastry. Carefully Roll Over The Puff Pastry, Covering The Entire Omni Log. Cut Off Any Excess Pastry And Pinch To Seal The Ends.
7. Optional (Skip To Step 8)– Wash The Pastry With Non-Diary Milk And Place A Lattice Pastry On Top Using The Second Pack Of Puff Pastry Roll. Wash The Lattice Work With Non-Dairy Milk, Season With Salt And Bake For 30Mins In A Preheated Oven At 200C.
8. Preheat The Oven To 200C. Wash The Pastry With Non-Diary Milk And, If Not Using A Lattice Top, Carve The Pastry With The Back Of A Knife Taking Care Not To Cut Through. Season With Salt And Place On An Oiled Baking Tray. Cook For 30 Mins.

title: Jackfruit Hopper
ingredients:
1. 1 Can Jackfruit
2. 1 Onion
3. 1 Tomato
4. 1 Green Chilli
5. 1 Bunch Coriander
6. 50G Green Beans
7. 1G Brown Mustard Seeds
8. 1G Cumin Seeds
9. 1G Cloves
10. 1G Chilli Powder
11. 1G Turmeric
12. 15G Ground Coriander
13. 15G Ground Cumin
14. 20G Crushed Ginger
15. 20G Crushed Garlic
16. 1 Small Can Coconut Milk
17. 5G Palm Sugar
18. Milma Batter Mix  Bag
preparation:
1. Prepare The Jackfruit – Drain The Can Of Jackfruit And Trim The Firm Pointy Ends Off Each Piece And Discard. Use A Fork To Make Sure The Jackfruit Is Well Shredded.
2. Prepare The Veg – Peel And Thinly Slice The Onion, Roughly Dice The Tomato And Thinly Slice The Green Chilli. Roughly Chop The Coriander And Chop The Green Beans Into Thirds. Set The Prepared Veg Aside Until Required.
3. Fry The Onions – Heat 3 Tbsp Of Oil In A Saucepan And Add The Brown Mustard Seeds, Cumin Seeds And Cloves. Sizzle The Spices For 1 Minute Before Adding In The Sliced Onions And A Pinch Of Salt. Fry Until Golden Brown For 5 Minutes. Fill And Boil Your Kettle.
4. Add The Aromatics And Jackfruit – Next Add The Crushed Ginger, Garlic And Green Chilli And Fry For 1 Minute. Add Chilli Powder, Turmeric, Ground Cumin And Ground Coriander, And Fry For 1 More Minute. Then Add In The Jackfruit Pieces And 100Ml Of Boiling Water And Simmer For 2 Minutes.
5. Add The Coconut Milk And Simmer – Pour In The Coconut Milk And Add The Palm Sugar, Then Continue To Simmer For 5 Minutes.
6. Add The Rest Of The Veg – Add The Green Beans And Tomato And Simmer Gently For 10 Minutes To Allow The Veg To Soften And The Sauce To Thicken. After 10 Minutes, Cover The Pan With A Lid And Remove From The Heat.
7. Time To Make The Hoppers – Heat 1 Tbsp Of Oil In Your Pan On A Medium Heat, Then Carefully Swirl The Oil Around The Pan To Grease The Sides. Pour In A Ladle Of The Batter And Swirl Again, Partially Covering The Sides Of The Pan With Batter Until You’Ve Achieved A Bowl-Shaped Pancake About 8-10Cm Tall (A Wider Saucepan Will Make For A Shorter Hopper)
8. Cook The Hopper – Cook The Hopper Uncovered For 1 Minute Then Cover With A Lid And Cook For 2-3 Minutes More Until The Edges Are Starting To Crisp And The Base Is Cooked Through. Loosen The Sides Of The Hooper Gently To Remove It From The Pan. Repeat The Process Until You Have 4 Hoppers. Keep The Hoppers In A Warm Place.
9. Finishing Touches – Add The Chopped Coriander To The Curry And Stir Through. Serve The Hoppers On Plates And Fill With The Jackfruit Curry.

title: Chocolate Dipped Maple Meringues
ingredients:
1. For The Maple Meringues
2. Chickpea Brine Drained From 1 Can Of Chickpeas  Approximately 1 Cup Of Liquid
3. 34 Grade B Maple Syrup
4. 1 Tsp Vanilla Bean Paste
5. 14 Tsp Cream Of Tartar
6. For The Chocolate Dipping
7. 50G Dark Chocolate 70
8. 1 Tsp Coconut Oil
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200F.
2. Line Two Baking Trays With Parchment Paper Or Silpat Mats.
3. I Had Some Extra Meringue Mixture Leftover So I Mixed It Up With Some Raw Cacao Powder And Drizzled Through Some Of The Chocolate Dip And Froze It! Chocolate Ice Cream!
4. First Reduce The Chickpea Brine. Pour It Into A Saucepan And Boil For 2-3 Minutes Until Reduced 2/3 Of A Cup. Set Aside To Cool For At Least Ten Minutes.
5. Once The Brine Is Cool, Add It To The Stand Mixer And Beat On High Until Foamy. Once Soft Peaks Form, Add The Cream Of Tartar. Beat For 3 Minutes.
6. Start Adding The Maple Syrup In 1/4 Cup Increments, Pouring Slowly And Beating Until Fully Incorporated. The Meringue Will Form Stiff Peaks.
7. Beat In The Vanilla Bean Paste. Spoon The Mixture Into A Piping Bag And Pipe The Meringue Into Medium Sized Rounds.
8. Repeat Until There Is No More Space On The Trays. Bake The Meringues In The Oven For 2 Hours.
9. Remove The Trays From The Oven And Allow The Meringues To Cool For 20 Minutes.
10. Whilst The Meringues Are Cooling, Prepare The Chocolate Dip. In A Heat Proof Bowl Over A Pan Of Boiling Water, Melt The Chocolate And Coconut Oil, Stirring To Incorporate.
11. Once The Meringues Are Cooled, Carefully Peel Them Off The Paper And Dip Half Of Each Into The Chocolate Mixture.
12. Store In An Airtight Container In The Fridge.

title: Butternut Squash and Tomato Muffins
ingredients:
1. 350G Butternut Squash
2. Peeled Weight
3. 100G Sundried Tomatoes
4. 250Cups Rice Milk Mixed With 1Tbsp Lemon Juice
5. 60Cups Olive Oil  1 Tbsp For Roasting
6. 1 Tbsp Baking Powder
7. Tsp Bicarbonate Of Soda
8. 300G Gluten Free Plain Flour
9. 4 Tbsp Ground Flaxseed Mixed With 6 Tbsp Water
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200C. Peel The Butternut Squash And Scoop Out Any Seeds Or Pith That May Be There. Cut Into 1Cm Cubes And Place In A Roasting Tray With 1 Tbsp Of Olive Oil. Season Well With Sea Salt And Black Pepper And Roast In The Oven For 40 Minutes Until Golden And Tender.
2. Roughly Chop The Sundried Tomatoes And Set Aside. Place The Ground Flaxseed And Water In A Small Bowl And Stir Together Until Combined. Place The Soured Milk, Flax Mixture And Olive Oil Into A Large Mixing Bowl And Gently Whisk Together. Sift In The Flour, Baking Powder And Bicarbonate Of Soda, Roast Squash, Sundried Tomatoes And Season Well. Fold The Mixture Together Using A Metal Spoon Until Evenly Combined.
3. Fill The Muffin Cases Two Thirds Full With The Mixture. Bake In The Oven For 45-50 Minutes Until Slightly Risen And Golden.

title: Almond Pancakes
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Allpurpose Flour
2. 12 Cup Almond Meal
3. 2 Tablespoons Coconut Sugar
4. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
5. 12 Teaspoon Salt
6. 1 Teaspoon Almond Extract
7. 12 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
8. 1 14 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
9. 2 Teaspoons Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 12 Cup Canola Or Vegetable Oil
preparation:
1. Combine The Almond Milk And Apple Cider Vinegar. Set Aside For 10 Minutes. This Will Make A Tasty Buttermilk Substitute!
2. In A Large Bowl, Combine Your Dry Ingredients. When Ready, Add The Almond Milk Mixture, Your Extracts, And The Canola Oil. Mix With A Wooden Spoon Until The Clumps Are Mostly Dissolved.
3. Warm A Non-Stick Griddle Over Medium Heat (At 350 Degrees If You’Re Able To Set It). Add Dollops Of Dough At About 1/3 Of A Cup Each To The Griddle And Cook For 3-4 Minutes On Each Side.
4. Makes 8-10 Pancakes.

title: Sweet Potato Pie
ingredients:
1. Sweet Potato Filling
2. 3 Cups Of Baked Sweet Potatoes About 4 Medium Whole Potatoes
3. 14 Cup Agave
4. 12 Cup 100 Maple Syrup
5. 3 Tbsp Energ Egg Replacer Or Equivalent Vegan Egg Replacer
6. 12 Tbsp Pure Vanilla Extract
7. 1 Tsp Cinnamon
8. 1 Tsp Nutmeg
9. 14 Tsp Ground Ginger
10. 14 Cup Melted Nondairy Margarine
11. Glutenfree Pie Crust Makes 2
12. 2 Cups Allpurpose Glutenfree Flour
13. 14 Tsp Salt
14. 12 Cup Nondairy Margarine Cut Into Cubes
15. 1 Tbsp Energ Egg Replacer  3 Tbsp Water
16. 23 Tbsp Ice Water
17. 2 Tbsp Agave  Maple Syrup
18. 1 Tbsp Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. The Pie Crust Is Suitable For Freezing.
2. Sweet Potato Filling:
3. Bake Unpeeled Sweet Potatoes In The Oven At 450F For 45-50 Minutes, Or Until Cooked All The Way Through.
4. Remove Potatoes From Oven And Let Cool Enough To Peel Them.
5. Place An Oven Rack On 2Nd To Last Shelf, Then Reheat Thee Oven To 350F.
6. Peel The Potatoes Then Puree In A Food Processor.
7. Add Egg Replacer, Agave, Maple Syrup, And Vanilla To Processor And Mix Well.
8. Heat Cinnamon, Nutmeg And Ginger In A Small Skillet On Medium-Low Heat For 30 Seconds. Then Add The Margarine To The Pan And Melt.
9. Add The Mixture To The Potatoes And Mix Well.
10. Pour Mixture Into The Piecrust Then Cover The Rim Of The Piecrust With Foil And Place On Bottom Rack Of The Over.
11. Bake For 45-50 Minutes Where Pie Filling Should Be Firm To Touch.
12. Remove The Foil During The Last 10 Minutes Of Baking To Brown The Crust.
13. Pie Crust:
14. Cut Margarine Into 1/2 Inch Pieces And Place In The Freezer For 15-30 Minutes. In A Small Bowl Mix Egg Replacer And Water And Sit To The Side.
15. Combine The Flour And Salt In A Bowl Of A Food Processor Or Mixer. Pulse 5-6 Times Of Until The Mixture Resembles Coarse Meal With Some Pea Size Pieces Of Margarine.
16. Mix Together The Egg Replacer, Water, Agave And Vanilla. With Processor Running, Add The Mixture Until You Get A Slightly Moist And Sticky Dough. Do Not Over Mix. For Gluten Free Dough Its Best To Be Too Moist Than Dry.
17. Remove The Dough From The Machine And Form Into 2 Evenly Sized Disks. Wrap Each Disk In Plastic Wrap And Let Sit 15 Minutes.
18. To Roll The Dough, Lay A Piece Of Waxed Or Parchment Paper On A Work Surface And Sprinkle Paper, Sprinkle Some More Flour And Lay On Another Piece Of Parchment Paper. Roll The Dough Into A Circle Approximately 12 Inches Wide.
19. Remove Top Sheet Of Parchment Paper And Invert Dough Into Pie/Tart Pan. Remove The Top Sheet Of Parchment Paper And Push The Dough Very Gently Down So It Lines The Bottom And Sides Of The Pie Plate. If The Dough Splits Or Breaks Just Push It Back Together. Trim The Edge Of The Piecrust To About 1/2 – 3/4 Inch Over Hand. Tuck The Overhand Under And Pinch The Dough Into A Decorative Finish.
20. The Other Crust Can Either Be Used As A Topping Or Can Be Refrigerated For Up To 2 -3 Days Or Frozen. Let Sit Out To Warm Slightly If In The Fridge Before Use.

title: Adzuki Bean Burgers
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Cooked And Drained Adzuki Beans
2. Grated Onion
3. Cup Toasted Sunflower And Pumpkin Seeds
4. 1 Tbsp Tamari Or Shoyu Natural Soya Sauce
5. 1 Tbsp Dried Or Fresh Sage Coriander Or Herbs Of Your Choice Leaves Only Finely Diced
6. Pinch Of Sea Salt And Pepper Optional
7. Buckwheat Flour
8. Organic Sunflower Frying Oil
preparation:
1. Mash The Adzuki Beans In A Bowl And Add The Onion, Seeds, Tamari Or Shoyu And Some Fresh Or Dried Sage/Herbs Of Your Choice And Mix Well. Next Add Enough Flour To Bind The Mixture Together, But Just Enough So It Remains Slightly Sticky.
2. Form Into Burger Shapes (Flour Your Hands So The Mixture Does Not Stick To Them)
3. Heat A Heavy Bottomed Pan And Fry The Burgers In A Generous Amount Of Hot Oil In A Frying Pan For 3-4 Minutes On Each Side.
4. Serve With Baked Pumpkin Slices On Top And Drizzle With A Reduced Sauce.
5. Quick Tip – Purchase Canned Organic Beans.

title: Chestnut, Black Olive and Thyme Pate
ingredients:
1. 1 Red Onion
2. Olive Oil For Frying
3. 200G Cooked Chestnuts
4. 35Cups Brandy
5. 30G Rye Bread
6. 1015 Black Olives Roughly Chopped
7. 2 Small Cloves Garlic
8. 7 Sprigs Of Thyme Leaves Picked
9. Tsp Cayenne Pepper
10. Salt And Pepper To Season
preparation:
1. Thinly Slice The Red Onion And Fry In A Little Olive Oil On Medium Heat Until Soft And Beginning To Colour. Set Aside To Cool.
2. Drain And Mash The Chestnuts And Stir In The Brandy.
3. To Make The Bread Crumbs You Can Grate The Bread Or Wizz It In The Food Processor. Alternatively, If The Bread Is Not Too Moist Then Just Rub Between Your Fingers To Until It Breaks Down Into A Fine Crumb.
4. Mash The Breadcrumbs In With The Chestnut Mix And Stir Through The Chopped Olives.
5. Finely Chop The Garlic And Add To The Chestnut Mix Along With The Thyme Leaves, Cayenne Pepper And Cooked Red Onion. Season To Taste.
6. Perfect Served Alongside Toasted Rye Bread Or Oatcakes And Accompanied By A Glass Of Brandy Or Port.

title: Savoury Gateau
ingredients:
1. 1Tbsp Sunflower Oil
2. 2Kg Butternut Squash Peeled And Cut Into 1 Inch Cubes
3. 2 Large Garlic Cloves
4. Salt To Taste
5. 1Tsp Ground Allspice
6. 1T Ground Cinnamon
7. 1Tbsp Sunflower Oil
8. 1 Large Onion Finely Chopped
9. 1 Large Carrot Finely Chopped
10. 600G Mushrooms Finely Chopped
11. 2 Garlic Cloves Finely Chopped
12. 200G Dried Green Lentils
13. 750Cups Water
14. 1Tsp Stock Powder
15. 2Tsp Salt
16. 1Tsp Ground Black Pepper
17. 2Tsp Fresh Sage Finely Chopped
18. 60G Oats
19. 80G Walnuts
20. 15Tbsp Hemp Ground Flax Or Chia Seeds
21. 1Tbsp Pink Peppercorns For Decoration
preparation:
1. Heat Your Oven To 200C/390F/Gm6. Mix The Squash With 1Tbsp Oil, Put The Squash On A Baking Tray With 2 Garlic Cloves. Bake For 15-20 Minutes Until The Squash Is Cooked Through. Be Sure To Check The Garlic During This Time, Remove It From The Oven Once It Is Soft Inside. If The Garlic Cloves Are Small They Will Not Need Long In The Oven.
2. Once Cooked Blend The Squash With The Roasted Garlic, Salt, Allspice And Cinnamon.
3. Heat 1Tbsp Oil In A Large Frying Pan. Once The Oil Is Hot Add The Onion And Carrot. Cook For 10-15 Minutes On A Medium Heat Until The Onion Is Translucent. Add The Mushrooms And Garlic To The Pan, Cook For A Further 5-10 Minutes Until The Mushroom Is Browned.
4. Add The Lentils, Water, Stock, Salt, Pepper And Sage To The Pan. Simmer For 20-30 Minutes Until The Lentils Are Very Soft. Add Splashes Of Water If The Pan Dries Out.
5. In A Food Processor Or The Chopper Attachment Of A Hand Blender Grind The Oats, Walnuts And Seeds. Grind The Pink Peppercorns In A Pestle And Mortar.
6. Layer The Gateau Using A Small Cake Tin Or Chef’S Rings. Start With A Thin Layer Of Squash, Then Add A Layer Of Lentils, Then Squash, The Lentils, Then Squash. Bake For 10-20 Minutes Until Completely Heated Through.
7. Add The Nut/Seed Sprinkle And Place The Gateau On Servings Plates. Dress With A Scattering Of Crushed Pink Peppercorns.

title: Citrus Celery Root Stew
ingredients:
1. 1 Whole Celery Root Celeriac Peeled Halved And Sliced Thin
2. 1 Onion Peeled And Sliced
3. A Little Olive Oil
4. 2 Carrots Peeled And Sliced
5. 2 Celery Stalks Preferably With Leaves Diced
6. 1 Orange Zest And Juice
7. 1 Lemon Zest And Juice
8. 12 Cup Water
9. 12 Cup Chopped Parsley
10. Salt And Pepper
preparation:
1. Sauté The Onion With Little Bit Of Olive Oil For A Couple Minutes On A High Heat.
2. Add The Carrots And The Celery Stalks.
3. When The Carrots Get A Little Bit Softer, Turn Off The Heat And Put The Veggies In A Bowl. Set Aside.
4. Using The Same Pot, Put A Layer Of Celery Root (Celeriac) And On Top Of It A Layer Of Veggie Mixture, And Repeat To Fill The Pot With These Layers. Add Some Salt And Pepper On Every Layer.
5. Put All The Citrus Zest And Juice On The Top, Add The Water And Another Drizzle Of Olive Oil.
6. Cut Parchment Paper To The Same Size As The Pot And Put It On Top As The Last Layer.
7. Put A Lid On, And Start Cooking Over A Low Heat For About 40 Minutes.
8. After Half An Hour Check The Liquid And Tenderness (If There Is Not Enough Liquid You Should Add Some To Avoid Burning The Bottom).
9. After The Celery Roots Have Become Soft, Turn Off The Heat.
10. Serve, And Garnish With Chopped Parsley And A Drizzle Of Olive Oil .

title: Chocolate Orange Bread and Butter Pudding
ingredients:
1. 810 Slices Gluten Free White Bread
2. 25G Dairy Free Soya Spread
3. 1 Tablespoon Of Vegan Custard Powder
4. 750Cups Soya Milk
5. 130G Bag Nkd Cocoa Orange Bits Chopped Into Small Pieces
6. The Finely Grated Rind Of 1 Orange
7. 2 Tablespoons Orange Juice
8. 50G Vegan Dark Chocolate Chopped
preparation:
1. Instruction : Time: 5 Minutes, Plus 10 Minutes Standing Time
2. Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
3. Preheat The Oven To 180C, Gas Mark 4 And Lightly Grease A 1 Litre Ovenproof Dish
4. Remove The Crusts From The Bread, Then Cover Each Slice With The Soya Spread And Cut In Half To Form Triangles
5. To Make The Custard, Place The Custard Powder In A Small Bowl And Blend With 2 Tablespoons Of Soya Milk
6. Place The Remaining Milk And The Nākd Cocoa Orange Fruit & Nut Bits In A Medium Saucepan, With The Orange Rind And Heat Until Nearly Boiling. Add Some Of This Mixture To The Custard And Mix Well
7. Return To The Pan, Along With The Remaining Milk And Whisk Over A Medium Heat, Until The Mixture Starts To Thicken. Add The Orange Juice And Simmer Gently For 1-2 Minutes
8. Pour A Little Of The Chocolate Custard Into The Bottom Of The Dish, Then Arrange Half The Bread Over The Top, In Overlapping Rows. Sprinkle Over A Little Of The Chopped Chocolate, Cover With More Of The Chocolate Custard And Arrange The Remaining Bread Over The Top
9. Sprinkle Over The Remaining Chocolate, Then Pour Over The Remaining Custard Ensuring That All The Bread Is Covered. Leave To Stand For 10 Minutes
10. Cook For 20-25 Minutes Until Bubbling And Allow To Stand For 5 Minutes Before Serving

title: Salted Caramel Cookie Pie
ingredients:
1. 85G1 Cup Porridge Oats
2. 140G1 Cup Whole Wheat Flour Or Gluten Free Blend
3. 12 Tsp Sea Salt
4. 125Cups12 Cup Melted Coconut Oil Use Refined
5. 125Cups12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
6. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
7. 60Cups14 Cup Nondairy Milk
8. 75G  150G12  1 Cup Dark Vegan Chocolate Chips
9. 35G13 Cup Pecan Pieces
10. Caramel
11. 1 Tbsp Water
12. 12 Cup Raw Coconut Sugar
13. 2 Tbsp Pure Maple Syrup
14. 12 Tsp Sea Salt Flakes
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180°C/350°F And Spray An 8 Inch Tart Panwith Non Stick Spray.
2. In A Large Bowl, Whisk Togetherthe Oats, Flour And Salt. Make A Well And Add The Coconut Oil, Maple Syrup, Vanilla And Milk.Then, Fold Through Thechocolate Chips And Pecans.
3. Meanwhile, Place All Of The Caramel Ingredients Into A Pan Over A Low-Medium Heat And Gently Heat, Avoiding Stirring, Just Until All Of The Sugar Has Dissolved (It Will Caramelise In The Oven, Do Not Caramelise On The Stove As It Will Become Bitter When Baking).
4. Spread The Cookie Dough Into The Pan, Making A Few Shallow Indentations For Pools Of Caramel To Sit.
5. Pour A Thin Layer Of Caramel Over The Cookie, It’S Good To Keep Some Behind To Heat Further On The Stove To Make A Sauce For Drizzling.
6. Bake Until Puffed And Golden,About 20 Minutes. Remove From The Oven And Let The Dangerously Hot Caramel Cool A Little Before Slicing, The Inside Should Be Warm And Gooey.

title: Banoffee Pie
ingredients:
1. For The Base
2. 250G Lotus Biscoff Biscuits Crushed Or Any Biscuit You Like
3. 75G Vegan Butter Alternative Melted
4. For The Filling
5. 50 G Veganbutter Alternative
6. 50G Light Brown Soft Sugar
7. 370G Carnation Vegan Condensed Milk Alternative
8. 270Cups Plantbased Whipping Cream
9. 3 Tbsp Cornflour
10. To Serve
11. 2 Bananas
12. 2
13. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract Or Vanilla Bean Paste
14. 15G Vegan Chocolate Shavings
15. 
16.
preparation:
1. Mix The Crushed Biscuits In A Bowl With The Melted Vegan Butter. Tip The Crumbs Into A 20Cm Loose Bottomed Cake Tin And Press Into The Base And Sides. Chill Until Set.
2. For The Caramel, Put The Remaining Veganbutter, Sugar Andcarnation Vegan Condensed Milk Alternative Into Alarge Non-Stick Saucepan. Put The Cornflour Into A Bowl And Gradually Add5Tbsp Of The Cream (Saving The Rest To Whip For The Topping Later). Whisk The Mixture Until Smooth, Then Addthe Paste To The Pan. Heat Until The Sugar Has Melted Then Gradually Bring The Mixture To A Rapid Boil For 5- 7Minutes, Stirring All The Time Until You Reach 113-115°C On A Sugar Thermometer. Leave To Cool For A Few Minutes.
3. Carefully Pour The Caramel Over The Base, Cool And Then Chill For 1-2 Hours Or Until Set.
4. When Ready To Serve; Whip The Remaining Plant-Based Cream With The Vanilla Until Soft Peaks Form. Slice The Bananas And Scatter Over The Caramel, Then Top With The Whipped Cream. Finish With Chocolate Shavings And Serve.

title: Scandi-Style Lentils, Beets & Coconut Yoghurt
ingredients:
1. 12 Lemon
2. 1 Avocado
3. 1 Tsp Oil
4. 200G Beetroot
5. 240G Black Beluga Lentils Drained
6. 2 Garlic Cloves
7. 400G Baby White Potatoes
8. 40G Mixed Salad Leaves
9. 60G Radishes
10. 80Cups Coconut Yoghurt
11. Medium Handful Of Fresh Dill
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 200C / Gas Mark 6.
2. Trim The Ends Of The Beetroot. Leaving The Skin On, Cut The Beetroot And Potatoes Into Small 1 Cm Cubes And Place On Baking Tray. Drizzle Over 1/2 Tsp Oil And Place In The Oven For 20 Mins, Turning Halfway Through.
3. Meanwhile, Drain And Rinse The Black Beluga Lentils And Finely Chop Or Crush The Garlic And Finely Chop The Dill. Heat A Frying Pan With 1/2 Tsp Oil On A Medium Heat And Cook The Garlic For 1 Minute, Then Add The Lentils For A Further 5 Mins And Season With Sea Salt And Black Pepper. Stir Through Half Of The Chopped Dill And Leave To Cool Slightly For 5 Mins.
4. Peel And De-Stone The Avocado And Roughly Chop. Thinly Slice The Radishes. Mix The Lentils With The Mixed Leaves, Roasted Beetroot And Potatoes, Avocado And Radish Slices.
5. To Make A Sauce; In A Small Bowl, Mix The Coconut Yoghurt With The Remaining Dill And A Squeeze Of Lemon Juice. Season With Sea Salt And Black Pepper.
6. Spoon The Scandi-Style Lentils Onto Two Warm Plates And Drizzle Over The Coconut Yoghurt And Dill Sauce.

title: Butterscotch Chocolate Chip Blondies
ingredients:
1. 100G Coconut Oil At Room Temperature
2. 100G Light Brown Sugar
3. Seeds From 1 Vanilla Pod
4. 100G Soya Or Natural Coconut Yoghurt
5. 2 Tablespoons Agave Syrup
6. 250G Plain Flour
7. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
8. Large Pinch Of Sea Salt
9. 90Cups Milk Coconut Almond Or Soya
10. 150G Dark Chocolate Or Butterscotch Chocolate Roughly Chopped
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 190°C/Fan 170°C/Gas 5. Grease A Square Brownie Tin, Line With Baking Paper And Set Aside.
2. Put The Coconut Oil And Sugar Into A Large Bowl And Mix Well With An Electric Whisk Or By Hand. Add The Vanilla Seeds And The Yoghurt And Beat Well Until Everything Is Combined. Add The Agave Syrup And Beat This In Too.
3. Put The Flour, Baking Powder And Salt Into A Mixing Bowl And Mix Well.
4. Add The Dry Ingredients To The Wet Ingredients And Mix Thoroughly Until Nicely Combined. Bit By Bit Add The Milk, Then Fold In The Chopped Chocolate.
5. Pour The Batter Into The Brownie Tin And Spread With A Spoon Or Spatula. Bake For 35–40 Minutes, Until The Top Is Firm And Brown.
6. Allow To Cool Completely, Then Cut Into Little Squares. The Yoghurt In These Means They Will Keep Gooey And Fresh For At Least A Week.

title: Maple Cinnamon Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients:
1. 100G Rolled Oats
2. 4 Tsp Coconut Oil Solid
3. 3 Tbsp Maple Syrup
4. 2 Tbsp Nondairy Milk
5. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract
6. 15 Tsp Cinnamon
7. 1 Tsp Baking Powder
8. 50G Dark Chocolate Chopped Into Small Pieces
9. 25 Tbsp Peanut Butter
10. Himalayan Pink Salt For Sprinkling
preparation:
1. For This Recipe I Have Used Dark Vegan Chocolate Instead Of Chocolate Chips. Cacao Nibs Are Also Great, You Just Don’T Get That Satisfying Melt.
2. Makes 15 Small Cookies.
3. Heat The Oven To180°C / 350°F / Gas Mark 4.
4. Putthe Coconut Oil Into A Ramekin And Melt It In The Oven.
5. Putall Of The Ingredients Except The Salt In A Bowl And Mix By Hand Until Completely Combined. Leaveit In The Fridge For Ten Minutes.
6. Take A Teaspoon Of The Mixture, Roll It Into A Ball And Place It On A Parchment Paper-Lined Tray. Repeat Until All Of The Cookie Mixture Is Used Up.
7. Using Your Thumb, Flatten Each Cookie Ball Gentlyand Sprinkle A Couple Of Flakes Of The Pink Salt Into Each Thumb Print.
8. Cook For No More Than 12 Minutes, You Don’T Want Burnt Chocolate!
9. I Like To Wait For These To Cool Down A Little Before Tucking In, And I Storethem In The Fridge. For An Extra Treat (Although Not A Guilty One) Fill The Thumb Prints With Sometoffee Cashew Cream. Yum!

title: Vegan Baked Blender Choc Oats
ingredients:
1. 1Cup Glutenfree Oats
2. 12Cup Plantbased Milk
3. 2 X The Coconut Collab Choc Pots
4. 1Tbsp Cocoa Powder
5. 1Tbsp Maple Syrup
6. 1Tsp Baking Powder
7. A Pinch Of Salt
8. Choc Pot For Topping
9. Optional Chocolate Chips
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 180 Degrees.
2. Blend All Ingredients On High Until You’Re Left With A Runny Batter.
3. Pour Into A Small Oven-Safe Dish (Stir In Chocolate Chips Here) And Cook In The Oven For 10 Minutes.
4. Remove From The Oven And Top With Another Choc Pot And Serve Hot.
5. Notes: If You Don’T Have A Blender, It Won’T Be The Same Cake-Like Consistency, But You Can Mix All Ingredients In A Mixing Bowl, Add Another 1/4Cup Milk And Then Cook For 10-12 Minutes. Still Delicious.

title: Rainbow Veg Rolls with Peanut Dipping Sauce
ingredients:
1. 100G Dried Cellophane Noodles
2. 2 Teaspoons Sesame Oil
3. 1 Pack Rice Paper Wrappers
4. 1 Large Bunch Of Coriander Leaves Picked
5. 1 Small Bunch Of Mint Leaves Picked
6. Cucumber Halved And Seeds Scraped Out With The Tip Of A Teaspoon Then Cut Into Very Thin Strips
7. 2 Carrots Peeled And Cut Into Very Thin Strips
8. 1 Red Pepper Cored Deseeded And Cut Into Very Thin Strips
9. 6 Radishes Very Thinly Sliced
10. 56 Spring Onions Cut Into Very Thin Strips
11. 1 Avocado Stoned Peeled And Cut Into Very Thin Strips
12. For The Peanut Sauce
13. 4 Tablespoons Smooth Or Chunky Peanut Butter
14. 4 Tablespoons Rice Vinegar
15. 2 Tablespoons Light Soy Sauce
16. 1 Tablespoon Light Brown Soft Sugar
17. Pinch Of Dried Chilli Flakes
preparation:
1. Start By Making The Peanut Sauce. Measure All The Ingredients Into A Small Saucepan, Place Over A Low Heat And Heat, Stirring Continuously, Until The Mixture Just Begins To Bubble. Remove From The Heat And Set Aside.
2. Place The Noodles In A Heatproof Bowl, Pour Over Boiling Water To Cover And Leave To Soak For 10 Minutes Until Rehydrated. Drain Well And Return To The Dried-Out Bowl. Drizzle Over The Sesame Oil And Toss The Noodles To Evenly Coat In The Oil.
3. Fill A Separate Bowl With Hot Water. Take A Rice Paper Wrapper And Dip In The Hot Water For About 5 Seconds Until Soft And Pliable – They Really Don’T Need Long.
4. Lay The Wrapper On A Board And, Working Quickly, Arrange Some Of The Herb Leaves Down The Centre Of The Wrapper. Then Take A Little Of Each Of The Thinly Cut Vegetables To Create A Neat Pile In The Centre Of The Wrapper. Finally, Place A Small Bundle Of Rehydrated Noodles On The Very Top Of The Veg. Fold In The Edges Of The Wrapper Over The Veggies And Then Roll Up.
5. Repeat With The Remaining Wrappers, Herbs, Veg And Noodles.
6. Cut Each Roll In Half To Expose The Pretty Rainbow Colours Of The Vegetables And Serve With The Warm Peanut Sauce.

title: Chickpea Chilli Burgers
ingredients:
1. 80G Heaping 34 Cup Rolled Instant Oats Glutenfree If Required
2. 1  Red Chillies Deseeded Or  Tsp Dried Chilli Flakes
3. 1 Red Pepper Roughly Sliced Into Chunks
4. 1 Medium Red Onion Roughly Sliced Into Chunks
5. 1  Tbsp Tamari Or Soya Sauce
6. 1 Tbsp Tomato Puree
7. 2 Tbsp Ground Flaxseed
8. 35G 13 Cup Sundried Tomatoes Drained
9. Tsp Salt And Black Pepper To Taste
10. 1 X 425G 15 Oz Can Chickpeas Drained Washed And Rinsed
11. 23 Plump Garlic Cloves
12. 1 Small Carrot Peeled And Roughly Sliced
13. 15G 14 Cup Fresh Coriandercilantro Or Parsley If Preferred
14. 1  Tsp Dried Mixed Herbs
15. 3 Tbsp Protein Powder Pulsin Soya Bean Or Pea
16. 2 Tbsp Ground Chia Seed
17. 1 Tbsp Sundried Tomato Paste
18. Variations
19. Include 30G 4 Tbsp Of Goji Berries For A Nutrient Boost
20. Spice It Up Curried Chickpea Burgers Or Similar
21. Add 1 Tsp Of Ground Coriander
22. 1 Tsp Ground Cumin
23. 1Tsp  Tsp Turmeric
24. Serve Burgers With Minty Yogurt
25. Try With Different Pulses Black Beans And Cannellini Beans Also Work Well
preparation:
1. In A Food Processor Or Blender, Mix Together The Oats And Chickpeas. Pour Contents Into A Large Bowl.
2. In The Same Food Processor Or Blender (No Need To Wash), Add The Remaining Ingredients And Whizz. Pour Into The Bowl Containing The Oats – Chickpea Mixture. Mix Well.
3. Using Your Hands, Mould The Mixture Into 5-6 Large Patties.
4. Chill For 20 Minutes Or Overnight To Firm Up.
5. Pan Fry In A Little Coconut Oil For 7-8 Mins, Or Grill Or Barbecue For 10-12 Mins, Turning Half-Way Through To Cook Both Sides.
6. Serve. I Love Serving Mine With Guacamole And Lots Of Fresh Salad.

title: Vegan Pesto Pasta
ingredients:
1. Pesto
2. 70G Pine Nuts
3. 3 Tbsp Olive Oil
4. Handful Of Kale
5. Handful Of Fresh Basil
6. 2 Garlic Cloves
7. 1 Unwaxed Lemon Zest
8. 120Cups Olive Oil
9. Salt  Pepper To Taste
10. Pasta
11. 350G Tortiglioni
12. 100G Frozen Peas
13. 12 Tbsp Natural Coconut Yogurt Or Your Preferred Yoghurt
14. 2 Courgettes Sliced Thinly
15. 200G Asparagus Chopped
16. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil If Stirfrying Vegetables
17. Chilli Flakes Optional
18. Pumpkin Seeds Optional
preparation:
1. Roast The Pine Nuts In A Hot Pan Until Toasted. Allow The Nuts To Cool Down Completely.
2. Into A Blender, Place All The Pesto Ingredients Apart From The Olive Oil. Process Until Chopped Small And Then Start Trickling In Olive Oil While The Motor Is Going.
3. Adjust The Seasoning To Your Taste.
4. Boil A Large Pan Of Water And Cook Your Pasta.
5. Prepare The Vegetables In A Separate Pan, Stir-Fry The Courgette And Asparagus For 2 Minutes. Boil The Peas For 2 Minutes.
6. Drain Your Pasta And Toss It In The Pesto, Coconut Collaborative Yoghurt And Mix The Veggies In And Serve.
7. For The Topping, Scatter Toasted Pumpkin Seeds And Chilli Flakes.
8. Did You Like This Recipe? Browse More Delicious Vegan Pasta Recipes!

title: VEGAN BANANA CAKE
ingredients:
1. 3 Flax Eggs 3 Tablespoons Flaxmeal  6 Tablespoons Water
2. 3 Cups Flour Spelt White Whole Wheat Or Allpurpose
3. 1 Cup Organic Pure Cane Sugar
4. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
5. 1 Teaspoon Baking Soda
6. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
7. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
8. 1 12 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
9. 12 Cup Light Flavored Olive Oil
10. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
11. 3 Bananas Mashed
12. Cashew Frosting
13. 1 12 Cups Raw Cashews Pref Soaked See Notes
14. 12 Cup Coconut Cream
15. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
16. 12 Lemon Juice Of
preparation:
1. Prep: Preheat The Oven To 350 Degrees. Make Your Flax Eggs In A Small Bowl, Let Set For At Least 10 Minutes To Thicken While Oven In Heating, Stir Occasionally. Lightly Grease A 9 X 13 Pan With Oil.
2. Measure:In A Large Bowl, Combine The Flour, Sugar, Baking Soda, Baking Powder, Cinnamon And Salt. In A Medium Bowl, Mash The Bananas. Measure The Milk, Oil And Vanilla, You Can Easily Combine These In A 2 Cup Measuring Cup.
3. Combine:Add The Plant Milk, Oil, Vanilla, And Flax Eggs To The Flour Mixture. Mix Until Just Combined. Stir In The Mashed Bananas.
4. Pour:Once Mixed, Pour Batter Into A 9 X 13 Baking Dish. If Needed, Spread The Batter Evenly Using A Spatula Or Back Of A Spoon.
5. Bake: Bake For 45 – 55 Minutes. If Top Starts To Brown, Top With Foil.
6. Cool:Once Done, Let Cool Completely. If You’D Like To Cool It Faster, After 30 Minutes Of Cooling On The Counter, You Can Put The Dish In The Refrigerator To Finish Cooling.
7. Frosting: While The Cake Is Baking, Make The Frosting. Add The Soaked Cashews, Maple Syrup, Coconut Cream, Lemon Juice And Pinch Of Salt To A High Speed Blender. Blend Until Creamy Smooth.
8. Assemble: Once Completely Cooled, Spread The Cashew Buttercream Frosting Over Top And Enjoy Often!
9. Store Covered In The Refrigerator If You Prefer It Chilled, Or Keep It On The Counter And Serve At Room Temperature.

title: VEGAN 7 LAYER DIP
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 14 Oz Vegetarian Black Or Pinto Refried Beans
2. 12  1 Teaspoon Cumin
3. 14  12 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Optional
4. 2  4 Tablespoons Water
5. 2 Avocados Or 1 Cup Store Bought Guacamole
6. 1 Large Lime
7. 12 Teaspoon Salt Or To Taste
8. 1 Cup Vegan Cashew Sour Cream Or Vegan Queso
9. 1 Cup Chunky Salsa Or Pico De Gallo
10. 12 Cup Sweet Corn
11. 12 Cup Roma Tomatoes Diced And Seeds Removed Or Red Bell Pepper
12. 14 Cup Black Olives Sliced
13. 1  2 Green Onions Sliced
14. Fresh Chopped Cilantro Optional
15. 1 Bag Tortilla Chips For Serving
preparation:
1. Beans: In A Small Mixing Bowl, Add Refried Beans And Mash Well, Add Cumin, Chipotle Powder And 1/4 Cup Of Water, Mix Well To Combine. The Water Will Help Make The Beans Creamy So They Aren’T Too Thick For Dipping, Add A Little Extra Water As Needed. If You Prefer, Heat The Bean Mixture Over Low Until Warmed Through Before Assembly.
2. Guacamole: To Make This Simple Guacamole, Slice Avocado Lengthwise, Twist The Two Halves To Open, And Remove The Seed. Squeeze Out The Flesh (Or Scoop It Out With A Spoon) And Place In A Medium Bowl With The Juice Of 1 Lime And Salt. Mash Well, And Season To Taste With Salt.
3. Assemble: To Layer The Bean Dip, Using A Shallow Dish Of Choice (Pie Dish, Baking Dish, Or Bowl), Start With A Layer Of Beans, Spreading To The Edges. Next, Repeat With A Layer Of Guacamole, Sour Cream, And Salsa. Next, Add The Corn, Tomatoes, Green Onion, And Olives. Top With Cilantro.
4. Serve: Pair With Your Favorite Tortilla Chips.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 2 – 3 Days In A Covered Container.

title: Vanilla Chia Pudding
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk Use Your Favorite
2. 12 Cup Chia Seeds
3. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract 12 Teaspoon Vanilla Bean Powder Or Seeds Of 1 Vanilla Bean
4. 1  2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup Or Coconut Turbinado Or Organic Pure Cane Sugar Optional
preparation:
1. Combine: Place Ingredients In Container Or Bowl And Mix Well.
2. Mix Twice: Mix The Chia Mixture After 5 Minutes, Then Again After 5 Minutes, Mixing Well Each Time. Mixing The Chia Seeds Is Important So They Don’T Fall To The Bottom Of The Container. If Not Shaken Or Stirred Every Now And Then, The Pudding Will Not Set Properly And The Seeds Will Sink To The Bottom.
3. Chill: Keep Covered In The Refrigerator Until Set. Will Be Ready In 3 – 4 Hours.
4. Makes About 2 1/4 Cups
5. Serve: Spoon Into Individual Bowls Or Containers, And Serve With Fresh Fruit, Granola Or Whatever Your Heart Desires That Sounds Good!
6. Store: Keep Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator.

title: Glow Sugar Scrub (DIY Sugar Body Scrub)
ingredients:
1. Base
2. 1 Cup Sugar Of Choice Organic Pure Cane Brown Pure Cane Turbinado Etc
3. 3 Tablespoons Give Or Take Sweet Almond Oil Jojoba Or Extra Virgin Olive Oil
4. Optional Ingredients
5. 1 Tsp Vanilla Extract Wo Alcohol
6. Few Drops Of Vitamin E Oil
7. 12 Small Lemon Juice Of
8. Or A Few Drops Of Your Favorite Essential Oils Such As Spearmint Lavender Grapefruit Etc See Notes
preparation:
1. Mix: Place Sugar In A Small/Medium Size Container And Add The Oil 1 Tablespoon At A Time, Mixing In Between. You Want The Consistency To Be Sandy, Not Soupy. If The Mix Is Too Soupy, The Sugars Will Dissolve In A Day Or Two And Not Slough The Skin As Well, But You Will Still Get Added Moisture From The Oil.
2. To Use: At The End Of Showering, Pat The Skin Dry And Gently Rub The Sugar Scrub In A Circular Motion Over Your Body, Rinse Well. I Find It Works Best After Soaking In The Tub For At Least 20 Minutes. Soaking First Will Help Soften The Skin, Allowing The Scrub Work To At Its Best, Leaving Your Skin Soft And Supple!
3. It Can Be Used 2 – 4 Times A Week (Depending On The Sugar Type).
4. Store: Sugar Scrub Should Be Sealed When Not In Use And Stored On A Shower Caddy Or Kept In A Cabinet. It Is Best Used Within 1 Month.

title: MIRIN & MAPLE TEMPEH STIR FRY
ingredients:
1. 8 Oz Package Tempeh Cut Into 12 Inch Cubes
2. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil
3. 13 Red Cabbage Thinly Sliced
4. 2  3 Large Carrots Peeled And Thinly Sliced Diagonally
5. 2  3 Scallions Thinly Sliced
6. Sesame Seeds Garnish
7. Cilantro Garnish Optional
8. Grain Of Choice Rice Quinoa Or Soba Noodles
9. Marinade
10. 13 Cup Mirin
11. 3 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
12. 2 Tablespoons Tamari Coconut Aminos Nama Shoyu Or Soy Sauce
13. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or To Taste
preparation:
1. Marinade: In A Large Bowl, Mix Together The Marinade, Add The Tempeh And Let Set For At Least 15 Minutes, Up To 4 Hours In The Refrigerator, Turning Every So Often. Reserve Marinade For Later.
2. Cook Tempeh: Heat Oil In A Large Skillet Or Wok Over Medium Heat. Spoon In The Tempeh, Reserving Most Of The Glaze In The Bowl (Set Aside For Later). Saute For 6 – 8 Minutes, Turning On Each Side Until Browned.
3. Add Veggies: Add The Cabbage And Carrots To The Tempeh, Cook For About 3 Minutes, Add Scallions, A Spoonful Of Marinade And Cook Another 2 Minutes Or Until Desired Firmness (I Like Mine Al Dente). Add A Tad More Marinade As Needed, Reserve The Rest To Spoon Over Serving Bowls.
4. Serve: In Individual Bowls, Add 1/3 Of The Stir Fry With A 1/2 Or So Of Grain Of Choice – White Or Brown Rice, Quinoa Or Soba Noodles Would All Be Great. This Cilantro Lime Rice Would Be Especially Delicious! Top With Any Remaining Sauce, Sesame Seeds And Few Extra Scallions And Cilantro.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: RADISH AND CUCUMBER SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cucumber About 2 Cups Thinly Sliced And Cut In Half
2. 1 Bunch Radishes About 2 Cups Thinly Sliced And Cut In Half
3. 18 Red Onion About 14 Cup Finely Diced
4. 3 Tablespoons Fresh Dill
5. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
6. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
7. 4 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
8. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
9. Freshly Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Prep: Wash The Cucumber And Radishes. Cut The End Off And Thinly Slice. Cut The Larger Pieces In Half For Easier Eating. Dice The Red Onion, And Drain And Rinse The Chickpeas.
2. Assemble: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Cucumber, Radish, Chickpea, Dill, Apple Cider Vinegar, Oil, Salt And Pepper, Toss Well To Coat. Season With More Dill, Salt And Pepper To Taste.

title: Vegan ‘Chicken’ Salad
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Cooked Or 2 Cans 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 1 Cup Celery Diced
3. 12 Cup Organic Dried Cranberries Chopped Fresh Would Be Great Too
4. 12 Cup Walnuts Or Pecans Roughly Chopped
5. 12 Cup Scallions Green Onions Thinly Sliced White  Green Parts
6. Mineral Salt  Freshly Ground Pepper To Taste I Used About 12 Teaspoon Each
7. Dressing
8. 6 Tablespoons 13 Cup Tahini Or Vegan Mayo
9. 4 Tablespoons 14 Cup Champagne White Wine Or Cider Vinegar I Used Orange Muscat Champagne Vinegar
10. 2 Tablespoons Water As Needed If Using Tahini
11. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
12. To Serve
13. Leafy Lettuce Of Choice
14. Bread Of Choice
preparation:
1. Dressing: Start By Mixing Your Dressing. In A Small Bowl Combine Tahini/Mayo, Vinegar, Water And Maple Syrup. Set Aside So The Flavors Come Together. This Can Be Made A Day Or Two Ahead And Stored In The Refrigerator Until Ready To Use. Add A Tad More Water, Or Vinegar If You’Re A Vinegar Lover, To Thin Out Dressing As Desired. If Using Vegan Mayo, You May Like To Add 2 More Tablespoons.
2. Mash Chickpeas: In A Medium To Large Bowl, Add Your Garbanzo Beans And Roughly Mash With A Strong Fork Or Potato Masher. Mash At Least 3/4 Of The Chickpeas So It Binds Well.
3. Assemble: Add In Celery, Cranberries, Nuts, Scallions, Salt, Pepper And Dressing, Mix Well. Serve At Room Temp Or Let Chill In The Refrigerator For An Hour Before Serving.
4. Serve: Serve On Your Favorite Bread As A Closed Or Open Faced Sandwich, Or On A Bed Of Leafy Greens. You May Even Opt To Simply Enjoy The Salad As Is.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: Vegan Scalloped Potatoes
ingredients:
1. 3 Pounds Potatoes Sliced 18 Inch Thick
2. 1 Cup Raw Cashews
3. 2 12 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Vegetable Broth Or Combo
4. 14  13 Cup Nutritional Yeast Optional
5. 2  3 Garlic Cloves Or 2 Teaspoons Garlic Powder
6. 1 Teaspoon Onion Powder
7. 1 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
8. 12 Teaspoon Fresh Ground Pepper
9. Juice Of 12 Lemon Or 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 18 Teaspoon Nutmeg Optional
11. 1 Teaspoon Fresh Thyme To Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F.
