4. 8 Oz Package Mushrooms Sliced Or Quartered About 1 12  2 Cups
5. 1 12 Cups Broccoli Florets
6. 2 Tablespoons Dijon Mustard
7. 1 Teaspoon Dried Tarragon Optional
8. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
9. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
10. 2 Handfuls Fresh Spinach
11. 1  2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
preparation:
1. In Skillet Or Wok, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Sauté For 4 Minutes. Add The Tofu, Crumbling It Between Your Fingers, And Cook For Another 3 Minutes.
2. Add Mushrooms, Broccoli, Dijon, Tarragon, Garlic Powder, Salt And Pepper, Cook Another 5 Minutes.
3. Add The Spinach And Continue To Cook Over Medium Heat, Stirring Occasionally Until Spinach Starts To Wilt, About 3 – 5 Minutes. Remove From Heat. Season To Taste, Adding The Optional Nutritional Yeast.
4. Serve As You Like Adding Whatever Extra Spices Or Condiments You Wish. I Served Mine With Toast With Avocado Butter And Fresh Fruit On The Side For A Refreshing Touch.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: EASY MINESTRONE SOUP (SLOW COOKER)
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Onion Diced
2. 2 Medium Carrots Diced
3. 2 Stalks Celery Diced
4. 1 Zucchini Cut Into Half Moons
5. 13 Lb Green Beans Cut Into 1 Inch Pieces About 1 12 Cups
6. 3  4 Cloves Garlic Minced
7. 1 Can 14Oz Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. 1 Can 14Oz Cannellini Or Northern Beans Drained And Rinsed
9. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
10. 1 Teaspoon Dried Basil
11. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
12. 2  3 Bay Leaves
13. Generous Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Optional
14. 4  5 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water Or Combo
15. Big Handful Of Fresh Spinach
16. 1 Cup Pasta Small Pasta Such As Elbow Shells Mini Penne Or Rotini
17. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
18. Optional Garnish
19. Lemon Juice Of
20. Fresh Chopped Parsley
preparation:
1. Add All The Ingredients To Your Slow Cooker, Except For The Spinach And Pasta, Ending With The Broth Last. Give A Good Stir And Cook:
2. High For 4 – 5 Hours
3. Low For 7 – 8 Hours
4. Add Spinach During The Last 30 Minutes Of Cooking. Cook The Pasta According To Package Directions, Adding To The Soup Once It Has Finished Cooking. Remove Bay Leaves Before Serving.
5. Serve With Squeeze Of Lemon And Parsley Overtop. Pairs Great With Artisan Bread!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days. To Freeze, Place Into Freezer-Safe Container And Store For Up To 3 Months.

title: BASIL-WALNUT PESTO + MUSHROOMS, JALAPENO & SUN-DRIED TOMATOES
ingredients:
1. 23 Cup Sundried Tomatoes Softened
2. 8 Oz Package Mushrooms Sliced
3. 2 Jalapenos Sliced And Seeds Discarded
4. 1 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil
5. 8 Oz Pasta Of Choice
6. Almond Parmesan For Topping
7. Walnut Basil Pesto
8. 2 Cups Basil Packed
9. 12 Cup Walnuts
10. 14 Cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil
11. 2 Tablespoon Lemon
12. 3 Or 4 Garlic Cloves
13. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste I Used White Pepper
14. 1 Tablespoon Nutritional Yeast Optional
preparation:
1. Start With Your Pesto By Combining Ingredients In Food Processor, Process Until Blended And Creamy, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. Set Aside.
2. Cook Pasta According To Package, Drain And Return To Pot You Cooked It In. Add A Small Amount Of Oil And Toss To Coat.
3. In Saute Pan Heat Oil Over Medium, Saute Mushrooms, Sun Dried Tomatoes And Jalapeno For 4 – 5 Minutes Or Until Mushrooms Are Tender. It Should Be Smelling Pretty Delicious About Now! Remove From Heat.
4. Toss Pasta With Pesto. Place Pasta On Individual Serving Dishes And Top With Sauteed Vegetables, Add Salt And Pepper To Taste. Top With Almond Parmesan For Even More Flavor.
5. Notes:
6. I Didn’T Use The Nutritional Yeast In My Recipe, It’S A Good Healthy Option For Those Seeking To Replace The Cheese Flavor In Other Pesto Recipes. Add Slowly Until You Find The Amount You Like.
7. Use As Much Of The Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Mushrooms And Jalapeno Pepper As You Like.
8. Use Rice Or Quinoa Pasta To Make This Gluten Free.

title: FRESH VEGAN LETTUCE WRAPS
ingredients:
1. 1 Or 2 Romaine Hearts
2. 12 Cup Hummus To Spread
3. 1 Cucumber Julienned
4. 12 Cup Shredded Carrots
5. 12 Cup Cherry Tomatoes Halved
6. 12 Cup Chickpeas Optional
7. 14 Cup Cilantro Sprigs
8. 2 Tablespoon Hemp Hearts
9. Salt  Pepper
preparation:
1. I’Ll Leave The Amount Of Ingredients You Want To Use Up To You. I Would Say A Handful Of The Vegetables, And A Sprinkle Of The Hemp Hearts, Salt And Pepper. You Really Can Eat About As Much As You Want Here And I Love It Like That!
2. Wash And Dry Your Romaine Hearts. I Usually Use 2 Leaves Together For Each Wrap, One Large And A Smaller One On Top. Add A Layer Of Hummus Down The Middle Of Romaine Hearts, It’S Ok To Spread A Little Out Toward The Edges If You Like. Layer First With Cucumbers, Carrots And Then Tomatoes. Add Cilantro And Top With A Sprinkle Of Hemp Hearts, Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper.
3. Enjoy As Much Or As Little As You Like!

title: TOFU RICOTTA
ingredients:
1. 1 Block 14Oz Tofu Soft Firm Or Extra Firm
2. 1  2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast
3. 2 Teaspoons Mellow White Miso
4. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
6. Salt  Pepper To Tate
7. Juice Of 1 Lemon
preparation:
1. To Make Tofu Ricotta, Add Crumbled Tofu, Miso, Nutritional Yeast, Garlic Powder, Onion Powder, Salt, Pepper And Lemon To The Bowl Of Food Processor Or Blender And Blend Until Creamy, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. Taste For Spices Adding Anything You May Like.
2. Makes About 2 Cups.
3. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator, In A Covered Container, For Up To 5 Days.

title: REFRIED BEAN & AVOCADO LAVASH WRAP
ingredients:
1. 2 Lavash Bread Whole Grain Pref
2. 1 Can 14 Oz Vegan Refried Beans
3. 13 Red Onion Sliced
4. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper Sliced
5. 1 Head Romaine Lettuce Or Other Leafy Greens Of Choice
6. 12 Avocado Sliced
7. Cilantro Sprigs Optional
8. Himalayan Salt  Pepper
9. Salsa On The Side
preparation:
1. Heat Up Your Refried Beans And Cut Up Your Veggies.
2. Layer Lavash Bread With 1/3 – 1/2 Of The Refried Beans, Onion, Red Pepper, Avocado And Leafy Greens. Sprinkle A Little Mineral Salt Over Top, Fold Over And Roll, Slice In Half And Enjoy!
3. A Little Salsa On The Side Is Perfect To Add A Little Extra Juiciness. You Could Also Use Tomato Slices In Place Of, Or In Addition To, The Red Bell Pepper For Added Juiciness.
4. Store: Lavash Wraps Can Be Stored In Covered Containers For Up To 2 Days.

title: THE ULTIMATE VEGETABLE LENTIL LOAF
ingredients:
1. Loaf
2. 1 Cup Dry Lentils Use Greenbrown
3. 2 12 Cups Vegetable Broth
4. 3 Tablespoons Flaxseed Meal Ground Flaxseeds
5. 13 Cup Water
6. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or Steam Saute Using 14 Cup Water
7. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
8. 1 Small Onion Finely Diced
9. 1 Small Red Bell Pepper Finely Diced
10. 1 Carrot Finely Diced Or Grated
11. 1 Celery Rib Finely Diced
12. 34 Cup Oats I Used Gf Oats
13. 12 Cup Oat Flour Or Finely Ground Oats Any Flour Of Choice Will Work Here Too
14. 2 Teaspoons Dried Thyme Or Italian Seasoning
15. 1 Teaspoon Each Garlic Powder  Onion Powder For Good Measure
16. 12  1 Teaspoon Cumin Optional
17. 14  12 Teaspoon Ground Chipotle Pepper Optional
18. Cracked Pepper  Sea Salt To Taste
19. Glaze
20. 3 Tablespoons Organic Ketchup
21. 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar Or Balsamic See Notes
22. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Prepare Lentils: Rinse The Lentils, Remove Odd Pieces. In Large Pot Add 2 1/2 Cups Water/Broth With Lentils. Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover And Simmer For About 35 – 40 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. It’S Ok If They Get Mushy, We Are Going To Roughly Puree 3/4 Of The Mixture When Cooled. Once Done, Remove Lid And Set Aside To Cool (There Should Only Be A Little Bit Of Water So Do Not Drain), Lentils Will Thicken A Bit Upon Standing, About 15 Minutes Is Good.
2. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees.
3. Make Flax Egg: In Small Bowl Combine Flaxseed Meal And 1/3 Cup Water, Set Aside For At Least 10 Minutes, Preferably In The Refrigerator. This Will Act As A Binder And Will Thicken Nicely Upon Sitting.
4. Saute Vegetables & Spices:In Saute Pan Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat. Saute Garlic, Onion, Bell Pepper, Carrots And Celery For About 5 Minutes. Add Spices Mixing Well To Incorporate. Set Aside To Cool.
5. Mash The Lentils:Using An Immersion Blender, Food Processor, Back Of A Fork Or Potato Masher, Blend 3/4 Of The Lentil Mixture. For Me This Was An Important Part, I Tried It Other Ways And This Worked To Help As A Binder. If Using An Immersion Blender, Tilt The Pot Slightly To The Side For Easier Blending.
6. Assemble Lentil Loaf: Combine Sauteed Vegetables With The Lentils, Oats, Oat Flour And Flax-Egg, Mix Well. Taste, Adding Salt And Pepper As Needed, Or Any Other Herb Or Spice You Might Like. Place Mixture Into A Loaf Pan Lined With Parchment Paper, Leaving It Overlapping For Easy Removal Later. Press Down Firmly Filling In Along The Edges Too.
7. Glaze: Prepare Your Glaze By Combining All Ingredients In A Small Bowl, Mix Until Incorporated. I Recommend Making Each Tablespoon Heaping So You Have Plenty Of This Great Sauce On Top (If Using Tomato Paste And Mixture Is Too Thick, Add A Teaspoon Of Water, Or A Little Extra Vinegar & Syrup). Spread Evenly Over Top The Loaf.
8. Bake: Place In Center Of The Oven, And Bake In Oven For About 45 – 50 Minutes. Let Cool A Bit Before Slicing.

title: Mixed Berry Yogurt Smoothie
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Frozen Berries Mix Strawberries Raspberries Blueberries Andor Blackberries
2. 1 Small Banana Optional But Adds Extra Creaminess
3. 1 Cup Unsweetened Nondairy Yogurt Plain Or Vanilla
4. 12 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Plain Or Vanilla
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract Or Ground Vanilla Bean Powder Optional
preparation:
1. Place Ingredients Into Your Blender, Blend Until Smooth, Stopping Every Now And Then To Scrape Down The Sides If Needed. Add An Extra Splash Of Non-Dairy Milk Or Water As Needed.
2. Serve As Is Ina Glass With Straw/Spoon. Alternately, Serve In A Bowl Making A Smoothie Bowl.
3. Either Way You Serve It, Top With Any One Or More Of These Optional Topping:
4. Frozen/Fresh Berries
5. Granola
6. Coconut Flakes
7. Cocoa Nibs
8. Chia/Hemp Seeds
9. Chopped Almonds
10. A Dollop Of Your Favorite Nut Butter

title: INSTANT POT CHICKPEAS
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Chickpeas About 2 Cups
2. 4  5 Cups Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Salt
4. Optional Addins
5. 2 Bay Leaves
6. 1 Kombu 4 Inch Piece
7. 1 Garlic Clove
8. 14 Chunk Of Onion
preparation:
1. Pick Out Any Odd Or Off-Colored Chickpeas And Discard.
2. Place Chickpeas Into The Bottom Of The Pressure Cooker Insert, Pour Water Overtop. Attach The Lid, Turn To Lock, And Move The Valve To ‘Sealing’. Set The Instant Pot To Bean Or Manually Set To High Pressure, And Cook For 5 Or 45 Minutes (See Below For Your Cooking Time). Once Done, Let The Pressure Release On Its Own For At Least 15 Minutes, Then Move The Valve To The ‘Venting’ Position To Complete The Process.
3. Unsoaked Chickpeas: Cook On Bean Or High For 45 Minutes With 15 Minute Natural Release. Use 5 Cups Of Water.
4. Soaked Chickpeas: Cook On Bean Or High For 5 Minutes With 15 Minutes Natural Release. Use 4 Cups Of Water.
5. Water Amounts When Using A Basket Insert. When Using An Instant Pot Basket Insert(Affiliate Link), Use 9 – 10 Cups Of Water. You Want To Be Sure To Cover The Chickpeas With At Least 2 Inches Of Water.

title: THE ULTIMATE TEMPEH CHILI
ingredients:
1. 1 8 Oz Package Tempeh I Used This Three Grain Tempeh Crumbled
2. 1 Large Onion Chopped
3. 3 Large Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Sauteing
5. 1 Can 15 Oz Red Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
6. 1 Can 15 Oz Pinto Beans Drained And Rinsed
7. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. 1 Can 28 Oz Diced Fire Roasted Tomatoes And Juices Or 3 Cups Fresh Diced Tomatoes
9. 1 Can 14Oz Sweet Corn Drained Optional
10. 1 Can 4 Oz Diced Mild Green Chilies Or 1 Green Bell Pepper Cored Seeded And Diced
11. 2 Tablespoons Chili Powder
12. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
13. 12  1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder Optional
14. 12 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Optional
15. Salt  Pepper To Taste
16. 1 Bottle 8Oz Dark Beer Negra Modelo 1 Bottle  1 12 Cups Plus 12 Cup Additional Water Or 2 Cups Water
17. Optional Garnish
18. Sliced Scallions
19. Vegan Cashew Sour Cream
preparation:
1. Stovetop: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Stock Pot, Heat Your Oil/Water Over Medium Heat. Add Onions, Garlic, Spices And Tempeh And Cook For 5 Minutes Stirring Frequently. Add Beans, Tomatoes, Green Chili And Dark Beer/Water, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Low, Partially Cover And Simmer For 45 Minutes To 1 Hour. Chili Will Thicken Upon Cooling.
2. Slow Cooker: Add The Ingredients To The Bowl Of Your Slow Cooker, Ending With The Liquids. Cook On Low For 6 – 8 Hours Or High For 3 – 4 Hours. Chili Will Thicken As It Cools.
3. Serve With Optional Garnish. Also, Pairs Perfectly With Jalapeno Cornbread Muffins Or Sweet Chia Cornbread!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6, Kept In Airtight Container. To Store Longer, Store In The Freezer With Freezer Safe Containers For 2 – 3 Months.
5. Notes:
6. Mix The Beans Up However You Like Using All Of One Type Or Your Favorite Combination. If You Would Rather Use Only 2 Cans Of Beans, That’S Great Too! I Like Adding More Ingredients As It Makes The Chili Go Further. If Using Your Own Cooked Beans You’Ll Need About 4 1/2 Cups.
7. Feel Free To Use 2 Packages Tempeh Instead Of Just 1. At Times I Like The Extra Dose Of Protein The Tempeh Adds And Will Double The Amount Making For An Extra Hearty Chili. It’S Just So Good!
8. For Those Who Do Not Care For The Taste Of Tempeh, I Recommend Making This A Day Ahead So The Flavors Really Meld Into The Tempeh Masking Most Of Its Natural Flavor. Or Try Using The Three Grain Tempeh As Its Flavor Is Not As Strong.
9. If You Find If You Added Too Much Heat From The Chipotle, Try Adding A Teaspoon Or So Of Cocoa/Cacao Powder Or Organic Sugar.
10. Updated: This Recipe Was Updated In Sept. 2019 With New Photos And Helpful Tips. The Only Changes Made To The Recipe Was Adding A Can Of Sweet Corn. Since So Many Who Commented On The Recipe Added It, I Thought I Would Do The Same. It’S Delicious, But Optional!

title: VEGAN BLUEBERRY MUFFINS
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour Allpurpose Spelt White Whole Wheat Or Combo
2. 2 12 Teaspoons Baking Powder
3. 14 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
4. 34 Cup Organic Pure Cane Or Turbinado Sugar
5. 1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
6. 13 Cup Olive Oil Or Fruit Infused Olive Oil Lemon Or Orange
7. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
8. 1 12  2 Cups Blueberries Fresh Or Frozen
9. Optional Garnish
10. A Few Extra Blueberries
11. Sprinkle Of Cane Sugar
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Mix Wet Ingredients: In A 2 Cup Measuring Cup, Add The Milk, Sugar, Oil, And Vanilla, Stir To Combine A Few Times To Help Soften The Large Grains Of Sugar.
3. Mix Dry Ingredients: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Mix Together The Flour, Baking Powder And Salt.
4. Combine Wet & Dry: Pour The Wet Mixture Into The Dry Mixture And Mix Until Just Combined. Don’T Overmix, Overmixing The Batter Tends To Make The Muffins Less Tender.
5. Add Blueberries: Toss In The Fresh Or Frozen Blueberries And Gently Fold Them Into The Batter.
6. Scoop: Fill Each Muffin-Lined Hole With Batter. For Uniformity, Fill Muffin Tin Using A 1/4 Measuring Cup Or Large Ice Cream Scooper To Scoop Up The Batter And Pour Into The Muffin Holes.
7. Topping: Optionally, Add A Few Strategic Blueberries On Top And Sprinkle The Top With A Little Pure Cane Sugar Or Raw Sugar. The Sugar Will Add A Nice Crunch To The Tops!
8. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 30 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes And Enjoy Warm Or At Room Temperature.
9. Makes 12 Muffins
10. Storing:
11. Counter & Fridge: Once Completely Cooled, Store The Muffins With A Paper Towel Underneath And Overtop In A Container On The Counter For Up To 3 – 4 Days. The Paper Towels Will Soak Up Moisture And Keep Them From Getting Too Moist, Losing Their Delicious Crunchy Top. They Are Also Fine Loosely Covered For 1 – 2 Days. Or Store In The Refrigerator For Up To A Week.
12. Freezer: Once Completely Cooled, Wrap Muffins Individually And Store Them In A Freezer-Safe Container Or Baggie For Up To 2 Months. When Ready To Eat Let Thaw To Room Temperature.

title: LEMON GINGER DETOX TEA
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Water
2. 1 Inch Ginger Peeled And Thinly Sliced
3. 1 Large Lemon Juice Of
4. 14 Teaspoon Turmeric Optional
5. Pinch Of Cayenne Optional
6. 14 Teaspoon Raw Coconut Or Organic Sugar Or Maple Syrup Optional
preparation:
1. Prep The Ginger By Using A Vegetable Peeler To Remove The Outer Skin And Thinly Slice With A Sharp Knife.
2. Using A Small Pot Or Kettle, Add The Water, Ginger, Lemon Juice, Turmeric And Cayenne, Give A Good Stir. Place Over Medium-Low To Low Heat And Warm Until Steam Comes Up Or Whistle Blows On The Kettle.
3. Let Rest For 5 Minutes, Pour Into Individual Cups, Add A Little Sweetener, And Enjoy.

title: SWEET CORN + ARUGULA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 2  3 Oz Baby Arugula
2. 4 Ears Of Corn Shucked About 3 Cups See Notes
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Diced
4. 12 Red Onion Diced
5. 1 Lemon Juice Of
6. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Optional
7. 12 Teaspoon Salt  Pepper Or To Taste
preparation:
1. Prep Corn: Remove The Husks And Stringy Fibers From The Corn Cut/Slice The Corn Off The Cob. See This, 3 Mess Free Ways To Get Corn Of The Cobb, For A Quick Tutorial. Prep The Bell Pepper And Onion.
2. Assemble: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Place The Arugula, Corn, Bell Pepper And Onion. Add The Lemon Juice, Olive Oil And Salt & Pepper. Mix Well To Combine. Taste For Seasoning Adding More Lemon Juice Or Salt & Pepper As Needed.
3. Serve: Enjoy Right Away, Or Let The Salad Set For About 10 Minutes (You Can Also Chill It If You Like). The Arugula Will Soften And Slightly Wilt During That Time Making The Salad Look More Proportioned And Not So Arugula Heavy (It Makes It A Little Easier To Eat).
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days Or So.

title: SPRING SALAD WITH EDIBLE FLOWERS & DANDELION GREENS
ingredients:
1. A Few Handfuls Spring Salad Mix
2. 1 Bunch Dandelions Or Watercress
3. Handful Wisteria Flowers Pulled Of Their Stems I Left Mine On Quite By Accident
4. 12 English Cucumber Chopped
5. 1 Orange Peeled And Chopped
6. Orange Zest
7. Dressing
8. 2 Tablespoon Balsamic Vinegar
9. 2 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
10. 1 Tablespoon Maple Syrup
11. 1 Teaspoon Dijon Mustard
12. Juice Of 12 Orange
13. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Start With The Dressing By Combining All Ingredients, Except The Oil, In A Small Bowl Or Decanter, Mix Well And Then Add In The Olive Oil. Mix Again And Let Set.
2. For The Salad Ingredients, Use As Much As You Like Of Each Ingredient. Mix Your Greens, Place On Serving Dish And Top With Cucumber, Orange Pieces, Orange Zest And Flowers. Drizzle With Dressing Just Before Serving. Enjoy!

title: CREAMY BUTTERNUT SQUASH PASTA SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth For Water Saute
2. 1 Large Shallot Diced
3. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 Tsp Garlic Powder
4. 1 Small Butternut Squash About 6 Cups Diced
5. 6  7 Large Sage Leaves About 2  3 Tablespoons Chopped Or 1 Tablespoon Dried
6. 14  12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Optional
7. 18 Teaspoon Nutmeg
8. 1 12 Cups Vegetable Broth
9. 12  1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Vegan Cream Plus More As Needed
10. 1 Cup Cooked Cannellini Or Great Northern Beans Optional
11. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
12. 12  16 Oz Pasta Of Choice
13. To Serve Optional
14. Small Handful Toasted Walnuts Or Pine Nuts
15. Fresh Chopped Parsley
16. Fresh Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. Pasta: Cook Pasta Of Choice According To Package Directions, Set Aside.
2. Cube Squash: Slice Off The Very Top And Bottom, Discard. Using A Vegetable Peeler, Remove The Hard Outer Skin. Cut The Butternut Squash In Half, Remove Seeds And Cut Squash Into 1/2″ Cubes (The Smaller The Cubes Are The Quicker They Will Cook).
3. Cook: In A Large Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Shallots And Saute 4 Minutes Or Until Softened. Add Butternut Squash, Garlic, And Herbs, Cook Another 4 Minutes Stirring Occasionally. Add Broth, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Cook, Stirring Occasionally, Until Squash Is Softened, About 8 – 10 Minutes. Add Milk And Optional Beans To The Pot.
4. Puree: Using An Immersion Blender Or Food Processor/Blender, Blend Until Smooth Or Desired Consistency (A Little Chunky Is Ok). If Using A Food Processor Or Blender You May Need To Do It In Two Batches. Taste For Seasoning. Add Back To The Pot And Heat Before Serving If Necessary.
5. Serve: To Serve, Add A Little Sauce To The Bottom Of Your Dish, Use The Back Of A Spoon To Spread The Sauce Outward A Bit Making A Circular Or Zig Zag Motion. Place Pasta On Top And Cover With More Sauce, Gently Toss To Coat If You Like (If You Prefer, Toss Your Pasta And Sauce Together In The Pot And Then Serve). Top With Optional Toppings And Fresh Cracked Pepper.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days, In Covered Containers. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer Stored In Freezer Safe Containers Or Bags. Reheat On The Stovetop Over Low Heat Until Warmed Through Or In The Microwave.

title: VEGAN GERMAN POTATO SALAD
ingredients:
1. 2 Lbs Baby Potatoes Red White Or Gold Cut In Half And Quartered
2. 1 Cup Cucumber Diced
3. 1 Small Shallot Finely Diced
4. 2 Tablespoons Wholegrain Mustard Or Dijon
5. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
6. 3 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
7. 2  4 Tablespoons Fresh Dill Chopped
8. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt  Pepper Plus More To Taste
9. 12  1 Teaspoon Caraway Seeds Optional
10. Juice Of 1 Lemon To Serve
preparation:
1. Potatoes: Wash And Scrub The Potatoes, Place In A Medium Size Pot, And Fill With Water, Cover The Potatoes With At Least 1 Inch Of Water. Bring The Water And Potatoes To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Medium And Cook For 5 – 6 Minutes, Or Until Potatoes Are Just Fork Tender. Drain Potatoes Using A Colander, And Run Potatoes Under Cool Running Water For 10 Seconds Or So. Set Aside.
2. Prep: While The Potatoes Are Cooking, Prep The Shallot, Cucumber And Dill, And Make The Dressing.
3. Potato Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Oil, Apple Cider Vinegar, Mustard, Salt And Pepper. Mix Until The Mustard Emulsifies And Dressing Is Somewhat Creamy.
4. Assemble: In A Medium Mixing Bowl, Add The Potatoes, Shallots, Cucumber And Dill, Pour The Dressing Overtop And Toss To Coat. Add More Salt, Pepper, Or Dill To Taste. Add A Squeeze Of Lemon Overtop.
5. Serve With Sliced Vegan Sausage Or Add A Handful Of Homemade Coconut Bacon. Even A Can Of Chickpeas, Drained And Rinsed Would Be Great Added To The Salad For Protein!
6. Keep Leftovers In The Refrigerator, In An Airtight Container, For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: INSTANT POT REFRIED BEANS
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Dried Pinto Beans 2 Cups Rinsed And Odd Beans Removed
2. 1 Small Onion Diced
3. 3 Garlic Cloves Mined
4. 1 Jalapeno Or Hatch Chili Pepper Seeds Removed And Chopped
5. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
6. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder Or Chipotle Powder
7. 2 Bay Leaves
8. 1 Teaspoon Black Pepper
9. 1 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
10. 8 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water Or Combo
11. 1  2 Limes Juice Of
preparation:
1. Start By Washing The Beans. Rinse The Beans Under Cool Running Water Using A Colander. Pick Out And Remove Any Odd Shaped Beans.
2. Add Ingredients To The Instant Pot. Place The Beans In The Bowl Of The Instant Pot, Add The Onions, Garlic, Cumin, Chili Powder, Chili Peppers (If Using), Bay Leaves, Salt, Pepper And Finish With The Liquids.
3. Pressure Cook The Beans. Manually Set The Instant Pot To High Pressure For 45 Minutes, Close The Vent. Once Done, Let The Pressure Cooker Steam Vent Naturally For 25 Minutes.
4. Drain The Beans. Let The Beans Cool A Few Minutes And Drain The Liquids, Reserving Up To 2 Cups.
5. Mash Or Puree The Beans. Using A Potato Masher Or Immersion Blender, Mash Or Puree The Beans To Desired Consistency. Add As Much Of The Reserved Liquids You Need To Thin. Ultimately, You May Like The Beans Un-Mashed, More Ranchero Or Charro Style.
6. Taste For Flavor. Taste The Beans, Adding As Much Lime Juice, Salt And Pepper As You Like.
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days In A Covered Container. To Keep Longer, Freeze The Beans In Freezer Safe Containers For 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Fridge Overnight. Re-Heat On The Stove Over Medium Low, Stirring Frequently.

title: STUFFED ACORN SQUASH WITH QUINOA
ingredients:
1. 3 Acorn Squash
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or Pure Maple Syrup
3. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
4. 2 Cups Water
5. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
6. 2  3 Sage Leaves Minced Or 34 Teaspoon Dried
7. 13 Cup Red Onion Finely Diced
8. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
9. 12 Cup Dried Cranberries Raisins Or Golden Berry Mix Ok Too
10. 12 Cup Pecans
11. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Or Silicone Mat.
2. Prep Squash: Lay The Acorn Squash On It’S Side, Find The Center And Cut In Half Widthwise. Turn The Squash Half On Its Side Again And Trim Off The End, Creating A Flat Bottom. Using A Sharp Edge Spoon Or 1 Tablespoon Measure Spoon, Scrape Around The Inside Of The Squash Removing The All Seeds.
3. Roast Squash: Place The Acorn Squash On Baking Sheet Cut Side Up. Brush With Oil (Or Maple Syrup For Oil Free), Season With Salt And Pepper. Bake In The Oven At 400 Degrees For 30 Minutes.
4. Quinoa: In A Medium Size Pot, Add Quinoa, Sage, Garlic Powder And Water, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Once Done, Fluff With Fork And Let Quinoa Rest For 10 Minutes.
5. Assemble Quinoa Stuffing: To The Quinoa, Add The Chickpeas, Red Onion, Cranberries, Salt And Pepper. Just Before Stuffing The Squash, Mix In The Pecans.
6. Stuff Squash: Fill Each Squash Half With Quinoa Stuffing. Top With Optional Chopped Parsley For A Little Pop Of Color And Fresh Flavor. Place In The Oven At 350 Degrees To Rewarm If Needed.
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up 4 – 5 Days, In Covered Containers. To Reheat, Place Them In The Oven At 350 Degrees For About 10 Minutes.

title: CRISPY BLACKENED TOFU WITH KALE + QUINOA
ingredients:
1. Quinoa
2. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa I Used Tricolor From Trader Joes
3. 1 34 Cups Water
4. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. Salt To Taste
6. Blackened Tofu
7. 1 Block 1416 Oz Organic Tofu Super Firm Pref Or Extra Firm
8. 2 Tablespoons Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Light Soy Sauce
9. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
10. Spice Blend
11. 2 Teaspoons Paprika
12. 12 Teaspoon Black Pepper
13. 1 Teaspoon Cornstarch Optional
14. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
15. 1 Teaspoon Onion Powder
16. 12 Teaspoon Salt
17. 1 Teaspoon Thyme
18. 12 Teaspoon Oregano
19. 18 Teaspoon Cayenne Pepper
20. Sauteed Kale
21. Chopped Kale I Used 10Oz Organic Package From Trader Joes
22. 2 Tablespoons Of Nutritional Yeast
23. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
24. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water Or Veg Broth
25. Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa:
2. Rinse Your Quinoa Under Cool Running Water To Remove Dust (If You Forego This Step Your Quinoa May Have A Bitter Taste).
3. In Medium Pot Add Quinoa, Garlic Powder Pinch Of Salt And Water, Bring To A Boil. Reduce Heat, Cover And Simmer For 15 Min.
4. Once Done, Uncover, Stir And Let Set For 10 Minutes To Cool And Soak Up Any Excess Water.
5. Fluff Before Serving. It Will Be A Perfect Quinoa, Fluffy And Sprouted.
6. Tofu Prep:
7. Open And Drain Tofu.
8. Slice Tofu Into 4 Large Slabs, Or Whatever Size You Prefer.
9. Press Tofu Between Paper Towels Or Kitchen Cloth To Remove Excess Moisture.
10. In A Shallow Dish Place Tofu And Tamari And Let Set While Mixing The Blackening Seasoning, Turn After A Few Minutes To Let The Other Side Soak.
11. Blackened Seasoning:
12. In A Flat Bottomed Medium Size Bowl, Combine All Spice Blend Ingredients And Mix Until Blended. This Is Fairly Spicy So You May Consider Using Less Black Pepper And/Or Cayenne.
13. Place Tofu Pieces In Spice Blend, Press Gently To Get A Good Coating, Turn And Repeat On All Sides.
14. Cook Tofu:
15. In Saute Pan, Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Coated Tofu And Cook 5 Minutes On Each Side.
16. Sauteed Kale:
17. In Large Wok Or Saute Pan Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Kale And Saute For 2 Minutes, Stirring Frequently.
18. Sprinkle Nutritional Yeast And Garlic Powder Over Top, Turning And Moving The Kale Around To Get All The Spices Mixed Well Throughout The Kale.
19. Continue Stir Frying For Another Four To 5 Minutes, Or Until Bright Green And Just Wilted. You May Leave A Cover On For A Minute Here And There In Between Stir Frying To Help Soften The Kale. When Kale Turns Bright Green It’S About Ready To Be Removed From Heat. Test A Piece And See If It’S Too Your Liking, If Not Saute A Little Longer. Some May Like It Crisp And Some May Like It Softer.
20. For A Change, The Blackened Tofu Would Also Be Great With Classic Sides Like This Vegan Macaroni Salad, Vegan Potato Salador Vegan Cornbread.
21. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: SUMMER ROLLS + TWO DIPPING SAUCES
ingredients:
1. 6 Rice Papers Preferably The Circular Sheets
2. 23 Medium Carrots Cut Into Matchsticks Or 14 Inch Sticks
3. 12 Cucumber Cut Into Matchsticks Or 14 Inch Sticks
4. 12 Bell Pepper Yellow Red Or Orange Thinly Sliced
5. 14 Red Cabbage Thinly Sliced
6. 1 Cup Greens Leafy Lettuce Pea Shoots Spring Salad Mix Or Micro Greens
7. 8 Oz Organic Tofu Firm Or Extra Firm Sliced Optional
8. Mint Small Handful Of Leaves
9. Cilantro Small Bunch Of Sprigs
10. Basil Regular Or Thai Small Handful Of Leaves
11. Sweet Chili Sauce 2 Servings
12. 14 Cup Unseasoned Rice Vinegar
13. 2 Tablespoons Water
14. 2 Tablespoons Maple Syrup
15. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Or Soy Sauce
16. 1 Clove Garlic Minced Or Grated
17. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Minced Or Grated
18. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or To Taste
19. Juice Of 1 Lime
20. Peanut Sauce 2 Servings
21. 14 Cup Nut Butter Peanut Or Almond Butter
22. 2 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
23. 2 Tablespoon Water
24. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Or Soy Sauce
25. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Minced Or Grated
26. Juice Of 1 Lime
27. 1  2 Tablespoon Rice Vinegar Optional
28. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Optional
preparation:
1. Dipping Sauces: Mix Your Dipping Sauce Together First, Let Set So The Flavors Can Mingle. It Will Taste Much Different After A Few Minutes. Taste For Flavor Before Serving.
2. Water Bowl: Fill A Large Bowl With Warm Water. Depending On The Size Of Your Sheets You Can Use A Shallow Pie Dish Or Large Bowl Or Pot.
3. Wet Rice Paper: Dip The Rice Paper In The Warm Water For Just 2 – 3 Seconds, It Should Be Stiff, And Will Soften As You Begin To Work.
4. Assemble: On A Non-Porous Work Surface, Lay The Rice Paper Sheet And Layer The Ingredients On The Edge Closest To You At The 1/3 Mark. Start With The Leafy Greens, Carrots, Cucumber, Tofu, Red Pepper And Herbs (Really Any Way You Want To Layer Is Fine).
5. Tuck & Roll: After Layering The Ingredients, ‘Tuck And Roll’ The Edge Closest To You, By Bringing The Edge Up And Over The Fresh Veggie Mound. Gently But Firmly, Tuck It Under And Roll Away From You. At The 2/3 Mark, Fold The Ends Up Onto The Roll, And Continue Rolling Tucking Them Under Until The Roll Is Finished.
6. Serve With Choice Of Dipping Sauce.
7. Makes 6 Summer Rolls, 2 Rolls Per Serving.
8. Store: Leftover Summer Rolls Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 Days In A Covered Container And The Dressing Will Last 5 – 6 Days. To Keep The Rolls From Sticking Together, Place A Piece Of Saran Wrap, Wax Or Parchment Paper Between The Rolls.

title: CHERRY, PISTACHIO + MINT QUINOA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
2. 1 34 Cups Water
3. 1 Lb Cherries About 2 Cups Pitted And Sliced In Half
4. 12 Cup Pistachios
5. 14 Red Onion Or 1 Small Shallot Minced
6. 14 Cup Mint Chopped
7. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
8. Juice Of 1 Lemon
9. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
10. A Handful Baby Arugula Optional
preparation:
1. In A Medium-Size Pot/Pan, Add Quinoa And Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low, And Simmer, At A Gentle Boil, For 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover, And Let Set 10 – 15 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork. Let Cool Almost Completely Before Assembly.
2. In A Large Mixing Bowl Or Pot/Pan, You Cooked The Quinoa In, Add The Cherries, Pistachios, Shallot, Mint, Apple Cider Vinegar, Salt, And Pepper. Toss Well To Combine, Adding In The Optional Baby Arugula If Desired.
3. Serve At Room Temperature Or Chilled.
4. Servers 4 – 6
5. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: SMOKY CHIPOTLE TOFU SANDWICH (TLT)
ingredients:
1. 1 Block 15 Oz Organic Tofu Firm Or Extra Firm
2. 1 Onion Thinly Sliced
3. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
4. 1 Medium Tomato Sliced Thin
5. Dijon Or Stone Ground Mustard To Spread Vegan Mayo Is Great Too
6. 1 12 Small Avocados Mashed To Spread
7. A Few Leaves Of Your Favorite Leafy Greens Red Or Green Leaf Romaine Iceberg Etc
8. Salt To Taste
9. 6 Slices Bread Of Choice
10. Marinade
11. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
12. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
13. 1 Tablespoon Water
14. 14 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
15. 14 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder To Taste
16. 14 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
preparation:
1. Cut Tofu: Remove Tofu From The Package. Turn Tofu On Its Side And Slice In Thirds, Creating 3 Large Slabs. Gently Press Each Slab Between A Clean Dish Towel Or Paper Towels To Remove Some Of The Excess Water. Cut The Slabs In Half. You Should Have Six Pieces That Look Like Large Domino (Rectangular) Shapes.
2. Marinade Tofu: In A Medium Sized Shallow Dish, Mix Together The Marinade. Place Tofu In The Dish And Let Soak For About 30 Minutes – 1 Hour Turning Carefully Once Or Twice In Between.
3. Saute Onions: Once The Hour Is Almost Up, Caramelize Your Onions Using 1 Tablespoon Oil. Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions, Turn Down Heat To Medium Low, Stir Often And Cook Until They Start To Brown And Caramelize. May Take 10 To 15 Minutes Or So. Once Done, Set Aside.
4. Cook Tofu: In Same Skillet, Heat Remaining Oil And Cook Tofu Over Medium High Heat. Once Tofu Has Browned, About 5 Minutes, Gently Flip And Brown The Other Side. It’S Ok If It Gets A Little Crispy Too! If You Feel It Is Drying Out Too Much, Add Some Of The Juices From The Bowl It Marinated In For Extra Moisture. When Done, Remove From Heat.
5. Build Sandwich: Toast Your Bread. Spread One Side Of Toast With Mustard And The Other With A Layer Of Mashed Avocado, About 1/2 Avocado. Over The Avocado, Layer Your Lettuce, Tofu, Onions And Tomato. Top With Your Other Slice Of Bread.

title: CUBAN BLACK BEAN + MANGO BOWL
ingredients:
1. Cuban Black Beans
2. 1 Lb Dried Black Beans Rinsed And Pick Over To Remove Odd Beans
3. 1 Spanish Onion Diced
4. 5  6 Cloves Garlic Minced
5. 2 Green Bell Peppers Cored And Diced
6. 1 Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced Optional
7. 12 Cup Pitted Green Olives Drained And Sliced I Used A 6Oz Jar
8. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
9. 1 Teaspoon Oregano
10. 2 Bay Leaves
11. 4 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth Or Combo
12. 1 2 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar Distilled Or White Wine Vinegar Is Great Too
13. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
14. Quinoa
15. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
16. 1 34 Cup Water
17. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
18. Dash Of Salt
19. Toppings
20. Mango Salsa Recipe
21. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Cook The Cuban Black Beans
2. Instant Pot :
3. *No Need To Soak The Beans.
4. Add All The Ingredients For The Cuban Black Beans, Except Thevinegar, To The Bowl Of Theinstant Potand Give A Good Stir. Positionlid To Lock, Andturn The Vent Valve At The Top Toits Sealedposition.
5. Press The Beans/Chili Button, And Adjust The Mode To Normal For Soft, Tender Beans, Or More For Very Soft, Almost Mushy Beans. Alternately, Press Manual, Then High Pressure And Set Timer For 30 Minutes For Soft Beans, Or 35 Minutes For Very Soft Beans. When Timer Goes Off, Let Pressure Release Naturally For At Least 25 Minutes. Carefully Turn Vent Valve To Open, Let Remaining Pressure Release And Remove Lid.
6. Add The 2 Tablespoons Of Vinegar (This Step Will Brighten The Overall Flavor And I Highly Recommend Not Skipping This Step). Season With Salt & Pepper To Taste.Beans Will Soak Up The Remaining Liquids As They Cool. Remove Bay Leaves Before Serving.
7. Slow Cooker :
8. *No Need To Soak The Beans.
9. Add All The Ingredients For The Cuban Black Beans, Except Thevinegar, To The Bowl Of Theinstant Potand Give A Good Stir. Place Lid On Top, Cook On High For 6 To 8 Hours. Will Be Ready When Beans Are Soft And Tender Throughout.
10. Add The 2 Tablespoons Of Vinegar (This Step Will Brighten The Overall Flavor And I Highly Recommend Not Skipping This Step). Season With Salt & Pepper To Taste. Beans Will Soak Up The Remaining Liquids As They Cool. Remove Bay Leaves Before Serving.
11. Stovetop :
12. *Soak The Beans First. In A Large Pot, Use Enough Cool Water To Cover The Beansby About 2 Inches. Cover With A Lid And Let Soak Overnight, Or At Least 8 Hours.
13. In A Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat 1 Tablespoon Oil Or 1/4 Cup Water (For Water Saute) Over Medium-High Heat. Add The Onion And Bell Peppers, Saute For About 5 Minutes. Next, Add In Garlic, Jalapeno, Cumin, Oregano And Olives, Cook For 1 Minute Stirring, Stirring Frequently.(If You Want To Skip This Stepas It’S Skipped In The Other S, By All Means All The Ingredients For The Cuban Black Beans, Except For The Vinegar And Cook As In The Next Step Below.)
14. Add In The Beans, Water/Broth, Bay Leaves, Cover And Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Medium-Low And Cook 50 – 60 Minutes. Beans Are Ready When They Are Soft And Tender Throughout.
15. Add The 2 Tablespoons Of Vinegar (This Step Will Brighten The Overall Flavor And I Highly Recommend Not Skipping This Step). Season With Salt & Pepper To Taste. Beans Will Soak Up The Remaining Liquids As They Cool. Remove Bay Leaves Before Serving.
16. Cook The Quinoa
17. In A Medium Pot, Place Quinoa, Garlic Powder, Salt And Water. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes.
18. Remove From Heat, Uncover And Let Rest For 10 Minutes. Fluff With Fork, Set Aside.
19. Alternatively, You Can Cook The Quinoa First Using This Instant Pot Quinoa Recipe.
20. Serve
21. Serve The Beans Alongside The Quinoa, And Top With Mango Salsa. Add A Squeeze Of Lime Over Top And Add Some Sliced/Diced Avocado If You Have One Hand.
22. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: RAW FRUIT TARTS
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Kiwi Peeled And Chopped
2. 14 Cup Strawberries Chopped
3. 14 Cup Blueberries
4. 14 Mango Chopped
5. Cashew Sweet Cream
6. Crust
7. 1 Cup Almonds Or Walnuts Or Combo I Used Almonds
8. 5 Medjool Dates
9. Dash Or Two Of Cinnamon
10. 2 Tablespoons Water Divided
preparation:
1. Cashew Sweet Cream: Make Your Cashew Sweet Cream, You Can Use Right Away Or Keep In The Fridge For A Few Hours To Thicken. Cashew Cream Can Also Be Made A Day Or Two Ahead.
2. Crust: Make Your Crust By Combining All The Ingredients, Except Water, Into A Food Processor/Blender And Blend Until Combined, And Somewhat Chunky. Add One Tablespoon Of Water, And Process Until Dough Forms. Add The Extra Tablespoon Of Water If Needed (You May Find In Your Climate Or Altitude That You May Not Need It). We Don’T Want The Dough Too Wet, Just Enough So That It Combines Nicely. Cover And Place In The Refrigerator For 20 Min To Stiffen.
3. Prep Fruit: While Dough Is Setting, Prepare Your Fruits And Set Aside.
4. Assemble: Using Molds Of Choice, Line Each With A Piece Of Saran Wrap Or Cut Parchment Paper (This Will Help To Remove Them So Be Sure To Leave Overhanging Flaps). Fill Each Pan With A Layer Of Dough, About 1/4 Inch Thick, By Pressing Firmly, Yet Gently Into Place. Fill Each Tartlet With Cashew Cream, Almost To The Rim, And Level Out, Top With 1/3 Cup Of Fruit.
5. Remove: To Remove Tart From Mold, Gently Lift The Edges Of Saran Wrap Or Parchment Paper, Place On A Flat Surface, And Using A Spatula Carefully Wedge Under The Tart And Move To Desired Flat Surface.
6. Make Ahead: You Can Prepare These A Couple Of Hours Ahead, Cover Them With Saran Wrap And Store In The Refrigerator Until Ready To Eat. Makes 3 Three-Inch Fruit Tarts Using The Mini Cake Molds. Each Fruit Tart Is About 2 Servings.

title: SUPER SPINACH SALAD + CARROT MISO GINGER DRESSING
ingredients:
1. Salad
2. 6  8 Oz Baby Spinach
3. 34 Cup Cooked Quinoa
4. 34 Cup Shredded Carrots
5. 34 Cup Edamame
6. 34 Cup Chickpeas
7. 13 Cup Dried Cranberries
8. 14 Cup Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds
9. 8 Oz Grapecherry Tomatoes
10. Carrot Miso Ginger Dressing
11. 14 Cup Neutral Oil Grapeseed Peanut Or Light Flavored Olive Oil
12. 3 Tablespoons Mellow Or Sweet Miso Yellow Or White
13. 1 Tablespoon Darktoasted Sesame Oil
14. 2 Tablespoons Rice Wine Vinegar
15. 2 Teaspoons Pure Maple Syrup
16. 2 Large Carrots Roughly Chopped Or 1 Cup Grated
17. 1 Inch Piece Ginger Peeled And Minced
18. Water As Needed To Thin
preparation:
1. Dressing: Place Ingredients Into A Food Processor/Personal Blender And Pulse A Few Times To Mince Carrots. Scrap Down The Sides. Blend Again Until Smooth, Stopping To Scrap Down The Sides As Needed. Taste For Flavor Adding Anything Extra You Like. For More Zestiness, Add More Vinegar. To Thin, Add Water Instead Of Extra Oil, A Couple Tablespoons Should Do The Trick. To Thicken, Add More Carrots Or Miso Paste.
2. Serve: Place A Large Handful Of Spinach In Your Serving Bowl, Top With Quinoa, Carrots, Edamame, Chickpeas, Cranberries, Pepitas And Tomatoes. Add The Dressing Over Top. Either Enjoy As Is Or Give The Salad A Good Toss.
3. Store Any Leftover Dressing In An Air Tight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. Dressing Can Be Made Ahead Of Time.

title: GARLICKY MUSHROOM + KALE WITH LINGUINE
ingredients:
1. 12 Oz Linguine Or Your Favorite Pasta
2. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth For Water Saute
3. 1 Large Shallot Or 12 Medium Onion Chopped
4. 6  7 Large Garlic Cloves Chopped
5. 2 Lbs 32 Oz Sliced Mushrooms Button Crimini Shitake Porcini Etc
6. 5 Oz Package Baby Kale Or 1 Bunch Lacinato Kale Julienned
7. 12 Heaping Teaspoon Thyme Herbes De Provence Rosemary Or Italian Blend
8. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Optional
9. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
10. 1 12 Cups Vegetable Or Miso Broth
11. Lemon Wedges To Serve Optional
preparation:
1. Pasta: In A Large Pot Cook Pasta According To Package, Drain In Colander And Set Side.
2. Saute Veggies: In Same Pot, Heat Olive Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Cook 4 Minutes, Add Garlic, Mushrooms And Herbs, Optional Red Pepper Flakes, Salt And Pepper, Cook Over Medium Heat Until Mushrooms Start To Release Moisture, About 4 – 5 Minutes. Add Kale And Continue To Cook Until Wilted (Lacinato Will Take Longer To Wilt Than Baby Kale).
3. Combine: Add The Pasta To The Mushroom Mix, Add Broth, Mix Well And Continue To Cook Until Broth Is Just Warmed.
4. Serve: Serve In Individual Bowls With Some Of The Juices, Top With Fresh Cracked Pepper And A Squeeze Of Lemon For Brightness.
5. Notes:
6. Add A Few Chopped Sun-Dried Tomatoes For Another Layer Of Flavor. It’S Delicious!
7. Use Spinach In Place Of Kale If You Like.
8. Add Extra Protein To This Recipe By Adding A Can Of Cannellini Or Great Northern Beans, Drained And Rinsed, To The Pot After Adding The Broth.
9. Use Any Noodles You Prefer, Penne, Farfalle, Soba, Udon, Ramen, Fettucine, Etc. Use Rice Or Quinoa Pasta To Make This Gluten Free.

title: BROILED GRAPEFRUIT
ingredients:
1. 2 Grapefruit Red Or Yellow
2. 2 Tablespoons Sugar Coconut Brown Raw Or Pure Cane Divided
3. 2 Tablespoons Coconut Oil Vegan Butter Or Pure Maple Syrup Divided
4. 1 Teaspoon Ground Ginger Or Finely Grated Ginger Divided
5. Salt To Taste
6. Optional Toppers
7. Shredded Unsweetened Coconut Add After The First Two Or Three Minutes
8. Dash Of Cinnamon
preparation:
1. Preheat Broiler. You Can Alternately Use A Toaster Oven For This Using A High Temp.
2. Prep Grapefruit: Slice Grapefruits In Half. You May Have To Slice A Tad Bit Off The Bottom If Your Grapefruits Don’T Stand Straight. Use A Grapefruit Knife Or A Serrated Paring Knife And Cut Each Segment So The Pink Flesh Is Cut Away From The Membrane. Next, Gently Par Around The Whole Outside Area Of Flesh Cutting Away From The Rind. It Will Make Your Grapefruit Eating A Little Easier And Less Messy.
3. Assemble: Place Each Half, Cut Side Up, On A Rimmed Cookie Sheet Or Baking Dish. Top Each Half With 1 Teaspoon Or So Of Coconut Oil, 1 Teaspoon Or So Of Sugar, And A Generous Pinch Of Ginger. Use Your Fingers To Blend And Spread The Ginger On The Grapefruit Halves.
4. Broil: Place Under The Broiler And Cook Anywhere From 4 – 7 Minutes. I Find It Best To Set Your Timer For 2 Minutes, Check Grapefruit, If Sugar Is Not Caramelized Or There Is No Excessive Charring Of The Grapefruit Rind (White Part), Add Another Minute And Repeat The Process Until Sugar Is Caramelized And Rind Is Gently Colored But Not Overly Burnt All Around. If Using Shredded Coconut, Sprinkle On Top Of The Grapefruit Halves After The First 2 Minutes. Once Done, Sprinkle With Salt.
5. Serve: Enjoy Right Away Or Let Cool And Serve At Room Temp.

title: VEGAN RANCH DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Raw Cashews Pref Soaked See Notes
2. 12 Cup Water  More As Needed To Thin
3. 2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice About 1 Lemon
4. 12 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
5. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
6. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. 34 Teaspoon Dried Dill Or 2 Tablespoons Fresh Finely Chopped
8. 34 Teaspoon Dried Parsley Or 2 Tablespoons Fresh Finely Chopped
9. Generous Pinch Of Paprika
10. Plenty Of Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. Add The Cashews, Water, Onion & Garlic Powder, Lemon And Apple Cider Vinegar To A High Speed Blender, Blend Until Creamy Smooth. Add The Dill, Parsley, Paprika, Salt And Pepper, And Mix By Hand.
2. For A Thinner Dressing, Add 1 – 2 Tablespoons Of Water At A Time Until Desired Consistency.
3. Use Right Away Or Let Set In The Refrigerator To Chill.
4. Makes About 1 Cup.
5. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container, In The Refrigerator, For Up To 6 Days.

title: ROASTED GARLIC MISO SOUP WITH GREENS
ingredients:
1. 2 Heads Of Garlic
2. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
3. 6 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
4. 3 To 4 Tablespoons White Miso To Taste
5. 4 Cups Kale Chopped
6. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Garnish
7. Squeeze Of Lemon Optional
8. Sliced Green Onions Optional
9. Himalayan Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees
2. Roast Garlic: Remove Most Outer Layer Of Skin From Bulbs Of Garlic, Leaving The Most Inner Layer So They Will Stay Together. Cut Off The Tops Of The Garlic Bulbs. Place Bulbs Cut Side Up On A Piece Of Tin Foil Large Enough To Fold Over And Close Tight At The Top When Done. Drizzle 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Over Each Bulb. Close The Tin Foil By Folding Up The Edges And Squeezing Them Together At The Top And Fold Over, Or Bring Up The Sides And Fold Over While Pinching And Folding The Ends. Bake For 45 – 50 Minutes. Let Cool For 10 Minutes.
3. Miso Soup: In A Large Pot, Squeeze Garlic Bulbs Into The Pan And Mush It A Bit With The Back Of A Wooden Spoon. Add Liquids, Turn Heat To Medium-Low. Add Your Miso And Stir To Incorporate The Paste. Add In Greens And Let Wilt Until Deep Dark Green, About 5 – 10 Minutes.
4. Serve With A Slice Of Lemon, Scallions And Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes.

title: RAW CREAMY MISO SOUP WITH MUSHROOMS
ingredients:
1. Soup Base
2. 6 Cups Water
3. 14 Cup Organic Miso Yellow Or White
4. 12 Cup Hemp Hearts Or Pine Nuts
5. 12 Cup Raw Cashews Pref Soaked See Notes
6. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
7. 1 Tablespoon Dulse Flakes Or Crushed Dried Wakame Optional
8. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. Mushroom Mixture
10. 1 Cup Shiitakes Sliced I Used Dried But Fresh Is Best
11. 12 Cup Baby Bella Mushrooms Or Mushrooms Of Choice Sliced
12. 2 Tablespoons Sesame Oil Or Vegetable Brothwater
13. 2 Tablespoons Tamari Soy Sauce Nama Shoyu Or Coconut Aminos I Used Tamari
14. Juice Of 1  2 Medium Lemons Or 2  3 Small Limes
15. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Adjust To Your Liking
16. Optional Garnish
17. 14 Cup Wakame Rehydrated And Drained Chopped
18. Scallions Sliced
19. Shallots Finely Diced
preparation:
1. Mushrooms: Start With The Mushroom Mixture By Combining The Mushrooms With Olive Oil Or Broth, Tamari, Lemon/Lime Juice And Red Pepper Flakes. Allow To Marinate For At Least 30 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
2. Soup Base: In Your Blender, Place The Water, Miso, Hemp Hearts, Cashews, And Maple Syrup/Agave, Blend Until Smooth. Taste For Flavor, Adding Salt & Pepper As Needed. It Will Have Some Froth On Top, You Can Either Leave It Or Scoop It Off. I Scooped Most Of It Off. Add Wakame/Dulse, Let Them Absorb The Soup.
3. Combine: Once Mushrooms Are Ready, Add The Mushroom Mix To The Blended Soup, Give A Good Stir.
4. Serve As Is Or Garnish With Scallions Or Shallots If You Like. Also, Feel Free To Warm Slightly Before Serving, Place Soup In Medium/Large Pot Over Medium Heat, Heat Until Just Warm.

title: A VERY GOOD SPLIT PEA SOUP (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Green Split Peas About 2 14 Cups Rinsed And Odd Peas Removed
2. 3 Large Carrots Chopped
3. 2 Celery Sticks Some Leaves Ok Chopped
4. 1 Onion Chopped
5. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
6. 14 Head Of Cabbage About 2 Cups Finely Shredded
7. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Herbes De Provence Or 1 Teaspoon Thyme And Oregano
8. 2 Bay Leaves
9. 1 Teaspoon Vegan Worcestershire Sauce Optional
10. 4  6 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water See Notes
11. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
12. 4 Tablespoons Fresh Parsley Roughly Chopped Or 2  3 Teaspoons Dried
preparation:
1. This Soup Can Be Prepared 3 Different Ways:
2. Slow Cooker:
3. Place Ingredients Into The Bottom Of Your Crock Pot, Starting With The Split Peas And Finishing With The Broth. Heat On Low For 7 – 8 Hours Or High For 4 – 5 Hours. Add Parsley 30 Minutes Before Done. Let Soup Cool Slightly And Remove Bay Leaves.
4. Using An Immersion Blender, Carefully, As To Not Burn Yourself, Puree Soup Until Desired Consistency. You Can Also Puree Using A Food/Processor Or Blender, May Take Two Batches. Taste For Seasoning, Adding Salt And Pepper As Needed. Soup Will Thicken Upon Standing.
5. Stovetop:
6. In A Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 1/4 Cup Water Over Medium-High Heat, Add The Onion And Saute For 5 Minutes. Add Carrots, Celery, Garlic, Cabbage And Herbs, And Saute, Stirring Frequently, For 3 -4 Minutes. Add The Split Peas, Bay Leaves, Worcestershire Sauce And Vegetable Broth.
7. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Medium-Low And Simmer For 2 Hours, Stirring Occasionally. Stir In Parsley 30 Minutes Before Removing From Heat. Let Soup Cool Slightly And Remove Bay Leaves.
8. Using An Immersion Blender, Carefully, As To Not Burn Yourself, Puree Soup Until Desired Consistency. You Can Also Puree Using A Food/Processor Or Blender, May Take Two Batches. Taste For Seasoning, Adding Salt And Pepper As Needed. Soup Will Thicken Upon Standing.
9. Instant Pot:
10. Set Instant Pot To Saute And Add The 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 1/4 Cup Water, Onion, Carrot, Celery, And Garlic, Saute For 4 – 5 Minutes (Feel Free To Skip This Step Entirely).
11. Add Split Peas, Cabbage, Herbs De Provence, Bay Leaves, And At Least 5 Cups Of Broth, And Stir To Combine.
12. Attach Lid And Turn To Lock, Set The Valve To Sealing, And Manually Set To High Pressure For 15 Minutes. Let Natural Release For 10 Minutes. Remove Bay Leaves, Season To Taste With Salt And Pepper. Stir In The Parsley.
13. Using An Immersion Blender, Puree The Soup To Desired Consistency. Alternatively, Puree Using A Food Processor Or Blender (May Take 2 – 3 Bathes).
14. Serve: Pair With Your Favorite Artisan Bread, Or Top With Crispy Roasted Chickpeasor Coconut Bacon.
15. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. Store In Mason Jars Or To-Go Containers For Easy Grab-N-Go Lunches. Freezes Well For Up To 2 Months, Just Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: KIMCHI TOFU SCRAMBLE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil Optional
2. 1 Block 14  16 Oz Organic Tofu Firm Or Extrafirm
3. 1  2 Tablespoons Tamari
4. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 4  5 Large Leaves Of Kale Center Stem Removed And Julienned
6. 3 Scallions Sliced Divided
7. 1  2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
8. 1 Cup Kimchi
9. To Serve Optional
10. Cilantro Sprigs
11. Sesame Seeds Toasted Black Or White
12. Lime Wedges
13. 6 Corn Or Flour Tortillas
preparation:
1. Open And Drain Tofu. No Need To Press The Tofu.
2. In A Large Wok Or Skillet, Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat. Add Tofu, Crumbling Between Your Fingers, Cook, Stirring Occasionally, For About 2 -3 Minutes.
3. Turn Heat To Medium, Carefully Add Tamari And Garlic Powder, Give A Good Stir. Add Kale And 2/3 – 3/4 Of The Scallions, Cook, Stirring Occasionally Until Kale Becomes Soft And Wilts, Cover Partially To Help With The Process, About 5 – 7 Minutes.
4. Lastly, Add The Nutritional Yeast And Kimchi, Mix And Cook Just Until Kimchi Has Warmed Through, About 1 Minute Or So. We Don’T Want To Overcook The Kimchi Or It Will Destroy Some Of The Health Benefits Of The Probiotics.
5. If Making Optional Tacos, Heat The Tortillas. I Like To Heat Mine Carefully Over A Gas Burner Until Lightly Charred In Spots. Use Your Preferred . Layer Tortillas With The Scramble Mixture, Add A Few Sprigs Of Cilantro, Some Of The Reserved Scallions, A Sprinkle Of Sesame Seeds And A Squeeze Of Lime.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: SPICY KALE PESTO + ZUCCHINI NOODLES
ingredients:
1. 3 Large Zucchini 1 Per Person Give Or Take Spiralized Or Julienned
2. Grape Tomatoes Sliced In Half
3. Almond Parmesan For Topping
4. Salt  Cracked Pepper
5. Pesto
6. 1 Bunch Kale About 4 Cups Or 10 Mediucupsarge Leaves Stems Removed And Roughly Chopped
7. 12 Cup Almonds
8. 3  4 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil More As Needed
9. 2 Cloves Garlic
10. 1  2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
11. Himalayan Salt To Taste
12. Generous Pinch Red Pepper Flakes
13. Juice Of 1 Small Lemon
preparation:
1. Pesto: Place Ingredients In Food Processor And Blend Until Desired Consistency. Add More Olive Oil (Or Water) If Desired And Taste For Seasoning, Set Aside.
2. Zucchini Noodles: I Use A Spiralizer To Get My Curly Noodle Effect. You Can Also Use A Julienne Tool Or Julienne Them By Hand Creating A Straight Noodle.
3. To Serve: Combine The Kale, Tomatoes And Noodles Together In A Medium Size Bowl And Transfer To Individual Serving Dishes. Top With A Dusting Of Almond Parmesan And Enjoy!
4. Store: Leftovers Kale Pesto Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days. If Storing Noodles And Pesto Together, Best Eaten Within 2 – 3 Days.

title: WALNUT MEAT (4 WAYS)
ingredients:
1. Walnut Meat Base
2. 1 Cup Walnuts
3. 1 Cup Mushrooms Sliced
4. 1 Tablespoon Tamri Nama Shoyu Or Soy Sauce
5. Salt  Pepper To Taste
6. Mexican
7. 1 Tablespoon Cumin
8. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
9. 14 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Or Cayenne
10. Italian
11. 2 Teaspoons Italian Seasoning
12. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
13. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder Or Garlic Powder
14. Indian
15. 2 Teaspoons Coriander
16. 12 Teaspoon Paprika
17. 12 Teaspoon Cumin Or Garam Masala
18. 14 Teaspoon Cayenne
19. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder Or Onion Powder
20. American
21. 34  1 Teaspoon Each Garlic And Onion Powder
22. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Pulse To Combine: Simply Add The Walnuts, Mushrooms, Tamari And Spices To The Bowl Of A Food Processor. Pulse A Few Times Until Just Combined And Crumbly. Careful Not To Over Process Or It Will Turn Smooth Like Pate.
2. Taste For Seasoning, Adding More Of Any Spice You Like.
3. Warm It Up: Optionally, Heat On The Stove Over Low Heat, Stirring Frequently Until Warmed Through. Alternatively, Heat In The Microwave Using 15 Second Intervals, Stirring Between Each, Until Warm. Just Don’T Overcook.
4. Makes About 1 1/2 Cups.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days.

title: TEXAS CAVIAR (COWBOY CAVIAR)
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15Oz Black Eyed Peas Drained And Rinsed
2. 1 Can 15Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
3. 1 Can 14Oz Corn Drained
4. 2 Red Bell Peppers Finely Diced
5. 1 Jalapeno Finely Diced A Few Seeds Are Ok
6. 12 Red Onion Finely Diced
7. 1 Large Or 2 Small Avocados Diced
8. 14 Cup Chopped Cilantro
9. 2 Limes Juice Of
10. 3  4 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
11. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
12. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder
13. 12 Teaspoon Cumin
14. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
15. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Apple Cider Vinegar, Lime Juice, Olive Oil, Chili Powder, Cumin, Garlic Powder, Ad Generous Pinch Of Salt. Set Aside. (You Can Also Just Pour The Ingredients Over The Assembled Salad Before Tossing, As Mentioned In The Post, But Mixing Will Help Dissolve The Spices.)
2. Prep: Drain And Rinse The Black Eyes Peas And Black Beans. Drain The Canned Corn, Or If Using Fresh Corn Cut It Off The Cobb. Dice The Red Peppers, Jalapeno, And Onion. Chop The Cilantro.
3. Avocado: The Easiest And Quickest Way To Dice An Avocado For This Recipe, Is To Slice It In Half, Remove The Seed, Using A Knife, Score The Flesh In To Segments, Using A Cross-Hatch Pattern, Being Careful To Not Break Through The Skin. Scoop It Out Using A Large Spoon, Getting As Close To The Skin As Possible, In One Swoop.
4. Assemble: In A Large Bowl, Add The Beans, Corn, Bell Pepper, Jalapeno, Onion, Avocado And Cilantro. Pour The Dressing Overtop And Toss Well To Coat. Taste For Flavor.
5. Eat Right Away, Or Let The Salad Rest In The Refrigerator For A Few Hours To Let The Flavors Mingle.
6. Leftovers Will Stay Fresh For Up To 4 – 5 Days In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator. I Don’T Recommend Freezing This Salad/Salad If Adding Avocado, If Planning On Freezing, Omit The Avocado And Add It When Serving. Freeze For Up To 2 Months.
7. Makes About 2 Quarts.

title: CRUNCHY ROMAINE SALAD + ALMOND-LIME DRESSING
ingredients:
1. Salad
2. 1 Cup Cucumber Andor Zucchini Sliced
3. 1 Cup Carrot Thinly Sliced
4. 1 Small Red  Yellow Bell Pepper Sliced
5. 1  2 Scallions Thinly Sliced
6. 2 Heads Romaine Or Leafy Greens Of Choice
7. Sprinkle Of Almond Slices Or Pepitas Optional
8. Lime Dressing
9. 4 Tablespoons Almond Butter
10. 2  4 Tablespoons Water
11. 1 12 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
12. 1 Teaspoon Tamari
13. Juice From 1 Lime
14. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Optional
preparation:
1. Almond Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Ingredients Until Creamy. Let Rest A Few Minutes So The Flavors Can Mingle. Taste For Flavor….More Tamari? More Sweetener?
2. Prep Veggies: Next, Prepare Your Vegetables Any Way You Like, Using As Much As You Like. Taste Dressing Once More To Make Sure It’S To Your Liking.
3. Assemble Romaine Salad: In Individual Bowls, Add The Romaine And Top With Veggies However You Like. Drizzle With 1/2 Of The Dressing Overtop And Enjoy.
4. Store: Leftovers Will Keep In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: EASY THREE BEAN CHILI RECIPE (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Large Onion Diced
3. 3 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 12 Tsp Garlic Powder
4. 2 Jalapenos Seeds Removed And Diced A Few Seeds Ok For Extra Heat
5. 3 Tablespoons Chili Powder
6. 1 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder
7. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. 1 Can 15 Oz Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
9. 1 Can 15 Oz Pinto Beans Drained And Rinsed
10. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
11. 1 Tablespoon Cocoa Powder Or Small Piece Of Dark Chocolate About 12 Oz Optional
12. 1 12 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth  More If Needed
13. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
14. To Garnish
15. Green Onions Sliced
16. Cashew Sour Cream
17. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Saute: In Large Pot Heat Olive Oil Over Medium Heat, Saute Onion For 7 Minutes, Or Until Tender And Translucent. Add The Garlic, Jalapeno, Chili And Chipotle Powder, Cook For 1 Minute, Or Until Fragrant.
2. Simmer: Add The Beans, Tomatoes, Chocolate, And Liquids, Bring To Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover Askew, And Simmer For 15 – 20 Minutes Or So, Stirring Occasionally. Add More Water As Needed. Taste For Flavor, Season With Salt And Pepper, And Add Anything Else You Feel It Needs.
3. Serve With The Sliced Green Onions, Cashew Sour Cream And Vegan Sweet Chia Cornbreador Jalapeno Cornbread Muffins.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept, Covered, In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6 Days. To Keep Longer, Freeze In Freezer Safe Containers For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Sonoma Chickpea ‘Chicken’ Salad
ingredients:
1. 2 Cans 14 Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Or 3 Cups Cooked
2. 1 12 Cups Of Seedless Grapes Sliced In Half
3. 12 Heaping Cup Celery Ribs Diced
4. 12  23 Cup Pecans Roughly Chopped
5. Creamy Poppy Seed Dressing
6. 4 Tablespoons Tahini 14 Cup Or Vegan Mayo
7. 2 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
8. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
9. 2 Teaspoons Dijon
10. 2 Teaspoons Poppy Seeds
11. Dash Or Two Of Garlic  Onion Powder
12. Pinch Of Salt  Pepper
13. To Serve Optional
14. Salad Greens Of Choice
15. Slices Of Your Favorite Bread
16. Chopped Chives To Garnish Not Shown
preparation:
1. Dressing: Place Ingredients In A Small Bowl And Mix To Combine. Add A Tablespoon Or Two Of Water As Needed To Thin. Set Aside.
2. Un-Mashed Salad: Add Chickpeas, Grapes, Pecans, And Celery To A Medium-Sized Mixing/Serving Bowl. Top With Dressing And Mix To Coat. Season With Mineral Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste.
3. Mashed Salad (Perfect For Sandwiches): Add Chickpeas To A Medium-Sized Mixing Bowl, Roughly Mash 2/3 – 3/4 Of The Chickpeas Using The Back Of A Fork Or Spoon. Add In The Grapes, Pecans, And Celery, Top With Dressing And Mix To Combine. Season With Mineral Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste.
4. Serve Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
5. Make Sandwiches, Wraps, Or Simply Serve With Leafy Greens.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: GREEK PASTA SALAD (EASY + HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Small Pasta Macaroni Elbow Rotini Penne
2. 10 Oz Jar Kalamata Olives Pitted Use Whole Or Sliced
3. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
4. 12 Red Onion Diced
5. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
6. 1 Cucumber Regular Or English Diced
7. 10 Oz Grape Tomatoes Sliced In Half
8. 14 Cup Fresh Parsley Chopped
9. 1 Tablespoon Fresh Oregano Chopped
10. 2 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil Lemon Infused Pref Optional
11. 2 Lemons
12. Salt  Pepper
13. Vegan Feta I Used Violife Crumbled Or Cubed Optional
preparation:
1. Pasta: Cook The Pasta, Al Dente, According To Package Directions. Once Cooked, Rinse Well Under Cool Running Water To Keep The Pasta From Overcooking.
2. Assemble: In The Pot The Pasta Was Cooked In (Or A Large Serving Dish), Add The Pasta, Olives, Chickpeas, Onion, Red Bell Pepper, Cucumber, Tomatoes, Parsley, Oregano, Salt, Pepper, And Squeeze Of Lemon And Drizzle Of Oil, Toss Well To Combine. Add Vegan Feta, Toss Again Or Leave As Is. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Salt, Pepper, Lemon Or Herbs.
3. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: PERSIMMON & GRAPE BAKED OATMEAL
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Old Fashioned Oats
2. 1 12 Teaspoons Cinnamon
3. 12 Teaspoon Cardamom
4. Pinch Mineral Salt
5. 2 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
6. 13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
7. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
8. 1 Fuyu Persimmon Peeled And Diced
9. 1 Cup Red Grapes Use Your Favorite Color Grapes
10. 12 Cup Chopped Pecans Or Walnuts Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F.
2. Mix: In A Medium Sized Or 8×8 Baking Dish, Combine The Oatmeal, Cinnamon, Cardamom And Salt. Add In Milk, Syrup And Vanilla, Mix Well. Add In Persimmon, Grapes And Nuts, Mix Again.
3. Bake: Place Baking Dish On Center Rack In The Oven And Bake For 35 – 40 Minutes.
4. Serve: Scoop Warm Baked Oatmeal Into Individual Bowls And Top With A Splash Or Two Of Non-Dairy Milk. If You Didn’T Bake With The Nuts In You May Like To Add A Few Over Top Before Eating.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator In A Covered Container For Up To 4 – 5 Days.

title: CRANBERRY PISTACHIO OATMEAL ENERGY BITES
ingredients:
1. Date Paste
2. 1 Cup Medjool Dates Pitted And Chopped About 11  12 Dates
3. 14 Cup Water Or Pure Maple Syrup
4. 1 Tablespoon Chia Seeds Hemp Hearts Or Flaxseed Meal
5. 12 Teaspoon Cardamom Or Cinnamon Optional
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
7. Foldins
8. 1 12 Cups Rolled Oats
9. 1 Cup Unsalted Pistachios Lightly Salted Ok Too
10. 1 Cup Cranberries Dried Or Fresh Chopped
11. 14 Cup Semisweet Chocolate Chips Cacao Nibs Or A Dark Chocolate Bar Chopped Into Small Pieces
preparation:
1. Paste: Place Dates, Water (Or Maple Syrup), Seeds Of Choice, Optional Spice And Salt Into The Bowl Of A Food Processor Or High Speed Blender. Process Until It Becomes A Paste Like Consistency, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed To Push The Ingredients Down.
2. Mix: In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Combine The Oats, Pistachios, Cranberries And Chocolate Chips, Add In The Date Paste And Mix Well.
3. Roll: Using A Tablespoon Measuring Spoon, Scoop Up Rounded Tablespoons And Roll Into Bite Size Balls. This Mixture Is Somewhat Loose And Will Need To Be Packed Well Into Ball Shapes. It Helps To Rinse Your Hands After Every Few Balls, Leaving A Little Moisture On Your Hands, To Remove Any Excess Date Paste (Otherwise It Gets To Be Messy And The Balls Don’T Roll As Well).
4. Makes About 16 – 18
5. Store:Keep In The Refrigerator In An Airtight Container For Up To 1 Week. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Eating.

title: CREAMY DILL POTATO SALAD (HEALTHY + VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 2 12 Lbs Potatoes Red Or Gold
2. 1 Can 14 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed Optional
3. 12 Cup Celery Some Leaves Ok Diced
4. 34 Cup Red Onion Finely Diced
5. 14  13 Cup Fresh Dill Chopped
6. Dressing
7. 4 Heaping Tablespoons Tahini  5 Tablespoons Water Or 12 Heaping Cup Vegan Mayo
8. 2 Tablespoons Dijon Or Whole Grain Mustard Or To Taste
9. 1 Juicy Lemon Juice Of
10. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Potatoes: Place Potatoes In A Large Pot With A Hefty Pinch Of Salt And Fill With Water, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To A Gentle Boil And Cook About 13 – 15 Minutes, Until Potatoes Are Just Fork Tender. Drain Potatoes And Let Cool. Once Cooled, Gently Peel The Skin Away (Or Leave It On If You Prefer). Using Your Thumb And Index Finger, Pinch The Skin And You’Ll See It Move, Skin Should Come Off Easily. Cut The Potatoes Into 1/2 – 3/4 Inch Cubes.
2. Prep Veggies: While Potatoes Are Cooking And/Or Cooling, Prepare The Onion, Celery, Dill And Chickpeas.
3. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Tahini/Mayo, Mustard, Lemon Juice, Salt And Pepper. Mix Well. If Using Tahini, Add Water Slowly Until Desired Consistency. If Dressing Is Too Thick, Add A Tad More Water Or Lemon Juice. Alternately, If Dressing Is Too Thin, Add More Tahini Or Mayo.
4. Mix Together: In A Large Bowl (Or Pot You Cooked The Potatoes In) Place The Potatoes, Chickpeas, Celery, Onion And Dill. Pour The Dressing Over Top And Mix To Combine. Season With Mineral Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper.
5. Serve As A Light Meal Or Side.
6. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: HEALTHY FLAX & EVO BALSAMIC VINAIGRETTE
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Flaxseed Oil Or Hemp Seed Oil
2. 14 Cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil
3. 14 Cup Balsamic Vinegar
4. 2 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup Optional
5. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Mustard Or Stoneground
6. 1 Clove Garlic Minced
7. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. In A Small/Medium Size Mason Jar, Or Other Container Of Choice, Combine The Balsamic Vinegar, Maple Syrup, Mustard, Garlic And Salt & Pepper, Mix Well To Emulsify The Mustard. Add In The Oil And Mix Well. Taste For Flavor.
2. Drizzle On Salads Or Vegetables…Anything You Like! Keep Refrigerated And Use Within A Week.
3. Makes 1 Cup, Serves 8
4. Notes:
5. You Can Also Make This Without The Flax Oil And It Will Last About A Month.
6. Always Store Flax Seed & Hemp Seed Oil In The Refrigerator.

title: FAVORITE VEGAN CORNBREAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Yellow Cornmeal Stoneground Pref
2. 1 Cup Flour Spelt Unbleached Allpurpose 1To1 Glutenfree Flour
3. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
4. 14 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
5. 13 Cup Organic Sugar Pure Cane Whitebrown Or Coconut
6. 1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
7. 13 Cup Light Flavored Olive Oil Or Your Favorite Neutral Oil
8. Juice Of 1 Small Lemon Or 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Lightly Grease An 8 Or 9-Inch Square Baking Pan.
2. Wet & Sugar: In A Medium Bowl (Or 2 Cup Measuring Cup), Mix Together The Milk, Lemon Juice, Sugar, And Oil, Mix Well. Set Aside, Stirring Occasionally, For 5 – 7 Minutes.
3. Dry: In A Large Bowl, Whisk Together The Cornmeal, Flour, Baking Powder, And Salt Together.
4. Mix: Pour The Wet Ingredients Into The Dry Ingredients And Whisk Until Combined. Avoid Over-Mixing.
5. Pour & Bake: Pour Batter Into Prepared Baking Dish. Place Baking Dish Into The Oven And Bake For 25 Minutes Or Until Golden Brown On Top And The Center Is Cooked Through. Use A Toothpick To Test For Doneness, Should Come Out Clean When Stuck In The Center. Once Done, Cool A Few Minutes Before Slicing And Serving.
6. Serve Cornbread With Vegan Butter, Homemade Chia Jam, On The Side With Chili, Soups, Or Stews.
7. Store: Wrap Leftovers Up Tightly And Store Them On The Counter For Up To 3 – 4 Days. To Keep Longer, Freeze Baked Cornbread For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Overnight In The Refrigerator And Heat Up In The Microwave Or Bake In A 300 Degrees F Oven For 10 Minutes.

title: MASHED CHICKPEA SALAD SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 12 Cup Celery Sliced
3. 12 Cup Carrots Diced
4. 14 Cup Scallions Sliced
5. 13 Cup Vegan Mayo 14  13 Cup Or So Hummus Or Tahini  2  3 Tablespoons Water See Notes
6. 1  2 Tablespoons Dijon Mustard Stoneground Ok Too
7. 14 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. Juice Of 1 Lemon Optional Adds Brightness
10. Small Handful Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds Optional
11. Paprika Regular Or Smoked Paprika To Garnish
12. To Serve
13. Bread Of Choice Or Tortillas
14. Leafy Lettuce
15. Mashed Avocado
preparation:
1. Mash Chickpeas: Place Chickpeas In A Medium Size Bowl And Roughly Mash About 3/4 Of The Garbanzo Beans With The Back Of A Sturdy Fork, Potato Masher Or Pastry Blender.
2. Assemble Salad: Add The Remaining Ingredients And Combine To Mix. Add More Vegan Mayo Or Hummus If You Like It Creamier. Taste For Seasoning.
3. Ways To Serve:
4. Sandwich: Using Bread, Layer The Bottom Half With Leafy Greens And The Top Half With Mashed Avocado. Spread The Chickpea Salad On The Bottom Half And Top With The Top Half. Slice In Half And Enjoy!
5. Wraps: Lay A Tortilla On Flat Surface, Add A Few Leafy Greens In The Center, Top With Chickpea Salad And Roll. Alternatively, Stuff Pita Bread With Salad And Leafy Greens.
6. Salad: Serve On A Bed Of Leafy Greens.
7. Dip: Scoop Up With Crackers Or Sliced Vegetables Like Cucumbers, Bell Peppers, Celery Sticks, Etc.
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In An Airtight Container In The Fridge For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: SKILLET CINNAMON APPLES (HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 4 Large Apples Peeled Cored And Sliced Into 14 Inch Slices
2. 1 Tablespoon Vegan Butter Or Coconut Oil Or 14 Water For Water Saute
3. 3 Tablespoons Sugar Pure Cane Coconut Brown Date Or Sugarfree Monk Fruit
4. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
6. 1 Teaspoon Cornstarch Or Arrowroot
7. 12 Cup Cold Water Or Apple Juicecider
8. Optional Addins
9. 14 Teaspoon Nutmeg
10. 14 Teaspoon Ground Ginger
preparation:
1. Saute: Heat Butter Or Oil, Over Medium Heat, Add Apple Slices And Saute For 6 Minutes.
2. Cornstarch Mix: Mix The Cold Water And Cornstarch, Set Aside.
3. Add Spices: To The Apples, Add The Sugar, Cinnamon, Vanilla And Water Mixture, And Stir To Combine. Continue Cooking At A Gentle Boil For 2 – 3 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Until Apples Are Fork Tender. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
4. Serve: Pair With Non-Dairy Ice Cream Or Serve Topped On Cinnamon Oatmeal, Waffles, French Toast Or Pancakes. Or Simply Enjoy As Is!
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In An Airtight Container For Up To 5 – 6 Days. You Can Also Freeze For Up To 2 Months.

title: SKILLET ASPARAGUS & TOMATO MEDLEY
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups About 10 Oz Cherry Tomatoes
2. 1 Bunch Asparagus About 10 Oz Ends Trimmed And Chopped In Thirds
3. 12 Red Onion Sliced
4. Whole Garlic Cloves As Many As You Like
5. 2  4 Small Lemons Quartered And Seeds Removed
6. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
7. Himalayan Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
8. 1 Teaspoon Thyme
9. 1 Can 15 Oz White Beans Drained And Rinsed Optional
10. Cooked Grain Of Choice  Quinoa Farro Barley Brown Jasmine Or Basmati Rice Optional
preparation:
1. Prep: Prep Your Veggies And Place In Medium Size Bowl Along With Salt, Pepper And Thyme. Drizzle With 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil And Mix To Coat.
2. Saute: Heat The Remaining Olive Oil In A Skillet Over Medium Heat. Add Vegetables And Cook For About 8 – 10 Minutes Stirring Occasionally. Done When Asparagus Is Just For Tender And Tomatoes Are Soft And Just About To Burst.
3. Add Optional Beans: A Few Minutes Before Removing From Heat, Add Beans And Let Warm Through.
4. Serve Warm On A Bed Of Grains Such As Quinoa, Farro, Rice Or Barley.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days In A Covered Container.

title: Cinnamon Applesauce Bread
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Light Spelt Flour Allpurpose And Whole Wheat Flour Ok Too
2. 12 Cup Old Fashioned Oats Optional
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. 2 Teaspoons Cinnamon
6. 12 Teaspoon Allspice
7. 14 Teaspoon Nutmeg
8. Pinch Of Salt
9. 1 12 Cups Unsweetened Applesauce
10. 12 Cup Maple Syrup
11. 14 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
12. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Lightly Grease A 9 X 5 Loaf Pan With Oil, Or Line With Parchment Paper.
2. Mix Dry Ingredients: In A Medium/Large Mixing Bowl, Combine The Flour, Oats, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, Cinnamon, Allspice, Nutmeg, And Salt.
3. Add Wet Ingredients: Add The Applesauce, Maple Syrup, And Milk To The Dry Ingredients And Mix Until Just Combined. Be Careful To Not Overmix.
4. Bake: Pour Batter Into Prepared Loaf Pan, Optionally Top With A Small Handful Of Whole Or Quick Oats, Place Pan In The Oven And Bake For 55 Minutes. Let Cool Before Slicing.
5. Makes 8 – 10 Slices
6. Store: Keep Leftovers Covered For 4 Days. To Keep Longer, Store In The Refrigerator For 2 Weeks Or In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months.

title: VEGAN GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE (HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. Crispy Onions
2. 1 Medium Yellow Onion Halved And Thinly Sliced
3. 14 Cup Flour Spelt Unbleached Allpurpose Or Oat
4. 2 Tablespoons Panko Bread Crumbs Or Fine Cornmeal Or Masa Flour
5. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt
6. Casserole
7. 1 Pound Fresh Green Beans Ends Trimmed And Cut In Half
8. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
9. 8  12 Ounces Mushrooms Trimmed And Sliced
10. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
11. Pinch Of Nutmeg Optional
12. 3 Tablespoons Flour Spelt Allpurpose Or Oat
13. 1 Cup Vegetable Broth
14. 1 Cup Unsweetened Cashew Milk Or Your Favorite Plant Milk
15. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 450 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Onions: Slice Onions As Uniform As Possible And Make Sure All The Pieces Are Separated. In A Large Mixing Bowl, Combine The Onions, Flour, Panko And Salt, Toss To Combine. Spread The Onions Evenly In A Single Layer On The Baking Sheet. Place The Baking Sheet Pan In The Oven On The Middle Rack, And Bake Until Golden Brown, Approx. 30 Minutes. Stir/Toss The Onions 2 To 3 Times During Cooking. After About 20 Minutes, Remove, And Set Aside, Any Onions That Are Cooking Too Fast. Once Done, Remove From The Oven And Set Aside. Turn The Oven Down To 400 Degrees F.
3. Green Beans: Fill A Large Pot 2/3 Full With Water And Add A Generous Pinch Of Salt. Bring The Water To A Boil, Add Beans And Blanch For 7 Minutes. Drain Beans Into A Colander And Immediately Plunge The Beans Into A Large Bowl Of Ice Water To Stop The Cooking. Drain And Set Aside.
4. Mushroom Sauce: In A Large Pan, Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Mushrooms And Cook, Stirring Occasionally, Until Mushrooms Begin To Sweat And Release Their Juices, Approx. 4 To 5 Minutes. Add The Garlic And Nutmeg, Continue To Cook For Another 1 To 2 Minutes. Sprinkle The Flour Over And Cook, Stirring Constantly, For 1 Minute. Add The Broth And Let Simmer For 1 Minute. Lower The Heat To Medium-Low And Add The Non-Dairy Milk. Cook Until Mixture Thickens, Stirring Occasionally, Approx. 6 To 8 Minutes. Taste For Seasoning, Add More Salt + Pepper To Taste. Remove From Heat.
5. Assemble & Bake: Add The Beans To The Mushroom Gravy And Give A Good Stir. Place Mixture In A Baking Dish And Top With The Baked Onions. Place In Oven, On The Center Rake, And Bake Until Bubbly, Approximately 15 Minutes. If Onions Start To Brown Too Much, Cover With Foil. Let Cool Slightly And Enjoy.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept For Up To 4 – 5 Days In The Refrigerator.

title: ROASTED CAULIFLOWER + CHICKPEA + GOLDEN BEET SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Small Head Cauliflower Cut Into Florets
2. 2  3 Golden Beets Diced
3. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Or 1 12 Cups Cooked
4. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
5. Small Handful Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
6. 1  2 Handfuls Baby Greens Kale Spinach Arugula Chard Etc Or Chopped Beet Greens
7. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley
8. 1 2 Tablespoon Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds
9. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
10. Sumacdressing
11. 2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
12. 1 Tablespoon Red Wine Vinegar
13. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Sumac  More As Desired
14. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line Baking Sheet With A Silpat, Parchment Paper Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Roasting:Place The Prepared Cauliflower On One Side Of The Baking Sheet And The Diced Beets On The Other. Sprinkle The Chickpeas Evenly Over Top Both The Cauliflower And Beets. Add A Small Drizzle Of Olive Oil Over Top, Gently Toss Each Vegetable With Your Fingers, Making Sure To Keep Them On Their Sides As Much As Possible. Sprinkle With A Little Garlic Salt (Or Mineral Salt And Dash Or Two Of Garlic Powder). Place Baking Sheet On The Middle Rack And Roast For 40 Minutes, Stirringhalf Way Through.
3. Dressing:In A Small Bowl, Combine The Lemon Juice, Vinegar, Sumac And Garlic. If Not Using Sumac, Add A Few Twists Of Fresh Cracked Pepperfor A Lemony-Pepper Dressing.
4. Mix Together:In A Large Serving Bowl, Add The Greens Of Choice, Roasted Vegetables And Chickpeas, Tomatoes, And Parsley. Top With The Dressing And Give A Good Stir. Add Salt & Pepper To Taste.
5. Serve:Serve In Individual Bowls With A Sprinkle Of Pepitas And Sliced Avocado.
6. Notes:
7. If Beets Are On The Larger Side, Use 2. If On The Smaller Side, Use 3.
8. Beet Greens Are Just As Delicious And Nutritious As Other Baby Greens. Chopping Them Up And Using Them In The Salad Is A Great Way To Use Them!
9. Add A Grain Like Quinoa To Make This A Healthy Grain Bowl!

title: ZUCCHINI ‘RICOTTA’ PASTA (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Small Pasta Bowties Penne Or Rigatoni
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water Or Broth
