7. 14 Small Red Onion Thinly Sliced
8. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Optional
9. 6  7 Large Basil Leaves Julienned
10. Almond Parmesan To Serve
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 450 Degrees F. Place Pizza Stone Or Large Baking Sheet Into The Oven While Oven Heats.
2. Prep The Dough: Let Dough Come To Room Temperature. Lightly Flour A Cutting Board Or Flat Workstation, Gently Stretch With Your Hands And Roll Out Into A 12 Inch Pizza Round. Be Patient With The Dough, It Will Want To Shrink Back (This Is Because Of The Gluten) But Keep Going You’Ll Get It To Stay In Place Soon Enough. Place Dough On A Good Size Piece Of Parchment Paper, This Is The Easiest Way To Transfer The Dough.
3. Par-Bake Dough: Once Oven Is Ready, Place Dough On Baking Sheet And Bake On The Center Rack For 7 – 10 Minutes.
4. Layer Pizza: Carefully Remove Pizza Dough From The Oven And Layer Starting With The Sauce, Then The Tomato Slices, Artichokes, Olives, Chickpeas And Finally The Red Onion. Give A Good Sprinkle Of Red Pepper Flakes And Mineral Salt.
5. Bake: Place Pizza Back In The Oven For An Additional 10 – 15 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes.
6. To Serve: Add Basil Or Arugula Over Top. Cut Into 4, 6 Or 8 Slices. Serve Warm With A Sprinkle Of Almond Parmesan.

title: MEXICAN HOT CHOCOLATE
ingredients:
1. 6 Cups Unsweetened Nondairy Milk Plain Or Vanilla
2. 6 Oz Semisweet Dark Chocolate Or Any Vegan Chocolate Or 6 Tablespoons Cocoa Powder
3. 13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Or Coconut Or Pure Cane Sugar
4. 2 Teaspoons Cinnamon Or 2 Cinnamon Sticks
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
6. 34 Teaspoon Ground Nutmeg
7. Pinch Of Cayenne
8. Optional Toppings
9. Light Dusting Of Cocoa Powder Or Dash Of Cinnamon
10. Dollop Of Coconut Whip Cream
11. Cacao Nibs Or Shaved Chocolate
12. Vegan Marshmallows
preparation:
1. Crock-Pot: Place Ingredients In Crock Pot, Cook On Low Temperature For 2 – 3 Hours, Stirring Every 20 Minutes Or So.
2. Stovetop: Place Ingredients In A Large Pot And Heat Over Medium-Low, Stirring Occasionally, Until Chocolate Is Completely Melted, About 10 Minutes. Turn Heat To Low And Cover, To Keep Warm Until Ready To Serve.
3. Serve: Ladle Into Mugs And Serve With A Light Dusting Of Cocoa Powder. Also Pairs Well With A Dollop Of Coconut Cream On Top.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 7 Days, In An Airtight Container. Reheat On The Stove Over Low Or In The Microwave For 30 – 60 Seconds, Or Until Warmed Through.
5. Notes:
6. Feel Free To Roughly Chop The Chocolate If You Like. I Added Mine In Large Chunks, But It Will Help To Melt Down Faster The Smaller The Pieces Are.
7. You Can Also Mix And Match Using Chocolate Pieces And Cocoa Powder. Use Half And Half (3 Oz. Chocolate Pieces And 3 Tablespoons Cocoa Powder. If Adjusting Differently, Use 1 Oz. Chocolate Pieces Or 1 Tablespoon Of Cocoa Powder Per Every 1 Cup Of Plant Milk Used.

title: CARROT GINGER ZUCCHINI SOUP
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Onion About 1 Cup Chopped
3. 2 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 1Inch Fresh Ginger Minced Or Grated
5. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
6. 1 Teaspoon Coriander
7. 12 Teaspoon Turmeric
8. 12 Teaspoon Paprika
9. 4  5 Medium Carrots About 2 Cups Diced
10. 2 Medium Zucchini About 2 12 Cups Chopped
11. 3 12 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water
12. 1 Can  15Oz Coconut Milk Light Or Full Fat
13. 12 Lemon Juice Of
14. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Saute: Heat Oil In A Large Pot On Medium Heat, Add Onion And Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Garlic, Ginger, Cumin, Coriander, Turmeric, And Paprika, Cook 1 Minute More, Or Until Fragrant. Add Carrots And Zucchini, Cook Another 7 Minutes Or So.
2. Simmer: Add The Vegetable Broth And Bring To Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low, And Simmer For 15 To 20 Minutes.
3. Add Remaining Ingredients: Turn Off Heat, Add Coconut Milk And Lemon Juice.
4. Puree: Using An Immersion Blender, Purée Vegetables Until Creamy. Alternatively, You Can Transfer The Soup To A Standing Blender To Puree, May Take Two Batches Depending On The Size Of Your Blender Cup.
5. Warm As Needed: Return To Low Heat And Warm Through If Needed.
6. Serve: Serve With Homemade Artisan Bread Or Crackers If You Wish. I Had Some Olive Oil & Sea Salt Pita Chips With Mine. Very Delicious!
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6 Days, In Covered Containers. It’S Also Freezer-Friendly For 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: QUINOA TABBOULEH
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Quinoa I Used Tricolor
2. 1 34 Cups Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 1 Bunch Parsley About 2 Cups Lightly Packed Stems Removed
5. 1 Small Bunch Mint About 1 Cup Lightly Packed Stems Removed
6. 1 Small English Cucumber Skin On Diced
7. 1 Small Red Onion Diced Or 3 Green Onions Thinly Sliced
8. 1 12 Cups Cherrygrape Tomatoes Halved Or Quartered Depending On Size
9. 14 Cup Hemp Hearts Shelled Hemp Seeds
10. Drizzle Of Good Extra Virgin Olive Oil
11. Juice Of 2 Large Lemons
12. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse Your Quinoa In A Fine Mesh Strainer To Remove Any Dust (Sometimes I Do This, Sometimes I Don’T). In A Medium Size Pot, Bring Water, Quinoa And Garlic Powder To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer On Low For 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Remove Cover And Let Set For 10 – 15 Minutes, Fluff With Fork.
2. Prep: In The Meantime, Finely Chop Your Parsley And Mint. Dice Your Cucumber, Tomato And Onion.
3. Assemble: Once Quinoa Is Ready, Add In The Parsley, Mint, Cucumber, Onion, Tomatoes, Hemp Hearts, Drizzle Of Olive Oil And The Juice Of Your Lemons, Salt & Pepper To Taste, Gently Mix Together.
4. Serve With A Few Whole Mint And/Or Parsley Leaves And Lemon Wedges.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: PINEAPPLE VEGGIE LOVER’S PIZZA (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. Prepared Pizza Crust Or Dough See Notes
2. Marinara Sauce Or Any Pizza Sauce Of Choice
3. 12 Cup Pineapple Diced
4. 1  2 Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced
5. Small Handful Mushrooms Sliced
6. 12 Bell Pepper I Used Orange
7. 4  5 Grape Tomatoes Quartered Or Halved
8. 12 Small Red Onion Diced
9. Red Pepper Flakes To Taste
10. Salt  Pepper To Taste
11. To Serve
12. 5  6 Big Leaves Of Basil Chopped
13. Almond Parmesan
preparation:
1. Prepare And Cook Pizza Dough According To Package Directions. If Using Pre-Made Thin Crust Like I’Ve Done Here, Simply Top And Bake.
2. Top With 1/3 – 1/2 Cup Tomato Sauce.
3. Add A Layer Of The Pizza Topping.
4. Bake On A Lined Cookie Sheet Or Pizza Pan For 10 – 15 Minutes (Or According To Package Directions).
5. Serve With Chopped Basil And Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan. For The Pizza Shown In The Recipe, I Cut Mine Into 4 Slices, And Ate Folding My Slice In Half.

title: VEGETARIAN SHEPHERD’S PIE
ingredients:
1. Mashed Potatoes
2. 2 12 Pounds Potatoes  I Used Yukon Gold
3. 14  12 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
4. 2  4 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or Vegan Butter
5. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
6. Filling
7. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
8. 1 Small Onion About 1 Cup Chopped
9. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
10. 2 Large Carrots About 1 Cup Chopped
11. 2 Stalks Celery About 1 Cup Sliced
12. 8 Ounces Mushrooms Sliced
13. 2 Tablespoon Flour
14. 2 Tablespoons Tamari Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos
15. 1 Cup Asparagus Sliced In 1 Inch Pieces
16. 1 Cup Green Beans Cut In 1 Inch Pieces
17. 1 Fresh Corn About 1 Cup Cut Off The Cob
18. 2 Cups Baby Spinach Loosely Packed
19. 1 Can 15Oz Kidney Beans 1 12 Cups Drained And Rinsed
20. 1 12 Teaspoons Dried Thyme Or 1 Tsp Fresh
21. 2 Teaspoons Fresh Rosemary Minced Or 1 Tsp Dried
22. 1 12 Cups Vegetable Broth
23. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Potatoes: Cut Potatoes Into 1 Inch Cubes. Add Potatoes To A Large Pot And Cover With Water (I Added A Few Sprigs Of Thyme To The Water.) Bring To A Boil And Simmer Until Potatoes Are Tender, About 15 Minutes. Drain Potatoes, Add Butter/Oil, Mash Into Potatoes To Melt, Add Milk And Stir Until Desired Consistency. Add Salt And Freshly Ground Pepper To Taste And Set Aside In A Warm Place.
2. Filling: In A Cast Iron Skillet, Warm Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Saute For 5 Minutes. Add Garlic, Carrots, Celery And Mushrooms, Sauté For 4 More Minutes. Add The Tamari And Flour, Mix Well Until Flour Is Incorporated And No White Streaks. Add The Corn, Kidney Beans, Green Beans, Asparagus, Herbs, And Vegetable Broth, Simmer For 10 To 15 Minutes, Until Vegetables Are Tender. Add The Spinach In The Last 5 Minutes, And Let Wilt. Season With Salt And Pepper To Taste.
3. Assemble: Spoon The Potatoes Evenly Over The Top Of The Filling And Add A Few Sprigs Of Thyme Or Paprika For Color. Place The Skillet Under The Broiler, About 3 – 4 Inches Away, For 5 Minutes To Let The Potatoes Brown.
4. Let Set A Few Minutes And Serve Warm. Gravy Will Thicken Upon Standing.

title: ROASTED CAULIFLOWER & SWEET POTATO NOURISH BOWL
ingredients:
1. 1 Head Cauliflower Cut Into Florets
2. 1 Sweet Potato Diced
3. 2 Beets Diced Optional Cook Separately
4. 6  8 Brussels Sprouts Quartered
5. 1 Red Onion Sliced
6. 1 Can 14 Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Or 1 12 Cups Freshly Cooked
7. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
8. Mineral Salt  Freshly Cracked Pepper
9. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
10. 1 12  34 Cup Water
11. 4  6 Cups Fresh Baby Spinach To Serve
12. Sliced Avocado To Serve
13. Pepitas Hemp Hearts Or Sunflower Seeds To Serve
14. Turmerictahini Dressing Serves 3
15. 14 Cup Tahini
16. 1 Teaspoon Turmeric
17. Juice Of 1 Lemon
18. 2  3 Tablespoons Water
19. Pinch Of Garlic Powder
20. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Roast: Place Vegetables And Chickpeas In A Large Mixing Bowl, Drizzle With Olive Oil And Toss Well To Coat. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With A Silpat, Light Coat Of Oil Or Parchment Paper. Place Vegetables On Baking Sheet And Sprinkle With Mineral Salt And Garlic Powder. Place Sheet On Middle Rack And Bake For 40 Minutes, Stirring Once Or Twice. If Using Beets, Prepare Same As Above But Cook Separately On A Small Baking Sheet And Place On The Bottom Rack. Remove The Beets Earlier If They Seem To Be Cooking To Fast.
3. Quinoa: In The Meantime, Add Quinoa And Water To A Medium Size Pot, Add A Pinch Of Salt And Dash Or Two Of Garlic Powder. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Cook For 15 Minutes. Once Done, Remove Cover And Let 10 Minutes, Fluff With Fork.
4. Dressing: Prepare The Dressing By Adding The Tahini, Turmeric, Lemon Juice, Water, Salt And Garlic Powder To A Small Bowl And Mix Well. Add More Water Or Lemon Juice To Thin, Add More Tahini To Thicken.
5. Serve: In Individual Bowls Place A Handful Of Spinach (Chopped If Needed), 1/2 Cup Quinoa And A Hearty Helping Of Vegetables & Chickpeas. Top With Sliced Avocado, Pepitas And A Generous Amount Of Dressing. Enjoy!
6. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Fridge. Will Last For Up To 5 Days.
7. Notes:
8. Vary Up The Dressing By Adding 1/2 Teaspoon Ginger Powder For Some Zing Or 1/4 Heaping Teaspoon Cayenne Powder For Heat. Make A Double Batch If You’D Like Since The Dressing Only Serves 3. Leftovers Store Well In A Sealed Container In The Refrigerator.
9. Change Up The Grain Using Farro, Rice Or Barley. Cook Grain Of Choice According To Package.
10. I Suggest Cooking The Beets Separately To Avoid Them Discoloring The Other Vegetables.

title: QUICK + EASY REFRIED BEANS RECIPE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 2 15 Oz Cans Pinto Beans Drained And Rinsed
3. 12 Cup 120Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
4. 12 Small Onion Diced
5. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 12 Teaspoon Cumin
7. 12 Teaspoon Chili Powder
8. 12 Teaspoon Dried Oregano Optional
9. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Saute. In A Medium Sauce Pan, Heat Oil Or Water, Saute Onions For 5 Minutes, Add Garlic Saute For 1 More Minute.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients. Add In The Beans, Spices And Water, Bring To A Simmer, And Cook For 5 Minutes.
3. Leave The Beans As Is For A Ranchero Or Charro Style Bean Or Continue To Next Step.
4. Puree Or Mash The Beans. My Favorite Way To Puree The Beans Is Using An Immersion Blender. You Can Also Mash Them Using The Back Of A Fork Or Slotted Spoon, Or Potato Masher. But I Find The Stick Blender Does The Best At Breaking Down The Beans Into A Nice Creamy Texture. Use Your Preferred .
5. Warm The Beans On Low If Needed And Add The Lime Juice. Beans Will Thicken As They Cool. Add More Water As Needed To Thin.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer Using Freezer Safe Containers Or Baggies.

title: ORANGE FRENCH TOAST (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 1 Loaf French Or Sourdough Bread Sliced 34  1 Inch Thick
2. 12 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Nondairy Milk Of Choice
3. 12 Cup Orange Juice
4. 2 Tablespoons Pure Cane Sugar Maple Syrup Or Coconut Palm Sugar
5. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon
6. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
7. 1 To 2 Tablespoons Vegan Butter Or Coconut Oil For Griddleskillet
8. To Serve
9. Pure Maple Syrup
10. Pure Cane Powdered Sugar Optional
11. Fresh Orange Slices
preparation:
1. Preheat A Griddle According To Manufacturer’S Instruction : (It’S Usually 350 Degrees For French Toast). Alternatively, Warm A Large Skillet Over Medium Heat.
2. Mix: In A Medium Size, Flat Bottom, Shallow Bowl, Mix Together The Milk, Orange Juice, Sweetener, Cinnamon, And Vanilla Extract.
3. Cook: Grease The Griddle Or Skillet. Lightly Dip Both Sides Of Toast Into The Mixture, Place On The Griddle, And Cook Until Golden Brown On Each Side, Approx. 3 Minutes Per Side.
4. Serve With Pure Maple Syrup And Garnish Of Choice.

title: BANANA CHIA PUDDING
ingredients:
1. 2 Large Overripe Bananas
2. 2 Cups Unsweetened Coconut Beverage Almond Or Cashew Milk
3. 6 Tablespoons Chia Seeds
4. Optional Addins
5. 2  4 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
6. 12  1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
7. To Garnish
8. Toasted Coconut Flakes
9. Banana Slices
10. Cacao Nibs Or Shaved Dark Chocolate
preparation:
1. In A Medium Bowl, Add Bananas And Mash Well, Stir In Non-Dairy Milk And Chia Seeds, Mix Well.
2. Let Set For About 30 Minutes, And Give A Good Stir, Repeat One More Time, Stirring Again After 30 Minutes. This Step Is An Important Step, As The Seeds Need To Be Stirred Once Or Twice Before Completely Gelling Up And Setting. If Not Stirred, The Mixture Will Be Soupy.Cover And Place In The Refrigerator For At Least 6 Hours, Or Overnight.
3. Serve With Sliced Bananas, Toasted Coconut Flakes And Cacao Nibs/Shaved Chocolate. Would Also Be Great With A Dollop Of Coconut Whipped Cream!
4. Makes About 3 Cups.

title: CLASSIC VEGAN PUMPKIN BREAD (1 BOWL + HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour Spelt Allpurpose Whole Wheat 1To1 Gf Flour Blend
2. 12  34 Cup Sugar Coconut Turbinado Or Organic Pure Cane
3. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
4. 1 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. 1 Tablespoon Pumpkin Pie Spice Or 1 Tsp Each Cinnamon  Ginger And 12 Tsp Each Nutmeg  Allspice And A Pinch Of Clove
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
7. 1  2 Teaspoons Vanilla
8. 13 Cup Water Or Unsweetened Almond Milk At Room Temp
9. 13 Cup Neutralflavored Oil Or Coconut Oil Is Liquid State Or Applesauce
10. 1 Can 15 Oz 100 Pumpkin Puree Or 1 12 Cups 338 G Fresh Pumpkin Puree
11. Small Handful Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds For Topping Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Lightly Grease Loaf Pan.
2. Mix: In A Medium Size Bowl, Combine Flour, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, Spices And Salt. In A 2 Cup Measuring Cup, Combine Oil, Sugar, Water/Milk And Vanilla. Add The Wet Mixture To The Dry Mixture Along With The Pumpkin Puree And Mix Well. Careful Not To Over Mix, But Be Sure There Is No Flour Clumps. Taste Batter, Adjusting Flavor Or Sweetness To Your Liking.
3. Bake: Pour Batter Into Prepared Loaf Pan, Place In Oven, On Center Rake, And Bake For 55 – 60 Minutes. Once Done, Remove From Oven And Let Cool 5 – 10 Minutes. Remove Loaf From Pan And Transfer Bread To A Wire Rack To Cool Slightly Before Serving.
4. Sliced Pumpkin Bread Is Delicious Warmed In A Toaster Oven And Served With A Smear Of Vegan Butter.
5. Makes 8 – 10 Slices
6. Store: Let Cool Completely Before Storing. Keep Covered On The Counter For 2 – 3 Days. Warm In The Toaster Oven.

title: MEDITERRANEAN VEGGIE SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. 4 Slices Of Bread Toasted Or Not Use Your Favorite
2. 14  13 Cup Hummus Regular Sundried Tomato Or Roasted Red Pepper Works Too
3. 1 Avocado Mashed Or Sliced
4. Leafy Greens Of Choice
5. 1 Tomato Thinly Sliced
6. 1 Cucumber Thinly Sliced Lengthwise And Cut To Width Of Bread
7. 2 Roasted Red Bell Peppers Make Your Own Or Purchase In Jars
8. 14 Red Onion Thinly Sliced
9. 6  8 Fresh Basil Leaves
10. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. How To Roast Red Peppers: Preheat Oven To 475 Degrees F. Cut Peppers In Half, Remove Stems And Seeds, Place Baking Sheet Lined With A Silpat Or Parchment Paper Cut Side Down. Roast On Middle Rack For 40 Minutes, Rotating Baking Sheet 180 Degrees After 20 Minutes. Peppers Are Ready When Blackened And Blistered. Using Tongs Place Hot Peppers In A Bowl And Cover With A Large Plate, Let Steam For 30 Minutes. Once Cooled, Peel Skin Away From Bottom To Top. Discard Peels. Peppers Are Now Ready To Be Used. For More Detailed Instruction : (With Pictures) See My Guide, How To Roast Bell Peppers, For Different S Of Roasting And Storing Peppers.
2. Prep: Gather Your Ingredients And Prepare The Veggies, Make Everything Handy.
3. Bread: Just Before Assembling Your Sandwiches, Get Your Bread Ready, If Toasting Go Ahead And Do So.
4. Assemble: Spread Hummus On One Slice Of Bread. Take The Back Of A Fork And Mash 1/2 Avocado In Its Skin. Spread Avocado On The Other Slice. Layer With The Leafy Greens, Tomato, Cucumber, Red Bell Pepper, Onion, Basil And A Sprinkle Of Mineral Salt & Fresh Cracked Pepper.
5. Slice In Half And Enjoy!
6. Makes 2 Sandwiches
7. Store: Sandwiches Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 1 – 2 Days. These Are Best Eaten Within 24 Hours.

title: CHICKPEA TIKKA MASALA
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth
2. 1 Large Onion Diced
3. 1 Teaspoon Cumin Seeds
4. 3  4 Garlic Cloves Minced
5. 2 Inch Piece Of Ginger Minced Or Grated
6. 1 Tablespoon Ground Coriander Optional
7. 1 12 Teaspoons Turmeric
8. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Garam Masala
9. 12  1 Teaspoon Cayenne
10. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
11. 2 Cans 14Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices Or 4 Tomatoes Chopped
12. 2 Tablespoons Tomato Paste
13. 2 Cans 14Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
14. 1 Can 15Oz Coconut Milk Full Or Low Fat  Cream Is Ok Too
15. To Serve
16. 12 Cup Chopped Fresh Cilantro
17. Grain Of Choice Rice Quinoa Couscous
18. Homemade Vegan Naan
preparation:
1. In A Large Pot, Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Cumin Seeds, Cook For 5 – 7 Minute, Until Onions Are Browned Around The Edges. Add The Ginger And Garlic, Cook 1 To 2 Minutes More. Add The Garam Masala, Turmeric, Garam Masala, Cayenne And Cook For 1 – 2 Two Minutes, Or Until Nice And Fragrant. Add Tomatoes And Cook For 4 Minutes, Until They Breakdown A Bit. Add Tomato Paste, Chickpeas And Coconut Milk, Stir To Combine And Bring To A Gentle Simmer, Stirring Occasionally. Simmer, Covered, For 25 To 30 Minutes Over Low Heat, Stirring Occasionally. Adjust Seasonings To Taste.
2. Serve With Rice, Cilantro Lime Rice, Quinoa, Couscous, Or Pair With Vegan Naan.

title: CREAMY BROCCOLI + RED LENTIL SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 14 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
5. 1 Cup Red Lentils
6. 2  3 Large Heads Broccoli About 1 12 Lbs Cut Into Florets Stalks Chopped Ok Too
7. 6  7 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water  Broth Combo
8. 1 Can Lowfat Coconut Milk Optional
9. Mineral Salt To Taste
10. Garnish Optional
11. Mustard Seeds Crushed I Used Black
12. 1  2 Scallions Sliced
13. Slivered Almonds
14. Croutons Simple Truth Organics Makes A Great Vegan Crouton
15. Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
16. Coconut Bacon
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Stock Pot, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Cook Until Translucent, About 5 Minutes. Add Garlic And Red Pepper Flakes, Cook Another Minute Or Until Fragrant.
2. Simmer: Add Lentils, Broccoli, Broth/Water And Optional Coconut Milk. Using The Back Of A Fork Or Spoon Press The Broccoli Down As Much As You Can To Cover With Liquids. Bring To A Boil, Cover Pot With Lid, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 – 20 Minutes. Soup Is Done When Lentils Are Tender. Season To Taste With Salt + Pepper.
3. Puree: Using An Immersion Blender Puree Until Desired Consistency. Or Once Cooled A Few Minutes, Use A Food Processor/Blender To Puree (This  May Take Two Batches To Complete).
4. Serve: Ladle Into Serving Bowls And Top With Mustard Seeds, Scallions And Almonds. Pairs Great With Homemade Artisan Bread Or Biscuits Of Choice. If You Have A Lemon On Hand, Add A Squeeze To Your Soup For Added Brightness.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating. Reheat On The Stove Or Microwave.

title: Black Eyed Pea Soup
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Black Eyed Peas Soaked  See Notes Or 3 Cans 14Oz Drained And Rinsed
2. 2 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 13 Cup Water
3. 1 Yellow Onion Diced
4. 2 Large Carrots Diced
5. 2 Celery Ribs Sliced
6. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
7. 1 Tablespoon Smoked Paprika
8. 1 Teaspoon Each Thyme Basil And Oregano
9. 1 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder
10. 12  1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Optional
11. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes With The Juices
12. 2  3 Cups Collard Greens Chopped
13. 6 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
14. 12  1 Teaspoon Each Salt  Pepper Or To Taste
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion, Carrots, And Celery, Saute For 7 – 10 Minutes. Add The Garlic, Smoked Paprika, Thyme, Basil, Oregano, And Garlic & Onion Powder, Cook Until Fragrant, About 1 – 2 Minutes.
2. Simmer: Add The Black-Eyed Peas, Tomatoes, And Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low, And Simmer For 20 Minutes (For Canned) To 1 1/4 Hours (For Soaked), Or Until Beans Are Tender. Before Soup Is Done, About 5 – 10 Minutes Ahead, Stir In The Collard Greens. Season With Plenty Of Salt And Pepper.
3. Serve: We Love Adding A Squeeze Of Lemon Over The Top Of Our Serving Bowls For Brightness. And This Slightly Sweet Vegan Cornbread Is The Perfect Accompaniment To This Savory Soup!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: STRAWBERRY + RHUBARB CRISP
ingredients:
1. Filling
2. 4  5 Stalks Of Rhubarb Chopped
3. 2 Lbs Strawberries Quartered
4. 2 Tablespoons Coconut Or Cane Sugar
5. Topping
6. 1 12 Cups Old Fashioned Oats I Used Gf
7. 12 Cup Almond Meal
8. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
9. 14 Teaspoon Cardamom
10. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
11. 14 Cup Coconut Or Cane Sugar Maple Syrup Works Too
12. 13 Cup Coconut Oil Room Temperature Or Any Neutral Oil
13. 13  12 Cup Slivered Almonds Chopped Walnuts Or Pecans Work Too
14. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Using An 9×9 Baking Dish, Add Rhubarb And Strawberries Directly To The Dish, Add Sugar And Stir Gently To Mix.
3. In A Medium Size Bowl, Mix Together The Ingredients For The Topping. Spread Evenly Over Top The Strawberries & Rhubarb Mixture.
4. Bake On The Middle Rack For 40 – 50 Minutes. Will Be Done When Mixture Is Bubbly And Top Is Golden. Let Cool 10 Minutes.
5. Serve Warm With A Dollop Of Non-Dairy Vanilla Yogurt Or A Scoop Of Your Favorite Non-Dairy Vanilla Ice Cream.

title: CHICKPEA & SWEET POTATO BREAKFAST HASH
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Lbs Sweet Potatoes Cut Into 34  1 Inch Cubes
2. 12 Large Onion Chopped
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
4. 1 Green Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
5. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
6. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
7. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt Or To Taste
9. Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
10. Sriracha Tahini Sauce
11. 4 Tablespoons Tahini
12. 4 Tablespoons Water
13. Juice Of 12 Small Lemon
14. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
15. Sriracha To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Line A Sheet Pan With Parchment Paper, A Silpat, Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Assemble: Place The Sweet Potatoes, Onion, Bell Peppers And Chickpeas On The Center Of The Sheet Pan, Drizzle With Olive Oil, Garlic Powder, Salt And Pepper, Toss Well To Coat. Arrange The Sweet Potato Mixture In A Single Layer.
3. Roast 1: Place Sheet Pan In The Oven, On The Center Rack, And Cook For 20 Minutes, Stirring Halfway Through.
4. Roast 2: Turn Heat Up To 500 Degrees F., Stir A Second Time And Continue Baking For Another 20 Minutes, Stirring Halfway Through. Let Cool A Few Minutes.
5. Dressing: While The Breakfast Hash Is Roasting, Whisk Together The Tahini, Water, Lemon, Salt, And Sriracha In A Small Bowl. Let Rest For Flavors To Develop. Taste For Flavor Before Serving.
6. Serve: Place In Individual Bowls And Serve With Sliced Avocado And Creamy Sriracha Tahini Sauce. Season With Salt + Pepper To Taste. You May Also Like This Easy Sriracha Cashew Cheese Sauce!
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days.

title: SIMPLE TOFU SCRAMBLE
ingredients:
1. 1 Block 14Oz Tofu Soft Firm Or Extrafirm Not Silken
2. 1  2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast
3. 12 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder Optional
4. 14 Teaspoon Turmeric
5. 2 Tablespoon Vegan Cream Optional
6. 14 Teaspoon Black Salt Kala Namak Optional
7. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Drain The Tofu, No Need To Press As The Water Will Dissipate As It Cooks. I Typically Let The Block Of Tofu Rest On Its Side Thin Side To Drain For A Few Minutes Before Using.
2. Cook Tofu: Heat The Skillet Over Medium Heat, Add The Tofu While Crumbling It Between Your Fingers (Above Right). Alternatively, Add The Tofu Block To The Skillet And Use The Back Of A Fork To Mash It A Bit. You Can Also Break It Up With A Wooden Spoon. Do Whatever Is Comfortable Or Makes Sense For You. Cook For 2 – 3 Minutes.
3. Add Seasoning: Add The Turmeric, Nutritional Yeast, Optional Garlic + Onion Powder, Salt And Pepper, Cooking For 2 Minutes More, Stirring Frequently. If Adding Veggies, This Is The Perfect Time To Add Them.
4. Add Cream: Lastly, Add The Vegan Cream And Black Salt, And Cook Another 3 Minutes, Stirring Frequently.
5. Serve Right Away With Breakfast Potatoes Or Home Fries, And Fresh Fruits. Also Great With A Slice Of Toasted Artisan Bread!

title: Spinach & Artichoke White Bean Dip
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Bread Crumbs Optional
2. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
3. 1 Large Shallot Or Medium Onion Finely Diced
4. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced Or 12  1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 1 Jarcan 14 Oz Artichoke Hearts In Water Drained And Chopped
6. 5 Oz Baby Spinach Or 1 Bunch Spinach Roughly Chopped
7. 1 Can 15 Oz White Beans Cannellini Navy Or Great Northern Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. 1 Small Lemon Juice Of
9. 12 Cup Water Or Vegetable Broth
10. 2  3 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
11. 1 Teaspoon Dried Thyme Basil Or Oregano I Used Thyme Or 2 Teaspoons Fresh Minced
12. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
13. 12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F.
2. Panko: In A Small Bowl Combine The Bread Crumbs With 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil, Mix Well Using Your Fingers, Set Aside. Add A Little Extra Oil If You Feel You Need It.
3. Saute: Heat The Remaining Oil In A Skillet/Pan Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Saute For About 5 Minutes, Until Onions Are Translucent. Add In Garlic And Cook 1 Minute More, Add Artichoke And Spinach, Cook Until Spinach Wilts.
4. White Bean Base: In Food Processor, Add Beans, Lemon Juice, Water, Nutritional Yeast, Herbs Of Choice, Salt And Red Pepper Flakes. Process Until Creamy Scraping Down The Sides As Needed. Add The Puree To The Sauteed Artichoke And Spinach Mixture And Mix Well.
5. Assemble: Fill A Small Baking Dish With Mixture, Add A Layer Of The Olive Oil Bread Crumbs Over Top.
6. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake, Covered For 10 Minutes (I Don’T Use Foil Anymore And Covered My Dish With A Small Silpat, Worked Well). After 10 Minutes, Remove Cover And Cook An Additional 10 Minutes. If Top Doesn’T Turn Golden, Place The Dip In The Broiler To Brown, About A Minute Or Two Should Do. Just Be Careful It Doesn’T Burn. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
7. Serve: Pair With With Toasted Sour Bread, Pita Chips Or Crackers. You Can Also Serve This With Fresh Slices Of Colored Bell Peppers.
8. Makes About 3 Cups.
9. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: LENTIL WALNUT LOAF
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Greenbrown Lentils Rinsed
2. 2 14 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water
3. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
4. 1 Small Onion Diced About 1 14 Cup
5. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
6. 2 Celery Stalks Diced About 1 Cup
7. 2 Carrots Diced Or Grated About 1 Cup
8. 1 Small Apple Cored Peeled And Diced Or Grated Use Firm Crisp Like Fuji Gala Or Granny About 1 Cup
9. 1 12 Teaspoons Fennel Seeds Use Whole Or Lightly Crushed
10. 1 12 Teaspoons Sage Or 2 Tablespoons Fresh Minced
11. 34 Cup Oats Quick Or Rolled I Used Quick Or Bread Crumbs
12. 14 Cup Flour Spelt Almond Oat Gf Allpurpose Etc
13. 12  34 Cup Unsweetened Organic Applesauce
14. 34 Cup Finely Chopped Walnuts
15. Salt  Pepper To Taste I Used White Pepper
16. Glaze
17. 6 Tablespoons Organic Ketchup
18. 3 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
19. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Cook Lentils: In A Dutch Oven Or Large Pot, Add Vegetable Broth And Lentils, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 40 – 45 Minutes, Most To All Liquid Should Be Absorbed. (If Most Liquid Is Not Absorbed, Cooked Until It Is Mostly Absorbed. If By Chance Your Liquid Absorbs Too Fast, Add A Tad More Water As Needed And Continue The Process.) Lentils Should Be Overcooked And Tender. Set Aside To Cool, Uncovered, For 15 Minutes. Mash Lentils With The Back Of A Spoon Or Fork, Or Roughly Puree Using An Immersion Blender Or Food Processor, About 2/3 – 3/4 Of The Lentil Mixture.
2. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
3. Toast Walnuts: Spread Walnuts On A Small Rimmed Baking Pan, Place In Oven And Toast Until Fragrant, About 10 -15 Minutes. Set Aside To Cool..
4. Prepare Vegetables And Apple: Heat Oil In A Medium Size Pan Over Medium Heat, Add Onion, Garlic, Celery And Carrot, Saute For About 5 Minutes. Add Apple, Fennel, Sage Salt & Pepper, Heat For Another 3 – 4 Minutes.
5. Combine Everything: Add The Sauteed Mixture With The Lentils And Mix. Add Flour, Oats, Walnuts And 1/2 Cup Apple Sauce, Mix Well To Combine. If Mixture Seems To Dry, Add A Little More Apple Sauce, Mix Again. Taste For Seasoning Adding Extra Herbs, Salt And Pepper As Needed.
6. Line A 9 X 5 Loaf Pan With Parchment Paper, (This Will Make For Easy Removal Later), Add Mixture And Press Down Gently But Firmly To Remove Any Air Pockets, Fill In Along The Edges As Well.
7. Make Glaze: In Small Bowl, Mix Together The Glaze And Spread Over Top Lentil Loaf As Evenly As You Can. Here You Can Even Add A Fresh Sage Leaf In The Center Of The Loaf, It Won’T Burn, It May Roll A Bit On The Edges, And Will Add A Nice Decoration.
8. Bake: Place Loaf In Oven, On Middle Rack, And Bake For 45 – 50 Minutes. Remove From Oven, Let Cool 10 Minutes, Remove From Pan Using The Edges Of The Parchment Paper. You May Like To Mix A Bit More Sauce And Spread Over Top. Place Loaf On Serving Dish, Cut And Serve Individual Slices.
9. Makes 8 Slices.

title: EASY VEGAN MAC AND CHEESE WITH PEAS
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Package 454G Pastasmall Pasta
2. 16 Oz Package 454G Peas Fresh Canned Or Frozen
3. Cashew Cheese Sauce
4. 1 12 Cups 180G Raw Cashews See Notes
5. Just Shy Of 2 Cups 450Cups Very Warmhot Water
6. 14 Cup 10G Nutritional Yeast Optional
7. 2 Teaspoons Cornstarch Or Arrowroot
8. 1 Clove Garlicor1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
9. 1 Teaspoon Onion Powder
10. 2 Teaspoons White Miso Pasteor2 Teaspoons Dijon Mustard
11. Juice Of 12 Lemonor2 Teaspoons Vinegar
12. 1 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
13. Black Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Pasta & Peas: In A Large Pot, Add Water And Bring To A Boil. Cook Pasta According To Package Directions, Add The Peas With The Pasta To Cook. Pasta Should Be Al Dente Or Just Fork Tender.
2. Sauce: Add The Cashew Sauce Ingredients To A Personal Blender Or High-Speed Blender, Blend Until Creamy, About 1 Minute.
3. Assemble: Once Pasta And Peas Have Been Drained, Add Back To The Pot They Were Cooked In And Add The Cashew Cheese Sauce Overtop, Stir To Combine.

title: BREAKFAST POTATOES
ingredients:
1. 2 Lbs Potatoes Use Your Favorite Scrubbed And Dried Cut Into 12 34 Inch Cubes
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Paprika Regular Or Smoked
5. 12 Teaspoon Salt Or To Taste
6. Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F.
2. Place Cubed Potatoes On The Center Of A Rimmed Baking Sheet Lined With Parchment Paper Or Silicone Mat (No Liner Is Fine Too). Drizzle With Olive Oil, Garlic Powder, Paprika, Salt And Pepper. Using Your Fingers And Hands, Toss The Potatoes Well And Spread Into A Single Layer. (Alternatively, You Can Add Everything To A Bowl, Toss, And Place On The Baking Sheet.)
3. Place In The Oven, On The Center Rack, And Bake For 25 Minutes, Stirring Once.
4. Turn Oven To 500 Degrees F. And Roast Another 10 – 15 Minutes, Stirring Once Until Edges Are Golden And Crispy.
5. Let Cool A Few Minutes And Serve Right Away.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container. To Keep Longer, Freeze The Potatoes For Up To 2 Months In Freezer Safe Containers Or Ziplock Bags.

title: ALMOST-EVERYTHING TRAIL MIX
ingredients:
1. 34 Cup Unsalted Peanuts Raw Or Roasted
2. 34 Cup Unsalted Almonds Raw Or Roasted
3. 13 Cup Unsalted Pepitas Raw Or Roasted
4. 12 Cup Banana Chips Pref Unsweetened
5. 12 Cup Chopped Papaya Pref Unsulfured  Unsweetened
6. 12 Cup Regular Or Crimson Raisins I Used A Combo
7. 14  12 Cup Toasted Coconut Flakes
8. 14  12 Cup Semisweet Or Dark Chocolate Chips
preparation:
1. Place All The Ingredients In A Small To Medium Sized Bowl And Toss Together.
2. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container.
3. Makes About 3 1/2 – 4 Cups.
4. Notes:
5. *If Using Shredded Coconut, Use The Smaller Amount Suggested. If Using Large Coconut Flakes, As Pictured, Use The 1/2 Cup Suggested.
6. **For The Chocolate Chips, If Using Mini-Chips 1/4 Cup Will Due. If Using Regular Sized Chocolate Chips, 1/2 Cup Is Good. I Used These Mini-Chips.
7. Feel Free To Substitute, Add Or Subtract Any Ingredient To Suit Your Taste.
8. Optional Subs & Add-Ins:
9. Pineapple
10. Cranberries
11. Mango
12. Apricot
13. Dates
14. Cashews
15. Pretzels
16. Cocoa Nibs

title: THAI CRUNCH SALAD + CITRUS PEANUT DRESSING
ingredients:
1. Salad
2. 2 12 Cups English Cucumbers Thinly Sliced And Halved Or Quartered
3. 1 Cup Carrots Thinly Sliced
4. 1 Red Bell Pepper Julienned
5. 2 Scallions Thinly Sliced
6. 1 Small Head Napa Cabbage About 2  3 Cups Sliced
7. 14 Head Of Red Cabbage Sliced
8. Handful Peanuts Or Cashews For Garnish
9. Handful Cilantro For Garnish Optional
10. Red Pepper Flakes For Garnish Optional
11. Citrus Peanut Dressing
12. 3 Tablespoons Orange Juice Lime Juice Or Lemon Juice  More As Needed
13. 3 Tablespoons Raw Or Natural Peanut Butter Almond Or Cashew Butter Is Great Too
14. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
15. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
16. 1 Garlic Clove Grated
17. 12 Teaspoon Fresh Ginger Grated
18. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Or 12 Teaspoon Sriracha Hot Sauce Optional
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Ingredients For The Peanut Citrus Dressing, Set Aside Allowing The Flavors To Come Together. Then Before Adding The Dressing To The Salad, Taste For Flavor Adding Anything Extra You Might Like. For A Thinner Dressing Add 1 Or 2 Tablespoons Citrus Juice Or Water. To Make It Thicker Add A Tad Bit More Nut Butter.
2. Assemble: Prepare Your Salad Ingredients. Check Your Dressing For Flavor. In A Large Bowl The Napa And Red Cabbage, Scallions, Red Bell Pepper, Cucumber, Carrots And Peanuts Or Cashews, Pour The Dressing Over Top The Salad And Toss Well To Coat.
3. Serve In Individual Bowls, Top With Peanuts Or Cashews, And Red Pepper Flakes.
4. Makes 3 – 4 Smaller Salads, Or 2 Generous Salads
5. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container For Up To 5 Days In The Refrigerator

title: VEGAN FRENCH ONION SOUP
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Vegan Butter Or Olive Oil I Used Miyokos Butter
2. 4 White Onions About 2 Lbs
3. 3  4 Sprigs Of Fresh Thyme Or 1 12 Teaspoons Dried
4. 2 Bay Leaves
5. 12 Teaspoon Salt
6. 1 Tablespoon Flour Or Arrowroot Powder
7. 34 Cup Dry White Wine Can Sub With Red For Fullbodied Flavor
8. 6 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
9. 12 Teaspoon Pepper Fresh Cracked Black Or White
10. 1 Baguette Sliced
11. Vegan Cheese I Used Miyokos Mozzarella
preparation:
1. Prep The Onions. Cut The Onions Lengthwise, Lay Cut Sides On Flat Surface And Trim The Ends. Peel Away The Outer Skin, First Thin Layer Of The Onion. Place Onion On One Of The End Cuts And Slice Lengthwise Into Thin Strips. You Should End Up With About 2 Lbs Of Sliced Onions (About 8 – 9 Cups).
2. Caramelize The Onions. In At Least A 4 Qt. Pan, Heat Vegan Butter Or Olive Oil Over Medium Heat, Add The Onions, Thyme, Bay Leaves, And Salt (Or Salt + Pepper). Cook The Onions Over Medium Heat, Stirring Frequently, For About 45 Minutes (Could Take Up To 1 Hour). Onions Are Ready When They Have Softened And Turned A Deep Golden Brown.
3. Add The Flour.Sprinkle In The Flour, Stirring Well To Incorporate Until There Are No White Streaks, Cook For About 1 Minute.
4. Add The Wine. Pour In The Wine, Continue To Cook For 10 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, To Reduce The Wine.
5. Add The Vegetable Broth. Lastly, Add The Broth And Pepper, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat And Simmer, Uncovered, For About 30 Minutes. Season To Taste.
6. Assemble Soup Bowls. Ladle Soup Into Individual, Oven Safe, Bowls. Add 1 Or 2 Slices Of The Baguette On Top Of The Soup, And Add A Layer Of Cheese And Sprig Of Thyme. Place Bowls On A Rimmed Baking Sheet As Shown Above Right. Alternatively, Warm Toast The Baguette Slice With Cheese Separately Following Instruction Below, Adding To The Top Of The Soup When Serving.
7. Bake Or Broil.Place In A Preheated Oven Set To 350 Degrees F. For About 20 Minutes. Alternatively, Place 5 Or 6 Inches Away From The Broiler For About 5 – 7 Minutes. The Bread Should Get Crispy On The Edges, And The Cheese Will Melt And May Turn Golden And Slightly Char.
8. Serve: Soup Is Best Served Right Away While It’S Warm. Alternatively, Enjoy The Soup As Is With Crusty Bread On The Side For Dipping.
9. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator, Without The Toppings, For 5 – 6 Days. To Store Longer, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator Before Reheating.

title: Black Bean, Broccoli + Avocado Salad
ingredients:
1. 2 Romaine Hearts Chopped
2. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
3. 1 14 Cup Broccoli Florets Steamed
4. 1 Avocado Sliced
5. 13 Cup Pico De Gallo Andor Corn Salsa
6. Cilantro Sprigs
7. 1 Jalapeno Or Serrano Chili Sliced And Most Seeds Removed
8. Cuminlime Tahini Dressing
9. 14 Cup Tahini
10. 13 Cup Water
11. Juice Of 1 Lime
12. 18  14 Teaspoon Cumin
13. Pinch Of Salt
14. 2 Teaspoons Finely Chopped Cilantro
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Dressing Ingredients, Except For The Cilantro. Use A Tad More Water As Needed To Thin. If Dressing Is Too Thin, Add More Tahini. Once Blended To Your Liking, Taste For Flavor, Stir In Cilantro, And Set Aside.
2. Broccoli: Steam Your Broccoli Just Until Al Dente And Bright Green Using A Bamboo Steamer, Double Broiler, Or Preferred .
3. Assemble: Add Romaine To Your Serving Dishes, Top With Black Beans, Broccoli, Avocado, Pico De Gallo, A Few Sprigs Of Cilantro, And Slices Of Chili Peppers. Top With Dressing And Enjoy!
4. Store: Leftover Salad And Dressing Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days.

title: BEST APPLESAUCE WAFFLES
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups 210G Flour Whole Wheat Spelt Or Allpurpose
2. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
3. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon
4. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
5. 1 14 Cups 281Cups Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk
6. 12 Cup 113Cups Unsweetened Applesauce
7. 14 Cup 56G Nondairy Buttermargarine Or Oil I Recommend Miyokos
8. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
preparation:
1. Preheat Waffle Maker According To Manufacturer’S Instruction :. Also, Preheat Oven To 200 Degrees F., For Keeping The Waffles Warm.
2. In A Medium Sized Mixing Bowl, Combine The Flour, Cinnamon, Baking Powder And Salt, Mix Well. Add In The Non-Dairy Milk, Applesauce, Butter/Oil, And Vanilla, Mix Well, Until Most Of The Flour Lumps Are Gone.
3. If Using Thiscuisinart Waffle Maker(Affiliate Link), Or One Similar, Using A 1/2 Measuring Cup, Scoop Up Batter And Pour In The Center Of The Heated Waffle Maker Plate. Close The Cover And Wait Until The Light Turns Green.
4. Gently Remove And Place Waffles On A Wire Rack In The Preheated Oven Until The Remaining Waffles Are Made.
5. Serve: Pair Your Waffles With Warm Healthy Skillet Cinnamon Apples And Pure Maple Syrup. Would Also Be Great With This Easy Homemadeblueberry Compote. In The Summer Months, Top With Fresh Fruit Like Sliced Banana, Strawberries, Or Other Fresh Berries.
6. Storage: Store Leftover Waffles In The Refrigerator For Up To A Week, Or Store In The Freezer For Up To 1- 2 Months. When Ready To Eat, Pop Them In The Toaster Oven.

title: MIRIN & MAPLE ROASTED ALMONDS
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Raw Almonds About 1 Lb
2. 3 Tablespoons Mirin
3. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
4. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
5. 18 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Or Cayenne
6. Generous Pinch Or Two Mineral Salt
7. 1 Heaping Tablespoon Sesame Seeds Black Andor White
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. In A Medium Mixing Bowl, Combine The Mirin, Maple Syrup, Cinnamon, Chipotle Powder And Salt, Mix Well. Add The Almonds To The Mirin Mixture And Toss To Coat. Add In Sesame Seeds And Combine.
3. On A Large Rimmed Baking Sheet, Lined With Parchment Paper Or Silpat, Spread Almonds In An Even Layer. You May Even Like To Sprinkle A Little Salt On Top Of The Almonds For A Little Extra Saltiness!
4. Bake For 15 – 18 Minutes, Stirring Once. Keep An Eye On Them After 15 Minutes, So They Don’T Overcook And Burn.
5. Remove From Oven, Let Cool And To Harden.

title: VEGAN BUTTERMILK BISCUITS & COUNTRY GRAVY
ingredients:
1. Biscuits
2. 2 12 Cups Unbleached Allpurpose Flour
3. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. Pinch Of Salt
6. 4 Rounded Tablespoons Of Vegan Butter I Used Smart Balance Wolive Oil
7. 1 Cup Unsweetened Cashew Milk
8. Juice Of 1 Lemon About 1 Tablespoon
9. Country Gravy
10. 5 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or Vegan Butter
11. 7 Tablespoons Allpurpose Flour
12. 1 Vegan Sausage Minced Tofurky Or Field Roast Optional
13. Pinch Of Garlic Powder
14. 12 Teaspoon Poultry Seasoning Optional
15. 18 Teaspoon Nutmeg Optional
16. 4 Cups Unsweetened Cashew Milk At Room Temperature
17. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Gravy: In A Medium Sized Pot Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Flour And Stir For 2 – 3 Minutes, Until It Turns Light Golden Brown. Add The Garlic Powder, Poultry Seasoning And Nutmeg, Mix Well, Add In The Sausage And Stir Another Minute Or So. Mixture Will Form A Ball Of Sorts. Slowly Add The Milk And Continue To Stir, Bring Just To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Medium And Continue To Cook, Stirring Constantly, Until Gravy Has Thickened To Desired Consistency, About 10 Minutes. Use The Back Of The Spoon/Fork To Help Break Up The Sausage If Needed. Gravy Will Thicken A Bit More As It Cools. Season With Plenty Of Pepper And Salt To Taste. Set Aside With Lid On, Or Slightly Askew Stirring Every Now And Then Until Ready To Serve. If Gravy Cools Too Much, Heat Over Low Until Warmed.
2. Biscuits: Make Your Buttermilk By Combining The Milk With The Lemon Juice. Let Set For About 10 Minutes.
3. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Lightly Flour A Flat Surface (Use A Cutting Board, Marble Slab, Etc). Leave A Little Extra Flour On The Side For Your Fingers And The Biscuit Cutter. Line A Baking Sheet With A Silpat Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
4. In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add The Flour, Baking Powder, Baking Soda And Salt, Mix Well To Combine. Add The Chilled Butter And Cut It Into The Flour Using A Pastry Blender Or The Back Of A Fork. You’Ll Know It’S Ready When The Butter Is About Pea Sized And The Mixture Is Crumbly Looking. Add In The Milk And Mix Until Just Combined, Making Sure There Are No Flour Patches. The Dough Should Form Into A Rough Ball, It Should Be Tacky Not Sticky. If Mixture Is Too Wet & Sticky, Add A Little Extra Flour And Mix Just A Needed.
5. Place Dough On The Prepared Floured Surface, Pat It Down Into A Rough Circle Or Rectangle About 1 Inch Thick, Fold Dough Onto Itself. Repeat 2 More Times (This Will Make For Flaky Biscuits). Add Extra Flour To Your Fingers Or Dough As Needed. Gently Flatten The Dough To About 3/4 Inch Thick. Using A 2 1/2 Inch Cookie Cutter, Place Cutter In The Reserved Flour, Tap The Cutter On The Flat Surface To Remove Any Excess And Press The Cutter Into The Dough, Repeat. As Much As You Feel You Want To, Do Not Twist The Cutter In The Dough As It Crimps The Edges And Will Interfere With Proper Rising. Place Biscuits On Prepared Baking Sheet, Brush With A Little Olive Oil Or Cashew Milk Over Top If You Like. Place In The Oven On The Middle Rack For 15 -18 Minutes.
6. Makes Approx. 10 Biscuits. You Can Get 12 If You Rework The Dough Scraps. They Won’T Be The Prettiest Biscuits But They’Ll Still Taste Great.
7. Serve: Split The Biscuits Open Face And Serve Gravy Over Top. Enjoy Often!

title: Enchilada Rice (Instant Pot + Stovetop)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Medium Onion Any Color Diced
3. 3  4 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1 Large Green Bell Pepper Diced
5. 1 12 Cups Long Grain White Rice See Notes For Brown Rice
6. 1 34 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water
7. 1 Can 14Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. 1 Can 14Oz Corn Drained
9. 1 Can 14Oz Fire Roasted Diced Tomatoes With Juices
10. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
11. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder Or Smoked Paprika
12. 12 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
13. 1 12 Cups Enchilada Sauce Green Red Salsa Verde Or Combo
14. Salt To Taste
15. To Serve Optional
16. Sliced Or Diced Avocado
17. Fresh Chopped Cilantro
18. Shredded Vegan Cheese
19. Tortilla Chips
20. Pico De Gallo
preparation:
1. Instant Pot:
2. Saute: Add The Oil/Water, Onion, Bell Pepper, And Garlic To The Insert Of The Instant Pot, Press The Saute Button, And Set The Time For 5 Minutes, Stir Frequently.
3. Cook: Add The Rice, Water, Spices, Tomatoes, Corn, Black Beans, And Finish With The Enchilada Sauce. Attach Lid And Turn To Close, Set Valve To Sealing, And Manually Set To High Pressure For 5 Minutes. Release Pressure When Done (To Help Keep The Steam From Getting All Over, Place A Thin, Single-Layer Kitchen Towel Over The Valve To Catch The Steam).
4. Let Cool To Thicken: Remove Lid And Give A Good Stir. It Will Seem Liquidy But Will Thicken After A Few Minutes. Add The Cilantro And Season To Taste.
5. Stovetop
6. Rice: Cook 1 1/2 Cups Of Rice According To Package Directions. Set Aside.
7. Saute: Heat Oil/Water In A Medium-Sized Pot, Add The Onion, Bell Pepper, And Garlic, Saute For 5 Minutes.
8. Cook: Add The Cooked Rice, Corn, Tomatoes, Black Beans, Spices, And Enchilada Sauce, Cook Over Medium-Low Heat For 10 Minutes, Or Until Heated Through.
9. Let Cool To Thicken: Remove From Heat, Let Rest To Thicken Up, About 5 – 10 Minutes. Add The Cilantro And Season To Taste.
10. Serve In Individual Bowls With Any Of The Optional Garnishes. Also, Use It As A Burrito Or Taco Filling With Shredded Lettuce!
11. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months Using A Freezer-Safe Container.

title: MARINA’RAW’ SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Tomatoes Roma Grape Or Cherry On The Vine Etc Chopped
2. 1 Cup 3Oz Sundried Tomatoes Not In Oil
3. 1 Clove Garlic Or 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 2 Tablespoons Shallots
5. 12 Cup Herbs Cilantro Parsley Or Basil Medium Packed
6. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Soak Sun-Dried Tomatoes: Start With Softening The Sun-Dried Tomatoes. Do This By Placing Them In A Small Bowl Of Warm, Not Boiling, Water, And Let Soak For About 20 Minutes. Drain Water.
2. Make The Sauce: Once Tomatoes Are Ready, Place All The Ingredients Into A Food Processor Or Blender, And Blend Until Mixture Is Fairly Smooth. You Can Also Leave It A Little Chunky If You Like. Taste For Flavor Adding More Of Anything You Like.
3. Store: Leftovers Sauce Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.
4. Makes 2 Cups.

title: CHOCOLATE VEGAN BELGIAN WAFFLES (HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Flour Whole Wheat Spelt Allpurpose Or 11 Gf Flour Blend
2. 12 Cup Organic Cocoa Powder
3. 14 Cup Sugar Organic Pure Cane Coconut Date Raw Or Monk Fruit Sweetener
4. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
5. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
6. 1 34 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Milk Of Choice
7. 14 Cup Light Flavored Olive Oil Or Room Temp Coconut Oil
8. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. Preheat Waffle Maker To Manufacturer’S Instruction :.
2. Mix Batter: In A Medium Size Bowl, Combine The Flour, Cocoa, Sugar, Baking Powder, Salt. Add Non-Dairy Milk, Oil And Vanilla, Mix Until Combined.
3. Cook: Pour Batter Onto The Waffle Iron, Close And Cook About 3 – 4 Minutes (Or According To Your Waffle Maker’S Instruction :). Gently Remove Waffles And Serve Right Away. You Can Also Keep Waffles Warm In A Preheated Oven At 200 Degrees F., Keep Waffles On A Cookie Sheet Until All Waffles Are Ready.
4. Serve: Top Waffles With Pure Maple Syrup. Pairs Perfectly With Fresh Sliced Strawberries, But Any Seasonal Berry Will Be Great Too. For Variation, Try This Nut Butter Maple Syrup.
5. Makes 2 Belgian Waffles (As Shown) Or 4 Regular Ones If Using A Classic Waffle Maker.
6. Store: Leftover Waffles Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days, Or In The Freezer For 2 – 3 Months. Reheat In The Toaster Oven.

title: VEGAN GLUTEN-FREE PANCAKES (ALMOND FOUR + BANANA)
ingredients:
1. 1 Overripe Banana About 12 Cup Peeled
2. 12  34 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Your Favorite Nondairy Milk
3. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
4. 12 Cup Glutenfree All Purpose Or Oat Flour
5. 12 Cup Almond Flour
6. 1 Tablespoon Flaxseed Meal Ground Flaxseeds Optional
7. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
8. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
9. Pinch Of Salt
10. 1 Teaspoon Coconut Oil For The Skilletgriddle If Needed
preparation:
1. Preheat Griddle According To Manufactures Instruction :.
2. Mix: In A Medium Bowl, Mash The Banana Until Creamy, Add The Almond Milk And Vanilla, Mix Well. Add The Flours, Baking Powder, And Pinch Of Salt, Mix Until Combined. Batter Should Be On The Thicker Side.
3. Cook: Add Oil To Griddle, Using A 1/4 Measuring Cup, Scoop And Pour Batter Onto Hot Griddle. Cook Until Nicely Golden Brown On Each Side, About 3 Minutes On Each Side.
4. Serve With Maple Syrup, Banana Slices And Walnuts.
5. Makes 6 Pancakes

title: SOBA MISO SOUP + ROASTED VEGETABLES
ingredients:
1. 1 Purple Sweet Potato Or Any Color Peeled And Cut Into 12 Inch Cubes
2. 2 Carrots Sliced Diagonally
3. 12 Cup Brussels Sprouts Quartered
4. 23 Cup Broccoli Florets
5. Drizzle Of Sesame Oil
6. 1 Package 9 Oz 100 Soba Noodles I Love These King Soba Noodles Affiliate Links
7. 5  6 Tablespoons Miso I Used Red Use Your Favorite
8. 4 Cups Water
9. Garnish
10. 2 Scallions Sliced
11. Toasted Sesame Seeds Raw Black Andor White Are Great Too
12. Handful Of Greens Pea Shoots Sprouts Greens Andor Cilantro
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Roast Veggies: Place Veggies On A Large Rimmed Baking Sheet That’S Lightly Greased Or Lined With A Silpat Or Parchment Paper. Add A Drizzle Of Oil And Toss Well. Add A Sprinkle Of Salt Over Top. Place Sheet On The Middle Rack And Cook For About 25 Minutes Stirring Every 10 Minutes, Vegetables Are Done When Just Fork Tender.
3. Noodles: Cook Your Soba Noodles According To The Package Directions. Be Sure To Use A Large Pot Filled Just Under Half Way When Cooking Soba Noodles. Once The Noodles Have Come To A Boil, The Water Tends To Foam Up Quickly And Overflow (Ugg, I’Ve Learned From Experience). Pay Attention And Reduce The Heat As Needed To Prevent The Water From Boiling Over While Keeping The Water At A Gentle Rolling Boil. Most Importantly, When Done Rinse The Noodles Right Away Under Cool Running Water To Keep Them From Cooking (Or Else You’Ll Have Mushy Noodles On Your Hands).
4. Miso Broth: Heat Your Water In A Small Pan Until Nicely Warmed, But Not Boiling, (Use The Pot The Noodles Were Cooked In To Save A Dish). Remove From Heat, Add Miso And Mix Until Miso Is Dissolved. This Keeps The Miso From Overheating And Killing The Beneficial Probiotics. You Can Opt To Keep It On The Burner On Low To Keep Warm Until Veggies Are Done.
5. Assemble Soup: Add Noodles And Vegetables To Your Serving Bowl, Top With Broth And Add A Few Of The Garnishes. Some Other Optional Garnishes Would Be A Dash Or Two Of Sriracha Or Red Pepper Flakes.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days In A Covered Container.

title: STUFFED ACORN SQUASH + WILD RICE MEDLEY
ingredients:
1. 3 Acorn Squashes Cut In Half Lengthwise And Seeds Removed
2. Olive Oil To Roast Oilfree See Notes
3. 1 Teaspoon Thyme Divided
4. Sea Salt
5. Wild Rice Medley
6. 1 Cup Wild Rice Dry I Used Half Black Wild Rice And Half Long Grain Brown Rice
7. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
8. 1 Mediucupsarge Red Bell Pepper Diced
9. 1 Small Onion Or 1 Large Shallot Diced
10. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
11. 8 Oz Mushrooms About 2 Cups Sliced
12. 2 Large Handfuls Baby Spinach Baby Kale Or Chard Is Great Too Or A Combo
13. 1 Can Cannellini Beans 15 Oz Drained And Rinsed
14. 1 Teaspoon Thyme Dried Or Fresh
15. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Optional
16. Sea Salt And Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Or Silicone Mat. In An Ovenproof Saucepan, Fill Halfway With Water And Place On The Bottom Rack (This Will Give A Little Steam To Your Squash).
2. Prep And Roast The Squash: Cut And Seed Your Squash, Place On Baking Sheet With Cut Side Up. Brush Each Half With A Little Oil, And Season With A Sprinkle Of Thyme, Salt And Pepper. Place In The Oven And Bake For 40-45 Minutes, Until Tender, Knife Should Easily Pierce The Flesh. If By Chance Your Squash Is Done First, Cover With Foil To Keep It From Drying Out.
3. Rice: Cook Your Rice According To Package Directions. Wild Rice Will Take About The Same Time As The Squash To Cook, About 40-45 Min. Set Aside.
4. Veggies: In Large Pan, Heat Oil On Medium Heat. Add Onion And Cook For 5 Minutes, Add Garlic And Cook 1 Minutes. Add The Mushrooms, Bell Peppers, Thyme, Red Pepper Flakes, A Few Twists Of Salt And Pepper, Cook For Another 5 Minutes Or So, Until The Mushrooms Start To Sweat And Soften. Add The Beans And Leafy Greens, Stir Frequently Until They Are Wilted And Warmed Through (You May Also Want To Use A Cover In Between Stirring To Help Soften The Greens).
5. Wild Rice Medley: Combine The Rice And Sautéed Vegetables In The Larger Of The Two Pots. Taste For Seasoning Adding Additional Salt And Pepper As Needed.
6. Stuff: Scoop Mixture Into Each Acorn Squash Half And Serve With Any Additional Seasonings. I Actually Like To Top Mine With Some Sriracha For That Extra Heat And Flavor I Love So Much. :)
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In An Airtight Container In Fridge For Up To 4 – 5 Days.
8. Notes:
9. Quinoa Or Quinoa/Rice Combo Would Be Great Too And Add Even More Protein Per Serving.
10. To Make This Oil Free, Omit The Oil When Roasting The Squash And Roast The Squash Cut Side Down To Keep The Moisture In. You Can Still Add A Little Salt And Pepper, And Place A Sprig Of Thyme Underneath So The Flavor With Infuse The Squash A Little. Use Water In Place Of Oil When Sauteing The Vegetables.
11. Recommended Equipment:I Love Mysilpatortheseparchment Linersfor Lining Thisrimmed Baking Sheet(Affiliate Links). For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools,Shop My Kitchen Essentials!

title: Cuban Black Bean Soup
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Dried Black Beans Or 3 Cans  15 Oz Rinsed And Drained See Notes
2. 1 Large White Onion Chopped
3. 4 Garlic Cloves Chopped
4. 2 Stalks Celery Chopped
5. 2 Medium Carrots Chopped
6. 1 Medium Red Bell Pepper Cored And Chopped
7. 2 Bay Leafs
8. 1  2 Teaspoons Cumin
9. 1  2 Teaspoons Smoked Paprika
10. 3 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
11. Juice Of One Orange  Orange Halves
12. Himalayan Salt And Pepper To Taste
13. Garnish
14. Diced Tomatoes
15. Onion
16. Vegan Sour Cream
17. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Soak Beans: The Night Before, Rinse Beans In Colander With Cold Running Water. Pick Through And Remove Any Broken Or Shriveled Beans. Place Beans In Large Pot With 5 Or 6 Cups Water And Cover To Soak Overnight.
2. Pre-Cook Beans: Next Day, Drain Beans And Rinse Again. Place Beans Back In Pot, Add Water, Bring To A Boil And Simmer Covered For 1 Hour, Drain And Rinse.
3. Orange: Juice The Orange And Set The Juice Aside. Reserve The Orange Halves For The Soup.
4. Cook Soup: To The Pot Of Freshly Cooked Beans, Add The Bay Leaves, Garlic, Cumin, Paprika, Onion, Celery, Carrots, Bell Pepper, Water/Broth, Orange Halves, Salt And Pepper, Reserving The Orange Juice For Later. Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover, And Simmer For 40 Minutes To One Hour, Or Until Beans And Vegetables Are Tender, Stirring Occasionally. Add Extra Water As Necessary (I Used Another 1 Cup Of Water).
5. Puree: Once Beans Are Tender, Remove The Orange Halves And Bay Leaves. Use An Immersion Blender To Blend Soup To Desired Consistency. I Blended About 3/4, Leaving Some Chunkiness. You Could Also Use A Food Processor/Blender (This  May Take Two Batches To Complete). Blending Is Optional, You May Like It Chunky As Is. Add The Orange Juice To The Pureed Soup And Cook Another 5-10 Minutes.
6. To Serve: Serve Alone Or Over A Bed Of Cooked Buckwheat, Farro Or Brown Rice. Top Soup With A Dollop Of Sour Cream, Lime Cilantro Cashew ‘Sour Cream’ Or Paprika Cashew Crema. You May Also Like To Top It With Diced Onion, Tomatoes, Bell Peppers, Avocado, Jalapenos, A Squeeze Of Lime And/Or Cilantro.

title: VEGAN PUMPKIN SCONES + MAPLE GLAZE
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour Spelt Allpurpose Or Light Whole Wheat
2. 14 Cup Sugar Pure Cane Or Coconut Sugar
3. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 2 Teaspoons Pumpkin Pie Spice
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
6. Pinch Of Salt
7. 6 Tablespoons Hardened Coconut Oil Or Vegan Buttermargarine
8. 34 Cup 100 Pumpkin Puree
9. 13 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Your Favorite Nondairy Milk
10. Maple Glaze
11. 1 Cup Organic Powdered Sugar
12. 2 Teaspoons Pure Maple Syrup
13. 1 Tablespoon Unsweetened Almond Milk
preparation:
1. Glaze: In A Small/Medium Bowl, Add The Powdered Sugar, Maple Syrup And Non-Dairy Milk, Mix Well And Set Aside. Glaze Should Be Thick. If Glaze Is Thin, Place In The Refrigerator To Chill And Thicken.
2. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper, A Silpat, Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
3. Mix: In A Medium Size Bowl, Mix The Flour, Baking Powder, Sugar, Pumpkin Spice And Salt, Blend Well. Add The Hardened Oil, And Using Either A Pastry Blender Or Mixing Spoon, Mix Well. Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect. Add The Pumpkin Puree, Vanilla, And Non-Dairy Milk To The Mixture, Stir To Form A Dough. Using Your Hands, Knead The Dough Into An Even Ball.
4. Shape & Cut Dough: Transfer The Dough To A Lightly Floured Surface. Lightly Flour The Top Of The Dough And Pat Into A 8 – 9 Inch Circle, 1 Inch High. Using A Knife, Gently Divide The Dough Into 6 – 8 Slices.
5. Bake: Place The Scones On The Prepared Baking Sheet. Place In The Oven On The Center Rake And Bake For About 18 Minutes, Until Lightly Golden Along The Edges. Let Cool A Bit Before Transferring To A Cooling Rack.
6. Glaze Scones: Once Cooled, Place A Spoonful Right In The Middle Of Each Scone And Use The Back Of The Spoon To Spread, Or Drizzle The Glaze In A Zig Zag Across The Top Of Each Scone. Let The Glaze Set.
7. Makes 6 – 8
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container, Either On The Counter Or In The Refrigerator, And Eat Within A Couple Of Days.

title: EVERYDAY DETOX SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Beet With Greens Beet Julienned Or Grated And Greens Julienned
2. 1 Large Apple Cored And Diced
3. 2 Medium Carrots Grated
4. 12 Cup Cilantro Roughly Chopped
5. 12 Cup Organic Raisins Or Golden Raisins
6. A Few Tablespoons Hemp Hearts Or Sesame Seeds To Serve
7. Ginger Lime Dressing
8. 3  4 Tablespoons Lime Juice Lemon Is Fine Too
9. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Finely Grated I Used A Microplane
10. 18 Teaspoon Ground Cardamom Or To Taste
11. 12  1 Teaspoon Pure Maple Syrup Or Coconut Nectar Optional
preparation:
1. In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Dressing Ingredients. Set Aside To Let The Flavors Mellow And Come Together. Check Dressing For Flavor Before Serving.
2. Prepare Your Salad Ingredients And Use 3 To 4 Large Beet Leaves (About 1 Cup Lightly Packed) And Place All Ingredients In A Large Bowl. Pour Dressing Over The Salad Ingredients, Toss To Coat. (You Can Also Make This Ahead Of Time And Keep Refrigerated Until Ready To Serve.)
3. Serve Topped With A Good Sprinkle Of Hemp Hearts Or Sesame Seeds, And Some Extra Raisins If You Like As They Add A Nice Sweetness.

title: VEGAN WHITE PIZZA RECIPE
ingredients:
1. 1 2 Zucchini Sliced Thin
2. 1 2 Yellow Squash Sliced Thin
3. 14 Red Onion Thinly Sliced
4. 4 Plain Or Whole Grain Vegan Naan Bread
5. White Sauce
6. 1 Block Organic Tofu 14  16 Oz Soft
7. 2  3 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast
8. 2  3 Teaspoons Mellow White Miso
9. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
10. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
11. Dash Of Pepper Black Or White
12. Generous Pinch Himalayan Salt
13. Juice Of 1 Lemon
14. A Few Parsley Tops
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. White Pizza Sauce: Place All Ingredients In The Bowl Of A Food Processor/Blender And Blend Until Creamy. Taste For Spices Adding Anything You May Like. Makes About 2 Cups. I Had Leftovers.
3. Prep Veggies: Slice Your Zucchini And Onions Very Thinly. You Can Use A Mandolin Or Put Your Knife Skills To Work And Slice.
4. Assemble Pizza: Spread A Layer Of The Ricotta On Your Flatbread And Top With Zucchini, Yellow Squash And Onion Slices. Add A Sprinkle Of Salt And Pepper.
5. Bake: Place Pizza On Cookie Sheet Lined With Parchment Paper And Bake For About 15 Minutes.

title: VEGAN BUDDHA BOWL + LEMON THAINI SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 1 Broccoli Head Cut Into Florets
2. 1 Cauliflower Head Cut Into Florets
3. Large Handful Radishes Halved Or Quartered Depending On The Size
4. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed Or 1 12 Cups Cooked
5. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or Sesame Oil
6. Generous Sprinkle Of Garlic Powder
7. Pinch Or Two Of Salt
8. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa Rinse If You Pref
9. 1 34 Cups Water
10. Chopped Fresh Parsley To Garnish
11. Creamy Lemon Buddha Bowl Sauce
12. 14 Cup Tahini
13. 2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
14. Juice Of 1 Large Lemon
15. Mineral Salt To Taste
16. 2  4 Tablespoons Water For Thinning
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees.
2. Roast Veggies: In A Large Bowl, Combine Chickpeas, Broccoli, Cauliflower And Radishes, Drizzle With Oil, Garlic Powder And Salt, Mix Well To Coat. Place Mixture On Rimmed Cookie Sheet Or Roasting Pan. Cook For 30 – 35 Minutes, Stirring Once In Between.
3. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot Add Quinoa And 1 3/4 Cup Water. Sprinkle In A Dash Or Two Of Garlic Powder And Mineral Salt. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover And Let Rest For 10 Minutes. Fluff With Fork.
4. Tahini Dressing: In A Small Bowl Mix Together The Tahini, Optional Nutritional Yeast, Lemon Juice, Salt And 2 Tablespoons Water, Combine Well. Add More Water As Needed To Thin. If Too Thin, Add A Tad More Tahini. Taste For Flavor Adding More Salt Or Lemon To Taste.
5. Serve: In Individual Bowls, Place Vegetables On Top Of 1/2 -2/3 Cup Quinoa, Add A Generous Amount Of Sauce On Top – Don’T Be Shy With The Sauce, It’S So Good And Healthy. Add Freshly Chopped Parsley And Cracked Pepper Or Lemon Pepper If You Like.
6. Store: Leftover Quinoa And Vegetables Can Be Kept In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To A 5 – 6 Days.

title: SESAME CABBAGE SALAD (QUICK + HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 1 Head Of Cabbage Shredded Green Napa Or Savoy
2. 14 Head Purple Cabbage Shredded Optional
3. 1 Cucumber Sliced Thin And Cut In Half Moons
4. 1 Cup Grated Carrots
5. 2  3 Green Onions Thinly Sliced
6. 13 Cup Radish Thinly Sliced And Cut Into Half Moons
7. 14 Cup Chopped Cilantro
8. 1 Tablespoon Raw Sesame Seeds To Garnish
9. Dressing
10. 5 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
11. 1 Tablespoon Tahini
12. 1 Tablespoon Dijon
13. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup Optional
14. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl Whisk Together The Apple Cider Vinegar, Tahini, Dijon, Salt, And Pepper. Set Aside To Let The Flavors Develop.
2. Assemble: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Cabbage, Cucumber, Carrots, Radish, Green Onions, And Cilantro. Pour The Dressing Over Top And Toss Well To Coat. Sprinkle With Sesame Seeds.
3. Chill: Place In The Refrigerator, Covered, For 2 – 3 Hours To Chill And Soften. Alternatively, Enjoy Right Away.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days In A Covered Container. Give A Good Mix Before Serving.

title: WHITE BEAN & CAULIFLOWER ALFREDO (VEGAN + HEALTHY )
ingredients:
1. Alfredo Sauce Makes Approx 4 Cups
2. 1 Can Cannellini Beans 15 Oz Drained And Rinsed
3. 1 Small Head Cauliflower
4. 1 14 Cups Unsweetened Nondairy Milk
5. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
6. 1 Large Shallot Or 12 Onion Diced
7. 14 Teaspoon Nutmeg
8. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. 1 Or 2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional I Didnt Use Any
10. 16 Oz Pasta Any Type I Used Penne
11. Optional Side Of Veggies
12. 5  6 Kale Leaves Stem Removed And Chopped
13. 13 Cup Sundried Tomatoes
14. 8 Oz Mushrooms Sliced
15. Generous Pinch Red Pepper Flakes To Taste
preparation:
1. Alfredo Sauce: Remove Any Leaves And Core The Bottom Of The Cauliflower. Cut Cauliflower Into Large Florets And Place In Pot Of Boiling Water. Cook For About 20 Minutes, Or Until Soft, Drain. While Cauliflower Is Cooking, Heat 1 Tablespoon Of Olive Oil In Saute Pan Over Medium To Medium High Heat, Add Shallots And Cook Until Soft And Lightly Browned.
2. Place Cooked Cauliflower In Blender/Food Processor Along With Beans, Milk, Shallots And Nutmeg. Blend Until Creamy. Taste For Flavor Adding Salt, Pepper And Any Other Spice You Might Like. Also, If Sauce Is Too Thick Add A Splash Or So More Milk (Or Water) As Needed, Blend Again.
3. Veggies:In Same Saute Pan You Cooked The Shallots, Heat 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Mushrooms, Kale, Sun-Dried Tomatoes And Red Pepper Flakes. Saute Kale Until It Has Sweated Down, Approx 5 Min. You Could Use A Cover To Help. Turn Off Heat When Done.
4. Pasta:Cook According To Package Instruction :.
5. Assemble: Place Cooked Pasta Back To The Same Pot It Was Cooked In, Add As Much Sauce As You Like. Stir Gently To Coat. Add A Tad More Sauce If Needed. Alternately, Add The Veggie Mix To The Pasta And Mix. Turn Heat To Low And Cook Until Warmed Through Adding A Splash Or So Of Milk If Needed To Keep From Drying Out. We Want To Keep It Moist And Creamy.
6. Pairs Well With This Artisan Bread!
7. Store: Keep Remaining Sauce Or Any Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Fridge. Will Last Up To A Week. When Reheating, Add More Non-Dairy Milk To Maintain Creaminess If Needed.

title: CHICKPEA AVOCADO SALAD SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Cooked Chickpeas Or 1 Can 15 Oz Drained And Rinsed
2. 1 Avocado Flesh Only
3. 1 Small Carrot About 14 Cup Finely Diced
4. Juice Of 1 Lemon
5. Dash Or Two Of Garlic Powder
6. Salt  Pepper To Taste
7. To Serve
8. Leafy Greens
9. 6 Slices Whole Grain Bread Or Your Favorite
10. Red Onion Slices
11. Sliced Tomatoes Optional
preparation:
1. Mash Chickpeas: In A Medium Size Bowl, Add Chickpeas And Roughly Mash 3/4 Of The Chickpeas With The Back Of A Strong Fork. You Can Also Use A Potato Masher Or Pastry Blender.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients. Add Avocado, Carrots, Lemon Juice, Garlic Powder, Salt And Pepper, Mash And Mix To Combine.
3. Assemble Sandwich: Layer Your Bread Slices With Leafy Greens, Onion And A Nice Helping Of The Mash. Top With Remaining Slice And Enjoy!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In A Covered Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 – 3 Days.

title: COCONUT GINGER BANANA ICE CREAM
ingredients:
1. 3 Frozen Bananas
2. 3 Tablespoons Coconut Coconut Butter Coconut Milk Or Shredded Coconut
3. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
4. 1 Tablespoon Fresh Ginger Minced
5. Splash Or Two Of Unsweetened Vanilla Nondairy Milk
preparation:
1. Place Ingredients Into Your Food Processor/Blender, Except Milk, Process, Adding Milk As Needed Through The Feeder To Help Move The Mixture Around, Blend Until Fairly Smooth And Creamy.
2. For Soft-Serve: Eat Right Away.
3. For Ice Cream: Place Mixture Into A Freezer-Safe Container, Cover And Place In The Freezer For At Least 4 Hours Before Serving. Scoop Out Like Ice Cream And Serve.
4. Serve With Mini Chocolate Chips, Shredded Coconut, Or Whatever You Like.

title: CRUNCHY THAI QUINOA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
2. 1 34 Cups Of Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
5. 1 Cucumber Diced
6. 1 Cup Carrots Diced
7. 14 Red Cabbage Shredded
8. 2  3 Scallions Thinly Sliced
9. 12 Cup Cilantro Lightly Packed Chopped
10. Handful Of Peanuts Or Cashews Optional
11. 4 Tablespoons Nut Butter Peanut Almond Cashew Or Sunbutter
12. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
13. 1 Teaspoon Tamari Nama Shoyu Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos
14. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Minced Or Grated
15. 1  2 Limes Divided
16. Mineral Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot, Add Quinoa, Water, And Garlic Powder, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove Cover, Fluff With A Fork And Let Rest For 10 Minutes. Alternatively, If You Have A Pressure Cooker, This Instant Pot Quinoa Recipe Is Super Easy!
2. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Nut Butter, Pure Maple Syrup, Tamai, Ginger, Juice Of 1 Lime. Add A Little Water, 1 Tablespoon At A Time, As Needed To Thin. Taste For Flavor, Season With Salt To Taste.
3. Assemble Salad: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Cooked Quinoa, Bell Pepper, Cucumber, Carrots, Cabbage, Scallions, And Cilantro. Drizzle With The Nut Butter Dressing And Toss To Combine. Alternatively, Toss The Quinoa And Veggies, And Add Dressing Once Plated.
4. Serve: Spoon Into Individual Bowls, Top With Optional Crunchy Nuts And Squeeze Of Lime.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days.

title: WHITE BEAN + TOMATILLO SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Dry Northern Beans Or 3 Cans 15 Oz Cannellini Beans Or Navy Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth For Water Saute
3. 1 White Onion Diced
4. 2  3 Garlic Cloves Diced
5. 1 12 Lb Tomatillos About 1113 Husks Removed Washed And Quartered Or Cut Into 6 Pieces
6. 1  2 Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced
7. 6 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Waterbroth Combo
8. 12 Teaspoon Cumin
9. 12 Teaspoon Coriander
10. Mineral Salt To Taste
11. Pinch Or Two Red Pepper Flakes I Like It For A Little Color
12. To Serve Optional
13. Chopped Cilantro
14. Avocado
15. Lime Wedges
16. Sliced Radishes
17. Corn Or Flour Tortillas Organic Tortilla Chips Would Be Great Too
preparation:
1. Beans: If Using Dried Beans, Wash And Pick Through Removing Any Unsightly Beans Or Pebbles. Soak Beans Overnight Or Quick Soak Them According To Package Directions. Drain And Rinse Beans Well. Place In A Medium Size Bowl Until Ready To Use. If Using Canned Beans Go To The Next Step And Add The Drained And Rinsed Canned Beans As Called For Below.
2. Tomatillos: Prepare Your Tomatillos By Removing The Husks And Washing Them Well To Remove Any Of The Sticky Residue. Chop Into Quarters Or Six Pieces Depending On The Size Of Your Fruits. Cut And Remove Seeds From Your Jalapeno, And Dice. Dice Your Onion And Garlic.
3. Saute + Simmer: In A Large Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium High Heat, Add Onion, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add In The Garlic, Tomatillos, Jalapeno, Cumin, Coriander, And A Pinch Or Two Of Salt, Saute Another 5 Minutes. Add In The Beans And Liquids, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 1 1/2 – 2 Hours (90 – 120 Minutes), Or Until Beans Are Tender, Stirring Occasionally. If Using Canned Beans, Cook For 20 – 30 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. Season To Taste.
4. Serve: Ladle Soup Into Individual Bowls And Serve With Diced Avocado, Cilantro, Lime Wedges And Tortillas.

title: ONE-POT PENNE PASTA W/ MUSHROOMS + SAUSAGE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Onion Sliced
3. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 2  3 Vegan Sausages Sliced Tofurky Or Field Roast
5. 1 Lb Mushrooms Sliced
6. 1 Can 28 Oz Crushed Tomatoes
7. 1 Teaspoon Dried Basil
8. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
9. 12 Teaspoon Fennel Seeds Optional
10. 4 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water Or Combo
11. 1 1B Penne Pasta I Used Whole Grain
12. 14  13 Cup Chopped Parsley
13. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Onion And Saute For 4 – 5 Minutes. Add Garlic And Sausage, Cook Another 1 Minute, Stirring Occasionally.
2. Cook: Add The Mushrooms, Tomatoes, Basil, Oregano, Optional Fennel, Broth/Water, Pasta, And A Good Pinch Of Salt & Twist Of Fresh Cracked Pepper. Bring Mixture To A Boil, Give Good Stir, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Let Simmer At A Constant Gentle Rolling Boil For 15 Minutes, Stir Occasionally. Remove From Heat, Stir In A Little Parsley And Give A Good Stir.
3. Serve With A Little Extra Parsley Over Top And A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan. Pair It With A Slice Of Your Favorite Crusty Bread.

title: EASY VEGAN PANCAKES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Spelt Flour Or Flour Of Choice
2. 2 Tablespoons Organic Cane Sugar Or Coconut Palm Sugar
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder This Will Make Them Nice And Fluffy
4. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
5. 1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Nondairy Milk Of Choice
6. 1 Small Lemon Juice Of Or 2 Teaspoons Apple Cider Vinegar
7. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
8. 1  2 Teaspoons Coconut Oil For Cooking
preparation:
1. Vegan Buttermilk: To Make A Vegan Buttermilk, Add Juice Of Small Lemon To The Milk And Let Rest For About 10 Minutes. This Can Be Optional.
2. Preheat: If Using Griddle Preheat To Manufacturers Instruction :.
3. Make Batter: Combine Flour, Salt, Sugar And Baking Powder Into A Medium Bowl Or Wide-Mouthed Pitcher. Add Milk And Vanilla, Mix Until Well Combined.
4. Cook: If Using A Skillet, Heat Oil On Medium Heat. Place Batter On Griddle/Skillet (I Like To Scoop The Batter Using A 1/4 Or 1/3 Cup Measuring Cup For Uniform Pancakes), Cook Until Bubbles Form Around The Edges Or Top And Flip, About 3 Minutes Per Side.
5. Keep Warm: If Needed, Keep The Pancakes Warm In A Preheated Oven Set To 200 Degrees, On A Baking Sheet.
6. Serve With Syrup, Fresh Fruit Or Any Dessert Sauce Of Choice.
7. Makes About 6 Pancakes, Serves 3
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 7 Days In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For 2 – 3 Months. Reheat In Toaster Oven Or Microwave.

title: VEGAN CORN CHOWDER
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 3  4 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 1 Medium Red Bell Pepper Diced
5. 2 Celery Ribs Or Green Bell Pepper Diced
6. 1 Teaspoon Thyme
7. 12  1 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
8. 2 Bay Leaves
9. 4 12 Cups Vegetable Broth
10. 8 Ears Of Corn Shucked Or 6  7 Cups Frozen Or Canned
11. 1Lb Potatoes Any Regular Or Sweet Cubed Into 12 Inches
12. 34 Cup Raw Cashews Or 1 Can 14Oz Coconut Milk Or Cream
13. Salt  Pepper To Taste
14. To Garnish Optional
15. Chopped Fresh Parsley Chives Or Green Onions
16. Red Pepper Flakes
17. A Sprinkle Of Smoked Paprika Or Nutritional Yeast
18. Coconut Bacon
19. Shredded Vegan Cheese
preparation:
1. Cashew Cream: If Using Cashews, Soak 3/4 Cup Of Raw Cashews In Warm Water For 5 Minutes. Drain. Puree The Cashews With 3/4 Cup Of Water. Set Aside. If Using Canned Coconut Milk, Skip This Step.
2. Saute:In A Large Dutch Oven, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion, Celery, And Red Bell Pepper, Saute For 7 Minutes. Add The Garlic, Thyme, And Optional Smoked Paprika After 5 Minutes.
3. Simmer:Add The Corn, Potatoes, Bay Leaves, And Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover Askew, And Simmer For 15 Minutes (Or Until Potatoes Are Fork-Tender). Add The Vegan Cream Or Coconut Milk 5 Minutes Before Soup Is Done. Remove From Heat.
4. Puree:Let Chowder Cool A Few Minutes And Remove The Bay Leaves. Transfer 2 – 3 Cups Of The Soup To A Blender And Puree. Add Back To The Soup, Stir Well, And Season To Taste With Salt And Pepper. For A Thicker Soup, Puree Up To Half. Soup Will Thicken Upon Standing.
5. Serve:Ladle Into Individual Bowls And Top With Your Favorite Toppings.

title: Southern Blackberry Cobbler (Vegan + Easy)
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Flour
2. 12 Cup Sugar
3. 1 Heaped Teaspoon Baking Powder
4. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon
5. 1 Cup Unsweetened Vanilla Plant Milk Warmed If Using Coconut Oil
6. 13 Cup Coconut Oil Or Vegan Buttermargarine Warmed To Liquid State
7. 2  3 Cups About 12Oz Blackberries Fresh Or Frozen
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Batter: In A Medium Bowl, Whisk Together The Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, And Cinnamon. Be Sure To Warm Your Milk If Using Coconut Oil Before Using Or It Will Harden The Coconut Oil When Combined. Add Milk And Mix Well. Add Oil/Butter, Mix Well Again.
3. Assemble: Pour Batter Into An 8-Inch Baking Dish. Drop Blackberries Into The Batter, Distributing Evenly All Over. Push Down Some Of The Blackberries Into The Batter, Then Add More Over Top. Sprinkle A Little Pure Cane Sugar Over Top If You Like. I Would Refrain From Using Coconut Sugar As It May Burn. If You Want To Add Coconut Sugar, Sprinkle Some At Least Halfway Through Baking Time.
4. Bake: Place In Oven On The Middle Rack And Bake For 40 – 45 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes And Serve.
5. Serve: Pair With A Scoop Of Non-Dairy Vanilla Ice Cream For Dessert And A Scoop Of Vanilla Non-Dairy Yogurt For Breakfast (Yes, This Would Be A Fine Way To Start Your Day!)
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days. Warm Serving Portions In The Microwave Or Oven Set To 350 For 10 – 15 Minutes.

title: SOUTHWEST TOFU SCRAMBLE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saut
2. 1 Block 14  16 Oz Organic Tofu Firm Or Extrafirm
3. 12 Onion Diced
4. 6 Oz Mushrooms Sliced
5. 1 Cup Broccoli Florets
6. Handful Cherry Tomatoes Whole Or Halved Or 1 Large Tomato Diced
7. Large Handful Greens Spinach Kale Or Chard
8. 12 Teaspoon Turmeric
9. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
10. 12 Teaspoon Cumin
11. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or 14 Teaspoon Cayenne Pepper
12. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
13. 1 Or 2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional For A Cheesy Flavor
14. To Serve
15. Avocado
16. Salsa Or Pico De Gallo
