17. Cilantro Optional
18. Sliced Green Onions Optional
preparation:
1. Drain Tofu. No Need To Press And Get It All, We’Ll Cook It Long Enough On The Stove To Remove The Remaining Moisture. Set Tofu Aside.
2. Sauté Onion: In A Skillet Or Wok, Heat Oil On Medium, Add The Onions And Sauté For 4 Minutes.
3. Add Tofu: Add Tofu To The Pan While Crumbling Chunks Between Your Fingers, Cook For 4 Minutes.
4. Add Veggies & Spices: Add The Mushrooms, Broccoli, Tomatoes, Cumin, Turmeric, Garlic Powder, Salt, Pepper And Red Pepper Flakes, Cook For 5 Minutes.
5. Add Leafy Greens & ‘Nooch’: Add The Greens And Nutritional Yeast, Stir And Cook Until The Greens Soften And Wilt. Remove Pan From Heat.
6. Serve With Salsa, Avocado And Season More To Taste.
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: ALMOND FLOUR VEGAN THUMBPRINT COOKIES
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Almond Flour I Used Bobs Red Mill Fine Af
2. Pinch Of Salt
3. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
4. 14 Cup Light Flavored Olive Oil
5. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
6. 13 Cup Slivered Almonds Crushed Or Chopped Optional
7. 3 Tablespoons Triple Berry Chia Seed Jam Or Your Favorite Jam Divided
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silicon Mat.
2. Make The Dough: In A Medium Bowl, Whisk Together The Maple Syrup, Olive Oil And Vanilla. Add The Almond Flour And Salt, Mix Well Until The Mixture Forms A Soft Dough Consistency.
3. Almonds: Place The Crushed Almonds In A Small Bowl, Set Aside.
4. Shape The Cookies: Roll Dough Into 1 Inch Balls (I Used A 1 Tablespoon Measuring Scoop, Scooping Up Rounded Tablespoons Full Of Dough). Roll The Dough Balls In The Crushed Almonds, And Place On A Rimmed Baking Sheet, About 2 Inches Apart.
5. Add The Jam: Using Your Thumb Or The Back Of 1/2 Teaspoon Measuring Spoon, Make An Indent In The Center Of Each Cookie. Pinch Together Any Large Cracks Around The Sides Of Each Cookie. Fill The Indent With 1/2 Teaspoon Of Jam.
6. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 10 – 15 Minutes, Oven May Vary (See Notes). Once Done, The Cookies Will Be Soft And Harden As They Cool.
7. Makes 16 – 18 Cookies
8. Store: Store Loosely Covered On The Counter For Up To 3 – 4 Days. You Can Also Keep Them In An Airtight Container, Just Note They Will Soften A Bit But Will Still Be Chewy. Or Keep In A Covered Container In The Refrigerator For 7 – 10 Days. To Freeze, Let Cool And Store In Freezer Safe Containers With Parchment Paper Between Each Layer, Will Keep For To 2 Months.

title: BAKED SWEET POTATO SHOESTRING FRIES
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Sweet Potato Per Person
2. Drizzle Of Olive Oil
3. Mineral Salt To Taste
4. Light Dusting Of Cornmeal Optional
5. Optional Flavor Variations
6. Sprinkle Of Garlic Powder Ground Chipotle Thyme Cayenne Or Smoked Paprika To Taste And Depending On Your Mood Or Any Combo You Like
preparation:
1. Hand Cut :
2. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees If Slicing By Hand. (If Julienning See Baking Instruction : Below)
3. Wash Your Potatoes And Remove Any Unsightly Areas.
4. Hand Cut: Slice The Sweet Potato In Half, Place Flat Side Down And Cut Thin Slices, About 1/4 Inch Thick Or Smaller. Then Turn Your Thinly Sliced Pieces On Their Side And Do The Same As Before Cutting Thin Slices. Try To Get Them As Uniform In Thickness As Possible So They Cook Evenly. You May Have To Go Through After Cutting And Double Check Your Work.
5. Assemble: Place Potatoes On Your Rimmed Cookie Sheet/S (I Used Two), Add A Small Amount Of Olive Oil (About 1 Tablespoon), Toss Gently To Coat. Place Potatoes In A Single Layer, Preferably Spread Out So They Don’T Touch Much, Sprinkle With Mineral Salt And Seasoning Of Choice.
6. Bake: Place In The Oven For 15 Minutes, Remove Sheet/S And Rotate Positions, Bake For Another 15 -20 Minutes. Keep An Eye On Them After 15 Minutes So They Don’T Burn. You May Lose Some, And Ending Cooking Times Will Greatly Depend On Your Oven. Allow To Cool A Few Minutes. They Will Crisp Up As They Cool.
7. Best Served Immediately With Choice Of Condiments.
8. Julienne :
9. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. (They Will Be A Bit Thinner And Should Be Baked At A Lower Temp But For The Same Amount Of Time As If Slicing By Hand.)
10. Wash Potatoes And Remove Any Unsightly Areas.
11. Julienne: Trim The Ends If You Like (I Usually Skip This Step). Julienne Your Sweet Potato.
12. Assemble: Place On Cookie Sheet, You May Need Two, Toss With Oil, Spread In A Single Layer As Much As You Can, And Sprinkle With Spices.
13. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 15 Minutes. Turn Sheet Around And Rotate Positions. You Can Also Use A Fork And Lift The Shoestring Fries Up Moving Them Around A Bit. Bake For Another 15 – 20 Minutes, Careful Towards The End As They May Cook And Burn Quickly At This Point. Keep An Eye On Them, Removing Any Pieces That Are Too Brown. You May Lose Some, And Ending Cooking Times Will Greatly Depend On Your Oven. Allow Them To Cool A Few Minutes, They Will Crisp Up A Bit.
14. Best Served Right Away With Choice Of Condiments.

title: GREEN BEANS ALMONDINE (AMANDINE)
ingredients:
1. 12 Oz French Green Beans Regular Green Beans Ok Too
2. 2 Tablespoons Vegan Butter I Recommend Miyokos
3. 12 Cup Slivered Almonds
4. 1  2 Lemons Juice Of
5. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Green Beans: Add 1 – 2 Cups Of Water And Generous Pinch Of Salt To A Heavy Bottom Pot, Add Green Beans And Bring To A Boil. Reduce Heat To Medium And Cook, Uncovered, Until Green Beans Brighten In Color, About 4 – 5 Minutes. Transfer Green Beans To A Serving Tray Or Casserole. Cover To Keep Warm.
2. Almonds: Using The Same Pot, Melt The Butter, Add The Almonds And Cook Until Golden, Stirring Often, About 5 – 6 Minutes.
3. Assemble: Spoon The Almonds Over Top The Green Beans, Add A Sprinkle Of Salt And Squeeze Of Lemon. Alternately, Toss The Ingredients Together In A Serving Bowl, Instead Of Layering.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days, In A Covered Container. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: HEALTHY NO BAKE CHOCOLATE CHIP ENERGY BALLS
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Raw Almonds
2. 12 Cup Old Fashioned Oats Use Quick Oats If Needed
3. 14 Cup Almond Or Peanut Butter Sun Butter Is Ok Too
4. 7  8 Medjool Dates Pitted And Chopped
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
6. 2 Tablespoons Water  Plus More As Needed
7. 13  12 Cup Dark Mini Or Regular Chocolate Chips Cacao Or Carob Nibs Or Raw Chocolate
8. Optional Add Ins
9. 14 Cup Shredded Coconut Flakes
10. 12 Teaspoon Or So Of Cinnamon
preparation:
1. Make Flour: Start By Processing The Almonds And Oats, By Pulsing Them Into A Rough Flour. It Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect And Can Be Even Chunkier Than Shown Above.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add The Remaining Ingredients, Except For Chocolate Chips. Blend, Scraping Down The Sides As Needed, Until Combined. (I Like To Leave Mine A Little On The Chunky Side). Add 1 Or 2 Tablespoons More Water As Needed.
3. Add Chocolate Chips: Remove Mixture And Place In A Medium Size Bowl, Mix In The Chocolate Chips.
4. Chill: Refrigerate For About 20 Minutes, It Will Help The Mixture Stiffen A Bit Making It Easier To Handle.
5. Roll: Scoop Dough And Roll Into 1 Inch Balls Or Flatten Like A Cookie. If Forming Them Into Balls You May Like To Roll Them In Cacao Powder, Cinnamon Or Shredded Coconut. I’Ve Done All Three And All Were Great!
6. Makes Approx. 16 – 18 Energy Bites
7. Store: Keep In The Refrigerator And Enjoy Within 1 – 2 Weeks. They Also Freeze Well.

title: Vegan Pumpkin Pancakes (Easy + Healthy)
ingredients:
1. 1 14 Cups Flour I Used Spelt
2. 3 Tablespoons Organic Cane Sugar
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 34 Teaspoon Pumpkin Pie Spice Or Cinnamon
5. Pinch Of Salt
6. 12 Heaping Cup 100 Pumpkin Puree
7. 1 14 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
8. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
9. 1  2 Tablespoon Coconut Oil For Griddle
10. Pure Maple Syrup To Serve
preparation:
1. Preheat: Preheat Griddle To Manufacturers Instruction :, Usually About 350 Degrees For Pancakes. Alternately, If Using A Stove-Top Griddle/Skillet, Heat Over Medium Heat. Preheat Oven To 200 Degrees (For Keeping Pancakes Warm), Place Cookie Sheet On Middle Rack While Oven Is Warming.
2. Mix: In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add The Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, And Spice, Mix Well. Add In The Pumpkin Puree, Vanilla, And Non-Dairy Milk, Mix Well.
3. Cook: Add Enough Oil To Coat The Griddle/Skillet. Using A 1/4 Measuring Cup, Scoop Batter And Place On Griddle. Let Cook About 3 Minutes, Edges Will Bubble Slightly And Start To Look Leathery, Flip And Cook Another 3 Minutes. Add Oil To The Griddle/Skillet, And Repeat Until Batter Is Gone.
4. Place Finished Pancakes On The Warm Cookie Sheet, Place In The Oven To Keep Warm While Cooking The Remaining Pancakes.
5. Serve With Pure Maple Syrup. Adding 2 Tablespoonsof Chopped Pecans Over Top Will Add Protein And Texture.
6. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days, Or Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months. Reheat In The Microwave Or Toaster Oven.
7. Makes About 6 – 8 Pancakes, Serving 3 – 4.

title: FAVORITE VEGAN BROWNIES
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup 113G Nondairy Butter Applesauce Or Light Flavored Olive Oil
2. 1 14 Cups 282G Sugar Organic Pure Cane Or Coconut
3. 3 Flax Eggs See Instructions
4. 1 Tablespoon Vanilla Extract
5. 1 Cup 125G Flour Allpurpose Spelt Whole Wheat Or Gluten Free Allpurpose
6. 23 Cup 65G Cocoacacao Powder
7. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
8. Generous Pinch Of Salt
9. 2 Oz Dark Chocolate Bar Chopped
10. Coarse Salt For Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line And 8 X 8 Baking Dish With Parchment Paper, Or Lightly Grease With Oil. If Using A 9 X 13 Baking Dish, See Recipe Instruction : Below.
2. Flax Egg: In A Small Bowl, Combine 3 Heaped Tablespoons Flaxseed Meal With 1/2 Cup Water Or Unsweetened Non-Dairy Milk. Let Rest For 10 Minutes To Thicken.
3. Mix: In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add The 1/2 Cup Butter/Oil/Applesauce And Sugar, Mix Well. Add In The Flax Eggs And Vanilla, Mix Again. Add In The Flour, Cocoa Powder, Baking Powder And Salt, Mix Well To Combine. May Take A Minute Or So To Completely Become Mixed.
4. Pour: Pour Brownie Batter Into The Center Of The Prepared Baking Dish. Spread To The Edges As Needed. Optionally Top With Chopped Chunks Of Dark Chocolate Or Vegan Chocolate Chips.
5. Bake: Place In The Center Of The Oven And Bake For 25 – 30 Minutes.
6. Cool: Let Cool In The Baking Dish. If You Used Parchment Paper, After 5 – 10 Minutes, Lift The Edges And Move The Brownies To A Wire Rack To Cool.
7. Store: Keep Loosely Covered On The Counter For Up To 4 – 5 Days. They Keep Longer In The Refrigerator, Up To 2 Weeks.

title: HEALTHY APPLE NACHOS (5-MINUTE)
ingredients:
1. 2 Apples Of Choice
2. 14  13 Cup Natural Nut Butter Peanut Almond Sunflower Etc
3. Small Handful Chocolate Chips I Used Enjoy Life Mini Chips
4. Small Handful Shredded Coconut
5. Small Handful Slivered Almonds Optional
6. Sprinkle Of Cinnamon
7. 1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice
8. Optional Toppings
9. Hemp Hearts
10. Cacao Nibs
11. Raisins Or Currants
12. Ground Cardamom
13. Pure Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Apples: Wash, Core And Cut Your Apples Into 1/4 Inch Slices. I Like To Cut Mine Into Quarters, Take A Small Paring Knife And Carefully Remove The Core And Upper And Lower End Where Dirt May Still Be Collected (Even After Washing). Lay Apple Quarters On A Flat Surface With The Inside Of The Apple Facing Up, Carefully Slice Your Apple Into 1/4 Inch Slices, Even 1/2 Inch Slices Is Good Too. Whatever Thickness You Prefer, No Rules Here! Place Apple Slices In A Small Bowl With The Lemon Juice, Toss To Coat.
2. Nut Butter: Heat Your Nut Butter Just Until Warmed And Somewhat Runny. I Like To Heat Mine By Using A Small Silicon Bowl Placed In A Small Pot With Just Enough Water To Reach Half Way Up The Side Of The Silicon Bowl, Heat Water On Low And Gently Heat The Nut Butter Until Warm And Drizzable. Alternatively, Warm In The Microwave For 20 – 30 Seconds.
3. Assemble: On A Serving Plate, Lay Your Apple Slices In A Single Layer Around The Outside Edge, Then Layer Another Small Layer Over Those But Towards The Inside Center Of The Plate (Like Shown In The Picture Above). Drizzle The Nut Butter In A Circular Motion, From The Middle Of The Plate To The Outside Edge. You Can Also Just Zig Zag The Almond Butter From One Side To The Other If You Like. Again, No Rules – Just Do What You Feel Is Best! Top With Chocolate Chips, Coconut Flakes, Almonds And Sprinkle Of Cinnamon (Or Whatever You’Ve Chosen To Use As Your Toppings).
4. Enjoy This Simple Yet Delicious Treat!

title: CILANTRO LIME RICE
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Long Grain Rice My Fav Is Basmati Or Canilla
2. 2 Cups Water
3. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 1 Bay Leaves
5. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
6. 12 Bunch Cilantro Chopped Leaves And A Few Stems
7. 2  3 Limes Juice Of About 2  3 Tablespoons
preparation:
1. First Step: To Rinse The Rice Or Not? It Is Recommended To Rinse Rice Before Cooking To Remove Any Loose Starches That May Make Your Cooked Rice To Become Gummy. I Almost Never Do This, But If You Find Your Rice Does Become Gummy, You May Need To Make A Habit Of It. If Using Canilla Rice, Which Calls For Skipping This Step To Keep All The Nutrients, I’Ve Never Had A Problem With Gumminess Using This Rice.
2. Stovetop: Add The Rice, Water, Garlic Powder, Bay Leaf And Salt To A Medium Sauce Pan, Add The Water And Bring To A Boil. Reduce Heat To Low, Cover, And Cook Over A Gentle Boil For 18 – 20 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Remove Cover And Let Rest For 5 – 10 Minutes. Remove Bay Leaf. Add The Cilantro And Lime, And Fluff With A Fork. Taste For Salt And Add More Lime Or Cilantro To Taste.
3. Rice Cooker: Add The Rice, Water (See Manufacturer’S Instruction : For Amount), Garlic Powder, Bay Leaf And Salt To The Bowl Of Your Rice Cooker. Pour The Water Overtop And Cook According To Manufacturer’S Manual. Once The Rice Is Finished, Remove Bay Leaf. Let Cool A Few Minutes, Add The Cilantro And Lime Juice, Fluff With A Fork. Taste For Salt And Add More Lime Or Cilantro To Taste.
4. Instant Pot: Add The Rice, Water And Salt To The Bowl Of Your Instant Pot. Attach The Lid And Turn To Lock The Lid. Set The Steam Valve To Seal. Cook White Rice For 4-8 Minutes. If Using Other Rice, See This Instant Pot Cooking Chart. Allow The Pressure To Release Naturally For 10 Minutes And Then Carefully Release Any Remaining Pressure.
5. Store: Leftover Rice Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, Kept In An Airtight Container. If Planning On Storing Leftovers, Be Sure To Cool It Quickly And Store It Within 2 Hours To Avoid Bacteria Growth. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer Using Freezer Safe Containers Or Baggies For Up To 2 Months.
6. To Reheat: Add A Splash Of Water Over The Top To Loosen The Clumps Of Dried Grains. Reheat The Rice In A Pot Over Medium-Low Heat On The Stovetop, Stirring Occasionally Until Heated Through. Or Heat In The Microwave, Covered, Using 30 Second Intervals, Stirring After Each Interval, Until Rice Is Warmed Through.

title: Vegan Kimchi Fried Rice
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Rice Or 3 Cups Cooked
2. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil
3. 1  2 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1 Inch Knob Ginger Grated Or Minced
5. 1 Cup Frozen Veggie Mix Anything With Carrots Peas Corn Andor Green Beans
6. 1  1 12 Cups Vegan Kimchi The More The Merrier Chop The Kimchi If You Like
7. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos Or To Taste
8. 1 Tablespoon Gochujang Or To Taste Optional
9. To Garnish
10. 1 Nori Sheet Thinly Sliced
11. 2 Scallions Thinly Sliced Pale Green  Green Parts Only
12. Sesame Seeds White Black Toasted Or Combo
preparation:
1. Rice: Cook The Rice According To Package Directions. For Best Results, Use Day Old Rice.
2. Stir-Fry: In A Wok Or Pan, Heat The Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add The Garlic And Ginger, Cook Until Fragrant, About 30 – 60 Seconds, Stirring Frequently. Add The Rice, Kimchi And Frozen Veggies, Give A Good Mix, Add The Tamari And Optional Gochujang, Stir Fry For 3 – 4 Minutes, Or Until Most Of The Liquids Have Been Absorbed. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Tamari Or Chili Pepper Flakes.
3. Serve: Spoon Into Individual Bowls With Sliced Nori Sheets, Scallions And Sesame Seeds.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 Days In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating On The Stovetop Or Microwave.

title: Fruit Carpaccio w/ Plums + Lemon Ginger Cream (Vegan)
ingredients:
1. Carpaccio
2. 8 Plums Any Color
3. Lemon Ginger Cream
4. 12 Cup Raw Cashews Soaked For 23 Hours
5. 3  4 Tablespoons Water
6. 2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
7. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
8. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Grated Ginger I Used A Microplane To Grate
9. Simple Syrup
10. 2 Medjool Dates Pitted Fresh Is Best
11. 13 Cup Water
12. Or
13. 13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup In Place Of Dates And Water
14. 12 Vanilla Bean Scraped Or 12 Teaspoon Vanilla Or Both If You Like
preparation:
1. Ginger Cream: Combine Ingredients In A Small Blender (I Used The Magic Bullet) And Blend Until Smooth. You Will Want It To Be On The Thick Side And Shouldn’T Need Any Additional Water. But If You Forgo The Soaking Process, You May Need To Add A Bit More. I Suggest Adding In 1 Tablespoon Of Lemon Juice Or Water At A Time. If You Find Your Cream Is A Bit Too Runny, Add In A Few Cashews And Blend. You Can Serve At Room Temp Or Refrigerate A Bit Before Serving. The Cream Can Be Made A Day Or Two Ahead Of Time.
2. Simple Syrup: Combine Either The Dates, Water, And Vanilla Or Maple Syrup And Vanilla Into A Small Blender (I Used The Magic Bullet) And Blend Until Smooth. Feel Free To Add A Tad Bit More Water As Needed To Thin If Using Dates. You Can Serve At Room Temp Or Refrigerate A Bit Before Serving. The Simple Syrup Can Be Made A Day Or Two In Advance.
3. Plums: Slice Your Plums Thinly Just Before Serving. I Have Given A More Detailed Way Of Slicing Above. Here Is The Simple Version: I Placed My Plums On A Flat Surface With The Stem Side Up And Sliced As Thinly As I Could By Hand With A Sharp Knife Starting From The Outside And Slicing In Until I Came To The Seed In The Middle. Do This For Both Sides.
4. Assemble: Place The Plums However You Like On Your Plate. Serve With A Nice Drizzle Of The Simple Syrup And A Dollop Of The Lemon Ginger Cream. Garnish With Optional Mint Leaves.

title: Vegan Quinoa Salad + Zesty Garlic Dressing
ingredients:
1. Salad
2. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
3. 1 34 Cups Water
4. 1 Cup Edamame
5. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas About 1 12 Cups
6. 1 12 Cups English Cucumber Chopped
7. 1 Yellow Bell Pepper Chopped
8. 1 Cup Carrots Chopped
9. 12 Cup Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
10. 12 Cup Red Onion Diced
11. 12 Cup Fresh Parsley Chopped Optional
12. Dressing
13. 4 Garlic Cloves Minced
14. 2 Medium Lemons Juice Of
15. 2 Tablespoons Dijon Or Stone Ground Mustard
16. 1  2 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil Optional
17. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse Quinoa Gently Under Running Water To Remove Any Dust. In A Medium Size Pot, Add Quinoa And 1 1/2 Cups Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Once Done, Remove Cover And Let Stand 15 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork. Perfect Quinoa! Alternatively, Use This Easy Instant Pot Quinoa.
2. Dressing: While Quinoa Is Cooking, Combine All The Dressing Ingredients In A Small Bowl, Taste For Seasoning And Let Set.
3. Prep Produce: Chop And Dice Your Remaining Vegetables, Except The Edamame. Place Chopped Vegetables And Edamame In A Large Bowl, Add The Dressing, Tossing Gently To Coat.
4. Assemble: Once Ready, Add Quinoa To The Vegetables And Toss Together. Serve With A Little More Sea Salt & Cracked Pepper And Squeeze Of Lemon On Top.
5. Serve Room Temperature Or Chilled.
6. Makes About 8 Cups.

title: LEMONY KALE AND WHITE BEAN SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 12 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 2 Medium Leeks About 3  4 Cups Thinly Sliced White  Pale Green Parts Only
3. 2 Large Carrots About 1 Cup Diced
4. 2 Celery Stalks About 1 Cup Diced
5. 2 Garlic Cloves Minced
6. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano Rosemary Or Thyme Or 2 Teaspoons Fresh Chopped
7. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
8. 6  7 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Combo Of Water  Broth
9. 2 Cans 15 Oz Cannellini Beans Drained And Rinsed Or 3 Cups Cooked
10. 1 Bunch Kale Lacinato Or Curly Middle Stem Removed And Julienned
11. 2  3 Lemons Juice Of
12. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
13. Chopped Parsley To Serve
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat, Add Leeks, Carrots And Celery And Saute About 5 – 7 Minutes (Leeks Should Be Softened And Wilted). Add Garlic And Herbs & Red Pepper Flakes, Saute 1 Minute More Or Until Fragrant.
2. Boil & Simmer: Add Liquids And Beans, Bring To A Slight Boil, Add Kale, Turn Down Heat To Low And Cook Until Kale Softens And Wilts, About 5 Minutes. Add Lemon Juice And Salt & Pepper To Taste. Add Extra Water/Broth As Needed.
3. Serve With A Sprinkle Of Parsley And Squeeze Of Lemon. A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan Would Be A Nice Touch Too. Pair With Your Favorite Crusty Bread Or Naan Bread To Soak Up The Juices.
4. Notes:
5. Add In 1/2 Cup Of Orzo Before Bringing To A Boil, Cook Soup At Least 10 Minutes On Medium Before Adding The Kale. Add An Extra Cup Of Water If Needed.
6. Use 1 Onion In Place Of The Leeks If Needed. Dice Onion And Cook The Same As The Leeks In This Recipe.
7. Use Baby Kale In The Tub (5 Oz.) If You Prefer.
8. Nutrition Information Is Calculated Using 1 Tbsp Oil And 3 Cups Veggie Broth.

title: Quick + Easy Vegan Pasta Salad
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Pasta Rotini Penne Bow Ties Elbow
2. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
3. 1 Can 6Oz Sliced Black Olives Drained
4. 1 Bell Pepper Any Color Diced
5. 1 Small Red Onion Sliced
6. 8 Oz Grape Or Cherry Tomatoes About 1 12 Cups Sliced In Half
7. 12 Large Cucumber Sliced And Quartered Optional
8. 14  12 Cup Fresh Parsley Chopped
9. Vinaigrette
10. 3  4 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
11. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar White Or Red Wine Vinegar Is Great Too
12. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano Italian Seasoning Or Herbs De Provence Is Ok Too
13. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
14. Generous Pinch Red Pepper Flakes
15. Generous Pinch Mineral Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper
16. Juice Of 1 Lemon Optional
preparation:
1. Pasta: Cook Pasta According To Package Instruction : To Al Dente. Drain And Rinse Until Cold Water.
2. Assemble: Pour Pasta Into A Bowl, Add Tomatoes, Bell Pepper, Olives, Red Onion And Parsley. Pour The Dressing Over Top And Gently Toss To Coat.
3. Serve At Room Temperature Or Keep In The Refrigerator To Chill For 30 Minutes. Keep Leftovers In An Airtight Container For Up To 6 Days. Add More Vinegar, Oil And/Or Lemon As Needed.
4. Add A Sprinkle Of Almond Parmesan For Added Flavor!

title: SMOKY LENTIL & QUINOA SOUP
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Water Or 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
2. 2 Large Carrots Sliced Or Diced
3. 2 Ribs Of Celery Diced
4. 1 Small Onion Diced
5. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 1 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
7. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
8. 1 Teaspoon Dried Thyme
9. 1 Teaspoon Dried Basil
10. 18 Teaspoon Nutmeg
11. 1 Cup Dried Lentils French Beluga Or Greenbrown
12. 12 Cup Dried Quinoa
13. 1 Can 15 Oz Diced Tomatoes I Used Fire Roasted Or 2 Fresh Tomatoes Diced
14. 2  3 Bay Leafs
15. 6  7 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water Or Use A Combo
16. Mineral Salt And Pepper To Taste
17. 1  2 Tablespoons Balsamic Vinegar
18. Chopped Parsley For Garnish Optional
preparation:
1. Rinse: Rinse Your Lentils Well And Pick Through Removing Any Oddly Shaped Or Colored Lentils. Rinse Quinoa Using A Fine Mesh Strainer To Remove Any Powdery Residue.
2. Saute: In A Large Pot/Dutch Oven, Heat Water/Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Onions, Celery, Carrots And Garlic, Saute For 5 Minutes, Until Onions Are Tender. Add Smoked Paprika, Cumin, Basil, Thyme And Nutmeg, Cook Until Fragrant, About 1 – 2 Minutes.
3. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add In Lentils, Quinoa, Tomatoes, Bay Leaves, Broth, Salt And Pepper. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 35 – 40 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally And Tasting For Flavor As You Go.
4. Add Balsamic: Once Done, Remove From Heat, Add Balsamic Vinegar And Stir. Remove Bay Leaves Before Serving.
5. Serve: Spoon Soup Into Serving Dishes And Top With Optional Chopped Parsley.
6. You May Like To Serve This With Some Fresh Homemade Artisan Bread, Vegan Cornbread Or Naan Bread Or Gluten Free, Chickpea Flour Socca Flatbread.
7. Soup Serves 4 – 6

title: BEST VEGAN WAFFLES (EASY + HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups 250G Flour Spelt Light Whole Wheat Allpurpose Flour Or Gf Flour Blend See Notes
2. 2 Tablespoons Sugar Coconut Pure Cane Or Turbinado
3. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
4. 1 34 Cups 403Cups Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk
5. 14 Cup Olive Oil Applesauce See Notes Or Vegan Butter I Recommend Miyokos
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt Optional
preparation:
1. Prep: Preheat Waffle Maker According To Manufacturer’S Instruction :. Also, Preheat Oven To 200 Degrees F., For Keeping The Waffles Warm.
2. Mix Batter: In A Medium Sized Mixing Bowl, Combine The Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Oil And Non-Dairy Milk, Mix Well, Until Most Of The Flour Lumps Are Gone.
3. Scoop, Pour + Cook: If Not Using A Non-Stick Waffle Iron, Spray Waffle Plate With Cooking Oil. Using A 1/2 Measuring Cup (Amounts Will Vary Depending On Your Waffle Iron), Scoop Up Batter And Pour In The Center Of Waffle Plate. Close The Cover And Cook As Directed By Manufacturer’S Instruction :. For Crispier Waffles, Let Cook 5 – 12 Seconds Longer, Depending On Your Waffle Iron.
4. Remove + Keep Warm: Gently Remove With The Tip Of A Fork And Place On A Wire Rack In The Oven Until The Remaining Waffles Are Made.
5. Serve: Pair Your Waffles With Fresh Blueberries, Strawberries, Raspberries Or Blackberries, And Top With Pure Maple Syrup Or This Easy Homemade Blueberry Compote. You May Even Like To Drizzle With Vegan Chocolate Syrup And Add A Dollop Ofwhipped Coconut Cream.
6. Makes 4 – 5 Waffles.
7. Store: Leftover Waffles Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To A Week, Or Store In The Freezer For Up To 1- 2 Months. When Ready To Eat, Pop Them In The Toaster Oven. Larger Batches Can Be Warmed In A Preheated Oven Set To 350 Degrees For 10 – 15 Minutes, Using A Greased Or Lined Baking Sheet.

title: ROASTED NOURISH BOWLS
ingredients:
1. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
2. 1 Large Sweet Potato Cut Into 34 Cubes
3. 2 Large Carrots Sliced
4. 1 12 Cups Brussles Sprouts Halved Or Quartered
5. 1 12 Cups Broccoli Florets
6. 12 Large Red Onion Sliced
7. 6 Serrano Chilis Sliced In Half And Deseeded
8. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Or 1 12 Cups Cooked
9. 1  2 Lemons Cut Into Six Pieces
10. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
11. To Serve
12. 2 Cups Cooked Quinoa
13. 5 Oz Spinach
14. 1  2 Avocados
15. Big Dollop Of Hummus
16. Red Pepper Flakes To Garnish
17. Hemp Hearts To Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Prepare Vegetables: Remove Any Unsightly Spots On The Sweet Potato Skins Before Cubing, Peel The Carrots If Needed And Half Or Quarter The Brussels Sprouts Depending On The Size.
3. Roast: Place Vegetables, Chickpeas And Lemon In A Large Roasting Pan Or Rimmed Baking Sheet. Toss With Oil And Sprinkle With Salt & Pepper To Taste. Roast For 40 – 45 Minutes, Stirring Halfway Through. Vegetables Should Be Slightly Browned On The Edges And Fork Tender. Remove From Oven And Let Cool A Few Minutes.
4. Serve: In Individual Bowls, Serve Vegetables With 1/3 Cup Quinoa, Handful Of Spinach, Sliced Avocado And A Nice Dollop Of Hummus. Top With A Sprinkle Of Red Pepper Flakes, Hemp Hearts A Squeeze Of Roasted Lemons.
5. Store: Keep Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days, In A Covered Container. For Storing And Meal Prep These Multi-Use Glass Containers(Affiliate Link).

title: SOBA NOODLE BOWL
ingredients:
1. 1 Package 8 Or 9 Oz Soba Noodles
2. 1 Cup Sugar Snap Peas
3. 1 Cup Carrots Shredded
4. 1 Cup Cucumber Sliced
5. 1 Cup Red Cabbage Shredded
6. 3 Radishes Sliced
7. 2 Scallions Green Onions Sliced To Garnish
8. Sesame Seeds Toasted Black Or White To Garnish
9. Handful Cilantro Sprigs To Serve
10. Lime Wedges To Serve
11. Miso Sauce
12. 2  3 Tablespoons Mellow Miso Paste White Miso
13. 2 Tablespoons Rice Wine Vinegar
14. 3 Tablespoons Water  More As Needed To Thin
15. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Grated Or Minced
16. Juice Of 1 Lime About 1 Tablespoon
17. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
preparation:
1. Noodles: Cook Soba Noodles According To Package Directions. Drain And Rinse The Soba Noodles Under Cool Running Water (This Helps Them To Not Turn Mushy!).(Note: If Using 100% Soba Noodles, Careful To Watch The Water After 2 Minutes Or So, It Will Start To Become Foamy And Bubble Over – Turn The Heat To Medium And Back Up Again As Needed To Keep The Water At A Boil But Not Boiling Over.)
2. Miso Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Miso Sauce Ingredients Together, Set Aside.
3. Assemble: Serve Noodles In Individual Bowls With 1/3 Cup Each Sugar Snap Peas, Shredded Carrots, Cucumber, And Red Cabbage. Top With Radishes, Sliced Scallions, Sesame Seeds, Cilantro And Lime Wedges To Squeeze Over Top. Drizzle Dressing Overtop And Enjoy!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days In A Covered Container.

title: SPICY CARROT & HUMMUS SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. 2  3 Large Carrots Coarsely Grated
2. 2 Cloves Garlic Thinly Sliced
3. 1 Teaspoon Caraway Seeds Cumin Would Be Nice Too
4. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
5. Pinch Red Pepper Flakes
6. Himalayanmineral Salt To Taste
7. Four Slices Bread Of Choice French Sourdough Rye Or Whole Grain Would Pair Nicely
8. Hummus To Spread
9. Cilantro
10. Cracked Pepper Optional
preparation:
1. Saute Carrots: In Skillet Heat Oil Over Medium, Add The Carrots, Garlic, Caraway Seeds And Season With Salt And Red Pepper. Cook Until Carrots Have Softened, About 4 Minutes. Let Cool.
2. Prep Bread: Toast Or Grill Your Bread, Or Leave As Is.
3. Assemble: Layer Both Sides Of Bread With Hummus (I Do Both Sides Because I Have Hummus Love). Add Carrot Mixture, Top With Cilantro And Season With Black Pepper.

title: ROASTED CAULIFLOWER + CHICKPEAS + MUSTARD DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 1 Large Head Cauliflower Cut Into Florets
3. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
4. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
5. 1 Cup Quinoa I Used Tricolor
6. 1 34 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
7. 14 Cup Fresh Italian Parsley Chopped
8. Fresh Cracked Pepper To Serve
9. Lemon Wedges To Serve
10. Mustard Dressing
11. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Mustard
12. 1 Tablespoon Whole Grain Mustard
13. Juice From 1 Lemon Or 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar
14. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees.
2. Roast: Prepare Cauliflower And Chickpeas, Toss Together In A Large Roasting Pan With 2 Tablespoons Of Olive Oil And Dash Or Two Of Salt. Roast For 35 – 40 Minutes, Stirring Every 15 Minutes Or So.
3. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot, Add Quinoa, 1 3/4 Cups Water And A Pinch Of Salt. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove Cover And Let Set 10 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork.
4. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Prepare Your Mustard Dressing And Set Aside. You May Like To Double This Recipe And Have Some To Drizzle Over Top Your Plated Serving.
5. Assemble: Once Roasting Is Done, Let Cool A Few Minutes. While Still Warm, Place Cauliflower And Chickpeas In A Medium Size Bowl, Add Dressing And Toss. Add In Parsley Last Or Top Your Portion When Before Serving. Tastes Great Warm Or At Room Temperature.
6. Serve Cauliflower And Chickpea Mix Over A Nice Bed Of Quinoa Along With Lemon Wedges.

title: EASY SPICY MAC-N-CHEESE
ingredients:
1. 8 Oz Favorite Pasta I Used Quinoa Pasta
2. 1 14 Cups Unsweetened Plain Almond Milk At Room Temperature
3. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
4. 3 Tablespoons Flour Spelt Rice Tapioca Or Allpurpose
5. 14  12 Cup Nutritional Yeast Flakes
6. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. 14 Teaspoon Chili Powder
8. 14 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder
9. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Pasta: Cook Your Pasta According To Package. Drain And Place Back In Pot, Set Aside.
2. Vegan Cheese Sauce: In A Small/Medium Saucepan, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Flour And Whisk To Incorporate. Continue Whisking And Cook For 2 Minutes, Mixture Will Be Bubbly. Add Milk Slowly, Whisking Constantly. Add The Garlic Powder, Chili & Chipotle Powder And Salt. Turn Heat To Low And Cook Until Sauce Thickens, About 8 Minutes, Stirring Frequently. Remove From Heat. Stir In Nutritional Yeast. Stir Until Everything Is Incorporated And Smooth Again. Taste For Flavor.
3. Assemble: Add Sauce And Pasta Together, Tossing Well, Add More Milk As Needed And Serve Right Away.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days In A Covered Container.

title: CARROT + ZUCCHINI RIBBONS + CILANTRO PEPITA PESTO
ingredients:
1. 3 Large Carrots
2. 3 Small Zucchini
3. Pepitas For Serving
4. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
5. Almond Parmesan For Serving
6. Cilantro Pepita Pesto Serves 4
7. 1 Large Bunch Cilantro 3 Cups Loosely Packed Ends Removed Leaves And Small Stems Ok
8. 13 Cup Pepitas Shelled Pumpkin Seeds Toasted Or Raw
9. 2 Tablespoons Hemp Hearts Optional
10. 2 Cloves Garlic
11. 1 Small Jalapeno Seed Removed Leave A Few Seeds For Heat If You Like
12. 3 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
13. Juice Of 1 Large Lemon
14. 12 Teaspoon Himilayan Salt
15. 12 Teaspoon Garam Masala Optional
preparation:
1. Pesto: Place Pepitas In Your Food Processor And Pulse A Few Times Until Seeds Are Broken Down Fairly Well. Add Remaining Ingredients And Blend Until Well Combined And Fairly Smooth, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. Add Water, 1 Tablespoon At A Time, To Thin If Needed (No Need To Add More Oil Unless You Want). Taste For Flavor And Season To Taste. Set Aside.
2. Ribbons: Peel The Outer Layer Of Your Carrots And Discard. Using The Peeler, Ribbon The Carrots. Wash Your Zucchini, Cut The Ends Off And Using A Mandolin, Or Tool Of Choice, Ribbon The Zucchini. You Can Just As Well Julienne Your Carrots And Zucchini With A Julienne Tool Or By Hand If You Would Rather Have Thinner Strands.
3. Combine: In A Medium Size Bowl, Place Carrots And Zucchini, Add A Few Spoonfuls Of Pesto And Mix To Combine. You Will Have Pesto Leftover Unless You Really Love The Stuff And Use It All!
4. Serve: Plate Your Ribbons, Top With A Sprinkle Of Pepitas And A Nice Dusting Of Almond Parmesan. For A Little Extra Color You Could Add Some Red Pepper Flakes To The Top.
5. Store Leftover Pesto In An Airtight Container In The Fridge For Up To A Week. Use The Pesto For Pasta, As A Dip For Vegetables, As A Spread For Sandwiches, Thin It Out With Water Or Lemon Juice And Make A Dressing For Salads, Etc. Lots Of Ways To Use Pesto.
6. Notes:
7. Use Almonds In Place Of Pepitas If Needed. I Used Raw Pepitas Instead Of Toasting Them.For The Garam Marsla, If Pairing This With Regular Pasta I Would Leave It Out. It Pairs Well With The Freshness Of The Carrot & Zucchini Ribbons. Also, I Found That It Tasted Fine With Almond Parmesan. But Like I Said Earlier, I Can Eat Some Really Unusual Combinations. If You Feel Like Experimenting, Try It Out…If In Doubt, Skip It.

title: VEGAN STREET TACOS
ingredients:
1. Taco Nut Meat
2. 1 Cup Walnuts
3. 1 Cup Mushrooms I Used Baby Bellas
4. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos
5. 1 Tablespoon Cumin
6. 12 Teaspoon Chili Powder
7. Spanish Quinoa
8. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
9. 12 Onion Diced
10. 1 Green Bell Pepper Diced Any Color Is Ok Optional
11. 1  2 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
12. 1 Cup Quinoa Rinsed
13. 1 Tablespoon Tomato Paste Or 1 Cup Diced Tomatoes
14. 2 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water
15. Salt  Pepper To Taste
16. To Serve
17. 6 Corn Tortillas Or 6 Leaves Butter Romaine Or Other Large Leafy Greens For Raw Taco Wrap
18. Black Bean Corn Salad Use Half Recipe
19. Cilantro To Serve
20. Lime Wedges To Serve
21. Pico De Gallo Use Prepackaged For Convenience To Serve
22. Avocado Slices To Serve
23. Hot Sauce  Tapatio Sriracha Or Your Favorite Hot Sauce To Serve Optional
preparation:
1. Spanish Quinoa (Serves 6):
2. In Medium Size Pan Or Skillet, Heat Oil Over Medium High Heat, Add Onion, Optional Bell Pepper And Cook For 3 Minutes, Add Quinoa And Garlic, Cook Another 5 Minutes Or So Stirring Frequently Until Quinoa Starts To Get Toasty And Turn Slightly Golden.
3. Add Water, Tomato Paste, Oregano, Salt + Pepper, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 20 Minutes.
4. When Done, Remove Cover, Fluff With The A Fork, And Let Set For 15 Minutes To Absorb The Rest Of The Liquids. Taste For Seasonings Before Serving.
5. Nut Meat (Makes 6 Tacos):
6. Place All Ingredients In Food Processor/Blender And Pulse Until You Have Chunky Crumbles. Don’T Over Process Or You Will Have A Nut Mushroom Pate, Which Wouldn’T Be So Bad But We Want A Crumbly Effect Here. For Visual Steps, See This Walnut Meat Recipe.
7. Optionally, Heat The Nut Meat On Low Just Until Warm In A Small Saucepan. You Don’T Want To Overheat Or The Mushrooms Will Cook Too Much, Just Slightly Warm It. I Find Both Ways, Warm And Room Temp, To Be Just As Appealing. Makes Enough For 6 Tacos.
8. Warm Your Tortillas On The Griddle Or Skillet For 30 Seconds Per Side.
9. Serve: Put Your Plates And Tacos Together As You Wish! You May Find That You End Up Combining The Black Bean Salsa With The Spanish Fried Quinoa. You May Also Find Yourself Making Tacos Out Of Both Of Those Side Dishes As Well. However You Craft Your Plate, Enjoy!

title: PASTA & PEAS + RED PEPPER ROMESCO SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 12  16 Oz Pasta Of Choice I Used Rigatoni
2. 1 Package 12 16Oz Frozen Peas Or 2 12 Cups Fresh
3. Romesco Sauce
4. 12 Cup Almonds
5. 4 Roasted Bell Peppers Or 1 Jar 14 Oz Roasted Bell Peppers Drained
6. 2  3 Large Garlic Cloves Or 12  34 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. 1 Cup Vegetable Broth Or Water
8. 1 Tablespoon Balsamic Vinegar Sherry Red Or White Wine Is Ok Too
9. 14  12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
10. Mineral Salt To Taste
11. To Serve
12. Chopped Basil Parsley Or Mint
13. Almond Parmesan
14. Fresh Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 475 Degrees F.
2. Bell Peppers: Wash And Dry Bell Peppers, Slice In Half, Remove Stems And Seeds, Place On A Rimmed Baking Sheet Cut Side Down. Bake In Oven For 40 Minutes, Turning The Baking Sheet 180 Degrees After 20 Minutes. Steam Peppers In An Airtight Container For At Least 20 Minutes. Remove Skin. For A More Detailed Overview Of Roasting Peppers Follow This Link: How To Roast Peppers
3. Pasta: Fill A Large Pot With Water And Bring To A Boil. Cook Pasta According To Package Directions. About 3 Minutes Before The Pasta Is Ready, Add Peas And Finish Cooking Together. Drain Pasta And Peas In A Colander. Set Aside.
4. Romesco Sauce: In A Food Processor/High-Speed Blender, Add Almonds And Pulse Or Process Until Roughly Chopped. Add In The Bell Peppers, Garlic, Broth/Water, Vinegar, Red Pepper Flakes, And A Pinch Of Salt. Blend Until Desired Consistency. Taste For Flavors And Adjust As Needed. You May Find You Need A Little More Salt, Especially If You’Ve Used Water Instead Of Vegetable Broth.
5. Combine: Bring The Pasta And Peas Back To The Pot They Were Cooked In. Add The Romesco Sauce And Gently Mix Until Pasta Is Well Coated. Warm Mixture Over Low Heat If Needed.
6. Serve With A Sprinkle Of Almond Parmesan And Chopped Herbs Of Choice. Enjoy!
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. For Longer Storage, You Can Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Reheat On The Stove Until Warmed Through, Adding A Splash Of Vegetable Broth To Loosen The Sauce. Can Also Be Microwaved.

title: Chana Masala (Quick + Easy)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Large Yellow Onion Diced
3. 4  5 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1  2 Serrano Chili Peppers Seeds Removed And Diced
5. 2 Tablespoons Fresh Ginger Grated Or Minced
6. 2 Teaspoons Garam Masala
7. 1 Teaspoon Each Ground Coriander Cumin And Turmeric
8. 1 Cinnamon Stick
9. 2 Cans 15Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Or 3  4 Cups Fresh Cooked
10. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
11. 14 Cup Water  More As Needed
12. 2 Small Lemons Or Limes Juice Of
13. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
14. Grain Of Choice Rice Quinoa Or Couscous Optional
15. Optional Garnish
16. 1 Bunch Cilantro
17. Lemon Or Lime Wedges
18. Sliced Cherry Tomatoes
19. Arugula
preparation:
1. Prep: Start With Chopping, Dicing And Mincing The Onion, Garlic, Ginger And Serrano Chili. This Is Pretty Much The Most Work You’Ll Have To Do. I Grated My Ginger Using This Handy Fine Grater (Affiliate Link), But Simply Mincing Your Ginger Is Great Too.
2. Saute: In A Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat And Saute The Onions Until Translucent, Add The Garlic, Ginger, Chili And Spices And Saute For 30 Seconds To 1 Minute.
3. Cook: Add The Chickpeas, Tomatoes, Cinnamon Stick And 1/4 Cup Of Water, Turn Heat To Low And Simmer At A Gentle Boil For 15 – 20 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. Add A Little More Water If You Prefer A Saucy Chickpea Stew. Remove Cinnamon Stick And Stir In The Lemon Juice.
4. Serve: Serve With Grain Of Choice And Optional Garnish. And For Scooping And Soaking, This Easyvegan Naanis Perfect!
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator In An Airtight Container For Up To 5 – 6 Days. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: FAVORITE CRANBERRY ORANGE BREAD
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups 240 G Flour Light Spelt White Whole Wheat Or Allpurpose
2. 23 Cup 133 G Organic Pure Cane Sugar
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. Generous Pinch Of Salt
6. 1 Cup Orange Juice
7. 12 Cup 113 G Unsweetened Applesauce
8. 1 Heaping Cup 129 G Fresh Or Frozen Cranberries Plus More For The Top
9. Tasty Optional Addins
10. 1  2 Teaspoons Vanilla Add With Orange Juice
11. 34 Teaspoon Cinnamon Or Ginger Powder Add With Dry Ingredients
12. 1  2 Tablespoons Orange Zest Optional Add With Cranberries
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Lightly Grease A 9 X 5 Loaf Pan.
2. In A Mixing Bowl, Add The Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Baking Soda And Salt, Stir To Combine.
3. Add In The Applesauce, Orange Juice And Optional Vanilla, Mix Until Flour Is Incorporated, Don’T Over Mix, Stir In The Cranberries And Optional Orange Zest, Give A Few Extra Stirs.
4. Pour Batter Into Prepared Loaf Pan, Strategically Arrange A Few More Cranberries On Top, And Place On Center Rack In The Oven, Bake For 50 – 55 Minutes.
5. Remove From Oven, Let Cool And Enjoy.
6. Store, Covered, On The Counter For Up To 3 Days, Or Keep In The Refrigerator For Up To 1 Week. Also, You Can Freeze Your Bread, Stored In A Freezer Safe Container For Up To 2 Months, Let Thaw In The Refrigerator.

title: VEGAN MUSHROOM GRAVY
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Olive Oil Or Nondairy Butter
2. 1 16 Ounce Package Sliced Mushrooms White Or Baby Bellas
3. 14 Cup Allpurpose Flour Or As Needed
4. 1 Quart 4 Cups Mushroom Or Vegetable Broth
5. Mineral Salt  Fresh Ground Black Pepper To Taste
6. 12 Teaspoons Fresh Thyme Leaves Or To Taste Optional
preparation:
1. Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Mushrooms And Season With A Pinch Of Salt. Simmer Mushrooms, Stirring Occasionally, Until Liquid Is Almost Evaporated, About 15 Minutes.
2. Add Flour, Continue Cooking And Stirring For About 3 – 5 Minutes, At Least Until The Flour Has Been Absorbed And Not White Anymore. Add 1 Cup Of Broth, Stirring/Whisking Briskly Until Incorporated And Liquid Has Thickened, There Should Be No Flour Lumps, About 5 Minutes.
3. Slowly Pour In The Remaining Broth And Mix Thoroughly. Season With Black Pepper And Thyme. Simmer At A Gentle Boil Over Medium-Low Until Thickened, About 20 Minutes, Stirring Often. Gravy Will Thicken Upon Standing. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Salt And Pepper As Needed.
4. Makes About 4 Cups.
5. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. To Freeze, Let The Gravy Cool And Store In An Airtight Container In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator And Reheat In A Saucepan, Whisking To Recombine.
6. Notes:
7. If You Find The Gravy Isn’T Thickening Up, Mix 1 Tablespoon Oil With 1 Heaping Tablespoon Flour, Mix Well Until Completely Blended, Add To Simmering Broth, Stirring Until Dissolved, Continue Cooking Until Thickened.
8. I Used Mushroom Gravy When Making This Recipe Which Gave It A Rich Brown Color, If Using Vegetable Broth Your Gravy May Be Lighter In Color.
9. Make This Gluten Free By Using Gluten Free Flour.

title: BANANA OATMEAL COOKIES (3 INGREDIENTS)
ingredients:
1. 2 Very Ripe Bananas Mashed
2. 1 Cup Oats Rolled Or Quick I Used Gf
3. 14 Cup Semisweet Chocolate Chips Enjoy Life Mini Chips
4. Optional Addins
5. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon Our Favorite
6. 12  1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
7. 14 Cup Shredded Coconut
8. 14 Cup Chopped Nuts
9. 14 Cup Dried Fruit
10. 2 Tablespoons Nut Butter Homemade Almond Butter
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper, Silicone Mat, Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Mix: In A Medium Size Bowl, Mash Bananas To A Fairly Smooth Consistency (A Few Small Chunks Is Ok). Add Oats And Mix Well. Add In Chocolate Chips, Mix Again. If The Mixture Is Really Wet, Add A Few Tablespoons Of Oats (See Notes).
3. Scoop: Using A 1 Tablespoon Measuring Spoon Or Trigger Scooper, Scoop Heaping Scoops Of Mixture And Place On Cookie Sheet. Leave In A Dome Shape Or Flatten It Out A Bit With Your Fingers To Make A Flatter Shape. Depending On The Size You Scoop, You Should Get Anywhere From 12 – 16 Cookies.
4. Bake: Place In Oven, On The Center Rack, And Bake For 15 – 20 Minutes. If You Make Your Scoops Dome Shaped And On The Larger Side, Bake For 20 – 25 Minutes. Remove From Oven, Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Eating.
5. Makes About 12 – 16
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept Loosely Covered And Eat Within A 1 – 2 Days (If They Last That Long!).

title: Apple & Coconut Bacon Salad
ingredients:
1. 1 Fuji Apple Use Your Favorite Apple Cored And Diced
2. 14 Cup Coconut Bacon
3. 1  2 Tablespoons Currants Or Raisins
4. 1  2 Tablespoons Slivered Almonds Pumpkin Sunflower Seeds Or Hemp Hearts Would Be Great Too
5. Favorite Salad Mix
6. Ginger Peanut Dressing
7. 2 Rounded Tablespoons Natural Peanut Butter Or Almond Butter
8. 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Or Rice Wine Vinegar
9. 2 Teaspoons Pure Maple Syrup
10. 14 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
11. 18 Teaspoon Ginger Powder Or 14 Teaspoon Fresh Grated
12. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
13. 2 Tablespoons Water Plus More As Needed To Thin
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Dressing Ingredients. Add Water, A Teaspoon Or Two At A Time, As Needed To Create Desired Consistency. Taste For Flavor Adjusting As Needed. If Dressing Becomes To Thin, Add A Bit More Peanut Butter To Thicken. Set Aside.
2. Salad: Create Your Salad By Adding A Few Large Handfuls Of Salad Mix To Your Serving Bowl—Top With Diced Apple, Handful Of Coconut Bacon, Currents And Slivered Almonds. Drizzle Ginger Peanut Dressing Over Top And Enjoy.

title: SALTED CHOCOLATE PECAN SANDIES (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Packed Almond Flour Or Almond Meal
2. 14 Cup Coconut Sugar Turbinado Sugar Or Pure Cane Brownwhite Sugar
3. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
4. 14 Teaspoon Baking Soda Or 12 Teaspoon Baking Powder
5. 14 Teaspoon Sea Salt
6. 14 Cup Coconut Oil Room Temp
7. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Warmed
8. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla
9. 12 Cup Pecan Pieces Raw Or Roasted Chopped
10. 14 Cup Mini Semisweet Chocolate Chips
11. Large Flake Salt To Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 325 Degrees. Prepare A Baking Sheet With Coconut Oil, Parchment Paper, Or Use A Non-Stick Mat.
2. Mix: In A Large Mixing Bowl Beat Together The Coconut Oil, Vanilla, And Maple Syrup Until Smooth. Add In The Almond Flour, Sugar, Cinnamon, Baking Powder & Soda, And Salt, Mix To Combine. Toss In The Pecans And Chocolate Chips, And Mix Again.
3. Shape: Scoop Rounded Tablespoons And Roll Dough Into 1 Inch Balls, Firmly But Gently Press Into A Ball, And Place On The Cookie Sheet. Using Your Fingers, Gently Press Down To Slightly Flatten. Sprinkle With Coarse Sea Salt.
4. Bake: Place In The Oven On The Center Rack And Bake For About 20 Minutes. They May Look Like They Need To Cook More But Don’T Worry Once They Cool They Will Darken Slightly, Harden A Little And Be A Perfect Cookie. Let Cool And Enjoy!
5. Makes 16 To 18 Cookies
6. Store: Cookies Can Be Stored On The Counter For Up To 5 – 6 Days Or Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 Weeks. To Keep Longer, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Cajun Quinoa Cakes + Lemon-Dill Remoulade
ingredients:
1. Quinoa Cakes
2. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
3. 1 34 Cup Vegetable Broth Or Water
4. 1 Tablespoon Flaxseed Meal
5. 3 Tablespoon Water
6. 14 Cup Flour Of Choice  More As Needed I Used Gf Oat Flour
7. 12 Red Onion Or 1 Large Shallot Diced
8. 1 Small Red Bell Pepper Seeded And Diced
9. 2 Ribs Of Celery Diced
10. 14 Cup Parsley Chopped
11. 1 12 Teaspoons Old Bay Optional
12. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder Or 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
13. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
14. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil For The Skillet
15. Lemondillsriracha Rmoulade
16. 23 Cups Raw Cashews Preferably Soaked For 2 3 Hours
17. 13 Cup Water  More As Needed
18. 1 Tablespoon Sriracha  More To Taste Or 14 To 12 Teaspoon Cayenne
19. 1 Small Clove Garlic
20. 2 Tablespoons Fresh Dill Chopped
21. 1 Lemon Juice And A Little Zest
22. Dash Or Two Onion Powder
23. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: In Small Pot Over Medium High Heat, Add Broth/Water And Quinoa, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Once Done, Remove Cover, Fluff With A Fork And Let Set For Another 15 Minutes To Cool And Absorb Remaining Water.
2. Flax Egg: While The Quinoa Is Cooling, Start Your Flax Egg By Mixing The Ground Flax Seed With 3 Tablespoons Water In A Small Bowl And Set Aside To Thicken, At Least 10 Minutes For Best Results.
3. Rémoulade: Place All Ingredients In A Blender/Food Processor, Except The Dill, And Blend Until Smooth (The Nutri Bullet Is A Perfect Tool For This Job). If Your Mixture Is Too Thin Add A Few Cashews And Blend Again, And If Too Thick Add 1 Tablespoon Water At A Time Until Desired Consistency. Stir In The Dill By Hand. Taste For Seasoning Adding More Of Whatever You Like. Cover And Keep At Room Temp Or Place In The Refrigerator Until Ready To Use (I Served Mine At Room Temp). This Can Also Be Made A Couple Days In Advance And Kept In The Refrigerator (Will Stay Fresh For Up To 5 – 6 Days).
4. Quinoa Cakes: In A Medium Bowl, Combine Quinoa, Flax Egg, Flour, Onion, Celery, Bell Pepper And Garlic. Mixture Should Be Moist Enough To Stick Together. Add Additional Flour Or Water, 1 -2 Tablespoons At A Time If Needed To Adjust Consistency. Taste For Seasoning. Scoop Up 1/4 – 1/3 Cup Of Mixture And Form Into A Ball, Pack Them Well While Forming Into A Ball. Gently Flatten To About 1/2 Inch And Pinch Any Cracks That Appear On The Sides And Tops. (Patties Can Be Made A Day In Advance And Kept In The Refrigerator.) Be Patient And Rinse Your Hands After Forming Each Patty, It Will Be A Bit Messy For The First Few Until You Get The Hang Of It.
5. Cook: Preheat Oven To 200 Degrees. In A Skillet Or Shallow Pan, Heat 1 1/2 Teaspoons Oil Over Medium Heat, Add 4 Patties And Cook, Until Nicely Browned On Each Side, About 4 – 5 Minutes Per Side. Repeat Until All Patties Are Cooked. Keep Finished Quinoa Cakes On A Baking Sheet In The Preheated Oven Until All Cakes Are Cooked. (See Notes For Baked Option)
6. Serve The Quinoa Cakes With A Nice Dollop Of Rémoulade And Pair With A Steamed Vegetable Of Choice. Would Be Great With Vegan Mac And Cheese, Coleslawor Sweet Corn & Arugula Salad Too.
7. Makes 8 – 9 Patties, Serves 4
8. Store: Patties Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: ZUCCHINI NOODLES + AVOCADO-CUCUMBER SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 2 Large Zucchini 1 Per Person
2. Grape Cherry Or Mini Heirloom Tomatoes Halved
3. Jalapeno Thinly Sliced And Seeds Removed Optional
4. Arugula Optional
5. Pea Shoots Or Micro Sprouts Optional
6. Zest Of One Lemon Meyer Or Regular
7. Avocadocucumber Puree
8. 1 Medium Avocado
9. 1 Small Cucumber Peeled And Sliced Thick
10. A Few Large Leaves Of Basil Optional
11. 1 Lemon Meyer Or Regular Juice Of
12. 2 Garlic Cloves
13. 14 Teaspoon White Pepper Or Black Pepper To Taste
14. Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Prepare Your Zucchini Noodles Julienne Style Or Spiralized. Or Alternately, Cook Your Pasta Of Choice, About 8 Ounces.
2. For The Puree, Place All Ingredients Into A Food Processor/Blender And Process Until Creamy, Stopping Every So Often To Scrape The Sides As Needed.. Taste For Flavor Adding Anything Extra You Might Like.
3. Toss Zucchini Pasta With Avocado-Cucumber Puree And A Handful Of Arugula Or Sprouts. Serve With Tomatoes, Peas Shoots, Jalapenos, Lemon Zest, Lemon Wedges And Fresh Cracked Pepper.
4. Notes:
5. Recommended Equipment: For Making Zucchini Noodles I Recommend Using A Julienne Tool To Make Straight Noodles Or You Can Spiralize Using A Spiralizer (Affiliate Links). For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools,Shop My Kitchen Essentials.

title: BUTTERNUT SQUASH + RED LENTIL SOUP
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Yellow Onion Diced
3. 3 Lb Butternut Squash Cubed 34 Inch About 6  8 Cups
4. 1 12 Cups Red Lentils
5. 2 Teaspoons Dried Sage Or 2 Tablespoons Fresh Minced
6. 7 Cups Vegetable Broth
7. Mineral Salt  White Or Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Cube Squash:Slice Off The Very Top And Bottom, Discard. Using A Vegetable Peeler, Remove The Hard Outer Skin. Cut The Butternut Squash In Half, Remove Seeds And Cut Squash Into 1/2″ Cubes (The Smaller The Cubes Are The Quicker They Will Cook).
2. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Stock Pot, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium High Heat, Add Onions And Saute For About 5 Minutes, Or Until Soft. Add Sage And Squash And Cook 3 Minutes More, Stirring Occasionally.
3. Simmer: Add Lentils, Broth And Salt & Pepper, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For About 30 Minutes, Until Squash Is Fork Tender And Lentils Are Soft.
4. Puree: Once Ready And Slightly Cooled, Puree Soup Using Your Preferred . Use An Immersion Blender And Puree Soup Right In The Pot Until Desired Consistency. Or You Can Puree In Your Blender Or Food Processor, This  May Take Two Or Three Batches To Complete. Add Extra Liquids As Needed For Desired Thickness.
5. Serve: Ladle Into Individual Serving Bowls And Top With Pine Nuts And Chopped Sage If You Like, Fresh Cracked Pepper Would Also Be Great.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating. Reheat On The Stovetop Over Low Until Warmed Through.

title: BERRY + SPINACH QUINOA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa Rinsed
2. 1 34 Cup Water
3. 5 Oz Baby Spinach About 5 Cups
4. 1 Cup Blueberries
5. 1 Cup Strawberries Sliced
6. 1 Cup Blackberries
7. 13 Cup Slivered Almonds
8. Sliced Avocado Optional
9. Citrus Dressing
10. 13 Cup Orange Juice
11. 2 Teaspoons Dijon
12. 2 Teaspoons Apple Cider Vinegar
13. 2 Teaspoons Pure Maple Syrup
14. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: In A Small Pot, Add Quinoa And Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove Lid And Let Rest For 10 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork.In A Small Bowl, Combine The Dressing Ingredients And Mix Well.
2. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Ingredients For The Citrus Dressing. Set Aside Until Ready To Serve.
3. Salad: In A Large Bowl Add The Spinach, Quinoa, Blueberries, Strawberries And Slivered Almonds. Pour Dressing Over Top And Toss Well To Coat.
4. Serve At Room Temperature Or Chilled In Individual Bowls With Optional Sliced Avocado And A Little Extra Slivered Almonds On Top.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days In A Covered Container.

title: ASIAN SLAW SALAD + MISO GINGER DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Green Cabbage Finely Shredded
2. 2 Cups Red Cabbage Finely Shredded
3. 2 Radishes Julienned
4. 1 Carrot Peeled  Julienned
5. 1 Tablespoon Black Sesame Seeds
6. Misoginger Dressing
7. 1 Inch Fresh Ginger Finely Grated
8. 1 Clove Garlic Finely Grated
9. 2 Tablespoons Mellow Miso
10. 2 Tablespoons Rice Wine Vinegar I Used A Seasoned Rice Vinegar
11. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Or Coconut Aminos
12. 2 Teaspoons Toasted Sesame Oil Optional
13. 3 Tablespoon Water
preparation:
1. In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Ingredients For The Dressing. Alternately You Can Use A Small Blender To Combine Until Smooth. Set Aside.
2. In A Large Bowl, Toss The Cabbage, Carrots, Radishes And Sesame Seeds Together With The Dressing. You Can Also Omit The Sesame Seeds And Serve Them As A Garnish As The Pictures Above.
3. Serve Immediately If You Like It Very Crunchy Or Let It Sit Covered In The Refrigerator For A Few Hours For A More Slaw-Like Texture And To Let The Flavors Mingle A Bit. Both Ways Are Great. Depending On How You Are Serving The Dish It Can Be Served At Room Temperature Or Cold.
4. Notes:
5. Thinly Sliced Green Onions Would Also Be A Great Addition To This Salad.
6. To Make Soy Free, Use Chickpea Or Brown Rice Miso.
7. For An Oil Free Slaw, Omit The Oil.

title: ROASTED DELICATA SQUASH + CRANBERRY SALAD
ingredients:
1. 2 Small Delicata Squash
2. 1 12 Cups Fresh Cranberries
3. 1 Cup Pecans
4. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
5. Dash Of Cinnamon Optional
6. 14 Red Onion Thinly Sliced
7. 5 Oz Baby Leafy Greens Kale Chard Spinach Arugula
8. 1 12  2 Cups Cooked Quinoa Wheat Berries Or Farro Optional
9. Apple Cider Dressing
10. 2 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar
11. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
12. 1 Heaping Tablespoon Dijon Mustard
13. 1  2 Tablespoons Water Or Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Squash: Wash Delicata Squash, Cut Ends Off, Slice In Half Lengthwise And Scrape Seeds Out With A Sharp-Edged Spoon. Lay Squash Cut Side Down And Cut Into 1/4 Inch Slices. Toss With 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil. Using A Rimmed Baking Sheet Lined With A Silpat, Parchment Paper Or Lightly Greased, Lay Pieces In A Single Layer And Lightly Sprinkle With Mineral Salt. Cook For 40 Minutes Stirring Once Or Twice.
3. Candied Nuts: In A Medium Bowl, Toss The Nuts And Cranberries With A Glug Of Maple Syrup And Dash Or Two Of The Optional Cinnamon. Place Mixture On A Small Rimmed Baking Sheet That Has Been Lined Or Lightly Greased. Add To The Oven With The Squash For The First 10 – 15 Minutes Of Baking Stirring After 10 Minutes. Remove, Let The Nuts Harden.
4. Vinaigrette: In A Small Bowl Combine The Dressing Ingredients And Mix Well.
5. Assemble: In A Large Mixing Bowl Combine The Leafy Greens, Onion, Slightly Cooled Squash, Cranberry/Nut Mixture And Dressing, Toss Well. Add In Cooked Grain Of Choice And Gently Toss Again.Season With Salt And Pepper.
6. Serve Warm Or At Room Temperature, Can Also Be Served Chilled.
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored Covered In The Refrigerator For 3 – 4 Days.

title: WHOLE ROASTED CAULIFLOWER W/ TAHINI SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 1 Head Of Cauliflower About 2 Lbs
2. 12 Cup Tahini
3. 14 Cup Lemon Juice About 1  2 Lemons
4. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 18  14 Teaspoon Cumin
6. Generous Pinch Of Salt Or To Taste
7. 2  3 Tablespoons Water  More As Needed
8. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley Loosely Packed
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Line A Pot, Skillet, Baking Sheet, Or Baking Dish With Parchment Or Foil.
2. Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Tahini, Lemon Juice, Garlic Powder, Cumin, Salt, And Water. Add More Water As Needed To Thin. Set Aside. Taste For Flavor Before Using.
3. Trim Cauliflower: Turn The Cauliflower So The Stem Is Facing Upward. Cut The Stem Straight Across Removing Any Bulky Stems. I Like To Leave Some Of The Stems And Leaves When Possible, But Feel Free To Completely Cut Them Away. Cutting Them Away Will Make It Easier To Coat The Inside, But If Leaving A Few Leaves Make Sure There Are A Few Holes To Drizzle The Tahini Sauce Through.
4. Coat Bottom: Drizzle A Few Tablespoons Of Tahini Sauce In And Around The Underside Of The Stem Area. If Leaves Are Still Attached, Make Sure To Get Into The Holes To Coat The Inside Of The Cauliflower Head.
5. Coat Top: Place The Cauliflower, Stem Down, Into The Pot. Drizzle The Top Of The Cauliflower With ¼ Cup Of Tahini Sauce And Brush To Coat The Entire Head, Adding More As Needed. Top With A Light Sprinkle Of Salt.
6. Roast: Cover The Pot And Place In The Oven On The Middle Rack For 25 Minutes. Remove Cover And Roast For 25 – 30 Minutes. If You Prefer More Charring, Place Under The Broiler For The Last 5 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes.
7. Transfer: Carefully Lift Up The Cauliflower Using Two Large Forks And Place On A Plate Or Platter (Or Slice And Serve From The Pot). Top With Parsley. Slice Into Serving Portions With A Knife. It Should Be Tender Enough To Slice With Ease.
8. Serve With Remaining Tahini Sauce And Chopped Parsley.
9. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days In An Airtight Container. For Longer Storage Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Reheat From Frozen Or Thawed In The Microwave Or Oven.

title: TEMPEH CHOW MEIN
ingredients:
1. 8  12 Oz Package Chow Mein Noodles Or Spaghetti Noodles
2. 2 8Oz Packages Tempeh
3. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
4. 12 Head Green Cabbage About 4 Cups Shredded
5. 1 Large Celery Stalk Sliced Diagonally
6. 2 Carrots Peeled And Sliced Diagonally
7. 1 Small White Onion Sliced
8. Sauce
9. 14 Cup Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
10. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
11. 2 Tablespoons Water
12. 1 Tablespoon Rice Wine Vinegar Optional
13. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
14. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Minced Or Grated
15. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste White Pepper Would Be Great Here
preparation:
1. Noodles: If Using Chuka Soba Or Chow Mein Noodles, Bring A Pot Of Water To A Boil, Add Noodles, Reduce Heat To Medium And Cook For 4 Minutes. Drain, Rinse And Set Aside. If Using Other Noodles, Cook As Directed On Package.
2. Stir-Fry Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Ingredients For The Sauce, Set Aside.
3. Tempeh + Onion: In A Large Wok, Heat Olive Oil Over Medium To Medium-High Heat, Add Tempeh, Crumbling It Between Your Fingers, And Onion, Cook 2 Minutes.
4. Remaining Veggies: Add The Celery, Cabbage, Carrot, And Pour 3/4 Of The Sauce Over Top. Stir-Fry, Mixing Well, For Another 5 – 7 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally Until Cabbage Has Shrunk Down And Softened.
5. Add Noodles: Add The Noodles And Remaining Sauce To The Veggies, Toss To Coat, Continue Cooking Until Noodles Are Warmed Through. Season To Taste With More Tamari Or Other Seasonings.
6. Serve: Serve Warm In Individual Bowls And Top With Optional Scallions, Red Pepper Flakes And Cilantro. Sesame Seeds And/Or Chili Sauce (Sriracha) Would Also Be Great!
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Keep Leftovers In The Freezer For Up 2 – 3 Months In Freezer Safe Containers. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: RAMEN NOODLE STIR FRY
ingredients:
1. 1 Package 9 Oz Ramen Noodles See Notes
2. 18  22 Oz Stir Fry Veggies Mix Fresh Or Frozen See Notes For My Mix
3. 1 Cup Bean Sprouts Optional
4. 12 Cup Fresh Basil Lightly Packed Chopped Optional
5. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil Or 14 Cup Veggie Broth
6. Stir Fry Sauce
7. 13 Cup Tamari Low Sodium Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos
8. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Sub With Coconut Or Pure Cane Sugar  3 Tbsp Water
9. 14 Cup Water
10. 2 Tablespoon Rice Vinegar
11. 1 Inch Knob Ginger Grated Or Minced
12. 3  4 Garlic Cloves Minced
13. 1 Tablespoon Cornstarch
14. 14  1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or 1 Teaspoon Sriracha Optional
preparation:
1. Stir Fry Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Tamari, Maple Syrup, Water, Rice Vinegar, Ginger, Garlic, Cornstarch And Red Pepper Flakes. Set Aside.
2. Noodles: Cook Your Ramen Noodles According To Package And Set Aside.
3. Assemble: In Wok Or Pan, Heat Oil Or Water On Medium-High Heat, Add The Vegetables And Basil, Stir Fry For 2 – 3 Minutes, Add The Noodles, Pour The Stir Fry Sauce Overtop And Cook For Another 3 – 4 Minutes, Spices, Stirring Frequently. Season To Taste With More Tamari, Rice Vinegar, Etc.
4. Serve: Place In Serving Dish And Garnish With Sesame Seeds, Sliced Scallions, And More Bean Sprouts.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: VEGAN PUMPKIN SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth For Water Saute
2. 1 Large Onion Diced
3. 4  6 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1  2 Teaspoons Fresh Thyme Chopped
5. Generous Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
6. 4  5 Lb Baking Pumpkin Skin Peeled Seeds Removed And Cubed
7. 1 Cup Dried Red Lentils
8. 6 Cups Broth Or Water Or Combo
9. Salt  Pepper To Taste
10. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley To Garnish
11. Pepitas To Garnish
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Garlic, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Thyme, Red Pepper Flakes, Salt And Pepper, Stir And Cook 1 Minute More Until Fragrant.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add The Pumpkin, Red Lentils And Liquids, Bring To A Boil, Cover, To Low And Simmer At A Gentle Boil For 20 Minutes. Soup Is Ready When Pumpkin Is Fork Tender And Lentils Are Soft.
3. Puree: Remove Soup From Heat, Let Cool A Few Minutes. Using An Immersion Blender (Or Stand Blender), Puree The Soup To Desired Consistency. Feel Free To Leave It A Little Chunky! Stir In The Fresh Parsley Or Use It As A Garnish When Serving.
4. Serve: Spoon Into Serving Bowls And Top Pumpkin Seeds, Red Pepper Flakes, Pepper And More Fresh Parsley.
5. Enjoy Your Soup With A Chunk Of Homemade Artisan Bread Or Vegan Naan Bread For Soaking Up The Juices. For Gluten Free, Try This Easy Socca Flatbread Made With Chickpea Flour.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator, In A Covered Container, For 5 – 6 Days. To Store Longer, Freeze Portions In Freezer Safe Containers Or Baggies For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Heating.
7. Reheat: Warm The Soup On The Stovetop Over Low Heat Until Warmed Through Or Warm In The Microwave At 30 Second Intervals, Stopping To Stir Each Time.

title: EASY PORTOBELLO FAJITAS (30-MINUTES)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 2 Portobello Mushrooms
3. 12 Large Onion Sliced
4. 3 Bell Peppers Any Combo Of Red Orange Yellow Or Green Sliced
5. 34 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
6. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
7. 1 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
8. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
9. To Serve
10. 2 Avocados
11. 1 Jalapeno Minced
12. Cilantro Sprigs
13. 2 Limes
14. 6 Corn Or Flour Tortillas
preparation:
1. In A Large Skillet, Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat, Add The Onions, Peppers, Cumin, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Powder And Salt, Toss To Combine.
2. Add In The Mushrooms And Saute, Gently Stirring The Mushrooms Carefully, Until Peppers And Portobellos Are Soft, About 10 – 15 Minutes.
3. Smash Or Slice The Avocado. I Smashed Mine And Added The Juice Of 1 Lime And About 2 Tablespoons Of Diced Jalapeno And Generous Pinch Of Salt.
4. Layer Each Tortilla With The Mushroom-Pepper Mix, Top With Avocado And Cilantro. Add A Squeeze Of Lime Over Top. A Little Hot Sauce Would Be Great Too!
5. Makes 6 Tacos, Serves 3

title: CRANBERRY ALMOND ENERGY BITES (NO BAKE)
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Raw Almonds
2. 1 Cup Dried Cranberries
3. 1 Cup Old Fashioned Oats
4. 12 Cup Shredded Coconut
5. 12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Or 1 Cup Pitted Medjool Dates 11  12 Chopped
6. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
7. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Blend: Add Ingredients To The Bowl Of A Food Processor And Blend Until Mixed Well And Crumbly, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed.
2. Chill: Place The Mixture In The Refrigerator For About 20 Minutes To Let It Stiffen Up A Bit.
3. Scoop And Roll: Using A 1 Tablespoon Measuring Spoon, Scoop Up Rounded Mounds Of And Roll Into 1 Inch Balls.
4. Add Finishing Touch. For A More Finished Look And To Keep The Dough From Sticking To Your Fingers, Roll The Energy Bites In Shredded Coconut Or Almond Flour.
5. Makes About 20 Energy Bites
6. Store: Keep Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To Two Weeks. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Eating.

title: CREAMY BROCCOLI PASTA
ingredients:
1. 4 Tablespoons Olive Oil
2. 6 Tablespoons Flour
3. 2 12 Cups Plain Unsweetened Cashew Milk Or Your Favorite Plant Milk
4. 1 12 Teaspoons Garlic Powder
5. 1 12 Teaspoons Onion Powder
6. 2  4 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
7. 16 Oz Pasta
8. 16 Oz Broccoli Florets About 4 Cups
9. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Cook Pasta & Broccoli: Cook Your Pasta According To Package And Set Aside. Steam Broccoli Using Your Preferred . If You Like You Can Cook Your Broccoli With The Pasta. Just Be Sure You’Ve Added Enough Water To The Pot. To Do This I Would Suggest Adding The Broccoli To The Cooking Pasta 3 Minutes Before Pasta Is Done. Broccoli Is At It’S Best When It Turns Its Brightest Green.
2. Cream Sauce: In A Medium Saucepan, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add The Flour And Whisk Until Smooth. Continue To Cook For Another 1 1/2 Minutes. Slowly Add In The Almond Milk And Continue To Whisk Until Smooth. Add In Garlic Powder, Onion Powder And Salt To Taste. Turn Heat To Medium Low And Cook Another 8 Minutes Until Sauce Thickens, Stirring Frequently. Remove From Heat And Add Optional Nutritional Yeast. Stir Until Well Incorporated And Taste For Flavor Adding More Salt Or Garlic/Onion Powder As Needed.
3. Mix Together: Using The Pot You Cooked The Pasta In, Toss Together The Pasta, Broccoli And Sauce. Serve With Fresh Cracked Pepper. For A Little Heat, Try Adding A Dash Or Two Of Red Pepper Flakes.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months.
5. Reheat: Warm Leftovers On The Stove Over Low Heat, Adding A Splash Of Milk For Moisture. Alternatively, Heat In The Microwave.

title: HERBED POTATO, ASPARAGUS & CHICKPEA SHEET PAN DINNER
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb Baby Red Potatoes Sliced In Half Lengthwise
2. 1 12 Cups Petite Baby Carrots
3. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
4. 1 Teaspoon Of Each Dried Basil Dried Thyme Dried Oregano See Notes
5. 1 Teaspoon Paprika
6. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. 2  3 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
8. 1 Lb Asparagus Ends Trimmed And Cut Into Thirds
9. 12 Large Yellow Onion Sliced Lengthwise
10. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
11. Fresh Parsley To Serve
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper, Silpat Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Assemble: Add The Potatoes, Carrots And Chickpeas To The Sheet Pan, Drizzle With 1 1/2 Tablespoon Olive Oil And 3/4 Of The Spices, Toss To Coat. Arrange The Potatoes Flesh Side Down, This Will Help Them Get Crispy Edges.
3. Roast: Place In The Oven For 20 -25 Minutes.
4. Add Onion + Asparagus: Carefully Remove The Pan From The Oven, Push The Potato Mixture To One Side, Add The Onion And Asparagus, Add The Remaining Oil And Herb/Spice Mix, Toss To Coat.
5. Continue Roasting: Place Sheet Pan Back In The Oven And Roast For 10 – 15 Minutes More. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
6. Serve: Place In Individual Serving Bowls And Top With Parsley Sprinkled Over Top And Sliced Avocado On The Side. Would Be Great With A Serving Of Quinoa On The Side As Well, Adding More Fiber And Protein!
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: APPLE, BEET, CARROT & KALE SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Apple Green Or Red  I Used Fuji Cored And Julienned
2. 2 Beets Peeled And Julienned
3. 1 12 Cups 173G Carrots Julienned
4. 3  4 Curly Kale Leaves Center Vein Removed And Chopped
5. 13 Cup 56G Cranberries Organic Pref
6. Pepitas Or Sunflower Seeds To Garnish
7. Orange Dressing
8. 4 Tablespoons Orange Juice
9. 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 2 Teaspoons Dijon Mustard
11. 2 Dashes Onion Powder
12. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
13. Couple Grinds Of Fresh Black Pepper
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Orange Juice, Apple Cider Vinegar, Dijon, Onion Powder, Salt And Pepper. Set Aside.
2. Salad: Place The Prepared Apple, Beet, Carrots, Kale And Cranberries In A Large Mixing Bowl, Pour The Dressing Overtop And Toss To Coat.
3. Serve: Place Servings In Individual Bowls And Top With A Sprinkle Of Pepitas Or Sunflower Seeds.
4. Notes:
5. For Cutting The Beets And Apples, I Used This Mandoline To Cut Thin Matchsticks. It Works Perfectly And Makes The Process Easy. There Is Also A Green One That Costs A Little Less, It Just Doesn’T Have The Non-Slip Rubber Or Groove For Placing Over Bowls.

title: RAW SPROUTED HUMMUS
ingredients:
1. 34 Cup Dried Garbanzo Beans Or 1 12 Cups Sprouted Chickpeas
2. 14 Cup Tahini
3. 2 Large Garlic Cloves
4. Juice Of 2 Medium Lemons
5. 14 Cup Purified Water  More As Needed To Thin
6. 1 Tablespoon Cumin
7. 2 Teaspoons Coriander
8. Himalayan Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Soak Chickpeas: If Starting With Dried Beans, Place The Dried Chickpeas In A Large Bowl And Fill With Fresh Purified Water. The Beans Will Double In Size So Be Sure To Cover And Leave Plenty Of Extra Water For Them To Soak Up, About 2 To 3 Times As Much Water. Soak For 8 -12 Hours. Rinse And Drain Thoroughly.
2. Let Beans Sprout: Place The Chickpeas In A Mason Jar With A Sprouting Lid (Or Sprout Them Using A Colander). Leave The Chickpeas Anywhere At Room Temp And Rinse And Drain Them 2 – 3 Times A Day For 2 To 3 Days. If Your Garbanzo Beans Are Not Sprouting, Try Moving Them To A Warmer Area. Here Is A Great Guide To Sprouting Garbanzo Beans From The Sprout Peoplefor Reference.
3. Hummus: Place The Ingredients Into A Food Processor Or High-Speed Blender And Process Until Creamy.D You May Need To Stop Every Now And Then To Scrape Down The Sides. Taste For Flavor, Adding Anything Extra You Like – Garlic, Tahini, Lemon, Spices, Or Salt. If Adding More Water, Add 1 Tablespoon At A Time Until Desired Consistency.
4. Makes About 2 Cups
5. Store: Keep Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.
6. Enjoy With Fresh Sliced Veggies Or Crackers.

title: CRISPY SMASHED POTATOES
ingredients:
1. Potatoes
2. 1 Lb Baby Potatoes Red White Gold Or Purple
3. 3 Tablespoons Olive Oil
4. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
5. Optional Seasonings
6. 1 Teaspoon Thyme Or Zaatar
7. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
9. To Serve
10. 2 Scallions Thinly Sliced
11. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley
12. Tahini Sauce Or Sriracha Cashew Sauce
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 450 Degrees F.
2. Line A Baking Sheet With Silpat, Parchment Paper Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
3. Prep Potatoes: Add Potatoes To The Center Of A Baking Sheet, Drizzle With Oil And Toss To Coat. Arrange Potatoes Spread Out Leaving A Little Room Between Potatoes.
4. Roast 1: Place In The Oven On The Center Rack And Bake For 25 Minutes (If Using Larger Potatoes Cook 30 – 35 Minutes).
5. Smash: Carefully Remove The Sheet Pan From The Oven, Using A Flat Bottom Item (I Used The Bottom Of A 1 Cup Measuring Cup) Or Back Of A Big Spatula, Smash Potatoes. Smash To About 1/2 Inch, A Little Smaller If You Can Without Them Falling Apart Too Much. Gently Use A Fork To Help Remove Potatoes That May Stick To Your Smasher Of Choice. It’S Ok If They Fall Apart A Little, They Should Crisp Up And Stick Together Once Finished.
6. Roast 2: Place Potatoes Back In The Oven And Continue To Bake For An Additional 20 – 25 Minutes, Until Edges Are Deliciously Golden And Crispy Looking. Bake Longer If You Prefer Very Crispy Potatoes!
7. Serve: Place Potatoes On Individual Plates And Drizzle With Sauce And Top With Greens. Or Serve However You Like!
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days. Reheat In The Toaster Oven Or Oven At 350 Degrees Until Warmed Through.

title: QUNIOA SALAD + ORANGE, CRANBERRY & MINT
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
2. 1 34 Cup Water
3. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
4. 7  8 Clementine Tangerine Mandarine Or Other Small Oranges
5. 12 Medium Red Onion Finely Diced
6. 12 Cup Dried Organic Cranberries
7. 3  4 Tablespoons Fresh Mint Chopped
8. 3  4 Tablespoons Fresh Parsley Chopped
9. Handful Arugula
10. Handful Slivered Almonds Optional
11. Dressing
12. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
13. Juice Of 1 Small Orange
14. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Optional
15. 1 Garlic Clove Minced
16. Mineral Salt And Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse The Quinoa Under Cool Running Water Using A Seive (I Typically Skip This Step). Add The Quinoa And Water To A Medium Size Pot, And Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer On Low For 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover And Let Rest For 10 Minutes. Fluff With Fork.
2. Oranges: Peel The Oranges And Thinly Slice Them Widthwise 1/4 Inch Thick. Alternately, Just Peel The Oranges Into Their Natural Wedges.
3. Vinaigrette: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Cider Vinegar, Orange Juice, Olive Oil, Minced Garlic, And Salt And Pepper.
4. Assemble: Using The Pot The Quinoa Was Cooked In, Or A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Quinoa, Chickpeas, Oranges, Cranberries, Onion, Arugula, Mint And Parsley, Pour The Dressing Overtop And Mix To Combine. Season With More Salt & Pepper To Taste.
5. Serve At Room Temperature Or Chilled.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. Salad Can Also Be Made Ahead And Travels Well!

title: MUSHROOM + BUCKWHEAT SOUP
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 2 Leeks Sliced Lengthwise And Thinly Sliced Green And White Part Only Or 1 Large Onion Diced
3. 2 Celery Ribs Sliced A Few Chopped Leaves Is Great Too
4. 2 Large Carrots Peeled And Diced Or Thinly Sliced
5. 1 1B 16 Oz Or 453G Mushrooms Sliced
6. 1 Cup 175G Buckwheat Groats Raw Pref  Kasha Ok Too Rinsed
7. 2 Teaspoons Thyme
8. 2 Teaspoons Fennel Seeds Optional
9. 7  8 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Or Mushroom Broth Or Water
10. 1 Lemon Juice Of
11. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
12. 12 Cup Flat Leaf Parsley Chopped To Garnish
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Stock Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Leeks And Saute Until Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add In Carrots, Celery, Mushrooms, Thyme And Optional Fennel Seeds, Cook Another 4 Minutes, Stirring Frequently.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add In The Buckwheat Groats, Broth, Lemon Juice And Salt & Pepper, And Bring To A Boil, Partially Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes.
3. Serve Garnished With A Sprinkle Of Parsley And A Side Of Crusty Artisan Bread Or Gluten Free Bread Of Choice.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days, In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer Using Freezer Safe Containers For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: RAW GINGER SNAPS
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Oats Regular Or Quick
2. 12 Cup Raw Almonds
3. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Or 34 Cup Dates 7 8 Pitted And Chopped
4. 1 12 Teaspoons Ginger Powder
5. 1 Tablespoon Unsulphured Organic Molasses
6. 12 Teaspoon Vanilla
7. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon
8. 18 Teaspoon Nutmeg Or Ground Cloves
9. 18 Teaspoon Salt
10. For Rolling Optional
11. Raw Sesame Seeds
12. Cinnamon
13. Shredded Coconut
preparation:
1. Blend Into Flour: Combine Oats And Almonds In The Bowl Of A Food Processor, Blend Until You Get A Fairly Fine Consistency, Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect.
