2. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add The Rest Of The Ingredients, Blend Until Combined And Dough Like Consistency, About 1 Minute, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. If For Any Reason You Added More Oats Or Nuts/Seeds And You Feel It Is Too Dry, Try Adding 1 Tablespoon Of Water At A Time To Get Desired Consistency.
3. Chill: Place Mixture In The Refrigerator For About 20 Minutes Or So To Help Stiffen The Dough For Rolling.
4. Roll: Using A 1 Tablespoon Measuring Spoon, Scoop Up Rounded Tablespoons Of Dough And Roll Into 1 Inch Balls.
5. Finishing Touch: Roll The Truffles In Choice Of Cacao Powder, Shredded Coconut, Cinnamon Or White Sesame Seeds For A More Finished Look.
6. Makes 12 Truffles
7. Store: Keep Refrigerated And Enjoy Within Two Weeks Or So. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator.

title: VEGAN BANANA FRENCH TOAST
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Ripe Banana
2. 34 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Milk Of Choice
3. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon Or To Taste
4. Dash Of Nutmeg Optional
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
6. Vegan Butter Or Coconut Oil For Greasing
7. 6 Slices Of French Or Sourdough Loaf Cut 34  1 Inch Thick
8. Pure Maple Syrup For Serving
preparation:
1. Preheat: Heat Your Skillet On Medium Heat Or Griddle To Manufacturer’S Instruction :.
2. Bread:Slice Your Loaf Of Bread Into 3/4 – 1 Inch Thick Slices.
3. Mix: In A Flat Bottom, Shallow Medium Bowl Mash The Banana Until Creamy And Fairly Smooth. Add The Cinnamon, Vanilla, Optional Nutmeg, And Milk, Stir Until Combined.
4. Dip: Using About 1 Teaspoon Of Butter Or Oil, Grease The Griddle/Skillet (Do This Each Time You Add A New Batch). Quickly Dip Bread Into The Wet Mixture And Flip To Coat The Other Side (Do Not Let The Slices Soak, Or You May Have Soggy French Toast).
5. Cook: Place French Toast Sliced On The Griddle And Cook For 3 – 4 Minutes On Each Side, Or Until Golden.
6. Serve With Pure Maple Syrup And Fresh Fruit Of Choice.

title: VEGAN POZOLE (POSOLE VERDE)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Large Onion Diced
3. 1 Large Jalapeno Diced Leave A Few Seeds For Heat If You Like
4. 3  4 Garlic Cloves Minced
5. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cumin
6. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Oregano
7. 1 Can 25  28 Oz Hominy Drained And Rinsed
8. 2 Cans 14 Oz Pinto Beans Drained And Rinsed
9. 6 Medium Tomatillos About 1 Lb Husks Removed Well Rinsed And Chopped
10. 4 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth  More As Needed
11. 1  2 Juicy Limes
12. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
13. To Serve Optional
14. Cilantro Leaves
15. Sliced Avocado
16. Sliced Radish
17. Shredded Cabbage Or Lettuce
18. Limes Wedges
19. Tortilla Chips Or Warmed Flour Or Corn Tortillas
20. Chili Peppers
preparation:
1. Stovetop: In Large Pot, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium, Add Onions And Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Garlic, Jalapeno, Cumin, Oregano, Salt And Pepper, Cook 1 Minute More, Or Until Fragrant. Add The Pinto Beans, Tomatillos, Hominy And Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Cover Askew, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 20 – 30 Minutes. Add Lime Juice And Season To Taste.
2. Instant Pot: Set The Instant Pot To Saute, Heat The Oil/Water, Add The Onion And Cook For 5 Minutes. Add The Garlic, Jalapeno, Cumin, Oregano, Salt And Pepper, Cook 1 Minute More, Or Until Fragrant. Add The Pinto Beans, Tomatillos, Hominy And Vegetable Broth. Cover With Lid And Turn To The Lock Position. Set The Valve To Sealed. Set Instant Pot To High Pressure And Manually Adjust The Time To 20 Minutes. Let Naturally Release For 10 Minutes, And Turn The Valve To Venting To Release Remaining Steam. Add Lime Juice And Season To Taste.
3. Slow Cooker: In The Bowl Of A Slow Cooker, Place All The Ingredients And Give A Good Stir. Cook On Low For 6 – 8 Hours Or High For 3 – 4. Add Lime Juice And Season To Taste.
4. Serve: Ladle Soup Into Individual Serving Bowls. Garnish With Cilantro, Avocado (Highly Recommended) And Radish, Or Any Of The Optional Garnishes.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months.

title: BLACK PEPPER TOFU
ingredients:
1. 1 Block 14  16 Oz Organic Tofu Super Firm Extra Firm Or Firm Cubed
2. 1 Tablespoon Toasted Sesame Oil Sesame Or Grapeseed
3. 14 Cup Tamari Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos
4. 14 Cup Water Or Veggie Broth
5. 3 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
6. 2 Teaspoons Cornstarch Tapioca Or Arrowroot Flour Is Fine Too
7. 1  2 Tablespoons Fresh Cracked Pepper
8. 3  4 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
9. 1 12 Inch Knob Ginger Minced
10. 1 Bunch Scallions Cut Into 1 Inch Pieces
11. 1  2 Chilis Peppers Sliced And Seeds Removed Or 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
12. 1 Bunch Cilantro Roughly Chopped To Serve
preparation:
1. Prep Tofu: If Not Using One Of The Tofu’S Mentioned Above, You’Ll Want To Drain And Press Your Tofu To Remove Excess Water. Simply Cut Tofu Into Slabs And Place Between Paper Towels Or A Clean Dish Cloth. With Wrapped Tofu Laying On A Flat Surface, Place A Heavy Book/Object On Top For About 15 Minutes Or So. Here’S A Great Tutorial From Olives For Dinner: How To Press Tofu Perfectly In Six Steps.
2. Stir-Fry Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Tamari, Water, Sweetener And Flour. This Will Be Your Slurry, Ensuring Your Tofu Will Be Coated Nicely.
3. Cook Tofu: Heat Oil In A Large Wok Or Skillet Over Medium High. Add Tofu And Cook, Stirring Occasionally For About 10 Minutes, Or Until Golden On All Sides. It Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect.
4. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add In Your Slurry Mixture, Ground Pepper, Garlic And Ginger. It Will Sizzle At First When Adding The Liquids. Stir Fry Another 3 Minutes Or So, Add In Hot Peppers And Scallions. Liquids Should Start To Thicken A Bit, Cook Another 5 Minutes Or Until The Scallions Are Just Softened.
5. Serve: Pair With Brown Rice, Brown Rice/Quinoa Mix, Basmati Or Jasmine Rice. Soba Noodles Would Be Great Too. Add A Large Handful Of Chopped Cilantro On The Side, It Will Add To The Flavors While Giving A Nice Dose Of Freshness To The Pepperiness. If You Love Cilantro, You Will Truly Appreciate It Here!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: CHOCOLATE CHIA PUDDING
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Your Favorite Nondairy Milk
2. 14 Cup  2 Tablespoons Chia Seeds
3. 13 Cup 100 Cocoacacao Powder
4. 14  13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
5. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. In A Medium Sized Mixing Bowl, Combine The Milk, Chia Seeds, Cocoa Powder, Maple Syrup, Vanilla And Salt, Whisk Until Blended. Be Patient, It Will Take A Good Minute Or So To Blend In The Cocoa Powder.
2. Cover And Place In The Fridge To Chill. Give A Good Stir After 30 Minutes (This Step Is Very Important Or You’Re Pudding Will Not Set Properly And You’Ll Have A Soupy Mixture), Cover Again And Continue To Chill. Stir Again After 15 To 30 Minutes. Pudding Should Be Thickened And Ready To Serve Within 4 Hours, And Will Be At It Thickest After 8 – 10 Hours.
3. Serve As Is, Or With A Few Of The Following….
4. Banana Slices
5. Berries (Raspberries, Strawberries, Blackberries And/Or Blueberries)
6. Kiwi, Pineapple, Cherries, Or Mandarin Oranges
7. Cacao Nibs, Mini Chocolate Chips, Or Shaved Chocolate
8. Granola
9. Dollop Of Whipped Coconut Cream, Peanut Butter, Or Non-Dairy Vanilla Yogurt
10. Notes:
11. As Suggested By A Reader, Try Adding A 1/2 – 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon!

title: VEGAN BANANA BREAD (HEALTHY + EASY)
ingredients:
1. 1 34 Cups 210 G Spelt Flour Whole Wheat Unbleached Allpurpose Or Gluten Free Blend See Notes
2. 13 Cup 75 G Organic Pure Cane Sugar Or 12 Finely Chopped Dates
3. 1 12 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
6. 13 Cup 75 Cups Neutral Flavored Oil Or Coconut Oil In Liquid State Vegan Butter At Room Temp Or Applesauce
7. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
8. 4 Small Or 3 Large Overripe Bananas About 1 12  1 34 Cups 338410G Mashed
9. 14 Cup 56 Cups Almond Milk Use Only If Needed
10. Optional Tasty Addins
11. 12  23 Cup Chopped Walnuts
12. 14  12 Cup Chocolate Chips Mini Or Regular
13. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Grease Your Loaf Pan.
2. One Bowl : In A Medium Sized Mixing Bowl, Mash 3 – 4 Bananas (About 1 1/2 Cups To 1 3/4 Cups Works Well), Add Oil/Applesauce And Vanilla Extract, Mix Again. Add The Flour, Sugar, Baking Soda, Baking Powder And Salt, And Mix Well, But Don’T Overmix, Just Enough Until The Flour Is Combined. Batter Will Be Slightly Thick And A Few Lumps Is Ok. If Mixture Seems Too Thick, Add Milk, Especially If Using Heavier Flours Such As Whole Wheat Or Whole Spelt (You’Re More Inclined To Need It).
3. Pour Batter Into A Greased Loaf Pan. Bake For About 50 Min – 1 Hour. Ovens Vary, Mine Usually Takes 50 Minutes. You Can Also Do The Toothpick Test In The Center Of The Loaf, If It Comes Out Clean It Should Be Ready. Remove From Oven And Let Cool For 10 Min Before Slicing.
4. Original : In A Medium/Large Size Bowl, Combine Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Baking Soda And Salt, Set Aside. In A Medium Bowl, Mash Bananas. Add The Oil, Vanilla And Bananas To The Dry Ingredients And Mix Until Combined, Do Not Overmix. If Mixture Seems Too Thick, Add The Almond Milk (Especially If Using Heavier Flours Such As Whole Wheat Or Whole Spelt, You’Re More Inclined To Need It).
5. Pour Batter Into A Greased Loaf Pan. Bake For About 50 Min – 1 Hour. Ovens Vary, Mine Usually Takes 50 Minutes. You Can Also Do The Toothpick Test In The Center Of The Loaf, If It Comes Out Clean It Should Be Ready. Remove From Oven And Let Cool For 10 Min Before Slicing.
6. Store: Keep Covered On The Counter For Up To 3 Days Or In The Refrigerator Up To 1 Week. Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months. Thaw The Wrapped Loaves Overnight In The Refrigerator. Reheat In The Microwave Or A Toaster Oven With A Door.

title: CARROT BANANA BREAD
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups 280 G Spelt Flour See Notes
2. 2 Teaspoons Cinnamon
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. Generous Pinch Of Salt
6. 13 Cup 75 G Sugar Organic Pure Cane Or Coconut
7. 12 Cup 113 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk Plain Or Vanilla
8. 14 Cup 56 Cups Light Flavored Olive Oil Or Warmed Coconut Oil See Notes
9. 3 Medium Bananas Mashed About 1 12 Cup 338 G
10. 3 Carrots Grated About 1 14 Cup 125 G
11. 34 Cup 86 G Chopped Walnuts Optional
12. Optional Toppings
13. Sprinkle Of Raw Sugar
14. 14 Cup 29 G Chopped Walnuts
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Grease A 9 X 5 Loaf Pan Lightly With Oil.
2. Mix: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add Flour, Cinnamon, Baking Powder & Soda, And Salt, Mix Well With A Large Slotted Spoon Or Fork. In A Small Bowl, Combine The Sugar, Milk, And Oil, Mix Well To Help The Sugar Dissolve. Mash The Bananas. Add The Wet Mixture And Bananas To The Dry Ingredients, Mix Until Just Combined. Fold In The Carrots.
3. Bake: Pour Batter Into Prepared Loaf Pan And Bake For 50 – 55 Minutes On The Middle Rack, Rotate Pan Halfway Through.
4. Let Cool For 10 Minutes, Remove From Pan And Let Cool Completely.
5. Serve Warmed Or At Room Temperature.Slices Pair Nicely With A Slather Of This Cashew Sweet Cream.
6. Store Covered On The Counter For Up To 3 Days Or In The Refrigerator For Up To 1 Week. Keep In The Freezer For Up To 3 Months – Place Completely Cooled Loaves In Freezer Containers Or Bags. Thaw The Wrapped Loaves Overnight In The Refrigerator.

title: HOMEMADE SOFT PRETZEL BITES
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cup Lukewarm Water 100F  110F
2. 1 Tablespoon Pure Cane Sugar
3. 1 Packet Instant Or Active Dry Yeast About 2 12 Teaspoons
4. 3 34  4 Cups Flour Allpurpose Spelt Whole Wheat Or Combo
5. 1 Teaspoon Sea Salt
6. 12 Cup Baking Soda
7. Olive Oil Or Vegan Butter Melted For Brushing
8. Pretzel Salt Or Any Course Salt As Topping
preparation:
1. Start Yeast: In A Large Bowl, Pour Warm Water And Sugar, Stir To Mix, Sprinkle With Yeast And Let Sit For 5 – 10 Minutes, Yeast Should Become Foamy. Alternatively, Use The Bowl Of Food Processor Or Stand Alone Mixer, Fitted With A Dough Attachment. Also, Instead Of Using A Spoon To Mix, Use A Hand Blender With Dough Attachment.
2. Make Dough: Add 2 Cups Flour To Yeast, Mix Until Combined. Add Salt And Rest Of Flour, Mix Until Combined, About 60 – 90 Seconds. If Using Processor Or Mixer, Beat On Medium-Low Until Dough Pulls Away From The Sides Of The Bowl, About 1 1/2 Minutes. If Dough Is Too Dry Add More Water 1 Tablespoon At A Time And If Dough Is Too Wet, Add More Flour 1 Tablespoon At A Time (This May All Depend On Weather Conditions). Transfer To A Lightly Floured Board And Knead About 3 Minutes, Or Until Somewhat Smooth.
3. Let Dough Rest: Sprinkle The Top Of The Dough With A Little Flour And Cover With A Kitchen Towel. Let Rest For About 10 Minutes, Up To 1 Hours.
4. Heat Oven To 425 Degrees.
5. Grease Baking Sheet With Olive Oil, Or Line With Parchment Or Silicone Mat And Lightly Grease (This Ensures Your Pretzels Don’T Stick), Set Aside.
6. Roll Dough: Knead The Dough Three To Four Times, Slice In Half Using A Sharp Knife Or Pizza Cutter. Roll And Shape Each Half Into A Log, About 10 Inches Long. Cut 1 Inch Pieces.
7. Baking Soda Bath: Fill A Large Pot (At Least 4 Quart) With 2 Inches Of Water (About 8 – 10 Cups). Bring To A Boil. Add Baking Soda, It Will Foam Up So Be Gentle When Adding. Reduce To Medium; Place Half Of The Bites In The Water And Poach For 30 Seconds. They Will Sink And Rise, Once Risen They Should Be Ready. Use A Slotted Spoon To Transfer Pretzel Bites To Baking Sheet. Continue Until All Pretzels Are Poached.
8. Bake: Using A Silicone Brush, Coat The Pretzel Bites With Olive Oil Or Vegan Butter, And Add A Sprinkle Of Salt Over Top. Bake Until Golden Brown, 12 – 16 Minutes (Oven May Vary).
9. Makes About 18 – 20 Pretzel Bites
10. Pretzels Are Best When Eaten Right Away Or The Same Day.
11. Serve Plain Or With Your Favorite Accompaniment. I Used Dijon And Whole Grain Mustard.
12. Store: You Can Keep Leftover Pretzels At Room Temperature, Lightly Covered, For Up To 3 Days. They May Soften After Storing.

title: CREAMY ZUCCHINI PESTO WITH ‘NOODLES’
ingredients:
1. Noodles
2. 2 Zucchini 1 Per Person Cucumber Would Be Good Too
3. Pesto Serves Two
4. 2 Small Zucchini Or One Large
5. 2 Cups Fresh Basil
6. 2 Cloves Garlic
7. 2 Tablespoons Tahini
8. 12 Teaspoon Himalayan Salt Or To Taste
preparation:
1. Noodles: Use A Spiralizer To Create The ‘Noodle’ Effect, Or You Can Julienne Them. Both Ways Are Great But I Do Highly Recommend The Spiralizer If You Intend On Making Raw ‘Noodles’ Often. It’S Really Fun And Easy To Use.
2. Pesto: Cut Zucchini Into 1-Inch Chunks. Steam Chunks Over Boiling Water For About 3 Minutes, Or Until Just Tender When Pierced With A Sharp Knife. I Kept Mine A Little Stiff, I Wanted This To Be As Raw As Possible.
3. Place All Ingredients In Food Processor/Blender And Process Until Finely Chopped.
4. Serve: Mix Your ‘Noodles’ With The Pesto And Serve With Halved Cherry Tomatoes And A Sprinkle Of Almond Parmesan.

title: MEDITERRANEAN KALE SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Bunch Kale Stems Removed And Julienned
2. 1 Large Lemon Juice Of
3. 1 Small Red Bell Pepper Sliced
4. 18 Small Red Onion Sliced
5. 12 Cucumber Sliced
6. 12 Cup Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half Or Campari Tomatoes Quartered
7. 13 Cup Kalamata Olives Pitted
8. 1 Cup Cooked Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans
9. Dollop Of Hummus Optional But So Good To Serve
10. Fresh Chopped Parsley To Serve
11. Vinaigrette
12. 2 Tablespoons Red Wine Vinegar Apple Cider Or White Wine Vinegar Is Ok Too
13. Juice Of 1 Lemon
14. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Dijon Mustard
15. 14 Teaspoon Dried Oregano Optional
16. 1 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil
17. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Marinate The Kale: Remove The Stems From The Center Of The Kale Leaves, As Least The Thickest Parts. Julienne Kale Leaves And Place In A Medium Size Bowl, Add Lemon Juice, Mix To Coat The Leaves And Let Set While You Prepare The Rest Of The Ingredients. The Lemon Juice Will Help Soften The Kale Leaves. Toss Every Few Minutes Or So.
2. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Add The Ingredients For The Vinaigrette. Whisk Together Until Emulsified. It Usually Takes Me About One Minute, Set Aside.
3. Assemble: Once You’Ve Prepped Your Other Ingredients You’Re Ready To Assemble Your Salad. In A Serving Dish, Add Kale And Top With Bell Pepper, Onion, Cucumber, Tomatoes, Olives And Chickpeas. Add Your Vinaigrette Over Top And A Dollop Of Hummus Anywhere You Like.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days In A Covered Container.

title: Spinach ‘Ricotta’ Cannelloni
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Vegan Ricotta Cashew Ricotta Or Tofu Ricotta
2. 20  24 Oz Frozen Spinach Thawed And Drained Well
3. 4 Cups Pasta Sauce Or Homemade Marinara Sauce
4. 14  18 Cannelloni Tubes Or Manicotti See Notes
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Mix Together The Ricotta And Spinach.
3. Place 2 Cups Of Pasta Sauce In The Bottom Of A Baking Dish.
4. Fill Each Tube With The Spinach Ricotta Mix Using A Gallon Ziplock Bag With Corner Cut Or Piping Bag.
5. Place Filled Shells In The Baking Dish And Top With The Remaining Sauce.
6. Cover And Bake For 40 Minutes. Uncover And Bake 5 – 10 Minutes More. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 – 7 Days.
8. Freezing For Later: Make As Directed And Store In A Freezer Safe Container That’S Sealed Well. Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. When Ready, Bake From Frozen As Instructed, Adding An Extra 10 Minutes To The Cooking Time.

title: SPINACH AND ‘RICOTTA’ VEGAN STUFFED SHELLS
ingredients:
1. 18 Jumbo Shells
2. 2 Cups Vegan Ricotta Cashew Ricotta Or Tofu Ricotta
3. 10 Oz Frozen Spinach Thawed And Drained Or 5 Oz Box Of Fresh Spinach Steamed
4. 1 Jar 25Oz Pasta Sauce Or Homemade Marinara Sauce
5. To Serve
6. Fresh Chopped Oregano Or Basil
7. Almond Parmesan
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Pasta: Cook Pasta Shells According To Package Directions.
3. Ricotta Stuffing: Combine The Cashew Ricotta With The Spinach, Set Aside.
4. Prep The Baking Dish: Pour The Entire Jar Of Pasta Sauce Into The Bottom Of A 9 X 13 Inch Baking Dish, Spreading Evenly To All Edges. Alternately, Pour Half The Pasta Sauce, Fill With Stuffed Shells, And Pour The Other Half Over Top.
5. Stuff Shells: Scoop Out Rounded Tablespoon Of The Spinach-Ricotta And Stuff Each Of The Pasta Shells, Placing Them In The Baking Dish. (I Was Able To Get 3 Rows Of 6, Your Results Will Vary Depending On Your Baking Dish.)
6. Bake: Place Baking Dish, Covered, In The Center Of The Oven For 15 Minutes, Sauce Should Be Bubbly. Remove Cover, Reduce Heat To 375 Degrees F. And Cook For 10 – 15 Minutes More.
7. Serve With Fresh Chopped Herbs Of Choice And A Good Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.
8. Store: Cooked, Or Leftover, Stuffed Pasta Shells Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator, In An Air-Tight Container, For Up To 5 Days.

title: SESAME QUINOA + TOFU
ingredients:
1. 14 Ounces Firm Or Extra Firm Organic Tofu Drained And Pressed
2. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil
3. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Seeds White Black Or Toasted
4. 12 Teaspoon Of Garlic Powder
5. 1 2 Tablespoons Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
6. 1 Cup Uncooked Quinoa I Used Tricolor
7. 1 12 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
8. 14 Teaspoon Himalayan Salt Or To Taste
9. 12 To 34 Cup Green Onions Sliced
preparation:
1. Place Tofu On Several Layers Of Heavy-Duty Paper Towels Or Dish Cloth, Let Stand 20 Minutes. Cut Into 1/2-Inch Cubes.
2. Heat Oil In A Medium Saucepan Over Medium Heat. Add Tofu And Dash Of Garlic Powder, Saute 3 Minutes, Add Tamari And Sesame Seeds, Cook Another 2 Minutes Or So, Until Tofu Is Lightly Golden On Each Side. Remove Tofu From Pan And Set Aside.
3. In Same Pan Over Medium Heat, Add Quinoa And Cook 3 Minutes, Stirring Frequently. Add Broth And Salt, Bring To Boil. Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover, Add Tofu But Do Not Stir, And Let Set 10 Min To Soak Up The Rest Of The Water. Add Onions And Fluff Everything Together With A Fork Or Spoon.
4. Serve With A Side Of Steamed Broccoli. Top With A Little Extra Tamari And Sesame Seeds, Plus A Little Fresh Cracked Pepper If You Like.
5. Notes:
6. Planning Ahead, If You’Re Gone For The Day But Want To Make This At Night. Drain Tofu And Let It Set In The Fridge Between Heavy Duty Paper Towels Or Dish Cloth, It Will Be Ready When You Get Home So You Can Have A Meal Within 30 Min Or So.

title: CRUNCHY KALE SALAD WITH CRANBERRIES
ingredients:
1. 1 Bunch Kale Julienned
2. 12 Cup Shredded Carrots
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Julienned
4. 12 Cup Dried Cranberries
5. 14 Cup Sunflower Seeds Toasted Or Raw
6. 14 Cup Hemp Hearts
7. Dressing
8. 4 Tablespoons Orange Juice
9. 2 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 1  2 Teaspoons Pure Maple Syrup
11. 1 Teaspoon Dijon Mustard Optional
preparation:
1. In A Small Mixing Bowl, Combine The Dressing Ingredients And Set Aside.
2. Mix Kale, Carrots, Bell Peppers, And Dressing Together. Let Set For About At Least 30 Minutes To An Hour At Room Temp Or In The Refrigerator. This Will Help Reduce The Toughness And Bitterness. Just Before Serving, Toss In The Sunflower Seeds And Hemp Hearts And Give A Good Stir.
3. Serve In Individual Bowls Topped With More Cranberries And Seeds As Desired. If You Don’T Have Time To Let The Kale Marinate With The Dressing, The Salad Will Still Be Great!
4. Notes:
5. Use Orange, Lemon, Lime And/Or Grapefruit As Your Citrus Juice. Mix And Match Your Citrus Flavors Using Whatever You Have On Hand Or Is Available.
6. Make This A Creamy Dressing By Adding 1 – 2 Tablespoon Tahini When Mixing The Dressing. For Variation Try Using This Creamy Poppy Seed Dressing.
7. The Dijon Is Optional, I Found That I Preferred It With A Small Amount. Try It Both Ways And See What You Think.

title: GRILLED HUMMUS SANDWICH + SAUTEED ONION
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Onion Halved And Thinly Sliced
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
3. 1 Large Tomato Sliced
4. 2 Small Handfuls Of Arugula
5. 12 Cup Hummus Use Your Favorite
6. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper
7. 4 Slices Bread Of Choice
preparation:
1. Saute Onions: Heat 1 Tablespoon Oil In A Medium Pan Over Medium High Heat, Add Sliced Onion And Cook, Stirring Occasionally Until Golden Around The Edges And Tender, About 5 – 7 Minutes Keeping An Eye On The Last 2 Minutes So They Don’T Over Char On The Edges. Set Aside.
2. Preheat Griddle: Heat Your Griddle Over Medium High. Depending On What Type Of Griddle You Are Using, You May Want To Lightly Grease It. I Used A Cast Iron Griddle And Didn’T Grease Mine.
3. Assemble Sandwiches: Layer Both Inside Slices Of Bread With 2 Tablespoons Each Of Hummus. Add A Layer Of Sautéed Onions, Then Sliced Tomato, Arugula And A Sprinkle Of Salt & Pepper. Add Top Slice Of Bread And Gently Press Down.
4. Grill: Drizzle Or Brush Olive Oil On The Top. Place Oiled Side On Griddle And Cook For About 2 – 3 Minutes, Or Until Golden (Times May Vary, Check Periodically So The Bread Doesn’T Burn). Before Flipping, Drizzle Or Brush The Top With Olive Oil. Using A Good Size Spatula, Flip And Cook For Another 2 -3 Minutes Until Bread Is Golden Once Again And Sandwich Is Warmed Through.
5. Slice And Devour!
6. Pairs Well With Seasonal Fresh Fruit Or Homemade Baked Potato Chips.

title: BOK CHOY & WILD MUSHROOM SOBA NOODLE SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Package 9 Oz Soba Noodles
2. 4 Oz Shiitake Oyster Or Mushrooms See Notes For Using Dried Wild Mushrooms
3. 2  3 Baby Bok Choy Ends Trimmed
4. 2  3 Tablespoons Miso Use Your Favorite
5. 4 Cups Water
6. 2  4 Oz Cubed Tofu Optional
7. Garnish
8. 2 Scallions Sliced
9. Fresh Cilantro Sprigs
10. Sesame Seeds
11. Red Pepper Flakes Optional
preparation:
1. Noodles: Cook Your Soba Noodles According To Package, Rinse Under Cool Water, Set Aside.
2. Stir-Fry Mushrooms: In A Wok Or Medium Pan, Heat 1 Tablespoon Dark Sesame Oil Or 1/4 Cup Water Over Medium-High Heat, Add Fresh Chopped Mushrooms And Stir Fry For 4 – 5 Minutes. Add A Little Tarmari For A Little Extra Flavor.
3. Add Remaining Ingredients: Reduce Heat To Medium, Pour 4 Cups Of Water Into The Pan, And Add The Bok Choy. Stir In The Miso And Gently Stir To Dissolve. Cook Over Medium To Medium-Low Heat For 10 -15 Minutes, Or Until Bok Choy Is Tender, Stirring Occasionally (Don’T Let The Soup Boil). Add The Optional Tofu To The Soup To Warm Through.
4. Assemble: In Individual Serving Bowls, Add 1/2 Soba Noodles And Top With 1/2 Bok Choy, Mushrooms. And Miso Broth Over Top. Top With Cubed Scallions, Cilantro Sprigs And Sesame Seeds.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: SESAME-GINGER CUCUMBER SOBA NOODLE SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Package 8 Or 9 Oz Soba Noodles
2. 1 Large English Cucumber Julienned
3. 12 Cup Cilantro Roughly Chopped
4. Lime Wedges
5. Ginger Scallion Sauce
6. 34 Cup Scallions Green Onions Thinly Sliced
7. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
8. 2 Tablespoon Fresh Ginger Grated Or Minced
9. 2 Tablespoons Sesame Seeds
10. 2  3 Tablespoons Rice Wine Vinegar Unseasoned
11. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
12. 1 Tablespoon Toasted Sesame Oil
13. 1  2 Tablespoons Tamari Soy Sauce Or Namo Shoyu
14. 1  2 Teaspoons Red Pepper Flakes To Taste
15. 12 Teaspoon Sriracha Optional
preparation:
1. Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Ingredients For The Sauce And Set Aside.
2. Soba Noodles: Cook Soba Noodles According To Package. I Recommend Salting The Water Well To Really Bring Out The Flavor (I Would Not Usually Recommend This But If Using 100% Buckwheat Noodles They Will Benefit From This…At Least I Think So). Once Done, Rinse The Soba Noodles Under Cool Running Water To Cool Them Down And Stop Them From Cooking, Or They Will Turn Mushy.
3. Cucumber: In The Meantime, Prepare Your Cucumber Using A Julienne Tool. If Your Cucumber Is Really Long, You Can Cut It In Half Before You Julienne It If You Like. You Can Also Spiralize If You Have A Spiralizer. Feel Free To Cut Them Into 1/4 Inch X 1 1/2 Inch Matchsticks Pieces If You Don’T Have A Julienne Tool.
4. Combine: Once Noodles Are Rinsed, Return To The Pot They Cooked In, Add The Cucumber, Cilantro And About 3/4 Of The Sauce, Toss Well.
5. Serve: In A Single Serving Dish, Add 1/2 Of The Noodle Mixture, Top With 1/2 Of The Remaining Sauce, And Salt & Pepper To Taste. Add As Much Lime Juice As You Like. I Especially Loved The Lime And Used About 2 Juicy Ones For Myself.
6. Serve Warm Or Cold.

title: ZUCCHINI & SWEET POTATO VICHYSSOISE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 5 Cups Leeks About 23 Large Or 45 Small Sliced
3. 4 Cups Sweet Potatoes About 2 Small Diced
4. 3 Cups Zucchini About 2 Small Chopped
5. 6 Cups Vegetable Broth
6. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
7. 2 Teaspoons Turmeric Or Curry Powder Optional
8. To Serve
9. 2 Tablespoons Basic Cashew Sour Cream Optional
10. Chopped Fresh Chives Or Scallions For Garnish
preparation:
1. Chop And Prepare Your Vegetables. For The Leeks, Once Sliced Place Them In A Bowl Of Cool Water Swishing Them Around To Rinse Away Any Dirt That Is Trapped, Drain In A Colander Giving Another Good Rinse, Or Simply Use A Colander Making Sure To Break Up The Rings Releasing Any Dirt In Between. The Sweet Potatoes Can Either Be Peeled Or Left Unpeeled.
2. In A Large Dutch Oven Or Stockpot, Heat Oil Over Medium, Add Leeks, And Saute Until Softened, About Five Minutes. Add The Sweet Potatoes, Zucchini, Vegetable Broth, Salt, Pepper, And Optional Turmeric, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Low, Cover And Simmer For 30 Minutes. Let Cool For About 10 – 15 Minutes. Using A Handheld Submersion Blender, Blend Until Creamy. Add The Cream And Blend Again. Or You May Opt To Use A Blender Or Food Processor To Blend Your Soup (This Will Most Likely Take Two Batches To Complete).
3. Serve Hot Or Chilled (I Especially Liked This Warm Or At Room Temp).
4. Makes About 4 Servings

title: GREEK QUINOA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa Rinsed
2. 1 34 Cups Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 1 Can 14 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
5. 1 Cup Grape Tomatoes Sliced In Half Diced Red Bell Pepper Would Work Here Too
6. 1 Cup English Cucumber Diced
7. 12 Red Onion Diced
8. 1 Jar 7 Oz Kalamata Olives About 1 Cup Pitted And Sliced
9. 14 Cup Loosely Packed Fresh Parsley Chopped
10. 3 Tablespoons Fresh Dill Chopped
11. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
12. Juice Of 1 Large Lemon
13. Drizzle Of Extra Virgin Olive Oil Optional
14. Peperoncini To Serve
15. Lemon Slices To Serve Optional
16. Arugula To Serve Optional
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse The Quinoa Using A Fine Mesh Strainer. In A Medium Size Pot, Add The Water, Quinoa And Garlic Powder And Bring To A Boil. Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover And Let Stand For 10 – 15 Minutes. Fluff With A Fork. Alternatively, You Can Make This Instant Pot Quinoa.
2. Assemble: Once Quinoa Is Ready, Add In The Chickpeas, Tomatoes, Cucumber, Onion, Olives And Parsley. Mix Well. Season With Salt, Fresh Cracked Pepper And The Juice Of 1 Large Lemon.
3. Serve On A Bed Of Arugula Or As Is. Tastes Great With Pepperoncinis And A Little Extra Lemon Juice Over Top. Add Extra Virgin Olive Oil If You Wish. Season To Taste With Salt + Pepper.
4. This Dish Can Be Served Warm, At Room Temperature Or Chilled.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator In A Covered Container For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: COCONUT BACON
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
2. 1 Tablespoons Liquid Smoke Optional
3. 1 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
4. 12 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
5. 2 Cups Large Flaked Coconut
6. Mineral Salt For Sprinkling Optional
7. Coconut Oil For Greasing Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 325 Degrees.
2. Mix: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Combine The Tamari, Liquid Smoke, Maple Syrup And Paprika, Making Sure To Break Up Any Clumps. Add Coconut Flakes And Gently Toss Making Sure To Coat Each Flake Well, Toss For About 45 Seconds Or So.
3. Layer: Using A Slotted Spoon, Scoop Seasoned Coconut Flakes And Place Onto A Lightly Greased, Or Parchment Paper Lined, Rimmed Baking Sheet In A Single Layer. The Key Is To Stir During Baking To Cook Evenly. Sprinkle Lightly With A Bit Of Mineral Salt If Desired.
4. Bake: Place In Oven And Bake For 15 Minutes. Set The Timer For Intervals Of 5 Minutes And Stir Each Time Making Sure To Rearrange All Pieces By Bringing The Center Flakes To The Outside, And The Outside Flakes To The Center For Even Cooking. If Making A Double Batch And Using Two Cookie Sheets, You May Even Like To Change The Position Of The Sheets In The Oven After The Second Interval, Moving The Top Sheet To The Bottom Rack And Vice Versa. Remove When Coconut Has A Nice Browned And Caramelized Color.
5. If For Some Reason You Need To Bake Longer Than 15 Minutes, Keep Close And Watch As The Coconut Bacon Can Burn Very Quickly At This Point. I Really Babied My Coconut Bacon Towards The End, It’Ll Be Worth Your While If You Do Too So It Doesn’T Burn.
6. Cool:Let Cool, It Will Get Crispy As It Cools.
7. Store: Once Completely Cooled You Can Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container And Keep In The Pantry For Up 1 To 2 Months. If It Softens A Bit, Re-Crisp In The Toaster Oven On Medium For A Few Minutes, Or Under The Broiler For A Few Seconds, Keeping An Eye That It Doesn’T Burn.
8. Makes 28, 2 Tablespoons, Servings.

title: BLUEBERRY COMPOTE
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Blueberries Fresh Or Frozen
2. Zest Of One Lemon Or Orange Optional
3. 2  3 Tablespoons Lemon Or Orange Juice
4. 2 Teaspoons Sugar Coconut Date Monk Raw Or Pure Cane Sugar
preparation:
1. Prep: If Using Fresh Blueberries, Rinse Well And Remove Any Stems.
2. Simmer: Place A Small Saucepan Over Medium Heat, Add Blueberries, Sugar, Lemon/Orange Juice And Zest, Bring To A Simmer, Mashing The Berries With The Back Of A Spoon.
3. Cool: Cook For 8 Minutes Or So, Until Compote Is Warm, Bubbly And Thickened, Remove From Heat And Set Aside, About 10 Minutes.
4. Best Served Warm Or At Room Temperature, But Can Also Be Served Chilled.
5. Makes About 2/3 Cup.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 7 Days. Give A Good Stir Before Serving. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In Refrigerator Before Using.

title: Italian Vegan Stuffed Peppers
ingredients:
1. 6 Large Bell Peppers Any Color Top Cut Off And Seeds Removed
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
3. 1 Medium Onion Diced
4. 3  4 Cloves Garlic Mined
5. 2 8Oz Packages Tempeh Crumbled
6. 1 Cup Zucchini Diced
7. 1 Cup Yellow Squash Diced
8. 8 Oz Package Mushrooms Sliced
9. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
10. 1 Teaspoon Dried Basil
11. Generous Pinch Red Pepper Flakes
12. 14 Cup Fresh Chopped Parsley
13. 1 Can 14Oz Tomato Sauce
14. 1 Cup Cooked Rice
15. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Saute: In A Large Skillet, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion, Garlic And Crumbled Tempeh, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Zucchini, Yellow Squash, Mushrooms, Oregano, Basil, Red Pepper Flakes, Parsley, Salt And Pepper, And Tomato Sauce, Cook For 2 Minutes Or So. Add Rice And Mix To Combine. Remove From Heat.
3. Stuff Bell Peppers: Fill Each Bell Pepper With Vegetable Mixture, Making Sure To Pack It Well. These Are Hefty Stuffed Bell Peppers. Sprinkle With Optional Vegan Shredded Cheese. Cover With Lid Or Tin Foil.
4. Bake: Place Dish On The Center Rake And Bake For 35 – 40 Minutes. Remove Cover And Bake For Another 5 – 10 More Minutes. Cooking Times Vary, Adjust To Suit Your Needs.
5. Once Done, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Serve With A Sprinkle Of Freshly Chopped Parsley.
6. Store: Store Leftovers, Covered, In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days. To Keep Longer Store Vegan Stuffed Peppers In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. To Freeze, Simply Let Peppers Cool Completely And Store Them In Freezer-Safe Containers. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: CURRY + SRIRACHA ROASTED CAULIFLOWER
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Head Cauliflower Cut Into Florets
2. 1  2 Tablespoons Sesame Oil Coconut Or Olive Oil Is Great Too
3. 1 Heaping Tablespoon Sriracha Chili Sauce
4. 1 Heaping Tablespoon Curry Powder
5. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees.
2. Mix: To A Large Bowl, Add Cauliflower And Top With Oil, Sriracha, Curry And Salt, Tossing Well To Coat.
3. Layer: Place Coated Cauliflower In A Single Layer On A Roasting Pan Lined With Parchment Paper, Silicone Mat Or Lightly Greased With Oil If Needed.
4. Roast: Place In Center Of The Oven For 45 Minutes, Stirring Every 15 Minutes.
5. Serve: Enjoy Alone As A Mono Meal, Or Serve Over Farro, Basmati, Jasmine Or Brown Rice, Even Quinoa Would Be Excellent.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: CHILI STUFFED SWEET POTATOES
ingredients:
1. 2  4 Sweet Potatoes 1 Per Person
2. 3  4 Cups Vegan Chili 12 Cup Per Person
3. Optional Toppings
4. Shredded Vegan Cheese
5. Sliced Scallions
6. Vegan Sour Cream
7. Hot Sauce
8. Chopped Cilantro
9. Red Pepper Flakes
10. Sliced Or Diced Avocado
preparation:
1. Prep: Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silpat. See Notes For Microwave Instruction :.
2. Sweet Potato: Scrub The Sweet Potatoes To Remove Any Dirt. Using A Fork Poke Holes Into The Top Of The Sweet Potato So It Can Release Steam While Cooking. Place On A Lined Rimmed Baking Sheet And Bake In The Oven For 50 Minutes To 1 Hour. Let Cool A Few Minutes.
3. Chili: If Making A Fresh Batch, Cook The Chili While The Sweet Potatoes Are Baking. If Using Leftovers, Reheat The Chili 5 – 7 Minutes Or So Before Baked Sweet Potatoes Are Done.
4. Assemble: Slice The Sweet Potato Lengthwise Along The Top Where The Holes Were Poked. Gently, And Slightly, Open The Sweet Potato And Fill With Your 3/4 – 1 Cup Of Chili.
5. Serve: Top With Optional Garnish And Enjoy This Delicious Hearty Meal! Pairs Great With Vegan Cornbread Or Jalapeno Cornbread Muffins!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In Covered Containers In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days. Store The Chili And Sweet Potatoes Separately Or Assembled.
7. Notes:
8. Microwave Instruction :: Place Thesweet Potatoeson Amicrowave-Safe Dish And Microwave For 5 – 10 Minutes. Add Two Minutes For Each Additionalpotato, Rotating Them Halfway Through. Sweet Potatoes Are Done When A Fork Spears Into Them Easily.
9. *Chili Suggestions: (These Are My Favorites For Stuffing Sweet Potatoes)
10. Easy Vegetable Chili(The Chili I Used)
11. The Ultimate Tempeh Chili
12. Easy Three Bean Chili
13. Quinoa Chili Verde

title: Quinoa + White Bean Veggie Burger
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup Dried Quinoa
2. 1 Cup Water
3. 12 Cup Corn Fresh Canned Or Frozen
4. 12 Cup Red Bell Pepper Finely Diced About 12 Bell Pepper
5. 12 Cup Shallot Finely Diced About 1 Medium Or Red Onion
6. 2 Teaspoons Thyme Divided Oregano Would Be Good Too
7. 1 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder
8. 12  1 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
9. 12 Teaspoon Chipotle Or Chili Powder Optional
10. 1 Can 15 Oz White Beans I Used Great Northern Drained And Rinsed
11. Juice Of One Small Lemon
12. 12 Cup Flax Meal Or Flour Of Choice
13. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
14. Olive Oil To Grease
15. To Serve
16. Tomato Sliced
17. Leafy Greens
18. Avocado Sliced Or Mashed
19. Red Onion Sliced
20. Wholegrain Or Dijon Mustard Hummus Or Vegan Mayo Is Great Too
21. Sriracha Or Sriracha Cashew Cream Use The Sriracha Cream In Place Of Mustard
22. Burger Buns Of Choice
preparation:
1. If Baking In The Oven, Turn Oven To 375 Degrees F. (It’S Helpful To Read Instruction : First Before Making The Patties)
2. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot, Add The Quinoa, Water, Red Bell Pepper, Corn, Onion, Garlic + Onion Powder, Thyme, Paprika, And Salt. Give A Gentle Stir, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat, And Simmer For 15 Minutes.
3. Mash The Beans: While The Quinoa Is Cooking, Drain And Mash The White Beans. You Can Quickly Mash The Beans In Your Colander If It Has Smaller-Sized Holes (It’Ll Save You A Dish To Wash). I Mash About 3/4 Of The Beans, Leaving A Quarter Of The Batch Whole Or Somewhat Whole.
4. Add Beans And Flax Meal: Once Quinoa Is Done, Remove The Cover And Stir In The Mashed White Beans And Flax Meal, Mixing Well. Let The Mixture Cool For 10 – 15 Minutes. Taste For Flavor – Seasoning To Taste With Salt, Pepper, And Other Spices.
5. Divide And Make Your Patties:I Like To Pat My Mixture Into The Bowl A Little And Divide It With A Knife Into 4 Sections, Making A Plus Sign If You Will. Take Each Section And Pack It Tightly Into A Ball In The Palm Of Your Hands. Flatten With Your Palms And Place On A Hard Surface. Cup The Edges With Your Palm, Tighten Them In A Bit, And Squeeze Together Any Cracks That Have Formed. Flatten The Top To The Desired Size. Mine Were About 1/2 Inch Thick With A 3 1/2 – 4 Inch Diameter.
6. Cook One Of Two Ways:
7. Oven: In The Oven At 375 Degrees On A Greased Or Parchment-Lined Cookie Sheet For 30 Minutes, Turning Once After 15 Minutes. I Also Added A Sprinkle Of Himalayan Salt To The Top Before Baking.
8. Stovetop: In A Large Skillet, Heat 1 Tablespoon Coconut Oil Or Olive Oil Over Medium To Medium-High Heat. Cook Patties For About 4 – 5 Minutes On Each Side. Burgers Should Be Lightly Charred, Crispy, And Browned On The Outside With A Tender Center.
9. I Cooked Both Ways And Had No Preference. They Both Held Up Well And Cooked Great.
10. Makes 4 Jumbo Patties
11. Serve On A Bun Or Bed Of Leafy Greens With Your Favorite Toppings!

title: HEALTHY BAKED BEANS (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 2 Teaspoons Smoked Paprika
4. 1 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder
5. 1 1B Dried Small White Beans Navy Or Great Northern 2 Cups Rinsed And Odd Beans Removed Not Soaked
6. 4 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Half Water  Broth
7. 13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
8. 14 Cup Tomato Paste Use A 6Oz Can For Extra Tomato Flavor
9. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 2 Tablespoons Mustard Regular Dijon Or Whole Grain
11. 12 Teaspoon Fresh Ground Pepper
12. 2 Bay Leaves
13. 12  1 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
14. Optional Addins For Variation
15. Small Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced Add A Few Seeds For Extra Heat
16. Small Green Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
17. 2  4 Tablespoons Unsulfured Blackstrap Molasses
preparation:
1. (These Instruction : Are For The No-Soak , If Using Soaked Beans, See Notes Below)
2. Instant Pot (No Soak ):
3. Press The Saute Setting On Your Instant Pot And Add 1/4 Cup Water. When Hot, Add Onion And Saute For 4 Minutes. Add The Smoked Paprika And Garlic Powder, Cook For 1 Minute, Or Until Fragrant, Stirring Frequently.
4. Next Add The Beans, Broth, Tomato Paste, Maple Syrup, Apple Cider Vinegar, Mustard, Bay Leaves, Ground Pepper And Salt, Gently Stir Until The Tomato Paste Is Dissolved Completely And Everything Is Well Combined.
5. Attach The Lid, And Make Sure The Vent Is In The Sealed Position. Push The Pressure Cooker Button, And Manually Set At High For 75 Minutes. When Done, Let The Steam Vent For 20 Minutes. Move The Vent To Open, Careful Not To Burn Yourself As There May Still Be A Little Steam Left. Remove Lid And Let Cool A Bit, Add Salt To Taste. Remove Bay Leaves And Taste For Seasoning. Transfer Beans To A Serving Dish.
6. Beans Will Thicken Once Cooled. If Too Thick, Add 2 Tablespoons Of Water At A Time, Mix Well, And Repeat Until Desired Consistency.
7. Total Cooking Time With Coming To Pressure Is About 2 Hours And 5 Minutes.
8. Slow Cooker (No-Soak ):
9. In Bottom Of Slow Cooker, Add The Onion, Beans, Maple Syrup, Vinegar, 4 Cups Water/Broth, Tomato Paste, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Powder, Mustard, Pepper, And Bay Leaves. Gently Stir, Until The Tomato Paste Has Broken Up And Dissolved.
10. Cook On High For 8 – 10 Hours. Check Periodically, Adding Up To 1/2 Cup More Water As Needed (I’Ve Used Up To 1 + 1/2 Cups For 8 Hours). You Will Also Want To Check For Doneness Towards The End So The Beans Don’T Overcook. Add Salt To Taste.
11. Store: Keep Leftovers In And Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To A Week. These Freeze Wonderfully, And Will Keep For Up To 2 Months In The Freezer. Thaw Before Reheating.

title: APPLE, BEET & FENNEL SALAD + BALSAMIC MAPLE-DIJON VINAIGRETTE
ingredients:
1. Candied Walnuts
2. 34 Cup Walnuts
3. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
4. Salad
5. 1 Red Beet Uncooked Peeled And Julienned Or Grated
6. 1 Fennel Bulb Thinly Sliced Save A Few Fronds Reserved For Garnish If Any
7. 1 Fuji Apple Or Hard Crisp Apple Or Pear Of Choice Cored And Diced Or Grated
8. Small Handful Of Mint Leaves Roughly Chopped
9. Arugula Or Spinach To Serve Optional
10. Balsamic Maple Dijon Vinaigrette
11. 1 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil
12. 1 Tablespoon Balsamic Vinegar
13. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
14. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Dijon Or Stone Ground Mustard
15. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees.
2. Line A Small Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or A Silpat. Place Nuts In The Center, Drizzle With Maple Syrup And Using Your Finger, Mix Well To Coat. Place In A Single Layer. Cook For About 10 Minutes, Set Aside To Cool. Maple Will Be Caramelized On The Nuts And Your Home Will Be Smelling Oh So Good At This Point!
3. In A Small Bowl Combine The Ingredients For The Vinaigrette, Whisk Until Well Blended Adding, Add Salt And Pepper To Taste.
4. Prepare Your Vegetables, Fruit And Herbs. Place Them In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add The Vinaigrette And Mix Well.
5. Serve On A Small Bed Of Arugula Or Spinach, Garnish With Nuts And A Few Fennel Fronds. Enjoy This Nutritious And Delicious Salad!
6. Notes:
7. Since Red Beets Tend To Be Pretty Messy To Work With, You May Like To Use Golden Beets Instead. You May Also Consider Using Apple Cider Vinegar In Place Of The Balsamic So The Dark Color Of The Balsamic Doesn’T Discolor Your Lighter Colored Beets.

title: CHOCOLATE CHAI ROASTED ALMONDS
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Raw Almonds
2. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
3. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract Optional
4. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cocoa Powder
5. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cinnamon
6. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cardamom
7. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Ginger
8. 12 Teaspoon Cloves
9. 14  12 Teaspoon Black Pepper
10. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350.
2. Mix: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add Almonds, Maple Syrup, Vanilla And Spices, Mix Well To Coat. On A Large Baking Sheet Lined With Parchment Paper Or Lightly Oiled, Spread Almonds In A Single Layer, It’S Ok If They’Re Touching Each Other, Add A Sprinkle Of Salt Over Top.
3. Roast: Bake On Center Rake Of The Oven For 15 Minutes, Shuffling The Almonds Around Once After 10 Minutes. Remove From Oven, Sprinkle With Mineral Salt And Let Cool To Harden. They May Clump Together A Bit While Cooling But Will Easily Come Apart.
4. Store In Airtight Container For Up To A Month.

title: DECONSTRUCTED NACHO BOWL (QUICK + EASY)
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Easy Refried Beans Or 1 Can 15Oz Refried Beans
2. 1 Cup Pico De Gallo
3. 1 Cup Fresh Corn Salsa
4. 1 Cup Red Cabbage Shredded
5. 2 Avocados Diced Or Sliced
6. 12  1 Cup Vegan Cheese
7. 4 Cups Tortilla Chips
8. Garnish
9. Lime Wedges
10. Cilantro Chopped
11. Vegan Sour Cream Optional
preparation:
1. Cook The Beans. If Making Them From Scratch They Can Easily Be Made Ahead Of Time And Then Warmed Up On The Stove Before Assembling Your Nacho Bowls. Using Canned Refried Beans, See Notes.
2. Prep The Salsa. Make The Pico De Gallo And Corn Salsa. Again, Both Of These Can Be Made In Advance, Up To 1 – 2 Days.
3. Prep The Remaining Produce. Shred The Cabbage Cabbage And Slice The Avocado.
4. Assemble The Nacho Bowls. To Assemble The Bowls, Arrange The 1/2 Cup Refried Beans, 1/4 Pico De Gallo, 1/4 Corn Salsa, Small Handful Of Red Cabbage, And 1/2 Avocado In A Serving Bowl, Top With Cheese And Place 1 Cup Of Chips On One Side Of The Bowl.
5. If You Prefer To Heat In The Oven:
6. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F.
7. Add The Serving To Refried Beans To Individual Bowls, Top With Cheese And Add A Handful Of Chips On The Side.
8. Place In Oven And Bake For 5 – 8 Minutes.
9. Remove From Oven, Add The Salsa, Red Cabbage And Avocado, Along With The Other Garnishing And Enjoy!
10. Makes About 3 – 4 Nacho Bowls.

title: QUINOA CHILI VERDE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 3 Tablespoons Water
2. 1 Large White Onion Diced
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Dried Oregano
5. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
6. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder
7. 1 1B Tomatillos Diced Or Quartered Or 1 Can 15 Oz Crushed
8. 2 Poblano Or Anaheim Peppers Deseeded And Diced
9. 1 Cup Corn Fresh Off The Cob Frozen Or Canned
10. 1 Can 15 Oz Cannellini Beans Or Pinto Beans Drained And Rinsed
11. 1 Can 15 Oz Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
12. 1 Cup Dry Quinoa
13. 4 Cups Vegetable Broth
14. Salt  Pepper To Taste
15. Optional Garnish
16. Avocado Diced
17. Bunch Cilantro Roughly Chopped
18. Cashew Sour Cream
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat And Saute Onions Until Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add Garlic Powder, Oregano, Cumin And Chili Powder, Cook For 1 Minute More Stirring Frequently, Or Just Until Spices And Herbs Become Fragrant.
2. Simmer: Add Tomatillos, Poblanos, Corn, Beans, Quinoa And Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 20 – 25 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover And Let Rest A Few Minutes Before Serving.
3. Serve In Individual Bowls Topped With Garnish Of Choice. Pairs Well With Cornbread Too, Either On The Side Or Broken Up In Your Chili!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored, Covered, In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 6 Days. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer Using Freezer Safe Containers Or Baggies For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: VEGAN CAULIFLOWER SOUP
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Vegan Butter  Miyokos Is The Best See Notes For Subs
2. 1 Large Onion Diced
3. 3 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1 Large Head Cauliflower About 2 12  3 Lbs Cut Into Florets
5. 1 Teaspoon Fresh Thyme Or 2 Sprigs
6. 5 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water
7. 1 Cup Vegan Cream Or Plant Milk Of Choice
8. 1 Small Lemon Juice Of
9. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Prep: Start By Prepping The Onion And Garlic. Cut The Cauliflower Into Florets, They Can Be On The Large Side As You Can Break It Down As It Cooks.
2. Saute: In A Heavy Bottom Pan, Heat The Butter Over Medium Heat, Add The Onion And Saute For 6 Minutes. Add The Garlic And Cook 1 Minute More.
3. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add The Cauliflower, Thyme, Salt And Pepper, And Water/Broth.
4. Simmer: Bring The Chunky Soup To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer, Stirring Occasionally, For 20 Minutes, Or Until Cauliflower Is Fork Tender.
5. Add Cream + Lemon: Stir In The Vegan Cream Or Plant Milk And Lemon Juice.
6. Puree: Once Soup Is Done, Let Rest For 10 Minutes To Cool. Using An Immersion Blender Or Cup Blender, Puree The Soup Until Desired Consistency. Season With More Salt & Pepper As Needed. Heat Over Low Until Warmed Through As Needed.
7. Serve: Serve With A Few Reserved Toasted Cauliflower Pieces, Drizzle Of Vegan Cream And/Or Fresh Cracked Pepper. For A Little Heat, Add A Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Or Crushed Mustard Seeds. Pair With Homemade Artisan Breador Soft And Chewyvegan Naanfor Soaking Up The Juices.
8. Store:Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days In A Covered Container. To Store Longer, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Pepper, Onion & Sausage Spaghetti Squash
ingredients:
1. 1 Cooked Spaghetti Squash
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Julienned
4. 12 Yellow Onion Sliced
5. 2 Vegan Sausages Such As Field Roast Or Tofurkey Sliced
6. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper
7. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
8. A Few Large Basil Leaves Julienned
9. 1 Jar Marinara Sauce Optional
preparation:
1. Cook The Spaghetti Squash Using This Step By Step Guide: How To Cook Spaghetti Squash
2. In A Medium Size Skillet, Heat Olive Oil Over Medium High Heat, Add Onion And Cook Until Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add Sliced Bell Peppers And Sausage, Cook Until Bell Peppers Are Softened And Sausage Is Lightly Browned Around The Edges.
3. While Veggies Are Cooking, Warm Pasta Sauce.
4. Serve Spaghetti Squash In Serving Bowl And Top With A Little Sauce And 1/2 Of The Vegetable Mixture. Add Julienned Basil Over Top And Enjoy.
5. Notes:
6. If You Prefer You Can Rake And Keep The Spaghetti Squash In Its Rind, Acting As Its Own Bowl. One Less Dish To Wash!
7. Marinara Sauce Can Be Optional, This Works Just As Well Without It.

title: Risi E Bisi (Italian Rice and Peas)
ingredients:
1. 8  10 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water Or A Combo
2. 2 Bay Leaves
3. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
4. 1 Clove Garlic Minced
5. 2 Medium Leeks Thinly Sliced Or 1 Medium Onion Or 2 Shallots Diced
6. 2 Cups 1 Lb Arborio Rice Carnaroli Or Vialone Nano Works Too
7. 4 Cups Or 2 10Oz Packages Peas Fresh Or Frozen
8. 14 Cup Flat Leaf Parsley Chopped And Loosely Packed
9. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
10. 14  13 Cup Nutritional Yeast Or To Taste Optional
11. Almond Parmesan For Topping Not Shown
preparation:
1. Warm Broth: In A Medium Saucepan, Place The Broth/Water And Bay Leaves, Bring To A Gentle Simmer And Keep Broth Warm.
2. Saute: In A Large Stock Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Leeks And Cook Until Just Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add Garlic And Rice, Toss Until Rice Is Nicely Coated, About 3 Minutes.
3. Slowly Add Liquids: Add In Warm Broth, One 1 Cup At A Time, The Stock Should Be Bubbly. Stir Often Allowing The Broth To Be Just Absorbed. Add In Another 1 Cup Of Broth, Repeat Until 6 Cups Have Been Used. Add In Peas, And Remaining Stock And Continue Cooking, Stirring Frequently, For Another 15 Minutes Or So, Or Until The Rice Is Al Dente, Tender But Chewy. The Whole Process Should Be About 25 – 30 Minutes.
4. Add Parsley: Once Done, The Rice And Peas Should Be A Little Soupy. Remove From Heat, Stir In The Optional Nutritional Yeast And Parsley. Season To Taste With Plenty Of Salt And Pepper.
5. Serve Topped With A Nice Dusting Of Almond Parmesan And Freshly Cracked Pepper.
6. Less Hands-On :
7. After Sauteing The Leeks And Rice As Above.
8. Add At Least 7 – 8 Cups Broth, Peas, Bay Leaves, Bring To A Boil, Cover And Cook For 20 – 30 Minutes Until Rice Is Tender.
9. Remove From Heat Add In Parsley. Let Set A Few Minutes And Serve As Desired.
10. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days In A Covered Container. To Store Longer, Freeze In Freezer Safe Containers For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: VEGAN TOFU POKE BOWL
ingredients:
1. Tofu Poke
2. 14 To 13 Cup Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
3. 1 Tablespoon Rice Vinegar Or Lime Juice
4. 12 Tablespoon Sambal Oelek
5. 1 Teaspoon Sesame Oil
6. 2 Cloves Garlic Smashed And Finely Chopped Or Finely Grated
7. 1 Inch Piece Ginger Peeled And Finely Chopped Or Grated
8. 13 Sweet Onion Such As Maui Onion Julienned
9. 14 Oz Block Organic Tofu Firm Or Extra Firm Cut Into 12 Inch Cubes
10. Bowl Filling
11. 12 Cucumber Sliced
12. 3  4 Radishes Sliced
13. 14 Red Cabbage Shredded
14. 1 Avocado Diced Or Sliced
15. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Seeds Toasted Or Black
16. 2 Scallions White And Green Parts Sliced Thinly On The Bias
17. 13 Cup Cilantro Roughly Chopped
18. 1 12 Cups Cooked Rice Brown Black Or Cilantro Lime Rice Or Quinoa
19. To Serve
20. Dynamite Sauce Optional
21. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Prep Tofu: Drain The Tofu And Place It On Its Side, Cut In Half Down The Long Side. Place On A Clean Dish Cloth Or Between Paper Towels And Gently Press To Soak Up Some Of The Moisture. Dice The Tofu Into 1/2 Inch Cubes.
2. Marinate: In A Medium Bowl Or Shallow Dish, Combine The Soy Sauce, Sambal, Sesame Oil, Garlic, Ginger And Sweet Onions. Toss In The Tofu And Let Rest In For 10 Minutes.
3. Prep The Remaining Ingredients And Assemble Your Bowls.

title: APPLE-CRANBERRY CRISP (EASY + HEALTHY)
ingredients:
1. 3 Medium Apples Cored And Chopped Peel If You Prefer
2. 1 12 Cups Cranberries Fresh Or Frozen
3. 3 Tablespoons Fresh Lemon Juice
4. 1 Tablespoon Sugar Coconut Or Organic Pure Cane
5. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cinnamon
6. Topping
7. 1 34 Cup Oats Quick Regular Oats Or A Combo
8. 14 Cup Flaxseed Meal Or Almond Meal
9. 1 Cup Finely Chopped Walnuts Or Pecans Optional
10. 12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup If Making Oil Free Add 2 Tablespoons Extra
11. 3  4 Tablespoons Coconut Oil At Room Temp Optional
12. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
13. 14 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
14. Cinnamon To Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Put The Fruit Together: Wash, Slice, Core And Dice The Apples, Into About 3/4 Inch Pieces. Combine Apples, Cranberries, Lemon Juice, Sugar And Cinnamon. Mix Well And Layer Into A 9 X 9 Baking Dish, You Can Also Use An Oval Shaped Dish.
3. Make The Topping:In A Mixing Bowl (Shown Above), Combine Oats, Flaxseed Meal, Walnuts/Pecans, Maple Syrup, Optional Coconut Oil (Mine Is Oil-Free), Vanilla And Salt, Mix Well.Spread Oat Mixture Evenly Over The Apple And Cranberries (Shown Below), And Sprinkle With A Little More Cinnamon Of You Like.
4. Bake For 35 – 40 Minutes, Or Until Apples And Cranberries Are Fork Tender. Towards The End Of Cooking, About 20 – 25 Minutes In, Keep An Eye On The Topping, If Its Getting To Dark, Cover Loosely With Foil (Nothing Worse Than A Burnt Crisp). Once Done, Let Cool 5 – 10 Minutes Before Serving.
5. Serve Warm As Is, With A Scoop Of Non-Diary Vanilla Ice Cream Or Dollop Of Whipped Coconut Cream. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.
6. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: THAI LETTUCE WRAPS (HEALTHY + VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. Meatballs
2. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas
3. 12 Cup Cooked Quinoa
4. 14 Cup Coconut Sugar Or Organic Brown Sugar
5. 2 Tablespoons Salted Natural Peanut Butter Smooth Or Chunky
6. 2  3 Tablespoons Tamari Or Soy Sauce
7. 14 Cup Finely Chopped Fresh Cilantro
8. 14 Cup Scallions Green Onions Thinly Sliced
9. 1 Teaspoon Chili Garlic Sauce
10. 14 Cup Roasted Salted Peanuts Crushed Or Finely Chopped
11. Peanut Sauce
12. 13 Cup Natural Peanut Butter Or Almond Butter
13. 1 Tablespoon Tamari Or Soy Sauce
14. 2 Tablespoons Coconut Sugar Or Organic Brown Sugar
15. 12 Lime Juiced
16. 12  1 Teaspoon Garlic Chili Sauce
17. 2  4 Tablespoons Hot Water To Thin
18. Lettuce Wraps
19. 1 Head Butter Or Bibb Lettuce Or 1  2 Head Romaine
20. Shredded Carrots
21. Sliced Green Onions
22. Chopped Peanuts
23. Chopped Fresh Cilantro
24. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silpat, Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Mash Chickpeas: Drain, Rinse And Pat The Chickpeas Dry As Possible. In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add Chickpeas And Mash Well With The Back Of A Fork (Pulsing In A Blender/Food Processor Will Also Work).
3. Mix The Meatball Mixture: Add In The Remaining Ingredients For The Meatballs With The Mashed Chickpeas. Mix Well To Combine. Taste And Adjust Seasoning As Needed. If Mixture Is Too Wet, Add A Bit More Crushed Peanuts (A Few Tablespoons Of Breadcrumbs Would Work Great Too). I Will Depend On How Wet Your Quinoa And Peanut Butter Are.
4. Roll Meatballs: Scoop Up Mixture, Using About 1 – 1 1/2 Heaping Tablespoons. Gently, But Firmly Press The Mixture Together And Shape Into Balls, Rolling Between Your Palms. Take Your Time. You Should Get About 12. The Mixture My Be Sticky And You May Need To Rinse Your Hands After Rolling 2 – 3 Balls, It Helps To Keep Your Hands Clean.
5. Bake: Place ‘Meatballs’ On The Prepared Baking Sheet. Place On The Center Rack In The Oven For 25 – 20 Minutes.
6. Peanut Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Mix The Peanut Butter, Tamari, Sugar, Lime, Garlic And Chili Sauce. Add Hot Water A Tablespoon Or So At A Time Until Desired Consistency. If Too Thin Add More Nut Butter.
7. Serve: Place Lettuce (You May Want To Double Up The Lettuce For Added Strength) On Individual Serving Dishes, Top With Carrots, Meatballs, Scallions, Peanuts, Cilantro And A Drizzle Of Peanut Sauce. Enjoy To The Fullest!
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: Black Bean, Corn & Avocado Salad
ingredients:
1. 2 Cans 14 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 2 Ears Of Corn Cut Off The Cobs About 1 12 Cups Sub With Canned Or Frozen
3. 1 Dry Pint Grape Tomatoes Or About 1 12 Cups Quartered
4. 1 Large Jalapeno Finely Diced And Most Seeds Removed
5. 12 Small Red Onion Finely Diced
6. 1 Avocado Firm But Ripe Finely Diced
7. 12 Cup Chopped Cilantro Loosely Packed
8. Dressing
9. 2  3 Tablespoons Olive Oil
10. 1 Large Juicy Lime About 2 Tablespoons Juice Of
11. 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar Optional
12. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
13. 12 Teaspoon Cumin  Chili Powder
14. Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Oil, Lime Juice, Apple Cider Vinegar, Garlic, Cumin, Chili Powder, And Pinch Of Salt. Set Aside.
2. Assemble: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Black Beans, Corn, Tomatoes, Jalapeno, Red Onion, Avocado, And Cilantro. Pour The Dressing Overtop And Toss Well To Coat. Taste For Seasoning.
3. Serve Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days In A Covered Container.

title: Southwest Quinoa Salad
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa Rinsed
2. 1 34 Cup Water
3. 1 Can 15Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
4. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
5. 1 Can 15Oz Sweet Corn Drained
6. Large Handful Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
7. 12 Cup Diced Red Onion Or Green Onions
8. 1 Small Can Of Diced Black Olives
9. 2 Limes Juice Of About 2 Tablespoons
10. 2 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
11. 1 Tsp Cumin
12. 14  12 Teaspoon Chili Powder
13. 14  12 Teaspoon Salt Or To Taste
14. 14 Cup Cilantro Chopped
15. Avocado Diced Or Sliced Optional
preparation:
1. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot, Add The Water And Quinoa, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat, And Simmer For 15 Minutes At A Gentle Boil. Turn Off Heat, Remove The Cover, And Let Rest For 10 Minutes. Fluff With A Fork. Alternatively, Use This Instant Pot Quinoa Recipe.
2. Quinoa Dressing: In A Small Bowl Or Jar, Whisk Together The Lime Juice, Olive Oil, Cumin, Chili Powder, And Salt. Season To Taste.
3. Assemble Salad: In A Large Bowl Or Pot, The Quinoa Cooked In, Toss Together The Quinoa, Corn, Beans, Tomatoes, Onion, And Cilantro With The Dressing. Season To Taste, Adding More Lime Juice And Salt Or Spices To Taste.
4. Store: Keep Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: AMERICAN VEGAN GOULASH
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Of Water Or 2 Tablespoons Oil
2. 2 8Oz Packages Tempeh Crumbled
3. 1 Large Onion Diced
4. 4 Cloves Garlic Minced
5. 2 Green Bell Peppers Cored Seeds Removed And Diced
6. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes Pref Fire Roasted
7. 1 Can 14Oz Tomato Sauce
8. 1 12 Teaspoons Each Dried Oregano Basil And Paprika
9. 2 Bay Leaves
10. 1 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
11. 14 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
12. 3 12  4 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
13. 2 Cups Elbow Pasta About 8 Oz
14. Pepper To Taste
15. Fresh Parsley To Serve
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot, Heat The Water/Oil Over Medium Heat, Add The Tempeh (Crumbing Between Your Fingers), Onion And Bell Pepper, Saute For 5 – 7 Minutes, Until Onions Are Soft And Tempeh Is Lightly Browned. Add The Garlic And Cook 1 Minute More.
2. Simmer: Add The Diced Tomatoes, Tomato Sauce, Oregano, Basil, Paprika, Bay Leaves, Salt, And Red Pepper Flakes And Water/Veggie Broth. Stir Well And Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Add The Pasta And Cook For 10 More Minutes, Or Until Pasta Is Tender, Make Sure To Stir Often So The Pasta Doesn’T Stick To The Bottom. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Salt & Pepper To Taste.
3. Serve: Serve In Individual Bowls With A Sprinkle Of Fresh Chopped Parsley.
4. Store: Leftovers Will Keep Fresh In The Fridge For 4 – 5 Days In A Covered Container. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: ROASTED VEGETABLE & CHICKPEA BOWL + LEMON CANNELLINI SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Sweet Potato Cut Into 1 Inch Cubes
2. 2 Cups Broccoli Florets
3. 2 Large Carrots Sliced
4. 2 Cups Brussels Sprouts Quartered Lengthwise
5. 1 Onion Sliced Use Your Favorite Onion Or What You Have On Hand
6. 1 Can 15 Oz Garbanzo Beans Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
7. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
8. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper Or Lemonpepper To Taste
9. 2 Cups Cooked Quinoa Or Grain Of Choice About 12 Cup Per Person
10. Lemoncannellini Sauce
11. 2 Cans 15 Oz Cannellini Beans Drained And Rinsed
12. 3  4 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast
13. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
14. 34  1 Cup Vegetable Broth Start Low And Add As Needed
15. Juice Of 1 Good Size Lemon
16. Generous Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
17. Mineral Salt To Taste
18. 1 Tablespoon Fresh Chopped Basil Thyme Parsley Chives Sage Or Tarragon Choose Your Favorite Or What Use What You Have On Hand
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F.
2. Roast: Line Roasting Pan/Baking Dish With Silpat, Parchment Paper Or Grease Lightly With Neutral Oil. Add Vegetables To Roasting Pan And Toss To Coat With Olive Oil. Arrange Vegetables In A Single Layer (As Much As Possible), Sprinkle With Salt And Pepper To Taste. Roast Vegetables Until Tender And Lightly Browned, About 45 Minutes, Mixing Once Halfway Through.
3. Grain: Start Your Grain Of Choice While Vegetables Are Cooking. Quinoa Will Take About 30 Minutes.
4. Sauce: Prepare Your Sauce By Placing All The Ingredients Into Your Food Processor/Blender, Except For The Herbs, And Process Until Smooth. Add Extra Broth As Needed To Thin. Add In Herbs And Pulse Once Or Twice. Place Sauce In A Small Saucepan And Heat Over Low Heat, Uncovered, Until Warm, Stirring Occasionally.
5. Serve: Serve Vegetables With Grain Of Choice And A Nice Helping Of Sauce Over Top. Serve Warm.
6. Store Leftovers In Refrigerator For Up To A Week. Leftovers Are Just As Delicious!

title: VEGAN TACO SALAD (HEALTHY + EASY)
ingredients:
1. Walnut Taco Meat
2. 1 Cup Walnuts
3. 1 Cup Mushrooms
4. 1 Tablespoon Tamari
5. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
6. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. 18 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Or Cayenne
8. Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. Cilantro Lime Sour Cream
10. 12 Cup Cashews Soaked For 2  3 Hours
11. 14 Cup Water Give Or Take
12. 1 Small Lime Squeezed
13. 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
14. 1 Clove Garlic
15. Few Sprigs Cilantro
16. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
17. Taco Salad
18. 2 Heads Romaine Chopped
19. 12 Cup Handful Grape Tomatoes Halved
20. 1 Bell Peppers Any Color Diced
21. 1 Cup Corn
22. 1 Green Onion Thinly Sliced
23. 1 Small Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Sliced Or Diced
24. 14 Cup Cilantro Chopped
25. Pepitas To Garnish
26. Lime Wedges To Serve
27. Sliced Avocado To Serve
preparation:
1. Walnut Taco Meat:
2. Place Ingredients In Food Processor And Pulse Until Coarse And Chunky. Don’T Over Blend Or It Will Become A Spread, Pate Like Consistency. For Pictures On How-To See Walnut Meat (4 Ways).
3. Cilantro Lime Sour Cream:
4. Soak Your Cashews In At Least 1 Cup Cool Water For 2 – 3 Hours Or 1 Cup Hot Water For 5 Min. Drain Well.
5. Add Ingredients To Blender Or Food Processor, Blend/Process, Scraping Down The Sides Every Now And Then Until Smooth. Add Extra Water 1 Tablespoon At A Time If Needed. For Thicker Cream Use Less Water. For A Thinner, Pourable Cream Use More Water.
6. Makes 1 Cup, Serves 8
7. Assemble Taco Salad:
8. In Individual Bowls, Add Romaine, And Top With Corn, Bell Pepper, Tomatoes, And Walnut Taco Meat. Use As Much As You Like Of Anything.
9. Serve With A Few Juicy Limes As Your Dressing.
10. Add A Dollop Of Cream Or A Drizzle Depending On How Thick Or Thin Your Cream Is.
11. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days.

title: CREAMY VEGAN POTATO LEEK SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 3 Medium Leeks Use White And Light Green Parts Only
3. 2 12 Lbs Potatoes Cubed 12 Inch Peeled Or With Skin On
4. 1 12 Teaspoons Dried Thyme Or Herbes De Provence
5. 1 Bay Leaf
6. 4 Cups Water Or Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
7. Mineral Salt To Taste
8. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley To Garnish
preparation:
1. Prep: Leeks, Start By Removing And Discarding The Root Ends And Thick Dark Green Parts. Cut The Leeks In Half Lengthwise And Rinse Each Half Under Cold Water, Pulling Apart The Layers To Remove Any Sand Or Debris Nestled Inside, Slice The Leeks Crosswise. Alternatively, Slice The Leeks, Then Put In A Colander And Wash Well Under Running Water. Should Yield 4 – 5 Cups. Cut Potatoes Into 1/2 Inch Cubes. Feel Free To Peel The Potatoes Or Leave The Skin On (I Left The Skin On).
2. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat The Oil/Water Over Medium Heat. Add The Leeks And Cook, Stirring Frequently, Until Soft And Wilted, About 10 Minutes. Adjust The Heat As Necessary So As Not To Brown The Leeks.
3. Simmer: Add The Potatoes, Broth, Bay Leaves, Herbs, Salt To The Pot And Bring To A Boil. Reduce Heat, Cover, And Simmer On Low For 15 Minutes, Or Until The Potatoes Are Fork-Tender.
4. Puree: Remove The Bay Leaves, And Puree The Soup Using A Hand-Held Immersion Blender Until Smooth (Or Leave A Little Chunky). Alternatively, Use A Regular Blender To Puree The Soup In Batches. Taste For Seasoning.
5. Serve: Serve Warm With Chopped Parsley, Crispy Chickpea Croutons,And A Side Of Crusty Artisan Bread.

title: QUINOA SPANISH RICE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Cup Onion Finely Diced
3. 1 Green Bell Pepper Finely Diced Optional
4. 1  2 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 1 Cup Quinoa Rinsed
6. 1 Tablespoon Tomato Paste Andor 1 Cup Diced Tomatoes If Using Canned Drained
7. 2 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
8. 12 Teaspoon Oregano
9. 12 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder For Good Measure But Optional
10. Salt  Pepper To Taste
11. Fresh Chopped Cilantro To Serve Optional
preparation:
1. Stovetop:
2. Saute + Toast: In Medium Size Pan Or Skillet, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium High Heat, Add Onion, Optional Bell Pepper And Cook For 3 Minutes, Add Quinoa And Garlic, Cook Another 5 Minutes Or So Stirring Frequently Until Quinoa Starts To Get Toasty And Turn Slightly Golden.
3. Simmer: Add Veg Broth, Tomato Paste, Oregano, Salt + Pepper, Give A Good Stir, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 – 17 Minutes.
4. Let Rest: When Done, Remove Cover, Fluff With A Fork, And Let Set For 15 Minutes To Absorb The Rest Of The Liquids. Taste For Seasoning.
5. Instant Pot:
6. Set Instant Pot To Saute For 7 Minutes, Add Oil/Water, Onion And Optional Bell Pepper, Saute For 3 Minutes, Add Quinoa And Garlic, Cook, Stirring Frequently For Remaining 4 Minutes.
7. Add The Tomato Paste, Just Shy Of 2 Cups Of Vegetable Broth, Tomatoes, Oregano, Salt & Pepper. Attach Lid And Turn To Lock. Turn The Valve To Sealing. Manually Set To High Pressure And Cook For 1 Minute.
8. Turn Valve To Venting For Quick Release (Or Let Natural Release For 5 Minutes), Remove Lid, Turn Off Heat, Fluff With Fork And Let Rest For 10 Minutes. Season To Taste.
9. Serve With Chopped Cilantro Overtop For A Pop Of Color And Flavor.

title: GRILLED BAJA TOFU TACOS + RED CABBAGE SLAW
ingredients:
1. 1 14 Ounce Package Nongmo Firm Or Extrafirm Tofu Pressed
2. Chipotle Mayo Or Chipotle Tahini Sauce Recipe To Serve
3. Pico De Gallo To Serve Optional
4. Limes Wedges To Serve
5. 6 Corn Tortillas To Serve
6. Tofu Marinade
7. 14 Cup Fresh Lime Juice About 2 Large Limes
8. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
9. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
10. Red Cabbage Slaw
11. 12 Small Red Cabbage Thinly Sliced
12. 3 Tablespoons Apple Cider Or Red Wine Vinegar
13. 14 Cup Cilantro Chopped
14. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. Press Tofu: Drain Tofu, Place Block On Its Side And Cut In Half Lengthwise. With Halves Still Together, Place Tofu Flat And Cut Into Thirds On Its Longest Side. You Will Get Six Pieces. Place Tofu Between A Double Folded Kitchen Towel And Add A Heavy Book Or Pot Over Top To Remove Excess Moisture. Let Sit While You Prepare The Marinade.
2. Marinate: In A Small/Medium Size Baking Dish Or Pan (I Used A Loaf Pan), Mix Together The Lime Juice, Cumin And Salt. Place Tofu In Mixture And Marinate For At Least 30 Min, And Up To 24 Hours.
3. Cabbage Slaw: In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add The Cabbage, Vinegar, Cilantro And Salt, Mix Well And Give A Toss Every Now And Then. Let Set At Least 10 Min. Making It Ahead A Day Or Two Is Also Great!
4. Grill Tofu: Heat Grill Over Medium To Medium-High Heat. Add Enough Oil To Generously Coat The Side Of The Griddle You’Ll Be Using, About Two Tablespoons. Add A Drop Of Water To The Griddle, If It Sizzles It’S Ready. Place Tofu On Griddle, Cook 3 – 4 Minutes Per Side, Or Until You Get Nice Grill Marks. It Helps To Press The Tofu With The Back Of A Spatula To Release Excess Liquids And Aid In Grill Marks. Once Done, Set Aside.
5. Serve: Warm Tortillas Over Medium-Low Heat On A Gas Or Electric Burner. Layer Each Tortilla With On Piece Tofu, Red Cabbage Slaw And Chipotle Sauce. Top With Optional Pico De Gallo And A Squeeze Of Lime.
6. Notes:
7. Don’T Be Shy With The Toppings. Pile Them As High As You Like!

title: ARTISAN BREAD RECIPE
ingredients:
1. Master Recipe
2. 3 Cups Lukewarm Water
3. 1 12 Tablespoons Active Dry Yeast
4. 1 12 Tablespoon Coarse Salt
5. 6 12 Cups Allpurpose Flour
6. I Used This Halved Recipe For Loaf Shown
7. 1 12 Cups Lukewarm Water
8. 1 Packet Active Dry Yeast About 2 14 Teaspoons
9. 2 Teaspoons Himalayan Salt
10. 3 14 Cups Bread Flour
preparation:
1. Make The Dough:
2. Mix: In A Very Large Mixing Bowl Combine The Water, Yeast And Salt. If Adding Herbs, Now Is A Good Time, Use A Teaspoon Or So Of Your Favorite Herbs Or Double If Using Fresh. Add Flour All At Once And Stir With A Wooden Spoon. Takes Only A Minute, If That. No Need To Knead, Just Mix. You Just Want Everything Mixed Well, No Streaks Of Flour Left, And You’Re Done.
3. Rise: Cover Container Loosely (I Used A Towel To Cover). Let It Rise In A Warm Area With No Draft, May Take Anywhere From 2 To 4 Hours Depending On Temperatures (Ideal Temp Is 80 – 90).
4. Separate: Once Done, If Making The Master Recipe, Pull Away 1/4 Of The Dough And Refrigerate The Rest To Bake Later. Store Unused Dough Covered Tightly With Plastic Wrap In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 Weeks.
5. Shape:Lightly Dust Your Hands And Flat Surface With Flour, Or Cornmeal, So It Won’T Stick. Take Your Dough And Place It On The Floured Flat Surface, Gently Pull The Sides Of The Dough Toward The Bottom, Rotating The Dough Until You Get A Roundish Shape With A Smooth Surface. Also, Don’T Worry If The Bottom Is A Little Bunched, It Will Flatten Out Upon The Second Rising.
6. Rest:Place Your Dough Ball Onto A Flat Surface Lined With Parchment Paper (If Not Using Parchment Paper, Place On Flat Surface Dusted With Cornmeal Or Flour), And Let It Rest For At Least 30 Minutes. No Need To Cover It. If The Dough Has Been Refrigerated, It Helps To Let It Rest A Little More, Until It’S No Longer Chilled.
7. Bake The Dough:
8. Preheat The Oven To 450 Degrees F. Placing A Cast Iron Skillet, Pizza Stone, Roasting Pan Or Shallow Fry Pan In The Oven To Get It Nice And Hot (A Baking Sheet Will Be Fine Too). Let The Oven Preheat For 30 Minutes.
9. Prep Oven And Dough: When Ready To Bake, Place A Rimmed Cookie Sheet Or Small Pot With At Least 1 Cup Of Water On The Bottom Rack To Steam – This Will Help The Crust Get Nice And Crispy, But It’S Fine If You Skip It. Line Your Baking Vessel With Parchment Paper Or Lightly Flour With Cornmeal. Dust A Little Flour On Top Of Your Loaf, Using A Knife Slash The Top, About 1/4 Inch Deep, In A Cross, Tick Tac Toe Or Scallop Pattern (This Helps The Bread Expand When Baking While Also Giving It A Rustic Look).
10. Bake: Place Prepped Dough In Center Of Baking Vessel And Place In The Oven, Center Rack, For 30 – 40 Minutes, Until You Get A Nice Brown Crust. Carefully Remove From Oven, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Enjoy!

title: LENTIL & SUN-DRIED TOMATO HUMMUS WRAP
ingredients:
1. Lavash Bread Whole Grain Pref Or Flour Tortillas
2. 12 Cup Cooked Lentils Per Wrap
3. Leafy Greens I Used Romaine
4. Red Pepper Flakes
5. Mineral Salt
6. Sundried Tomato Hummus
7. 1 12 Cups Fresh Cooked Garbanzo Beans Chickpeas Or 1 Can 15Oz Garbanzo Beans
8. 2  3 Tablespoons Sundried Tomatoes Chopped
9. 14 Cup Tahini Or Cut In Half And Use 2 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil
10. 1 Clove Garlic
11. 12 Teaspoon Paprika Regular Or Smoked
12. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
13. Juice Of 1 Lemon Or 1  2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
14. 14  13 Cup Water As Needed
preparation:
1. Sun-Dried Tomato Hummus:
2. If Using Packaged Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Soak Your Tomatoes In Water For About 15 Minutes To Soften, Reserve Water. If They Are Super Fresh, No Need To Soak, Just Chop And Use. Use The Remaining Water As Needed When Adding It To The Hummus. If Using Bottled In Oil Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Use As Is.
3. Place All Ingredients Into Food Processor/Blender, Except For The Water. Blend Until Creamy, About 3 Minutes Or So, Adding Water As Needed To Thin. I Used About 1/3 Cup Water As I Like My Hummus On The Moist, Thin Side.
4. Makes About 1 1/2 Cups.
5. Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.
6. Assemble Your Wrap:
7. Lay Your Lavash Bread On A Flat Surface. Spread A Nice Layer Of Hummus Over 3/4, Top With About 1/2 Cup Lentils Over Top, Sprinkle With Red Pepper Flakes And Mineral Salt, Add Leafy Greens Over Top. Roll Gently, But Tightly As You Can. Slice In Half And Enjoy!
8. Store: Wraps Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 Days In Covered Containers. They Are Best Eaten Within 24 Hours Of Making.

title: CRISPY BAKED KALE CHIPS
ingredients:
1. 1 Bunch Of Kale Curly Or Flat
2. 1 Tbsp Olive Oil I Usually Use A Little Less
3. Flavor Options
4. Mineral Salt
5. Cracked Pepper
6. Garlic Powder
7. Nutritional Yeast
8. Zaatar
9. Spice Blend Cajun Or Chili Powder
10. Or Whatever You Feel Like Using
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 325 Degrees F.
2. Prep: Wash Kale Thoroughly And Pat Dry. Remove Leaves From Stem And Break Up Into The Medium Sized Chunks, About 1 – 2 Inch Pieces.
3. Add Oil + Seasoning: Put Leaves Into A Large Bowl And Drizzle With Olive Oil. Massage Until Coated. Add Herbs/Spices And Toss To Coat.
4. Layer: Lay Pieces On A Baking Sheet Lined With Parchment Paper Making Sure To Keep A Little Space Between. Don’T Overcrowd Them Or They May Not Cook Evenly And Take Longer To Cook. Use Two Baking Sheets If Needed.
5. Bake: Place Them In The Oven On The Middle Rack For About 10 Min. Check After 6 Minutes Or So And Flip Any That Seem To Be Browning Too Much On The Edges.

title: POTATO + LEEK + WHITE BEAN SOUP
ingredients:
1. 2 12 Lbs Yukon Gold Potatoes Cubed 12 Inch
2. 2 Mediucupsarge Leeks Sliced And Dirt Removed White  Pale Green Parts Only
3. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water Water Saute
4. 34 Teaspoon Each Dried Tarragon  Savory Or 1 12 Teaspoons Herbes De Provence Or Thyme
5. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
6. 3 Cups Cooked Or 2 Cans 15 Oz Cannellini Beans Drained And Rinsed
7. 5 Cups Vegetable Broth
8. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
9. Fresh Parsley To Garnish
preparation:
1. In A Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium-High. Add Leeks And Saute Until Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add In Herbs And Spices, Cook Until Fragrant, About 1 Minute. Add In Potatoes, Beans, Broth And Salt & Pepper To Taste. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For About 20 Minutes, Or Until Potatoes Are Fork Tender. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
2. Serve Topped With Fresh Chopped Parsley. Great With Your Favorite Crusty No Knead Bread Or This Easy Gluten-Free Socca Flatbreadto Soak Up The Juices!
3. Notes:
4. You Can Change Up The Herbs Here With What You Have On Hand. I Really Love The Tarragon And Savory Here But Starter Cooks May Not Have Them On Hand So The Herbs De Provence And Thyme Will Be Great Too!
5. Here Is A Simple Guide To Slicing And Cleaning Leeks: How To Clean Leeks

title: ASIAN CHOPPED SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Small Head Green Savoy Or Napa Cabbage Sliced
2. 1 Head Romaine Sliced
3. 13 Head Red Cabbage Sliced
4. 1 Red Bell Pepper Julienned
5. 1 Yellow Bell Pepper Julienned
6. 1 Small Cucumber Halved And Thinly Sliced
7. 2 Stalks Of Celery Thinly Sliced
8. 12 Cup Chopped Cilantro Loosely Packed
9. 2 Tablespoons Black Sesame Seeds Garnish
10. 14 Cup Slivered Almonds Garnish
11. 8 Oz Plain Or Grilled Firm Or Extra Firm Tofu Cubed Optional
12. Peanut Sesame Dressing
13. 12 Cup Apple Cider Or Rice Wine Vinegar
14. 13 Cup Natural Peanut Or Almond Butter
15. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup 2 If Using Raw Almond Butter
16. 1 Teaspoon Toasted Sesame Oil Optional
17. 1 Inch Knob Ginger Grated Or Minced
18. Pinch Red Pepper Flakes Or 1 Tsp Sriracha Optional
19. Pinch Of Pink Salt Or Splash Of Tamari
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Mix Your Dressing And Set Aside Letting The Flavors Develop. Taste Before Serving Adding Anything You Feel It Needs.
2. Salad: Prepare Your Vegetables, Place In A Large Bowl. Pour The Dressing Over Top And Toss To Coat. Top With Sesame Seeds And Slivered Almonds. Alternatively, You Can Toss And Serve Adding A Drizzle Of Dressing Over Top Once Plated.
3. Serve: Place In Individual Bowls And Serve With Optional Tofu And Extra Sesame Seeds And Slivered Almonds.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days In A Sealed Container.

title: INSTANT POT STEEL CUT OATS
ingredients:
1. 1 Cups Steel Cut Oats
2. 2 12 Cups Water
3. Pinch Of Salt
4. Optional Addins
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
6. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
7. 14 Teaspoon Cardamom
8. To Serve
9. 2 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup Per Serving
