10. 14 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Oat Cashew Soy Or Your Favorite Plant Milk
11. Handful Of Berries Strawberries Blueberries Raspberries Or Blackberries
12. 1  2 Tablespoons Nuts Or Seeds Almonds Walnuts Pecans Pumpkin Seeds Hemp Hearts Etc
preparation:
1. Add The Steel Cut Oats, Optional Spices & Vanilla, Pinch Of Salt, And Water To The Instant Pot Insert. Attach Lid And Twist To Lock. Turn The Valve To Sealing Position. Manually Set To High Pressure And Cook For 4 Minutes. Let Natural Release For 15 Minutes.
2. Serve In Individual Serving Bowls Or Glass Containers, And Top With Your Choice Of Toppings, Pure Maple Syrup And Non-Dairy Milk.
3. Makes About 2 Cups (2/3 – 1 Cup Per Serving)
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days. Warm On The Stovetop Over Low, Adding A Splash Of Water Or Milk, Until Warmed Through.

title: QUICK N’ HEALTHY VEGGIE PASTA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Bowtie Pasta Or Your Favorite Small Pasta
2. 1 Cucumber Diced
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
4. 1 Orange Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
5. 1 Yellow Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
6. 4 Oz Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
7. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. Zesty Garlic Lemon Dressing
9. 4 Large Garlic Cloves Minced
10. Juice Of 2 Lemons About 14  13 Cup
11. 2 Tablespoons Dijon Mustard
12. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
13. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Pasta: Cook The Pasta According To Package Directions.
2. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together Garlic, Lemon Juice, Dijon, Oil, Salt, And Pepper. Set Aside.
3. Assemble Salad: Once Veggies Are Prepped, Using Either A Large Mixing Or Serving Bowl, Or Pot The Pasta Was Cooked In, Combine The Pasta, Veggies And Dressing, Toss Well To Coat.
4. Chill: Place In The Refrigerator To Chill For A Few Hours Or Enjoy As Is.
5. Serve: Spoon Into Individual Bowls And Top With A Squeeze Of Lemon And/Or A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan. Enjoy The Simples!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Fridge For Up To 5 – 6 Days. This Is A Great Salad For A Pot-Luck Or Family/Work Gathering. Can Be Made 1 – 2 Days In Advance.

title: CASHEW ‘RICOTTA’ CHEESE
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Raw Cashews Soaked
2. 12 Cup Water
3. Juice Of 1 Large Lemon Or 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar
4. 1  2 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast Optional
5. 1 Small Garlic Clove
6. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
7. Himalayan Sea Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Soak Cashews: First, It’S Best To Soak Your Cashews In Water Before Starting. There Are 2 Ways To Soak:
2. Soak Cashew In Cool Water For Atleast 2 Hours In A Bowl Of Water, Covering The Cashews About 2 – 3 Inches Of Water As They Will Swell Up.
3. For A Quick  Of Soaking, Let Cashews Sit In Hot Water For 5 Minutes.
4. Blend: Drain Cashews And Place All Remaining Ingredients Into A Blender Or Food Processor, Process Until Creamy Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides Every Few Minutes. Taste For Flavors Adding Any Additional Ingredients. Some Like A Salty Ricotta So Feel Free To Add As Much Salt As You Want.
5. Chill: Store In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For An Hour Or Two, This Will Stiffen The Mixture A Bit. You Can Also Prepare Your Dish Straight Away Without Refrigeration If Needed. Refrigeration Will Thicken The Mixture A Bit. If It Becomes Too Thick, Add A Tad Of Water And Mix Well.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To A 5 – 6 Days. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months In A Freezer Safe Container. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator. Give A Good Stir Before Using.
7. Makes Approx. 2 Cups

title: Mediterranean Orzo Salad
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Package Orzo Pref Whole Wheat
2. 1 Medium Red Bell Pepper Diced
3. 12 Medium Red Onion Diced
4. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
5. 1 Can 14Oz Artichoke Hearts Sliced
6. 23 Cup Pitted Kalamata Olives Sliced In Half Or Quartered
7. 1 Pint 8Oz Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
8. 12 Cup Toasted Pine Nuts
9. 12 Cup Loosely Packed Chopped Parsley
10. 2 Tablespoons Fresh Dill Fronds Or 2 Teaspoons Dried
11. Mineral Salt  Pepper Or Lemon Pepper Or To Taste
12. 2 Lemons Juice Of About 3  4 Tablespoons
13. 3  4 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil Optional
preparation:
1. Orzo: Cook The Orzo Pasta According To Package Instruction :.
2. Assemble: In A Large Bowl Add The Cooked Orzo, Red Bell Pepper, Onion, Chickpeas, Artichoke, Olives, Tomatoes, Pine Nuts, Parsley, Dill, Salt And Pepper. Add The Lemon Juice And Optional Oil Over Top, Toss Well To Coat. Season To Taste.
3. Serve Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
4. Salad Is Great Alone. Also, Try Adding A Small Handful Of Leafy Greens Such As Arugula To Your Serving For Added Freshness And Fiber. It’S Delicious!
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator In An Airtight Container, For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: Mini Chickpea Flour Frittatas (Vegan)
ingredients:
1. 1 34 Cups Chickpea Flour Aka Garbanzo Bean Flour Gram Flour
2. 14 Cup Nutritional Yeast Optional
3. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
4. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 1 Teaspoon Dried Basil
6. 34 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or Black Salt See Notes
7. 2 Cups Water
8. 1 Cup Corn Frozen Fresh Or Canned
9. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper 1 Cup Finely Diced
10. 1 Jalapeno Finely Diced
11. 14 Red Onion Or Medium Shallot Finely Diced
12. Handful Of Baby Kale Or Spinach Roughly Chopped
13. Chives To Garnish Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F. If Not Using A Non-Stick Muffin Tin, Lightly Grease With Oil (See Notes) Or Use Muffin Liners.
2. Mix: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Combine The Chickpea Flour, Optional Nutritional Yeast, Baking Powder, Salt, Garlic Powder, And Basil. Whisk In The Water (Batter Will Be Runny, But That’S Normal). Add The Corn, Bell Pepper, Jalapeno, Onion, And Baby Greens, Mix To Combine.
3. Scoop: Using A 1/4 Measuring Cup, Scoop The Batter Into The Muffin Tin, Filling All 12 Holes. Top With A Sprinkle Of Chives.
4. Bake: Place In The Oven, On The Center Rack, And Bake For 35 – 45 Minutes (Depending On The Veggies Used). Do The Toothpick Test By Sticking It In The Center Of A Muffin, If It Comes Clean, Frittatas Are Ready. If Cooking For 35 Minutes And The Center Seems Soggy, Let Them Cool, And They Will Stiffen Up Nicely.
5. Remove From Oven, Turn Out Frittatas, And Place On A Cooling Rack To Cool.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored, Covered, In The Refrigerator, Or On The Counter. Reheat In A Toaster Oven Or Microwave.
7. Makes 12

title: BLACK BEAN FAJITAS + GUACAMOLE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Small White Onion Sliced
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Cored And Sliced
4. 1 Yellow Bell Pepper Cored And Sliced
5. 1 Green Bell Pepper Cored And Sliced
6. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder
7. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
8. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
9. 14  12 Teaspoon Chipotle Or Cayenne Powder Optional
10. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
11. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
12. 6 Corn Or Flour Tortillas
13. 14 Head Of Cabbage Shredded Optional To Serve
14. Lime Wedges To Serve
15. Guacamole
16. 2  3 Avocados
17. 1 Small Jalapeno Most Seeds Removed And Diced
18. 14 Red Onion Diced
19. Small Handful Cherry Tomatoes Quartered Or 1 Small Tomato Diced
20. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Or To Taste
21. Few Sprigs Cilantro Leaves Diced
22. 1 Lime Squeezed
preparation:
1. Guacamole: Cut Avocados In Half Lengthwise, Remove Seed And Using A Spoon Scoop Out The Flesh, Place In Medium Size Bowl. Using A Fork Cut The Halves Into Large Chunks And Mash About 1/3 – 1/2. Add Diced Jalapeno, Onion, Tomatoes, Mineral Salt And Lime Juice. Mix To Incorporate. Add In Chopped Cilantro And Mix Again Gently. Tip: To Keep Your Guacamole From Browning, Pack Your Guacamole Well, Add About 1/4 – 1/2 Inch Water Over Top And Place In The Fridge. When Ready To Serve, Drain Water, Mix And Serve. This Will Keep Air Away Preventing Oxidation.
2. Fajitas: In A Large Skillet Or Wok, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium High Heat, Add The Onions And Bell Peppers, Cook For About 6 – 7 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. Add The Chili Powder, Cumin And Garlic Powder, And Optional Chipotle/Cayenne, And Cook 1 Minute More. Add Black Beans And Cook Until Heated Through, About 3 More Minutes. Adjust Seasoning To Taste Adding Anything Extra You Like.
3. Tortillas: Warm The Tortillas. I Like To Heat Mine Carefully Over The Open Flame Of The Stove Top.
4. Assemble: Serve Layering The Fajita Mix On Top Of Each Tortilla, Then Add Cabbage And A Nice Helping Of Guacamole. Top With A Squeeze Of Lime To Each Taco If You Like.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: KALE + BLACK BEAN BURRITO BOWL
ingredients:
1. Quinoa Or 1 Batch Cilantro Lime Rice
2. 1 Cup Dry Quinoa
3. 1 34 Cups Water  2 Tablespoons
4. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
6. Mineral Salt To Taste
7. 12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
8. Kale
9. 12 Bunch Kale Center Stem Removed And Julienned
10. 1  2 Limes
11. Chipotle Tahini Sauce
12. 3 Tablespoons Tahini
13. 2  3 Tablespoons Water Plus More As Needed
14. Juice Of 12 Lime
15. 18  14 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder
16. Dash Garlic  Onion Powder
17. Pinch Of Salt
18. To Serve
19. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Or 1 12 Cups Instant Pot Black Beans
20. 1 Batch Pico De Gallo
21. 1 Avocado Sliced
22. Cilantro Chopped
23. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot, Add Quinoa, Water, Garlic & Onion Powder,, Red Pepper Flakes, And Salt, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove Cover And Let Set 10 Minutes, Fluff With Fork. You Will Most Likely Have A Bit Of Leftovers.
2. Kale: Rinse Kale, Remove The Hard Center Stem And Julienne. Either Right On The Cutting Board Or In A Large Bowl, Squeeze The Juice Of 1 – 2 Limes Over Top And Mix To Coat (This Will Help Soften The Kale), Set Aside To Let The Kale Marinate.
3. Chipotle Dressing: Place All Ingredients In A Small Bowl And Mix Well. Taste For Flavor Adjusting As Needed. To Thicken Add A Tad More Tahini, To Thin Add More Water. Set Aside, The Flavors Will Develop Over A Few Minutes.
4. Beans: To Heat Or Not To Heat Is Up To You (I Typically Don’T). If Heating, Place Beans With Juices In Small Pan And Heat Over Medium Until Warm. If Not Heating, Drain And Rinse Beans Well.
5. To Serve: In Serving Bowl, Place About 3/4 – 1 Cup Cooked Quinoa, 1/3 Of The Beans, 1/3 Of The Kale. Top With Pico De Gallo, Avocado And Chipotle Tahini Sauce. Add A Few Smashed Tortilla Chips Or Pepitas (Pumpkin Seeds) Sprinkled Over Top For A Crunchy Addition. Mix It All Together And Enjoy!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: HOW TO ROAST & STORE RED PEPPERS (OR ANY PEPPER REALLY!)
ingredients:
1. 1  8 Peppers Any Color
2. If Making A Large Batch And Storing In The Freezer
3. Parchment Paper
4. Air Tight Containers That Are Freezer Safe
5. For Storing In Jars
6. Vinegar Plain Balsamic Whitered Wine Or Apple Cider
7. Mineral Salt
8. Olive Oil
9. Clean Pint Sized Mason Jars
preparation:
1. Prepping Peppers:
2. There Are Two Ways To Prepare Your Peppers For Roasting.
3. The First Is To Simply Roast The Whole Pepper, Seeds, Stem And All. (This Will Work With All Roasting S.)
4. The Second Is To Slice The Peppers In Half Lengthwise, Remove The Stem And Seeds, And Place On The Baking Sheet Cut Side Down. (Use This  For The Oven  And/Or When Using A Baking Sheet. These Peppers Require No Flipping, Only Rotating Of The Baking Sheet. This Is My Favorite Way Of Roasting Peppers.)
5. Roasting S:
6. Oven: Preheat Oven To 475 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Or A Silpat.
7. Place Peppers On Baking Sheet. Bake 4 – 5 Inches From The Flame. If Using An Electric Oven Or There Is No Flame, Place Baking Sheet On The Middle Rack. Roast Peppers For 40 Minutes, Turning At Least Once During Cooking Using Sturdy Tongs (If Peppers Are Sliced In Half No Need To Turn, Just Rotate The Baking Sheet 180 Degrees). They Are Ready When Charred/Blackened And Blistered. Whole Peppers Will Still Be Full Of Air And Puffy Once Removed From The Oven. As The Peppers Cool They Will Deflate And Become Wrinkly Looking.
8. Broiler: I Used To Have An Oven Where The Broiler Was Underneath The Oven, Now Mine Is In The Oven. Either Way, Turn Broiler To Medium – High (Or 500 Degrees If Yours Is By Numbers) And Char Peppers Turning Every So Often Until Browned And Blackened. If You’Ve Prepped Your Peppers By Slicing In Half, No Need Turn The Peppers, Simply Adjust The Baking Sheet Turning It To Get All The Peppers Charred. This May Take Anywhere From 15 – 25 Minutes.
9. Open Grill: Place Whole Peppers On Their Sides Over An Open Flame On The Grill, Turning Every Now And Then Until Nicely Charred All Over. Depending On How Big Your Grill Is Will Determine How Many You Can Do At One Time.
10. Stove Top: If Roasting Just 1 Or 2 Peppers, You Can Roast It Over The Gas Burner Of Your Stove (I Suppose You Could Do 4 Peppers Utilizing Each Burner). Place Pepper On Its Side And Adjust The Flame So It ‘Licks’ The Peppers. Keep An Eye On It And Turn It As Needed To Blacken And Char, About 15 – 20. This Tends To Be A More Time Consuming  Since You Have To Be So Watchful.
11. Steaming & Peeling:
12. While Peppers Are Hot From The Oven, Carefully Place Them In A Bowl And Cover With A Plate, Or Use A Pot With Lid. The Goal Is To Steam The Peppers Making The Skin Peel Easily. Let The Peppers Steam For About 30 Minutes. Once Peppers Are Cool, Remove The Skins, Stems And Seeds. I Find It Easiest To Peel The Pepper From The Bottom To The Top. A Few Seeds Left Are Fine. Do Not Run Peppers Under Water To Clean, You’Ll Lose Most Of The Roasted Flavor That You Worked So Hard Get. Keep As Much Of The Pepper Juices As You Can If Storing Leftovers.
13. From Here You Can Use Right Away To Make Hummus, Romesco, Soups, Layer On Sandwiches And Toss In Salads, Etc.
14. Storing:
15. Rerfrigerator:Great For Short Term Storage.
16. Keep Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To A 5 – 6 Days.
17. If You Coat Them With A Little Oil They Will For A Couple Of Weeks. You Can Even Add Some Of The Pepper Juices To The Container.
18. To Always Be Safe, At The First Sign Of Mold Or Spoilage, Throw Away Immediately.
19. If Storing For Longer, You Have A Couple Simple Options:
20. Freezing:This Is My Favorite  Of Long Term Storing, As It Is Not Blended With Any Other Flavors, It’S Super Easy To Do, And They Thaw Out Amazingly Well.
21. Freeze Your Peppers In A Tightly Sealed Container. They Thaw Out Pretty Fast Once Removed From The Freezer Making This A Nice Way Of Preserving Your Precious Peppers.
22. This  Of Storing Is A Neutral Way Of Keeping The Full Roasted Flavor Intact As They Won’T Be Tainted With Any Other Flavors.
23. I Would Suggest Cutting And Placing A Small Piece Of Parchment Paper Between The Peppers For Easy Removal.
24. Will Last Up To 2 Months.
25. Vinegar :This Is  Will Leave Your Peppers With A Little Bit Of Tang From The Vinegar, In Some Cases It May Overpower Them, But It’S A Great Way To Store Them. Use These Peppers For Sauces, Dips, And Soups.
26. Place Peppers In A Jar With A Little Salt, Vinegar And Pepper Juices.
27. To Do This You’Ll Want To Sprinkle Your Peppers With A Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt And Mix Well.
28. Place 1/2 Inch Of Vinegar At The Bottom Of Your Pint Sized Mason Jar, Add Peppers Leaving About 1 1/2 Inches Headspace.
29. Using The Handle Of A Spoon Or Fork, Poke Along The Inside Edges Of The Jar To Release Air Bubbles (This Is Important), Pour Reserved Pepper Juices Over Top So Peppers Are Completely Covered, Leaving 3/4 Inch Room.
30. Add About 1/8 Inch Of Olive Oil Over Top To Keep Air Out, Leaving 1/2 Inch Headspace.
31. Seal And Place Towards The Back Of The Refrigerator. Will Be Good For Up To 2 Months, Maybe Even A Little Longer.
32. If You See Any Sign Of Mold Or Spoilage, Throw Away Immediately!

title: HOUSE SALAD + APPLE CIDER VINAIGRETTE
ingredients:
1. 2 Heads Romaine About 6  8 Cups Chopped
2. 34 Cup Croutons
3. 12 Cup Shredded Carrots
4. 12 Cucumber Thinly Sliced
5. 14 Red Onion Sliced
6. Handful Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
7. Apple Cider Vinaigrette
8. 4 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar Pref Braggs Raw
9. 3 Tablespoons Olive Oil See Notes
10. 1  2 Teaspoons Dijon
11. 1 Clove Garlic Minced
12. 14  12 Teaspoon Salt  Pepper
preparation:
1. Vinaigrette: In A Small Bowl Or Glass Jar, Whisk Together The Apple Cider Vinegar, Olive Oil, Dijon, Garlic And Salt + Pepper. Season To Taste.
2. Assemble Salad: In A Large Serving Bowl, Fill With Romaine (Or Leafy Greens Of Choice), Top With Carrots, Onion, Cucumber And Croutons. Drizzle The Dressing Overtop And Toss To Combine.
3. Serve In Individual Bowls. For More Texture And Flavor, Top With Coconut Bacon, Crispy Roasted Chickpeas Or Almond Parmesan For Variation. A Sprinkle Of Pepitas, Sunflower Seeds Or Hemp Seeds Would Be Great Too!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 – 3 Days. If Making For Meal Prep, It Might Be Best To Store The Salad And Dressing Separately Until Ready To Serve.

title: EASY VEGAN MAYO
ingredients:
1. 7 Oz Organic Tofu Silken Or Soft
2. 13 Cup Neutral Oil I Used Light Flavored Olive Oil
3. 1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice About 12 Medium Lemon
4. 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
5. 14 Teaspoon Salt  More To Taste
6. 14 Teaspoon Dijon Mustard
preparation:
1. Small Personal Blender: Simply Add Everything To The Cup, Attach The Criss-Cross Blade, And Blend For 1 Minute. Taste For Flavor. This Is My Preferred  And Love My Nutribullet (Affiliate Link ) For Small Jobs Like This!
2. Immersion Blender: Place The Ingredients Into A 2-Cup Measuring Cup Or Tall Straight Glass (A Mason Jar Would Be Great), And Using The Immersion Blender, Blend For 30 Seconds To 1 Minute, Until Creamy. Taste For Flavor.
3. Regular Blender: This Will Work Best When Doubling This Recipe. Simply Place The Ingredients In The Blender, And Process Until Smooth And Creamy, About 1 Minute, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. Taste For Flavor.
4. Store In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 1 Week.

title: APPLE QUINOA SALAD + TAHINI MAPLE DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Quinoa I Used Tricolor
2. 1 34 Cup Water
3. 1 Lemon Juice Of
4. 2 Large Apples Cored And Diced 1 Green  1 Red Or 2 Same Color
5. 1 12 Cups Grapes Sliced In Half
6. 1 Celery Rib Thinly Sliced
7. 14 Cup Raisins Or Cranberries
8. 14 Cup Almonds Slivered Or Chopped
9. A Few Large Mint Leaves Julienned
10. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon Or To Taste
11. Salt  Pepper To Taste
12. Sweet Tahini Dressing
13. 14 Cup Tahini
14. 3 Tablespoons Water
15. 1  2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
16. 12 Teaspoon Cider Vinegar Or To Taste Optional
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse Your Quinoa In A Fine Mesh Sieve. In A Medium Size Pot, Add Water And Quinoa, Bring To A Boil. Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove Cover And Let Set 15 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork.
2. Dressing: While Quinoa Is Cooking, Prepare Your Dressing By Combining Ingredients In A Small Bowl. Mix Well And Set Aside To Let The Flavors Relax Into Each Other. Add More Water, 1 Teaspoon At A Time, To Thin As Needed. To Thicken Add More Tahini. It Should Be Thin Enough To Drizzle. Dressing Serves Four.
3. Salad: Core And Dice Apples, Top With Lemon Juice And Toss Gently (I Did This Right On The Cutting Board To Not Dirty Up Another Bowl). Prepare The Remaining Ingredients. Add The Apples, Grapes, Celery, Raisins, Almonds, Mint Leaves And Cinnamon To The Quinoa, Mix Well. Taste For Flavor Adding More Cinnamon If You Like.
4. Spoon Into Serving Dishes And Serve With A Good Drizzle Of The Sweet Tahini Dressing.

title: VEGAN BURRITO
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Rice White Or Brown Or Quinoa
2. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
3. 12 Large Onion Diced
4. 1 Green Bell Pepper Cored And Diced
5. 1 Can 14Oz Fired Roasted Diced Tomatoes Drained
6. 1 Can 4Oz Diced Green Chilies Drained Or 1 Large Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced
7. 1 Tablespoon Cumin
8. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder
9. 1 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Optional
10. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
11. 12 Teaspoon Salt Or To Taste
12. 1 Can 9Oz Corn About 1 Cup Drained
13. 1 Can 14Oz Black Beans About 1 12 Cups Drained And Rinsed
14. 14  12 Cup Cilantro Loosely Packed
15. 6 Large Flour Tortillas Or Your Favorite Gf Tortillas
16. 2 Cups Shredded Lettuce
17. Guacamole Or Sliced Avocado Optional
18. To Serve
19. Pico De Gallo
20. Vegan Sour Cream
21. Corn Salsa
22. Your Favorite Salsa
23. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Grain: Cook Your Grain According To Package Directions And Set Aside.
2. Black Bean + Corn Sofrito: In A Large Pan Or Pot, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Bell Pepper, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Tomatoes, Green Chilies Or Jalapeno, Cumin, Chili Powder, Garlic Powder And Salt, Mix Well And Continue To Cook Another 4 – 5 Minutes, Stirring Often. Add The Black Beans And Corn, Cook A Few Minutes Until Warmed Through. Stir In The Cilantro. Taste For Seasoning.
3. Layer + Roll: Place Tortillas On A Flat Surface, Down The Center, Leaving A Few Inches At Each End, Layer With 1/2 Cup Of Black Bean Mix, Then Shredded Lettuce, Guacamole, And Finish With 1/2 Cup Of Rice. Fold Each Of The End Pieces Up Towards The Center, Holding The Flaps Down, Roll The Edge Closest To You Up And Over, And Continue To Roll The Burrito Away From You To Completely Close It.
4. Serve With Condiments Of Choice.
5. Makes 6 Grande Burritos
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In A Covered Container, Wrapped In Foil Or Baggies And Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days. For Longer Storage, They Freeze Well For Up To 2 – 3 Months (Store Without Lettuce Or Avocado For Best Results).

title: CRISPY ROASTED CHICKPEAS RECIPE
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Or 1 12 Cups Fresh Cooked
2. 1  2 Teaspoons Olive Oil
3. 1 Teaspoon Flavor Seasoning  Garlic Salt Or Lemonpepper
4. Generous Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Prep: If You’Re Using Canned Chickpeas, Place Them In A Colander And Rinse Them Under Cool Running Water.
3. Dry: Fold A Large Dish Towel Or Flour Sack In Half, Placing The Chickpeas Between. With Your Hands Laid Flat, Roll The Chickpeas Using The Palm Of Your Hand And Extended Fingers To Move The Garbanzo Beans Around. Try To Remove As Much Of The Moisture As You Can.
4. Remove Loose Skins: Once Dried, Pick Away Any Skins That Have Noticeably Become Detached Or Loosened By Gently Pinching The Chickpeas Between Your Thumb And Forefinger. Repeat Rolling The Chickpeas One More Time For Good Measure.
5. Oil & Season: Spread The Chickpeas Onto A Rimmed Baking Sheet Lined Withparchment Paperorsilpat (Affiliate Links), Lightly Greased Is Ok Too. Drizzle With A Teaspoon Or Two Of Olive Oil, Add Seasoning And Mix Well To Coat. Arrange The Chickpeas Across The Baking Sheet In A Single Layer.
6. Roast: Bake For 40 – 45 Minutes, Stirring Every 10 Minutes Or So. Once Done Let Cool A Bit Before Using Or Storing.
7. Store: Chickpeas Will Stay Crispy And Crunchy Stored In An Uncovered Or Loosely Covered Bowl Or Container. When Stored In An Airtight Container They Will Soften Up And Lose Their Crunchy Texture. Will Last On The Counter For 5 Days Or So.

title: PASTA AND BEAN SOUP with KALE
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Yellow Onion Diced
3. 2 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 2 Large Carrots Sliced
5. 1 Tablespoon Dried Thyme Or 2 Tablespoons Fresh
6. 2 Teaspoons Dried Sage Optional
7. 2  3 Teaspoons Smoked Paprika
8. A Pinch Or Two Of Red Pepper Flakes
9. 3 Cans 15Oz Beans Blackeyed Peas Pinto White Or Kidney Drained And Rinsed  Or 1 Pound Dried Beans Cooked Blackeyed Peas Cranberry Or Great Northern Beans
10. 8 Oz Of Pasta Of Choice
11. 1 Can 15 Oz Diced Tomatoes With The Juices
12. 2  3 Bay Leaves
13. 8 Cups Vegetable Broth Plus More As Needed
14. 1 Bunch Tuscan Kale About 4 Loose Cups Center Stems Removed And Roughly Chopped
15. Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
16. To Serve
17. Almond Parmesan
18. Squeeze Of Lemon
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot, Add Oil/Water And Heat Over Medium Heat. Add Onion, Carrot, And Garlic, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add In The Thyme, Paprika, Optional Sage, And Red Pepper Flakes, Cook 1 More Minute, Or Until Fragrant.
2. Simmer: Add The Beans, Pasta, Tomatoes, Bay Leaves, And Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low, And Simmer Until Pasta Is Al Dente, About 10 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. Remove From Heat, Stir In The Kale To Soften And Wilt (If You Prefer Very Soft Kale, Add It 5 Minutes Before Soup Is Done. Remove Bay Leaves Before Serving. Season With Salt And Pepper.
3. Serve: We Love Adding A Squeeze Of Lemon To Our Serving Bowl For Brightness. And For Soaking Up The Juices, This Homemade Artisan Bread Is Delicious!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 – 7 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. To Freeze, Let Cool Completely And Store In Freezer-Safe Containers. Reheat On The Stove Or In The Microwave.

title: EASY APPLE COLESLAW
ingredients:
1. 12 Head Green Cabbage About 4  5 Cups Shredded
2. 2 Carrots About 1 12 Cups Julienned Or Shredded
3. 2 Apples Green Or Red Cored And Cut Into Matchsticks
4. 34  1 Cup Dried Cranberries
5. 12 Cup Slivered Almonds
6. 2  3 Green Onions About 12 Cup Sliced
7. Tahini Maple Dressing
8. 14 Cup Tahini
9. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
11. 14 Teaspoon Fresh Cracked Pepper
12. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Tahini, Maple Syrup, Apple Cider Vinegar Add Pepper. Add 1 -2 Tablespoons Of Water As Needed To Thin. Set Aside To Rest.
2. Assemble Coleslaw: In A Large Bowl (A Large Soup Or Stock Pot Will Work Too), Add The Cabbage, Apples, Carrots, Cranberries, Green Onions And Almonds. Drizzle The Tahini Maple Dressing Over Top And Mix Well To Coat. Finish With Salt And Pepper To Taste.
3. Serve As Is, Or Store In The Refrigerator For 30 Minutes To Chill. Coleslaw Can Be Made A Day Ahead And Stored, Covered, In The Refrigerator Until Ready To Serve.
4. Makes About 8 Cups

title: Golden Tofu Coconut Curry
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Black Rice
2. 1 34 Cup Water
3. 1 Tablespoon Coconut Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth For Water Saute
4. 1 Small Onion Thinly Sliced Lengthwise
5. 2 Garlic Cloves Minced
6. 1 12 Inch Knob Fresh Ginger Peeled And Minced
7. 1 Large Sweet Potato Peeled  Diced
8. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper Seeds Removed  Thinly Sliced
9. 8 Oz Shiitake Or Cremini Mushrooms Sliced
10. 1 Tablespoon Curry Powder
11. 2 Teaspoons Turmeric
12. 1 Block 12 14 Oz Organic Tofu Firm Or Extrafirm
13. 1 Can 14 Oz Coconut Milk Light Or Fullfat
14. 2 Cups Water Vegetable Broth Or Plain Nondairy Milk
15. 3  4 Tablespoons Fresh Lime Juice
16. Big Handful Baby Greens Spinach Kale Chard Or Combo
17. Mineral Salt To Taste
18. Cilantro To Serve
19. Lime Wedges To Serve
preparation:
1. Black Rice: In A Medium Pot, Add Rice And Water, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover And Let Simmer For 25 Minutes.
2. Tofu Curry: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat The Coconut Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion, And Cook Until Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add In Garlic, Ginger, Sweet Potato, Bell Peppers, And Mushrooms, Cook Another 2 – 3 Minutes. Add Curry Powder And Turmeric, Cook For 1 Minute Or Until Fragrant. Add In The Coconut Milk, Remaining Liquids, And Tofu, Stir Gently. Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover And Simmer For 10 – 15 Minutes, Until Sweet Potato Is Fork-Tender. Turn Off The Heat, Add In The Lime Juice And Leafy Greens, Stirring Gently Until The Greens Soften And Wilt.
3. Serve The Tofu Curry Overtop Rice And Enjoy With Fresh Cilantro On Top And A Squeeze Of More Lime Juice If You Like. Pairs Well With Homemade Vegan Naan.
4. Store: Leftovers Store Well For A Few Days In An Airtight Container In The Fridge. Flavors Will Enhance With Time. For Longer Storage, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: GREEN SALAD + LEMON TAHINI DRESSING
ingredients:
1. Spring Salad Mix Or Any Salad Mix You Prefer
2. Handful Grape Or Cherry Tomatoes Halved
3. 1 Shallot Thinly Sliced
4. Micro Greens Optional
5. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
6. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
7. Lemontahini Dressing
8. 4 Tablespoons Tahini
9. Juice Of One Large Lemon
10. Dash Of Mineral Salt
11. Dash Of Garlic Salt
12. Dash Of Red Pepper Flakes
13. 2  3 Tablespoons Water Or Lemon Juice As Needed To Thin
preparation:
1. Tahini Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together All The Ingredients Except For The Water. Taste For Flavor Adding Any Extra You Might Like. Add The Water Or Lemon Juice One Tablespoon At A Time To Thin As Needed To Desired Consistency.
2. Assemble Salad: Prepare Your Salad, Layer As You Like Adding Half The Chickpeas And Top With Dressing.
3. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days, In A Covered Container. If Making For Meal Prep, Keep The Salad And Dressing Stored Separately.

title: ROASTED POBLANO TACOS
ingredients:
1. 2 Medium Poblano Chiles Anaheim Or Hatch Chilies Ok Too
2. 1 Can 15 Oz Pinto Black Beans Or Refried Beans
3. 2 Scallions Sliced
4. Purple Or Green Cabbage Shredded
5. Avocado Sliced
6. Cilantro
7. 6 Corn Tortillas Or 9 Organic Corn Tortilla Sliders
8. Lime Wedges To Serve
9. Hatch Chile Cashew Dressing Or Cilantro Lime Cashew Cream To Serve
preparation:
1. Roast Poblanos: Turn Broiler To Medium – High, Place Poblanos On Baking Sheet And Place Under The Broiler For About 7 – 10 Minutes, Turning Every Few Minutes To Char And Brown Evenly On All Sides. Poblanos Will Crackle And Pop While Cooking, They Will Be Ready When Charred And Softened To The Touch Of A Fork Pushing On Its Side. Place Poblanos In A Bowl, Cover With A Plate Or Saran Wrap And Let Steam For A Few Minutes (This Will Help Loosen The Skin For Peeling). Remove The Skin, Lay The Peeled Poblano On A Flat Surface, Remove The Top And Make A Slit Down The Center, Open And Remove The Seeds. Slice Lengthwise Into 1/2 Inch Strips.
2. Heat Beans: Place Beans In A Small Pot And Cook Over Medium Until Warm, Stirring Occasionally. If Using Pinto Or Black Beans, Add A Dash Or Two Of Garlic Powder For A Little Extra Flavor. You May Decide To Not Heat Your Canned Whole Beans In Which Case, Drain And Rinse Before Using.
3. Prep Veggies: Prepare Scallions, Purple Cabbage And Avocado. Heat Your Tortillas Over The Gas/Electric Burner Until Slightly Charred.
4. Build: Layer Your Tacos With Beans, Poblanos, Cabbage, Scallions, Avocado, Cilantro And A Sprinkle Of Pink Salt & Drizzle Of Cashew Cream Of Choice Or Sriracha (Or Both!).

title: VEGAN MINESTRONE SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 2 Medium Carrots Diced
4. 2 Celery Ribs Diced
5. 3  4 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 1 Zucchini Cut Into Half Moons
7. 13 Pound Green Beans About 1 12 Cup Cut Into 1 Inch Pieces
8. 1 Can 14Oz Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
9. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
10. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
11. 2 Teaspoons Italian Seasoning Blend
12. Generous Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
13. 2  3 Bay Leaves
14. 1 Cup Small Pasta Elbow Shells Mini Penne Rotini
15. 4 Cups Vegetable Broth
16. 2  4 Cups Water
17. 2 Handfuls Fresh Spinach
18. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
19. To Serve Optional
20. Lemon Juice Of
21. Fresh Parsley Chopped
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Add The Oil Or Water And Saute The Onion, Carrot And Celery For 5 Minutes.
2. *Alternately, You Can Skip Sauteing And Add All The Ingredients, Except For The Spinach, To A Large Pot, Bring To A Boil And Continue With The Recipe As Written. This Makes For One Less Step!
3. Cook: Add Remaining Ingredients, Except The Spinach, Bring To A Boil, Cover Askew, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer At A Gentle Boil For 20 – 25 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally. Soup Is Done When Veggies Are Tender And Pasta Is Cooked. Add More Broth Or Water As Needed.
4. Add Spinach: Five Minutes Before Soup Is Done, Add The Spinach And Stir To Mix.
5. Let Soup Cool A Few Minutes And Serve With A Squeeze Of Lemon And Chopped Parsley On Top. Pairs Will With Homemade Vegan Cornbread, Crusty Artisan Bread Or Soft And Chewy Vegan Naan For Soaking Up The Juices.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days. This Soup Also Freezes Well And Will Last For Up To 2 Months.

title: BEST PUMPKIN OATMEAL (HEALTHY + EASY)
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Old Fashioned Oats
2. 12 Cup Pumpkin Puree
3. 1 Teaspoon Pumpkin Pie Spice Or Cinnamon
4. 14 Cup Plant Milk I Used Oat Milk
5. 1 12 Cups Water
6. Pinch Of Salt
7. To Serve
8. 1  2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
9. 1  2 Tablespoons Nondairy Milk I Used Oat Milk Optional
10. 14  12 Cup Pecans Optional
preparation:
1. Stovetop: In A Saucepan, Combine Oats, Pumpkin Puree, Pumpkin Spice, Plant Milk , Water, And Salt, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Simmer And Cook Over A Gentle Boil For 3 – 4 Minutes. Remove From Heat And Let Stand For 2 To 3 Minutes.
2. Microwave: Add Ingredients In A Large Bowl And Mix Well To Combine. Microwave On High For 3 Minutes, Stopping To Stir After 2 Minutes. To Prevent The Oatmeal From Boiling Over, Be Sure To Use A Larger, Wider Bowl. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
3. Instant Pot: Combine Oats, Pumpkin Puree, Pumpkin Spice, Plant Milk, Water, And Salt Into The Bottom Of An Instant Pot Insert. Give A Good Stir To Mix In The Pumpkin Puree. Attach Lid, Turn To Lock, And Set Valve To Sealing. Manually Set To Cook For 1 Minute On High Pressure, And Let The Pressure Natural Release For 5 Minutes. Total Time, Including Coming To Pressure, Is About 17 – 20 Minutes.
4. Slow Cooker (Double Recipe Unless Using A 3 Qt.): Combine Oats, Water, Pumpkin Puree, Pumpkin Spice, 1Plant Milk, And Salt In The Bowl Of A Slow Cooker. Stir Well To Combine And Break Up The Pumpkin Puree. Cook On Low For 8 Hours.
5. Serve: Place Oatmeal In Your Serving Bowl, Top With Pecans, And Drizzle Of Maple Syrup And Plant Milk.
6. Store:Leftover Oatmeal Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6 Days And Make For Great Grab-N-Go Meals. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator Before Reheating.

title: Smoky Black Bean Burger
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 2 Tablespoons Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Small Onion About 1 Cup Chopped
3. 1 12 Cups Cooked Quinoa Packed Or Brown Rice
4. 2 Cans 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
5. 12 Cup Flaxseed Meal Or Pankobread Crumbs
6. 1 12 Teaspoons Smoked Paprika
7. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. 1 Teaspoon Oregano Or Cumin Or 34 Teaspoon Both
9. 12 Mineral Salt Or To Taste
10. Glaze
11. 1 Tablespoon Balsamic Or Apple Cider Vinegar
12. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
13. 1 Teaspoon Tamari Coconut Aminos Of Soy Sauce
14. 1 Teaspoon Tomato Paste
15. 12  1 Teaspoon Sriracha Or Hot Sauce Of Choice
16. To Serve
17. Hamburger Buns
18. Leafy Greens
19. Sliced Red Onion
20. Tomato Slices
21. Garlic Aioli
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Small Pan Or Skillet, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Saute For About 5 – 7 Minutes, Onions Should Be Tender And Slightly Golden On The Edges. Let Onions Cool A Bit Before Moving To The Food Processor.
2. Glaze: Next, Prepare The Glaze. In A Small Bowl, Combine The Vinegar, Maple Syrup, Tamari, Tomato Paste, And Sriracha. Mix Well, And Set Aside To Let The Flavors Mingle. Taste Again, Adding More Of Any Ingredient To Suit Your Taste.
3. Process: Using A Food Processor, Add Slightly Cooled Onions, Quinoa/Rice, Black Beans, Flaxseed Meal, And Spices/Herbs. Pulse For 5 – 6 Seconds At A Time, Until About Half The Mixture Is Combined. Be Careful Not To Over-Process, You Want Some Chunkiness From The Beans And Onions.
4. Mix: Place Mixture In A Mixing Bowl. You’Ll Notice Once You Remove The Mixture, The Underneath Part Will Be More Processed Than The Top. Using Your Hands Or Spatula, Mix Together Well.
5. Patties: Form 4 Round Jumbo Balls, Making Sure To Pack The Balls Together Well. Flatten Each Ball Into A Patty, About 3/4 Inch Thick, And Smooth Any Cracks Along The Edges. Place On Prepared Baking Sheet. Alternately, You Can Make 6 Regular-Sized Patties Or 8 Sliders.
6. How To Cook
7. Oven: Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees. Line A Baking Sheet With Silpat, Parchment Paper, Or Lightly Grease With Oil. Place Baking Sheet In Preheated Oven And Bake For 12 – 15 Minutes. Using A Spatula, Gently Flip Patties And Bake Another 12 – 15 Minutes. Brush Tip And Sides With Balsamic Glaze. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
8. Stovetop: Heat 1 Tablespoon Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Patties, And Cook 5 Minutes, Or Until Lightly Browned. Carefully Flip Patties And Cook Another 5 Minutes. Remove, Brush With Balsamic Glaze.
9. Grill: Preheat Grill To Medium-High Heat, On Greased Grill, Place Patties And Cook 5 Minutes, Carefully Flip And Cook Another 5 Minutes, Or Until Lightly Browned And/Or Charred. Remove, Brush With Balsamic Glaze.
10. Serve With Fixins Of Choice And Enjoy!
11. Makes 4 Jumbo Or 6 Regular Patties, Or 8 Sliders.
12. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To A Week, Or In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months (Thaw Before Cooking).
13. Pair Your Burgers With These Homemade Baked Potato Chips, Vegan Coleslaw, Classic Potato Salad Or Healthy Baked Beans!

title: HEALTHY BAKED APPLE OATMEAL
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Oldfashioned Oats
2. 2 Teaspoons Cinnamon
3. 12 Teaspoon Nutmeg
4. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
5. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
6. 2 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
7. 1 Cup Mashed Banana Optional
8. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Optional
9. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
10. 1 Medium Apple Use Your Favorite I Used Fuji Cored And Diced
11. 12  1 Cup Walnuts Chopped
12. To Serve
13. Sliced Apple
14. Pure Maple Syrup
15. Unsweetened Almond Milk
16. Unsweetened Toasted Coconut Flakes Its Delicious
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Lightly Grease Your Baking Dish With Coconut Oil If You Like (Generally I Skip This Step).
2. Mix: In An 8 × 8 Baking Dish, Add Oats, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Baking Powder And Salt, Mix Well. Add In The Milk, Banana, Optional Syrup And Vanilla, Gently Whisk To Combine. Top With Chopped Apples And Walnuts, Mix Them In If You Like.
3. Bake: Place In The Oven On The Middle Rack And Bake For 30 Minutes. Once Done, Let Cool Slightly.
4. Serve: Slice And Serve Warm In Individual Bowls With Toppings Of Choice. Voila’….Enjoy This Most Delicious And Worth The Wait Oatmeal!

title: INSTANT POT APPLESAUCE (+ SLOW COOKER)
ingredients:
1. 3 Lbs Apples About 6  7 Fuji Gala Granny Smith Honey Crisp Delicious
2. 1 Small Lemon Juice Of
3. 12 Cup Water
4. 1 Cinnamon Stick Or 12  1 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
preparation:
1. Prepare The Apples:
2. Unpeeled: Wash The Apples Well, Quarter And Core The Apples, Cut The Quarters In Half.
3. Peeled: Peel The Apples, Quarter, Core And Cut The Quarters In Half.
4. Instant Pot:
5. Place Apples In The Bottom Of The Instant Pot, Add The Lemon Juice, Water And Optional Cinnamon.
6. Attach Lid, And Make Sure Vent Is In The Sealed Position. Push The Pressure Cooker Button, And Manually Set The Time For 6 Minutes.
7. When Done, Let The Steam Vent On It’S Own, Takes About 6 Minutes. Move The Vent To Open, Careful Not To Burn Yourself As There May Still Be Steam Left. Remove Lid And Let Cool A Bit, Remove Cinnamon Stick.
8. Mash Or Puree: If Cooking With The Skins On, Use An Immersion Blender Right In The Pot To Puree The Mixture, Or Transfer To A Blender Or Food Processor To Puree Until Desired Consistency. When Cooking Without The Skins You Can Simply Mash With A Potato Masher Or Back Of A Fork Or Slotted Spoon.
9. Slow Cooker:
10. Add The Apples To The Bottom Of The Crockpot, Add The Lemon, Water And Optional Cinnamon, And Cover With Lid.
11. Set The Slow Cooker On High For 4 Hours, Stirring Once Or Twice. Let Cool A Few Minutes, Remove Cinnamon Stick, And Mash Or Puree.
12. Mash Or Puree: If Cooking With The Skins On, Use An Immersion Blender Right In The Pot To Puree The Mixture, Or Transfer To A Blender Or Food Processor To Puree Until Desired Consistency. When Cooking Without The Skins You Can Simply Mash With A Potato Masher Or Back Of A Fork Or Slotted Spoon.
13. Storeyour Applesauce In The Refrigerator For Up To 7 Days, Or Freeze For Up To 2 Months.
14. Makes 4 – 4 1/2 Cups.
15. Notes:
16. For Ultra Smooth Applesauce, Use A Blender To Puree.
17. If You Prefer More Sweetness, Add A Tad Of Sugar 1 – 2 Teaspoons At A Time Until Desired Sweetness.
18. If You Didn’T Add Cinnamon While Cooking, Feel Free To Add Some After Cooking.
19. Picking Apples:
20. When Picking Your Apples Stick With Your Favorites To Start, Using All Of One Type Or A Combination Of 2 – 3 Types Of Apples. Organic Is Best, Especially If Cooking With The Skins On!
21. I’Ve Used All Fuji Apples Which Were Delicious And On The Sweeter Side. So If You Prefer Your Applesauce To Be Very Sweet Use Only Fuji.
22. As For Combinations, My Favorites Are A Mix Of Fuji And Granny Smith Apples Or A Mix Of Honey Crisp, Granny Smith And Fuji. These Combos Balance Each Other Out Well, Having Just The Right Amount Of Natural Sweetness And Tartness.
23. To Peel Or Not To Peel Your Apples?
24. Peeling: It Takes A Bit Longer To Prep But The End Result Is A Little Easier Since You’Ll Simply Need To Mash The Apples With A Potato Masher, Back Of A Fork Or Back Of A Slotted Spoon.
25. No Peel:The Prep Time Moves Along Quicker, But The End Time May Take A Little Longer With The Need To Use An Immersion Blender, Or Transferring The Cooked Apples To A Blender Or Food Processor, To Get A Smooth Consistency. The Clear Advantage Of Not Peeling Your Apples Is The Health Benefits, Apples Skins Have Antioxidants And Fiber.

title: RUSTIC CABBAGE, POTATO & WHITE BEAN SOUP
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Water Or 2 Tablespoons Olive Or Grapeseed Oil For Sauteing
2. 2 Leeks Use White  Pale Green Parts Sliced And Rinsed
3. 2 Carrots Diced
4. 2 Stalks Celery Some Leaves Ok Diced
5. 2  3 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 1 Tablespoon Herbs De Provence Or 1 Teaspoon Each Thyme Rosemary Oregano
7. 1 Can 15 Oz Diced Tomatoes I Used Fired Roasted
8. 5  6 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water
9. 3 Medium 1 Lb Gold Potatoes Diced
10. 12 Head Large Cabbage About 4 Cups Sliced Savoy Or Green
11. 3 Cups Cooked White Beans Or 2 Cans 15 Oz Drained And Rinsed Use Cannellini Great Northern Or Navy
12. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
13. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley To Garnish
preparation:
1. Washing Leeks: Slice Off The Root End And The Dark Green Parts. Slice In Half Lengthwise. Run Under Cold Running Water, Opening Up The Layers As You Rinse To Remove And Dirt Between The Leaf Sheaths. Lay On Flat Surface And Cut Into Thin Slices Horizontally (Widthwise).
2. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Stock Pot, Heat Water/Oil Over Medium To Medium-High Heat, Add Leeks, Carrots And Celery, Saute For 5 Minutes. Smells Delicious Already! Add Garlic And Spices, Saute For 1 Minute More Or Until Fragrant.
3. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add Tomatoes, Potatoes, Cabbage, Beans, And Veg Broth.
4. Simmer: Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low, And Simmer For 20 – 30 Minutes, Or Until Potatoes And Cabbage Are Tender. Taste For Seasoning Adding Salt & Pepper As Needed.
5. Serve Topped With Parsley And A Serving Of Gluten-Free Socca Or Crusty Artisan Bread. Enjoy!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator In Covered Containers For Up To 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer Using Freezer Safe Containers Or Bags For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: THE ULTIMATE VEGETABLE VEGAN LASAGNA
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Small Onion Diced
3. 2  3 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 2 Carrots 2 Cups Diced
5. 1 Zucchini 2 Cups Diced
6. 1 Yellow Squash 2 Cups Diced
7. 8 Oz Mushrooms Chopped
8. 12 Teaspoon Italian Seasoning Or Thyme Basil Or Marjoram Optional
9. 1 Package 10  12 Oz Frozen Spinach Thawed And Drained
10. 1 Jar 25  28 Oz Pasta Sauce About 3 Cups
11. 9 Lasagna Noodles Approx Regular Or Noboil
12. 2 Cups Vegan Ricotta Cashew Ricotta Cheese Or Tofu Ricotta
13. Salt  Pepper To Taste
14. To Serve
15. Almond Parmesan For Garnish
16. Fresh Basil Leaves Julienned For Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F.
2. Noodles: Cook Noodles According To Package Directions, Set Aside. If Using No Boil Lasagna Noodles Like I Did There Is No Need To Cook First.
3. Saute Veggies: In A Large Skillet, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Garlic, Saute For About 5 Minutes. Add Carrots, Zucchini, Squash, Mushrooms, Herbs/Seasonings And Good Pinch Of Salt And Pepper, Continue To Saute For Another 5 – 7 Minutes. We Don’T Need To Saute The Zucchini, Yellow Squash And Mushrooms Too Much, We Want Their Juices To Fully Release While Baking. Remove From Heat.
4. Spinach Ricotta: Mix Together The Cashew Ricotta And Spinach, Mix Well.
5. Assemble & Layer: Using A Large Rectangular Baking Dish (9 X 12) Place About 1/3 Cup Of Sauce On The Bottom Of The Dish Spreading To Coat, Add A Layer Of Pasta, Top With 1/2 Ricotta Cheese And 1/2 Vegetables. Add Another Layer Of Pasta, 1/2 Of The Remaining Sauce, Then The Rest Of The Ricotta, Then Vegetables. Add One More Layer Of Pasta And Top With The Remaining Sauce. Cover With Lid, Small Silpat Or Foil.
6. Bake:Cover And Bake On The Center Rack For 40 Minutes. Let Rest Covered For 5 Minutes, Remove Cover And Let Cool 10 Minutes. If Not Using No-Boil Noodles, You Can Remove The Cover Half Way Through For A Baked Look.
7. To Serve: Add A Sprinkle Of Almond Parmesan And A Bit Of Freshly Chopped Basil Overtop.
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: HEALTHY BARLEY BOWL
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Pearl Barley
2. 2 34 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
3. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
4. 1 Small Butternut Squash About 2 12 Cups Diced
5. 12 Small Onion Sliced
6. 1 Can 15 Oz Great Northern Or Cannellini Beans Drained And Rinsed
7. 2  3 Handfuls Baby Spinach
8. Generous Dash Of Garlic Powder
9. 12 Teaspoon Dried Thyme Or 1 Tsp Fresh
10. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
11. Avocado To Serve
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Cook Grain: In A Medium Size Pot Add Barley, A Pinch Of Salt And Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 45 Minutes. Remove Cover And Let Set 5 – 10 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork. Drain Any Remaining Liquids. If Using Quick Cooking Barley, Follow Package Instruction : Making 4 Servings (1 Cup Barley + 1 1/3 Cup Veg Broth).
3. Roast Squash: While Your Barley Is Simmering, Prepare Your Butternut Squash By Cubing Into 3/4 – 1 Inch Pieces. Place On Roasting Pan Lined With Parchment Paper, A Silpat Or Lightly Greased. Toss The Squash With 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil And Sprinkle With The Thyme And Salt. Place On Middle Rake For 25 – 30 Min, Stirring Once. Squash Is Ready When Fork Pierces Easily.
4. Beans: In A Medium Size Pan, Heat The Remaining Olive Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Cook About 5 Minutes. Add Spinach And Cook Until Wilted (Using A Cover Will Help Wilt The Spinach Faster), Add Beans And A Dash Or Two Of Garlic Powder, Cook Until Heated Through.
5. Serve: In Individual Bowls, Add A Portion Of Barley, Beans And Butternut Squash. Add A Side Of Sliced Avocado.
6. Serve With Avocado And Season To Taste With Salt & Pepper.

title: INSTANT POT MASHED POTATOES (EASY, NO DRAIN RECIPE)
ingredients:
1. 5 Lbs 23 Kg Potatoes Yukon Gold Russet Red Or White
2. Vegetable Broth Or Water See Methods
3. 34  1 14 Cups 237  355 Cups Unsweetened Plain Nondairy Milk Or Vegan Cream At Room Temp
4. 13 Cup 113 G Dairyfree Butter Miyokos Pref Margarine Or Extra Virgin Olive Oil At Room Temp
5. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Instant Pot:
2. Peel, Or Leave Skins On, And Quarter The Potatoes (If Using Larger Potatoes Like Russet, Cut Into 1 1/2 Inch Cubes). If Cooking With The Skins, Scrub Potatoes Well Before Cutting.
3. Place Potatoes At The Bottom Of The Instant Pot, Add 1 1/2 Cups (355 Ml) Water And A Generous Pinch Of Salt (If Halving Or Doubling Recipe See Notes).
4. Attach Lid, Set Vent To The Sealed Position. Push The Pressure Cooker Button, And Manually Set The Time For 10 Minutes(Instant Pot Will Come To Pressure Before Actually Cooking Which May Take 10 Minutes).
5. When Done, Let The Steam Vent On Its Own, Or Carefully Move The Valve To Open If You’Re In A Hurry.
6. Add Oil/Butter, And Give The Mashed Potatoes A Mash With A Potato Masher. Add The In Milk, Salt And Pepper, And Mash & Stir Well Until Fluffy And Creamy, A Few Lumps Is Ok. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Salt & Pepper To Taste.
7. Keep Warm In The Instant Pot With This Instant Pot Glass Lid. Add A Tad More Milk And Stir Well To Bring Back Creaminess Before Serving If Needed.
8. Stovetop (Or See This Stovetop Vegan Mashed Potatoes):
9. In A Large Pot, Add Potatoes And Fill Pot With Enough Water To Cover Potatoes, There Should Be About 1 Inch Of Water Overtop.
10. Bring To A Boil, Cover Askew, Reduce Heat To Low, And Cook Over A Gentle Boil For 15 – 20 Minutes. Potatoes Are Done When Fork Tender.
11. Remove From Heat, Carefully Drain Water.
12. Mash With Potato Masher, Add Oil/Butter And 1 Cup Milk, Salt & Pepper, Stir To Combine. Add More Milk, A Little At A Time, As Needed To Achieve Desired Consistency (You May Find You Use Up To 2 Cups). Taste For Flavor, Adding More Salt & Pepper To Taste.
13. Pair Your Mashed Potatoes As A Side With This Flavorfulthe Ultimate Vegetable Loaforapple, Fennel & Sage Lentil Loaf. Also, Use Them As A Bed For This Delicious Mushroom Stroganoff, Mushroom Bourguignonorhearty Lentil & Mushroom Ragu.

title: EGGPLANT PUTTANESCA
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Onion Chopped
3. 2 Medium Eggplants Cut Into 12  34 Inch Cubes
4. 1 25Oz Jar Pasta Sauce Or Homemade Marinara Sauce
5. 12 Cup Pitted Olives Kalamata Green Or Greek
6. 2 Tablespoons Capers
7. 12  1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
8. 16 Oz Pasta Of Choice
preparation:
1. In Large Skillet/Saute Pan Heat Olive Oil Over Medium Heat, Saute Onion And Eggplant Until Tender, About 8 – 10 Min. Add Sauce, Olives, Capers, Red Pepper Flakes, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 – 20 Min. Sauce Is Ready When Eggplant Is Fully Tender.
2. Cook Pasta According To Package Directions.
3. Serve Eggplant Sauce Over Pasta With A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan Over Top. Pairs Well With A Slice Of Crusty Bread.

title: VEGAN NAAN
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour Allpurpose White Whole Wheat Spelt Or Glutenfree Flour Blend
2. 2 Teaspoons Organic Pure Cane Sugar Or Pure Maple Syrup
3. 1 Teaspoon Rapidrise Fast Acting Yeast If Using Active Yeast See Notes
4. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
5. 34 Cup Warm Water Between 105 And 115F
6. 4 Tablespoons Unsweetened Nondairy Yogurt At Room Temp
7. 2 Teaspoons Olive Oil
8. Garnish
9. Melted Vegan Butter Or Garlic Infused Olive Oil
10. Freshly Chopped Parsley Or Cilantro
preparation:
1. Mix Dry Ingredients: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add The Flour, Yeast, Sugar And Salt, Mix To Combine.
2. Mix Wet Ingredients: In A Medium Bowl Or 2 Cup Measuring Cup, Combine The 3/4 Cup Warm Water (Between 105 And 115ºf.) With The Yogurt And Oil.
3. Combine Dry & Wet: Pour Wet Ingredients Into The Dry Ingredients. Mix The Wet And Dry Ingredients Together. Dough Will Be Rough & Shaggy Looking And Tacky To The Touch.
4. Quick Knead: Knead The Dough By Pulling The Dough Ball Onto Itself About 5 Times, And Form A Ball. Doesn’T Have To Be A Tight Ball.
5. Cover And Let Rise: Tightly Cover Bowl With Saran Wrap And Let Rest In A Warm Area Away From Drafts For About 60 – 90 Minutes. The Warmer The Area, The Faster The Dough Will Rise. Once Dough Has Risen It Will Have Doubled In Size.
6. Turn Dough Out: Fill A Small Bowl With Flour And Lightly Sprinkle A Flat Surface With Flour. Turn Dough Onto The Flat Surface And Sprinkle With Flour. Dough Will Be Tacky.
7. Shape Dough: Dust Fingers With Flour And Shape The Dough Into A Rectangle, It Doesn’T Have To Be A Perfect Shape.
8. Cut Dough: Cut The Dough Into 6 Pieces, Making Them As Even As Possible (Again It Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect).
9. Roll & Flatten: When Ready To Bake, Roll A Piece Into A Ball. Using A Lightly Floured Rolling Pin, Roll The Dough Into An Oval Shape (About 9 X 4 Inches), Flatting To About 1/8 Inch Thick. Add More Flour As Needed To Your Work Area And Fingers.
10. Heat Skillet And Bake: Get The Skillet Nice And Hot By Heating Over Medium-High Heat. Place Dough Onto The Skillet Surface. When Bubbles Start To Appear (Above Left), Flip The Naan And Cook The Other Side.
11. Garnish: Once Done Brush With Olive Oil Or Melted Vegan Butter And Enjoy!
12. Makes 6
13. Store: Leftover Naan Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container For Up To 3 Days On The Counter. To Keep Longer, Freeze For Up To 2 Months.

title: EASY VEGAN CALZONES
ingredients:
1. 1 1B Pizza Dough I Used Trader Joes Divided Into 4 Sections
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
3. 12 Onion Sliced Or Diced
4. 2  3 Garlic Cloves Minced
5. 2 Teaspoons Dried Thyme
6. 3 Large Portobello Mushrooms About 6Oz Sliced
7. 1 12 Cups Broccoli Florets Cut Somewhat Small
8. 4  6 Large Leaves Of Kale Curly Or Flat Stems Removed And Roughly Chopped Or Left Somewhat Whole
9. Large Handful Cherry Or Grape Tomatoes Sliced In Half
10. Himalayan Salt And Pepper To Taste
11. Cornmeal For Dusting The Pizza Wheel
12. Garlic Cream Sauce
13. 1 Cup Raw Cashews Soaked See Notes
14. 12 Cup Water Plus A Little More As Needed
15. 2  3 Cloves Garlic
16. 2 Teaspoons White Miso
17. Juice Of 1 Lemon
18. Himalayan Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Prep Dough: Remove Pizza Dough, Slice Into 4 Equal Pieces, Sprinkle With A Little Flour, Lay A Towel Overtop And Let Pizza Dough Come To Room Temp Away From Oven Heat For 30 Minutes.
2. Garlic-Miso Cream: Drain Cashews And Place All Ingredients For The Cream Into A Small Blender Cup And Process Until Creamy, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. If Cream Is Too Thick And Extra Water 1 Tablespoon At A Time Until Desired Consistency, Being Careful Not To Thin It Out Too Much Making It Runny, If In Doubt Leave It On The Thick Side. Taste For Seasoning, Set Aside.
3. Saute Veggies: In Large Skillet, Heat Olive Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Onion, Garlic And Cook Until Onions Become Soft. Add In Mushrooms, Broccoli, Kale, Thyme And Salt & Pepper To Taste, Cook For Another 5 Minutes Or So. Turn Off Heat And Cover Ajar To Help Steam And Soften The Veggies A Little More While Working On The Next Step.
4. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Place Pizza Stone Or Cast Iron Pizza Pan In The Oven To Heat Up.
5. Make Calzone: On A Lightly Floured Surface Or Parchment Paper, Roll Each Portion Out Into An Eight Inch Oval, Rectangle, Circle – Whatever Works Easiest For You. Lay On Some Of The Veggie Mixture, Add A Few Heaping Tablespoons Of The Garlic Miso Cream And Top With Tomatoes. Fold The Other Half Over And Seal The Edges By Pressing With A Fork. Make A Few Small Slits In The Top So Steam Is Able To Release. Top With A Light Coat Of Olive Oil And A Sprinkle Of Salt, Pepper And Thyme.
6. Bake: Dust The Heated Pizza Stone With Cornmeal, Place Calzone On The Pizza Stone (Or If Using Parchment Paper, Transfer To Pan Or Stone) And Bake For 15 – 20 Minutes, Until Crust Is Puffy And Golden Brown. Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Serving.
7. Serve With Garlic Miso Sauce On The Side.
8. Store: Calzones Can Be Kept In A Covered Container In The Refrigerator For Up 4 Days. Reheat In A Toaster Oven Or Microwave.

title: Roasted Orange Tempeh + Asparagus
ingredients:
1. 1 Package 8 Oz Tempeh Cut Into 12  34 Inch Cubes
2. 1 Bunch Asparagus 1 Lb Ends Trimmed And Cut Into 1Inch Pieces
3. 3 Tablespoons Red Miso Paste White Miso Is Ok Too
4. 3 Tablespoons Balsamic Vinegar Or Glaze Rice Vinegar Ok Too
5. 2 Teaspoons Sesame Oil Regular Or Dark
6. 6 Tablespoons Cup Orange Juice
7. 1  2 Teaspoons Pure Maple Syrup Optional
8. 3 Tablespoons Chopped Fresh Basil
9. To Serve
10. 1 12 Cups Cooked Brown Rice Quinoa Or Cauliflower Rice
11. Toasted Andor Black Sesame Seeds
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 450 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Orange-Miso Sauce: In A Small Or Medium-Sized Bowl, Whisk Together The Miso, Vinegar, Oil, Orange Juice, And Optional Maple Syrup.
3. Tempeh: In A Medium Bowl, Add The Tempeh And A Few Tablespoons Of The Sauce, Toss Well To Coat. Place The Tempeh On The Prepared Baking Sheet. Alternatively, Add The Tempeh To The Baking Sheet And Toss It With Sauce Right On The Pan.
4. Roast: Place Baking Sheet In The Oven And Cook For 12 Minutes. Stir The Tempeh And Add The Asparagus To The Baking Sheet. Continue To Cook For 8 – 10 Minutes. It Will Be Ready When Asparagus Is Bright Green And Just Fork Tender.
5. Add Basil To Sauce: Add The Chopped (Or Julienned) Basil To The Remaining Sauce.
6. Coat Tempeh + Asparagus: Once Roasting Is Complete, Remove The Baking Sheet. Let Cool A Few Minutes, Add A Few Tablespoons Of Sauce To The Tempeh And Asparagus, And Toss To Coat.
7. Serve: Serve In Individual Bowls With A Grain Of Choice And Tempeh & Asparagus Mixture Over The Top. Add A Drizzle Of Remaining Juices And A Sprinkle Of Toasted And/Or Black Sesame Seeds. Enjoy The Simples!

title: Vegan Alfredo Sauce
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Raw Cashews
2. 3  4 Garlic Cloves
3. 2 Teaspoons White Miso Or 1  2 Tbsp Nutritional Yeast Or 1 Tsp Dijon
4. 1 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder
5. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt  More To Taste
6. Juice Of 1 Small Lemon About 1 Tablespoon Or 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
7. 34  1 Cup Warm Water
8. 12 Ounces Long Pasta Fettuccini Or Linguine
preparation:
1. Soak Cashews: Place Cashews In A Small Bowl And Cover With Very Warm, Not Boiling, Water. Let Soak For 10 Minutes. Alternatively, Soak The Cashews In Cool Water For 2 Hours. Drain Water Before Using.
2. Alfredo Sauce: In A Blender, Add The Cashews, Garlic, Miso, Onion And Garlic Powder, Salt, Lemon Juice, And Water, And Blend Until Thick Can Creamy, Stopping As Needed To Scrape Down The Sides. Taste For Flavor And Add More Liquids To Thin To Desired Consistency. Tastes Will Vary – If You Find It’S Too Bland, Add More Salt To Taste.
3. Pasta:Cook The Pasta According To Package Directions.
4. Combine: With The Pasta Freshly Cooked And Drained, You Can Toss The Pasta And Alfredo Sauce In The Pot The Pasta Was Cooked In. Alternatively, Serve The Warm Pasta In Individual Bowls, Top With Alfredo Sauce, And Toss.
5. Serve: Top With Chopped Parsley And Fresh Cracked Pepper. It’S Great With A Slice Of Homemade Artisan Bread Or Garlic Bread.
6. Store: Leftover Sauce And/Or Pasta Can Be Kept In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days. Reheat On The Stove Over Low Heat, Adding A Splash Or Two Of Water.

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
ingredients:
1. 34 Cup 156G Coconut Oil At Room Temp Use Vegan Butter Or Unsweetened Applesauce
2. 34 Cup 150G Coconut Sugar Or Organic Cane Sugar
3. 12 Large Banana Mashed Or 2 Flax Eggs See Instructions
4. 14 Cup 60Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Pure Maple Syrup
5. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
6. 1 12 Cups 153G Spelt Flour Allpurpose Pastry Oat And White Whole Wheat Ok Too
7. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cinnamon
8. 1 Teaspoon Baking Soda Baking Powder Also Works
9. Generous Pinch Of Salt
10. 2 12 Cups 240G Oats Old Fashioned Or Quick
11. 1 Cup 175G Dark Chocolate Or Carob Chips I Love Enjoy Life
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees.
2. Flax Eggs: If Using Flax Eggs, In A Small Bowl Combine 2 Tablespoons Flaxseed Meal + 6 Tablespoons Water. Set Aside For At Least 10 Minutes To Gel Up. If Using Banana, In Small Bowl Mash Your Banana As Smooth As Possible, Set Aside.
3. Cream Together Oil & Sugar: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Combine Coconut Oil And Sugar, Mix Well, Making Sure There Are No Lumps Of Oil.
4. Add Wet Ingredients: Add In Mashed Banana/Flax Egg, Non-Dairy Milk Or Maple Syrup, And Vanilla.
5. Add Dry Ingredients: Add The Flour, Cinnamon, Baking Soda, And Salt, Mix Well To Combine Scraping The Bottom To Make Sure There Are No Flour Clumps. Add In The Oats And Mix Well. Lastly, Add In Chocolate Chips, Mix Again.
6. Scoop Dough: Line A Cookie/Baking Sheet With A Silpat Or Parchment Paper. Scoop Out Rounded Tablespoons Of Mixture And Place On Baking Sheet About 1 1/2 Inches Apart.
7. Bake: Place Baking Sheet In The Oven And Bake For 10 – 13 Minutes, Until Lightly Browned Around The Edges. Remove From Oven, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Enjoy.
8. Makes Approx. 24 Cookies
9. Store: Cookies Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container On The Counter For 5 Days. They’Ll Keep Longer If Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 Weeks. You Can Freeze Your Cookies For Up To 2 Months (See Notes).

title: AUTUMN WHEAT BERRY + BUTTERNUT SQUASH SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Butternut Squash Diced About 4 Cups
2. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
3. 2 Cups Wheat Berries I Used Bob Red Mills
4. 5 Cups Water
5. 1 Bunch Tuscan Kale Stems Removed And Chopped
6. 12 Red Onion Diced
7. 34 Cup Pomegranate Seeds
8. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
9. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley Optional
10. Apple Cider Vinaigrette
11. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
12. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Or Whole Grain Mustard
13. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
14. Fresh Cracked Pepper
15. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Butternut Squash: Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper, A Silpat Or Lightly Greased With Oil. Place Butternut Squash On Baking Sheet, Drizzle With 1 Tablespoon Oil, And Mix Well To Coat. Add A Sprinkle Of Salt And Pepper Over Top. Place In Oven On The Middle Rack And Cook For 25 – 30 Minutes, Stirring After 15 Minutes. Remove From Oven, Set Aside.
2. Wheat Berries + Kale: In A Medium Size Pot, Add Water, Wheat Berries And A Pinch Of Salt, Bring To Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low So Water Is At A Gentle Boil, And Cook For 45 Minutes, Or Until Wheat Berries Are Tender. Add Kale To The Wheat Berries And Give A Good Stir, Let Set For 5 Minutes, Or Until Kale Softens And Wilts. Drain Wheat Berries And Kale.
3. Onion: In A Small Skillet Or Pan, Heat 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Cook 5 Minutes, Until Softened.
4. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Apple Cider, Dijon Mustard, Olive Oil, Pepper And Salt, Mix Well To Combine.
5. Mix It All Together: In A Large Serving/Mixing Bowl, Combine The Kale, Wheat Berries, Butternut Squash, Onion, Pomegranates, Optional Parsley And Dressing, Toss Well To Combine. Add Extra Salt And Pepper To Taste.
6. Serve Warmed, At Room Temperature Or Chilled. Tastes Great With A Slice Of Freshly Cut Crusty Bread. Enjoy!
7. Notes:
8. If Using Different Wheat Berries, Cook According To Package, And Add An Extra Cup Of Water.
9. Use Farro Or Barley In Place Of The Wheat Berries If You Prefer. Cooking Times Of Farro And Barley My Vary So Adjust And Cook According To Package Directions. You Can Still Add The Kale At The End, Just Be Sure To Put The Lid On For A Few Minutes To Help Stem The Kale.
10. Feel Free To Use Baby Kale Instead. No Need To Cook The Baby Kale. Simply Add It To The Mixing Bowl While Everything And Combine.

title: AUTUMN BUTTERNUT SQUASH QUINOA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup 200 G Dried Quinoa I Used Tricolor
2. 1 34 394 Cups Cup Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder Divided
4. 1 Small Butternut Squash About 2 Lbs 90 Kg Or 6 Cups Peeled Seeded And Diced 12 Inch Cubes
5. 1 Medium Red Onion Diced
6. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
7. 12 Cup 100 G Dried Cranberries
8. 12 Cup 100 G Raw Pecans
9. 2 Handfuls Of Baby Kale About 3 Ounces
10. 14 Cup 56 Cups Orange Juice
11. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
12. Mineral Salt  Fresh Ground Pepper To Taste
13. A Handful Of Pomegranates When In Season Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. (204 C). Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper, A Silpat Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Quinoa: In A Medium Pot, Bring The Quinoa, Water And 1/2 Teaspoon Garlic Powder To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer Over A Gentle Boil For 15 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Uncover And Let Rest 10 – 15 Minutes, Fluff With Fork.
3. Roasted Butternut Squash: Place The Butternut Squash And Onion The Prepared Sheet Pan, Drizzle With Oil, Using Your Hands Or Utensils, Toss To Coat. Spread Across Sheet Pan In A Single Layer, Sprinkle With Remaining 1/2 Teaspoon Garlic Powder And Mineral Salt. Place On Rack In Center Of The Oven And Roast For 20 – 30 Minutes, Stirring Once Or Twice. Will Be Done When Butternut Squash Is Just Fork Tender, Not Mushy.
4. When Done, Remove From Oven And Sprinkle Dried Cranberries Overtop, Let Cool A Few Minutes. Cranberries Will Soften And Warm.
5. Toast Pecans:Heat A Small Pan Over Medium-Low, Add Pecans And Stir Often Until Fragrant For 2 – 3 Minutes, Careful Not To Let Them Burn. This Step Is Optional, Pecans Are Great Un-Toasted Too.
6. Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Orange Juice And Cinnamon.
7. Assemble: In A Large Mixing/Serving Bowl, Add The Quinoa, Butternut Squash Mixture, Kale, Pecans, And Drizzle With The Dressing, Toss To Combine. Season With Salt And Pepper.
8. Serve: Serve Warm, At Room Temperature Or Chilled. When In Season, It Pairs Great With Pomegranate Seeds!
9. Store: Keep Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: VEGAN BAKED ZITI
ingredients:
1. 16 Oz Pasta Ziti Penne Or Rigatoni
2. Parsley To Serve
3. Tomato Sauce
4. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
5. 2 Cans 28Oz San Marzano Whole Tomatoes With Juices
6. 1 Small Onion Diced
7. 2  3 Cloves Garlic Minced
8. 34 Teaspoon Each Dried Thyme  Oregano Sub With 1 12 Tsp Italian Seasoning
9. Salt  Pepper To Taste
10. Cashew Ricotta Cheese
11. 1 Cup Raw Cashews
12. 34 Cup Water
13. Juice Of 1 Small Lemon Or 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
14. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
15. 14 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder
preparation:
1. Cashew Ricotta: Soak The Cashews In Warm Water For 5 – 10 Minutes, Drain. In A Blender Cup, Place The Cashews, Water, Lemon Juice, Garlic & Onion Powder And Salt, Blend Until Creamy Smooth. Set Aside.
2. Pasta: Cook The Pasta According To Package Directions.
3. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
4. Tomato Sauce: In A Medium Pot, Heat The Oil/Water Over Medium Heat And Saute The Onion For 5 Minutes, Add Garlic And Cook 1 Minute More. Add The Tomatoes, Thyme, Oregano, Salt And Pepper, Continue Cooking Over Medium Heat For 7 – 10 Minutes, Breaking Up The Tomatoes As You Cook. Taste For Flavor.
5. Assemble: In A Casserole Or Medium-Large Baking Dish, Combine The Sauce And Pasta Together, Mixing Well To Incorporate The Bits Of Tomato Throughout. Top With Vegan Ricotta And Cover.
6. Bake: Place On The Center Rake And Bake For 30 Minutes, Removing The Cover After 20 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes, Top With Chopped Parsley Or Basil.
7. Serve In Individual Bowls With A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.
8. Store: Leftovers Will Keep In The Refrigerator, Covered, For Up To 4 – 5 Days.To Store Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Homemade Tahini
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Hulled Sesame Seeds 1 Lb I Used Bobs Red Mill
2. Optional Ingredients
3. Generous Pinch Of Salt Or To Taste
4. 1 12  2 Tablespoons Oil Sesame Light Olive Oil Avocado Canola Etc See Notes
5. 12  1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
preparation:
1. First, You May Want To Toast Your Seeds To Bring Out The Most Flavor, But This Is Optional. You Want Your Seeds To Become Fragrant And Slightly Darker During The Process.
2. Toast Your Seeds One Of Two Ways:
3. Preheat Oven To 350. Place Seeds On A Roasting Pan Or Rimmed Cookie Sheet And Roast For About 10 – 15 Minutes Making Sure To Move Them Around Every Few Minutes So The Seeds On The Bottom Don’T Burn.
4. Or
5. Dry Roast Over Medium-Low Heat In A Skillet Using One Cup At A Time (Add More Or Less Depending On Your Skillet). Be Sure To Move The Seeds Around Frequently To Ensure That They Don’T Burn.
6. Process The Sesame Seeds: Once You Have Toasted Your Seeds And They Have Cooled A Bit, Place Them In Your Food Processor Or High-Speed Blender (Add Optional Salt/Garlic Powder), And Process Until Creamy, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides A Few Times. The Process Will Take Approximately 5 – 10 Minutes To Blend Depending On Your Equipment.
7. Makes About 1 1/2 Cups.
8. Store: Keep In The Pantry For 1 Month (Maybe More), In An Airtight Container. For Maximum Freshness, Store It In The Fridge For Up To 6 Months.

title: SPICY RED LENTIL DAL
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Red Lentils If Using Greenbrown See Notes
2. 4 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
3. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
4. 2 Medium Yellow Onions Diced
5. 2  3 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 1 12 Inch Knob Ginger About 2 Tablespoons Minced
7. 4 Medium Tomatoes Diced Or 1 Can 14Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
8. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Each Cumin Coriander  Turmeric
9. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon
10. 14  12 Teaspoon Cayenne Pepper
11. Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Saute: In Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Saute Until Onions Are Translucent, About 5 – 7 Minutes. Add Tomatoes, Garlic And Ginger, And Cook 5 Minutes, Or Until Tomatoes Start To Break Down.
2. Simmer: Add The Lentils, Liquids, And Dry Spices, Bring To Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer At A Gentle Rolling Boil For 15 – 20 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Until Lentils Are Tender, Not Mushy. Dal Will Thicken Upon Standing, Add More Liquids As Needed.
3. Serve: Ladle Into Individual Serving Bowls As Is. Or Serve Over A Bed Of Arugula, White Rice, Brown Rice, Or This Cilantro Lime Rice. Top With A Squeeze Of Lemon For Brightness. It Pairs Great With A Side Of Homemade Vegan Naan.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: HEMP HEART ENERGY BITES (NO BAKE)
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Oats Rolled Or Quick I Used Gf
2. 12 Cup Hemp Hearts
3. 6 Medjool Dates Pitted And Chopped
4. 3 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
5. 12 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
6. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
7. Pinch Of Salt Optional
preparation:
1. Mix: Place All Ingredients In Food Processor, Blend Until Combined. Add 1 Tablespoon Water At Time If Needed To Help The Mixture Clump Up. I Used About 1 Tablespoon, Use At Your Discretion.
2. Don’T Worry If The Dough Seems A Little Too Sticky, As It Will Become A Bit Stiffer Once Refrigerated. And If It’S A Little Sticky It Will Help When You Roll The Balls In A Coating. If The Mixture Is Too Wet, Try Adding A Pinch Or Two Of Oats. The Dryer They Are The More They Will Be A Stiffer, But Chewy Cookie. The Moister They Are, They Will Be More Like Cookie Dough. Both Ways Are Good. :)
3. Scoop + Roll: Next, Roll The Dough Into One Inch Balls. If Dough Seems Too Sticky To Roll, Refrigerate The Dough For About 20 Minutes Before Rolling.
4. Finishing Touch: You Can Roll The Energy Bites In A Variety Of Ingredients For A Nice Finishing Touch. I Rolled Some In Hemp Seeds, Coconut, Cinnamon And Cacao Powder. I Wanted To Experiment With Different Coatings. If Rolling In Powders Be Sure To Gently Lift And Drop Your Coated Balls A Few Times An Inch Or Two Above A Hard Surface To Let Any Excess Powder Fall Off.
5. Makes 12 Energy Bites
6. Store: Keep In The Refrigerator And Eat Within 1 – 2 Weeks. For Longer Storage, They Can Be Kept In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Stuffed Avocados
ingredients:
1. 3 Avocados Sliced In Half And Seed Removed
2. 1 Lemon Juice Of
3. 13 Cucumber Diced
4. 1 Bell Pepper Any Color Cored And Diced
5. 1 Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced
6. 14 Red Onion Or 1 Small Shallot Diced
7. 1 Garlic Clove Minced Or 18  14 Teaspoon Garlic Powder Optional
8. Small Handful Grape Tomatoes Diced Optional
9. 2  4 Tablespoons Hummus Vegan Mayo Or Garlic Aioli
10. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Prepare The Ingredients. Once You’Ve Sliced The Avocados And Removed The Seeds, Squeeze Or Rub A Little Lemon Juice On The Flesh To Keep The Browning At Bay.
2. Place The Cucumber, Bell Pepper, Jalapeno, Onion, And Optional Garlic And Diced Tomatoes In A Small/Medium Mixing Bowl, Add Just Enough Of The Hummus Or Vegan Mayo To Bind.
3. Fill Avocados And Top With Salt, Pepper And Squeeze Of Lemon. Adding A Little Chopped Parsley Will Add Even More Color!

title: PERSIMMON RICOTTA SCONES
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour Spelt Allpurpose Whole Wheat 11 Gf Flour Blend
2. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Aluminum Free Baking Powder
3. 14 Cup Organic Pure Cane Sugar
4. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon
5. 14 Teaspoon Ground Ginger
6. 14 Teaspoon Nutmeg Or Allspice Or Cardamom
7. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
8. 6 Tablespoons Vegan Butter Or Coconut Oil Chilled
9. 1 Heaping Cup Fuyu Persimmons About Two Medium Finely Chopped
10. 34 Cup Vegan Ricotta Cashew Ricotta Cheese Or Tofu Ricotta
11. 12 Cup Almond Milk
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper.
2. Mix Dry Ingredients: In A Medium Size Bowl, Mix The Flour, Baking Powder, Sugar, Salt And Spices, Blend Well.
3. Cut In Butter: Add The Butter Or Oil, And Using Either A Pastry Blender Or Back Of A Fork, Mix Well. There Should Be Little Clumps Of Butter Or Oil, It Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect.
4. Mix In Wet Ingredients: Add The Ricotta And Almond Milk To The Mixture And Stir Until Just Mixed.
5. Add Persimmon:Toss In The Persimmons And Finish Mixing.
6. Shape And Cut Dough: Turn The Dough Out Onto A Flat Surface Sprinkled Lightly With Flour, Shape Into A Ball And Flatten Into A Round Circle About 7 – 8 Inches In Width And 1 Inch In Height. It’S Ok To Have Lumps And Bumps, Giving A Rustic Look.Using A Knife, Divide The Dough Into 6 – 8 Pieces.
7. Bake: Place The Scones On The Prepared Baking Sheet. I Like To Add A Sprinkle Of Sugar Over Top. Bake For About 18 – 22 Minutes Until Lightly Golden At The Edges. Let Cool A Bit Before Transferring To A Cooling Rack.
8. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored Loosely Covered And Eaten Within A Couple Of Days, But They Are Best Eaten Right Away.

title: VEGAN SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Raw Cashews Pref Soaked
2. 2  4 Tablespoon Nutritional Yeast Or 1 Tablespoon Mellow Miso
3. 1 12 Teaspoons Garlic Powder Or 2  3 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 1 12 Teaspoons Onion Powder
5. 1 Teaspoon Mineral Salt Plus More As Needed
6. Salt  Pepper To Taste
7. Juice Of 1 Small Lemon Or 1  2 Teaspoons Apple Cider Vinegar
8. 1 12 Cups Unsweetened Plain Almond Milk Or Your Favorite Or Water
9. 10  14 Oz Spinach Frozen Or Fresh See Notes
10. 1 Can 14Oz Artichoke Hearts In Brine Drained And Finely Chopped
11. To Serve
12. Sliced Baguette
13. Pita Chips
14. Crackers
15. Veggie Sticks
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Soak Cashews: Soak, Covered With 1 Inch Of Very Hot Water For 5 – 10 Minutes To Help Soften Them Up So They Blend Ultra Creamy. If You Have Nut Sensitivities, Soak The Cashews In Cool Water For 2 – 3 Hours To Aid In Digestion.
3. Prep: Dice The Artichoke Hearts And Prep The Spinach.
4. Cashew Cheese: Using Your Favorite Blender, Add The Soaked Cashews, Nutritional Yeast, Garlic Powder, Lemon Juice, Salt And Pepper, And Liquids To The Bowl And Process Until Nice And Smooth, About 3 Minutes Or So. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Of Anything As Needed.
5. Assemble: In A Small Or Medium Sized Baking Dish, Add The Spinach And Artichoke Hearts, Pour The Cashew Cheese Overtop And Mix To Combine. Wipe Along The Rim Of The Baking Dish Before Baking For Clean Finish If You Like.
6. Bake: Place In The Oven, Covered For 10 Minutes, Remove Cover And Bake Another 10 Minutes. Feel Free To Adjust The Cover At Any Time To Your Preference (For Me, Sometimes I Leave It Covered The Entire Time).
7. Serve: Serve As Is Or Give A Good Stir Before Serving. This Dip Is Great Warm Or At Room Temperature, And Is Delicious Scooped Up With A Sliced Baguette Or Homemade Crusty Bread, Pita Chips, Crackers Or Fresh Vegetable Sticks.
8. Would Be Great With A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan Too!
9. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days, In A Covered Container. Reheat In Preheated Oven Set To 375 Degrees For 10 – 15 Minutes, Or Until Warmed Through.

title: CARROT MISO SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 2  2 12 Lbs Carrots Peeled And Chopped
3. 1 Large Onion Diced
4. 4 Garlic Cloves Minced
5. 1 12 Tablespoons Fresh Ginger Finely Grated
6. 4 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth I Used Veg Paste With Water
7. 14 Cup 4 Tablespoons White Miso Paste
8. 2  4 Oz Organic Silken Tofu Thin Sliced 1 Inch Pieces Optional
9. Cayenne Pepper As Garnish To Taste
10. Scallions Or Chives Thinly Sliced
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Carrots, Saute 5 Minutes, Or Until Translucent, Add Garlic And Ginger, Cook 1 Minute More.
2. Simmer: Add The Liquids, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 20 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Or Until Carrots Are Tender.
3. Puree: Let Soup Cool A Bit. Add Miso To Soup And Puree Using 1 Of 3 S: An Immersion Blender Right In The Pot, A Food Processor Or A Regular Blender. You May Have To Puree The Latter Two S In Batches.
4. Finishing: Add A Bit More Water As Needed. Taste For Seasoning Adding Salt, Especially If You Didn’T Use Veggie Stock You May Like To Add Salt. Add Pepper, More Miso Or Grated Ginger To Taste.
5. Serve: Ladle The Soup Into Serving Bowls, Top With Sliced Tofu, A Sprinkle Of Cayenne For Some Heat And A Nice Bunch Of Chives Or Scallions. Enjoy!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: Spicy Mango Salad Dressing
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Ripe Mango About 2 Cups Cut Into Cubes Or Slices
2. 1 Clove Garlic
3. 14 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar
4. 2 Tablespoons Water Or More Acv
5. 12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or To Taste
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. To The Bottom Of A Blender Cup Or Food Processor Bowl, Add The Mango, Garlic, Apple Cider Vinegar, Water, Red Pepper Flakes, And Salt. Process Until Smooth And Blended, About 1 Minute.
2. Makes About 1 1/4 Cups.
3. Store: Keep Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. Will Also Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months In Freezer Safe Containers. Let Thaw Before Using.
4. Ways To Use: Rainbow Salad, Super Spinach Salad, Or Grilled Tofu Skewers

title: PIZZA PIE + BALSAMIC-TOMATO SAUCE + ROASTED VEGETABLES
ingredients:
1. 1 Ready Made Pizza Dough I Use Trader Joes
2. Fresh Basil Leaves To Serve
3. Red Pepper Flakes To Serve
4. Almond Parmesan To Serve
5. Topping
6. 2 Cups Mushrooms Sliced
7. 12 Medium Zucchini Cut In Half Lengthwise And Sliced
8. 1 Small Orange Bell Pepper Sliced
9. 13 Red Onion Sliced
10. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
11. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
12. Balsamic Tomato Sauce
13. 1 12 Cups Grape Or Cherry Tomatoes
14. 3 Tablespoons Tomato Paste Sundried Tomato Paste Is Great Too
15. 1  2 Tablespoons Balsamic Vinegar
16. 1 Garlic Clove Or 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
17. 1 Teaspoon Italian Seasonings Or A Mix Of Oregano Basil Thyme Etc
18. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 500 Degrees F.
2. Let Dough Rest: Coat An 8 Or 10 Inch Cast Iron Skillet With Olive Oil. Remove Dough From Refrigerator, Open Package And Place Dough In Center Of The Skillet, Cover Skillet With A Clean Dish Towel. Let Set For 30 Minutes.
3. Roast Veggies: Prep The Mushrooms, Zucchini, Bell Pepper And Onion.
