Place On A Rimmed Baking Sheet, Along With The Tomatoes For The Sauce, Drizzle With Olive Oil And Gently Toss To Coat, Keeping The Tomatoes Together. Sprinkle With Salt. Place In The Oven On The Middle Rack For 15 Minutes. Remove And Set Aside.
4. Pre-Bake Dough: Remove Dish Towel For Skillet And Gently Flatten Out Dough, Pushing Up The Edges About 1 – 1/2 Inches. Place In Oven On Middle Rack And Bake For 10 Minutes.
5. Make Sauce: While Dough Is Pre-Cooking, Add The Warm Tomatoes, And Remaining Ingredients For The Balsamic Tomato Sauce To A Food Processor Or Blender And Process Until Blended And Fairly Smooth. Taste For Flavor Adding Anything Extra You Might Like.
6. Bake Pizza: Remove Dough From The Oven, Layer With 1/2 Cup Of The Tomato Sauce And Reserved Roasted Vegetables. Place In Oven And Bake For 15 Minutes, Until Crust Is Golden. Remove From Oven And Let Cool A Few Minutes Before Cutting To Serve.
7. Serve With Red Pepper Flakes And A Good Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.
8. Notes:
9. If Your Crust Doesn’T Become Golden Enough For You, Place The Skillet Pizza Under The Broiler For A Minute Or So Checking Often So It Doesn’T Burn.
10. I Would Love To Recommend A Good Pizza Dough Recipe But I Haven’T Made One Yet And Find The Ready Made Dough Is Quick And Works Great For Me. If You Have A Good Whole Wheat Pizza Dough Recipe I’D Love Know About It!

title: VEGAN CAESAR SALAD
ingredients:
1. 3 Heads Romaine Lettuce Chopped
2. 1 Avocado Sliced Optional
3. Almond Parmesan
4. Chickpea Croutons
5. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
6. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
7. 34 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. Generous Pinch Mineral Salt
9. Caesar Dressing
10. 34 Cup Raw Cashews
11. 12 Cup Water
12. 2 Garlic Cloves
13. 2 Teaspoons Capers
14. 1 Tablespoon Vegan Worcestershire I Use Annies
15. 2 Teaspoons Dijon Mustard
16. Juice Of 1 Medium Lemon Or 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
17. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silpat.
2. Chickpea Croutons: Place Rinsed Chickpeas Between A Clean Dish Cloth, And Gently Rub Them To Dry, Removing Any Of The Loose Skins. Place Chickpeas On A Prepared Baking Sheet, Drizzle With Oil And Toss To Coat, Sprinkle With Garlic Powder And Salt. Arrange Chickpeas In A Single Layer, And Garlic Cloves (From The Dressing), And Bake For 40 – 45 Minutes, Stirring Every 10 Minutes Or So. Remove The Garlic If They Seem To Be Getting Too Baked (Especially If They Are On The Smaller Side). Once Done, Set Aside.
3. Caesar Salad Dressing: Soak The Cashew In Hot Water (Not Boiling) For 5 Minutes, Drain. In A High Speed Or Personal Blender, Add The Cashews, Water, Roasted Garlic Cloves, Capers, Worcestershire, Dijon, Lemon Juice, Salt & Pepper, Blend Until Creamy Smooth. Makes About 1 Cup.
4. Assemble Caesar Salad: Place The Chopped Romaine In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add As Much Or As Little Of The Dressing As You Like, You May Have Some Leftover, And Give A Good Toss. Top With Chickpea Croutons, Avocado, And A Sprinkle Of Almond Parmesan.
5. Store: Leftover Salad And Dressing Will Stay Fresh In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days In Covered Containers.

title: BLACK BEAN TACOS
ingredients:
1. Black Beans
2. 1 Tablespoon Water Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
3. 1 Small Onion Diced
4. 1 Small Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Diced Optioanal
5. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
6. 12 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
7. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. Salt To Taste
9. 2 Cans 15Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
10. 14  12 Cup Water Or Vegetable Broth
11. To Serve
12. Corn Or Flour Tortillas Warmed
13. Romain Or Lettuce Shredded
14. Pico De Gallo Corn Salsa Andor Mango Salsa
15. Avocado Sliced
16. Chopped Cilantro
17. Lime Wedges
18. Vegan Cheese My Favorite Is Miyokos Mozz Crumbled
preparation:
1. Black Beans: In A Medium Pot, Warm Oil Over Medium Heat, Add The Onions And Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Jalapeno, Cumin, Oregano, Garlic Powder And Pinch Of Salt, Cook For 30 Seconds To 1 Minute, Until Nice And Fragrant. Add The Beans, And 1/4 Cup Of Water, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 5 – 8 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Smash At Least 1/2 Of The Beans, Using The Back Of A Slotted Spoon Or Fork. Add The Remaining Water As Needed For Desired Consistency. If You Add Too Much Water, The Beans Will Thicken Upon Standing. Taste For Flavor Adding More Salt As Needed.
2. Warm The Tortillas:I Love To Warm My Tortillas Over A Medium-Low Flame Of The Stovetop Burner, Flipping Them Often Until They Are Lightly Charred Around The Edges.
3. Assemble: Lay The Tortilla On A Flat Surface, Top With 1/4 Cup Of The Beans, Small Handful Of Leafy Greens, Pico De Gallo And/Or Corn Salsa, Sliced Avocado, And Crumbled Cheese (Optional). Add A Sprinkle Of Salt And Squeeze Of Lime Overtop.
4. Makes About 10 Tacos, 2 Tacos Per Serving.
5. Store In The Refrigerator Or Freezer: Keep Leftover Black Beans In The Refrigerator 4 – 5 Days, Stored In Covered Containers. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For 2 – 3 Months In Freezer Safe Containers. Let Thaw Before Reheating.
6. To Reheat: Warm The Beans On The Stove Over Low, Stirring Occasionally, Until Warmed Through. Alternately, Place Them In The Microwave For 30 Second Intervals, Stirring Each Time, Until Warmed.
7. Notes:
8. These Instant Pot Black Beans Made From Scratch Using Dried Beans Would Be Great Too!
9. For Creaminess, Try Adding A Dollop Of Vegan Sour Cream Or Sriracha Cashew Cream.

title: Buckwheat Banana Bread
ingredients:
1. 1 34 Cups 210 G Buckwheat Flour
2. 13 Cup 75 G Sugar Pure Cane Coconut Sugar Or Maple Syrup
3. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Cinnamon
4. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Baking Powder
5. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
6. 4 Large Very Ripe Bananas Mashed About 1 34 410 G
7. 13 Cup 75 Cups Light Flavored Olive Oil Coconut Oil In Liquid Form Or Hazelnut Oil
8. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. In A Medium/Large Mixing Bowl, Combine The Buckwheat Flour, Sugar, Cinnamon, Baking Powder And Salt, Mix Well. Add The Mashed Bananas, Oil And Vanilla, Mix To Combine. Place Batter In A Lightly Greased 9×5 Loaf Pan And Bake On The Middle Rack For 50 Minutes. Remove From Oven, Let Cool About 10 Minutes And Enjoy.
3. Pairs Wonderfully With A Little Homemade Almond Butter!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored Covered On The Counter For Up To 3 Days Or In The Refrigerator For Up To 1 Week. Keep In The Freezer For Up To 3 Months – Place Completely Cooled Loaves In Freezer Containers Or Bags. Thaw The Wrapped Loaves Overnight In The Refrigerator.
5. Makes 8 – 10 Slices

title: EVERYDAY NOURISH BOWL
ingredients:
1. Leafy Greens Of Choice I Used Baby Kale
2. Cooked Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans
3. Carrots Grated Or Sliced
4. Grape Or Cherry Tomatoes Sliced In Half
5. Red Onion Diced Or Green Onion Sliced
6. Cucumbers Sliced
7. 12 Avocado Sliced
8. Big Fat Dollop Of Hummus
9. Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds To Garnish
10. Hemp Hearts To Garnish
11. 1 Lemon Squeezed At Serving
preparation:
1. I’Ll Let You Measure Your Ingredients. I Used About 1/2 Cup Of Chickpeas, 1/2 Avocado And A Small Handful Of Carrots, Tomatoes, Onion And Cucumber For Each Salad. Use However Much You Like Depending On How Big Your Salad Is Going To Be.
2. Place Your Ingredients In Your Serving Bowl, Add A Big Dollop Of Hummus To The Middle, Sprinkle With Seeds And A Big Squeeze Of Lemon. Say Out Loud, Or To Yourself, “I Am Grateful For All That Is”, While Keeping Good Thoughts In Your Mind. Then Dig In And Nourish Yourself Everyday!
3. Notes:
4. Add In Any Vegetables You Prefer….Broccoli Florets, Sliced Zucchini, Radishes, Bell Peppers, Artichokes Hearts, Olives, Etc. In The Cooler Months Try Adding In Roasted Vegetables Like Sweet Potato, Butternut Squash, Broccoli, Carrots, Etc. You Can Also Add In Some Fresh Herbs Like Parsley Or Cilantro If You Have Them On Hand.
5. Sub In Sunflower Seeds And/Or Sesame Seeds For The Pumpkin Seeds And Hemp Hearts.
6. For The Best Chickpea Flavor, Try Making Them Fresh At Home. It’S Really Easy And Nothing Beats The Freshness Of Homemade Chickpeas!
7. Enjoy And Be Grateful!

title: Vegan Jambalaya
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 4 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 3 Large Bell Peppers Green Red  Yellow Seeded And Diced
5. 2 Large Celery Ribs Diced
6. 2 Teaspoons Smoked Paprika
7. 1 Teaspoon Each Dried Thyme  Oregano
8. 14  12 Teaspoon Cayenne Or Red Pepper Flakes
9. 1 Can 14Oz Crushed Tomatoes
10. 1 12 Cups Dry Longgrain Rice
11. 1  2 Bay Leaves
12. 3 12  4 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
13. 1 Can 14Oz Red Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
14. 3  4 Vegan Sausages About 14 Oz Sliced And Cooked Or Extra Can Of Beans
15. 1 Teaspoon Pink Salt Or To Taste
16. Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
17. To Serve
18. Sliced Scallions Green Onions
19. Chopped Parsley
20. Dash Of Hot Sauce Tabasco Franks Or Your Favorite
preparation:
1. Vegan Sausage: If Using Plant-Based Sausage, You’Ll Want To Cook It First. Slice It Into Bite-Size Pieces And Cook In A Skillet With 1 Tablespoon Oil, Over Medium Heat Until Browned, About 3 – 5 Minutes On Each Side. Transfer To A Small Plate Lined With A Paper Napkin To Soak Up Excess Oil.
2. Saute: In A Large Pan, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium-High Heat, Add The Onion, Garlic, Celery, And Bell Peppers, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Smoked Paprika, Thyme, And Oregano, And Saute For 1 Minute More.
3. Simmer: Add The Crushed Tomatoes, Rice, Bay Leaves, And Broth, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover Askew, And Simmer On Low For 20 – 25 Minutes, Stirring Every 7 Minutes Or So To Keep The Rice From Sticking To The Bottom Of The Pan. In The Last 5 Minutes, Add The Beans And/Or Sausage And Continue To Cook Until Warmed Through. Remove Bay Leaves, Season With Salt And Pepper.
4. Serve: Spoon Into Serving Bowls And Top With Garnish Of Choice.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored For Up To 5 Days In The Refrigerator. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating On The Stovetop Or In The Microwave.

title: CRANBERRY APPLESAUCE (INSTANT POT + STOVETOP)
ingredients:
1. 3  4 Lbs Apples Pref A Sweet Variety Fuji Honey Crisp Macintosh Gala Delicious About 6  8 Large Peeled Cored And Chopped See Notes
2. 2 Cups Fresh Or Frozen Cranberries
3. 12 Cup Water Or Appleorange Juice Or Any Combo
4. 1 Lemon Juice Of
5. 1 Large Cinnamon Stick Or 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon
6. Optional Tasty Addins
7. 1 Teaspoon Fresh Grated Ginger Or Ginger Powder
8. Use Apple Cider Vinegar In Place Of Or In Combo With The Waterjuice
preparation:
1. Instant Pot:
2. Place The Quartered Apples, Than Cranberries, Lemon Juice, Apple/Orange Juice Or Water, And Cinnamon Stick In The Insert Of A6 Qt.Instant Pot.
3. Attach Lid, And Make Sure Vent Is In The Sealed Position. Push The Pressure Cooker Button, And Manually Set The Time For 5 Minutes.
4. When Done, Let The Steam Vent On It’S Own, Takes About 6 Minutes. Move The Vent To Open, Careful Not To Burn Yourself As There May Still Be Steam Left. Remove Lid And Let Cool A Bit.
5. Remove The Cinnamon Stick And Mash With A Potato Masher Or Back Of A Slotted Spoon, Until Desired Consistency. Alternately, For A Smooth Applesauce, Once Cooled A Bit, Use An Immersion Blender Or Transfer To A High-Speed Blender Or Food Processor.
6. Stovetop:
7. In A Large Pot, Add The Chopped Apples, Cranberries, Lemon Juice, Apple/Orange Juice Or Water, And Cinnamon Stick, Cook Over Medium Heat, Stirring Frequently, For 15 – 20 Minutes, Or Until The Apples Are Very Soft And/Or Berries Pop.
8. Remove The Cinnamon Stick And Mash With A Potato Masher Or Back Of A Slotted Spoon, Until Desired Consistency. Alternately, For A Smooth Applesauce, Once Cooled A Bit, Use An Immersion Blender/High-Speed Blender Or Food Processor.
9. Slow Cooker:
10. Add The Diced Apples To The Bottom Of The Crockpot, Add The Cranberries, Lemon Juice, Apple/Orange Juice Or Water And Cinnamon Stick.
11. Set The Slow Cooker On High For 4 Hours, Stirring Once Or Twice.
12. Remove The Cinnamon Stick And Mash With A Potato Masher Or Back Of A Slotted Spoon, Until Desired Consistency. Alternately, For A Smooth Applesauce, Once Cooled A Bit, Use An Immersion Blender/High-Speed Blender Or Food Processor.
13. Serve Warm Or Chilled.
14. Storeyour Applesauce In The Refrigerator For Up To 7 Days, Or Freeze In A Freezer Safe Container For Up To 2 Months.
15. Makes 4 – 4 1/2 Cups.
16. Notes:
17. If Applesauce Is Not Sweet Enough After Cooking, Add 1 Tablespoon Of Pure Maple Syrup At A Time, Until Desired Sweetness.
18. Cut The Apples Accordingly:
19. Instant Pot: Quartered Is Fine, You Don’T Really Need To Worry About The Size Since The Pressure Cooker Will Cook Them Well, No Matter What Size They Are.
20. Stovetop: Best To Chop Or Dice, The Smaller The Cubes, The Quicker They Cook.
21. Crock Pot: Chop Or Quartered Will Do Fine, Since They Will Be Cooking For Up To 4 Hours.

title: SUMMER CHERRY-BERRY FRUIT SALAD
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Strawberries Tops Removed And Quartered
2. 1 Cup Cherries Seed Removed And Sliced In Half
3. 1 Cup Raspberries 6 Oz
4. 1 Cup Blueberries 6 Oz
5. 1 Cup Blackberries 6 Oz
6. 2  3 Tablespoons Fresh Mint Minced
7. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon
8. 14 Teaspoon Cardamom
9. 1 Large Juicy Lemon Or 3 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
preparation:
1. In A Small Bowl, Add Lemon Juice And Spices, Mix Well. Set Aside.
2. Place Fruit In A Mixing Bowl, Top With With Mint And Lemon Juice Mixture, Gently Toss To Combine.
3. Serve Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
4. Pairs Great With Non-Dairy Ice Cream Or Yogurt!
5. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator, Will Last 2 – 3 Days.
6. Notes:
7. Use Any Combination Of Berries, Or Change The Amounts Using More Or Less Of Each. This Is Just A Template.
8. The Fruits Were Naturally Sweet On Their Own And Didn’T Need Any Sweetener. If You Find Your Cherries And Berries Are Not Very Sweet, Add 1 – 2 Tablespoons Of Sweetener Of Choice. Add It To The Lemon Juice, Or Drizzle/Sprinkle It Over Top Of The Salad.
9. Use Orange Juice In Place Of Lemon For Variation.
10. Recommended Sweeteners:
11. Pure Maple Syrup
12. Coconut Nector
13. Turbinado (Raw) Sugar
14. Coconut Sugar
15. Date Syrup

title: TOMATILLO SALSA VERDE
ingredients:
1. 2 Lbs Tomatillos Husks Removed Rinsed Well And Quartered
2. 1 Small Red Onion About 1 Cup Diced
3. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 2 Jalapenos Seeds Removed And Diced A Few Seeds Are Ok For Heat
5. 2 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
6. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt  More To Taste
7. 12 Cup Chopped Cilantro I Like A Cilantro  Parsley Combo
preparation:
1. Simmer: In A Medium Pot, Add The Tomatillos, Onion, Garlic, Jalapeno, And Vegetable Broth And Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes.
2. Blend: Let Cool A Few Minutes And Gently Transfer To A Blender. Add The Cilantro And/Or Parsley And Process Until Smooth. Taste For Flavor, Adding More Salt As Needed.
3. Makes About 6 Cups
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. To Freeze, Let Cool Completely And Store In Freezer Safe Containers Leaving 1/2 Inch Of Head Space For Expansion. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator Before Using.

title: BLACK BEAN + QUINOA BURRITOS (VEGAN FREEZER BURRITOS)
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup Dried Quinoa
2. 34 Cup  1 Or 2 Tablespoons Water
3. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
4. 12 Large Red Onion Diced
5. 1 Orange Bell Pepper Seeds Removed And Diced
6. 1 Can 14Oz Diced Tomatoes Drained Or 2 Roma Tomatoes Seeds Removed And Diced
7. 1 Medium Zucchini Diced
8. 2 Cans 14 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
9. 1 Can 14 Oz Corn Drained
10. 14  12 Cup Cilantro Roughly Chopped
11. 2 Teaspoons Cumin
12. 1 Teaspoon Chili Powder
13. 34  1 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Or 2  4 Chipotles In Adobe Sauce
14. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
15. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
16. Mineral Salt To Taste
17. 6  8 Mediucupsarge Tortillas
18. To Serve
19. Sliced Avocado
20. Salsa Of Choice
preparation:
1. Quinoa: In A Small/Medium Pot, Combine The Quinoa And Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 13 Minutes. Remove Lid, Let Set 10 Minutes, Fluff With A Fork. Set Aside.
2. Filling: In A Large Pan Or Pot, Heat Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Saute For 4 Minutes, Add Bell Pepper And Continue To Cook For 2 Minutes. Add The Tomatoes, Zucchini And Corn, Cook Another 3 Minutes Or So (Cook Veggies Until They Are As Soft As You Like, I Prefer Mine To Be A Little Al Dente). Add The Black Beans, Quinoa, Cilantro, Cumin, Chipotle, Garlic & Onion Powder, And Salt, Continue To Cook Until Heated Through.
3. Roll: Place Tortillas On A Flat Surface, Place A Mound Of The Filling In The Center, Leaving Room All The Way Around, Fold In Half, Fold Up Each End, And Roll The Burrito Away From You To Completely Close It.
4. Freeze: I Try To Avoid Foil, So Here I Used Paper Sandwich Bags. Feel Free To Use Foil, Freezer Paper, Saran Wrap, Plastic Freezer Ziploc Bags Or Whatever You’Re Used To Freezing With. If Using The Paper Sandwich Bags, They Should Be Eaten Within A Few Weeks To Avoid Freezer Burn. Most Likely They Won’T Be Around That Long!
5. Reheat: If At Room Temperature, Warm In The Oven/Toaster Oven At 375 Degrees F For 10 Minutes Or So, Or Microwave For 30 Seconds. If Frozen Heat In The Oven At 375 Degrees For 30 Minutes, Or Microwave For 1:30 – 2 Minutes.
6. Serve With Sliced Avocado And Your Favorite Salsa (I Paired Mine With A Hatch Chili Salsa). You May Also Like To Pair It With Any Of These Condiments: Cashew Sour Cream, Cilantro-Lime Cashew Cream, Chipotle Tahini Dressing, Cumin-Lime Tahini Dressing, Pico De Gallo, Or Homemade Guacamole.
7. Enjoy These Flavorful Vegan Freezer Burritos!

title: HEALTHY HOMEMADE GRANOLA RECIPE (OIL-FREE)
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Old Fashioned Oats
2. 1 Cup Raw Almonds Whole Or Slivered
3. 1 Cup Raw Cashews Whole Or Halves  Pieces
4. 1 Cup Coconut Flakes Or Shredded Coconut
5. 14 Cup Flaxseed Meal
6. 12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
7. 1 Tablespoon Vanilla Extract
8. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
9. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Prep: Preheat Oven To 300 Degrees Fahrenheit. Line Large, Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or A Silpat.
2. Combine: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Combine The Oats, Almond, Cashews, Flaxseed Meal, Coconut Flakes, Maple Syrup, Vanilla, Optional Cinnamon And Pinch Of Salt, Mix Well To Combine.
3. Spread: Layer Granola Mixture On The Lined Baking Sheet, Spreading Out To The Edges, In As Evenly Distributed As Possible.
4. Bake: Place Baking Sheet In The Oven, On The Middle Rack, And Cook For 45 Minutes, Stirring The Mixture Well Every 10 Minutes Or So.
5. Let Cool Slightly: Once Done, Remove From Oven And Let Cool. When Granola Has Cooled, It Will Be Perfectly Crunchy And Ready For You To Devour!
6. Store:Keep Leftover Granola In An Air Tight Container For Up To 3 Weeks.
7. Makes 6 Cups, With 12 Servings
8. Ways To Serve Your Granola:
9. It’S Great As A Cereal With Fresh Fruit, Non-Dairy Milk Or Yogurt.
10. Topped On Non-Dairy Ice Cream
11. Add A Small Handful On Top Of Your Favorite Smoothies, Smoothie Bowls And Shakes

title: HEALTHY RAINBOW SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Head Romaine Sliced
2. 1 Small Head Savoy Cabbage Or 12 Head Large Sliced
3. 14 Head Red Cabbage Sliced
4. 1 Red Bell Pepper Sliced
5. 1 Yellow Bell Pepper Sliced
6. 2 Scallions Sliced
7. 12 Cup Cilantro Roughly Chopped
8. To Serve
9. Mango Dressing Use Full Recipe
10. 1 Avocado Sliced
11. Black Sesame Seeds
12. Slivered Almonds
preparation:
1. Salad: Add Romaine And Cabbage To A Large Bowl. Add The Bell Peppers, Scallions, And Cilantro Over The Greens. Toss To Mix.
2. Serve: Serve In Individual Dishes, Top With Diced Avocado And Spicy Mango Dressing. Add A Sprinkle Of Black Sesame Seeds And Slivered Almonds Over Top. If Eating This As A Monster Salad, Simply Enjoy Straight From The Large Bowl.
3. Makes One Very Large Salad Or Four Smaller Salads.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 Days.

title: Vegan Almond Chunky Monkey Ice Cream
ingredients:
1. 3 Frozen Bananas Cut Into Chunks
2. 3 Tablespoons Almond Butter Or Any Nut Butter Of Choice
3. 14 Cup Almonds Cut In Half
4. Dark Chocolate Either In Chips Or Bars Broken Into Pieces
preparation:
1. In A Food Processor (Or Blender), Place Frozen Banana Pieces And Almond Butter, Blend Until A Fairly Smooth Consistency Stopping Every Now And Then To Scrape Down The Sides And Push The Mixture To The Bottom Of The Processor.
2. Serve In Bowls And Top With, Or Incorporate, The Chocolate Pieces And Almonds While Blending, Use As Much As You Like.
3. Enjoy Right Away As A Soft Serve Or Freeze To Harden Like Ice Cream. To Freeze, Store In Sealed Freezer-Safe Containers. It Will Take About 6 Hours To Fully Harden. Will Last For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: KALE, QUINOA & WHITE BEAN SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Waterbroth For Water Saute
2. 1 Onion Diced
3. 2 Large Carrots Diced
4. 2 Large Celery Stalks Chopped Leaves Ok Too
5. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
6. 1 12 Teaspoons Herbes De Provence Or Thyme
7. 12 Teaspoon Lavender Optional
8. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Optional
9. 12 Cup Dried Quinoa
10. 2 Cans 15 Oz White Beans Drained And Rinsed
11. 1 Can 14 Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices Fired Roasted Pref
12. 7  8 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water
13. 1 Package 5 Oz Baby Kale Or 1 Small Bunch
14. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Saute For 5 Minutes, Until Translucent. Add In Garlic, Celery, Carrots And Herbs/Spices, Cook Another 2 Minutes Or So.
2. Simmer: Add In The Quinoa, Beans, Tomatoes, And Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Turn Heat To Low And Simmer For 25 Minutes. Add In Kale And Keep On Low Heat, Stirring Occasionally, Until Kale Wilts (Baby Kale Will Wilt Faster Than A Typical Bunch Of Kale).
3. To Serve: Pair With A Slice Of Crusty Bread And A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan. We Also Love Adding A Squeeze Of Lemon For Brightness.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. To Freeze, Let Cool Completely And Store In Freezer-Safe Containers. Reheat On The Stovetop Or In The Microwave.

title: SOCCA (FARINATA)
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Chickpea Flour Aka Besan Or Garbanzo Bean Flour
2. 1 Cup Lukewarm Water
3. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
4. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
5. Optional Addins For Variation
6. 18  14 Teaspoon Cumin
7. 12 Teaspoon Fresh Rosemary Or Thyme
8. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
9. Small Handful Chopped Basil
10. Fresh Cracked Pepper
11. 18  14 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
12. Sliced Shallots
preparation:
1. Mix And Let Rest: In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Add Flour, Water And Salt. Whisk Until Smooth, Cover And Let Set For At Least 15 Minutes, Up To 12 Hours, Covered, On The Counter Or Overnight In The Fridge.
2. Preheat: Heat Oven To 450 Degrees F. Place A Well Seasoned Skillet On The Middle Rack While Oven Is Heating (We Want It To Get Nice And Hot).
3. Oil Skillet + Pour Batter: Once Oven Is Ready, Carefully Remove Skillet, Add 1 – 2 Tablespoons Oil And Carefully Twirl Skillet So The Oil Coats The Bottom Evenly. Pour The Batter Into The Skillet.
4. Bake: Place Skillet Into The Oven And Back In The Oven For 12 – 15 Minutes, Until Golden On The Edges And Firm Throughout.
5. Optional Broiler: Once Done You May Like To Add A More Golden And Rustic Look, Turn Broiler To High, Place Skillet Under Broiler For About 2 Minutes, Until Top Starts To Golden A Bit.
6. Cool & Remove: Remove From The Oven And Let Cool A Few Minutes. Using A Spatula Gently Push Under And Around The Sides Of The Flatbread. Tip Skillet To Remove Socca Bread Or Carefully Flip Skillet Over To Remove.
7. Serve: Cut Into 4 – 8 Slices Or Pull Apart And Eat. Socca Is Best Eaten Right Away.
8. Store: Socca Can Be Stored On The Counter In An Airtight Container For Up To 3 Days.

title: CREAMY HATCH CHILE DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Raw Cashews Soaked For 2  3 Hours
2. 2 Hatch Chiles Anaheim Or Poblano Ok Too Or 40Z Can Of Diced Green Chile Peppers
3. 2 Garlic Cloves Chopped
4. 12 Teaspoon Cumin
5. Good Pinch Of Salt
6. Juice Of 1 Lime
7. 12  34 Cup Water
8. 14 Cup Cilantro Chopped
preparation:
1. Soak Cashews: Soak Your Cashews In Enough Water To Cover And Have About 2 -3 Inches Of Water Over Top. Cashews Will Swell Up And Need Plenty Of Water To Soak Up. Let Soak For 2 – 3 Hours. Alternately, Do A Quick Soak By Soaking Cashews In Hot Water For 5 Minutes.
2. Broil Chiles: Turn Your Broiler On To Medium Or Medium-High, Place The Hatch Chiles On A Baking Sheet And Set Under The Broiler. Times Will Vary Depending On Your Oven So Pay Attention And Check On Them Every Few Minutes. You Will Hear Them Blister And Crackle Every Now And Then. Turn Every Few Minutes To Char Evenly On All Sides. Chiles Will Be Ready When Charred And Softened. Mine Took About 7 – 10 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes.
3. Peel + Slice: Remove The Charred Skin, Make A Slit Lengthwise, Core And Remove The Seeds (Some Seeds Ok).
4. Puree: Place The Cashews, Chiles, Cumin, Garlic, Cilantro, Salt, Lime Juice And Water (Starting With The Least Amount) In A Blender/Food Processor. Blend Until Creamy Scraping Down The Sides Every Now And Then. Taste For Flavor And Add More Water As Needed To Create Desired Consistency.
5. Makes About 2 Cups.
6. Store: Leftover Dressing Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 – Days. Dressing Will Thicken Upon Chilling, Thin With Water If Needed.

title: CURRY SWEET POTATO + RED LENTIL SOUP
ingredients:
1. 2 Teaspoons Curry Powder
2. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
3. 2 Onions Diced
4. 1 Green Apple Peeled Cored And Diced
5. 3 Garlic Cloves Minced
6. 13 Cup Cilantro Roughly Chopped
7. 1 Inch Piece Fresh Ginger Minced
8. 2 Large Sweet Potatoes Cubed
9. 1 Cup Dried Red Lentils
10. 5 Cups Vegetable Both Water Or Combo
11. 1 Can  14Oz Coconut Milk Light Fullfat Or Cream Or 1 12 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
12. Juice Of 1 Lime
13. To Serve Optional
14. Choppped Cilantro
15. Red Pepper Flakes
16. Coconut Cream
17. Lime Slices
preparation:
1. Toast The Curry: Heat A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot (At Least A 5 Quarts) Over Medium Heat, Add The Curry Powder And Toast For About 2 Mins. The Color Will Darken Slightly And Become Fragrant. Add The Olive Oil, And Give A Good Stir, Letting The Spices Sizzle.
2. Saute: Next, Add The Onions, Apple, Garlic, Cilantro And Ginger, Gently Saute For 5 Mins, Stirring Occasionally (Things Are Really Starting To Smell Good Now!).
3. Simmer: Add The Sweet Potatoes, Lentils, Broth And Milk, Bring To A Gentle Boil, Cover And Reduce Heat To Low And Let Simmer For 20 Minutes, Sweet Potatoes Should Be Fork-Tender And Lentils Soft.
4. Puree: Once Done, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Blend Until Smooth Using An Immersion Blender. Stir In The Lime Juice (Start With 1/2 Lime), Check For Flavor, Adding The Remaining 1/2 Lime Juice, Salt & Pepper To Taste.Add A Tad More Milk/Water If You Prefer A Thinner Soup.
5. Serve With Chopped Cilantro, Red Pepper Flakes, And A Drizzle Of Coconut Cream. For Extra Brightness, Add A Squeeze Of Lime Over Top.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days In An Airtight Container. It’S Also Freezer Friendly And Can Be Stored In The Freezer For Up To 3 Months. Defrost The Soup In The Refrigerator Overnight And Reheat On The Stovetop Over Medium Heat Until Warmed Through.

title: CHOCOLATE PEANUT BUTTER NO-BAKE COOKIES
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup Peanut Butter Almond Butter Works Too
2. 13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
3. 14 Cup Almond Milk
4. 14 Cup Coconut Oil
5. 3 Tablespoons Cacao Cocoa Or Dutch Cocao
6. 1  2 Teaspoons Vanilla
7. 2 Cups Old Fashioned Oats Quick Oats Is Fine Too
preparation:
1. Warm Mixture: Start By Warming The Peanut Butter, Coconut Oil, Maple Syrup, Almond Milk, Vanilla And Cacao Powder Over Low Heat, Stirring Constantly Until Warm And Starting To Thicken.
2. Remove From Heat And Stir In The Oats And Mix Well To Coat.
3. Drop 2 Rounded Tablespoonfuls Of The Mixture On A Cookie Sheet Lined With Parchment Paper Or Silpat. Shape Them Nicely And Flatten The Tops A Little If You Like, Or Simply Leave Them In Rustic Looking Mounds Of Chocolatey Goodness.
4. Place The Cookie Sheet In The Refrigerator To Chill. You Can Grab One After 30 Minutes, But They Set Up Best After 6 Hours In The Fridge.
5. Recipe Yields About 20 – 24 No Bake Cookies.
6. Store The Cookies In An Airtight Container For Up To 2 Weeks, Or Freeze For Up To 2 Months.
7. Notes:
8. *Substitute Maple Syrup With Coconut Sugar Or Pure Cane Sugar. Just Add 2 Extra Tablespoons Of Almond Milk.
9. Recommended Equipment: For Scooping, I Used This 1.5 Tablespoon Trigger Scooper To Create Uniform Looking Cookies. A 2 Tablespoon Scoop Will Do Fine Too. For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools,Shop My Kitchen Essentials.

title: ONE POT VEGAN CHILI MAC
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Large Onion Diced Any Color
3. 4 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1  2 Peppers Bell Or Poblano Seeds Removed And Diced
5. 1 Package 8Oz Tempeh Crumbled
6. 1  2 Tablespoons Chili Powder
7. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
8. 1 Teaspoon Oregano
9. 1 Teaspoon Paprika Smoked Or Regular
10. 1 Can 15Oz Red Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
11. 1 Can 15Oz Sweet Corn Drained Or 1 12 Cups Fresh Or Frozen
12. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes Fire Roasted Pref
13. 4 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water
14. 1 Bottle Dark Beer Modelo Negra Or 1 12 Cups Water
15. 12 Oz Elbow Pasta Or Other Small Pasta About 2 12 Cups
16. Salt And Pepper To Taste
17. Optional Garnish
18. Shredded Vegan Cheese
19. Sliced Green Onions
20. Vegan Cashew Sour Cream
21. Fresh Chopped Cilantro
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat The Oil/Water Over Medium Heat, Saute The Onion, Garlic, Peppers And Tempeh For 5 Minutes. Add The Chili Powder, Cumin, Paprika, Oregano And Salt, Cook 1 Minute, Or Until Nice And Fragrant.
2. Boil And Simmer: Add The Tomatoes, Pasta, Beans, Corn, And Pour The Liquids Over Top, Give A Good Stir. Bring To A Boil, Cover Askew, Reduce Heat And Simmer At A Gentle Rolling Boil For 10 Minutes, Or Until Pasta Is Tender. Season With Salt And Pepper. Add A Bit Of Cayenne Powder For Extra Heat If You Like.
3. Serve Warm With Optional Toppings.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days In An Airtight Container. It’S Also Freezer Friendly And Can Be Stored In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Healthy Oatmeal Recipe (Vegan)
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Oats Old Fashioned Or Quick
2. 3 12 Cups Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Optional
4. Pinch Of Salt
5. To Serve
6. 2  4 Tablespoon Unsweetened Almond Milk Coconut Milk Or Vegan Cream
7. 1  2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
8. 14 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
9. 18 Teaspoon Cardamom Optional
10. Small Handful Mixed Nuts
11. Small Handful Dried Or Fresh Fruit
12. Healthy Variations
13. Strawberries And Cream Top With Fresh Sliced Strawberries Coconut Cream Or Vegan Cream Pure Maple Syrup And Sprinkle Of Cardamom Its So Simple Yet Utterly Decadent
14. Blueberry Pecan  Applesauce Top With Fresh Blueberries Pecans Unsweetened Applesauce Drizzle Of Pure Maple Syrup And Coconut Cream Or Almond Milk
15. Peanut Butter Banana  Chocolate Chips For A Healthy Protein Rich Oatmeal Serve With 2  3 Tablespoons Of Almond Butter Over Top With Sliced Banana Sprinkle Of Chocolate Chips Or Cacao Nibs Drizzle Of Maple Syrup And Coconut Cream Or Almond Milk
16. Berries And Cream Top Oatmeal With Raspberries Blackberries And Blueberries With A Sprinkle Of Cardamom Or Cinnamon And Drizzle With Coconut Cream Or Plant Milk And Maple Syrup
17. Peanut Butter  Jelly Another Protein Rich Oatmeal With 2  3 Tablespoons Of Your Favorite Almond Butter And Berry Chia Jam With A Drizzle Of Pure Maple Syrup And Coconut Cream Or Plant Milk
18. Cherry Chocolate  Coconut Serve With Dried Cherries Mini Chocolate Chips Or Cacao Nibs Toasted Or Shredded Coconut And Drizzle Of Maple Syrup And Coconut Cream
preparation:
1. Instant Pot: Combine 2 Cups Of Oats With 3 1/2 Cups Of Water (Or Double The Amounts) In The Instant Pot Insert. Attach Lid, Turn To Lock, And Set Valve To Sealing. Manually Set To Cook For 1 Minute On High Pressure, And Let The Pressure Natural Release For 5 Minutes. Total Time, Including Coming To Pressure, Is About 17 – 20 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes. Stir In 1/2 Cup Of Unsweetened Plant Milk, If Needed To Thin.
2. Stovetop: Bring 3 1/2 Cups Water To A Boil In A Saucepan, Add 2 Cups Oats, Stir Well, Reduce Heat And Cook Over A Gentle Boil For 5 – 7 Minutes. Remove From Heat And Let Stand For 2 To 3 Minutes. Stir In 1/2 Cup Of Unsweetened Plant Milk, If Needed To Thin.
3. Slow Cooker: Combine 2 Cups Of Oats And 3 1/2 Cups Of Water In A Slow Cooker. Cook On Low For 8 Hours, Without Stirring. Let Cool A Few Minutes, Stir In 1/2 Cup Of Plant Milk As Needed To Thin.
4. Microwave: Add Water And Oats To A Microwave Safe Bowl, And Microwave On High For 5 – 7 Minutes (Maybe A Little Longer If The Water Is Cold), Stopping To Stir Every 45 – 60 Seconds. To Prevent The Oatmeal From Boiling Over, Be Sure To Use A Larger, Wider Bowl. Let Cool A Few Minutes, Stir In 1/2 Cup Of Plant Milk As Needed To Thin.
5. Serve: Place Oatmeal In Your Serving Bowl, Top With Any One Of The Combinations Above Or Make Your Creation, And Enjoy!
6. Store: Leftover Oatmeal Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6 Days And Make For Great Grab-N-Go Meals. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator Before Reheating.

title: CINNAMON APPLESAUCE PANCAKES
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Flour Light Spelt Or Unbleached Allpurpose
2. 2 Tablespoons Sugar Coconut Or Organic Pure Cane
3. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 34 Teaspoon Cinnamon
5. Pinch Of Nutmeg
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
7. 1 14 Cups Unsweetened Almond Milk
8. 12 Cup Unsweetened Applesauce
9. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
10. 1 Tablespoon Coconut Oil Divided For Greasing
11. 1 Apple Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat: Heat Griddle As Per Instruction : Or If Using A Large Skillet Heat Over Medium To Medium-High Heat. Meanwhile, Preheat Oven To 200 Degrees F, And Place A Baking Sheet On The Middle Rack While Oven Is Heating.
2. Prepare: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Cinnamon, Nutmeg And Salt, Mix Well. Next, Add In The Applesauce, Non-Dairy Milk And Vanilla Extract, Mix Until Just Combined, Do Not Over Mix. Your Mixture May Seem To Swell Up A Bit Due To The Baking Powder, This Is Normal.
3. Clean And Quarter An Apple, Remove The Core. Cut Into Thin Slices About 1/8 – 1/4 Inch.
4. Cook: Place 1 Teaspoon Of Oil On The Griddle/Skillet And Spread Evenly Over The Cooking Area (I Use A Silicone Brush). Place 2 Apple Slices On Griddle, Side By Side, Where Pancake Batter Is Going To Cook. Using A 1/4 Cup Measuring Cup, Scoop Batter And Place On Top Of Apple Slices. Cook Until Bubbles Form On The Top And Edges Start To Look Leathery, About 2 1/2 – 3 Minutes Per Side. Flip Pancakes, Cook Another 2 – 3 Minutes. Repeat Until Batter Is Gone.
5. Keep Warm: As Pancakes Finish, Place Them In The Oven On The Warm Cookie Sheet To Keep Warm Until All Pancakes Are Ready.
6. Serve With Pure Maple Syrup. A Few Fresh Apple Slices Would Also Be Great To Serve.
7. Makes About 8 Pancakes. Store Leftover Pancakes In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To A Week, Or Freeze For Up To 2 Months. Reheat In The Oven At 350 Degrees For 10 Minutes. Alternatively, Warm In The Microwave For 1 – 2 Minutes.

title: RAW ZUCCHINI WRAPS + KALE PESTO
ingredients:
1. 2 Zucchini Thinly Sliced Lengthwise
2. 1 Red Bell Pepper Cut Into Thin Strips Or Julienned
3. 1 Yellow Bell Pepper Cut Into Thin Strips Or Julienned
4. Handful Carrots Julienned I Used Baby Carrots Cut Into Quarters
5. Sproutsmicro Greens Of Choice
6. Cilantro Optional
7. Fresh Cracked Pepper  Mineral Salt
8. Tooth Picks
9. Small Batch Kale Pesto
10. 2 Cups Kale Packed Or 1 Cup Basil  1 Cup Kale
11. 2 Tablespoons Almonds
12. 1 Clove Garlic
13. 2 Tablespoons Tahini Optional
14. 3 Tablespoons Or So Extra Virgin Olive Oil Use Water For Oilfree
15. Himalayan Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Veggies: Amounts For The Vegetables Will Vary On How Many Your Making, Use Your Best Judgement On How Much You Will Need. 1 Medium Zucchini Will Make About 10 Thin Strips. If You Can’T Find Sprouts Or Micro Greens, Try Using Cilantro Or Fresh Basil Leaves.
2. Kale Pesto: Place Ingredients Into Food Processor And Process Until Desired Consistency. Taste For Seasoning.
3. Assemble: Lay Your Zucchini Flat On A Hard Surface, Layer With The Pesto, Place Sprouts And 1 Of Each Veggie In A Mound On One End. Roll Into A Wrap And Stick With A Toothpick In The Center. Top With Mineral Salt & Cracked Pepper.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 Days. The Zucchini Will Soften A Bit After A Day Or So. For Best Presentation, Serve Right Away Or Within A Few Hours Of Making.

title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Butternut Squash 3Lb Peeled Seeded And Cubed Into 34 Inch Pieces
2. 3 Garlic Cloves Peeled
3. 1 Shallot Or 12 Sweet Onion Peeled And Halved
4. 1 Tablespoon Olive Or Coconut Oil
5. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
6. 4 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silicone Mat.
2. Prep Produce: Prepare Vegetables, Toss With Olive Oil Right On The Roasting Pan Or Rimmed Cookie Sheet (Line With Parchment Paper Or Use A Silpat If You Rather But Tossing With Oil On The Cookie Sheet With Also Grease Your Pan).
3. Roast: Place Baking Sheet In The Oven For 40 Minutes, Stirring Once Or Twice, Cooking Until Squash Is Fork Tender. Remove Any Onion Or Garlic That Seem To Be Over Roasting And Set Aside. Once Done, Remove And Let Cool For 10 To 15 Min.
4. Puree Your Soup One Of Two Ways:
5. Immersion Blender: Place Roasted Vegetables, Liquids And Salt In Large Pot, Use A Hand Held Stick Blender To Blend Until Smooth. Depending On How Much Squash You Actually Used, Add More Liquid As Needed For Desired Consistency. Cook On Medium Low Until Heated Through. Taste For Seasoning.
6. Regular Blender: Place Squash And Shallots In Blender/Food Processor And Blend Until Creamy. In Large Pot Place Blended Mix And Add Water And Salt. Cook On Medium Low Until Heated Through Adding More Liquid As Needed And Taste For Seasoning.
7. Serve As You Like Topped With Seeds, Herbs And Spices Or Leave It Simple As Is.
8. I Topped Mine With Parsley And Red Pepper Flakes For A Little Heat. A Little Coconut Bacon On Top May Be A Nice Variation Too.
9. Pair With A Simple Sandwich Or Make Homemade Artisan Bread Or Vegan Naan Bread.

title: HEARTY LENTIL & MUSHROOM RAGU
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Small Onion Diced
3. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced Or 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 2 Large Carrots Diced
5. 8 Oz Mushrooms Sliced Or Diced
6. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
7. 1 Tablespoon Dried Oregano Or Herbes De Provence
8. 1 12 Cups Lentils Brown Green Or Puy
9. 1 Can 28 Oz Diced Tomatoes See Notes
10. 2 Cups Vegetable Broth
11. 12 Cup Fullbodied Red Wine
12. 3 Tablespoons Tomato Paste
13. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
14. 16 Oz Pasta Of Choice Linguine Fettuccine Pappardelle Rigatoni Etc
15. Chopped Parsley To Serve
preparation:
1. In A Large Dutch Oven/Pot, Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Saute For 5 Minutes. Add Garlic, Carrots, Mushrooms, Red Pepper Flakes And Oregano, Saute For 4 Minutes, Or Until Mushrooms Begin To Soften.
2. Add Lentils, Tomatoes, Vegetable Broth And Wine, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 30 – 40 Minutes, Until Lentils Are Tender. Add More Water/Broth Or Wine As Needed.
3. Cook Pasta According To Package Directions.
4. Serve Ragu Over Pasta. Top With Chopped Parsley And A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days In A Covered Container. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: TERIYAKI TOFU-TEMPEH CASSEROLE
ingredients:
1. 10 Oz Organic Tofu Extrafirm Or Super Firm Cubed
2. 8 Oz Tempeh Cubed
3. 12 Oz Combo Of Snow Peas Baby Carrots And Broccoli Florets Or 1 Bag 12 Oz Stirfry Vegetables Found In The Produce Section
4. 1 Cup Long Grain Rice Or 3 Cups Cooked Rice Of Choice Quinoa Or Cauliflower Rice Would Be Great Too
5. Teriyaki Sauce
6. 34 Cup Tamari Lowsodium Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos
7. 34 Cup Water
8. 12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup Or 13 Cup Cane Sugar Or Coconut Sugar
9. 12 Teaspoon Ground Ginger Or 1 Teaspoon Freshly Grated
10. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder Or 1 Garlic Clove Minced
11. 2 T Cornstarch Or 3 T Tapioca Flour  Equal Amount Of Water
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
2. Prep Tofu-Tempeh: Drain Tofu And Place Between A Clean Folded Dish Towel, Place A Medium Pot On Top For About 10 Minutes To Remove Excess Water. If Using Super Firm Tofu, Skip This Step. Once Done, Cube Into 3/4 – 1 Inch Cubes. Cube The Tempeh As Well.
3. Make Teriyaki Sauce: In A Small Saucepan, Add The Tamari, Water, Maple Syrup/Sugar, Ginger And Garlic, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat And Cook On Low For 1 Minutes. In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Cornstarch/Tapioca Powder With The Water Until Smooth. Add The Mixture To The Teriyaki Sauce And Cook Another Minute, Or Until Sauce Thickens. Remove From Heat, Cover And Set Aside. Taste For Flavor. If You Like Your Teriyaki Sauce On The Sweeter Side, Add An Extra Tablespoon Or Two Of Your Preferred Sweetener.
4. Bake Tofu-Tempeh: In A 9×13 Casserole Or Baking Dish, Add Tofu And Tempeh, Drizzle With 1 Cup Of Teriyaki Sauce And Gently Toss To Coat. Place In Oven On Middle Rack And Bake For 20 – 25 Minutes. Turn Down Oven To 350 Degrees F.
5. Cook Rice: Cook Rice According To Package Directions. I Used Basmati Rice Here Which Only Took 20 Minutes Total To Cook. Rice May Vary In Cooking Time, Some Take As Long As 40 Minutes. If Making A Longer Cooking Rice You May Like To Start It Earlier.
6. Steam Veggies: Steam The Veggies Using A Bamboo Steamer, Microwave Or Whatever Is Your Preferred .
7. Combine Everything: In Dish The Tofu-Tempeh Cooked In, Scoot The Tofu And Tempeh To One Side, Add The Cooked Rice And Steamed Vegetables. Pour Most Of The Remaining Teriyaki Sauce Overtop, Reserving A Little For Serving, Toss To Combine. Enjoy As Is Or Continue To Next Step To Warm Through If Needed.
8. Bake: Place In Preheated Oven Set To 350 Degrees, Uncovered, For About 10 – 15 Minutes To Heat Through As Needed (Feel Free To Skip This Step).
9. Serve: Place In Individual Bowls And Top With A Little Remaining Sauce. Would Also Be Great With A Sprinkle Of Toasted Sesame Seeds Over Top. Enjoy!

title: KALE & MUSHROOM GRATIN
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Small Onion Or Large Shallot Diced
3. 1 Lb 16 Oz Mushrooms Sliced Or Quartered Cremini Or Baby Bellas
4. 1 1B 16 Oz Or 2 Large Bunches Kale Stems Removed And Chopped Or Use Precut For Ease
5. 14 Cup White Wine
6. 1 Cup Vegan Heavy Cream Recipe In Notes
7. 14 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk More As Needed
8. Himalayan Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
9. To Serve
10. Almond Parmesan A Pantry Staple
11. Grain Or Pasta Farro Quinoa Rice Barley Bowtie Couscous Penne
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees.
2. Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Saute For 3 – 4 Minutes, And Mushrooms And Cook Another 5 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally Until Some Of Mushroom Liquid Cooks Away And They Start To Brown.
3. Add The White Wine And Boil For A Couple Minutes. Add Kale, And Continue Cooking Until Soft, About 4 Minutes.
4. Add The Cream And Milk, Let Simmer For Several More Minutes. Turn Off Heat. (If You Have Time, Leave This Mixture To Steep; The Cream And Milk Will Get Wonderfully Mushroomy.) Season With Salt And Pepper.
5. Transfer The Mixture To A Shallow Baking Dish. Place In The Oven And Bake For About 25 Minutes, Or Until Golden And Bubbly. Top With A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.
6. Serve Over A Bed Of Farro, Barley, White Or Brown Rice, Pasta Or Pasta Of Choice. Top With A Tad More Almond Parmesan And Salt & Pepper To Taste. Enjoy With The Rest Of The Wine Or A Nice Glass Of Lemon Water.

title: ROASTED BUTTERNUT SQUASH SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Butternut Squash Peeled Seeds Removed And Cubed 12 Inch
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
3. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
4. 14  13 Cup Dried Cranberries
5. 2  4 Tablespoons Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds
6. 8 Oz Salad Mix Of Choice Baby Greens Gem Arugula Spring Mix Etc
7. Shallot Vinaigrette
8. 2 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
9. 2 Tablespoons Water
10. 2 Tablespoons Shallot Minced
11. 1 Tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar Champagne Or White Wine Vinegar
12. 2 Teaspoons Dijon
13. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F. Line A Roasting Pan With Parchment Paper Or Lightly Grease Your Pan.
2. Roast Squash: Combine Squash With 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil And Maple Syrup (Either Do This In A Medium Sized Bowl Or Right On The Baking Sheet For One Less Dish To Wash). Spread Butternut Squash On Baking Sheet In A Single Layer, Sprinkle With Salt And Pepper To Taste. Cook For 30 Minutes, Stirring Half Way Through, Or Until Squash Is Fork Tender. Remove From Oven And Let Cool A Bit.
3. Dressing: In A Small Bowl Mix Together The Olive Oil, Vinegar And Mustard. Blend Until Mustard Has Emulsified. Add In Water Shallots, Salt & Pepper And Whisk Again Until Combined. Set Aside.
4. Assemble: Fill Your Serving Dish With Salad Of Choice, Add Butternut Squash, Top With Cranberries And Pepitas. Drizzle Your Dressing Over Top And Serve.
5. Makes 3 Generous Serving, Or 6 Smaller Portions.
6. Notes:
7. Feel Free To Use Raisins Or Pomegranates Seeds In Place Of Cranberries.
8. Use Pecans, Walnuts Or Almonds In Place Of The Pumpkin Seeds If You Prefer.
9. Try Adding The Cranberries With The Butternut Squash For The Last 5 Minutes Of Cooking To Warm Them Up A Bit.
10. Feel Free To Warm Your Dressing Just Before Serving, Or Keep Near A Warm Spot By The Stove Until Ready To Serve.
11. To Make An Oil Free Vinaigrette For This Salad, Use 1/4 – 1/3 Cup Apple Juice Or Apple Cider In Place Of The Oil And Water. When Cooking The Butternut Squash, Simply Omit The Oil.
12. Recommended Equipment:I Love Mysilpatortheseparchment Liners For Lining This Rimmed Baking Sheet(Affiliate Links). For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools, Shop My Kitchen Essentials!

title: HEALTHY GREEN MATCHA POPCORN
ingredients:
1. 3 Tablespoons Coconut Oil
2. 12 Cup Popcorn Kernels
3. 2 Tablespoon Matcha
4. 1  2 Tazo Zen Tea Bags Optional Affiliate Link
5. 1 Tablespoons Coconut Sugar Or Organic Pure Cane
preparation:
1. Matcha Seasoning: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Matcha, Sugar, And Tea From The Tea Bags. Set Aside.
2. Stock Pot:
3. In A Large Stock Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium High To High Heat. Once The Oil Has Melted, Add Popcorn Kernels, Swirl The Pot To Coat The Kernels.
4. Cover, Shake Every 10 Seconds Or So To Move The Kernels Around. You Want To Move Them Around So They Don’T Burn On The Bottom. You Should Hear Continual Popping About 3 Minutes In, At This Time You Can Stop Shaking, Listen For The Slow Down Of Popping.
5. Turn Heat Off, Uncover, Add Seasoning, Cover And Carefully Shake The Pot Every Which Way To Coat Your Popcorn. Lift Lid, If You Have A Lot Of Seasoning On The Lid And Sides Of The Pot, Use A Flat Edge Spatula To Scrape It Off And Mix It In.
6. Popcorn Maker:
7. Add Popcorn, Cook As Directed And Move To A Large Bowl.
8. In A Small Bowl, Melt Coconut Oil.
9. Once Popcorn Is Done, Drizzle With Oil And Top With Seasoning, Toss To Coat Well.
10. Serve Warm Or At Room Temperature.
11. Makes About 12 To 14 Cups.
12. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In Airtight Containers For 7 – 14 Days.

title: CLASSIC VEGAN COLESLAW
ingredients:
1. 5  6 Cups Green Cabbage Shredded
2. 2 Cups Red Cabbage Shredded
3. 1 Cup Carrots Shredded Or Julienned
4. Coleslaw Dressing
5. 23 Cup Vegan Mayo
6. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Mustard
7. 2 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
8. 1 Tablespoon Pure Cane Sugar Or Pure Maple Syrup
9. 12  1 Teaspoon Celery Seed Powder Optional
10. Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Dressing:In A Small Bowl, Whisk The Mayo, Apple Cider Vinegar, Mustard, Sugar, Salt, And Pepper.
2. Assemble:Add The Cabbage And Carrots In A Very Large Mixing Bowl, The Larger The Better. Pour The Dressing All Over The Cabbage, And Toss Well To Combine. Finish With Salt & Pepper To Taste.
3. Serve Right Away, Or Let The Coleslaw Rest In The Fridge For At Least 30 Minutes Before Serving.
4. Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator In An Airtight Container For Up To 5 Days, But It’S Best Within 3 Days.

title: CREAMY PUMPKIN SAUCE & ZUCCHINI NOODLES
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 14 Oz 100 Pumpkin Puree
2. 1 12 Cups Unsweetened Cashew Milk
3. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 3 Tablespoons Water For Water Saute
4. 1 Small Shallot Minced
5. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 2 Vegan Sausages Sliced
7. 5 Large Lacinato Kale Leaves Stems Removed And Julienned
8. 34 Teaspoon Dried Thyme Or 12 Teaspoon Fresh Chopped
9. 4 Large Zucchini Spiralized Or Julienned
10. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. In A Medium Size Bowl, Combine The Milk And Pumpkin Puree, Set Aside.
2. In A Large Pan, Heat Oil Over Medium, Add Shallot And Saute For 4 Minutes, Add Garlic, Sausage, Kale And Thyme, Cook Until Kale Softens, Stirring Occasionally, About 3 – 4 Minutes.
3. Turn Heat To Medium-Low, Add The Pumpkin Mixture, And Give A Good Stir. Add In The Zucchini Noodles, Using Tongs, Mix To Coat, Place The Cover Askew And Let Simmer 4 – 5 Minutes, Or Until Zucchini Has Become Al Dente, Stirring Occasionally. If The Sauce Is Bubbling Too Much, Reduce Heat To Low. Taste For Flavor Adding Salt & Pepper To Taste.
4. Pairs Great With A Dusting Of Almond Parmesan And Slice Of Your Favorite Artisan Bread.
5. Notes:
6. Try Using Mushrooms In Place Of The Sausage If You Like. Simply Add The Mushroom With The Shallots And Cook Until Mushrooms Have Just Started To Sweat Down. Continue With The Kale And Thyme, And So On…
7. Spiralized Sweet Potato Would Be Great Here Too!
8. Use Your Favorite Pasta. There’S Enough Sauce For About 12 – 16 Oz. Of Pasta. Cook The Pasta According To Package Directions And Add It In The Recipe In Place Of The Zucchini. Easy Peasy!
9. If You Have Garlic And Powder On Hand, Try Adding A Dash Or Two. It Will Ensure Full Flavor.
10. Recommended Equipment: For Spiralizing Zucchini Noodles I Love Use Thisspiralizer , And For Straight Noodles Use A Hand Held Julienne Tool. For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools, Shop My Kitchen Essentials.

title: HEARTY CHICKPEA NOODLE SOUP (VEGAN)
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Onion Diced
3. 3 Large Carrots Peeled And Diced
4. 3 Ribs Celery Sliced Some Leaves Ok
5. 1 Teaspoon Each Dried Thyme Basil And Oregano
6. 2 Cans Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
7. 12  16 Ounces Rotini Pasta
8. 10  12 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth Or Combo
9. 14 Cup Fresh Chopped Parsley
10. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
11. Lemon Wedges To Serve
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Stock Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onion, Carrots, Celery And Herbs, Cook For 5 – 6 Minutes, Stirring Frequently.
2. Simmer: Add The Chickpeas, Pasta, And Liquids To The Pot, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To A Gentle Simmer, And Cook For 6 – 7 Minutes, Or Until Pasta Is Al Dente.
3. Season: Finally, Stir In The Chopped Parsley, And Season With Salt And Pepper To Taste.
4. Serve: Ladle Into Individual Bowls And Serve With Lemon Wedges For Squeezing. The Lemon Is Highly Recommended And Will Add A Delicious Spark Of Flavor, Trust Me! Add A Little More Fresh Parsley To Garnish.
5. This Soup Is Perfect With Homemade Artisan Bread Or Vegan Naan For Dipping!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. It’S Also Freezer Friendly And Can Be Kept For Up To 2 – 3 Months In The Freezer.

title: GRILLED KIELBASA & VEGETABLE KABOBS
ingredients:
1. 4 Kielbasa Sausages I Used Tofurky Kielbasa Sliced Diagonally About 13 Inch Thick
2. 1 White Or Red Onion Sliced
3. 1 Zucchini Or Yellow Squash Cut Into Moons
4. 1 Large Green Bell Pepper Chopped
5. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper Chopped
6. 3 Tablespoons Olive Oil Bonus Points For Garlic Olive Oil
7. 1 Tablespoon Dijon
8. 14  12 Teaspoon Freshly Cracked Pepper Or Lemon Pepper
preparation:
1. If Using Wooden Skewers, Soak Them In Water For 10 – 30 Minutes.
2. Preheat The Grill Or Grill Pan To Medium High.
3. In A Small Bowl, Combine The Olive Oil, Dijon And Pepper, Mix Well. Set Aside.
4. Skewer The Sausage And Veggies However You Like. I Started With The Kielbasa, Red Pepper, Onion, Green Pepper, Zucchini, And Repeat Until Skewer Is Full.
5. Brush Each Kabob With The Dijon Dressing.
6. Grill Skewers For 10 – 12 Minutes, Turning Once Or Twice, Or Until Vegetables Are Tender. Brush Will Any Remaining Oil Mixture As Needed.
7. Serve With Sides Of Choice. It’S Great With Grilled Corn And Baked Beans, Vegan Potato Salad Or Classic Vegan Coleslaw.
8. Makes 12 Small Kabobs Or 8 Regular Sized.
9. Notes:
10. Add More Dijon Mustard If You Like, 1 – 2 Teaspoons More Is Great. This Peppery Mustard Mixture Is Great Brushed On Corn Before Grilling Too!

title: MOROCCAN PUMPKIN & CHICKPEA STEW
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Coconut Or Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Yellow Onion Diced
3. 4 Cloves Garlic Minced
4. 1 Inch Knob Of Ginger Grated Or Minced
5. 2 Teaspoons Cumin
6. 2 Teaspoons Coriander
7. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon Or 1 Cinnamon Stick
8. Good Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
9. 2 Carrots Diced
10. 2 Small Sweet Potatoes Cubed
11. 1 Small Sugar Pumpkin About 3 4 Cups Cubed Or Butternut Squash
12. 1 Can 28 Oz Stewed Tomatoes
13. 3 Cups Cooked Chickpeas Or 2 Cans 15Oz Drained And Rinsed
14. 3 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water
15. 14 Cup Raisins I Used Golden
16. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
17. Few Large Handfuls Baby Kale Or Spinach Chopped Whole Ok Too
18. Lemon Or Lime Wedges To Serve
19. Cilantro To Garnish
preparation:
1. Pumpkin: Prepare Your Pumpkin By Slicing In Half, Removing Seeds With A Spoon And Slice Halves Into Quarters. Using A Vegetable Peeler, Remove The Hard Skin. Alternatively, Turn Slices On Their Sides And Carefully Sheer The Hard Skin Off From Top To Bottom. Cube Into 1 Inch Pieces.
2. Saute: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Onions And Cook Until Translucent, About 5 Minutes. Add Garlic, Ginger And Spices, Cook Another Minute Or Until Fragrant.
3. Simmer:Add Carrots, Sweet Potatoes, Pumpkin, Tomatoes, Chickpeas, Broth/Water, Good Pinch Of Salt And Raisins, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 30 – 40 Minutes, Or Until Pumpkin Is Fork Tender.
4. Add Spinach: Add In Greens Of Choice And Cook Until Wilted. Taste For Seasoning Adding Salt, Pepper Or Any Other Additional Spices Or Raisins.
5. Serve:In Individual Serving Bowls, Spoon Stew Over A Grain Of Choice – Rice, Quinoa Or Couscous Work Well Here. Top With Cilantro And Squeeze Of Lemon/Lime. Pairs Great With A Piece Of Vegan Naan.
6. Store: Leftovers Are Even Better And Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator.

title: CARROT, SWEET POTATO + CORIANDER SOUP W/ ROASTED TURMERIC CHICKPEAS
ingredients:
1. Roasted Chickpeas
2. 1 Tablespoon Coconut Or Olive Oil
3. 1 Can 14Oz Garbanzo Beans Chickpeas
4. 12 Heaping Teaspoon Turmeric
5. 12 Heaping Teaspoon Cumin
6. Pinch Of Salt
7. Soup
8. 1 Tablespoon Coconut Or Olive Oil
9. 12 Large Yellow Onion Or 1 Small Diced
10. 1 Lb Carrots Peeled And Sliced
11. 1 Large Sweet Potato Peeled And Cubed
12. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Ground Coriander
13. 5 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
14. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
15. 14  12 Cup Cilantro Chopped
preparation:
1. Chickpeas: Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper, A Silpat, Or Light Grease With Coconut Or Olive Oil.
2. Drain And Rinse Chickpeas. Gently Pat Dry, They Don’T Have To Be Completely Dry. In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Place The Chickpeas, Oil, Turmeric, Cumin And Salt, Mix Well To Coat. Place Chickpeas On Baking Sheet In A Single Layer. Place In Oven For 40 – 45 Minutes, Stirring Once. Set Aside To Cool.
3. Soup: In A Large Dutch Oven/Pot, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Onions And Cook For 5 Minutes. Add Carrots, Sweet Potato And Coriander, Cook For 1 Minute Or So, Add Broth/Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 20 Minutes, Or Until Carrots And Potatoes Are Fork Tender. Remove From Heat And Let Cool For 10 Minutes.
4. Puree The Soup Using An Immersion Blender. Alternately, You Can Use Either A Blender Or Food Processor (May Take 2 Batches To Complete). Add Extra Water As Needed To Thin. Reheat On Low Until Warmed Through If Needed.
5. To Serve: Serve Topped With Roasted Chickpeas And Chopped Cilantro. A Small Handful Of Micro-Greens Are Great Too! Pair With Your Favorite Artisan Bread.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: 5-INGREDIENT KIELBASA with PEPPERS & POTATOES
ingredients:
1. 1 Glug Olive Oil About 2  3 Tablespoons
2. 1 Medium Onion White Brown Or Red Thinly Sliced
3. 1 34 Lbs Baby Potatoes Red Or Gold Quartered Or Diced Into 12 Inch Cubes
4. 1 Package 14 Oz Kielbasa Sausage Sliced I Used Tofurkey
5. 2 Bell Peppers 1 Red  1 Green
6. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. In A Large Pan, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat, Add The Onions, Potatoes And Kielbasa, And Cook Uncovered For 20 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
2. Add Bell Peppers And Cook Another 10 – 15 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Just Until Al Dente Or Cook A Little Longer If You Prefer Everything Softer.
3. Remove From Heat, At This Point If Your Potatoes Aren’T Quite Tender Enough For You, Cover With The Lid And Let Steam A Bit. Season With Plenty Of Salt & Pepper.
4. Serve With Grilled Corn On The Cob And A Fresh House Salad. Would Be Great With These Baked Beans, Vegan Potato Salad Or Classic Vegan Coleslaw, Making A Terrific Well-Balanced Lunch Or Dinner!

title: KUNG PAO TOFU
ingredients:
1. 1 Block 14  16Oz Tofu Super Firm Extra Firm Or Firm Organic Pref
2. 5 Tablespoons Tamari Soy Sauce Or Coconut Aminos Divided
3. 1 Tablespoons  2 Teaspoons Dark Sesame Oil Toasted Divided
4. 2 Tablespoons Regular Oil Sesame Or Olive Oil Divided
5. 12 Teaspoon Fresh Cracked Black Pepper
6. 14 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or To Taste
7. 3 Tablespoons Water
8. 3 Tablespoons Rice Wine Vinegar
9. 3 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
10. 10  12 Dried Red Chilies See Notes
11. 1 Small White Onion Diced 34 Inch
12. 2 Bell Peppers Red And Green Cored And Diced 34Inch
13. 1 Zucchini Quartered And Diced
14. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
15. 1 12 Inch Knob Ginger Minced
16. 2 Teaspoons Organic Cornstarch Or Arrowroot Or Tapioca Powder
17. 14 Cup Roasted Peanuts Unsalted
18. 1 Green Onion Thinly Sliced
preparation:
1. Prep The Tofu: Place The Block Of Tofu Between A Clean Dish Towel, Gently Press Down On Top And Along The Edges So The Towel Absorbs The Moisture. Cut The Tofu Into 3/4 Inch Cubes.
2. Marinate The Tofu: Add 2 Tablespoons Tamari, 2 Teaspoons Dark Sesame Oil, Black Pepper And Red Pepper Flakes To A Medium-Sized Bowl, Add Tofu And Gently Fold Together Until Tofu Is Coated. Let Tofu Marinate While Preparing The Other Ingredients.
3. Stir-Fry Sauce: To Make The Sauce, Whisk Together 3 Tablespoons Water, 3 Tablespoons Soy Sauce, 3 Tablespoons Rice Vinegar, 3 Tablespoons Maple Syrup, And 1 Tablespoon Dark Sesame Oil In A Small-Medium Bowl.
4. Brown Tofu: Heat 1 Tablespoon Regular Oil In A Wok Or Large Saute Pan Over Medium-High Heat. Add Marinated Tofu In A Single Layer In The Pan And Cook Without Moving For 2 – 3 Minutes. Stir The Tofu And Cook For 2 – 3 Minutes, Stir Once Again And Cook For 2 Minutes. Transfer Tofu To A Plate.
5. Stir-Fry Veggies: Turn Heat Down To Medium And Add 1 Tablespoon Regular Oil. Add Red Chili Peppers, Stir-Fry For 1 Minute. Add The Onion And Stir-Fry 1 Minute. Add Bell Peppers And Stir-Fry For 1 Minute. Add Zucchini, Garlic, Ginger, And Cook For 1 Minute.
6. Add Tofu & Sauce: Add The Tofu Back To The Pan. Add The Sauce To The Pan And Allow To Heat And Bubble, About 1 To 2 Minutes.
7. Add Slurry Mix: Make A Cornstarch Slurry By Mixing Together 2 Teaspoons Cornstarch And 1 Tablespoon Water. Add To The Pan, Stirring To Combine, Continue Stirring Until The Sauce Is Thickened, About 1 Minute.
8. Serve: Serve With Rice Or Quinoa. Garnish Kung Pao Tofu With Peanuts And Sliced Green Onions.
9. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: RED HOT MISO NOODLE BOWL
ingredients:
1. 1 Package 8Oz Bean Thread Noodles Or Noodles Of Choice
2. 4 Small Bok Choy Or 2 Larger
3. 2 Carrots Peeled And Sliced Diagonally
4. 6 Oz Mushrooms Shiitake Cremini Or Your Fav Sliced
5. At Least 4 Strands Of Broccoli Rabe Baby Broccoli
6. Handful Sugar Snap Peas
7. 4 Cups Water Vegan Dashi Or Vegetable Broth
8. 3  4 Tablespoons Miso
9. 4 Oz Cubed Organic Firm Tofu Optional
10. 1 Tablespoon Chili Paste Or Sriracha
11. 1 Teaspoon Grated Ginger Optional
12. To Serve
13. 1  2 Scallions Thinly Sliced
14. Small Bunch Cilantro
15. Toasted Sesame Seeds
preparation:
1. Noodles: Cook Noodles According To Package Directions. Set Aside.
2. Stir-Fry: In Wok Or Dutch Oven, Stir Fry The Mushrooms And Carrots Over Medium-High Heat With 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil Or Water/Veggie Broth For 3- 4 Minutes.
3. Add Remaining Ingredients: Turn Down The Heat To Medium-Low, Add Water, Bok Choy, Carrot, Sugar Snap Peas, Optional Ginger & Tofu, Miso And Chili Paste. Cook Over Low Heat For About 10 – 15 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Or Until Bok Choy Is Tender.
4. Assemble Miso Noodle Bowls: In Each Serving Dish, Place One Serving Of Noodles Along With Veggies And Spicy Miso Broth. Top With Scallions, Toasted Sesame Seeds And Cilantro. Add More Chili Paste Or Sriracha To Taste.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days. Reheat On The Stove Or In The Microwave.

title: VEGAN PUMPKIN MUFFINS
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour Spelt Allpurpose Whole Wheat Or 11 Gf
2. 23  34 Cup Sugar Organic Pure Cane Or Coconut
3. 3 Teaspoons Cinnamon
4. 1 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
6. Pinch Of Salt
7. 1 Can 15Oz 100 Pumpkin Puree Or 1 12 Cups Fresh Pureed
8. 13 Cup Unsweetened Applesauce Or Oil Olive Oil Or Room Temp Coconut Oil
9. 13 Cup Unsweetened Plant Milk
10. 1  2 Teaspoons Vanilla
11. Chopped Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds Optional Topping
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line 12 Cup Muffin Tin With Liners.
2. Mix: In A Medium Mixing Bowl, Mix Together The Flour, Sugar, Baking Soda, Baking Powder, Cinnamon And Salt. Add The Pumpkin Puree, Applesauce, Vanilla And Non-Dairy Milk, Mix Well (Shown Above). Don’T Overmix.
3. Fill Muffin Tin: Add Batter By The Large Spoonful To Lined 12 Cup Muffin Tin, Filling To The Rim (Shown Above). Sprinkle With The Optional Chopped Pepitas.
4. Bake: Place On The Center Rake In The Oven And Bake For 20 – 25 Minutes. To Test For Doneness, Stick A Toothpick In The Center And It Should Come Out Clean. Let Muffins Cool A Few Minutes, Move To Wire Rack.
5. Makes 12 Muffins.
6. Store: Keep Leftovers Muffins On The Counter In A Covered Container For Up To 3 – 4 Days. Keep Longer In The Refrigerator For 6 – 7 Days.
7. To Freeze, Let Muffins Cool Completely, And Keep In Freezer Safe Containers Or Baggies For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator Or On The Counter.

title: CHAI CHOCOLATE POPCORN (STOVETOP)
ingredients:
1. 3 Tablespoons Coconut Oil
2. 12 Cup Popcorn Pref Organic
3. 1 Tablespoon Sugar Coconut Sugar Or Organic Cane Sugar
4. 1 Tablespoon Cocoa Powder
5. 1 12 Teaspoons Cinnamon
6. 1 Teaspoon Cardamom
7. 1 Teaspoon Ground Ginger
8. 12 Teaspoon Clove Or Nutmeg
9. Pinch Of Mineral Salt  Pepper Optional
preparation:
1. Spices: In A Small Bowl, Mix Your Spices. Feel Free To Use Heaping Measurements.
2. Heat Oil: In A Large Stock Pot, Add Coconut Oil, Cover And Heat Over Medium High Heat For About 2 1/2 Minutes.
3. Add Popcorn: Pour Popcorn Into Pot And Cover With Lid, Let Cook For 2 – 3 Minutes, Carefully Shaking The Pot Back And Forth Almost Continuously. Popcorn Will Be Done When You Don’T Hear Kernels Popping For 5 – 10 Seconds.
4. Add Spice: Once Popping Comes To A Minimum, Lift Lid, Add Spices, Cover Tightly, Carefully Lift Pot And Tilt, Round And Round, Upside Down, Every Which Way You Can.
5. Serve: Enjoy Right From The Pot Or Pour Popcorn In A Large Bowl Or Small Individual Bowls.
6. Makes About 12 To 14 Cups
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In Containers Or Ziplock Baggies For 1 – 2 Weeks. Be Sure To Remove As Much As Possible, And Keep Moisture Away, To Keep It From Going Stale Too Soon.

title: CANNELLINI BEAN & FENNEL FLATBREAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Pizza Or Focaccia Dough See Notes For Homemade Dough
2. Olive Oil
3. 12 Cup Kalamata Olives Or Your Favorite
4. 1 Small Lemon Juice Of
5. 1 Fennel Thinly Sliced About 14 Inch Or Smaller
6. 1 Can 15 Oz Cannellini Beans Drained And Rinsed
7. 1 2 Tablespoons Capers
8. 2 Teaspoons Fennel Seeds Thyme Or Herbs De Provence Would Be Great Too
9. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
10. Red Pepper Flakes To Taste Optional
11. Chopped Flat Leaf Parsley To Garnish
12. Almond Parmesan To Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F.
2. Cut The Fennel. Slice The Stalks And Ends Off. Discard Wilted Or Discolored Outer Layers. Slice Down The Center, Lengthwise, Slice Two Halves In Half. Slice Thinly Into 1/4 Inch Strips.
3. Make The Simple Olive Spread. Add The Olives And Lemon Juice To The Cup Of A Blender (I Used A Small Personal Blender), And Blend Until Roughly Combined.
4. Spread Dough On Baking Sheet.Place The Dough On A Well Oiled Baking Sheet, Let Rest For 30 Minutes, Covered. Spread The Dough, Using The Heel Of Your Hand, And Shape Into A Rectangular (Or Any Shape You Prefer).
5. Layer The Ingredients.Spread A Thin Layer Of The Olive Mix On The Dough (You May Have Leftovers). Top With Beans, Fennel, Capers, Fennel Seeds, Red Pepper Flakes, Salt & Pepper.
6. Bake The Flatbread. Bake For 20 – 25 Minutes, Until Edges Are Golden And Bottom Is Crisp.
7. Let Cool A Few Minutes And Slice. Top With Chopped Parsley.
8. Serve With A Light Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.

title: SPICY QUINOA-LENTIL WRAPS + TAHINI SAUCE
ingredients:
1. Lentilquinoa Mix
2. 34 Cup Red Lentils Sorted And Rinsed
3. 12 Cup Quinoa Rinsed
4. 2 12 Cups Water  More As Needed
5. 2 Heaping Teaspoons Cumin
6. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. 1 Teaspoon Onion Powder
8. 12 Teaspoon Pink Salt Or To Taste
9. 1 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Optional
10. 2 Tablespoons Chopped Parsley
11. 1 Green Onion Thinly Sliced
12. Spicy Tahini Sauce
13. 14 Cup Tahini
14. 12 Cup Water  More As Needed
15. Juice Of 12 Lemon Or 1 Tablespoon
16. Pinch Of Pink Salt
17. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
18. 1 Tablespoon Parsley Finely Chopped
19. To Serve
20. Shredded Cabbage Or Micro Greens
21. Lavash Bread Or Corn Tortillas Flour Tortillas Work Too
22. Chili Paste Or Sriracha
23. Sliced Avocado For Tacos Optional
preparation:
1. Lentil-Quinoa Mix: In A Medium Saucepan, Add The Water, Lentils, Quinoa, Cumin, Garlic & Onion Powder, Salt And Red Pepper Flakes, Bring To A Boil, Cover And Simmer For 20 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Add In Chopped Parsley And Scallions, Let Rest For 10 Minutes. If You Feel It’S Too Dry, Add A Couple Tablespoons Of Water. Mixture Should Be Creamy, Not Dry. Add Extra Spices To Taste.
2. Tahini Sauce: In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Tahini, Water, Lemon, Salt, Red Pepper Flakes And Parsley. Set Aside.
3. Assemble Wraps: Lay Lavash Bread On A Flat Surface. Spread A Tablespoon Or So Of Chili Paste, About 1 1/2 Inches From The Edge On The First 1/3 Portion From Top To Bottom, Leaving An Inch On Both Ends. Layer With About 1/2 Cup Lentil & Quinoa Mix And Cabbage, Fold Over And Roll. Slice In Half And Serve With A Drizzle Of Tahini Sauce On Each Bite.
4. For Tacos, Warm Your Tortillas, Layer With Lentil & Quinoa Mix, Micro Greens Or Cabbage, Add Chili Paste And Tahini Dressing To Taste And Sliced Avocado.
5. Serve Warm, Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
6. Store: Wraps Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: MUSHROOM BOURGUIGNON
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided See Notes For Oilfree
2. 2 Pounds Mushrooms Sliced Brown Crimini
3. 1 Cup Pearl Onions Peeled And Ends Trimmed Thawed If Frozen
4. 1 Large Carrot Diced
5. 1 Yellow Onion Diced
6. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Fresh Thyme Leaves Or 12 Teaspoon Dried
7. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
8. 2 Or 3 Cloves Garlic Minced
9. 1 Cup Fullbodied Red Wine
10. 2 Cups Vegetable Broth
11. 2 Tablespoons Tomato Paste
12. 1 12 Tablespoons Flour
13. To Serve
14. Farro I Used Farro Pasta Of Choice Or Roasted Or Mashed Potatoes
preparation:
1. In A Large Dutch Oven Or Heavy Pot, Heat 1 Tablespoon Oil Over Medium-High Heat, Add Mushrooms And Pearl Onions, Sear Until They Begin To Take On A Little Coloring, About 3 To 4 Minutes.
2. Reduce Heat To Medium, Add The Carrots, Onions, Garlic, Thyme, Salt And Pepper, Saute For 5 To 7 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally, Until Onions Are Lightly Browned.
3. Slowly Add The Red Wine To The Pot And Scrap Any Bits That Are Stuck To The Bottom Or Sides. Turn Heat To Medium-High And Reduce Wine By Half.
4. Stir In Tomato Paste And Broth, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 20 Minutes, Or Until Mushrooms Are Very Tender. Let Simmer, Covered Or Cover Askewed, Stirring Occasionally And Enjoy The Wonderful Aroma.
5. In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Remaining Tablespoon Oil, Or Water, With Flour To Make A Paste, Stir Into The Stew. Simmer For 10 Minutes. If The Sauce Is Too Thin, Boil It Down To The Right Consistency. Season To Taste.
6. Serve Spooned Over A Bed Of Farro, Pasta Of Choice, Oven Roasted Red Potatoes Or Mashed Potatoes.

title: HEIRLOOM TOMATO & ENDIVE SALAD + OLIVE BAGNA CAUDA
ingredients:
1. Salad
2. 2 Medium Heirloom Tomatoes Any Color Sliced Into Wedges
3. 12 Cup Grape Heirloom Tomatoes Sliced In Halve
4. 1 Cup Cooked Chickpeas
5. 2 3 Endive Sliced Arugula Would Be Great Too
6. Lemon Wedges To Serve
7. Chopped Parsley To Serve Optional
8. Olive Bagna Cauda
9. 14 Cup Good Olive Oil More As Needed
10. 13  12 Cup Black Olives Andor Capers I Used A Mix Pitted And Minced Or Diced
11. 3 Large Cloves Garlic Minced
12. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes Optional
13. Juice Of 12 Lemon
14. Salt And Freshly Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Prepare Your Salad Ingredients And Set Aside.
2. In A Small Saucepan Over Low Heat, Add The Garlic, Black Olives/Capers And Optional Red Pepper Flakes And Cook, Stirring Often, For About 7 Minutes. The Garlic Should Soften And The Flavors Will Permeate The Oil Nicely. Add In The Lemon Juice And Gently Cook For Another 2-3 Minutes. Taste For Seasoning Adding Salt And Pepper As Needed. Remove From Heat.
3. Arrange Your Salad On Serving Dishes And Spoon The Warm Bagna Cauda Over Top And A Squeeze Of Lemon Juice. Serve With A Slice Of Your Favorite Artisan Bread. Bagna Cauda Is Delicious On Bread!
4. Notes
5. Bagna Cauda Can Also Be Made Raw And Served At Room Temperature. Combine The Bagna Cauda Ingredients In A Small Bowl. Mash The Olives And Capers A Bit To Allow The Juices To Escape, Let The Mixture Sit For An Hour Or Two Before Serving. Serve As A Dip Or Dressing With Raw Vegetables Like Fennel, Zucchini, Tomatoes, Endive, Arugula, Radishes, Carrots, Cauliflower, Celery And Bell Peppers To Name A Few.

title: PUMPKIN GRANOLA (VEGAN + OIL FREE)
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Old Fashioned Oats
2. 1 Cup Pecans
3. 12 Cup Pepitas
4. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon Or Pumpkin Pie Spice
5. 14 Teaspoon Allspice Or Nutmeg
6. 14  12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
7. 23 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
8. 12 Cup 100 Pumpkin Puree
9. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract Optional
preparation:
1. Prep: Preheat The Oven To 300 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silicone Mat.
2. Dry Ingredients: In A Medium Mixing Bowl, Combine The Oats, Pecans, Pepitas And Spices.
3. Wet Ingredients: In A Measuring Cup Or Small Bowl, Mix Together The Pumpkin Puree And Maple Syrup.
4. Mix Wet & Dry: Pour The Wet Mixture Into The Dry Ingredients, Mix Well To Combine.
5. Layer: Spread The Granola On Rimmed Baking Sheet In A Single Layer.
6. Bake: Place In The Oven At Bake For 40 – 50 Minutes, Stirring Half Way Through. Let Cool, Granola Will Harden As It Cools.
7. Makes About 4 1/2 – 5 Cups. Store: Keep Granola In A Mason Jar Or An Airtight Container For Up To A 1 – 2 Months.
8. Notes:
9. Additional Add-Ins:
10. 1 – 2 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract (Mix In With Wet Ingredients)
11. 1/2 Cup Coconut Flakes (Add To Dry Ingredients)
12. Recommended Equipment:I Love Mysilpatortheseparchment Liners For Lining This Rimmed Baking Sheet. For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools, Shop My Kitchen Essentials!

title: VEGAN CHOCOLATE STOUT CRINKLE COOKIES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Flour Spelt Whole Wheat Pastry Flour Or Unbleached Allpurpose
2. 14 Cup 100 Cocoa Powder
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 1 Teaspoon Espresso Powder Optional
5. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
6. 14 Cup Sugar Coconut Pure Cane Or Date
7. 12 Ounces Good Quality Dark Chocolate 60  Cocoa Or Semisweet Chips Or A Combo
8. 13 Cup Coconut Oil
9. 12 Cup Chocolate Stout At Room Temp
10. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
11. 2 Flax Eggs 2 Tablespoons Flax Meal  5 Tablespoons Water
12. 1 Cup Organic Powdered Sugar For Rolling
preparation:
1. Flax Egg: Start By Mixing The Flax Eggs. In A Small Bowl, Combine Flax Meal With Water And Let Set For About 10 Minutes. It Will Become Gelatin Like In The Meantime.
2. Combine Dry Ingredients: In A Bowl Add The Flour, Cocoa Powder, Baking Powder, Salt, Espresso Powder And Sugar, Mix Until Well Combined. Set Aside.
3. Melt Chocolate + Oil:
4. Saucepan: In A Saucepan Over Low Heat, Add Chocolate And Coconut Oil, Cook, Stir Frequently Until Mixture Begins To Melt, Then Stirring Constantly Until It Is Completely Melted. Add Beer And Stir.
5. Microwave: In A Microwave Safe Bowl Add The Chocolate And Coconut Oil. Microwave On High For 20 Seconds, Stir And Repeat Until Melted. Don’T Over Heat Or The Chocolate Will Seize. Add Beer And Stir.
6. Add Remaining Wet Ingredients: Add The Flax Eggs And Vanilla To The Chocolate And Stir Until Well Combined.
7. Combine The Wet & Dry Ingredients: Add The Wet Ingredients To The Dry Ingredients And Stir Until Just Combined, Some Lumps Are Ok.
8. Chill: Cover And Refrigerate Until The Dough Has Set, About 3 Hours And Up To 36. Overnight Refrigeration Is Recommended.
9. Prep: Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment, Silpat Or Lightly Grease With Coconut Oil. Place Powdered Sugar In A Small Bowl.
10. Scoop And Roll: Using A Cookie Dough Scoop Or Ice Cream Scoop, Make Balls Just A Bit Smaller Than Golf Balls, Roll Into Shape With Your Hands. Place Dough Balls Into Powdered Sugar, Roll Until Well Coated. Place Sugared Cookies On Prepared Cookie Sheet.
11. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 8 – 10 Minutes Or Until Edges Have Set.
12. Makes 24 Cookies.
13. Store Cookies In A Loosely Covered Container For 3 – 4 Days.
14. Notes:
15. *You Won’T Experience Much Of A Difference If You Don’T Use Any Espresso Powder And Will Still Have A Winning Cookie.
16. Recommended Equipment:I Love Mysilpatortheseparchment Liners For Lining This Rimmed Baking Sheet(Affiliate Links). For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools, Shop My Kitchen Essentials!

title: LAVENDER CHAI TEA – CONCENTRATE
ingredients:
1. 3 14 Cups Water
2. 3 Black Tea Bags Or 3 Tablespoons Loose
3. 1 Large Or 2 Small Cinnamon Sticks
4. 8 Whole Cloves
5. 6 Peppercorns
6. 1 Teaspoon Culinary Lavender
7. 14 Teaspoon Ginger Powder Or 12 Inch Piece Fresh Sliced Optional
8. 14 Teaspoon Cardamom Or 3 Whole Pods Lightly Crushed Optional
9. Dash Of Nutmeg
10. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
11. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
preparation:
1. Bring 3 Cups Water To A Boil, Add Tea, Cinnamon, Cloves, Peppercorns, Lavender, Ginger, Cardamom And Nutmeg, Turn Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Turn Of Heat And Let Cool 10 Minutes. Remove Tea Bags. Add Vanilla And Maple Syrup, Give A Good Stir. Strain Out The Large Ingredients And Place In Container Of Choice.
2. In A Glass Or Mug/Cup, Pour Tea Concentrate To About 1/3 – 1/2 Full, Fill Remaining With Water Or Milk. Would Be Great With A Little Vegan Cream Stirred In!
3. Serve Warm Or Iced.
4. Store Leftover Tea In The Refrigerator, Use Within One Week.
5. Makes About 4 – 6 Servings

title: YUKON GOLD & SWEET POTATO HOME FRIES
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
2. 1 Onion Chopped
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper Chopped
4. 5 Yukon Gold Potatoes About 1 Lb Cut Into 1 Inch Cubes
5. 1 Large Sweet Potato Cut Into 1 Inch Cubes
6. 1 Teaspoon Thyme Dried Or Fresh
7. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
8. 12 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder Or To Taste
9. Dash Or Two Allspice Or Nutmeg Optional
10. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. In Large Skillet Over Medium Heat, Heat 1 Tablespoon Oil And Cook Onions And Bell Peppers Until Onions Are Softened, About 5 Minutes. Add Potatoes, Herbs, Spices And Remaining Oil, Cook On Medium To Medium Low Heat, Uncovered, For About 25 – 30 Minutes Stirring Occasionally. You Want The Potatoes To Brown And Crisp A Little On The Edges. Be Sure To Scrap The Bottom Of The Skillet As Well To Get All The Pieces That May Stick To The Bottom, They Will Add Nice Flavor And Some Crispy Texture To Your Dish.
2. Season With Plenty Of Salt And Pepper. Serve Right Away.
3. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 Months.

title: SPICY TOMATO SOUP WITH CURRY
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water
2. 1 Large Sweet Onion Thinly Sliced
3. 3 Cups Tomatoes About 6 Large Diced Or 1 Can 28Oz Tomatoes  Juices Pref Fired Roasted
4. 2 Cups Water Or Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
5. 1 Tablespoon Curry Red Curry Paste Or Yellow Curry Powder
6. 14 Cup Fresh Basil Loosely Packed
7. 12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Or To Taste
8. Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. 1 Can 14 Oz Light Coconut Milk Or Cream Or 1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
10. Spiralized Zucchini Optional 1 Per Person
preparation:
1. Saute: In A Large Pot, Heat Oil On Medium, Add Onions And Saute For Five Minutes, Or Until Softened.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients: Add Tomatoes, Water, Curry, Basil, Red Pepper Flakes And Salt, Turn Heat To Medium High, Bring To Boil, Reduce Heat, Cover And Simmer For 15 Minutes.
3. Coconut Milk: If You Want A Creamy Soup, Add The Coconut Milk/Cream After 10 Minutes Of Simmering, Continue To Simmer For Five More Minutes. Or You Can Add A Few Spoonfuls To The Individual Serving Bowl. Once Done, Taste For Flavor Adding Extra Spices As Needed.
4. Puree: Once Soup Is Done, Remove From Heat, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Puree Using A Submersion Blender Or Food Processor (If Using A Food Processor You May Have To Puree In A Couple Batches).
5. While Soup Is Cooking Or Cooling, Julienne Or Spiralize Your Zucchini. No Need To Cook As These Will Be Served Raw And Warm A Bit Once The Soup Is Served Over Top.

title: APPLE CINNAMON MUFFINS (GLUTEN FREE)
ingredients:
1. 2 14 Cups Almond Flour
2. 12 Cup Quick Oats
3. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
4. 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
5. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon
6. 2 Flax Eggs Or 12 Cup Unsweetened Applesauce
