7. 14 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
8. 14 Cup Light Flavored Olive Oil
9. 14 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Nondairy Milk Of Choice
10. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
11. 1 Medium Apple About 34 Cup Finely Diced Or Grated
12. 12 Cup Chopped Pecans Or Walnuts Optional
13. Garnish
14. 2 Tablespoons Coconut Sugar Pure Cane Sugar Or Turbinado
15. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon
16. Tablespoon Quick Oats Optional
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees. Line A Muffin Tin Using 10 Liners.
2. Flax Egg: In A Small Bowl Combine 2 Tablespoons Flaxseed Meal With 6 Tablespoons Water. Let Set For 10 Min To Thicken.
3. Topping: In A Small Bowl, Combine The Sugar And Cinnamon, Set Aside.
4. Combine Dry Ingredients: In A Large Bowl, Combine The Almond Flour, Oats, Salt, Baking Powder And Cinnamon, Give A Stir To Mix.
5. Add In The Wet Ingredients: To The Dry Ingredients, Add The Flax Egg, Maple Syrup, Oil, Plant Milk And Vanilla, Mix Until Just Combined. Stir In The Apples, Mix Again. Batter Will Not Be Runny And Should Be On The Thicker Side.
6. Fill Muffin Tin: Scoop And Fill Each Muffin Cup Just To The Top. Sprinkle With Cinnamon Sugar Topping. Bake For 20 Minutes, Or Until Toothpick Comes Out Clean And Muffins Are Lightly Browned On Top. Let Cool A Bit, Remove Muffins To Finish Cooling On A Cooling Rack.
7. Makes 10 Muffins
8. Storing: Freshly Baked Muffins Will Keep Well Loosely Covered, On The Counter For 4 – 5 Days. Or Once Completely Cooled, Keep Them In The Refrigerator For Up To 8 – 10 Days. If Storing In A Container, Let Muffins Cool Completely Before Storing.

title: FRENCH LENTIL & BITTER GREENS SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup French Lentils Beluga Or Puy Rinsed And Picked Over
2. 2 Bay Leafs
3. 3 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth
4. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. 6 Oz Bitter Greens Of Choice Arugula Belgian Endive Watercress Spinach Lacinato Kale Escarole Dandelion To Name A Few
6. Grape Tomatoes Halved
7. 1  2 Scallions Sliced
8. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
9. Lemon Dijon Balsamic Vinaigrette Serves One
10. 2 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil 1 Tbsp Each Oil  Water
11. 2 Tablespoons White Or Dark Balsamic Vinegar I Used White
12. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Mustard Whole Grain Is Great Too
13. Juice Of One Large Lemon
14. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Lentils: In A Medium Size Pot, Bring Water, Lentils, Bay Leafs And Garlic Powder To A Boil. Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer For 20 Minutes. We Want Them Tender But Still Holding Their Shape. Remove From Heat, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Drain.
2. Dressing: While Lentils Are Cooking Start Your Vinaigrette. In A Small Bowl, Whisk Together The Olive Oil, Balsamic Vinegar, Dijon Mustard, Lemon Juice, Salt & Pepper. Set Aside.
3. Produce: Next, Prepare Your Greens And Remaining Salad Ingredients Using As Much Or Little As You Like.
4. Serve: Prepare Your Salad By Laying Your Greens First, Then Add 2/3 – 3/4 Cup Or So Of Lentils And Toss Gently. Top With Tomatoes, Scallions And A Good Sprinkling Of Mineral Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper. Or Simply Lay Your Greens And Top With Lentils And Remaining Salad Ingredients Without Tossing At All If You Rather. No Rules Here, Do What Feels Best For You!
5. Store: Leftover Lentils Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Another Salad Or Usage Of Choice.

title: VEGAN BUCKWHEAT PANCAKES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
2. Juice Of 12 Lemon Or 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
3. 1 Cup Buckwheat Flour
4. 2 Tablespoons Coconut Or Organic Pure Cane Sugar
5. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
6. 12 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
7. Pinch Of Salt
8. Coconut Oil For The Griddle
9. Berries Of Choice To Serve Blueberries Raspberries Blackberries Or Strawberries
10. Pure Maple Syrup To Serve
preparation:
1. Buttermilk: In A Measuring Cup, Add Milk And Lemon Juice, Let Set For 10 Minutes.
2. Preheat Griddle To Manufacturers Setting For Pancakes. Once Hot Add 1 Tablespoon Or So Of Coconut Oil And Spread To Coat Griddle.
3. Mix: In A Medium Sized Mixing Bowl, Add Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Cinnamon And Salt, Mix Well. Add In Vegan Buttermilk And Mix To Combine. These Are Thicker Pancakes, For Thinner Pancakes, Add Up To 1/4 Cup More Milk To The Batter.
4. Pour And Cook: Using A 1/4 Cup Measuring Cup, Scoop Up Batter And Place On Griddle. Once The Top Forms Bubbles And Sides Look A Little Leathery, About 2 – 3 Minutes, Flip And Cook The Other Side For 2 -3 Minutes.
5. Serve With Berries Of Choice And Pure Maple Syrup. You May Even Like To Top With This Blueberry Compote (It’S Really Easy To Make And Delicious!).
6. Makes 8 Pancakes.

title: KALE QUINOA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dry Quinoa Rinsed
2. 1 34 Cups Water
3. 1 Can 15Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Optional
4. 6  8 Good Sized Kale Leaves Stems Removed And Finely Chopped Or Julienned
5. 14 Red Onion Finely Diced Or 3 Scallions Thinly Sliced
6. 2 Carrots Diced
7. 12 Large Zucchini Diced
8. 12 Cucumber Diced
9. 1 Red Bell Pepper Diced
10. 2  3 Lemons
11. Drizzle Of Extra Virgin Olive Oil Optional
12. Lemon Pepper Seasoning Or Cracked Pepper To Taste
13. Mineral Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse Your Quinoa And Place In A Medium Saucepan With Water. Bring To Boil Over Medium High Heat, Cover, Reduce Heat And Simmer On Low For 15 Minutes. Once Done, Remove Cover And Let Set For 10 Minutes. Fluff With A Fork.
2. Kale: While Your Quinoa Is Cooking, Place The Chopped Kale In A Medium Size Bowl Or On A Chopping Board, Drizzle With The Juice Of One Lemon And Mix Occasionally. This Will Help Massage And Soften The Kale A Bit, Reducing It’S Bitterness.
3. Assemble: Once Quinoa Is Done, Combine The Prepped Veggies And Kale, Along With Lemon Pepper And Salt To Taste. Squeeze The Juice Of The Remaining Lemon On Top And Drizzle With Optional Oil, Mix Once More.
4. Serve At Room Temperature Or Chilled. This Is A Salad You Can Eat With A Spoon!
5. Store In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For 5 – 6 Days.

title: VEGAN CREAM CHEESE
ingredients:
1. 1  12 Cup Raw Cashews
2. 12 Cup Water
3. 3 Tablespoons Lemon Juice About 2  3 Small Lemons
4. 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar
5. 14  12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
6. Optional Addins Use One
7. 3 Tablespoons Fresh Chives Chopped
8. 1 Small Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Minced
preparation:
1. Soak Cashews: Cover Cashews With Hot Water And Soak For 5 – 10 Minutes. Alternately, Soak Them For 2 – 3 Hours In Cool Water. Soaking Will Aid In Digestion.
2. Blend: Using A High Speed Blender Or Small Personal Blender, Add The Ingredients To The Cup Of Your Preferred Blender And Blend Until Creamy, Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides Every Now And Then. If Using Optional Add-Ins, Stir Them In.
3. Enjoy Vegan Cream Cheese Right Away Or Let Chill In The Refrigerator Before Serving.
4. Makes About 1 Cup
5. Store: Leftovers Will Keep For 5 – 6 Days In The Refrigerator. For Longer Storage, It Will Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months. Let Thaw In The Refrigerator Before Using.

title: HEARTY VEGAN LENTIL SOUP
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Water Or 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 2  3 Carrots About 1 Cup Diced
4. 2 Celery Ribs Diced
5. 3 Cloves Garlic Minced
6. 1 Cup 6Oz Green Beans Cut Into 1 Inch Pieces Fresh Or Frozen
7. 1 Can 14Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices Or 2  3 Roma Tomatoes Diced
8. 1 Lb Baby Potatoes Diced
9. 1 12 Cups Dried Brown Or Green Lentils
10. 1 12 Teaspoons Paprika
11. 12 Teaspoon Cumin
12. 12 Teaspoon Curry
13. 6 Cups Water Or Lowsodium Broth  More As Needed
14. 2 Handfuls Of Baby Spinach Or Kale
15. Juice Of 1 Lemon
16. 12 Cup Parsley Chopped
17. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Stovetop (See Notes For More Cooking Options):
2. Saute: In Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat Water/Olive Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Onion, Carrots, Celery, And Garlic, Saute For 5 Minutes. Add The Paprika, Curry, And Cumin, Saute 1 Minute, Or Until Fragrant.
3. Simmer: Add The Green Beans, Tomatoes, Potatoes, Lentils, And Liquids, Give A Good Stir And Bring To A Boil, Turn Heat To Low, Cover Askew And Simmer For 30 – 35 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
4. Add Greens: 5 Minutes Before Soup Is Done, Stir In The Greens. Add More Water If Needed, Maybe Up To 1 Cup. Add Lemon Juice And Season With Salt & Pepper.
5. Serve: Ladle Into Soup Bowls And Top With A Sprinkle Of Fresh Chopped Parsley And Squeeze Of Lemon Juice For An Extra Touch Of Brightness. Pairs Great With Homemade Vegan Cornbread, Vegan Naan Or Artisan Bread.
6. Store: Leftovers Will Keep In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days. Store Covered. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer In Freezer-Safe Containers For 2 – 3 Months.

title: LEMON CHICKPEA ORZO SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 12 Onion Diced
3. 3 Carrots Peeled And Diced
4. 3 Cloves Garlic Minced
5. 7  8 Cups Vegetable Broth Or Water Or Combo
6. 1 Cup Whole Wheat Orzo
7. 2 Cans 15Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
8. 13 Cup Tahini
9. 14  12 Cup Lemon Juice About 2  4 Large Lemons
10. A Large Handful Fresh Baby Kale Or Spinach
11. Chopped Fresh Dill To Taste
12. Mineral Salt To Taste
13. Fresh Cracked Pepper Or Lemonpepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Heat Oil Or Water Over Medium Heat, Add Onion And Carrot, Saute For About 5 – 7 Minutes, Add The Garlic And Saute For 1 Minute More.
2. Add The Broth Or Water, Bring To A Boil, Add The Orzo And Chickpeas, Reduce Heat To Medium-Low And Cook At A Gentle Boil For 8- 9 Minutes, Orzo Should Be Tender.
3. Remove From Heat, Add Tahini And Lemon Juice (Start With The Smaller Amount Of Juice, Adding More To Taste), Stir Well. Add The Baby Kale Or Spinach, Give A Good Stir, Greens Will Soften And Wilt Within A Few Minutes. Add As Much Dill As You Like, And Season Well With Salt & Pepper. Soup Will Thicken Upon Standing, Add More Liquids As Needed.
4. Serve In Individual Bowl With Your Favorite Crusty Artisan Bread For Soaking Up The Wonderful Juices.

title: AVOCADO CUCUMBER SUSHI ROLLS
ingredients:
1. 3  4 Nori Sheets
2. 1 Package Cauliflower Rice 16 Oz Or 1 Lb Cauliflower Head
3. 1 Tablespoons Rice Vinegar
4. 1 Mango Sliced
5. 1 Avocado Sliced
6. 1 Cucumber Julienned
7. 14 Red Cabbage Sliced
8. To Serve
9. Sesame Seeds Black Or Toasted
10. Pickled Ginger
11. Dynamite Sauce
preparation:
1. Cauliflower Rice: If Using A Head Of Cauliflower, Grate Cauliflower Using A Handheld Grater Or The Grater On Your Food Processor. Alternately, Place Cauliflower In A Food Processor And Pulse Until It Resembles Rice. (If Using Prepackaged Cauliflower Rice Or Pearls, Skip This Step.)
2. Heat 3 Tablespoons Water In A Pan Over Medium-High, Add Cauliflower Bits And Saute, Stirring Constantly, For About 4 – 5 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Add Rice Vinegar And Mix Well. Set Aside, Let Cool Completely.
3. Assemble: Fill A Little Bowl With Water And Keep Handy. Place A Nori Sheet, Shiny Side Down, On The Bamboo Mat. On The Edge Closest To You, Layer And Press The Cauliflower Rice On 2/3 Of The Sheet.
4. Add The Mango, Avocado, Cucumber And Red Cabbage Lengthwise, Leaving About 1 Inch On The End.
5. Start Rollingthe Nori, Folding Over The Mango, Avocado, Cucumber And Cabbage, Give A Good Press To Secure, And Continue To Roll. Using The Water, Wet Your Finger And Dab The Top End Of The Nori With Water To Seal. Let Rest A Few Minutes Before Cutting, Nori Will Soften And The Seal Will Dry. Repeat, Until Ingredients Are Gone.
6. Using A Clean, Sharp Knife, Cut Into 6 Even Rounds, Total Of 8 Pieces. You May Need To Wipe Clean The Knife After Each Cut.
7. Serve With Dynamite Sauce, Or Dipping Sauce Of Choice.

title: SPICY COLESLAW + TAHINI DIJON DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 1 Head Green Cabbage Shredded
2. 1 12 Cups Carrots Julienned
3. 4 Scallions Green Onions Sliced
4. 12 Peperoncini Or Banana Peppers Julienned Or Diced
5. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
6. Sesame Seeds To Serve
7. Dressing
8. 4 Tablespoons Tahini
9. 4 Tablespoons Water
10. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Mustard
11. 2 Teaspoons Pure Cane Sugar Or Pure Maple Syrup
12. 2 Teaspoons Apple Cider Vinegar Or Juice Of 12 Lemon
13. Pinch Of Fresh Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. Start By Mixing Your Dressing. In A Small Bowl Combine Dressing Ingredients. Set Aside. After Five Minutes Or So, Taste For Flavor Adding Anything Extra You Might Like. (You May Also Consider Mixing The Dressing On The Bottom Of The Bowl You Will Be Mixing Your Coleslaw In Leaving One Less Dish To Wash.)
2. In A Large Mixing Bowl, Add Cabbage, Carrots, Scallions, Peperoncinis. Drizzle With Dressing And Mix To Combine. Add Salt & Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste.
3. Serve At Room Temp Or Chilled. This Is A Great Salad To Make Ahead And Let Set Covered An Hour Or So On The Counter Or In The Refrigerator For Longer.
4. Serve With A Sprinkle Of White Sesame Seeds Over Top.

title: VEGAN FRENCH ONION DIP
ingredients:
1. 1 Medium Yellow Onion Diced
2. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Watervegetable Broth
3. 1 14 Cups Vegan Sour Cream Or 1 Tub 12Oz Tofutti Sour Cream
4. 1 Teaspoon Vegan Worcestershire I Use Annies
5. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
6. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
7. Mineral Salt To Taste
8. Chopped Parsley To Serve
preparation:
1. Onions: Heat The Oil/Water In A Nonstick Skillet Over Medium Heat. Add The Onions And Saute For 10-15 Minutes, Stirring Every Few Minutes. Add A Little Bit Of Water/Veggie Broth And Let It Sizzle And Evaporate. Keep Stirring Every So Often, Add More Liquids. After About 25 – 30 Minutes, Onions Should Be Caramelized And Fragrant.
2. Mix: Combine The Vegan Sour Cream With The Garlic & Onion Powder And Worcestershire Sauce. Add The Onions And Mix Well. Taste For Seasoning.
3. Serve: Serve Topped With Chopped Parsley. Pair Your French Onion Dip With Chips, Crackers, And/Or Sliced Vegetables.
4. Makes About 1 3/4 Cups.
5. Store Leftovers, Covered, In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days.

title: ROASTED CURRIED CAULIFLOWER SALAD + QUINOA
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Head Of Cauliflower
2. 1 Medium Apple I Used Fuji Cored And Diced
3. 12 Cup Golden Raisins
4. 13 Cup Shredded Coconut
5. 1 12 Cups Cooked Quinoa
6. Dressing
7. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
8. 3 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
9. 1 Tablespoon Dijon Mustard
10. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
11. 1 Tablespoon Lemon Or Orange Juice
12. 2 Tablespoons Water
13. 2 Teaspoons Curry Powder
14. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 425 Degrees F.
2. Prep + Roast Cauliflower: Cut Cauliflower Into Florets. Lay In A Single Layer On A Large Rimmed Baking Sheet. Add A Drizzle Of Oil And Toss To Coat. Roast In The Oven For 40 Minutes, Mixing The Cauliflower Around Half Way Through. Remove From Oven, Let Cool.
3. Curry Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Ingredients For The Dressing. Set Aside To Let The Flavors Develop. Taste For Seasoning Adding Anything Extra You Might Like.
4. Quinoa: See Notes If Making Quinoa From Scratch, Or Use This Quick + Easy Instant Pot Quinoa Recipe.
5. Assemble: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Combine Quinoa, Cauliflower, Apple, Raisins, Shredded Coconut And Dressing, Toss Well To Coat.
6. Serve At Room Temperature Or Chilled.
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days In A Covered Container.

title: Overnight Steel Cut Oats Breakfast Jars
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Steel Cut Oats Or 1 Cup Steel Cut Oats  1 Cup Raw Buckwheat Groats
2. 5 Cups Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
4. 12 Teaspoon Cardamom Optional
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract Optional
6. Pinch Of Himilayan Salt
7. Optional Ideas For Topping
8. 1  2 Tablespoons Chopped Dates Raisins Apricots Or Other Dried Fruit
9. 1 Tablespoon Unsweetened Coconut Flakes
10. 14 Cup Fresh Berries Of All Kind
11. 14  13 Cup Coconut Almond Cashew Oat Or Any Nondairy Milk
12. 1  2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup Coconut Sugar Or Other Sweetener Of Choice
13. 1  2 Tablespoon Nuts And Seeds Of All Kinds
14. Sprinkle Of Cocoa Nibs
15. 1  2 Tablespoons 100 Fruit Chia Jam
16. 1  2 Tablespoons Almond Butter Or Nut Butter Of Choice
preparation:
1. Simmer: In A Dutch Oven Or Large Pot, Steel Cut Oats, Spices, Salt, And Water, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low, And Simmer For 5 Minutes. Remove From Heat, Give A Good Stir, Add More Water As Needed.
2. Rest Overnight: Let Cool, Fill Individual Mason Jars (Or Other Containers), Cover, And Let Sit Overnight In The Fridge. Alternatively, Keep It In The Pot You Cooked It In, Cover, And Keep In The Fridge Overnight.
3. Fill Jars: The Next Day Fill Your Jars With A Mix Of Toppings For Grab & Go Time Or Simply Top Each Jar When Ready To Eat.
4. I Prefer To Eat My Breakfast Jars At Room Temp But You Can Heat Yours Either In The Microwave For A Minute Or Two, Or Use A Heated Pot Of Water Setting The Mason Jar In The Center Until Warmed.
5. This Will Fill 4 – 6 Pint-Sized Mason Jars With Plenty Of Toppings. Wide Mouths Are Preferred As It’S Much Easier To Spoon Out Of For Eating.
6. Store: Keep Breakfast Jars In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: FRESH MANGO SALSA
ingredients:
1. 2 Large Ripe Mangos Small Diced
2. 1 Large Red Bell Pepper Cored Seeds Removed And Finely Diced
3. 14 Large Red Onion Finely Diced
4. 1 Medium Jalapeno Seeds Removed And Finely Diced
5. 14 Cup Cilantro Chopped
6. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
7. 1 Lime Juice Of
preparation:
1. Place The Diced Mango, Bell Pepper, Onion, Jalapeno And Cilantro In A Medium/Large Mixing Bowl. Add A Pinch Of Salt And Squeeze Of Lime Juice Over Top, Gently Toss To Coat.
2. Enjoy Right Away Or Let It Rest For 30 Minutes So Flavors Can Mingle.
3. Serve With Chips, Or As A Condiment Or Side To Any Complimentary Meal, Such As Bean Tacos, Bean & Quinoa/Rice Burritos, And Various Vegan Bowl Meals.
4. Store Leftovers In A Sealed Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days, Or Freeze For Up To 2 Months.

title: ONE-POT CREAMY FETTUCCINE + PEAS + KING OYSTER MUSHROOM ‘SCALLOPS’
ingredients:
1. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
2. 2 King Oyster Mushrooms Cut Into 12 Inch Slices
3. 4 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 14  12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes Optional
5. 3 14 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth Or Water  12 Tsp Better Than Bouillon
6. 8 Oz Fettuccine
7. 1 12 Cup Fresh Peas If Frozen Let Thaw
8. 1 Large Lemon Juice Of About 3  4 Tablespoons  A Little Zest If You Like
9. 14 Cup Chopped Parsley
10. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
11. Heavy Cashew Cream
12. 13 Cup Cashews Soaked For 2 Hours And Drained
13. 14 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Cashew Milk
14. Juice Of 12 Small Lemon About 2 Teaspoons
15. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
preparation:
1. King Oyster Mushroom Scallops: Gently Wash And Dry The Mushrooms. Slice Into About 1/2 Inch Pieces. Heat Oil Over Medium Heat In A 4 Qt. Pan Or Pot (Pref. Wide Bottomed So The Dry Noodles Can Lay Flat), Add Mushrooms And Cook Until Golden On Each Side, About 6 – 8 Minutes Total. After Cooking A Few Minutes, Add About 2 Tablespoons Of Water To The Pan, Repeat As Needed When Water Has Evaporated. This Will Help Keep Them Moist Looking. You May Also Like To Season Them With A Splash Of Coconut Amino’S, Low Sodium Tamari Or Pinch Of Salt When Adding The Water. Once Done, Reserve Mushrooms On A Small Plate Until Later.
2. Vegan Cream: In A Small Blender, Place The Cashews, Almond Milk, Lemon Juice And Pinch Of Salt, Process Until Creamy. Add 1 Tablespoon Milk At A Time As Needed To Thin. Set Aside.
3. Pasta: In Same Pot, Heat Remaining Oil Over Medium Heat, Add Garlic And Red Pepper Flakes, Saute For About 1 Minute, Or Until Garlic Is Golden In Color. Add Broth And Fettuccine, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To A Semi-Rigorous Rolling Boil And Cook, Stirring Occasionally For About 13 – 14 Minutes (If Using Different Pasta, Cooking Times With Vary So Check The Package Directions For Cooking Times). About 4 Minutes Before Pasta Is Done, Add The Peas And Continue To Cook. A Little Broth Left At The End Of Cooking Is Ok (About 1/4 Cup), It Will Add To The Creaminess When The Cream Is Added. If More Than 1/4 Cup, Keep Cooking To Reduce The Liquids. Once Done, Add The Juice Of 1 Lemon, Heavy Cream, Mushrooms, Salt And Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste, Stir To Combine. Serve Warm.
4. Serve: Place Pasta In Individual Bowls, Top With Chopped Parsley, A Little Fresh Cracked Pepper And Enjoy!

title: LEMON PEPPER TOFU SHEET PAN DINNER
ingredients:
1. 1 Block  14  16 Oz Tofu High Protein Extrafirm Or Firm
2. 1 Lb Fresh Asparagus Ends Trimmed
3. 2  3 Small Lemons Sliced And 1 Zested
4. Salt  Lemon Pepper To Taste
5. 1  2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
6. Grain Of Choice White Or Brown Rice Quinoa Or Farro To Serve
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silicone Mat.
2. Tofu: If Using High Protein Tofu, There Is No Need To Press. If Using Extra-Firm Or Firm, Let The Tofu Rest On Its Side In The Tub It Came In For About 10 Minutes To Drain. Cut The Tofu Into 6 Rectangular Slabs.
3. Trim Asparagus: Slice Or Snap The Ends Of The Asparagus.
4. Layer On Baking Sheet: Place The Tofu Slabs On A Lined Rimmed Baking Sheet. Add The Asparagus In Between The Tofu As Shown Above, Drizzle With A Little Olive Oil, Then Add Lemon Slices Overtop. Sprinkle With Plenty Of Lemon Pepper And Generous Pinch Of Salt.
5. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 20 Minutes, Rotating The Baking Sheet Half Way Through.
6. Serve With Grain Of Choice, Add A Little Lemon Zest And More Lemon Pepper To Taste.
7. Store: Store Leftovers In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days.

title: ROASTED SWEET POTATO SALAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Sweet Potato Diced
2. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
3. 1 Large Shallot Sliced
4. 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil Divided
5. Pinch Garlic Powder
6. Pinch Chili Chipotle Or Smoked Paprika Powder
7. Pinch Pink Salt
8. 6 Oz Leafy Greens Of Choice I Used Baby Kale
9. 2 Tablespoons Pepitas Pumpkin Seeds
10. Simple Lemon Tahini Dressing
11. 3 Tablespoons Tahini
12. Juice Of 12 Medium Lemon
13. 23 Tablespoons Water  More As Needed
14. Pink Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400F.
2. Roast: Place Sweet Potato And Chickpeas On A Large Rimmed Baking Sheet Lined With A Silpat, Parchment Paper Or Lightly Greased. Drizzle With Oil, Toss To Coat. Sprinkle A Few Dashes Of Salt, Garlic And Chili Powder Of Choice Over Top. Place In The Oven And Roast For About 25 – 30 Min, Stirring Once Halfway Through, Potatoes Will Be Ready When They Are Fork Tender. Ovens Vary So Your Cooking Time May Be More Or Less.
3. Crispy Shallots: Heat Remaining Oil In A Small/Medium Pan Over Medium Heat, Add Shallots And Cook For About 5 Minutes Stirring Frequently. Lower Heat To Medium Low And Cook The Shallots Until Nicely Browned, About Another 5 – 10 Minutes. Once Browned To Your Liking, Remove From Pan And Set Aside On A Paper Towel Lined Plate (If You Leave Them In The Pan To Cool, They May Cook A Bit More (Possibly Overcook) Since The Pan Will Still Be Hot). Sprinkle With A Little Salt And Pepper If You Like.
4. Dressing: Place The Dressing Ingredients In A Small Bowl, Mix Well And Add More Water As Needed To Thin. Set Aside.
5. Serve: Add Leafy Greens To Serving Dish/Plate, Top With 1/2 Of The Roasted Sweet Potatoes And Chickpeas Along With 1/2 Of The Crispy Shallots. Add A Sprinkle Of Pepitas Over Top And Drizzle With 1/2 Of The Dressing. Add A Squeeze Of The Remaining Lemon Half Over To If You Like!
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days In A Covered Container.

title: SPICY RAW TOMATO + RED PEPPER SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Lb 16Oz Tomatoes Use Your Favorite
2. 1 Medium Red Bell Pepper Cored And Sliced
3. 1 Lemon Juice Of
4. 2 Teaspoons Nutritional Yeast
5. A Few Cilantro Parsley Or Basil Leaves
6. A Few Chives
7. Pinch Of Red Pepper Flakes
8. Himalayan Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Prep: Quarter Your Tomatoes. Core And De-Seed Your Bell Pepper, Cut Into Slices.
2. Puree: Place All Ingredients In Food Processor/Blender And Blend Until A Soup Consistency. Taste For Flavor Adding Extra Ingredients To Suit Your Taste.
3. Enjoy As Is Or Place In The Refrigerator To Chill For 1 Hour Before Eating.
4. Makes About 3 Cups, Serves 2 – 3
5. Serve: Place In Individual Bowls And Topwith A Squeeze Of Lemon Juice Over Top And Some Chopped Chives, Parsley Or Basil. Sliced Or Diced Avocado Is Also Excellent Adding A Little Creaminess!

title: QUICK + EASY VEGETABLE SPAGHETTI
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
2. 1 Onion Thinly Sliced
3. 2  3 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 8 Oz Mushrooms Sliced I Used Baby Bella
5. 1 Medium Zucchini Thinly Sliced And Cut In Half
6. 1 Medium Yellow Squash Thinly Sliced And Cut In Half
7. 1 Can 28 Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
8. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
9. 12 Teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes
10. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
11. 2 Handfuls Of Spinach Or Baby Greens Of Choice
12. 8 Oz Pasta Of Choice I Used Quinoa Linguini Pasta
13. Almond Parmesan To Serve
preparation:
1. Pasta: Cook Your Pasta Of Choice According To Package Directions. Set Aside.
2. Vegetables: In A Large Flat Bottom Pan, Heat Oil On Medium High, Add Mushrooms, Zucchini, Onion, Garlic And Spices, Cook For About 8 – 10 Minutes, Or Until Mushrooms And Zucchini Are Tender, Stirring Frequently. Add Tomatoes And Cook Until Heated Through. Stir In Spinach And Let Wilt. Taste For Seasoning.
3. Assemble: Serve Veggies Over A Bed Of Pasta With A Good Dusting Of Almond Parmesan.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 5- 6 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: VEGAN COCONUT MACAROONS
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Unsweetened Coconut Flakes Finely Shredded See Notes
2. 1 Cup Canned Coconut Milk Or Cream Full Or Lowfat
3. 13 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
4. 13 Cup Slivered Almonds Chopped Is Ok Too Optional
5. 13 Cup Oat Flour Coconut Flour Allpurpose Or Glutenfree Flour Blend
6. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
7. Pinch Of Mineral Salt
8. 7 Oz Vegan Dark Chocolate Bar Or Chocolate Chips
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or A Silpat.
2. Mix: In A Medium Size Mixing Bowl, Combine The Coconut, Coconut Milk, Syrup, Almonds, Flour, Vanilla And Salt, Mix Well.
3. Scoop: Using A 2 Or 3 Tablespoon Measuring Spoon, Scoop Out Rounded Tablespoons, Making Sure To Pack It Well**. This Last Part Is Very Important, Or Your Macaroons May Tend To Fall Apart. Place Packed Mounds On Cookie Sheet, About 1 Inch Apart.
4. Bake: Place Cookie Sheet In The Oven And Bake For 20 – 30 Minutes (Ovens Vary And It Depends On How Big The Mounds Are), Until Golden, Rotating Sheet Half Through Baking. Let Cool Completely.
5. Chocolate: Warm The Chocolate On The Stove Over Low Heat, Stirring Frequently Until Melted. Alternately, You Can Melt The Chocolate In The Microwave, Stopping To Give A Good Stir Every 30 Seconds. Dip The Bottoms Of The Macaroons Into The Melted Chocolate. Place The Cookies Back On The Lined Baking Sheet. Drizzle Remaining Chocolate On Top Using A Spoon Or Pastry Piping Bag. Refrigerate For 7 – 10 Minutes, Or Until Set.
6. Makes About 24 Two Tablespoon Cookies, 18 Three Tablespoon Cookies, Or 12 Four Tablespoon Coconut Macaroons.
7. Store: Keep Macaroons Covered Or In An Airtight Container, Will Last For Up To 4 – 5 Days On The Counter. To Keep Fresher Longer, Store In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator.

title: GOJI BERRY + WHITE CHOCOLATE TRUFFLES
ingredients:
1. 4 Oz Raw Cacao Butter Melted
2. 1 Cup Raw Cashews Soaked 2 Hours And Drained
3. 7 Medjool Dates Pitted
4. 1 Vanilla Bean Seeds Scraped Optional
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
6. Dash Of Himalayan Salt
7. 13 Cup Goji Berries
8. For Rolling
9. 14  13 Cup Shaved Cacao Butter Or Unsweetened Shredded Coconut
preparation:
1. Melt Cacao: Place The Raw Cacao Butter In A Small Saucepan And Heat On The Lowest Setting. Keep An Eye On It While You Start Putting The Rest Of The Truffles Together, Swish It Around Every Once In A While. At This Low Temperature It Won’T Burn And Should Melt Completely Within 5 Minutes Or So. Once Melted, Turn Off Heat And Set Aside Until Ready To Use. Alternatively, Melt In The Microwave Using 30 Second Intervals, Stirring After Each Until Melted.
2. Blend: Combine The Cashews, Dates, Vanilla Bean Seeds, Vanilla Extract And Salt Into Your Food Processor/Blender And Blend Until Completely Combined And You Have A Smooth Consistency. With Equipment Turned Off, Slowly Add The Melted Cacao Butter And Blend Again Until Combined.
3. Add Berries: Transfer Truffle Mixture Into A Small Bowl, Mix In The Goji Berries.
4. Chill And Roll: Place Mixture In The Refrigerator For About 30 Minutes. Scoop Out Rounded Tablespoons Of Dough And Roll Into Balls With The Palms Of Your Hand, Washing Hands As Needed In Between Balls. Roll In Shaved Cacao Butter Or Shredded Coconut.
5. Makes About 14
6. Store: Store In An Airtight Container On The Counter For Up To One Week, Refrigerator For Up To Three Weeks Or So, Or Freeze For Much Longer Storage.

title: LEMON COCONUT ENERGY BITES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Raw Cashews
2. 13 Cup Buckwheat Groats Not Toasted Kasha
3. 13 Cup Rolled Oats
4. 14 Cup Unsweetened Shredded Coconut Flakes
5. 2 Medium Lemons Zest Of 2 Juice Of 1
6. 7  8 Medjool Dates Pitted And Chopped
7. Pinch Of Mineral Salt Optional
8. For Rolling
9. 14  12 Cup Shredded Coconut Flakes
preparation:
1. Place Cashews, Buckwheat Groats And Oats In Food Processor And Blend Until A Medium To Fine Grind (Doesn’T Have To Be Perfect). The Buckwheat May Stay A Bit Chunky So If You’Re Looking For A Smooth Center Use All Oats.
2. Add The Coconut, Lemon Zest + Juice, And Dates, Blend, Stopping Once Or Twice To Scrape Down The Sides, Until You Have A Doughy Consistency. If You Find Your Dough Is A Bit Too Dry Try Adding More Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice, 1 Tablespoon At A Time.
3. Chill Dough For About 20 – 30 Minutes (This Will Help Stiffen The Paste For Rolling). Roll Into 1 Inch Balls, Then Roll In Coconut Flakes.
4. Makes Approx. 14 – 18 Balls
5. Store: Keep In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For 1 – 2 Weeks. For Longer Storage, Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Raw Brownies (Vegan + No Bake)
ingredients:
1. 34 Cup Raw Almonds Walnuts Or Pecans
2. 13 Cup Unsweetened Shredded Coconut
3. 13 Cup Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
4. 1 13 Cups Packed Medjool Dates Pitted Softened And Chopped
5. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
6. 18 Teaspoon Himalayan Salt
preparation:
1. Make Flour: Combine Almonds, Coconut And Cocoa Powder In Food Processor/Blender And Process Until Almonds Are A Fairly Fine Consistency. Remove Mixture And Set Aside.
2. Date Paste: Add Dates To The Food Processor/Blender And Process Until Dates Become A Paste.
3. Combine: Add In The Almond, Coconut And Cocoa Powder Mixture Along With The Remaining Vanilla And Salt. Pulse Until Just Combined.
4. Pack In Loaf Pan: Line A Loaf Pan With Plastic Wrap, Wax Paper Or Parchment Paper. Place Mixture Into Loaf Pan, Press Down Firmly While Smoothing Out The Surface.
5. Chill: Place The Brownies In The Fridge For At Least 30 Minutes Or So To Harden A Bit Before Cutting.
6. Slice: Cut Into 12 Squares To Make A 3 – 4 Bite Size Brownie Or Cut Into 24 Squares For A 1 – 2 Bite Size Brownies.
7. Finishing Touch: Optionally, Sprinkle The Brownies With Cacao Powder Or Place A Walnut On Top Of Each Piece For Decoration.
8. Makes 12 – 24
9. Store: Keep In An Airtight Container In The Fridge For Up To Two Weeks. For Longer Storage, Place In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: PAN BAGNAT (WHITE BEAN NICOISE SALAD SANDWICH)
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15 Oz Cannellini Or Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed Or 1 12 Cups Fresh Cooked
2. 12 Red Bell Pepper Chopped
3. 14 Cup Blanched French Green Beans Cut Into Half Or Thirds
4. 1 Jar Artichoke Hearts In Water Drained And Chopped
5. 12 Small Red Onion Diced
6. 34 Cup Nicoise Or Kalamata Olives Pitted And Sliced
7. 2 Tablespoons Parsley Finely Chopped
8. 2  3 Greek Pepperoncini Diced Optional Not A Traditional Ingredient
9. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
10. Dressing
11. 2  3 Tablespoons Extra Virgin Olive Oil
12. Juice Of 1 Large Lemon About 2 Tablespoons
13. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Dijon Mustard
14. To Assemble
15. 1 French Baguette Ciabatta Loaf Pain De Campagne Boule Or Artisan Loaf Of Choice Even Good Sized Rolls Would Be Great
16. Extra Virgin Olive Oil To Brush
17. 8  10 Basil Leaves
18. 1 Medium Tomato Thinly Sliced
19. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper
preparation:
1. Dressing:In A Small Bowl, Mix The Dressing Ingredients Together Until Dijon Has Emulsified. Set Aside To Let The Flavors Develop.
2. Assemble Salad: In A Medium/Large Mixing Bowl, Add Beans And Roughly Mash Leaving About 2/3 Whole Beans. Add In Dressing To The Beans And Mix Well. Add In The Bell Pepper, Green Beans, Artichokes, Red Onion, Olives, Parsley, Optional Peperoncini And Salt & Pepper. Mix To Combine.
3. Prep Bread: Cut Bread In Half Lengthwise. Remove Some Of The Insides Of Each Half Making A Trough For The Filling (This Will Help Keep The Filling Inside The Sandwich When Eating). Brush Both Halves With Extra Virgin Olive Oil.
4. Assemble Pan Bagnat: Layer Your Bottom Half Of Bread With A Good Serving Of The Mixed Salad. Add Tomatoes Across The Top, Then Top With Basil Leaves And Salt & Pepper. Top With Other Slice Of Bread. (You Can Also Vice Versa This Layer Order Starting With The Basil And Tomato On The Bottom And Salad On Top.)
5. Cover With Saran: Wrap Sandwich Tightly In Saran Wrap And Press With A Few Heavy Books/Pots For At Least An Hour To Overnight. If Overnight, Be Sure To Press In The Refrigerator.
6. When Ready To Serve, Slice In Half Or Make As Many Slices As You Like.
7. Serve Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
8. Makes 2 Sandwiches
9. Store: Store Any Leftover Salad Mixture Covered In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days. Also, Sandwiches Will Last For 3 – 4 Days, Wrapped Or In A Covered Container.

title: CHIPOTLE ROASTED CHICKPEAS
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Or 1 12 Cups Cooked
2. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Or Olive Oil
3. 1 Teaspoon Chipotle Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
5. Mineral Salt To Taste
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees.
2. After Draining And Rinsing Your Chickpeas, Pat Them Dry With Dish Towel Or Paper Towel. Remove Any Lose Skins.
3. Line A Rimmed Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silpat. Place Chickpeas In The Center Of The Baking Sheet, Drizzle With Oil And Spices, Mix Well To Coat.
4. Arrange Chickpeas In A Single Layer, Place Baking Sheet In The Oven, And Bake For About 40-50 Minutes, Stirring Every 15 Minutes Or So Until Chickpeas Have A Nice Roasted Look And Are Crispy.
5. Let Cool For 10 Minutes Before Serving.
6. How To Store: Keep Your Chickpeas Crunchy By Storing Them In A Container That Lets Air Flow Through. When Stored In An Airtight Container They Will Soften Up And Lose Their Crunchiness.
7. Notes:
8. For A Spicy & Sweet Flavor, Replace The Oil With Pure Maple Syrup!
9. Recommended Equipment: I Love And Use This Parchment Paper And Silpat(Affiliate Links). For More Of My Favorite Cooking Tools, Shop My Kitchen Essentials.

title: Vegan Maple Butter Pecan Ice Cream
ingredients:
1. 3 Large Or 4 Small Ripe Bananas Frozen Or Unfrozen
2. 12 Cup Raw Almond Butter
3. 14  12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup To Taste
4. 14 Cup Tahini
5. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
6. 2 Teaspoons Or So Vanilla Extract
7. 1 Cup Pecans
preparation:
1. Place Ingredients, Except For The Pecans, In A Food Processor/High-Speed Blender And Process, Scraping Down The Sides As Needed, Until Creamy And Combined. Taste For Sweetness, Adding More Maple Syrup If Needed. Stir In Pecans.
2. Place In An Airtight Container And Keep In The Freezer For At Least 6 Hours To Harden. Let Sit For About 10 Minutes Or So To Soften Before Scooping Into Serving Bowls.
3. Makes About 4 Cups

title: ‘CHICKPEA OF THE SEA’ TUNA SALAD SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 14 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. Juice Of 12 Lemon  Some Zest If You Like
3. 14  13 Cup Of Vegan Mayo Or 3  4 Tablespoons Hummus Or White Bean Hummus  2  3 Tablespoons Water
4. 14 Cup Celery About 2 Small Stalks Leaves Ok Too Chopped
5. 14 Cup Red Onion About 12 Small Chopped
6. 14  12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
7. Himalayan Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
8. Dash Of Cayenne Optional
9. Other Optional Ingredients
10. Crushed Nori Sheets Or Dulse Seaweed
11. 1 Tablespoon Chia Seeds Or Hemp Hearts For Some Omega 3  6
12. Sweet Or Dill Pickle Relish
13. To Serve
14. 6 Slices Whole Grain Sprouted Whole Grain Flourless Or Artisan Bread To Serve
15. Leafy Greens To Serve
16. Nori Sheets To Serve Optional
17. Pickles Optional
preparation:
1. Mash Chickpeas: Drain And Rinse Chickpeas, Place In Medium Size Bowl And Roughly Mash About 3/4 Of The Chickpeas With The Back Of A Fork Or Potato Masher, Until Desired Consistency.
2. Assemble Salad: Add The Rest Of The Ingredients And Mix Well, Adding Any Extra Ingredients You Like. Alternatively, You Can Use A Food Processor Starting With The Beans, Pulse A Few Times, Add Remaining Ingredients Pulsing Again A Few Times Until Desired Consistency.
3. Serve Chilled Or At Room Temperature.
4. Ways To Serve:
5. Serve On Bread Of Choice, Along With Some Leafy Greens And The Optional 1/4 Sheet Of Nori.
6. You Can Also Serve On Bibb Or Romaine Lettuce Like A Wrap, Instead Of Using Bread, For A Gluten-Free Meal Like Shown Below.
7. Try Serving With Sliced Fresh Scoopable Veggies Like Cucumber, Red Bell Peppers, Zucchini, Etc.
8. Lastly, Pair With Your Favorite Crackers.
9. Salad Serves 3 Generously.
10. Store: Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. Stir Before Serving.

title: RAW SPAGHETTI + VEGETABLE PASTA
ingredients:
1. 1 Large Zucchini Spiralized Or Julienned
2. 1 Large Cucumber Spiralized Or Julienned
3. 1 Cup Mushrooms Diced
4. 12 Each Red  Yellow Bell Pepper Diced
5. 1  2 Carrots Diced
6. 1  2 Scallions Sliced
7. Fresh Chopped Basil Or Parsley Optional
8. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
9. Red Pepper Flakes To Serve
10. 1 Batch Raw Marinara Sauce
preparation:
1. Vegetable Noodles: Spiralize The Zucchini And Cucumber, Set Aside. You Can Also Julienne By Hand Or Use A Julienne Tool, But The Spiralizer (Affiliate Link) Is Really Fun And Easy. I Highly Recommend Having One If You Make Raw Noodles Often.
2. Prep Veggies: Dice Up Your Veggies, Using As Much As You Like.
3. Assemble: You Can Either Mix Everything Together In A Separate Bowl And Transfer To Individual Serving Dishes, Or You Can Serve And Mix Right In Your Serving Dish.
4. Top With Sliced Green Onions, Fresh Herbs Of Choice, Mineral Salt & Cracked Pepper To Taste. It’S Extra Aaamazing Topped With A Dusting Of Almond Parmesan!

title: VEGAN OATMEAL PANCAKES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Spelt Flour Or Allpurpose Whole Wheat Or 11 Gf
2. 12 Cup Oats Old Fashioned Or Quick Oats
3. 1 Tablespoon Sugar Coconut Raw Or Pure Cane Sugar
4. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
5. Pinch Of Salt
6. 1 Cup Vegan Buttermilk 1 Cup Nondairy Milk  1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice Or Apple Cider Vinegar
7. 1 Flax Egg 1 Tablespoon Flax Meal  3 Tablespoons Water Optional
8. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla
9. 2 Teaspoons Coconut Oil Or Your Favorite
preparation:
1. Flax Egg (Optional): If Using A Flax Egg, Place Ingredients In Small Bowl And Set Aside For About 10 Minutes To Set. I Have Made Pancakes Many Times Without The Need For An Egg Replacement, But You Can Think Of It As Added Nutrition As Flax Meal Is Very Good For You!
2. Vegan Buttermilk: In A Small Bowl, Add The Milk And Juice Of 1/2 Lemon, Let Rest For 5 – 10 Minutes To Curdle. This Is Optional, Use Plain Plant Milk If You Prefer.
3. Preheat: Preheat Griddle Or Pan To Medium Heat. If Keeping Pancakes Warm, Set Oven To 200 Degrees And Place Baking Sheet In Oven To Warm.
4. Make Batter: Combine The Flour, Oats, Sugar, Baking Powder And Salt In A Large Bowl. Add The Vanilla And Vegan Milk To The Dry Mixture, And Blend Until Just Combined.
5. Scoop And Cook: Using A 1/4 Cup Measuring Cup, Scoop And Pour Pancake Mix Onto A Lightly Greased Griddle Or Skillet. Cook Until Bubbles Form Along The Top And Edges, About 2 To 3 Minutes, Bottom Should Be Golden Brown. Carefully Flip And Cook For Another 2 Minutes Or So Until Golden Brown Underneath.
6. Keep Warm: Transfer Pancakes To Warm Baking Sheet And Place In Oven Until All Pancakes Are Made.
7. Makes About 8 Small Pancakes.
8. Serve: Servewarm With Blueberry Compote And Pure Maple Syrup.
9. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 7 Days In A Covered Container. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For 2 – 3 Months. Reheat In Toaster Oven Or Microwave.

title: CURRY POTATO SALAD
ingredients:
1. 2 Lbs Baby Potatoes I Used Yukon Gold Cut Into 34  1 Inch Pieces
2. 34 Cup Carrots Shredded Or Chopped Small
3. 12 Cup Celery Thinly Sliced Some Leaves Ok Too
4. 12 Cup Green Onions Thinly Sliced
5. 1 Can 14 Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed
6. 14 Cup Chopped Cilantro
7. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
8. Chopped Chives To Garnish Optional
9. Curry Tahini Dressing
10. 5 Tablespoons Tahini  5 Tablespoons Water  More As Needed
11. Juice From 1 Lemon About 2 Tablespoons
12. 2 Teaspoons Curry Powder
13. 1  2 Teaspoons Hot Sauce I Used Sriracha Or 14  12 Teaspoon Cayenne Or Hot Paprika Powder
14. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
15. Pinch Of Salt
preparation:
1. Potatoes: Place Potatoes Into A Medium/Large Pot, Fill Pot With Water, Covering Potatoes With At Least 1 Inch Of Water, Add A Generous Pinch Of Salt. Bring To A Boil, Turn Heat To Medium-Low, Place Lid Slightly Askew, And Cook Potatoes In Gently Boiling Water For About 10 Minutes. Potatoes Should Be Al Dente. Drain, And Set Aside And Let Cool A Bit.
2. Dressing:In A Small Bowl, Combine The Tahini And Water, Mix Well. Add The Lemon Juice, Curry, Hot Sauce, Onion Powder And Salt, Mix Well To Combine. Add A Tad More Water As Needed To Create Desired Consistency. You Don’T Want The Dressing To Be Too Thick (I Ended Up Using About 2 Tablespoons Extra). Use Your Best Judgement. (If Using Vegan Mayoas Per The Notes, Simply Combine Everything At Once And Mix Well.) Taste For Seasoning. Makes About 3/4 Cup.
3. Salad:In A Large Bowl, Add Potatoes, Celery, Carrots, Green Onions, Chickpeas, And Cilantro. Top With Dressing, And Gently Toss To Combine. Season With Salt And Pepper To Taste.
4. Serve:Serve Chilled, At Room Temp, Even Warm Is Ok Too.Top With Chopped Chives Or Sliced Green Onions. Garnish With More Freshly Chopped Cilantro If You Like.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator In A Covered Container For Up To 4 – 5 Days.

title: EASY BLACK BEAN BROWNIES (VEGAN + GLUTEN FREE)
ingredients:
1. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 12 Heaping Cup Cocoa Powder
3. 12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
4. 3 Tablespoons Coconut Or Neutralflavored Oil Or Applesauce
5. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Baking Powder
6. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
7. 2 Flax Eggs 2 Tablespoons Flaxseed Meal  5 Tablespoons Water
8. 14 Cup Semisweet Chocolate Morsels
9. 12 Teaspoons Natural Peanut Butter Or Almond Butter Divided Chilled
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Make Your Flax Egg In A Small Bowl By Combining The Flax-Seed Meal And Water, Mix Well. Place In Refrigerator For At 5 – 7 Minutes To Set. Should Be Thick And Goupy When Ready.
3. Prepare Your Muffin Tin By Lightly Greasing It With Oil. Use Muffin Liners If You Prefer.
4. In A Food Processor/Blender, Add Black Beans, Flax-Eggs, Cocoa Powder, Maple Syrup, Oil, Baking Powder, And Vanilla. Blend Until Creamy Stopping To Scrape Down The Sides As Needed. The Batter Should Be About The Consistency Of Pudding, Not Too Thick, Not Too Thin. Mix In Chocolate Chips.
5. Fill Each Cup About 1/4 – 1/3 Full. Use Any Remaining Batter To Make Sure All Tins Are Equally Filled. Place 1 Teaspoon Of Chilled Nut Butter In The Center Of Each Cup. Using A Toothpick, Chopstick, Or Something Pointy, Swirl The Nut Butter Into The Chocolate.
6. Place In Oven On Middle Rack And Bake For 22 – 25 Minutes. Let Cool About 15 – 20 Minutes. Using A Butter Knife, Gently Guide The Knife Around The Outside Of The Muffin Making Sure It Is Away From The Pan. Gently Nudge Under Each Brownie With The Knife And Lift Removing From The Tin.
7. Makes 12

title: Chocolate Vegan Buckwheat Waffles (Gluten Free)
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Buckwheat Flour
2. 12 Cup Organic Cocoa Powder
3. 14 Cup Sugar Organic Pure Cane Or Coconut Sugar
4. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
5. 1 Teaspoon Cinnamon Optional
6. 12 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
7. 1 34 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk Or Plant Milk Of Choice
8. 14 Cup Light Flavored Olive Oil Coconut Oil Or Applesauce
9. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Optional
10. Maple Nut Butter Syrup Serves 2
11. 4 Tablespoons Almond Butter Or Nut Butter Of Choice
12. 4 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
13. 2 Tablespoons Water  More As Needed
preparation:
1. Nut Butter Maple Syrup: First, Mix Your Nut Butter Syrup. Combine Ingredients In A Small Bowl And Stir Until Smooth. For Thinner Syrup Use More Water. Set Aside.
2. Preheat Waffle Maker To Manufacturer’S Instruction :.
3. Waffle Batter: In A Medium Size Bowl, Combine The Flour, Cocoa, Sugar, Baking Powder, Salt. Add Nut Milk, Oil And Vanilla, Mix Until Combined.
4. Cook: Pour Batter Onto The Center Of Waffle Iron, Close And Cook About 3 – 4 Minutes (Or According To Your Waffle Maker’S Instruction :). Gently Remove Waffles And Serve Right Away. You Can Also Keep Waffles Warm In A Preheated Oven At 200 Degrees F., Keep Waffles On A Cookie Sheet Until All Waffles Are Ready.
5. Serve With The Maple Nut Butter Syrup And Sliced Bananas.
6. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days, Or In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Reheat In The Toaster Oven.
7. Makes 4 – 5 Regular Or 2 Belgian Waffles.

title: KELP NOODLE SALAD + PEANUT DRESSING
ingredients:
1. 1 Package Kelp Noodles Rinsed Well
2. 2 Cups Carrots Shredded
3. 1  2 Scallions Thinly Sliced To Garnish
4. Black Sesame Seeds To Garnish
5. Lime Wedges To Serve
6. Dressing
7. 3 Rounded Tablespoons Natural Peanut Butter I Used Raw Almond Butter
8. 2  3 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
9. 1 Tablespoon Tamari
10. 1 Tablespoon Pure Maple Syrup
11. 1 Clove Garlic Grated Minced Or Pressed
12. 34 Inch Of Fresh Ginger Minced Or 2 Teaspoons Ground
preparation:
1. Dressing: Start By Mixing The Dressing In A Small Bowl, Set Aside Letting The Flavors Develop. Add Water As Needed To Thin, Adding 1 Tablespoon At A Time.
2. Assemble: Add Noodles And Carrots To A Large Bowl, Add Dressing And Mix Until Well Coated. Be Patient While Mixing Your Kelp Noodles, They Are Not As Soft And Pliable As Regular Noodles And Will Take Moment To Completely Coat.
3. Serve In Individual Bowls, Garnish With Scallions And Sesame Seeds. Top With Fresh Lime Juice.
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 3 – 4 Days, In A Covered Container.

title: VEGAN ENCHILADAS VERDE
ingredients:
1. Cashew Cream
2. 1 Cup Raw Cashews Soaked For 2 Hours
3. 1 Teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar Optional
4. 2 Tablespoon Fresh Lime Or Lemon Juice
5. 14 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika
6. 12 Teaspoon Onion Powder
7. Salt To Taste
8. 12  34 Cup Water
9. Vegan Enchilada Sauce
10. 2 Lbs Fresh Tomatillos Husked And Quartered
11. 1 Medium Red Onion Coarsely Chopped
12. 2 Garlic Cloves Chopped
13. 1 Jalapeo Seeded And Coarsely Chopped
14. 2 Cups Vegetable Broth
15. 12 Cup Parsley Or Cilantro Or Combo Chopped
16. Mineral Salt To Taste
17. Enchiladas
18. 1 Medium Zucchini Chopped Into 12 Pieces
19. 1  2 Ears Of Corn Shucked With The Corn Cut Off The Cob
20. 34 Cup Or 12 Pint Cherrygrape Tomatoes
21. 1 Large Carrot Peeled And Diced
22. Olive Oil
23. 12 1 Teaspoon Cumin
24. Salt  Cracked Pepper
25. 1 Can Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
26. 9  12 Corn Tortillas
preparation:
1. Cashew Cream: Soak The Cashews In Two Cups Cold Water For 2+ Hours Or Hot Water For 5 Minutes, Drain Well. Place Cashews, Lime Juice, Paprika, Onion Powder, Salt And 1/2 Cup Water Into Blender/Nutribullet And Blend Until Smooth. Add Additional Water, 1 Tablespoon At A Time, To Thin To Desired Consistency. Taste For Flavor. Add More Paprika To Your Liking, But Keep In Mind The Color Will Change.
2. Enchilada Sauce: Place The Tomatillos, Onion, Garlic, Jalapeno, And Vegetable Broth In A Medium Pot And Bring To A Boil. Lower To A Simmer And Cook Until Tender, About 15 Minutes. Carefully, Transfer To A Food Processor/Blender, Add The Cilantro And/Or Parsley, And Salt, Process Until Smooth. Set Aside. You May Need To Process Your Verde Sauce In Two Batches If Using A Food Processor. (Note: See Salsa Verde For Step By Step Instruction :) Makes About 6 Cups.
3. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F.
4. Enchilada Filling: Warm The Olive Oil In A Skillet Over Medium Heat, Add The Zucchini, Carrots, Corn, Tomatoes, Cumin, And Salt, And Saute Until Just Tender, About 5 – 8 Minutes.
5. Warm The Tortillas: This Helps To Make Them Pliable. I Prefer To Warm Mine Over The Stovetop So The Edges Get A Little Charred. Keep Them Stacked On Each Other With A Towel Over Top To Keep Warm. Alternatively, Wrap Your Corn Tortillas In A Dampened Paper Towel And Microwave 45 Seconds.
6. Assemble: Once Everything Is Ready, Start Putting The Enchilada’S Together. Pour 1 Cup Of The Sauce Into The Bottom Of A 9 × 13 Baking Dish. Fill Each Tortilla With About 1/4 C Of The Vegetable Mixture, A Spoonful Of Black Beans, Roll Up And Place Seam Side Down In The Baking Dish. Once Filled, 2 – 3 Cups Of The Remaining Sauce On Top Of The Enchiladas (Use More If You Like). Pour The Cashew Creama Overtop. Cover With Foil And Bake 20 Minutes. You May Also Like To Leave The Foil Off For The Last 10 Minutes To Let The Exposed Tortillas Get A Bit Crispy. Add A Finishing Touch With Fresh Chopped Cilantro Overtop.

title: VEGAN EGG SALAD SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. 1 Tub 1416Oz Organic Tofu Silken Soft Or Medium Firm
2. 14 Cup Vegan Mayonnaise
3. 1 Heaping Tablespoon Dijon Mustard Whole Grain Or Regular Ok Too
4. 12 Teaspoon Celery Powder Or 14 Cup Fresh Celery Diced Optional
5. 12 Teaspoon Turmeric Optional For Color
6. Generous Pinch Of Salt Kala Namak Smoked Or Regular Mineral Salt
7. Pepper To Taste
8. 2 Tablespoons Finely Chopped Chives
9. To Serve
10. 6 Slices Of Bread Of Choice
11. Leafy Greens
12. Red Onion Thinly Sliced Optional
13. Radishes Thinly Sliced Optional
preparation:
1. Tofu: Cut Tofu Into About 1/2 Inch Cubes, Lay In Between A Dish Towel Or Paper Towels To Soak Up Excess Moisture. Gently Press, Careful To Not Press Too Hard If Using Silken And Soft Tofu.
2. Assemble Salad: In The Bottom Of A Medium Sized Mixing Bowl, Add The Mayonnaise, Dijon, Optional Celery Powder And Turmeric, Salt And Pepper, Mix Well To Combine. Add Tofu And Chives, Gently Fold Into The Mayo Mix Until Well Coated. If You Like, Feel Free To Mash The Vegan Egg Salad, Or Mash Just 1/2 Of It.
3. Serve: Serve On Your Favorite Bread With Leafy Greens. Great With Crackers Too!
4. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 Days.

title: QUINOA FRIED RICE WITH VEGETABLES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa Rinsed
2. 1 34 Cups Water Or Lowsodium Vegetable Broth
3. 1 Cup Corn
4. 8 Oz Mushrooms Sliced
5. 2 Carrots Peeled And Diced
6. 3 Scallions Thinly Sliced Green And White Parts
7. 1 Small Zucchini Diced
8. 1 Cup Cabbage Shredded
9. 12 Cup Bell Pepper Any Color Cored And Diced
10. 12 Cup Basil Chopped Optional
11. 1 Tablespoon Sesame Oil
12. 3 Tablespoons Tamari Coconut Aminos Or Soy Sauce
13. 2  3 Teaspoons Garlic Powder
14. Salt  Pepper To Taste
15. Sriracha Hot Sauce Red Pepper Flakes Or Dash Of Cayenne Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Quinoa: Rinse Your Quinoa In A Fine Mesh Sieve Under Cool Running Water. In Medium Sauce Pan Combine Quinoa With 1 3/4 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth, Bring To A Boil, Simmer Covered For 15 Minutes. Once Done, Remove Cover And Let Set For Another 10 Minutes To Soak Up The Excess Water. Fluff With A Fork And Set Aside. (Or Use This Fail-Proof Instant Pot Quinoa Recipe)
2. Veggies: In Wok Or Large Skillet, Heat Oil Over Medium High, Add Vegetables And Stir Fry For 1 Minute Or So. Add Tamari, Garlic Powder And Other Seasonings To Taste. Cook For Another 3 – 4 Minutes Stirring Occasionally, Use A Lid If Needed To Help Soften The Vegetables A Bit.
3. Combine: Add In Quinoa To The Veggie Mixture, Turn Heat To High, Cook Another 3 – 5 Minutes Stirring Constantly Adding A Drizzle Of Oil If Mixture Seems Too Dry.
4. Serve Warm. Top With A Little Sriracha Or Tamari If You Like.

title: HEALTHY APPLE & PEAR CRISP
ingredients:
1. 3 Medium Apples Cored And Chopped Peel If You Prefer
2. 3 Medium Pears Cored And Chopped Peel If You Prefer
3. 3 Tablespoons Fresh Lemon Juice
4. 1 Tablespoon Sugar Coconut Or Organic Pure Cane
5. 1 Heaping Teaspoon Cinnamon
6. Topping
7. 1 34 Cup Old Fashioned Oats
8. 14 Cup Almond Meal Or Flaxseed Meal Optional
9. 1 Cup Finely Chopped Walnuts Optional
10. 12 Cup Pure Maple Syrup
11. 3  4 Tablespoons Coconut Oil At Room Temp
12. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
13. 14 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
14. Cinnamon To Garnish
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F.
2. Wash Apples Well. Slice, Core And Dice Apples And Pears.
3. In A Large Bowl (Or Right In Your Baking Dish), Combine Apples, Pears, Lemon Juice, Sugar And Cinnamon. Mix Well And Layer Into A 9 X 9 Baking Dish.
4. In A Medium Size Bowl, Combine Oats, Almond Meal, Walnuts, Maple Syrup, Coconut Oil, Vanilla And Salt, Mix Well. Spread Oat Mixture Evenly Over The Apples And Sprinkle With A Little Cinnamon.
5. Bake For 35 – 40 Minutes, Or Until Apples And Pears Are Fork Tender. Let Cool 5 – 10 Minutes Before Serving.

title: VEGAN CRANBERRY ORANGE MUFFINS
ingredients:
1. 2 Cups Flour
2. 34 Cup Sugar Pure Cane Coconut Or Date
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
5. Pinch Of Salt
6. 1 Cup Orange Juice
7. 12 Cup Unsweetened Applesauce
8. 2 Cups Cranberries Fresh Or Frozen
9. 1 Tablespoon Orange Zest
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Muffin Tin With Parchment Liners Or Lightly Grease With Oil.
2. Mix: In A Medium Mixing Bowl, Whisk Together The Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Baking Soda And Salt. Add The Orange Juice And Applesauce, Mix Well Until Just Combined, Don’T Overmix. Fold In The Cranberries And Orange Zest.
3. Fill Muffin Tin: Spoon The Batter Into The Muffin Tin Holes, Filling To The Rim. Optionally, Top With A Few Cranberries As Desired And A Sprinkle Of Sugar For A Crunchy Top.
4. Bake: Place On The Center Rack And Bake For 30 Minutes. Once Done, Let Cool A Few Minutes And Enjoy!
5. Store: Muffins Will Keep On The Counter, Loosely Covered, For Up To 3 Days. For Longer Storage Keep In The Refrigerator For Up To 6 Days, Or Freeze For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: Strawberry Banana Muffins (Vegan + Healthy)
ingredients:
1. 13 Cup Olive Oil Or Vegan Butter At Room Temp
2. 13 Cup Pure Cane Sugar Coconut Sugar Or Pure Maple Syrup
3. 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
4. 2 Large Overripe Bananas Mashed About 1 Cup
5. 1 34 Cups Flour Allpurpose Whole Wheat Spelt Or Combo
6. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
7. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
8. Pinch Of Pink Salt
9. 1 Cup Strawberries About 7  8 Diced Plus Extra For Topping
preparation:
1. Prep: Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees. Line A Muffin Tin With Muffin Liners Or Lightly Grease Each Hole With Oil Or Butter.
2. Batter: In A Large Mixing Bowl, Cream Together Room Temperature Butter/Oil And Sugar. Add The Vanilla And Mashed Banana, Mix Well. Add The Flour, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, And Pinch Of Salt To The Wet Ingredients And Mix Well To Combine. Add The Strawberries And Gently Fold Them Into The Batter.
3. Scoop: Scoop The Batter Into Each Muffin Hole, Filling To At Least 3/4 Full. Top With A Few Diced Strawberries (And/Or Banana Slices).
4. Bake: Place In The Oven On The Center Rack And Bake For 20 – 25 Minutes. Let Cool A Few Minutes And Transfer The Muffins To A Wire Rack To Cool.
5. Makes 10 – 12 Muffins

title: GRILLED TOFU SKEWERS + PINEAPPLE-TERIYAKI SAUCE
ingredients:
1. 1 Block 14 Oz Organic Tofu Firm Extra Or Super Firm
2. 12 Of A Fresh Pineapple
3. 1 Red Bell Pepper
4. 1 Large Zucchini
5. 1 Large Red Onion
6. Pineappleteriyaki Sauce
7. 12 Cup Coconut Aminos Or Lowsodium Tamari Or Soy Sauce
8. 12 Cup Pineapple Juice
9. 2 Cloves Garlic Minced
10. 12 Teaspoon Ground Ginger Or 1 Teaspoon Fresh Grated
11. 2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup Coconut Sugar Or Pure Cane Sugar Optional
12. 2 T Tapioca Powder Or 1 T Cornstarch  Equal Amount Of Water
preparation:
1. Press Tofu: Drain Tofu And Place Between A Clean Double Folded Kitchen Towel, Or Paper Napkins. Place A Medium Stainless Steel Pot On Top To Help Press The Tofu, Releasing It Of Excess Moisture. If Using Super-Firm Tofu, Skip This Step. Let Set While Making The Sauce. If Using Bamboo Skewers, At This Time You May Also Like To Soak Them In Water To Keep Them From Burning On The Ends.
2. Make Sauce: In A Small Saucepan, Add Coconut Amino’S/Tamari, Pineapple Juice, Garlic, Ginger And Optional Sweetener, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat And Cook On Low For 1 Minutes. In A Small Bowl, Mix Together The Cornstarch/Tapioca Powder With The Water Until Smooth. Add The Mixture To The Teriyaki Sauce And Cook Another Minute, Or Until Sauce Thickens. Remove From Heat, Cover And Set Aside. If You Like Your Teriyaki Sauce On The Sweeter Side, Add An Extra Tablespoon Or Two Of Your Preferred Sweetener.
3. Prep Tofu & Veggies: Cut Tofu Into 3/4 – 1 Inch Cubes, Place In A Shallow Baking Dish And Add About 1/3 – 1/2 Of The Sauce, Gently Toss To Coat Tofu, Cover And Let Marinate For At Least 30 Minutes. Chop And Prep The Veggies. Thread Tofu & Veggies On The Skewers, Distributing Evenly, In Whatever Order You Like.
4. Grill: Turn On Grill To Medium High And Coat With Oil. Once Grill Is Nice And Hot, Add Skewers And Cook, Turning Every So Often, Until Tofu Is Slightly Charred And Vegetables Are Fork Tender (Or Al Dente If You Prefer), About 8 Minutes. Brush With A Little Sauce On The Skewers While Cooking If You Like. Just Be Sure To Save Some For Dipping Later Or Adding Over Top Of Your Grain.
5. Serve Warm With Grain Of Choice. I Made A Garlic Cauliflower Rice With Chopped Cilantro That Was Pretty Darn Good! This Ginger Cauliflower Rice Would Be Great Too!
6. Notes:
7. If You Don’T Have Pineapple Juice On Hand, Puree 1/2 Cup Of Fresh Pineapple And Add Enough Water To Equal 1/2 Cup, Mix Well.

title: VEGETABLE CABBAGE SOUP
ingredients:
1. 14 Cup Water Or 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 2 Carrots Peeled And Sliced
4. 2 Celery Sticks Sliced
5. 2 Tablespoons Italian Seasoning
6. 1 Can 28Oz Diced Tomatoes With Juices
7. 1 Medium Potato Or 6 Baby About 1 Cup Diced See Notes
8. 1 12 Cups Green Beans Sliced Into 1 Inch Pieces
9. 1 Head 2Lbs Of Green Cabbage About 8  10 Cups Cored And Chopped
10. 6 Cups Low Sodium Vegetable Broth
11. Salt  Pepper To Taste
12. To Serve Optional
13. Chopped Parsley
14. Lemon Wedges
15. Crusty Bread
preparation:
1. Stovetop: (See Notes For More Cooking S)
2. In A Large 5Qt. Dutch Oven Or Pot, Heat Water/Olive Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Carrots, Celery, Onions And Garlic, Saute For 4 Minutes. Add The Herbs And Saute Until Fragrant, About 1 Minute.
3. Add The Green Beans, Tomatoes, Potatoes, Cabbage, And Liquids, Cover, Bring To A Boil. Remove Lid, Cabbage Should Be Starting To Shrink Enough That You Can Give A Good Stir. Cover, Turn Heat To Low And Simmer For 20 – 30 Minutes, Stirring Occasionally.
4. Add More Water If Needed, And Season With Salt And Pepper To Taste.
5. Serve: Ladle Into Soup Bowls And Top With Chopped Parsley. Pairs Great With Homemadevegan Cornbread,Vegan Naanorartisan Bread.
6. Store:Leftovers Will Keep In The Refrigerator For 4 – 5 Days. Store Covered. To Keep Longer, Store In The Freezer In Freezer Safe Containers For 2 – 3 Months.

title: Lemon Quinoa & Chickpea Salad
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Dry Quinoa I Used Tricolor
2. 1 34 Cup Water
3. 1 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
4. 1 12 Cups Cooked Or 1 Can 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
5. 1 12 Cups Cucumber Quartered And Thinly Sliced
6. 1 Red Or Yellow Bell Pepper About 1 Cup Diced
7. 1 Cup Grape Tomatoes Sliced In Half
8. 34 Cup Carrots Diced Small
9. 12 Cup Scallions Thinly Sliced
10. 12  1 Cup Parsley Chopped
11. 2  3 Juicy Lemons About 14  13 Cup Juice Of
12. Red Pepper Flakes Optional
13. Mineral Salt  Fresh Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Rinse Quinoa: In A Fine Mesh Sieve Rinse Quinoa Under Cool Running Water.
2. Cook Quinoa: In A Large Pot, Combine Water, Quinoa And Garlic Powder, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 15 Minutes. Remove Cover And Let Set 10 – 15 Minutes. Fluff With A Fork. Alternatively, Use This Quick And Easy Instant Pot Quinoa.
3. Prep Veggies: While The Quinoa Is Cooking Prep The Veggies.
4. Assemble Salad: Once Quinoa Is Ready, Add The Chickpeas, Carrots, Cucumber, Scallions, Bell Pepper, Tomatoes, Parsley, Lemon Juice And Spices, Mix Well. Season To Taste With Salt And Pepper.
5. Serve Warm, At Room Temperature, Or Chilled. I Love Serving Mine With More Lemon Juice Drizzled On Top. Avocado Slices Would Be A Great Addition Too!

title: SWEET CHIA CORNBREAD
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Organic Cornmeal Fine Medium Or Course Grind
2. 1 Cup Flour Spelt Whole Wheat Pastry Or Allpurpose Glutenfree Flour
3. 13 Cup Pure Cane Sugar
4. 1 Tablespoon Baking Powder
5. 14 Teaspoon Salt
6. 2 Tablespoons Chia Seeds
7. 6 Tablespoons Water
8. 1 Cup Unsweetened Almond Milk
9. Juice Of 12 Lemon Or 1 Tsp Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 14 Cup Oil Coconut Oil Melted Or Extra Light Flavored Olive Oil
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 400 Degrees F. Lightly Grease An 8 Or 9-Inch Square Baking Pan.
2. Prepare A Vegan Buttermilk By Mixing The Almond Milk With The Lemon Or Vinegar And Set Aside.
3. Mix The Chia Seeds With The Water, Set Aside. Let These Set For 10 Minutes.
4. Combine All Dry Ingredients In Medium Size Bowl. Add Milk, Oil, Chia Seed Mixture And Combine Making Sure To Break Up Any Lumps Of Chia Seeds. Pour Batter Into Greased Baking Pan Or Dish. Bake For 25 Minutes. Test By Inserting A Toothpick, If It Comes Out Clean It’S Ready.
5. Makes 9 Slices
6. Notes:
7. *All Grinds Of Cornmeal Work Great Here. I’Ve Tried Them All And They All Hold Up Well. For Maximum Texture Use Course Grind.
8. You Could Also Add In 1 Cup Canned, Fresh Or Thawed Corn To The Mix.
9. For A Spicy Kick, Add 1 Diced Jalapeno, Leave A Few Seeds For Extra Heat.

title: CHICKPEA ‘EGG’ SALAD SANDWICH
ingredients:
1. Chickpea Egg Salad
2. 1 Can 14Oz Chickpeas Drained And Rinsed Or 1 12 Cup Fresh Cooked
3. 3 Tablespoons Red Onion Finely Diced
4. 2 Tablespoons Celery Finely Chopped
5. 1  2 Tablespoons Diced Pickles Or Relish Sweet Or Dill
6. 14 Cup Cup Vegan Mayo
7. 1 Tablespoon Dijon
8. 12 Teaspoon Each Garlic  Onion Powder Can Be Optional
9. 14  12 Teaspoon Turmeric
10. 12  1 Teaspoon Fresh Dill Or 14  12 Tsp Dried
11. Salt To Taste Use Kala Namak For Eggy Sulfur Flavor
12. Sandwiches
13. Multigrain Bread
14. Leafy Greens
preparation:
1. Mash The Chickpeas.Roughly Mash The Chickpeas With The Back Of A Strong Fork, Potato Masher Or Pastry Blender. The Better You Mash Them, The Better They Will Hold Together.
2. Add Remaining Ingredients.To The Chickpeas, Add Celery, Red Onion, Sweet Or Dill Pickles Or Relish, Vegan Mayo, Dijon, Garlic + Onion Powder, Turmeric, And Salt (Shown Above). Feel Free To Add A Squeeze Of Lemon Juice.
3. Mix To Combine.As You Can See Above What It Will Look Like When It’S Mixed And Ready To Use.
4. If Making Sandwiches, Layer A Slice Of Bread With Leafy Greens, Spread ‘Egg’ Salad On Top Of Leafy Greens And Top With Other Half Of Sandwich Bread, Slice In Half And Enjoy!
5. Easy And Delicious!
6. Salad Serves 2 – 3
7. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Day.

title: PARSNIP & SPLIT PEA SOUP
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 2  3 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 2 Large Parsnips Peeled Quartered And Chopped
5. 2 Large Carrots Peeled Quartered And Chopped
6. 1 Pound Dried Green Split Peas About 2 14 Cup Picked Over And Rinsed
7. 1 Teaspoon Dried Thyme
8. 1 Teaspoon Poultry Seasoning Or Herb De Provence Optional
9. 2 Bay Leaves
10. 6 Cups Lowsodium Vegetable Broth  More As Needed
11. 1 Teaspoon Liquid Smoke Optional I Didnt Use Any
12. Salt  Pepper To Taste
13. 14 Cup Fresh Chopped Parsley Optional
preparation:
1. This Soup Can Be Prepared 3 Different Ways:
2. Instant Pot:
3. Set Instant Pot To Saute And Add The 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 1/4 Cup Water, Onion, Carrot, Parsnip, And Garlic, Saute For 4 – 5 Minutes (Feel Free To Skip This Step Entirely Adding Everything To The Pot And Cooking).
4. Add Split Peas, Herbs, Bay Leaves, And At Least 5 Cups Of Broth, And Stir To Combine.
5. Lock Lid, Set The Valve To Sealing, And Manually Set To High Pressure For 15 Minutes. Let Natural Release For 10 Minutes. Remove Bay Leaves, Stir In Parsley, Season To Taste With Salt And Pepper.
6. Using An Immersion Blender, Puree Soup Until Desired Consistency. Alternatively, Use A Blender Or Food Processor (May Take 2 – 3 Batches).
7. Slow Cooker :
8. Place Ingredients Into The Bottom Of Your Crock Pot, Starting With The Split Peas And Finishing With The Broth. Heat On Low For 7 – 8 Hours Or High For 4 – 5 Hours. Add Parsley 30 Minutes Before Done. Let Soup Cool Slightly And Remove Bay Leaves.
9. Using An Immersion Blender, Puree Soup Until Desired Consistency. You Can Also Puree Using A Food/Processor Or Blender, May Take Two Batches. Taste For Seasoning, Adding Salt And Pepper As Needed.
10. Stove Top :
11. In Large Pot Or Stock Pot, Heat Oil Or Water And Saute Onion, Garlic, Carrots And Parsnips Until Onions Are Translucent, About 5 Minutes.
12. Add The Split Peas, Herbs, Bay Leaves And Vegetable Broth.
13. Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Medium-Low And Simmer For 2 Hours, Stirring Occasionally.
14. Stir In The Parsley 30 Minutes Before Soup Is Done.
15. Let Soup Cool Slightly And Remove Bay Leaves.
16. Using An Immersion Blender, Puree Soup Until Desired Consistency. Alternatively, Use A Food Processor Or Blender, May Take Two Batches. Taste For Seasoning, Adding Salt And Pepper As Needed.
17. Serve With Whole Grain Or Artisan Bread. I Just Paired Mine With Some Good Seeded Bread I Had On Hand And Added Some Diced Raw Carrots On Top Which Gave A Nice Freshness And Crunch To The Soup. Crumbled Coconut Bacon Is Also A Nice Topping!
18. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. For Longer Storage, Keep In The Freezer For Up To 2 – 3 Months.

title: VEGAN PUMPKIN OAT MUFFINS + CRUMBLE TOPPING
ingredients:
1. 1 12 Cups Light Spelt Flour
2. 12 Cup Packed Organic Brown Sugar
3. 2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
4. 1 12 Teaspoons Pumpkin Pie Spice
5. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
6. Pinch Of Salt
7. 1 14 Cups 100 Pure Pumpkin Puree
8. 12 Cup Almond Milk Room Temp
9. 13 Cup Coconut Oil In Liquid State Or Applesauce
10. 1 12 Cups Oldfashioned Oats
11. 14 Cup Barberries Or Currents Optional
12. Topping
13. 13 Cup Packed Organic Brown Sugar
14. 1 Tablespoon Flour
15. 34 Teaspoon Cinnamon Or Pumpkin Spice
16. 1 Tablespoon Solid Coconut Oil Or Vegan Buttermargarine
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 375 Degrees F.
2. In A Large Bowl, Add The Flour, Sugar, Baking Powder, Pumpkin Spice, Baking Soda, And Salt, And Mix To Combine. Add The Milk, Oil, And Pumpkin To The Dry Ingredients And Mix Just Until Moistened. Stir In Oats And Raisins. Fill Each Muffin Space, Just Below The Rim, With The Pumpkin Batter.
3. In A Small Bowl, Combine The Brown Sugar, Flour, And Pumpkin Pie Spice, Add Oil/Butter And Cut Into Sugar Mixture Until Crumbly. Sprinkle 1 Heaping Teaspoonful Over Top Each Muffin.
4. Bake In Oven On Middle Rack For 20 – 25 Minutes, Or Until A Toothpick Comes Out Clean.
5. Let Cool 5 Minutes Before Removing From Pan To A Wire Rack. Serve Warm.
6. Store Covered Loosely In A Container On The Counter For 4 Days, Or Keep Longer By Storing In The Refrigerator.
7. Makes 12 Muffins

title: VEGAN BUTTERNUT SQUASH MAC & CHEESE
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Butternut Squash About 12 Oz Peeled Seeds Removed And Cubed Or 1 Can 14Oz
2. 12  16 Oz Pasta Elbow Shells Penne Ect
3. 1 Cup Raw Cashews
4. 2  4 Tablespoons Nutritional Yeast See Notes To Taste
5. 2 Cloves Garlic
6. 1 Teaspoon Dijon
7. 1 Teaspoon Onion Powder
8. 1 2  1 Teaspoon Smoked Paprika To Taste
9. 1 Small Lemon Juice Of Or 1 Tsp Apple Cider Vinegar
10. 2 Cups Water Vegetable Broth Or Combo Plus More As Needed
11. Mineral Salt  Pepper To Taste
12. Optional For Baking
13. 12 Cup Panko Or Breadcrumbs
14. 1  2 Tablespoons Oil
preparation:
1. Cook The Butternut Squash:
2. Oven: Preheat Oven To 400, Spread On Baking Sheet Lined With Parchment Paper, Add Butternut Squash, Drizzle With A Tiny Bit Of Oil, Toss Well To Coat, And Cook In The Oven For 30 Minutes, Or Until Fork Tender.
3. Stovetop: In A Pot Add 2 – 3 Cups Of Water And Butternut Squash, Bring To A Boil, Reduce Heat To Medium Low And Cook At A Gentle Boil For 20 Minutes.
4. Microwave: Place Butternut Squash In A Microwave Safe Bowl, Add 1/2 Cup Of Water, Place A Small Plate Overtop To Bowl, And Heat For 5 Minutes On High. Carefully Lift Plate And Check If Squash Is Ready, Or Cook For 1 – 2 More Minutes, Until Fork Tender.
5. Soak The Cashews:
6. Quick Soak: Cover Cashews With Hot, Not Boiling, Water And Let Soak At 10 Minutes.
7. Long Soak: Cover Cashews With Cool Water And Let Soak For 2 – 3 Hours.
8. Cook The Pasta: Cook The Pasta According To Package Directions.
9. Make Butternut Squash Cheese: In Blender, Add The Cooked Butternut Squash, Soaked Cashews, Nutritional Yeast, Garlic, Onion Powder, Smoked Paprika, Lemon Juice, 1/2 Teaspoon Salt And Few Grinds Of Fresh Cracked Pepper, Add 1 1/2 Cups Of Water And Blend Until Creamy. Add More Water As Needed To Thin To Desired Consistency. You Don’T Want It Too Thick, As It Will Thicken As It Sets. The Sauce Just Needs To Cling So Use Your Best Judgement On How Much Extra Water To Add.
10. Assemble Mac & Cheese: Add The Butternut Squash Cheese Sauce To The Pasta And Stir To Combine, Heat Over Low To Warm Through If Needed. Serve As Is Or Bake As Noted Below.
11. Oven Baked Mac & Cheese: Toss 1/2 Cup Of Panko Or Bread Crumbs With 1 – 2 Tablespoons Of Olive Oil. Sprinkle The Mixture Over Top The Mac And Cheese, Place In A Preheated Oven Set To 350, Uncovered, For 15 – 20 Minutes, Or Until Top Turns Golden. Or Put It A Few Inches Under The Broiler Until Top Is Crispy, About 5Minutes.
12. Store:Leftovers Can Be Kept In The Refrigerator For Up To 4 – 5 Days, In A Covered Container. It’S Also Freezer Friendly And Can Be Stored In Freezer Safe Containers For Up To 2 – 3 Months. Let Thaw Before Reheating.

title: VEGAN PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES
ingredients:
1. 1 Cup Natural Peanut Butter 270G Creamy Or Crunchy Or Almond Butter
2. 1 Cup Coconut Sugar Or Pure Cane Sugar 192G
3. 6 Tablespoons Almond Milk Room Temp
4. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
5. 1 Cup Flour 120G Spelt Unbleached Allpurpose Almond Flour Or 11 Glutenfree Blend
6. 1 Teaspoon Baking Soda
7. Generous Pinch Of Mineral Salt Only Use If Nut Butter Is Unsalted
preparation:
1. Preheat The Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Cookie Sheet With Silicone Mat, Parchment Paper Or Leave Ungreased.
2. Make The Dough: In A Large Bowl, Add The Peanut Butter And Sugar And Mix Until Creamy. Stir In The Almond Milk And Vanilla. Next, Add The Flour, Baking Soda, And Salt, Mix To Combine. The Dough Will Be Tough To Stir, Using Your Hands To Mix It Together Will Be Easier.
3. Roll And Flatten: Using A 1.5 Tablespoon Scooper, Scoop Out The Dough And Roll Into Balls, About 1 1/4 Inch. Place The Balls Of Dough About 2 1/2 Inches Apart On A Baking Sheet. Using The Back Of A Fork, Flatten In A Crisscross Pattern. Optionally, Sprinkle With Sugar Or Coarse Salt.
4. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 10 – 13 Minutes (13 Minutes Will Yield A Crispier Cookie That’S Tender Inside). Let Cool A Few Minutes, Transfer Cookies To Wire Rack And Repeat With Remaining Dough.
5. Makes 20 – 24 Cookies.
6. Store: Cookies Can Be Stored In An Airtight Container On The Counter For 5 Days. They Do Well Loosely Covered On The Counter For 2 – 3 Days As Well. To Keep Longer, Store In The Refrigerator For Up To 2 Weeks.
7. To Freeze: Let Cookies Cool Completely, Store In Freezer Safe Container For Up To 2 Months.

title: Tex-Mex Quinoa Vegetable Soup
ingredients:
1. 1 Scant Cup Dried Quinoa
2. 12 Large Yellow Onion
3. 3 Large Carrots Sliced
4. 2 Celery Ribs Sliced
5. 1 Medium Zucchini Sliced
6. 1 Can 14 Oz Corn Drained
7. 1 Can 14 Oz Diced Tomatoes With Green Chilies With Juices Fire Roasted Pref
8. 2 Cans 14 Oz Beans Red Pinto Black Kidney Or White Beans Drained And Rinsed
9. 3  4 Tablespoons Tomato Paste
10. 2 Teaspoons Chili Powder
11. 1 Teaspoon Cumin
12. 12 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
13. 2 Bay Leaves
14. 6 Cups Vegetable Broth
15. Salt  Pepper To Taste
16. To Serve Optional
17. Avocado Diced
18. Chopped Cilantro
19. Lime Wedges
preparation:
1. Crock-Pot: In A 5Qt. Or Larger Crockpot, Add All The Ingredients Finishing With The Vegetable Broth, Give A Good Stir, And Cook On Low For 5 – 8 Hours Or High For 2 – 4 Hours. Add More Broth/Water As Needed. Taste For Seasoning Before Serving.
2. Stovetop: In A Large Dutch Oven Or Pot, Add Ingredients Finishing With The Vegetable Broth, Give A Good Stir, Bring To A Boil, Cover, Reduce Heat To Low And Simmer For 45 Minutes To 1 Hour. Add More Broth/Water As Needed. Taste For Seasoning Before Serving.
3. Instant Pot: Set Instant Pot To Saute And Add The 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or ¼ Cup Water, Onion, Carrot, And Celery, Saute For 5 Minutes, Adding The Spices And Garlic Powder In The Last Minute (Feel Free To Skip This Step Entirely Adding Everything To The Pot And Cooking). Add The Quinoa, Beans, Corn, Zucchini, Tomato Paste, Bay Leaves, Salt, Pepper, And Vegetable Broth, Stir To Combine. Attach Lid And Turn To Lock, Set The Valve To Sealing, And Manually Set To High Pressure For 3 Minutes (It Takes About 25 Minutes To Come To Pressure). Let Natural Release For 10 Minutes. Season To Taste.
4. Serve With Diced Avocado And Chopped Cilantro. Pairs Well With Tortilla Chips And A Squeeze Of Lime.
5. Store Leftovers In An Airtight Container In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days. This Soup Also Freezes Well For Longer Storage.

title: Mango Coconut Popsicles (+ Granola)
ingredients:
1. 2 Mangos Cubed Or 16 Oz Bag Frozen Mango Thawed
2. 1 Lime Juice Of
3. 1 Cup Unsweetened Canned Coconut Milk I Recommend Targets Good  Gather
4. 1  2 Tablespoons Pure Maple Syrup
5. 12 Cup Vegan Granola Of Choice
6. Tools
7. Any Popsicle Mold Or About 6 Small 5 Oz Dixie Cups
8. Wooden Popsicle Sticks
9. Blender
preparation:
1. Puree: In A Blender, Mango (About 3 Cups), And Lime Juice, Puree Until Smooth.
2. Combine: Mix The Coconut Milk And Pure Maple Syrup.
3. Assemble: Pour The Mango Puree Into The Mold, About 1/3 Full. Add A Little Granola, Gently Press Down, Sinking Them A Little Into The Mixture. Pour In A Layer Of Coconut Milk. Repeat With Another Layer Of Mango Puree. Top Each Mold With A Little Granola. Tap The Molds Gently On The Counter To Remove Any Excess Air Bubbles, And Place The Stick Or Cut Straw Right In The Center.
4. Freeze: Place In The Freezer, Towards The Back If Possible, For At Least 6 Hours.
5. Remove From Molds: Let Sit At Room Temp For A Few Moments. It Should Slide Out Easily Or With A Little Pull. Alternately, Place The Popsicle Maker In Room Temp Water, Letting It Reach Just Under The Brim Of The Pop Maker. Do This Just For A Few Seconds. Remove Popsicles With A Gentle Pull.
6. Makes About 10 Regular-Sized Popsicles 6 – 4.5 Oz. Popsicles.
7. Store: Store Pops From The Popsicle Maker In An Airtight Container In The Freezer. Place Parchment Or Wax Paper Between The Pops To Keep Them From Sticking Together. Pops Made In Dixie Cups Can Easily Be Stored In Their Own Container In The Freezer (Maybe In The Door Slot). They Will Last For About 3 – 4 Weeks.

title: The Best Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1. 12 Cup 113G Vegan Butter I Used Miyokos At Room Temp
2. 12 Cup 85G Coconut Sugar
3. 14 Cup 43G Pure Cane Sugar
4. 3 Tablespoons Unsweetened Cashew Or Almond Milk
5. 2 Teaspoons Vanilla Extract
6. 1 12 Cups Flour Light Spelt 149G Allpurpose 180G Or Gluten Free Flour Blend
7. 12 Teaspoon Baking Soda
8. 14 Teaspoon Mineral Salt
9. 1 Cup 175G Vegan Chocolate Chips I Used Enjoy Life
preparation:
1. Preheat Oven To 350 Degrees F. Line A Baking Sheet With Parchment Paper Or Silpat, Or Use Baking Sheet As Is, Un-Greased.
2. Cookie Dough: Combine Flour, Baking Soda And Salt In Small Bowl, Set Aside. Beat Butter, Coconut Sugar And Pure Cane Sugar In Large Mixing Bowl Until Creamy. Add Almond Milk And Vanilla Extract, And Beat Until Fluffy And Creamy, About 1 – 2 Minutes. Add 1/2 Of The Flour And Mix To Combine, Add Remaining Flour And Mix Again. Stir In Chocolate Chips.
3. Scoop: Drop Rounded 1 1/2 – 2 Tablespoons Full Of Cookie Dough Onto Prepared Baking Sheet, Keeping Them About 2 Inches Apart.
4. Bake: Place In The Oven And Bake For 10 To 12 Minutes (Don’T Overbake). Cool On Baking Sheets For 2 Minutes, Move To Wire Racks To Cool.
5. Makes 2 Dozen Cookies.
6. Storing:
7. Already Baked Cookies: Baked Cookies Will Stay Fresh Stored In A Covered Container For 4 – 5 Days. To Keep Longer, Let Them Cool Completely And Store Them In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months In Freezer Safe Containers.
8. Cookie Dough: Store Cookie Dough In An Airtight Container For Up To 4 -5 Days In The Refrigerator. You Can Keep It Longer In The Freezer For Up To 2 Months.

title: BEST CURRIED CHICKPEA SALAD
ingredients:
1. 3 Cups Cooked Or 2 Cans 15 Oz Chickpeas Garbanzo Beans Drained And Rinsed
2. 2  3 Carrots About 1 Cup Diced
3. 3  4 Scallionsgreen Onions About 1 Cup Sliced
4. 12 Cup Raisins Dried Currants Or Chopped Dates
5. 12 Cup Cashews Pref Raw
6. 12  23 Cup Vegan Mayo Or Thinned Hummus Or Tahini See Notes
7. Juice Of One Lemon
8. 1 Tablespoon Curry Powder  More To Taste
9. 34 Teaspoon Garlic Powder
10. Mineral Salt  Cracked Pepper To Taste
preparation:
1. Curry Dressing: In A Small Bowl, Combine Vegan Mayo With Curry, Garlic Powder, And A Generous Pinch Of Salt. Blend Until Combined. Set Aside. (If Adding Vinegar Or Maple Syrup As Per The Notes Below, Add To The Hummus At This Time.)
2. Mash Chickpeas (Or Leave Them Whole): In A Medium Mixing Bowl, Add Chickpeas And Roughly Mash About 1/2 – 2/3 Of The Beans With The Back Of A Sturdy Fork Or Potato Masher. Mashing Is Great When Used As A Sandwich Filler, Helping It To Bind Together.
3. Assemble: Add In The Carrots, Scallions, Raisins, Cashews, And Pour Dressing Overtop Along With A Big Squeeze Of Lemon, Mix Well To Combine. Taste For Flavor Adding Salt And Pepper To Taste.
4. Serve: Serve As Is, With Sliced Red Bell Peppers As Scoopers, On A Bed Of Leafy Greens, With Crackers Or Made Into A Chickpea Curry Salad Sandwich With Bread Of Choice.
5. Store: Leftovers Can Be Stored In The Refrigerator For Up To 5 – 6 Days.

title: Sweet Potato & Quinoa Chili
ingredients:
1. 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil Or 14 Cup Water For Water Saute
2. 1 Medium Onion Diced
3. 5  6 Garlic Cloves Minced
4. 1 12 Tablespoons Chili Powder
5. 1 Tablespoon Cumin
6. 1 Teaspoon Dried Oregano
7. A Few Dashes Of Garlic Powder
8. A Few Dashes Of Onion Powder
9. Himalayan Salt To Taste
10. 1 Cup Dried Quinoa
11. 1 Can 15 Oz Black Beans Drained And Rinsed
12. 1 Can 15Oz Kidney Beans Drained And Rinsed
13. 1 Can 15 Oz Fire Roasted Diced Tomatoes With Juices Or 1 12 Cups Diced Fresh Tomatoes
14. 1 Can 6 Oz Tomato Paste
15. 1 Large Sweet Potato About 1 Lb Diced With Or Without Skin
16. 5  6 Cups Water Or Vegetable Broth Or Combo
17. Optional Garnish For Serving
18. Diced Avocado
19. Cilantro
20. Diced Onion Andor Jalapeno
preparation:
1. Stovetop: In Large Pot Or Dutch Oven, Heat Oil Over Medium Heat. Add Onions, Cook Until Soft And Edges Browned, About 5 – 6 Minutes. Add Garlic, Cook 1 Minute More.
